job_desc:
Assistant to Director
A Fairer Chance is a social business committed to reducing reoffending through employment.
We want to recruit someone to the team, primarily to support the Business Development Director but, as we are a small team, get involved in all aspects of the business
We pride ourselves on our knowledge of the labour market and strive to get the right job for the people we support.
Our work is both in custody and in the community and applications are welcome from people with lived experience , who can achieve clearance to work in prisons
We are in our twelfth year and generate our income through delivering on contracts.
Formal qualifications are not essential but good relevant experience, and the ability to communicate well, in person, by phone and in writing is.
In addition to supporting the directors you will have line management responsibility for case managers. We aim high and our case managers are completing a Level 4 Apprenticeship as Employment Practitioner. We would support further relevant training for the successful candidate.
We are looking for someone who is really committed to what we do and can fit in with our small teamâ€¦â€¦â€¦. that includes an 
office dog.
Essential
Â· Minimum of three years experience in recruitment, administration, advisory work bid writing or other related area. Paid or unpaid
Â· Some experience of managing staff,
Â· Experience of researching funding opportunities and drafting responses 
Â· Excellent IT skills including ability to set up and manage data bases. 
Â· An understanding of the London labour market ( we will ask for a short presentation at interview stage)


Desirable
Â· Experience of working in the Criminal Justice System
Â· Understanding of DWP and MOJ funding
Â· Reporting


As a social business we share the success with our staff and where we meet or surpass our targets there is the ability to earn bonuses.
We are looking at someone to work between 20 and 30 hours a week
Salary. Subject to negotiation.
Minimum Pro rata Â£28,000 


Please apply by addressing the Person specification and email to Info@afairerchance.co.uk with CV 
If you have any questions you can also email them to that address. We will aim to get back to you the same day
Closing date 28
th
 February 2023
title: Assistant to the Director

job_desc:
The Development and Alumni Officer is a new role within the school. It is anticipated that a Director of Development will be appointed by 2025 to lead this area of major strategic importance to the school. Until that time, the Development and Alumni Officer will develop the schoolâ€™s database and alumni relations programme.
 
 
Initially reporting directly to the Head, William Goldsmith, the postholderâ€™s primary responsibility is to develop the alumni and supporter database, and develop the alumni into an active, involved body of supporters, cultivating relationships with and beyond the alumni body.
 
 
The Development and Alumni Officer will ultimately report to the Director of Development, who will be a key member of the Schoolâ€™s Senior Leadership Team.
 
 
The Development and Alumni Officer will work closely with the Marketing and Communications team, led by the Director of Marketing and Communications. Developing a close working relationship with the â€˜central teamâ€™, comprising the Registrar, Business Director, Finance team, Assistant Bursar (Estates and Facilities), Executive Assistant to the Head, and the main office team, will be crucial to contribute to the team spirit which exists at St Georgeâ€™s.
 
 
KEY DUTIES
 
Database Creation and Development
 
â—Â To create and develop a new alumni / supporter database, processing all new contacts on the database;
 
â—Â Ensure data is kept up-to-date on the database with contact details, name changes, leavers and in-year joiners;
 
â—Â Produce termly reports and management information as requested by the Head, Business Director and Governing Body;
 
â—Â Manage all communications with new alumni and contributors, responding to queries quickly and efficiently.
 
â—Â Manage data integrity, ensuring compliance with the GDPR by maintaining communication preferences and recording changes of personal information;
 
â—Â Use the database and other channels, such as school records and Linkedin, to grow the database;
 
â—Â Be the primary contact for the database software provider. Alumni Relations and Supporter Development
 
â—Â To develop the alumni into an active, involved body of supporters, cultivating relationships with and beyond the alumni body to enable the school to benefit from their influence, contacts, expertise, voluntary help and financial support;
 
â—Â To organise alumni events, such as a summer gathering.
 
â—Â To maintain a proactive relationships with alumni, generating leads and contacts and keeping the alumni abreast of school developments;
 
â—Â To provide a â€˜personal touchâ€™ to maintain and enhance communications with supporters and alumni.
 
 
Communication
 
â—Â Aligning with the schoolâ€™s brand guidelines, and in collaboration with the Director of Marketing and Communications, produce alumni correspondence and engagement materials.
 
â—Â To report regularly to the Head, and in time the Director of Development, on the progress of the database cleansing and alumni relations engagement;
 
â—Â Produce reports, as requested by the Head or Business Director, for the Governing Body of the school.
 
 
Financial administration
 
â—Â To monitor the development budget, recording any income and expenditure, and checking invoices are correct and paid;
 
â—Â Manage the BACS direct debit scheme and submit BACS files when required;
 
â—Â Undertake monthly reconciliation of the development and alumni bank accounts;
 
â—Â Utilise and administrate the gift management processing systems, including online merchant accounts, standing orders, direct debits, legacies and single gifts;
 
â—Â Produce quarterly Gift Aid claims and submit them to HMRC
 
â—Â Work with auditors from the appointed auditing firm to ensure correct financial procedures are followed;
 
 
General Responsibilities
 
â—Â To support the Head in maximising goodwill towards the school;
 
â—Â Maintain a full awareness of, and act in accordance with, legislation concerning fundraising legislation, philanthropic gifts and related matters;
 
â—Â Work outside office hours including occasional weekends and evenings when required;
 
â—Â Develop an appreciation and understanding of school life as it is today, through communications with staff and, where possible, attending any special events.
 
â—Â Provide administrative support to the Development Office, as required.
 
PERSON SPECIFICATION
 
Essential
 
â—Â Awareness and understanding of the importance of safeguarding and the welfare of children
 
â—Â Experience of setting up a database
 
â—Â A sound understanding of GDPR and data protection regulations
 
â—Â Experience managing and leveraging information stored on a database
 
â—Â Experience managing, processing and logging gifts
 
â—Â Experience managing financial reconciliation
 
â—Â Experience establishing and building relationships
 
â—Â Strong administrative and organisational skills
 
â—Â Advanced IT skills using a range of different packages.
 
â—Â Excellent interpersonal skills
 
â—Â Excellent written and verbal communication skills
 
â—Â Attention to detail
 
â—Â Ability to work independently and within a team
 
 
Desirable
 
â—Â Experience of successful fundraising or transferable professional experience
 
â—Â Experience of managing creative projects to deliver outputs that engage, inspire and communicate core messages effectively
 
â—Â Experience of communicating through social media platforms
 
â—Â Experience of working in an educational institution
 
â—Â Experience of alumni relations within an educational institution
 
â—Â Understanding of the relationship with parents in a fee-paying context
 
 
We are looking for someone who:
 
â—Â Possesses a strong commitment to achieving high standards
 
â—Â Is self-motivated
 
â—Â Demonstrates flexibility and a â€˜can-doâ€™ attitude
 
â—Â Is able to prioritise and solve problems, working in a fast-moving environment
 
â—Â Aligns with the core values of St Georgeâ€™s
 
â—Â Possesses a high degree of personal professionalism and discretion
 
â—Â Possesses common sense
 
 
 
A full description of the role along with the relevant application form and details of how to apply, can be found at https://www.stgwindsor.org/community/staff-recruitment/
 
 
 
NB: The above list is not intended to be exhaustive and details of the terms and conditions of employment at St George's are to be found in the Staff Contract. The specific job descriptionn will be reviewed upon the employment of the Director of Development.

job_desc:
Role Purpose
 
Provide BAU support to the existing Finance functions & also work on internal Project delivery tasks that will include Data Migration and developing Integrations. We are looking for a self-assured individual, with enough experience (technical and functional) to function with minimal supervision or help from other team members.
 
 
The role is permanent basis, to join existing team based in Manchester. The experienced candidate will be empowered to leverage his or her own experience and skills to make a real impact. The candidate will be responsible for Technical and Functional ORCALE requirements and be comfortable with all afore-mentioned processes from business users, implementation and technical development and support point of view.
 
Skills split is 70% technical and 30% functional
 
Key Responsibilities
:
 
 
TECHNICAL ORACLE FUSION SKILLS (REQUIRED)
 
Development/Implementation/Support of integrations for Oracle Fusion SaaS & PaaS from/to third party systems.
Designing, developing, enhancing and supporting bespoke solutions in Oracle Fusion that involve complex inbound and outbound interfaces, and modelling the standard modules for Greenergyâ€™s specific requirements and business model.
Maintaining existing ORACLE integration solutions involving Fusion, DBCS, BI & OIC by working in close collaboration with the Middleware team (OIC) and other IT teams within Greenergy.
Competency with Web Service interactions such as RESTAPI, JSON, XSLT, SOAPUI, Postman etc
Languages/Scripting
: Advance knowledge of SQL, PL/SQL working with DBCS.
Data Load/ Migration:
 
Working knowledge of FBDI and use of open interfaces are required.


 
 
 
ORACLE FUNCTIONAL KNOWLEDGE (REQUIRED / DESIRED AS NOTED IN LINE)
 
Good functional knowledge of Fusion Finance Oracle and related tools.
Knowledge of the key ERP business flows (P2P, O2C, R2R), are required â€“ these are required from Business User and implementation point of view
 
Knowledge of General Ledger, Accounts Receivables, Accounts Payables, Cash Management, Purchasing & iProcurement, SLA (Sub Ledger Accounting) are required, to enable self-sufficiency in performing day-to-day BAU support and new implementations.
Functional knowledge of Fusion SCM (OM, Inventory, Costing) are desired
Knowledge of Fusion Reporting solutions (BI and OAC), are desired
Good Business Analysis skills with ability to easily and properly understand Business Requirements
Good Business requirements and solution design documentation skills are desired.


 
SUPPORT AND TROUBLESHOOTING SKILLS
 
 
Good awareness of inter-relationship of modules within the ORACLE system from a functional and business process point of view and good business knowledge â€“ enabling awareness of issues and quick and easy resolution
Logical thinking and knack for finding the root cause of issues and proffering permanent solutions.


 
RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT
 
Develop and maintain relationships with key business representatives and business users
 
 
Develop and maintain relationships with key personnel within the vendors organisations
 
Develop and maintain relationships with outsourced technology partners


 
 
Skills / Attributes Required
 
 
 
 
An IT background â€“ Computer Science or related discipline.
Working experience in ORACLE ERP Finance at application implementation and technical development/Support.
Required: Technical experience showing sound knowledge in Oracle Fusion Integrations and using ORACLE development tools
Desired: functional experience with knowledge of O2C, P2P and R2R around ORACLE General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Cash Management, Account Receivables, AGIS, Purchasing and iProcurement


 
 
 
 
Skills / Attributes Desired
 
 
Good communication and team working skills.
Focuses efforts and prioritizes work to deliver business value.
Overcomes obstacles and adapts approach to achieve outstanding results.
Bias for action â€“ does things before being asked to or forced to by events.
Progresses issues, even when only partial information is available.
Anticipates future situations and plans ahead to meet them.
Thinks outside normal parameters, takes unusual perspectives on situations, challenging traditional thinking.
Builds networks to enhance effectiveness and shared knowledge.
Actively seeks out know-how and best practice, related to own area of contribution.
Demonstrates shared commitment to team success.
Promotes open and effective communication.
Coaches others to help their development.


 
 
Greenergy are proud to be an equal opportunities employer and we are committed to equality of opportunity for all staff. We believe that diversity and inclusion among our colleagues is critical to our success as a global company. Employment at Greenergy is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications directly related to professional competence. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity, race, religion or belief, marriage and civil partnerships.
title: Techno-Functional Analyst (Oracle ERP Fusion Finance)

job_desc:
JOB TITLE:
 
Full time Senior Rehabilitation/Sales Engineer

Craig Sweetlove

This is a Regional Position, primarily based in the East Midlands
 
SALARY:
 
Negotiable
 
As a Senior Rehabilitation / Sales Engineer you will be the face of our company both in the field and in our showrooms.Â You will be assisting customers in a variety of ways from assessing for new equipment, modifying existing, servicing & repairs, quotations, care home visits, working with therapists the list goes on. The position would suit someone with previous industry experience looking for a new challenge or looking to move to the next level. job_desc:
Welcome to Skills Builder Partnership
 
There are eight skills that are essential for success in all areas of life. Research shows that they underpin academic progress, support wellbeing and lead to higher skilled, higher paid careers. Unfortunately, those from less privileged backgrounds have fewer opportunities to build these skills. We exist to change the systems that allow this to happen.
 
Joining Skills Builder is not like working anywhere else. Our team consistently say they have never worked anywhere as collaborative, supportive or mission oriented. We combine the fun and dynamism of a start-up, the professional development opportunities of a corporate, the innovation of a digital native and the social impact focus of a charity.
 
We are serious about delivering social mobility through our vision that one day everyone builds the essential skills to succeed. That means we are ambitious and set high standards for ourselves. We are reflective, inclusive and supportive.
 
 
In practice this means that everyone makes time for others in the team, we get stuck in to solve problems together, we have regular employee surveys where leadership talk through every single suggestion and the whole team is involved in developing our strategy.
 
We are working toward systemic change by rapidly scaling our approach. The Skills Builder Partnership already consists of over 700 organisations. Together, we delivered over 1.4 million opportunities for individuals to build essential skills in 2020 alone. Our strategy of collective impact means we already have the backing of key sector leaders like CIPD, BITC and the Careers & Enterprise Company.
 
 
 
About the role
 
As the Strategy & Data Associate, you will be answering some of our most important questions, like â€œwhat is the impact of our programmesâ€ and â€œhow can we improve the user journey through this product?â€
 
The person in this role will develop our technical systems and analyse data from various sources. In practice this will involve developing tools in our Salesforce environment, working with SQL databases, conducting analysis in Excel and Python, and figuring out how all these things fit together. You may not yet have these skills; we are looking for exceptional capability and an eagerness to put new skills into practice.
 
We are looking for individuals who are excited by the prospect of solving problems and developing solutions. The role will be an exciting platform to build a career as part of a team with a strong coaching and support ethos, developing new technical, professional and essential skills. You will benefit from training and the opportunity to gain qualifications should you want to.
 
We have big ambitions and your scope to grow, learn and achieve matches that. If you want to benefit from working with an inspiring team, with huge potential for learning, growth and development, we want to hear from you.
 
 
Key responsibilities
 
1) Data
 
â—Â Â Â Â Working with our various sources of data to answer questions and provide insight for the team.
â—Â Â Â Â Producing statistical analyses and data visualisations in order to investigate strategic and operational hypotheses.
â—Â Â Â Â Working with the operations team on research projects to understand and showcase our impact.
 
(2) Internal products
â—Â Â Â Â Improving and developing automated processes by which data is retrieved, analysed, and made visible to the team and the users of our products.
â—Â Â Â Â Supporting the maintenance and improvement of our core systems and automations, enabling teams across the organisation to work more effectively.
 
(3) Solutions
â—Â Â Â Â Identifying and solving problems across the team.
â—Â Â Â Â Anticipating future challenges and developing proactive solutions to mitigate them.
â—Â Â Â Â Responding to technical questions and resolving technical problems experienced by our team.
 
(4) External Products
â—Â Â Â Â Analysis of user journeys and usage data from our digital products.
â—Â Â Â Â Participating in existing and new product development.
â—Â Â Â Â Improving the monitoring, management, and integration of our digital products.
 
 
Technical Skills and Experience
â—Â Â Â Â You have experience solving problems with data or developing systems or products, either through your studies or work experience.
title: Strategy & Data Associate

job_desc:
Nationwide
 
Do you want to make a difference and be part of a vibrant and inclusive organisation that has been helping save lives for more than a century? As one of the countryâ€™s best-loved charities, St John Ambulance played a pivotal role in responding to the pandemic as well as â€˜everydayâ€™ health emergencies, training, supporting communities, and improving young peopleâ€™s lives.
This is an exciting time to join St John as we enter a period of significant change and digital transformation. Our Quality and Safety Team are responsible for supporting the organisation to ensure safe, quality care for our people and the communities we serve. The Quality and Safety Data Analyst will be responsible for providing data analysis and reports to functions within SJA to support high-quality risk assessments, up-to-date status evaluations, to monitor Quality & Safety related activities and provide key management information. This will empower St John to drive improvements, enabling the organisation to meet its statutory and regulatory obligations as well as ensuring internal policy compliance.
 
We pride ourselves in being a great place to work, providing a supportive culture with opportunities to grow and develop your career, achieve a healthy work life balance and to be recognised for the great work you do. The role benefits from a competitive salary, generous pension, hybrid, flexible working, 33 days holiday (inclusive of bank holidays) - increasing to 38 days over 5 years, options to buy and sell holiday, free first/mental aid first aider courses, Blue Light and NHS online shopping discounts, cycle to work scheme, life assurance, flu jab, eye care, mental health and wellbeing tools and volunteering days.
 
Please see the job description for more detail (this can be viewed on our website or once you click apply)
About You:
 
Significant experience within a similar role (e.g. Data Analyst or equivalent)
Experience of developing reporting mechanisms including automated processes
Fluent in statistical packages such as Excel and experienced user of flows, forms and lists
Advanced knowledge of descriptive and inferential statistics
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and disseminate data


About The Role:
 
Review existing data sources and data collection methods to check reliability, validity and improve efficiency and ease of understanding.
Support development and management of a Quality Dashboard and develop reports from all Quality Management systems including IMF
Advise on developing reports from a variety of data bases, particularly those on Microsoft SharePoint, and design of assurance measures.
Setting up quality assurance processes to allow rigorous checking of data before release to stakeholders.
Use spreadsheet programmes such as Pivot Tables, Data Validation, INDEX/MATCH formulae (or VLOOKUP), graphs, etc.


About Us:
This is a fantastic opportunity to join a team of over 1,700 employees and over 30,000 volunteers, united by our goal of saving lives through essential first aid services, training and campaigning. As a charity with rich heritage and a long history of serving humanity, we are proud of our past and excited about creating a healthier, safer, more resilient future.
St John Ambulance works at the heart of communities, supporting and enabling them to access and receive physical and mental health first aid. We do this through developing and providing effective community response and outreach services (e.g. Ambulance response, Falls response, Night Time Economy and Homelessness outreach) and using our longstanding expertise to empower people with vital clinical skills and the confidence to use them (e.g. our Volunteers and Community Advocates, NHS Cadets and Young Responders programmes).
 
 
Find out more about us, including our new Ask Me campaign, at www.sja.org.uk
If you are a current St John Ambulance employee, please apply here: Click here
For all other candidates, or St John Ambulance volunteers wishing to apply: please apply below
St John Ambulance are committed to increasing the diversity of our team and making sure we best reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. At St John, everyone is valued and supported to thrive, we have several networks including Multi Culture, Disability and Accessibility, Pride, Family and Carers and Womenâ€™s groups. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination and engender a sense of belonging for all, by creating an environment of mutual respect, where we value unique differences and demonstrate authentic allyship. We believe passionately in equality, diversity and inclusion.
 
 
Please note: St John does not accept speculative CVs and will only review CVs sent in application for an advertised vacancy.
Recruitment Agencies: We are not utilising the services of recruitment agencies for this vacancy and will accept direct applications only.
title: Data Quality Analyst

job_desc:
Please note this is a part-time role for 3 days per week with a view of being full-time in the future. Salary is negotiable depending on experience and is on a pro-rata basis.
 
THIS IS AN ON-SITE / HYBRID ROLE. PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE UNABLE TO WORK IN MACCLESFIELD.
 
Remap Consulting is searching for a talented, friendly, and enthusiastic individual to join our expanding team in the
 
Presentation Specialist
 
role. We are looking for candidates to support our project and operations teams in all aspects of delivery.
 
You may apply via LinkedIn jobs, however, in order to be considered for this role, you will also be required to send a CV, covering letter and a portfolio of presentation design work demonstrating your abilities to careers@remapconsulting.com.
 
About Remap
 
Remap Consulting is a specialist pharmaceutical pricing, reimbursement and market access consultancy offering an integrated, evidence-based approach to optimising price and patient access for our clientâ€™s products. We work with a broad range of clients, from top 10 pharma through to small start-up organisations on a diverse range of business-critical projects, market access training and product launches.
 
Job Purpose
 
You will be working closely with senior management, operations and project delivery teams in preparing and supporting various projects such as styling and formatting documents for pitches, client deliverables, training materials and providing various administrative support activities that support our strategic pricing and market access projects that meet the client and business needs.
 
You will be expected to spend approximately 3 days per week supporting the delivery of our projects, principally through interpreting complex data-driven content in PowerPoint. You must be able to clearly communicate complex text driven information through visual representation in PowerPoint in a concise and impactful way. Fundamental to your PowerPoint capabilities will be solid formatting and proof-reading ability to ensure our deliverables are accurate and consistent.
 
As part of your application, we would like to see a portfolio of presentations work demonstrating your capabilities in this area.
 
Your remaining time will be spent on various other administrative responsibilities, which will vary week by week depending on the needs of the project/business.
 
The role requires the ability to work well as part of a team but also be self-motivated to complete the tasks independently, using your own initiative where appropriate.
 
The Ideal Candidate
 
The ideal candidate will be experienced in creating engaging data revisualisationâ€™s, recreating figures and data-led charts in PowerPoint such as styling and formatting documents for pitches, client deliverables, training materials and providing various administrative support activities that support our strategic pricing and market access projects that meet the client and business needs.
You will have a proven creative aptitude of developing and communicating complex information visually in PowerPoint in a clear and simple way coupled with strong administrative skills. Candidates will be highly organised, able to efficiently multi-task and can communicate effectively in a friendly and courteous manner at all levels and have a keen eye for detail with an ability to complete tasks efficiently to meet challenging deadlines.
 
The successful candidate will be enthusiastic, confident and have a flexible approach to work. You should be able to demonstrate good organisational skills including the ability to multi-task, prioritise work under pressure and meet conflicting deadlines. You will be willing to go the extra mile to support a diligent team of like-minded individuals.
 
Required skills
 
Proven advanced PowerPoint creative design with a minimum of 3 years experience, preferably within the pharmaceutical / life sciences industry
Highly proficient in creating meaningful PowerPoint presentations through creative design, advanced drawing techniques, formatting and animations
Ability to work quickly and accurately to produce original and compelling presentations using native PowerPoint
Strong typographical and composition skills
Proven administrative experience, preferably within the pharmaceutical industry and/or a consultancy environment
Excellent IT skills â€“ Spreadsheets, word processing, PowerPoint, email, and data entry
Excellent work ethic and commitment to delivering high quality work
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of graphic software (i.e. Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign â€“ Advantage
Portfolio or work samples (presentations preferable) â€“ Advantage


 
Behaviours
 
Results driven:
 
Takes responsibility for own activities and tasks, demonstrating a desire to achieve the best possible results. Takes a proactive approach to tasks, requiring minimal supervision
Team working:
 
Actively work with colleagues to build relationships and maintain a strong effective team
Effective communication:
 
Able to communicate effectively with both excellent written and verbal communication skills
Planning and organising:
 
Highly organised with the ability to prioritise and respond to requests and enquiries in a timely and accurate manner
Time management:
 
Ability to multi-task, prioritise work under pressure and meet conflicting deadlines
Quality management:
 
High level of accuracy/attention to detail. Be proactive about improving processes and ways of working, actively seeking and acting on feedback.


 
Key Responsibilities
 
Presentation Design Skills
 
Responsible for the comprehensive preparation of PowerPoint presentations for designated projects to be delivered to global pharmaceutical clients
Creation of effective, dynamic and well-thought-out internal and external presentations
Formatting and styling of high-quality creative PowerPoint presentations to specific guidelines with a high level of consistency and accuracy
Creatively re-visualise and animate slide content, recreating figures in PowerPoint
Create new fit for purpose icons, figures and diagrams and re-drawing graphs, charts and tables in PowerPoint
Proof reading and document formatting ensuring adherence to company branded guidelines
Manage your own projects, ensuring deliverables are achieved within stated timelines
Support the team in the creation of high-quality reports, presentations, and other client deliverables


 
Other Responsibilities May Include:
 
Proof reading and document formatting ensuring adherence to company branded guidelines


 
You must be able to demonstrate that you are eligible to work in the UK
title: Presentation Specialist

job_desc:
The Arora Group
 is one of the largest private owner and operator of hotels in the UK, with over 6000 rooms in operation across 12 Global Brands, including Marriott, Hilton, Accor and IHG portfolios. Our values revolve around our people, our guests and achievement through ownership which has enabled our exponential growth over the last few years.


A great opportunity has arisen for hospitality professionals as a Group Purchasing Executive at Arora Head Office in Heathrow.


The Group Purchasing Executive will fulfil an all-round supporting role in the Group Purchasing Department with a specific focus on the Purchasing System management (Adaco system). The role requires a focused and well-organised individual with excellent communication skills and good attention to detail. Adaco database management and support in day-to-day procurement process are very important elements of the role. The successful candidate will get exposure to management of purchasing categories and will carry out benchmarking exercises and data analysis.


 What we are looking for


Previous purchasing experience in a Hospitality Environment is preferrable
Excellent IT skills and previous experience of purchasing software administration (preferably Fourth Adaco), good knowledge of Microsoft Excel 
Flexible and approachable team player, who is comfortable in taking initiative and has a â€œcan doâ€ attitude
Good analytical skills, numerate, attention to detail and good organisational skills are a must for this role 
Ability and confidence to interact with suppliers, and communicate with all levels of management within Arora Group
Ambitious, systematic, and well organised with the ability to prioritise workload and use own initiative
Good interpersonal skills with excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Full driving licence preferable
title: Group Purchasing Executive

job_desc:
You will work with Procurement team to manage the preparation and compilation of the Aerospheres quarterly Sales forecast updates and implementation of the agreed forecast into the MRP system. To ensure that the required inventory are strategies are put in place for all products in terms of Runners, Repeaters and Strangers.
 
Responsibilities
 
To support the maintenance of accurate and timely update of the master data on the MRP system and to provide analysis, reports and implementation of improvements as required, ensuring the product forecast data and MRP attributes (part numbers, suppliers, lead-time, MOQ, Safety stock) is up to date.
To maintain the integrity of master data on MRP, amending data as required as a result of product changes such as new products, obsolete products, replacement products etc.
To extract and compile forecast data from last 12 months sales compared to last forecast and provide management data on differences for Sales and Operations planning review.
To assist the Procurement Director in defining product inventory targets based on supplier lead times and EOQ/MOQâ€™s, together with consulting with Operations team on space warehouse requirements for those inventories.
Working with product suppliers on key(stable) Runner and Repeater products ensure MRP order prompts are released as direct orders on suppliers.
To assist in ad-hoc procurement buying activities as required.
To act as a team member on improvements projects in Procurement team.


 
 
Qualifications

job_desc:
Role Description
IDG is an ethical security provider, which supports the work of international development organisations and private companies across Asia, Africa, and the Middle East.
 
IDG is growing rapidly worldwide, and the Bid Writer will play an integral role in supporting this expansion. They will work to the Operations & Plans Manager, primarily using their technical bid writing skills to produce high quality proposals that win new business for the organisation. The primary focus initially will be on United Nations and governmental / diplomatic bids globally.
 
Further to their bid writing tasks, they will also be required to assist the Ops & Plans Manager and other new and developing sections of the business with gathering business intelligence, conducting market studies and research, and providing support to the global Head of Business Development. In doing so, they will provide both valuable assistance to relevant parts of the organisation, while deepening their understanding of the business and operating environment in a manner which enhances the bids they produce.
 
We offer a competitive salary plus other internal benefits. The successful applicant work as a part of a young and dynamic London Office team, but with great flexibility for remote or hybrid working.
 
Duties & Responsibilities
1. Bid writingÂ (primarily for UN and humanitarian / governmental / diplomatic bids).
a)Â Â Â Â Â Work to the Ops & Plans Manager in the overall management of the bid submission process from Initial Opportunity Assessment to decision communicated
b)Â Â Â Â Â Gather evidence (with the support of the Legal and Financial Departments) to complete Pre-Qualification Questionnaires (PQQ) and other pre-selection requirements where applicable
c)Â Â Â Â Â Undertake market research for the kick off meetings
d)Â Â Â Â Â Check the rules the bid must follow, ensuring IDG has the appropriate certification to be eligible to bid
e)Â Â Â Â Â Present technical information in accessible formats
f)Â Â Â Â Â Â Ensure that win themes are articulated in such a way to meet / exceed the clientâ€™s requirements
g)Â Â Â Â Â Design, write, edit and submit bid documents
h)Â Â Â Â Â Keep accurate records and save material to build a 'bid library' for future use.
 
2.Â Â Â Â Â Operations & Plans
Provide general support to IDG Security Operations as directed by the Ops & Plans Manager.
a)Â Â Â Â Â As a part of the London Office, assist in developing a full understanding of the business from an operational perspective to aid bid preparation
b)Â Â Â Â Â Will gain a full understanding of the IDG Security Operations Management System in support of ISO 18788 reaccreditation.
 
3.Â Â Â Â Â Acumen Support
 
Provide support to the growth and development of IDGâ€™s new subsidiary, Acumen.
a)Â Â Â Â Â Bid writing (as per above)
b)Â Â Â Â Â Market research
c)Â Â Â Â Â Business Intelligence.
 
4.Â Â Â Â Â Business Development
Provide BD support to the Global Head of BD including:
a)Â Â Â Â Â Support development of new markets for IDG Security and Acumen
b)Â Â Â Â Â Ensure business development opportunities are highlighted and forwarded to GHBD
 
c)Â Â Â Â Â Work alongside the GHBD to ensure bid and opportunity tracking software is kept up to date.
 
Qualifications
-Â Bachelorâ€™s Degree
-Â 5 years + previous successful bid writing experience
-Â Experience with UK Civil Service / FCDO (procurement) is desirable
-Â Ideally qualified by the Association for Proposal Management Professionals (APMP)
-Â Excellent computer literacy with all Mac / PC spreadsheet, word processing, email, messaging and accounting software systems
-Â Preferably has experience of working in a multilingual, multinational environment.

job_desc:
Who we are at Snug
If the home is where the heart is, the sofa's the heartbeat. Itâ€™s the place we feel most at home, a haven from the outside world, where everything becomes manageable from the moment we flop. Itâ€™s our basecamp for everything that the world throws at us. So it needs to be, well, Snug.
Being Snug sets you free from lifeâ€™s constraints. Itâ€™s about pure, perfect cosiness that nudges the reset button and gets you back to neutral. It creates a space to grow, to be creative and to just be as you are.
 
Thatâ€™s
 
Snug. A sofa that grows with you. We make people comfortable, whoever they are, wherever they are.
 
 
About the Role
Reporting to the Head of Data, the Data Analyst supports the wider E-Commerce team to deliver accurate reporting and actionable insights across many areas of the business, including E-Commerce sales, retail sales, customer behavioral data and performance marketing.
 
This role requires a self-starter with a can-do attitude to setting up processes, the desire to drive a test and learn culture and someone who can be an ambassador of data and insight-driven decision making within the team. The role will involve turning data from multiple sources into valuable insights, enabling key stakeholders to make informed, data-led decisions.
 
You will be responsible for analyzing data using statistical techniques, implementing and maintaining databases, gathering data from primary and secondary sources, identifying, analyzing and interpreting trends from the data.
 
 
Data management:
 
Deliver a full suite of reports on a variety of frequencies, including real-time, daily, weekly, and monthly for all sales channels
Where needed, facilitate the work groups to drive improvements to data quality, processes and procedures related to e-commerce
Monitor data quality and data integrity
Define data standards and business rules to ensure data reliability and monitor its implementation
Collect and combine data from multiple sources
Provide recommendations on how to manage the data
Identify ways to improve analytical procedures to improve agility and efficiency through the automation of reports
Maintain and improve existing analytical and operational data pipelines


 
Analytics And Insight Delivery:
 
Support with ad hoc and deep dive analysis to support business planning across specific categories, products, acquisition channels, or journeys
Deliver forecasts and measure the outcome and provide recommendations to relevant stakeholders
To be familiar with such techniques as customer segmentation, basket analysis, A/B testing, recommendations systems
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across the business to gain a comprehensive understanding of end-to-end channel performance to ensure accurate analysis and interpretation
Support the wider business to ensure data sources are maintained in line with best practices, providing additional training where required


 
About you
Youâ€™re a passionate and driven data expert with a background working in high-growth, product or service led companies. Share the ambition and enthusiasm of the brand with a hands-on approach.
Be customer-centric with communication and interpersonal skills with the confidence to liaise at all levels.
 
Have an eye for detail with the ability to work independently.
 
 
What you'll need:
 
 
Experience with data visualisation tools (Power BI, Mode etc.)
Experience with ETL in an e-commerce setting (eg. Fivetran, Stitch Data, Seekwell etc.)
Good knowledge of the most common endpoints/source systems in a modern e-commerce data stack (Shopify, Google Analytics, Meta, Google Sheets, ERP etc.)
A solid history of data analysis, preferably in an e-commerce setting using SQL as the primary language
Experience with creating custom AWS Lambda functions where off-the-shelf connectors are not available or not fit for purpose


 
Whatâ€™s in it for you?
An opportunity to flourish with a digitally focused and multi-channel company.
 
Salary of Â£45,000
Full-time role: 8.30am - 5pm, Monday to Friday
Hybrid working (London office)
Health insurance
33 daysâ€™ holidays (inclusive of bank holidays)


 
We're dedicated to creating an inclusive environment, and we welcome applications from everyone!
title: Data Analyst

TCTâ€™s key strength is our people, who offer quality and flexibility that only an independent organization can provide.

to join our team.
 
Reporting to the Manager â€“ Part Sales, the
 
Shipping/Receiving - Materials Coordinator
 
will be expected to assist in all duties within the Materials department including the Shipping (domestic & international), receiving, data entry, storing, issuing and handling of turbine parts, tooling and materials. This position requires the individual to be highly organized, have the ability to shift priorities at a momentâ€™s notice, work at a strong pace while producing and maintaining an extremely high level of quality.

Employee/team flexibility is of prime importance to TransCanada Turbines. It is important that all employees are willing and able to assist with any activity, at any time, as necessary to support the needs of a changing and demanding customer base in the gas turbine repair and overhaul business.

job_desc:
Syngenta is a world-leading plant science company committed to promoting sustainable agriculture through innovative research and technology. In more than 90 countries around the world, our employees enable millions of farmers to improve global food security by making better, more sustainable use of available resources.
 
Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
 
We are offering a 3-year scheme for young talents with keen interest in science, data, and technology as well as passion for sustainability and agriculture. Our scheme will offer various role opportunities for graduates, with well-established rotations each year to provide a comprehensive overview of the IT technology landscape, diverse R&D and IT teams and their ways of working, including how to use Agile methodology and cloud computing
 
 
Role Purpose:
 
 
We are looking for recent graduates and final year undergraduates, as we are offering you the first step in your career. Prior work experience is useful but not essential as we will support you from day one. You will have a leadership ambition, self-motivation, and desire to build a successful career in Syngenta. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain real IT experience in an exciting R&D environment working alongside technical, scientific, and data-driven colleagues.
 
Moreover, you will be able to individually shape your roles in the next 3 years. You can decide to pursue a technical specialist journey by exploring roles such as Developer, DevOps Engineer and Solution Architect, or decide for a managerial path such as Business Analyst, Project/Product Manager and Scrum Master, or combine both depending on your development plans.
 
Your experimentalist mindset, curiosity, and willingness to try things out will inspire others as you innovate and learn together. We will need you to communicate well and be happy to spend time researching information when required. You will also need to be comfortable with working remotely via Zoom.
 
In return we will provide training and mentoring to support your longer term personal and professional development and speed up your leadership journey.
 
 
Direct accountabilities will differ depending on the specific role that you will take on each year. You choose!
 
In general, in each role you will be accountable for:
 
 
Bringing fresh perspective and experimental mindset to inspire and challenge established teams
 
Promoting and actively implementing Agile methodologies and internal standards
 
Liaising with Communities of Practice to gain and share experiences, skills, and innovation across IT
 
Contributing to various initiatives that bring value to our communities and stakeholders
 
Highlighting risks as they become evident
 
Asking questions when things are not clear
 


 
 
Requirements:
 
 
 
Minimum bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in computer science or STEM degrees (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics)
 
Some knowledge of either IT infrastructure (cloud or physical), application or data management
 
Keen interest in technology and science in the external world
 
Awareness of emerging technologies
 
Ability to work autonomously with suitable guidance and support, in a complex scientific or business sustainability environment while still ensuring full compliance with all internal and external standards
 
Ability to manage complexity and uncertainty, including self-driven research and learning
 
Good communication skills with a willingness to ask questions
 
Strong customer focus and teamwork skills
 
Self-motivated, organized, and proactive
 
Fluency in English
 


 
 
What we offer:
 
 
 
We offer a position which contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment
 
Flexible working arrangements and environment with an open culture and diverse workforce
 
The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees
 
Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options
 
You will profit from an onsite doctor, gym, canteen, and other benefits
 


 
Interested?
 
We look forward to receiving your online application by February 20th including all relevant documents (cover letter and CV, diploma, certificates). Interviews will take place in March and the position starts after graduation on Sept 4th 2023.
 
Please be aware that the job title may differ from the position title.
 
Did you know? Syngenta has been ranked as a top employer by Science Journal.
 
Learn more about our team and our mission.
 
Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

job_desc:
Company Description
 
We're ASOS. We blend our flair for fashion with our love of cutting- edge technology, but more importantly were interested in how we can bring the best out of you.
 
We exist to give people the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. At ASOS, you're free to be your true self without judgment, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.
 
Job Description
 
As part of the Insight data team, you will be responsible for our whole data estate. Working with the wider ASOS data services department to ensure the Insight teams have all the data they need. The aim is to bring all data points available to ASOS together to be easily accessed and drive insight and analysis for the business.
 
We are looking for a data-driven person who is comfortable using many different sources of data across multiple systems. The goal is to increase the variety, depth, and ease of use of data for an audience of analysts of varying skills.
 
You'll need to work collaboratively with various teams to source and surface new data sets as well as continually improve existing ones.
 
You will work with stakeholders across the business, gaining a better understanding of their needs to then work with analysts to fulfil requests. You'll to see your work being implemented to have a direct improvement in the experience for the customer.
 
What You'll Be Doing...
 
 
Delivery of a varying range of simultaneous data focused projects
Supporting data for projects across SSMS and Databricks
Building and supporting data pipelines for both internal and 3rd party sources
Be Insight's point of contact to the wider data services department
Key person for database management and data structuring
Work with a variety of insight functions to help meet their data needs (Customer, Marketing, Retail, Research)
Proactively bringing new ideas to the table relating to business questions, analytics approaches, datasets and ways of working.


 
Qualifications
 
Weâ€™d love to meet someone with...
 
 
Strong SQL Skills
Knowledge of Python desirable
Microsoft SQL Server, SQL BI Stack experience, Databricks (desirable)
Understanding of Dimensional Data Modelling
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to rapid change
Good organisational, written and oral communication skills
A passion for data and problem solving
Ability to work under own initiative, effectively prioritise workload and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication skills and a good team player


 
Additional Information
 
What's in it for you?
 
 
Generous salary, bonus and pension matching
 
Great development programmes
 
Amazing offices and great culture
 
25 days holiday plus one extra day for your birthday
 
Subsidised gym and canteen
 
Huge staff discount and regular sample sales
 
Life Insurance, medical care, cycle to work scheme
 
And tonnes moreâ€¦
 


 
We want our people to be whoever they want to be. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re committed to creating a truly inclusive culture at ASOS, but how we're doing it?
 
Through our Fashion with Integrity strategy we are driving diversity, equity and inclusion across every aspect of ASOS and ensuring every ASOSer can be their authentic self at work. We want our people to be whoever they want to be, because we believe people who bring their best selves to work, do their best work.
 
Weâ€™re proud members of Inclusive Companies, are Disability Confident Committed and have signed the Business in the Community Race at Work Charter. Weâ€™ve also recently been placed 8th in the Inclusive Top 50 Companies Employer List too.
 
There are safe space employee networks and we host a monthly DEI events series to help support and celebrate all of our people. We are constantly listening to our people, evolving, changing and taking a flexible approach to how we make ASOS truly inclusive.

job_desc:
Data Analyst Graduate
 
â€“â€“â€“
 
Lisburn
 
Data Analyst Graduate
 
Full Time â€“ 18 month Graduate Programme
 
Reporting to: Data Analyst Manager
 
Entry Level
 
Camlin Technologies Ltd
 
What To Expect Day To Day
 
Camlinâ€™s vision is to optimise the critical infrastructure all around us by bringing revolutionary products to life for a wide range of industries, including energy and rail, and has interests in a number of R&D projects in a variety of scientific sectors. At Camlin we believe in high quality engineering and design, allowing us to develop market leading products and services. In short, we love creating value for our customers by solving difficult problems. As of today, the Camlin operation spans over 20 countries across the globe.
 
The successfully appointed candidate will be reviewing data from devices monitoring critical infrastructure in the UK. You will identify trends and fault conditions in the data and learn to independently understand the causes and resolutions for issues identified from the data. The advanced candidate will develop their own tools and scripts to perform deeper analysis and present results and contribute to software being developed by the wider team.
 
RESPONSIBILITES
 
You will join an existing team who focus on the performance of our customers. We respond to daily queries from customers about electrical fault cases as well as providing ongoing performance analysis. We use data from multiple systems and create insights and dashboards in systems such as Tableau. We use insights from our AI team to support customers in the management of developing faults on the network.
 
 
 
Monitoring data being produced by Camlin devices in the field
 
 
Producing fault reports and analysis
 
 
Identifying trends in data series
 
 
Developing new tools for monitoring and analysing data
 
 
The successful candidate will have experience planning own work and working with limited supervision
 


 
What You Will Need To Succeed
 
 
 
You will need to be a final-year student from a 3rd level qualification seeking an excellent opportunity to learn and grow in business.
 
 
Be working toward a degree in a relevant scientific field incorporating programming components, such as electronic engineering or computer science
 
 
Have a strong mathematical background
 
 
Be confident in the use of data analysis tools
 


 
DESIRED CRITERIA
 
The following skills will be valuable but are not essential:
 
 
 
Experience of programming in a high-level language such as Python
 
 
Experience of data analysis on a cloud computing platform such as databricks, and utilising a distributed processing framework such as pyspark.
 
 
An interest in data science
 
 
Be enthusiastic about learning new skills, technologies and methodologies
 


 
OUR VALUES
 
 
 
We work together - We know that working collaboratively will help us reach our shared goals faster, so we always look for ways to help each other.
 
 
We believe in people - Here at Camlin, our people are central to what we do and what we can achieve. And as we move towards becoming industry and customer â€˜partnersâ€™ thatâ€™s even more important. We trust our team members to do their best and be supportive.
 
 
We wonâ€™t accept the â€˜way itâ€™s always been doneâ€™ - Since Camlinâ€™s inception, weâ€™ve been curious, inquisitive and always want to improve. Thinking differently is in our DNA and we love solving tough challenges.
 
 
We listen to learn - Whether itâ€™s our customers, our markets, or each other, we ask questions and listen to the answers so we can learn and improve.
 
 
Weâ€™re trying to do the right thing - We take responsibility for our actions and take decisions based on whatâ€™s right for people, profit and planet.
 


 
Company Description
 
Camlin is a global technology leader that operates with the vision of bringing revolutionary products to life for a wide range of industries, including power and rail, and also has interests in a number of R&D projects in a variety of scientific sectors.
 
At Camlin we believe in high quality engineering and design, allowing us to develop market leading products and services. In short, we love creating value for our customers by solving difficult problems.
 
As of today, the Camlin operation spans over 20 countries across the globe.
 
Benefits
 
 
 
Competitive salary
 
 
Company Pension & Life Assurance Schemes
 
 
On-site parking
 
 
Smart / Remote Working
 
 
Subsidised Gym Membership
 
 
Wellness programmes
 


 
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT
 
Individuals seeking employment at Camlin are considered without regards to race, colour, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

job_desc:
About Us:
 
StatsBomb was founded in January 2017 to provide data, analytics and consultancy to football teams, media and gambling companies, and has grown into a global multi-sports data and analytics SAAS provider.
 
StatsBomb are well known in the sports analytics industry for providing unique insights into the game of football and have developed a strong brand synonymous with highest quality and accuracy of data coupled with excellent customer service and support.
We have grown from our initial founder team of 3 at the start of 2017 to over 800 employees based in Europe, the US and Egypt, and are continuing to expand our operation as we build out our product portfolio and customer base.
 
Our core products are data and analytics tools, with a tech stack that includes computer vision, machine learning, stream processing, and web-based dataviz. We also have a growing consultancy service that allows customers to have additional access to our expertise and insight. From our origins as a blog pre 2017, StatsBomb have always had a strong foothold in the football analytics community and education remains a constant feature of both our products and our customer support ethos.
 
StatsBomb is an inspiring place to work. Our vision is clear - to be the world's leading sports data company - and we have a driven and dedicated leadership team to get us there, including the original founders, and headed up by CEO Ted Knutson. Our culture is open, honest, transparent, supportive and driven. Our employees are dedicated, motivated and genuinely love their work as well as the people they work with.
 
 
About The Role
 
At StatsBomb we are at the cutting edge of various aspects of the data analytics industry, however our Customer Success team is a truly unique offering within the industry. The StatsBomb Customer Success team manages and maintains the relationship with our customers within the football, gambling and media industries by offering detailed product demos, providing tools to manage the raw data, creating custom queries and reports and more. Our aim is to help our customers get more from our data, whether they are analysts, Sporting Directors, pundits/commentators, content creators or data scientists. A good customer success practitioner needs to be part consultant, part project manager, part product expert, part account manager and crucially for StatsBomb, an industry expert.
 
The majority of the work is done online, in the form of written emails or providing customers with reports as well as code - often creating new bespoke analysis either in R or Python depending on the customers internal set up. We also have a number of video calls with our customers and occasional face to face visits.
 
We are looking for an energetic and ambitious French speaking Customer Success Analyst to join our growing team. We are looking for someone who loves to scrutinize data to solve problems, who has experience with football data and with excellent communication skills. The ideal candidate will have advanced French language skills and will have impeccable written and spoken English skills.
 
The role is full time (38 hours) and can be flexible to suit your location/time zone and preferred ways of working. You should expect to be hands on from the beginning. You will be part of the Customer Success team who aim to provide the best customer service in the industry. You will be expected to fulfill some shifts during evenings and weekends - usually about 2 weekend days per month. You will be compensated at 1.5x per hour for all out of hours work that falls outside of your normal working week.
 
The career opportunities at StatsBomb are unlimited. Within the Customer Success team you will be working with our Data Scientists, Engineers and Product Owners, Marketing and Sales and there is flexibility to specialize in areas that interest you. We are keen to ensure that this role has growth opportunities and space for individuals to follow their areas of passion whilst also providing great value to our customers.
 
 
Job Responsibilities
 
 
Assist our customers and partners with setting up and using the products and services
Teach and demonstrate our products and services and assist in creating presentations and training
Respond to customer queries ranging from basic questions to advanced problem solving
Managing a subset of our customer base, ensuring they have everything they need to get the best out of StatsBomb Data and Analytics.
Responsible for customer renewals and upsells, establishing clear retention goals.
Creating bespoke reports and solutions for customers depending on their analysis needs
Updating customer information within our CRM to ensure one source of truth for all communication with our customers
Creating content and processes for our customer knowledge base in order to ensure that all bespoke reporting can scale and be used by all our customers as we grow
Helping customers use our APIâ€™s - showing them how to download, store and manipulate data using Python and R programming languages


 
Your technical skills:
 
Essential:
 
 
Confident interpersonal and written communication skills in English and French
Understanding Football / Soccer both generally and using data
Ability to solve problems on your own as well as in a team environment
A customer first mindset
Organized individual who can manage their time effectively
An eternal student who wants to continually learn and improve
A positive and optimistic attitude
2-4 years proven experience working in a similar role


 
Desirable:
 
Experience using Tableau/Power BI
Previous experience using StatsBomb Data
Python and / or R programming languages
Experience within a Customer Success Team
Written and verbal communication skills in German would be a plus.


 
Your background:
 
Experience working with Football Data
Educated to degree level
A passion for Football / Soccer
Proven ability to excel in a fast paced environment
Experience of Customer Success in a SAAS based industry


 
Salary
: Â£ 25-35K PA depending on experience plus a competitive stock option package.
 
 
Our process
:
 
An interview with someone from the Customer Success Team and HR plus a background check
An interview with 2 Customer Success Team members
A short task to check football / data analytics knowledge and approach to solving data queries
A final interview with at least one member of the senior management team


 
StatsBomb is an inspiring place to work. If you think you have the passion, drive and talent to join our exciting and fast paced team, weâ€™d love to hear from you!
 
In return, we offer the following:
 
 
Excellent career development opportunities
The opportunity to work with smart and dedicated colleagues, working towards a shared vision
A collaborative and diverse team environment
Remote and flexible working as well as inclusive wellbeing benefits
Team social activities
Competitive salaries and commission
Out of Hour compensation
Competitive stock option package for all employees
Competitive holiday allowance:
25 days holiday,
1 well-being day per quarter,
1 day off on your birthday,
possibility to buy and sell holidays
Equal maternity and paternity provision (20 weeks)
title: Customer Success Analyst - French Speaking

job_desc:
This is an exciting opportunity to join our expanding Client Integration Team. In this role, you will apply data analytics tools and techniques to identify changes and optimise the relevant screening systems, and will work as part of Proof of Concepts (POCs) and Implementations to support appropriate setup of the Screening Solution.
 
 
Key responsibilities in this role will include (but not be limited to):
 
Apply data analytic tools and techniques to identify changes to optimise relevant screening systems
Build a good understanding of the screening solution and identify tuning rules to reduce false positives generated from the screening system
Build a good understanding of the auto-decision solution and build a process to validate and manage rules within the auto-decision solution
Support the Integration Analytics Lead in applying the tuning framework to reduce false positives within the screening process
Conduct data analysis by leveraging historical data to identify ways to improve screening output
Review and assess existing system and controls relevant to screening to ascertain operational performance and effectiveness measures


 
 
 
Experience in an analytics role
Proven experience of leading a team of tuning analysts
Mature experience in a data / risk analytics role
Experience in configuration and validation of transaction screening solutions
Ability to analyse information (identify trends & patterns) and present a summary of results
Experience in statistical modelling, and analysis using techniques such as regression analysis, multivariate analysis, factor analysis, and clustering
Proficiency Python programming, SQL scripting and SQL databases
Experience in analysing data in payments platforms including SWIFT, ISO20022


 
 
GSS is a newly created regulatory technology business which brings global financial institutions together to optimise standards in compliance, by providing a trusted platform to exchange and enhance information.
 
Initially delivering sanctions transactions screening, GSS changes the way financial crime is tackled by partnering with leading financial institutions and trusted industry partners to deliver effective and efficient screening. As well as promoting excellence in compliance, GSSâ€™ solution significantly removes friction in the customer experience. The solution will perform state of the art, real time watchlist screening using the most advanced technology solutions for list management, alert generation, and disposition.
 
Backed by an industry consortium of financial service market leaders and equipped with decades of industry experience and advanced technologies, GSS will redefine how compliance can be delivered.
 
Are you ready to be part of the revolutionary organisation that will solve one of the most critical challenges facing the financial services industry?
 
 
 
We are purposeful and impact orientated. Be a part of a visionary company solving one of the most critical challenges facing the financial services industry
Teamwork and collaboration are at the heart of what we do and how we work
We pride ourselves on our diverse and inclusive environment, where everyone is welcome and able to flourish
We offer a fantastic opportunity to develop and grow your career within a fast-paced start-up business

Flexible hybrid working
Competitive salary and benefits


 
 
GSS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or disability.

About us:
Tutorful began in 2015, and weâ€™ve taken the tutoring world by storm. Today, Tutorful has over 11,000 tutors on our books who have taught over 2 million lessons to over 140,000 students. We have backing from a leading VC and several prominent tech executives. Weâ€™re a close-knit and highly-skilled team who love working together to create something that genuinely helps thousands of people.
 
Everything we do at Tutorful is promoted by 5 company values, encompassing our culture and how we work as a team:
- We put our customers first
- We favour small, autonomous teams with clear objectives
- We strive for impact
- We're open and transparent

The Role

Don't meet every single requirement? Statistics show that women and people of colour are less likely to apply for a role unless they meet every listed qualification. The APEM Group is a global environmental consultancy, we work with a range of clients including large corporations and governments to help them understand and solve a wide variety of environmental projects in the UK and globally. Our successful pioneering work has enabled us to grow and combine forces with other businesses who share our ethos and integrity. At our core, our people are working towards the protection of the environment across the globe.
 
Why Join Us?
 
APEM are looking for a Data Coordinator with an interest in Marine Wildlife and Image Analysis. This role is an exciting opportunity for somebody interested in gaining knowledge in the environmental sector, looking to get their foot in the door of a leading consultancy. You will coordinate with the team, dealing with data transcription and shipment. You will get involved in image analysis work, and maintaining records to ensure all data is up to standard.

Due to the importance of the data, you will have excellent attention to detail and hold strong communication skills to provide the best service to the team.
 
Next steps

job_desc:
The Position
 
About Roche:
 
We believe itâ€™s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now â€“ even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patientsâ€™ lives. We are courageous in both decision and action. We believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
 
We are proud of who we are, what we do, and how we do it. We are many, working as one across functions, across companies, and across the world.
 
We are Roche.
 
About the Apprenticeship:
 
Our
 
Product Development Informatics (PDIX)
 
organization is co-creating a better future for patients through technology and information. We are an agile organization that brings together great people who are passionate about technology innovation, and who thrive in dynamic, cross-functional, and mission-driven teams.
 
Our agile organization is made up of structures called Networks and Chapters. â€œNetworksâ€ comprise business domain and technical experts aligned closely with our Product Development business partners to develop and deliver technology-enabled business strategy. Our â€œChaptersâ€ are centers of expertise of deeply skilled people deployed for maximum impact. These teams work together to deliver outstanding value to our business, patients, and customers.
 
As a Data Science apprentice within the PDIX Data and Analytics Chapter, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve complex data problems enabling PD to transform data into actionable insights. You will collaborate with IT and business stakeholders to co-create data and analytics enabled solutions that help our teams fulfill our mission: to do now what patients need next.
 
The
 
Product Development Data Sciences
 
team in Welwyn Garden City is also seeking high calibre apprentices to join our teams to contribute to the development of our medicines, specifically the analysis, reporting and submission of clinical trial patient data.
 
In the biopharmaceutical industry, each data point is part of a patient's story and their contribution to developing better medicines and understanding disease. It is our responsibility to maximize the use of this data for answering new questions and enabling larger-scale analyses for generating new insights.
 
Successful candidates will use their data science and technical skills to contribute to the success of data science and insights generation at Roche working across diverse areas from the management and governance of data, to acquiring data and engineering solutions for visualising, integrating and analysing data, as well as ensuring data privacy,and also in areas such as learning and process management and healthcare compliance.
 
Apprentices joining Roche will work as part of a team in the Product Development Data Sciences department to deliver data and insights about our medicines and to provide solutions that aid the collection, databasing and analysis of clinical data for medicines in Rocheâ€™s diverse pipeline, contributing to the delivery of these to patients.
 
What you could be working on:
 
 
Leverage business acumen and technical expertise to support the quick creation of high-impact Prototypes/PoCs
Advanced data projects including predictive learning, neural networks, machine learning, anomaly detection, predictive analysis, exploratory data analysis and other data science practices
Generating insights from data, enabling us to optimise business performance. Solve complex data problems and deliver the insight that helps to define our strategy and enable our organisation to reach our patients faster
Collaborate in multidisciplinary agile teams to collect requirements, user specifications, approvals, and verify functionality and usefulness prior to full development of solutions
Collaborate with Data Engineers, Architects and Data and Analytics specialists to build lasting solutions to our data modelling


 
Essential Qualifications:
 
 
First or second class honors in computer science, Maths or related numerical discipline
At least A level Maths or Statistics (or equivalent)
Experience with Python programming
 
Level 2 Maths and English


 
Application Process:
 
 
Stage 1: CV & Cover Letter
 
Please ensure you include a CV and a cover letter with your application.
 
As part of your cover letter, Roche is keen to understand your motivation in applying for this position. You should, therefore, provide responses to the following questions:
 
 
Why have you applied for this Apprenticeship program?
 
If you had to choose a single example or achievement in your life, that you feel would make you suitable for this role, what would it be and why?


 
Your cover letter should not exceed one page.
 
Please not that all applications without a cover letter will be rejected automatically.
 
Video Interview
 
Once the HR review is complete, you may be invited to complete a video Interview to support your application.
 
 
Stage 2: Assessment Centre
 
If you are successful at the Video, CV and Cover Letter screening, you will be invited to the final stage of the application process. This will include a face-to-face interview, and relevant activities critical for the role, giving you a taste of Roche and the opportunity.
 
Application Deadline: 20th February 2023
 
Start Date: September 2023
 
Who we are
 
At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, weâ€™ve become one of the worldâ€™s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.
 
Our UK Pharmaceutical head office is situated in Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire, with beautiful countryside surrounding the area. Supported by major motorways & airports as well as being a 30 minute train ride to London, access is easy. Our award-winning office, known as Hexagon Place, was opened in 2005 and provides a modern, flexible working environment with facilities that are second-to-none. Around 2,000 people work at our Welwyn office in Global Early Development (pRED), Global Product Development (PD), Commercial (Rx) and our Corporate functions.
 
Roche offer a competitive salary plus the excellent benefits you would expect from a blue-chip organisation. There is a fully equipped gym on-site, a library and information centre, and an active sports and social club. We also have a subsidised staff restaurant providing foods to cater for every taste throughout the day. At the heart of the building is an informal meeting area known as The Street which features a coffee shop, snack machine and cashpoint. A second building on-site, called The Hub, contains modern meeting room and conference facilities. Roche promotes personal well-being and work-life balance. Therefore, flexible working options will be considered for all roles at Roche UK. Roche is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment. The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of Roche.
 
The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of Roche Products Ltd. At Roche Products we believe diversity drives innovation and we are committed to building a diverse and flexible working environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion or belief, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, disability or age. We recognise the importance of flexible working and will review all applicantsâ€™ requests with care. At Roche difference is valued and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer where you are encouraged to bring your whole self to work.
