job_desc:
Heard of us?
 
Urenco is a trusted, long-term supplier to the nuclear industry, specialising in safe, cost effective and reliable uranium enrichment services. As demand in our sector increases, we are creating career opportunities and growth across our teams.
 
For us, a happy and engaged workforce is vital to our sustainability. Our aim is to recruit and retain talented people who can help us deliver outstanding customer service and achieve long-term commercial success.
 
The role of Reward Analyst is important to us. Based at our Capenhurst site (near Chester) youâ€™ll report to the Group Head of Reward with a day to day guidance from the Reward Business Partner. The Reward & HR Analyst will provide technical, analytical, and administrative support to the C&B team and HR. In addition, the purpose of the role is to deliver a full HR and Reward reporting insights and help identify opportunities for change, improvement, alignment, and consistency.
 
This is a fixed term contract role covering maternity leave until end of June 2024. We are looking for candidates that are available at short notice and could start in April 2023.
 
What will your day look like?
 
Manage HR dashboard reporting to incorporate HR KPIs across the business.
Manage the analysis and completion of salary survey reports with accurate and timely information.
Produce reports and management information to support business decision making as required, as well as maintaining key statistical information / metrics on a proactive basis
Manage the annual Gender Pay reporting and submission process.
Monthly job evaluation reporting
Annual global equal pay analysis
Ensure best use of existing reward tools and systems and contribute to the design and implementation of any future reward/HRIS systems
Support annual remuneration processes (salary review) through provision of market data and salary banding
Support as necessary the day-to-day operation of the UK Benefits portfolio
actively support the re-broking and contract negotiation / service delivery processes with suppliers
Manage system administration of the flexible benefits platform and resolve any day-to-day issues raised by employees or the provider
Support flexible benefits annual enrolments/renewal projects including systems testing and addressing any issues
Support Pensions & Payroll Manager with UK pensions administration e.g., delivery of pension inductions to new joiners
Support Reward team members in the delivery of reward and HR improvement projects as required
Support with the implementation and communication of new employee benefits and initiatives


 
What do you need to be great at this role
 
Educated to degree standard, preferably with further qualifications in Human Resources/Reward or Finance or equivalent experience
Proven experience of compensation and benefits within a large commercial organisation involving practical and detailed application of the existing compensation and benefits policies and processes
Experience of job evaluation (Hay) and job matching (Korn Ferry / Mercer / Willis Towers Watson)
Experience of salary reviews and bonus administration
Experience of working in a unionised environment (Desirable)
Experience of dealing with 3rd party suppliers/contracts (Desirable)
Experience of working in a global reward and benefits environment (Desirable)
Excellent numerical and analytical skills with high attention to detail
Proficiency in Excel and complex data modelling
Excellent problem solving skills with a continuous improvement mind-set: able to investigate issues and respond appropriately using different sources of information
Strong planning and organisational skills: able to manage several different tasks simultaneously ensuring that timelines are met
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentation
Ability to work in a complex, challenging and sensitive environment
Application of â€œthink global, implement localâ€ concept
Strong commercial acumen
Collaboration - able to work effectively and inclusively, within and outside of the immediate team
Knowledge of compensation reporting software and experience using HR Information Systems (SAP ERP 6.0 and Success Factors desirable).


 
What can you expect of us?
 
At Urenco weâ€™re dedicated to offering flexible benefits that support our people across all aspects of their lives. Weâ€™re delighted to offer a range of benefits to support our employeesâ€™ physical, emotional and financial wellbeing.
In addition to a competitive salary (Â£46,000-Â£59,000), we offer:
 
 
Annual leave starting at 25 days, which increases by one day for every two years of service up to a maximum of 30 days. In addition, you will be able to accrue 13 additional days off to be used flexibly.
A diverse range of family friendly policies.
A generous bonus scheme based on company performance.
A defined contribution pension scheme; with up to 16% employerâ€™s contribution.
Flexible benefits package; including life assurance and income protection. In addition, youâ€™ll have an opportunity to purchase additional benefits that suit your lifestyle and take advantage of tax and NI savings.
Education and training; we take pride in helping people learn and develop by supporting, accelerating and directing your learning. As well as the completion of mandatory health and safety courses, training packages will be offered to meet your specific needs.


 
This role is subject to passing:
 
Security Clearance
Medical, drug and alcohol tests


 
Still curious?
 
At Urenco, everyone is welcome. We strive to create an inclusive and diverse environment where we all have a voice, and you can feel confident being yourself. Weâ€™re committed to equality, diversity and inclusion. Weâ€™d like our future workforce to have an equal gender balance, represent a broad mix of people from minority ethnic backgrounds, LGBTQ+, those with a disability and supporting social mobility.
 
Join us on our journey, front and centre, to a net zero future.

job_desc:
At PitchBook, we are always looking forward. We continue to innovate, evolve and invest in ourselves to bring out the best in everyone. Weâ€™re deeply collaborative and thrive on the excitement, energy and fun that reverberates throughout the company.
 
Our extensive mentorship, education and training programs help us create a culture of curiosity that pushes us to always find new solutions and better ways of doing things. The combination of a rapidly evolving industry and our high ambitions means thereâ€™s going to be some ambiguity along the way, but we excel when we challenge ourselves. Weâ€™re willing to take risks, fail fast and do it all over again in the pursuit of excellence.
 
If you have a good attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done, PitchBook is the place for you.
 
About The Role
 
Leveraged Commentary & Data (LCD) provides news and research on the leveraged finance markets to 80,000 plus subscribers worldwide. The Research Team is responsible for maintaining LCDâ€™s databases, ensuring that not only is information entered in a timely fashion, but also with the utmost attention to accuracy and quality. We are a leading information provider whose success hinges upon producing a best-in-class data and research product.
 
As an Associate Data Analyst for leveraged loans, you will handle all aspects of data management, including the secondary market data behind LCD's loan indexes, the primary market data behind LCDâ€™s market technicals and investor market data (business development companies (BDCs), collateralized loan obligations (CLOs), etc.). Management of this data is a cornerstone to LCDâ€™s unique content and maintaining our position in market.
 
Primary Job Responsibilities
 
 
 
Provide support to the analytical team by building and updating leveraged loan and high yield bond profiles in LCDâ€™s proprietary database based upon bank books and prospectuses gathered from the market
 
 
Bring together information from market sources such as SEC filings or Ratings Direct and update LCDâ€™s related databases and analysis
 
 
Develop an understanding LCDâ€™s production processes for its research reports and analysis
 
 
Support senior analysts and other group members for varied data collection processes and analysis
 
 
Build your knowledge of the basics of the leveraged finance markets including loans and high yield bonds, including the mechanics of the markets, syndication processes and documentation
 
 
Support the vision and values of the company through role modeling and encouraging desired behaviors
 
 
Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested
 


 
Skills And Qualifications
 
 
 
Bachelor's degree in finance, economics or accounting, or equivalent experience
 
 
2+ years experience in an analytical role in financial services is strongly preferred
 
 
Strong attention to detail, particularly with regards to the ability to accurately handle data
 
 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
 
 
Ability to be an independent self-starter in a fast-paced environment
 
 
Intellectual curiosity and dedication to learn about financial markets
 
 
Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and Power Point. Access is a plus
 
 
Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data
 


 
Benefits At PitchBook
 
Physical Health
 
 
 
Private medical insurance
 
 
Dental scheme
 
 
Additional medical wellness incentives
 
 
Life cover
 


 
Emotional Health
 
 
 
Paid sabbatical program after four years
 
 
Paid parental leave
 
 
Education subsidies
 
 
Robust training programs on industry and soft skills
 
 
Minimum 25 days annual leave and volunteer days
 


 
Social Health
 
 
 
Employee resource groups
 
 
Company-wide events
 
 
Employee referral bonus program
 
 
Quarterly team building events
 


 
Financial Health
 
 
 
8% Pension contribution
 
 
Income protection
 
 
Shared ownership employee stock program
 
 
Transportation stipend
 
Please be aware the above PitchBook benefit and perk offerings are subject to corresponding plan and policy documents and may change during the course of your employment.


 
Life At PB
 
We are consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work and our culture is at the heart of our success. Itâ€™s our fundamental belief that people do and create great things and that people are the cornerstone of prosperity. We believe that proactively seeking out different points of view, listening to others, learning and reflecting on what weâ€™ve heard creates a sense of belonging within PitchBook and strengthens the PitchBook community.
 
We are excited to get to know you and your background. Concerned that you might not meet every requirement? We encourage you to still apply as you might be the right candidate for the role or other roles at PitchBook.

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
THE ROLE
 
Bud is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our Product team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for leveraging, analysing, and driving actionable insights to the business and our customers. This role will report to the Lead Product Owner and will work within a well-established, talented Business Intelligence team on a day-to-day basis. The business intelligence team consists of 2 SQL/BI developers and testers. The role will include product owner responsibilities for the Business Intelligence team such as managing the product backlog and generating work for the team.
 
MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES
 
 
 
Interpret data and analyse results using statistical techniques
Present data in various forms for technical and non-technical stakeholders
Manage, cleanse and aggregate data from various sources
Develop data models and architecture that meet ongoing requirements for data collection whilst optimising statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Work with management and scrum teams to prioritise business and information needs
Manage the backlog of work for the Business Intelligence team


 
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
 
 
Essential
 
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Excellent Excel, SQL and data visualisation skills
Proven working experience with Microsoft PowerBI
Ability to design and communicate effective briefs to stakeholders


 
Desirable
 
Experience of owning a BI product
Previous experience as a Product Owner
Knowledge of other programming languages such as DAX, Python or R.
Machine learning experience
An understanding of BI testing
Experience of working within a Training Provider or funded learning environment
Understanding of training providersâ€™ reporting needs and challenges
Scrum or Kanban experience e.g. Azure DevOps


 
KEY ATTRIBUTES
 
 
High levels of drive and determination, that strive to exceed expectations
Works with a sense of urgency and enjoys being in a fast-paced environment
Logical and analytical approach
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Ability to identify issues quickly, investigate and solve complex problems and apply appropriate solutions
Resilient in the face of challenges
Adaptable to changing contexts
 


 
THE TEAM
 
You will be a key member of Bud, and work within the Product team. Our Product team works together with our Development, Test and Infrastructure teams to form our wider Delivery team. We collaborate together, following agile development practices to continuously ship incremental value to our customers and end users.
 
THE PERKS
 
Benefits
 
25 days holiday (plus bank holidays), rising to 29 days (fte) with service
Additional day leave for birthday
Hybrid working
Life Assurance
Private healthcare
Company Contributory pension scheme
Free on-site gym
Ongoing personal development opportunities


 
Bud Systems are not a sponsoring organisation. You must have the right to live and work in the UK without restriction or limitation.
 
 
A BPSS clearance is required for all Bud employees and the scope of this role may require an additional Security Clearance (SC).

This is a 12 month FTC to facilitate the business to deliver on a number of key technology initiatives. As a Data Analyst, you'll play a crucial role in integrating the third-party services and new lease management system. Experience with visualization tools such as PowerBI and the Microsoft Azure ecosystem.

Two Circles is a vibrant, multi-award-winning and rapidly-expanding sports marketing agency. We work with some of the worldâ€™s biggest sports organisations including the NFL, Premier League and UEFA.
 
Weâ€™re looking for growth-oriented, dynamic and motivated new team members to help us build a once-in-a-lifetime sports business and reimagine the commercial frameworks of the global sports industry.
 
Every day, our team analyses billions of pieces of behavioural, attitudinal and purchase data from sports fans spanning the globe, using the latest machine-learning and data visualisation technology. We do this to give our clients the tools and insight required to build direct relationships with fans, grow engagement, and drive revenue across their event-day, sponsorship and media businesses.
 
We have a global team of 500 Two Circlers working from six offices across the world (London, New York, Los Angeles, Melbourne, Paris and Bern) who work cross-region to service our expanding international client base. See here for some examples of our work.
 
As part of our ongoing growth, we are looking to innovate with our technology stack and are seeking a Junior Data Ops Engineer to onboard Clients and maintain the Two Circles services and products we provide them, including:
 
Data Operations:
 
Configuring and maintaining the cloud-based applications, components and infrastructure that underpins our market-leading products and service, from provisioning environments all the way to user access management and permissions
Data Management:
 
Aggregating and structuring diverse sets of data, and providing machine-learning-powered models to forecast and influence commercial performance
Data Analytics:
 
Analysing commercial performance, audience segmentation, and monitoring sales and marketing campaigns in real-time


It is a fantastic opportunity for a smart, dynamic and ambitious person interested in working for sportâ€™s most exciting agency at our UK headquarters, located at the heart of Londonâ€™s technology hub.
 
Role Profile:
As a Junior Data Engineer at Two Circles, you play a key role assisting our team of engineers configuring and supporting data and BI solutions for the largest sporting organisations in the world. Using your keen eye for detail, logical and analytical mindset and understanding of configuring data technology, you help implement Two Circlesâ€™ industry leading data solutions for our clients and projects.
 
There will be plenty of opportunities to rotate through different teams (Data Engineering, BI Engineering) to give you real learning and development chances in different areas of our tech team. You can take significant ownership over what you learn and what you want to have different exposure to!
 
You collaborate with multiple internal teams to understand requirements, thoroughly planning and testing changes before accurately implementing them to a high standard of client and colleague satisfaction. You are a natural problem solver managing multiple proactive and reactive tasks and assignments, effectively prioritising your work, identifying risks and clearly communicating these to stakeholders.
 
You thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment and are equally comfortable discussing technical concepts with your DataOps & Engineering peers as you are explaining them to less technical colleagues.
 
When you are not delivering against specific projects or contributing to effective IT Operations activities, you are spotting opportunities to add value or realise improvements, working on your own professional development and learning objectives or sharing knowledge with other Two Circlers.
 
This role will be part of the Data & Engineering Team.
 
Your main duties & responsibilities:
 
Monitoring our data management platform and associated data pipelines, working with Engineering colleagues to provide expert support as required
Supporting the onboarding of new clients into our Data Analytics and Management products including configuration of data ingestion, data mapping, opt-in tracking, customer matching, data export and client facing dashboards and analytics
Using Data Management hubs to configure and manage client environments, including implementing changes, testing and supporting the regular release of feature updates
Working across the DataOps & Engineering function to help input into feature specification and ideation to improve product and services offering
Providing client-facing Services and Product teams with accurate and informative reports on data quality, integrity of transformation procedures and timeliness of task sequences and schedules
Reconciling data throughout stages of collection, processing and presentation
Playing a role in our User Access Management process across Two Circlers and Client users
Protecting the data entrusted to us by our clients at all times


 
The ideal background and skills we are looking for include:
 
 
Understanding of IT Operations and Service Management practices, including incident/request, change and problem management, monitoring, events and alerting, task tracking and fulfilment toolsets, capacity planning
Demonstrable knowledge of data-intensive technology environments, or equivalent higher education qualification
Analytical mindset with some experience of Systems and Data configuration, e.g. DWH, CMS, CRM, ERP, PIM
Basic knowledge of at least one of the following data query languages; SQL or Python/Pyspark
Awareness of Data Protection, Privacy and Governance principles, e.g. GDPR
Producing and maintaining good standards of documentation
Great self-starting attitude and keen to join an entrepreneurial organisation where every working day is different
Excellent time management, organisational skills and attention to detail
Problem solver - you have a curiosity and a willingness to learn new things
A team player who contributes to collective goals above personal gain


 
Process:
 
 
Introductory Call with Emily - Talent Manager (30 mins over Teams)
 
Tech Team Day -
 
16th October
 
(fun exercises, relaxed/informal Q&A sessions with the team over a coffee, tech presentation, tour of the office and an interview -
 
lunch and travel expenses provided
)


 
 
Though these are the basics written down, we will principally be recruiting for energy, values and commitment â€“ both to Two Circles and to your career.
 
 
Our recruitment process will be honest & thorough, and so will our roles. In return, we can offer honesty, integrity, and the chance to progress in the organisation as quickly as you develop within it.
 
 
Two Circles is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

job_desc:
We are now closed for 2023 and are hiring for 2024!
 
 
Are you a graduate keen on data and looking for a chance to kickstart your career? Rockborne could be the place for you with our Data Programme!
 
Rockborne was founded by a team of passionate industry experts with decades of international Data & Analytics experience, with the aim to turn our graduates into talented, world-class consultants. We employ diverse, talented, and ambitious graduates and immerse you in a powerful combination of bespoke technical, business, and interpersonal training to meet the needs of leading UK companies.
 
You will be a part of Rockborneâ€™s bespoke 28 month paid graduate programme, providing you with a truly rounded training experience, so as well as learning to excel in areas including data engineering and data analytics, we will train you in business acumen, consultancy and much much more. This is your chance to learn from the best in the business, and take on real-world data problems.
 
After an initial 13 weeks of in person training, you will spend the next two years gaining real-world experiences with our clients, whilst continuing to get support, development, mentoring, and coaching from our experienced Rockborne team.
 
Our clients are UK wide so you could work anywhere, but most projects are within the M25 and range from fast-growing start-ups to industry titans on your Rockborne journey. Our in person training programme is London-based at our Wimbledon head office and weâ€™re looking for Graduates who are up for a challenge.
 
We will ensure youâ€™re matched to a leading business that will offer you the optimal experience based on your ethical beliefs, career preferences, development aspirations, and our clientsâ€™ requirements. You will need to be flexible where youâ€™re located but, rest assured, no matter where you are based, you will always get access and support from your Rockborne family.
 
We will support you every step of the way and provide you with sound career advice to make sure you emerge from Rockborne fully equipped to make a difference in the world of data.
 
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
 
Â· Educated to a degree level with a strong interest in data - you don't need set grades or a certain degree to join us
Â· A natural problem solver, comfortable translating complex issues in a clear and easy to understand way
Â· A self-starter who is willing to go the extra mile either for your clientâ€™s benefit, or building your own knowledge agenda
Â· A desire to work in a stakeholder focused environment, comfortable blending the technical with a more client-facing aspect
 
HOW TO APPLY AND WHAT TO EXPECT:
 
Â· Submit your profile via the â€˜Apply nowâ€™ button
Â· Your CV will be reviewed by a real person
Â· Telephone interview - an introduction call to Rockborne, you interview us!
Â· Online numerical test - coming into data, numbers are important and that's all we are looking at
Â· Video call - asking you to undertake some research for us in data, can you showcase what you've learnt
 
And that's it, no psychometrics, trip hazards or bots. We would love to hear from you and learn more about you and you personal goals and drivers.
 
Our intakes are throughout the year and we work to a timetable that suits you. We are now closed for 2023 and are hiring for 2024!

job_desc:
Our mission is to make life easier for the lifeblood of economies globally; small and medium-sized businesses. Codat is a universal API for consented business financial data, powering the next generation of products and services for this historically underserved market. We have offices in London, New York, Sydney, and a San Francisco office will be opening soon. We are a privately held company and have recently closed our Series B, being funded by Index Ventures, Tiger Global, American Express, PayPal and a line-up of world-class angel investors.
 
No matter what weâ€™re doing - whether weâ€™re speaking to customers, partners or to each other - we live by our values.
 
We believe in delivering
 
useful
 
technology that solves real problems for real businesses. We have a real want to do the stuff that isn't always â€œcoolâ€ but makes a difference.
 
We believe that the people in the best teams push and enable each other to excel Weâ€™re
 
united
 
when we have each otherâ€™s backs - when something goes wrong, we donâ€™t blame, we work together to fix it. We embrace differences of opinion to end up with better outcomes. We donâ€™t let our egos win.
 
We believe that
 
an unstoppable
 
drive towards a single, clearly stated goal is the best way to build great things. We are biased towards action - we make informed decisions and then we act. There is no such thing as an impossible problem, just a great challenge to sink our teeth into.
 
About the role:
We are looking for a Data Scientist to capitalise on our rapidly growing data infrastructure to provide advanced analytics and develop models designed to increase growth and efficiency. There is an immense amount of opportunity to leverage data in more sophisticated ways across Codatâ€™s different functions like Product, Engineering, Sales and Marketing. The role will also entail a high degree of autonomy, responsibility, and exposure to senior stakeholders across the business. It is reasonable to expect some data engineering-style work such as writing SQL to pre-process data.
 
Key responsibilities:
 
Be a critical member of a tight-knit and high-performing Data and Analytics team
Lead on Codatâ€™s internal data science efforts, specifically:
Identify metrics of interest to the business
Design and productionise predictive models for key metrics
Work cross-functionally to implement solutions that translate analytical insight into real value-add data-driven action
Contribute to Codatâ€™s data engineering strategy, and be responsible for the maintenance of key analytical data sources
Prioritise the most critical needs of the business and deliver analytics to support those areas
Act as a spokesperson for the Data and Analytics Team internally, while building wider understanding and appreciation of data resources within Codat
Provide technical expertise and training on analytical best practices to the data and wider business teams
Lead efforts to migrate decision-making away from ad-hoc processes to being fully-underpinned by intelligent data-driven models


 
What excites us:
 
Demonstrably strong technical skills, with a focus on Python and SQL
Demonstrable experience working in a data science environment at a start-up or scale-up
Familiarity with key data science concepts, ideally supported by a combination of relevant degree, educational qualifications, and data science project experience
Professional drive and intellectual curiosity
Excellent communication skills and EQ
Experience with delivering projects against tight deadlines while maintaining a balance between programmatic rigor, speed of execution, and long-term planning
Technical skills: Python, SQL, Data science with some experience working with commercial data in a time-series environment
Experience translating predictive models into real value-add action, in addition to expertise in data science and predictive modelling

Drive, enthusiasm, intellectual curiosity, willingness to learn
Experience working with commercial data i.e. data from different parts of a business
Software familiarity: Microsoft Azure, Pyspark / Databricks, dbt, Looker, Snowflake


 
Company Benefits
 
Share Options scheme, empowering everyone to share in our success
25 days holiday (plus Bank Holidays)
'In person optional policy'- working in the office is entirely your choice
 
Team lunches, Company Socials, office snacks and roof top barbecues
Professionally led Yoga classes, office football team and Cycle to Work Scheme
Work alongside some of the UK's best Software Engineering talent
Cutting-edge and always evolving tech stack
Fun, fast paced, directly see your impact and full autonomy

Modern, airy and dog-friendly offices with private roof terrace


 
Interview Process

1 hour Final Interview

title: Junior Data Consultant

job_desc:
Who We Are


People have always been at the heart of St. Jamesâ€™s Place, we value long-term relationships and we are a home for people who care about the future â€“ financially, environmentally and socially. These core values have enabled us to become a leading FTSE 100 Wealth Management company.


Junior Data Analyst


Location:
 Hybrid Cirencester/Remote (2 days p/wk in Cirencester office)


Employment Type:
 Permanent


We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Junior Data Analyst. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and implementing data integration solutions using ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tools and technologies.




You will be expected to learn one or two of the following ETL systems including; SQL, Talend, Matillion, Snowflake, Informatica, DataStage and Tableau Prep. Training and support will be provided to help you accomplish this.




Once the data is extracted you will work with others to make the data available to those who need it, or create data visualization reports as necessary for Stakeholders. This will be done using Tableau or Power BI.


 What youâ€™ll be doing: 


Support the development of self-serve reporting by being an SME in divisional data sources and engaging with data recipients.
Youâ€™ll help with the design and develop ETL processes using tools such as Talend, Informatica, or Datastage.
Extract data from various sources, including databases, flat files, and APIs.
Transform data using techniques such as data cleansing, data mapping, and data aggregation.
Load data into target systems such as data warehouses, data lakes, and business intelligence platforms.
With support, youâ€™ll design and build new reports/dashboards based on divisional requirements by being a SME in the use of the division's chosen data visualisation tool (i.e. Tableau).
Deliver regular MI insights to the Senior Management Team within agreed SLAs, provide written commentary and analysis on the contents of the reports.
Maintain appropriate procedure documents for team tasks, completing an annual review across these to ensure they remain up to date.
Support projects by working with stakeholders to elicit the MI requirements, delivering on these by building the required MI and providing relevant insights into the data produced.
Any ad hoc tasks as required within the MI or wider Strategy & Change team which can utilise the individualâ€™s analytical and data driven approach.


 Who weâ€™re looking for: 


Proficiency with ETL tools such as Talend, Informatica, or Datastage.
Good understanding of SQL and database concepts.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret large and multiple data sets.
Experience developing new data sets and defining MI & reporting requirements for a large division.
Strong experience with Tableau preferred, together with advanced Excel skills with experience in designing and building dashboards.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with ability to present your findings from complex data sets to the end user is a simple and easy to understand way.
Ability to amalgamate data from multiple sources and present it in a simple and functional way.
Ability to identify data requirements and define required data sets.
Successfully engage in multiple projects simultaneously.
Proof reading skills and a strong eye for accuracy.
Ability to interact professionally within diverse groups, including executives, managers, subject matter experts and end users.


 Flexible Working 




We understand that employees work best in different ways, at different times and in different environments. We value all of our employees and appreciate that everyone is unique, and at one of many stages within their career. Recognising this, we have introduced a hybrid working policy to provide greater flexibility for part-time work, job-sharing, remote working, and flexibility on hours. Our people are encouraged to work in a flexible way that suits their lifestyle where it can be accommodated, so please ask the question and start a conversation!




Research tells us that applicants (especially those from underrepresented groups) can be put off from applying for a role if they do not meet all the criteria or have been on an extended career-break. If you think you would be a good match for this role and can demonstrate some transferable experience please apply, regardless of whether you tick every box.


 Why work for us? 


 Our Rewards 




In addition to an attractive salary and eligibility to participate in the discretionary annual bonus opportunities, you will also receive an excellent benefits package including:


Non-Contributory Pension â€“ 10% (increasing with length of service) with further pension matching
Meaningful protection benefits with real value, such as 10X life cover, PHI, and critical illness.*

28 days holiday entitlement plus bank holidays (based on full-time equivalent) with the option to buy up to an additional 5 days holiday

Not applicable to fixed term contracts (standard uplift applies in lieu of the protection benefits)


 Our Culture 




Our culture is the glue that binds us together - Itâ€™s one of our biggest assets and one of the biggest reasons for our success. Itâ€™s underpinned by core values of doing the right thing, being the best version of ourselves and investing in long term relationships.




We want to embrace diverse backgrounds and experiences to connect with clients, solve problems and innovate. We raise our voice on the things that matter to us and drive change from the front. Contributing to our inclusive culture is vital, ensuring a space for everyone to be their authentic self, no compromises.




In all we do, we consider how our work affects the communities in which we belong. Over 96% of our group employees are involved in supporting our communities through financial education, charitable giving and volunteering. Over 80% of all our employees and Partners donate each month to our Charitable Foundation, which is now the 3rd largest corporate charity in the UK.




SJP are delighted to have signed The Armed Forces Covenant, and we are active members of LGBT Great, 30% club, The Diversity Project, Disability Confident and more! Find out more: https://www.sjp.co.uk/careers/life-at-sjp


 Our Awards: 




We understand itâ€™s important to be proud of the company you work for, thatâ€™s why weâ€™re proud to share with you some of our recent awards:


Wealth Manager of the Year â€“ Growth Investor Awards 2021
Best Wealth Manager â€“ Shares Awards 2021
Championing LGBTQ Inclusion - Financial Adviser Diversity in Finance Awards 2020
Top 75 Employer - Social Mobility Foundation Employer Index 2021

job_desc:
We are looking for an experienced automation delivery and implementation specialist. This is a role for a lead of a future Appian delivery team. We are implementing a range of applications developed using Appian as part of the cloud platform that we are building for our customers.
 
The Automation / Case Management Lead will become responsible for end-to-end delivery of further developments, enhancements, applications at GSS. Initially, the individual will be the first internal developer of GSS applications on Appian low-code platform. Over time, this person would become a lead for Appian developers and testers.
 
 
 
 
Key responsibilities in this role will include (but not be limited to):
 
Design, develop, enhance applications on Appian low-code platform as part of GSS platform.
Define and implement Appian solutions within the GSS platform, through the entire life-cycle of Appian projects / workstreams from initiation to go live and support.
Depending on the GSS pipeline for Appian delivery, there may be demand for Appian developers or testers in the future. The Appian Lead would take an active role in their recruitment and take on the ongoing management of these individuals.
Lead the Appian delivery work and a delivery team which may consist of GSS developers and partners in designing applications and related development activities.
Coordinate and collaborate with GSS stakeholders, GSS customers, Appian themselves and external Appian partners to arrive at application design and architectural decisions.
Lead and/or Perform testing of Appian functionality.
Align with or set up governance mechanisms to ensure enforcement and continuity of the quality assurance process. Experience of automated testing on Appian is an advantage.
Work with GSS Product teams to identify how best to leverage Appian to deliver on and enhance GSS value proposition and product roadmap.
Make decisions on Appian architecture (solution architecture, integration design, etc).
Perform L2-L3 support activities related to customers using Appian as part of GSS platform. Escalate and coordinate with Appian Support.
Coach delivery team members to ensure high quality standards in the delivered application, best practices, design patterns, shared components.


 
 
 
 
Appian design and development experience, or relevant enterprise technology lead experience such as BPM, low-code etc., preferably within the Financial Services sector.
Ability to understand business use cases and related personas, proactively engage with GSS Product Owners and stakeholders, and collaborate/contribute to GSS Product roadmap strategy.
Experience leading enterprise BPM, low-code or workflow projects in a Technical Lead position. You have led teams of developers and testers to deliver at pace and to meet commitments following a Scrum and/or Scaled Agile methodology.
Ability to manage the delivery team by understanding strengths, weaknesses and needs.
Strong database skills (SQL, data model design).
Willingness to be a lifelong learner in Appian methodology and technology.
Complex platform software delivery experience including successful delivery of a major programme.
Ability to effectively identify risks, come up with recommendations, make decisions and drive a delivery project towards realisation of value.
Ability to work in a structured manner even in situations where multiple tasks are required (e.g. balancing new delivery and ongoing maintenance).


 
 
 
GSS is a newly created regulatory technology business which brings global financial institutions together to optimise standards in compliance, by providing a trusted platform to exchange and enhance information.
 
Initially delivering sanctions transactions screening, GSS changes the way financial crime is tackled by partnering with leading financial institutions and trusted industry partners to deliver effective and efficient screening. As well as promoting excellence in compliance, GSSâ€™ solution significantly removes friction in the customer experience.
 
The solution will perform state of the art, real time watchlist screening using the most advanced technology solutions for list management, alert generation and disposition. Backed by an industry consortium of financial service market leaders and equipped with decades of industry experience and advanced technologies, GSS will redefine how compliance can be delivered.
 
Are you ready to be part of the revolutionary organisation that will solve one of the most critical challenges facing the financial services industry?
 
 
 
 
We are purposeful and impact orientated. Be a part of a visionary company solving one of the most critical challenges facing the financial services industry
Teamwork and collaboration are at the heart of what we do and how we work
We pride ourselves on our diverse and inclusive environment, where everyone is welcome and able to flourish
We offer a fantastic opportunity to develop and grow your career within a fast-paced start-up business
Flat non-hierarchical team structures, offering exposure and plenty of opportunities to learn from your peers
Flexible hybrid working


 
 
We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.

job_desc:
Job Id: 23613166
 
Overview of Citi:
 
Citi is a world-leading global bank. We have approximately 200 million customer accounts and a presence in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions worldwide. We provide consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. We enable clients to achieve their strategic financial objectives by providing them with cutting-edge ideas, best-in-class products and solutions, and unparalleled access to capital and liquidity.
 
Citi Belfast is one of the largest employers in Northern Ireland with a diverse and talented team of over 3000 people from over 40 different nationalities across our four Belfast offices.
 
We are the only global investment bank operating in Northern Ireland. Every day, our local experts interact with global teams in over 100 countries developing and supporting next-generation technology solutions for the enterprise and delivering critical services to the bank and its customers, to make sure we are a stronger and safer organization for our clients.
 
You will have a truly global reach, which will provide you with new experiences and development opportunities right here in Belfastâ€™s iconic Titanic Quarter.
 
About the team:
 
Our mission at Institutional Clients Group (ICG) Engineering and Architecture Practice (EAP) is to focus on ensuring architectural cohesion and delivering common, cross-functional capabilities across ICG Technology. This will be done by improving and upgrading our tools, streamlining our processes, automating, and strengthening our controls, and helping development teams adopt modern ways of working. As part of it, the Business Architecture practice will guide transformational IT improvements supporting ICGâ€™s global functions.
 
The Business Architecture Analytics team is a new team within ICG Technology, Engineering and Architecture Practices, working within our Business Architecture function. Our mission is to enable more efficient data-driven decision making by capturing data and extracting metrics to create insightful visualisations. The platform will make it easier for senior business and technology leaders to understand the data and leverage the insights and metrics to drive future business architecture and investments decisions.
 
The Opportunity
 
The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for working directly with stakeholders to build out the Business Architecture tooling portfolio by designing and delivering data insights which will be exposed by the Business Architecture analytics platform. This modelling will continuously evolve as it extends with more data sources become available. They will partner with a range of technology teams from across different front office ICG line of business and enterprise functions to ensure authorized data sources are used to connect and analyze information, to create actionable intelligence for our business and technology leaders. They will focus on the accuracy of the metrics and information displayed and take feedback on board to customize it in accordance with stakeholdersâ€™ requests. The role will grow as more complex data sets are analyzed and integrated in the platform.
 
This is both an exciting and challenging opportunity to join a growing team and help drive improvements to business architecture across global technology teams.
 
Responsibilities:
 
 
Design and lead the data analysis to define metrics that will be fed into the Business Architecture analytics platform
Liaise with key stakeholders, SMEs, to identify authorized data sources and standardize access to the data
Translate and articulate technical data insights and ideas to a larger audience including with peers and senior management
Develop junior talent on the team


 
Characteristics/Experience:
 
 
Experience creating client centric analytics solutions to business problems with a holistic view of multiple businesses
Experience owning and delivering multiple complex analytics projects
Experience with Python
Experience working with Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau
Experience with NoSQL or Relational DB
Experience working in an agile environment
Must have a positive attitude and a readiness to lead from the front
Stays abreast of developments within own field (data modelling, machine learning etc) and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business.
An excellent communicator who is collaborative by nature, gets on well with others and builds strong working relationships across the firm
A self starter with the ability to work effectively in teams


 
 
We work hard to have a positive financial and social impact on the communities we serve. In turn, we put our employees first and provide the best-in-class benefits they need to be well, live well and save well.
 
Weâ€™ll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decisions, and allow you to choose which benefits suit you and your personal life best.
 
Visit our Global Benefits page to learn more.
 
Highlights to our core benefits include:
 
 
Award winning pension
On-site health services
Private medical insurance packages to suit your personal circumstances
Paid parental leave
Generous holiday allowance starting at 27 Days plus bank holidays; increasing with tenure


 
Citi Belfast also champions diversity within our workforce, which helps us be well and live well together. We have over 40 different nationalities in our Northern Ireland offices, are a vocal supporter of LGBTQ+ rights, and are proud to have 47% of our leadership team made up of individuals who identify as women.
 
We encourage and lead inclusivity through our Pride, Disability, Multicultural, Families Matter, and Women affinity networks that are run by and for, Citi Belfast colleagues; providing them with the support they need in their personal and professional journeys and supplying them with the tools to help educate colleagues on all things related to each network to help us work better together.

NGS Data Analyst
 
London
 
Permanent
 
Â£ Competitive
 
Role profile:
 
SRG are partnering with a unique game-changer in the field of semiconductor technology combined with biochemical methodologies, to develop a novel approach to next generation sequencing (NGS). This role will see you support the platform development team through analysis of NGS data throughout the R&D lifecycle.

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
About us
 
The UCL Estate comprises of over 200 buildings valued at over Â£2 Billion, more than four million square feet of academic accommodation and approaching 4000 student bedrooms. The scale, variety and complexity of the estate are unparalleled in the sector. Based in the heart of London, it is a dynamic, outward-looking institution. At its establishment in 1826, UCL was radical and responsive to the needs of society, and this ethos - that excellence should go hand-in-hand with enriching society - continues today. UCL is committed to providing the best possible Campus Experience, ensuring that its experience and infrastructure is sector leading and over time provides another reason to join or work with/for UCL, alongside its academic excellence. Data and technology play a key role within Campus Experience and Infrastructure (CE&I), and we are recruiting for a Data Management Analyst who will be the subject matter expert on the creation of Management Information across all services.
 
 
About the role
 
The Data Management Analyst's role will have an operational focus on 'hard services' areas of CAFM / IWMS, ensuring that internal customer needs are identified, understood and put into practice to provide a comprehensive single source of operation and information and ensure best practice use of available technology. They will become the subject matter expert for MI information across CE&I systems, including Planon which is newly implemented, and will identify trends, areas of concern, SLA performance and make recommendations, provide reports including via dashboards such as Power BI/Tableau etc. The successful candidate's operational focus will be on the 'hard services' areas of Computer Aided Facilities Management/Integrated Workplace Management Systems (CAFM/IWMS), through accurate creation and review of data, ensuring best practices in data are being followed. They will work with others to plan system needs, advise on data requirements and conduct data uploads as needed. The postholder will also troubleshoot system operations issues and play an active role in the continuous development of hard services elements of the CAFM / IWMS, including its data, operations and reporting. This role will also have line management responsibility for the teams Data Management Officer.
 
 
About you
 
To excel in this role, you will have a minimum of three years' experience in CAFM/IWMS operation, alongside a string understanding of facilities management, its operations and its stakeholders. You have excellent data management skills and will be able to demonstrate this through the use of data management tools like Excel, you will also have advanced knowledge of MS Suite. You will be an analytical thinker, an accurate and methodical worker, with the capability to use available information to problem solve and make sound operational decisions. You will also have an understanding of the principles and frameworks of successful project/programme management including robust assurance from a support perspective.
 
 
What we offer
 
We are operating hybrid working and you will have the opportunity to work remotely for up to 3 days a week if you wish. As well as the exciting opportunities this role presents, we also offer some great benefits, which can be seen on our benefits webpages.
 
 
Our commitment to Equality, Diversity and Inclusion
 
As London's Global University, we know diversity fosters creativity and innovation, and we want our community to represent the diversity of the world's talent. We are committed to equality of opportunity, to being fair and inclusive, and to being a place where we all belong. We therefore particularly encourage applications from candidates who are likely to be underrepresented in UCL's workforce. These include people from Black, Asian and ethnic minority backgrounds; disabled people; LGBTQI+ people; and for our Grade 9 and 10 roles, women. We will consider applications to work on a part-time, flexible and job share basis wherever possible. Our department is working towards an Athena SWAN award. We are committed to advancing gender equality within our department.

job_desc:
CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the worldâ€™s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.
 
 
What does that mean for you? Youâ€™ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. Youâ€™ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. Youâ€™ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model.
 
 
Brambles companies, including CHEP, help move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organisation on earth. Our 350+ million pallets, crates and containers are continuously in motion, forming the invisible backbone of the global supply chain and the worldâ€™s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, sustainably, and safely.
We want to ensure we play our part in stopping climate change. As pioneers of the sharing economy, Brambles created one of the world's most sustainable logistics businesses through the share and reuse of its platforms. To enable us to do this, we need to digitize what we do. Moving so many pallets to so many customers generates a lot of data â€“ over 2 billion rows and counting. We need to utilize modern methods to capture and analyse data, ensuring that we can track where our pallets are, what theyâ€™re being used for and ensuring they return to the pool to be reused in the future. We need to ensure what we build not only works for the now, but for the future as well.
 
 
Brambles understands the importance of digital and data and is growing heavily. Think of us as a start-up, based inside an established company. We have the benefits of a start-up, around autonomy to work and a wealth of exciting projects to deliver. Essentially this a Greenfield site so you get to help decide what the future platform looks like.
 
 
We want to help our employees to grow technically, but also develop skills that will enable them to set the direction of their career. Weâ€™re committed to helping you achieve what you want and provide the necessary tools to enable you to do so. Some of our benefits include
 
 
Competitive Remuneration package
Training delivered both in-role and in the form of structured training programs
Annual bonus based on company & personal performance.
Opportunity to take part in the Brambles share program.
Fully committed to a future of flexible working
Pension contribution and Private Medical insurance
Various health & wellbeing events and programs
25 Days holidays per year
3 Working Days per annum to use for social projects.


 
The Data Analyst will help the business use Data to understand the supply chain lifecycle. You will make a tangible impact on our internal and external customers by building data-driven solutions and providing high impact analytical insights and recommendations.
 
You will be a trusted advisor and empowered to put Customer at the heart of decision making, and an ambassador for Data Analytics across Digital and the wider Data Analytics Community.
 
Key Accountabilities
 
 
Utilise your inquisitive mindset, analytical skills & ask the right questions to understand complex business challenges
Develop and implement analytics aligned with the business needs and in accordance with best practices
Use Statistical experience and Business knowledge to solve complex business challenges
Interrogate, manipulate and analyse complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and analytical techniques
Build engaging and interactive visualisations using state of the art methods
Provide and concisely communicate high quality deep dive analysis with clear recommendations and actionable insight
Collaboratively work within a squad to deliver solutions by defining and designing Data Analytics tasks (for example, data requirements, output, success criteria, timescales)
Provide guidance on KPIs and best practice in reporting and analytical problem solving
Embed data analytics in Product solutions


 
Skills
 
 
Experience in turning data into insight and recommendations for action.
Working across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information, and identifying linkages across disparate data sets
Experience in clearly communicating (verbal and written) Insight to technical and non-technical Stakeholders
3+ years of Data Analytics experience
SQL
BI tools such as QlikView, Tableau, or Power BI
Understanding of Python or transferrable coding languages


 
We will consider candidates ranging from recent graduates to those with more experience. A commitment to continuous learning will be essential to succeed in this role.
 
As an inclusive employer, Brambles wants to see every candidate performing at their best throughout the job application process, interview process and whilst at work. We therefore encourage you to inform your Talent Acquisition Partner of any reasonable adjustments you might need to enable this to happen.
 
Brambles employs more than 10,000 people and operates in over 60 countries with its largest operations in North America and Western Europe. For further information, please visit www.brambles.com.
 
Bachelors
 
3 - 5 years
 
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to developing a diverse workforce in which everyone is treated fairly, with respect, and has the opportunity to contribute to business success while realizing his or her potential. This means harnessing the unique skills and experience that each individual brings and we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.
 
 
Individuals fraudulently misrepresenting themselves as Brambles or CHEP representatives have scheduled interviews and offered fraudulent employment opportunities with the intent to commit identity theft or solicit money. Brambles and CHEP never conduct interviews via online chat or request money as a term of employment. If you have a question as to the legitimacy of an interview or job offer, please contact us at recruitment@brambles.com.

Details

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialised in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing. Being dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations, we are proud to say weâ€™re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clientsâ€™ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. define the needs of its customers by conducting interviews with customer teams and multiple technology partners,

job_desc:
Holland & Barrett International is striving to be the world's leading health and wellness business. Currently the largest in Europe and growing in other markets, the health and wellness of our colleagues and customers is at our heart.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Holland & Barrett is one of the nation's most loved and trusted brands, known for offering quality health food, vitamins and supplements all sold by highly trained and qualified advisors.
 
Our culture respects equality, values diversity and encourages individuality â€“ because this allows our people to unlock their potential and be their best. We are a growing and pioneering business. Our diverse and EPIC teams enable us to push boundaries and accomplish the extraordinary. As we continue to transform, we need more of the brightest and best minds to join us to turn our vision into a reality.

job_desc:
Who we are:
 
Zilch, the worldâ€™s first Commerce Card, is a UK-headquartered payments technology company, known for creating the
 
Googlisation of Payments
. Our mission is to create the best and most empowering way to pay, for anything, anywhere our customers want to spend. Using Zilchâ€™s virtual Mastercard that sits in a customerâ€™s digital wallet, Zilch combines the best of debit, credit and savings. Meaning our customers can either earn rewards on debit payments in the form of instant cashback (â€˜Pay in 1â€™) or spread interest-free repayments over six weeks (â€˜Pay in 4â€™), bringing them financial choice and maturing their credit profiles.
 
This is uniquely made possible by the proprietary Ad-Subsidised Payment Network (ASPN) that Zilch has built, which in cookieless world enables merchants around the world to connect directly with the millions of Zilch customers they otherwise couldnâ€™t reach and offer them savings, deals and discounts.
 
 
By vertically integrating with consumers, rather than with merchants, Zilch allows customers to pay using either reward-earning debit or interest-free credit, both online and in-store, anywhere Mastercard is accepted. To ensure we are helping our customers to manage their cash flow responsibly when they make credit payments, we set dynamic borrowing limits using best-in-market data from leading credit reference agencies, open banking technology and behavioural data analysis. Together these generate a real-time, comprehensive, 360-degree view of a customerâ€™s affordability profile, allowing us to set personalised borrowing limits accordingly. To further bolster our customer safeguards, we are fully regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority, having obtained a consumer credit license prior to our launch.
 
 
Since launching as an FCA regulated business in the UK in September 2020 and in the US in May 2022, Zilch has amassed over 3 million customers in 24 months and turned gross profitable â€“ years faster than other well-known fintechs. In that time, we have provided our customers with over Â£80 million in aggregate rewards and savings on fees and interest. Zilch is Europeâ€™s fastest-ever company to go from Series A to double-unicorn status, in just 14 months, after raising capital at a $2bn valuation in November 2021 and maintaining that valuation in a subsequent equity funding round in Summer 2022.
 
 
Weâ€™re looking forâ€¦.
 
An analyst keen to be part of a collaborative team who is passionate about the data domain
Someone who looks for opportunities to improve process and support stakeholders
An enthusiastic data person with attention to detail who sets a high standard for themselves
A champion of metrics and the measurement of impact, with the inquisitive acumen to explain the â€œWhyâ€, not just the â€œWhatâ€
Someone with a thorough approach to model and report building who can identify solutions that meet business needs


 
Day-to-day responsibilities will include:
 
Working alongside data scientists, data analysts, data engineers and analytics engineers
Supporting business requirements for model and report building
Enhancing and optimising existing models and visualisations
Assisting with ad-hoc development and data dictionary related duties
Maintaining the metric definitions across the business
Collecting and proposing data requirements
Working to agile methodologies


 
Key requirements:
 
Strong SQL background (this is a prime requirement)
Strong experience in data visualisation (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Quick Sight, PowerBI, etc)
3+ yearsâ€™ experience as a data analyst working in a fast-paced environment
Strong deep-dive skills, the ability to tell a strong data story
Good stakeholder engagement experience and the ability to prioritise delivery
Understanding of operational processes


 
Bonus skills:
 
A financial technology background, e.g., risk, finance, credit, or electronic trading
Understanding of DBT
Experience with Python
Experience of automation and optimisation


 
 
What we offer:
 
Hybrid working - 3 days per week in the London office
Income protection - long term injury or illness the company will pay 75% of your base salary for up to 5 year
Pension scheme, 5% employee contribution and 3% employer contribution
26 days holiday + UK Bank Holidays

Zilch is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

We celebrate diversity, embrace our differences and know that this is critical for our success. We work hard to make sure weâ€™re inclusive and we are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. So, if you are great at what you do and share our values, we want to hear from you.
 
 
About the role:
The purpose of this role is to support the Intelligence and Analytics team to gather, analyse and present data to effectively benchmark, analyse, and monitor the Licensing portfolio to enable presentation to Digital Resources Senior Leadership Team and with other areas of Jisc; drive and inform licensing negotiations; and inform, support, and provide value to our members.
 
 
Responsibilities will include:
 
Work as part of the Intelligence and Analytics team to prototype, develop, launch, maintain and enhance a portfolio of licensing data analytics products that are quality assured, user focused, automated, reliable and secure
 
Work closely with the Data Analysts, to understand project aim, product vision and timescales and to contribute to sprint backlogs that are understood by everyone, and deliver discrete increments of the project and product
Creating statistically valid, user friendly visualisations and dashboards
 
Explore opportunities for improved collection, analysis, use and presentation of data and information, both within and without Digital Resources, including identifying where data is missing, needed and how to or who to collect it from


 
 
Key Skills and Experience:
 
Excellent organisational, analytical, problem solving and time-management skills and is detail-focused

Excellent communication skills both written and verbal such as creating clear documentation and reports
Experience in gathering data and information using surveys or other routes
Experience of combining and analysing data using software such as MS Excel
Experience of presenting and summarising data and information in written and/or visual ways through tools such as MS PowerPoint or other graphical software
 


 
 
Please refer to the job description for full details.
 
 
 
Donâ€™t meet every single requirement?
We know that sometimes people can be put off applying for a job if they think they canâ€™t tick every box but we realise the â€˜perfect candidateâ€™ doesnâ€™t exist. So, if you can do most of what weâ€™re looking for, go ahead and apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!
 
 
Why work at Jisc:
At Jisc we believe a balance between your personal and professional life is essential to your happiness and fulfilment. We work flexibly at Jisc and focus on outputs rather than presenteeism and are open to a whole range of ways of working. It isnâ€™t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; itâ€™s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life.
 
 
 
We offer hybrid working and although the majority of our staff work from home, getting face to face is something we value and find time for when we can. If you prefer an office environment all our hubs are open and offer a great space to work.
 
 
 
Our benefits are great too. We offer:
 
Flexible work pattern, which can adapt to suit your schedules and personal commitments
28 days annual leave (plus bank holidays) and an additional three closure days over Christma
A generous pension scheme with above average employer contributions
A range of leave options, including parental leave, volunteer leave and even career breaks.
 
A generous budget to attend conferences and in-person training
 
Allocated allowance of up to Â£250 to equip your home office
 
A company culture which supports and promotes personal learning and development, including access to thousands of courses on LinkedIn Learning
Mental health first aid trained staff and supportive environment, plus your own Wellbeing allowance to spend on wellbeing for you
 
Financial well-being support
Discounts on big-name high-street stores
Cycle to work scheme
Employee recognition awards and travel loans


 
 
Equality, diversity and inclusion
At Jisc, we strive to be best in practice and are working hard to achieve progressive change. â€˜Always inclusiveâ€™ is one of our six guiding principles - a principle which actively encourages acceptance of differences within individuals.
 
 
We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, neurodivergence, trans status, veteran status or gender identity.
 
 
 
Application process:
 
Please do let us know what reasonable adjustments you need made to the application or selection process so you can do your best. We will be happy to help you.
 
 
Just so you know, we review CVs as we receive them, and interview as soon as we have applications that look like a good match (usually within a week). We donâ€™t use closing dates. So, please apply as soon as possible to avoid missing out on this role. We advertised this role on 24/01/2023

job_desc:
About Noon


At Noon, we believe in Student First in everything we do. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™ve built a global social learning platform that radically changes the way people learn, with the aim of positively impacting millions of students across the globe and bringing education to everyone.


Our open platform is loved by 10+ million students across 8 countries and is growing all the time â€“ our aim is to radically transform the lives of 50+ million learners by 2023! Our students use Noon every day to engage with live interactive classes and gamified peer learning features, study with celebrity teachers, and compete and socialise with their friends.


We are a distributed company with a collaborative culture. We come from a diverse set of backgrounds and countries, enabling us to work at a global scale whilst bringing local impact by being a part of the communities we serve. As a fast-paced, innovative scaling business, our ability to learn at speed is powered by our obsession with our â€œstudent-firstâ€ culture that ultimately defines what we do and why we do it. Our principles: Student first, Never Deprive a Learner, Be Better Everyday, Be original, Own It & Be Bold. These values got us to where we are today, and theyâ€™re a big part of what weâ€™re looking for in you.


What you will do

Work closely with feature teams to develop the right metric to focus on, and help the team set an ambitious goal (OKR) against this metric
Identify user needs through usage pattern analysis to help feature teams focus on areas of highest opportunity
Work closely with stakeholders across engineering, product, design, and UX research to drive product decisions
Design experiments that will enable feature teams to make effective product decisions, and help teams evaluate the results of these experiments
Cultivate a data-driven culture throughout the organisation by exposing data through Tableau and Superset dashboards for internal stakeholders to view on-demand
Identify opportunities to automate manual processes
Work closely with the data engineering team to shape the overall data strategy for the company
Manage and mentor other data analysts across the organisation.
 
About you


Numerical/Analytical minded (degree in a numerical subject is preferred)
Minimum 3 years of experience as a data analyst, ideally working on consumer-facing products
Proficient in SQL or similar data querying languages
Experience with dashboarding/ reporting tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc
Excellent stakeholder and time management skills
Experience with owning multiple projects from start to finish
Experience with experimentation (A/B testing), eg Firebase, Mixpanel
Familiarity with statistical analysis in Python, R, Matlab.


About the Benefits


You will be joining the world's first social learning platform where you can have a real impact in a smart, low-ego, multi-cultural team. We provide an environment where you can develop your skills and deliver meaningful work that matters. Youâ€™ll be able to enjoy a competitive salary as well as a full spectrum of generous perks and rewards:


Not a morning person? No problem! We offer flexitime and a great work-life balance, including 2-3 days working from home per week
25 days annual leave and Christmas office closure days on top
Generous pension scheme â€“ Noon matches up to 5%
Full premium Private Medical Scheme including Family cover
Subscription to Perkbox

Cycle to work scheme and commuter season ticket loan

Why work at Noon?


The opportunity to work within an innovative start up in its initial stages and help shape our success globally
Work with a team who believes in STUDENT FIRST, you will have an opportunity to build the first (BE ORIGINAL) Open Social Learning Platform that can impact millions of students across the globe
A working environment where you can look at things differently and challenge and offer solutions and that also offers you a freedom to commit â€˜nâ€™ number of first time mistakes â€“ NEVER DEPRIVE A LEARNER
Complete ownership and responsibility for the success of your autonomous team across all scope of works â€“ OWN IT and BE BOLD
An opportunity to work with a bunch of Young, Smart, Driven, and Dynamic people who are committed to go BEYOND SELF and solve business challenges
Work closely with the leadership team who live by the value of BE BETTER EVERYDAY to help grow an amazing organisation
Help us to build the future of education!
 
About Diversity & Inclusion


At Noon, we respect and value differences. We know that when people from different backgrounds and with different points of view work together, we create the most value â€“ for our clients, our people, and society. Weâ€™re so lucky to live in a society where differences are celebrated, so weâ€™d expect nothing less from our teams. That means whatever your race, religion, sexual orientation, or gender, this is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely, and make your mark. Noon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of age, disability, gender identity, marital status, race, colour, ethnicity, religion, sex, national origin, or sexual orientation. title: Data Analyst (Product)

job_desc:
CABI creates and applies knowledge that addresses faced by people around the world. We are proud that we have over 400 staff working from more than 20 locations globally, providing huge amounts of expertise in many fields. CABI envisions a world in which development impact is magnified through digital innovation in agriculture and the environment. Through the creation and application of digital technologies, CABI brings science-based agricultural knowledge to millions of smallholder farmers helping to increase their yields.
 
 
We are looking for a Data Analyst with strong professional experience in working with large datasets and statistical methods, ideally with knowledge or understanding of agriculture and/or international development. The role is based in Wallingford, Oxfordshire, but we welcome conversations about working from home for a couple of days a week.
 
Data driven approaches are increasingly supporting decision making in agriculture globally. CABI is establishing itself as an expert in facilitating the development of tools and products which utilise a variety of data sources and modelling approaches, combined with an understanding of Integrated Pest Management (IPM), Good Agricultural Practice (GAP) and human-centred design (HCD). These tools and products enable stakeholders to make informed decisions and access information relating to crop health. As an organisation, CABI produces and collates large amounts of ecological, environmental, socio-economic and earth observation (EO) data through its science and major programmes; including Global Burden of Crop Loss (GBCL), PRISE, PlantwisePlus, Action on Invasives and CABI Compendia.
 
We are looking for a data analyst to work across CABI digital development programmes, with a focus initially on Global Burden of Crop Loss (GBCL). GBCL aims to generate comprehensive, authoritative evidence on the magnitude of crop losses worldwide, disaggregated by crop, biotic and abiotic causes. GBCL is modelled after the Global Burden of Disease initiative in human health, which has transformed health policy, research, and funding over the last 25 years through better use of data.
 
If youâ€™d like to find out more about this role , please review the role profile and click apply. â€œ

Kantar is the leader in providing digital TV audience and advertising measurement tools and intelligence. With a proven track record in audience research services across 50+ countries, Kantar is at the forefront of technological developments in audience measurement in the media industry, working with broadcasters and advertisers, media agencies and industry committees.
 
The Data Science team provides research and technical expertise, support, oversight, and methodological development to our global operating services.
 
Within the team the data analyst supports other data scientists and developers with necessary data queries and runs periodic Quality Control analyses on live services. Job Role Requirements

Attention to details and accuracy

Education and experience
