At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.
 
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career thatâ€™s out of the ordinary and join us.
 
We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and wellbeing is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.
 
At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity; therefore, we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
DATA SCIENTIST | Remote - UK based
 
ABOUT THE ROLE
 
The role of the Data Scientist is to help discover and build algorithms for Wejoâ€™s data products utilising data & analytics platforms in place for both stream and batch systems. You will be required to perform some basic engineering activities to across a wide range of datasets to prepare/curate the data.
 
Once the prepared data is in place, you will then utilise and apply the necessary industry/academic data models/algorithms to help understand and shape the data to underpin Wejo as a â€œdata driven businessâ€.
 
 
Key Responsibilities
 
Provide the insights and discovery on a variety of dataset across the business
Work with other members of the Data function to design, estimate and build big data products.
Work with the product owners and business analysts in analysing business requirements to design and implement data structures and fine tune performance to meet those requirements.
Review new external data sets and open data sources to understand potential usage.
Work with Infrastructure and DevOps teams to release and maintain live products.
Participate in establishing processes and best practices around development standards, version control, quality control, deployment, maintenance and change management.
Ensuring a professional image of the company and themselves is presented at all times.


 
ABOUT YOU
 
 
Data Science related qualification at degree level or higher
Experience in the field of big data engineering.
Strong experience with Hadoop and Spark using language of python or Scala
Solid understanding of statistical and predictive modelling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms
Knowledge of some / all of: regression, neural networks, decision trees (random forest, gradient boosted trees etc.), agglomerative clustering, k-means, gradient descent, logistic regression etc.
Ability to analyse large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets using SQL, R and / or python


 
 
You might also have:
 
 
Experience working with an Agile environment
Experience with SQL query engines. E.g. Hive, Impala or Presto.
Experience setting up build pipelines. E.g. Git, Jenkins and Nexus.
Experience with cloud computing environments. E.g. AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform.
Experience developing stream-processing systems. E.g. Kafka, Spark streaming, Storm or Flink.
Experience with data modelling and data warehousing. E.g. Postgres, Redshift.
Experience with other NoSQL technologies. E.g. Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Redis or Ignite.
Experience Managing Data ingestion and processing operations


 
**
 
**
 
ABOUT WEJO
 
Wejo is a global leader in the connected car market and is shaping the future of mobility. The connected car space is one of the fastest growing sectors in the IoT industry. Car manufacturers are looking to extend traditional infotainment systems, insurers are seeking a better understanding of risk, users are demanding more feedback and firms are generating increasing amounts of data and require support in understanding its applications and value. We specialise in creating new services and products to help clients make the most of their data and realise its value.
 
We bring together the brightest minds and industry experts with award-winning platform technology and advanced privacy and security to revolutionise the way we live, work and travel using connected car data, insights and analytics.

job_desc:
ABOUT ZENOBE
 
Our goal is to make clean power accessible, to accelerate the shift to zero carbon power and transport.
 
Weâ€™re transforming grids to enable the take up of more renewables, electrifying fleets for cleaner air, repurposing electric vehicle batteries for clean portable power and using proprietary software and data analysis to optimise operational performance for our customers.
 
We have 225 MW of operational and under construction grid scale battery capacity and over 30% of the UKâ€™s EV buses, and are expanding our operations in Australia, New Zealand, US and Europe. Weâ€™re a rapidly growing company looking for talented people to join us.
 
THE OPPORTUNITY
 
As we continue to scale, we have an exciting opportunity for someone to join our fast-paced, ever evolving operations team, to apply their skills to the performance, monitoring and management of our Network Infrastructure assets. You will report into the Grid Services Operations Manager and work collaboratively with our Construction, Product and Commercial Analytics teams. This is an ideal role for a self-starter with an analytical and solutions driven mindset. This will be a hybrid role with a mixture of home and office working out of our London office.
 
A TASTE OF THE DAY TO DAY
 
 
Supporting day-to-day monitoring and management of our BESS assets.
 
Reviewing and logging tickets to track operational activities (Zendesk, Jira, Salesforce).
 
Evaluating the performance of our assets and escalating remedial work requirements to the Operations Manager.
 
Investigating underperformance on the BESS hardware, software and network systems.
 
Developing reports for internal and external stakeholders to review operational performance and uptime.
 
Arranging and executing testing of BESS assets in line with their warranty agreements.
 
Informing our Commercial Analytics team of changes in asset availability and arranging maintenance visits to minimise asset downtime.
 
Documenting and creating processes for scaling up Operations in UK and abroad
 
Aiding Grid Services Operations Manager in activities for future Network Infrastructure projects.
 


 
WHAT WEâ€™RE LOOKING FOR
 
We realise that certain groups of people are less likely to apply for a role if they donâ€™t meet 100% of the job requirements. To be absolutely clear: if you like the look of this job and think you could do it well, we encourage you to apply with a CV that highlights your transferable skills and experience. Above all, ZenobÄ“ is looking for collaborative, flexible, empathetic people who are interested in creating and promoting practical routes to a zero carbon world.
 
 
STEM degree
 
1-2 yearsâ€™ experience in similar field (or can demonstrate equivalent experience through education)
 
Genuine passion for renewable energy / sustainability / battery storage
 
Problem-solving skills, attention to detail,
 
Python or SQL experience is desirable
 
Excellent communication both verbal and written
 


 
WORKING AT ZENOBE
 
Weâ€™re passionate about sustainability and are proud to offer Team ZenobÄ“ a pioneering and collaborative working environment. We encourage our people to take ownership of their career progression and celebrate those that can think outside the box.
 
If youâ€™d like to join our community of likeminded people hit the apply button now, weâ€™d love to hear from you!
 
WHAT WE OFFER
 
Charge your career at ZenobÄ“ and receive
 
 
Up to 20% annual bonus for being awesome
 
25 days holiday, plus bank holidays
 
Private Medical Insurance, for you and the family
 
Â£1500 training budget per year, to ensure you grow as we do
 
EV Salary Sacrifice Scheme
 
Pension scheme, up to 8% matched contributions
 
Enhanced parental leave
 
Cash back health plan
 
Plus more
 


 
Lots of our people work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time, flexitime and hybrid working. We canâ€™t promise to give you exactly what you want, but please talk to us about the flexibility you need and letâ€™s see how we can make it work.
 
OUR APPROACH TO DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION
 
Our people are our strongest asset and the key determinant of our success, and we value a range of skillsets and perspectives. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. We work to provide equal opportunities and an inclusive work environment, where everyone is fairly treated in the application process and through their career at ZenobÄ“. If there are any adjustments that would help improve your experience with ZenobÄ“, please let us know when you apply.

UE03: Â£20,400.00 (Â£11.18 per hour) Per Annum, Pro Rata.
 
University Secretary's Group / Careers Service.
 
Fixed Term Contract - June 2023 - August 2023 (12 weeks); Full Time - 35 Hours Per Week.
 
We are looking for an intern who is interested in gaining professional work experience and is enthusiastic about information visualisation. You will investigate and create solutions to visualise careers data and information in flexible, filterable online formats. This will enable students to make informed career decisions, for example about which employers to speak to on the day of a Careers Fair.
 
 
You will be working on a project to investigate and create solutions to visualise careers data and information for students.
 
The primary focus will be how to present information about employers attending Careers Fairs in a way that allows students to make informed decisions about who to speak to on the day. The aim is for this information to be accessible online, in a flexible, filterable format without the need to download anything additional. The solution also needs to able to be edited and maintained by other Careers Service staff after the internship has finished.
 
The outcomes of this project will provide 1000s of students with the tools and information that help them to learn more about the employers who come onto campus to promote their opportunities, and to make informed decisions about how they might want to interact with them.
 
You will get experience applying research, digital and independent thinking skills in a professional working environment.
 
 
Employ.ed on Campus is run by the Careers Service in collaboration with University departments and Schools. It offers exclusive summer internships at the University over the summer for 2nd year to penultimate year undergraduate students from the University of Edinburgh based in the UK. You cannot take part if you are a visiting student, or you have already taken part in the programme before. Further information about Employ.ed on Campus can be found on our
 
Employ.ed on campus webpages
 
(opens new browser tab) .
 
 
 
Interest in the student and graduate labour market
 
Strong digital and tech skills and/or confidence to learn to use online tools for data and information visualisation
 
Effective research and analytical ability; able to review and report in writing, both qualitative and quantitative data.
 
Excellent interpersonal and verbal communication skills; with the ability to build rapport quickly with different audiences.
 
Excellent written communication skills; able to clearly express concepts and findings in written form to different audiences.
 


 
Click to view a copy of the full job description (opens new browser tab)
 
 
Application Process
 
 
- Please upload a CV and covering letter of no more than 500 words, detailing how you meet the knowledge, skills and experience required, and your motivation for applying for this post.
 
For guidance on writing an effective application see the Careers Service website:
 
 
 
CV and application support
 
 
Book a careers appointment for feedback on your CV
 
 
Come to a careers drop-in session for quick feedback on your application
 


 
As a valued member of our team you can expect:
 
 
An exciting, positive, creative, challenging and rewarding place to work. We give you support, nurture your talent and reward success. You will benefit from a competitive reward package and a wide range of staff benefits, which includes a generous holiday entitlement, a defined benefits
 
 
pension scheme
 
 
 
,
 
 
staff discounts,
 
 
family friendly initiatives
 
 
, flexible working and much more. Access our
 
 
staff benefits page
 
 
for further information and use our
 
 
reward calculator
 
 
to find out the total value of pay and benefits provided.
 
The University of Edinburgh holds a Silver Athena SWAN award in recognition of our commitment to advance gender equality in higher education. We are members of the Race Equality Charter and we are also Stonewall Scotland Diversity Champions, actively promoting LGBT equality.
 
If invited for interview you will be required to evidence your right to work in the UK. Further information is available on our
 
right to work web pages
 
(opens new browser tab) .
 
The University is unable to sponsor the employment of international workers in this role. International applicants will therefore be unable to apply for and secure a Skilled Worker visa. They will only be able to take up this role if they can demonstrate an alternative right to work in the UK.
 
Unless stated otherwise the closing time for applications is 11:59pm GMT. If you are applying outside the UK the closing time on our adverts automatically adjusts to your browsers local time zone.
 
 
As a world-leading research-intensive University, we are here to address tomorrowâ€™s greatest challenges. Between now and 2030 we will do that with a values-led approach to teaching, research and innovation, and through the strength of our relationships, both locally and globally.
 
Organization
 
Our award winning Careers Service gives careers advice to matriculated students and recent graduates to help them find personal and professional achievement and fulfilling futures by working in partnership with academic colleagues and employers. Students are also helped to build up useful work experience through part-time and vacation employment. Providing a world-class careers service for world-class graduates demands a challenging level of skills and talents and the highest standards of professionalism.
 
To find out more, visit https://www.ed.ac.uk/careers

job_desc:
We strongly encourage applications from people of colour, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, parents and people from lower socio-economic backgrounds. If thereâ€™s anything we can do to make adjustments for you in the hiring process, please donâ€™t hesitate to let us know. Weâ€™re intentional about building a diverse, inclusive and equitable environment. Check out our diversity, equity and inclusion statement.
 
Looking to do work that matters?
 
We get it â€“ itâ€™s why most people come to Cleo. Together weâ€™re fighting for the worldâ€™s financial health, building an AI that helps our users make the best money decisions from day one. Weâ€™ve helped 5 million people so far with personalised insights and a voice you donâ€™t expect in FinTech. But itâ€™s time to do more.

As we enter the next phase, weâ€™re looking for more improvisers, data geeks and grown ups who want to own their work and create meaningful change.
 
The team
 
Youâ€™ll join the existing data science function here at Cleo; a thoughtful and collaborative team of 10 dedicated data scientists, ML engineers, and analysts with significant industry experience that is at the heart of everything we do at Cleo. Youâ€™ll build and deploy production models that developers will feed directly into the product.

This position is essential in the expansion of both product and business. We are highly data driven, whether that be understanding natural language, deriving insights from financial data, or determining which financial product is best suited to a user. We have interesting problems to solve on an ever-increasing scale

Here's a great blog post on how data science works at Cleo!

Youâ€™ll be working on a hugely impactful workstream, helping us understand our users' finances, so we can coach them through the power of chat. Youâ€™ll be working as part of a cross functional team to develop Cleo into a hyper-personalized financial coach.
 
 
Improving our current machine learning models
Actively building and productionising classifiers - no dependencies on engineering teams
Working to implement and utilize GPT, to continue developing our hyper-personalized AI assistant
 
A wide range of ML tasks: classification, recommender systems, NLP
Finding opportunities for model and product improvements in Cleo's extensive datasets of chat conversations, spending patterns, and app interactions
 


 
At least 3 years of experience in data science or related roles
Commercial experience of deep learning, NLP and text analysis
Ability to write production quality code in Python and SQL
Experience deploying machine learning / deep learning algorithms into production
Experience conducting large scale A/B experiments
A strong ability to communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders in a concise and engaging manner
Experience with NLP methods
 


Nice to have
 
 
Experience with containers and container orchestration: Kubernetes, Docker, and/or Mesos, including lifecycle management of containers
Experience working with AWS technologies such as EC2, S3, Sagemaker
 


What do you get for all your hard work?
 
 
Salary banding can be seen here. You'll also have equity options. You can view our progression framework and salary bandings here: https://cleo-ai.progressionapp.com/ - This role would be from level DS3 depending on experience
 
Work at one of the fastest growing tech startups, backed by top VC firms, Balderton & EQT Ventures
Cleo is a culture of stepping up. We want, and expect you to grow and develop. That means trying new things, leading others, challenging the status quo and owning your impact. Youâ€™ll have our support in everything you do. But more importantly, youâ€™ll have our trust.
We treat you as humans first, employees second. Because we canâ€™t fight for the worldâ€™s financial health, if weâ€™re not healthy ourselves. This means the usual perks but it also means flexibility.
Other benefits include;
 
 
Check out our new benefits package here: https://web.meetcleo.com/blog/big-benefits-energy-the-latest-cleo-employee-benefits
25 days annual leave a year + public holidays (+ an additional day for every year you spend at Cleo)
401k matching in the US and 6% employer-matched pension in the UK
2 months paid sabbatical after 4 years at Cleo!
Early finish every Friday
Regular socials and activities, online and in-person
Online mental health support via Spill
And many more!
 




UK App access:
 
The Cleo app is no longer downloadable in the UK (but only until next year). If youâ€™re an existing user, youâ€™ll still have access to the app. But some features wonâ€™t be available (just for a little while). Why? 99% of our users are based in the US â€“ where financial health is often overlooked. Weâ€™ve decided to shift our focus to where we can provide the most value and make the greatest impact for users who need it most. Then weâ€™ll be able to apply what we learn to better support our UK users in the future. Check out this page for more information.

job_desc:
Job Title:
 
Data Analyst
Location:
 
UK â€“ London / Remote
Reporting to:
 
Head of Data & Analytics
 
Who are we
At Monica Vinader, weâ€™re on a mission to prove that buying better, wearing longer and doing better donâ€™t have to be mutually exclusive. From our commitment to making the most sustainable jewellery we can using precious materials, to the timeless style and endless versatility of our pieces, we are driven to making everyday fine jewellery accessible and affordable.
And donâ€™t just take our word for it, we are proud to be recognised in the industry through three recent awards, proving we are leading the way in sustainable jewellery:
â— Ethical Jewellery Business of the Year 2021, Retail Jeweller
â— Queen's Award for Enterprise: Sustainable Development 2022
â— Responsible Luxury Business of the Year 2022, Positive Luxury
â— Best Sustainable Luxury Jewellery Brand 2022, Marie Claire UK
We are digital first, customer obsessed, female led and inclusive, focused on creating meaningful relationships with our community, who we owe our success to. We are looking for someone special to join our team to help us make luxury something we can all enjoy everyday.
 
 
Where we need your help
The Monica Vinader Data & Analytics team plays an important role in supporting decision making, strategy development and process automation across the business. The team owns, maintains and improves all reporting data systems working in close collaboration with retail, inventory, operations, digital and technology teams.
 
A key contributing factor for ensuring the continued growth of the business is establishing a holistic view of our customer and how they flow through the experience. The team works to ensure optimal selection, configuration and governance of the analytics stack to achieve a true understanding of each and every touch point along the customer journey.
 
As a Data Analyst, you will deliver compelling, coherent and meticulously distilled insights to stakeholders across the business. We will look to you to source, maintain and interpret numerous streams of data to provoke conversations and provide direction appropriately for your stakeholders' needs. Your work will influence and drive decision-making anywhere from the user experience to the strategic direction of the business more generally.
 
 
What youâ€™ll be doing
â— Support decision making by providing detailed, action orientated insights, continuously highlighting potential opportunities and risks.
â— Owning the end-to-end delivery of meticulous insights right across the Monica Vinader business including ecommerce, retail, operations, supply chain, customer care, logistics, finance
â— Develop relationships with your stakeholders and an understanding of their business areas, enabling your insights and recommendations to be relevant
â— Partner with the Product Team and Developers to ensure we have the right data collection and tracking processes in place to feed our models
â— Configure and govern automated reporting in our cloud based data stack. Including the building and development of SQL data models in DBT
â— Champion a culture of self service by ensuring your stakeholders are suitably skilled in how use our analytics tools
â— Building out customer segments based on behaviours including value, recency, products purchased and other factors in order to enable targeted communications and promotions
â— Analysing customer churn and building models to identify key characteristics or behaviours that flag that customers have a higher propensity to churn and therefore are at risk
â— Prioritise & resolve issues and requests raised via the internal Data Support desk solution
â— Maintain strict QA processes and standards in order to deliver high data integrity and uptime. Proactively monitor the integrity of our data connections and metrics, taking the lead on troubleshooting
â— Maintain a strong focus on good governance and documentation for our data systems, ensuring our approach is compliant and continues to be best in class
â— Play a central role in ensuring the security of our customersâ€™ data while also ensuring our compliance with international data compliance regulation (such as GDPR, PECR,CCPA)
 
 
What youâ€™ll bring
â— Experience in the data and analytics domain with a demonstrable track record in influencing business decisions using data
â— Strong technical and data modelling skills including advanced SQL and preferably one other programming language
â— Familiarity of working with a spectrum of cloud-based technologies which sit within the modern data stack (e.g. BigQuery/GCP/Snowflake/DBT/Snowplow)
â— Experience of using Agile frameworks, methodologies, and best practices within analytics
â— Analytics experience in customer behaviour, lifetime value, segmentation, experimentation, cohort analysis, etc., ideally in a DTC omni-channel business
â— Strong attention to details to highlight and address data quality issues
â— Self-motivated, responsible and technology-driven individual who performs well both independently and as a team member
â— Team player, able to work with multiple business functions to achieve objectives
â— Exceptional communication skills, written and verbal, youâ€™re known for your visual organisation plus clear and concise style
â— Experience with Google Analytics, GA4, and BI tools such as PowerBi, Tableau etc
â— Aptitude for test and learn mindset - and feeding that into day to day operations
â— Experience working at a high-growth start-up or scale-up environment where youâ€™ve had to be a scrappy self-starter with a focus on iteration and pragmatism
â— Self-motivated and enthusiastic approach to work who excels in challenging environments
â— A growth mindset, comfortable surfacing your own failures to drive learnings, knowing when to pivot, knowing when to persevere
 
 
To be successful at Monica Vinader...
â— You are a doer.
â— Youâ€™re a team player.
â— Youâ€™re humble.
â— You are honest, straightforward and transparent.
â— You are a good teacher/mentor (approachable and accessible).
â— You want to get your hands dirty.
â— You solve problems.
â— You are resilient.
â— You are flexible.
â— You are entrepreneurial, smart, and passionate.
â— If you don't know something, you say so. Then go figure it out quickly.
â— You love working in a creative environment.
â— You have a sense of humor.
â— You are an insatiable learner
 
 
Additional Requirements
Ability to document your authorization to work in the United Kingdom
 
 
Our Aims and Values
Our mission is to be the leading accessible luxury brand, by delivering outstanding quality, design and customer service. We are:
 
Customer Obsessed
Our customers are at the core of everything we do. We will always deliver an outstanding and personal experience to them every time they interact with us, to ensure their ongoing support and loyalty.
 
Caring
We treat people with respect, as we would want to be treated. We are apolitical and assume good intentions in others. We are open and honest with each other while ensuring we take an empathetic and supportive approach.
 
Fast Paced
We are passionate about what we do, and we want to reach as many customers as fast as we can. We combine focus with pragmatism and flexibility so that we can move at pace in whichever direction we need to take.
 
Exceptional
We have a relentless desire to continually learn and improve to ensure our products and approach are exceptional. Our tenacity, high standards and attention to detail give us a competitive advantage.
 
Commercial
We focus hard on facts and approach things in a logical, rational and analytical way. We challenge each other to make sure we make decisions and take actions that create value for our business and our customers.
 
Monica Vinader as a global business makes the following inclusive culture pledge:
Our jewellery is for everyone and so is our community. Together, we will continue to implement sustainable changes to ensure that career opportunities and progression are open to all. We commit to celebrating the diverse voices of our employees, partners, and the customers we serve.
 
This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of duties to be performed by the employee. This job description may be altered to reflect the business needs of the company.

job_desc:
A data solution analyst
 
generally works on implementing complex data projects with a focus on collecting, parsing, managing, analyzing, and visualizing large sets of data to turn information into insights using multiple platforms. He or she should be able to decide on the needed hardware and software design needs and act according to the decisions. The big data engineer should be able to develop prototypes and proof of concepts for the selected solutions.

Ideal candidate for this role is someone with a strong background in computer programming, who is eager to tackle problems with large, complex datasets using the latest SQL, python, or Spark. You are a self-starter who will take ownership of your projects and deliver high-quality data-driven analytics solutions. You are adept at solving diverse business problems by utilizing a variety of different tools, strategies, algorithms, and programming languages.
 
Specific responsibilities are as follows:
 
 
Strong analytical & logical skills
Utilize the data skills within and outside of the developing Chubb information ecosystem for discovery, analytics and data management
Work with data scientists, architects, business partners and business analysts to understand requirements, design and build effective solutions
Understanding of P&C insurance processes, risk data attributes and concepts such as Limits, Exposure bases, Coverages, Packaged, Rating Factors, etc. Experienced in identifying, capturing, profiling & analyzing data from multiple sources (internal and external).
 
Skilled in identifying remediation solutions for addressing data issues. Experience in documenting data capture requirements, source to target mappings, data flow diagrams, entity relationships and complex data models. Experienced in translating business needs into systems requirements including rating systems, reports, dashboards and scorecards with minimal or no supervision
Work with various relational and non-relational data sources with the target being Azure based SQL Data Warehouse & Cosmos DB repositories
Sourcing data from multiple applications, profiling, cleansing and conforming to create master data sets for analytics use
Design solutions for managing highly complex business rules within the Azure ecosystem
Experience working/creating Rule Engines
 


Qualifications
 
Skills Required
 
 
Extensive experience working with Data APIs (Working with RESTful endpoints and/or SOAP)

Excellent working knowledge of relational databases, MySQL, Oracle etc.

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Job Description
 
We are looking to recruit a Data Analyst within our Market Data group. The primary focus of this role will be related to the management of inbound and outbound data used to support Tradeweb's electronic trading platform and its data products. In this role, the Data Analyst will be involved with the onboarding and review process related to new and existing reference data used to populate Tradeweb's Security Master Data. The Analyst will also be responsible in documenting and maintaining quality checks on data products. The data will cover a broad array of financial markets and securities.
 
 
Job Responsibilities:
 
 
 
 
Update and document current data processes.
 
 
Develop tests, reports, and procedures around data quality improvements.
 
 
Perform operational checks for data quality validation.
 
 
Implement data requests to fulfill business requirements.
 
 
Track and communicate entitlement changes related to use of third party data.
 
 
Analyze and test new and existing data sets.
 
 
Write specifications around data extraction, transformation, and mapping.
 
 
Day-to-day operational work; quality checks, daily tests, internal client queries.
 


 
 
Required Qualifications:
 
 
 
 
Strong academic record, including a relevant degree (Finance/computer science/technology).
 
 
Passion for data analysis with emphasis on financial markets reference data.
 
 
Knowledge of Fixed Income and Equity securities across a broad array of markets is a plus.
 
 
Strong data analysis skills with an emphasis on data quality.
 
 
Familiarity with data mapping, data modeling, and relational database design.
 
 
Ability to write basic to intermediate SQL queries.
 
 
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, VBA, database connections, etc.) .
 
 
Experience with Python
 
 
Strong communication skills and the ability to coordinate projects with multiple parties.
 
 
Ability to work on multiple projects with shifting priorities in a fast paced environment.
 


 
 
About Tradeweb:
 
 
Tradeweb Markets Inc. (NASDAQ: TW) is a leading, global operator of electronic marketplaces for rates, credit, equities and money markets. Founded in 1996, Tradeweb provides access to markets, data and analytics, electronic trading, straight-through-processing and reporting for clients in the institutional, wholesale and retail markets. Advanced technologies developed by Tradeweb enhance price discovery, order execution and trade workflows while allowing for greater scale and helping to reduce risks in client trading operations. For more information, please go to www.tradeweb.com .
 
Tradeweb values diversity of culture and thought and seeks talented, qualified employees in all its operations around the world regardless of race, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other protected classification under country or local law.

job_desc:
We are looking for enthusiastic and aspiring
 
Graduate Data Analysts
, who enjoy working with numbers, to join the Pricing teams of our various Insurance products of our multi-award-winning business.
 
What do Pricing do?
 
Our Pricing department is a fundamental cornerstone of the successful growth of our business.

Pricing determine and adjust the prices we charge our customers through
 
logic-based reasoning and statistical analysis
. Pricing Analysts will
 
build and run pricing models
 
and make r
ecommendations for rate changes
 
and are responsible for
 
setting the rates
 
which create competitive prices for our customers.
 
As a Graduate in Pricing, you could be involved in:
 
 
Running pricing models using statistical tools and understanding the numbers within those models
Having responsibility for making proposals for potential improvements to our productsâ€™ rating structure and other business-critical decision-making processes
Unearthing value from both in-house and external data sets by cooperatively finding correlations in customer behaviour and fraudulent activity
Working together with our colleagues, including teams overseas, to make proposals to improve the pricing structure in our international operations
 


Should you be successful, you will be notified of which Pricing team you are joining nearer your confirmed start date. Start dates on offer with this role are flexible throughout 2023.
 
Please note, this is a permanent role, not a rotational graduate programme with different placements/rotations.
 
The Admiral Group has consistently been recognised as one of the best companies to work for in the UK, and this is an exciting time to join us as we expand our efforts into exciting new products and services.

As part of our rapidly growing business, working closely with our whole Pricing leadership team and reporting to one of our Pricing Managers, Graduate Analysts at Admiral enjoy fantastic career progression opportunities and our unique employee ownership model, which includes a free share scheme open to all staff. This means an added incentive to make a difference in our business's future and make our business, your business!
 
Location / Hybrid working
 
We are working in a hybrid approach and so are in the office approximately once per week in Cardiff (travel expenses are not covered). We will provide you with everything you need to work comfortably from home.
 
Qualifications
 
 
2.1 or above in a Mathematical degree discipline is desired
If you do not have a Mathematics degree, we are open to other STEM disciplines, subject to demonstrating a solid numerical and/or analytical academic background
 


 
Demonstrable ability to combine analytical thinking based on numbers, together with common sense and imagination
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
A willingness to dive into detail
This position is heavily based on Mathematical and Analytical skills, if you are looking for Data Science positions then there are other opportunities available throughout the year.
 


Development and progression
 
Weâ€™re a big believer in personal development and preparing you for success in this role as well as your next. Weâ€™ll provide a range of on-the-job training as well as other opportunities to learn all the key skills youâ€™ll need. There is fantastic opportunity for progression and development from this role, presenting opportunity to speedily progress your career within Pricing at Admiral.

We offer a steady career growth path with many of our previous graduates progressing to leadership roles involving regular contact with some of our most senior managers.

Thanks to our business's culture and structure, the skills and experience developed within our Pricing and Fraud Analytics teams would be transferable to other analytical departments as we grow our product portfolio.
 
Our Commitment to You
 
At Admiral, we are committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. Admiral is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment.
 
We do not have a set salary for this position, as it will be dependent on the successful candidateâ€™s experience. We are happy to see CVs from all candidates who meet the requirements and will be happy to discuss the remuneration package.

At Admiral, we are proud to be a diverse business where we put our people and customers first. We have great benefits to ensure employees have a great work-life balance; it's one of the reasons weâ€™re consistently voted one of the Sunday Times Best Big Companies to Work For in the UK. We want you to have an element of freedom to define a working lifestyle that supports this, so accommodate flexible hours wherever possible.

All colleagues will receive 33 days holiday (including banks holidays) when they join us, and this will increase with length of service, up to a maximum of 38 days (including banks holidays). You also have the option to buy or sell up to five days of annual leave in addition to your allocation.

You can also view some of our other key benefits here.
 
Next steps & Application Process
 
If you think this role is for you and would like to be considered for this opportunity, please click â€œapply nowâ€ to complete an online application form,
 
including an up-to-date copy of your CV
 
(it is encouraged to also supply a Cover Letter if possible).
 
If your CV and Cover Letter demonstrate the requirements as shown in this â€˜About Youâ€™ section, you will be invited to complete an online numeracy test.

The Hiring Managers will then review your application along with your test score. Following review of your application and test score together, you will be invited to attend an interview.

This is an on-going recruitment so applications will be reviewed as soon as they come through. We are flexible with the start date and will take individual circumstances into account.

job_desc:
Data Execution Analyst

London
 
As a Barclays Data Execution Analyst, you will be responsible for the execution of data lineage, documentation of appropriate data quality controls, analysis/remediation support of data quality issues and assessment of authoritative data sources, to conform to the requirements of the Group Data Management Policy & Standards. Your engagement will include working alongside Application Owners, CIO Technology and business SMEs to ensure accurate and complete representation of the flow of critical data.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality, and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity â€“ helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.
 
Working Flexibly
 
Weâ€™re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in. This environment recognizes and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees, globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customersâ€™ and clientsâ€™ needs. Whether you have family commitments or youâ€™re a carer, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager, and your request will be reviewed subject to business needs.

We are currently in the early stages of implementing a hybrid working environment, which means that many colleagues spend part of their working hours at home and part in the office, depending on the nature of the role they are in. Weâ€™re flexible on how this works and it may continue to change and evolve. Depending on your team, typically this means that colleagues spend a minimum of between 20% to 60% of their time in the office, which could be over a week, a month, or a quarter. However, some colleagues may choose to spend more time in the office over a typical period than their role type requires. We also have a flexible working process where, subject to business needs, all colleagues globally can request work patterns to reflect their personal circumstances. Please discuss the detail of the working pattern options for the role with the hiring manager.
 
What will you be doing?
 
 
 
Capturing and documenting subject matter knowledge about how data flows operate
 
Investigating and analyzing of data to understand the availability, meaning and suitability of data
 
Maintaining and enhancing data lineage and related information in CDO mandated tools
 
Supporting on data lineage interlock with other CDO BUs/Functions
 
Analyzing and documenting relevant business processes, finding opportunities to streamline activities
 
Ensuring adherence to Group Data Management Standards, Attestation and Re-certification
 


What Weâ€™re Looking For
 
 
 
Proven financial Services experience
 
Excellent analytical and literacy ability
 
Broad working knowledge and understanding of governance frameworks, standards and policies
 
Comprehensive knowledge & understanding of using data analysis & reporting / visualisation packages e.g. SQL, Tableau, Qlik
 


Skills That Will Help You In The Role
 
 
 
Familiarity with a component of Data Management e.g., Data Quality, Data Lineage, Metadata management and the like
 
Understanding of and proven experience in business and data analysis within a complex end-to-end architecture
 
Broad experience in data and operating model process re-engineering and ownership
 
Proven Corporate or Investment banking experience in a Risk and Controls or issue resolution environment
 


Where will you be working?
 
In the heart of Canary Wharf, our headquarters at Churchill Place boasts onsite amenities such as; a gym, staff restaurant and deli bar, and is easily accessible by tube and bus links. With a population of around 5000 staff the atmosphere is second to none with a real buzz being created around the offices within.

job_desc:
Goodwill Caravan is a humanitarian charity operating in the UK and in Greece, founded in 2015, Goodwill Caravan run humanitarian protection projects for vulnerable refugee families, orphans, detained unaccompanied children at risk of organ trade, trafficking and kidnappings if left in detention centers, jails or homeless on arrival to host countries.
 
Our vision is of a world in which children affected by war or natural disaster can live safe and fulfilled lives. This vision drives our mission to deliver life-changing humanitarian support to refugees and others in great need.
 
Our current projects include:
â€¢ Legal aid for refugees and asylum seekers with emphasis on supporting vulnerable groups.
â€¢ Emergency shelter for vulnerable refugees.
â€¢ Weekly distributions of food, clothing, and other necessities.
â€¢ Medical and healthcare support services.
â€¢ Educational and vocational training.
 
SCOPE
The Grants and Partnerships Officer will be responsible for the overall Grants management processes for Goodwill Caravan and support with partnerships oversight. S/he will oversee the implementation of GWC partnership management system, ensuring that GWC identifies, appropriately allocates and effectively mitigates programmatic, operational, financial, and reputational risk, establishing a strong foundation for strategic partnerships. S/he lead in all partnership identification, serve as the primary liaison with all sub-grantee partners, ensure compliance to donor rules and regulations while maintaining active and cooperative relationships with all the GWC staff and partners. 
 
The Grants & Partnership Officer will be based in London, UK and might be expected to travel occasionally.

st
 of April

Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)/Partnership agreements

REQUIREMENTS

job_desc:
Why join Azets?
 
At Azets people are at the core of what we do, with trainees being the first important building block in our success. We are extremely proud of and value the expertise and technical know-how within our business, but we equally understand the importance of enhancing and sharing this knowledge to continuously develop our future workforce.
 
With the everchanging economic landscape and advances in technology, there has never been a more exciting time to start a career in data. Whether a school/college leaver, a graduate or simply looking for a career change, why not start your journey here at Azets?
 
We are committed to offering development opportunities to all of our staff, from Entry Level Trainee through to Senior Partner. As a trainee, all of our roles will provide a professional qualification specific to the business area you will be working in â€“ in this case a Masters in Data Science.
 
About The Role
 
Data is everywhere. In a world where data is generated at an ever-increasing rate, clarity and insight seems to be in ever shorter supply and understanding is ever more elusive. Our Data Analytics team focus on helping their clients uncover actionable insight from their data. The team provide the technical expertise and capacity to clients that may not have the time nor resources to do inhouse to get the most out of their data. The team is also at the forefront of many internal projects that are supporting the automation of our business as well as the development of tools to be used to drive efficiency into our own business processes.
 
Our Services Include
 
 
Improving decision making: Providing insights into businesses by identifying trends, patterns and high-risk issues that help inform decision-making.
Identifying efficiencies and process improvements: Developing data visualisations to enable improvements and support the reduction in the costs of business process.
Automation of assurance activities: Automation of audit procedures using population-testing and custom-built dashboards to ensure real-time, accurate reporting.
Training to utilise data to improve profits, efficiency, and strategy.
Working with our internal audit teams to enable greater efficiencies and more robust testing approaches.
Providing training programmes to non-data scientists to enable them to work more effectively with data and to get more value from their business data.


 
When you join our Technology Risk team youâ€™ll get the opportunity to work on:
 
 
Dashboards & BI â€“ Creating interactive MI and BI Dashboards for easy monitoring and automated reporting.
Targeted Data Analysis â€“ Answering client questions using available data and identifying trends and patterns in a range of difference areas from staffing patterns, crime and environmental stats, financials analysis and more.
Automation â€“ Automating processes that require a lot of manual manipulation of data to increase efficiency.
Training â€“ Deliver training and upskilling of staff in analytics and various analytical tools such as Excel, Power BI and Python.
Analytics Testing â€“ Using data analytics to test revenue, payroll, absences etc. in audit.


 
Qualification
 
We have created a first-class training and development programme and, by starting your career at Azets, in addition to the comprehensive on the job training, you will also be given all the support you need to complete a professional qualification, including college and/or study days, mentoring and a designated buddy.
 
We offer a range of different qualification pathways at Azets which are determined by the role you are applying for. The qualification that will be undertaken for this position will be a Masters in Data Science.
 
Application Requirements
 
To get the job that youâ€™ll love
 
you will have:
 
 
You will need the right to work in the UK from your start date.
On track to achieve or have already achieved a minimum 2:1 in your undergraduate degree (or 2:2 if you can provide evidence of extenuating circumstances)


 
For us, the personal attributes of each of our employees are what makes us authentic in the marketplace. We look for people who can collaborate with peers but can also bring their own voice to the table. We want people who are dynamic in their approach and respectful of other peopleâ€™s opinions. We are looking for someone who wants to be more than just a team member, but who wants to join a family of likeminded individuals.
 
Benefits
 
At Azets, we understand that whilst job satisfaction and success is important, you should be rewarded for the work you do.
 
Our benefits include 23 days of annual leave (plus bank holidays), Agile & Flexible working, Employee referral bonuses, Lead incentive schemes and much more. You can find out more about how we reward our staff

job_desc:
Does working for Multi-National Lottery Operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, and Italy sound like the perfect place of employment for you?

They canâ€™t talk too much about their plans â€“ youâ€™ll have to speak to us to find out more â€“ but they can promise a fast-paced, exciting environment, innovative projects like none you have worked on before, and the opportunity to transform a core pillar of the UK economy, while contributing to good causes that benefit society.
 
Job Description:
Data Analyst - Full Time - Hybrid
 
 
 
Join our journey to create a new experience for the National Lottery and help us to power change for the greater good.
About us:
Allwyn UK is part of Allwyn Entertainment Group â€“ a multi-national lottery operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, and Italy. In 2022, Allwyn was selected in a Government tender as the Preferred Applicant to operate the UKâ€™s National Lottery from February 2024.
 
Over the next two years we are embarking on a largescale transformation journey to build a bigger, better and safer National Lottery that delivers more money to Good Causes. Once-in-a-lifetime opportunities exist for people from within and outside the betting and gaming industry to join us play a part in giving the National Lottery a fresh start

Role Responsibilities:

Respond to insight queries from the product team

Proactively analyse research findings to develop Allwyn UK friendly internal reports for both quantitative and qualitative reporting, using a story-based reporting approach
Support product lifecycle research programs to ensure product and planned marketing campaigns will resonate with relevant target audiences

Key Measures of Success:

Provide high quality outputs with digestible summaries and recommendations
High quality of data visualisation
Proactive approach to data analysis with insights and recommendations actively raised to the team
Support the business planning process with insights, modelling and forecasting inputs
Work closely with other Consumer Insights team members to develop internal qualitative and quantitative best practices


 
Key Skills and Experience:
 
Experience with application development is a plus
Experience in using either: SPSS, SAS, SQL
Experience in manipulating data in excel and using other platforms e.g. Tableau
Bachelorâ€™s degree from a recognized university, Masterâ€™s degree/MBA strongly preferred
3 + years of relevant job experience working in areas of data analysis
Ability to understand and translate technical, numerical data
Experience in data analysis for product development and management
Experience in the interactive entertainment industry a plus, with a preference on gambling
Consumer research or research agency experience a plus

job_desc:
Springer Nature opens the doors to discovery for researchers, educators, clinicians and other professionals. Every day, around the globe, our imprints, books, journals, platforms and technology solutions reach millions of people. For over 175 years our brands and imprints have been a trusted source of knowledge to these communities and today, more than ever, we see it as our responsibility to ensure that fundamental knowledge can be found, verified, understood and used by our communities â€“ enabling them to improve outcomes, make progress, and benefit the generations that follow.

Visit: group.springernature.com and follow @SpringerNature
 
 
Product Analyst / Senior Product Analyst (Depending On Experience)
 
Permanent contract
 
Located in London, Lisbon or Berlin
 
Springer Nature is seeking a Product Analyst / Senior Product Analyst (depending on experience) for its Product and Platform Group. The group meets the needs of researchers through products that include Springer Link, www.nature.com, www.biomedcentral.com and new solutions for the research community. This is an exciting opportunity as PPG looks to reimagine our core researcher experiences, and we are looking for someone that is able to independently lead and drive work, drawing on the wider global team.
 
As a Product Analyst, youâ€™ll be analysing data from very highly trafficked websites and content. You will provide actionable analysis and insight into the behaviour of researchers in their roles as authors and users of scientific information. You will be driving change that improves their experiences with SpingerNature, contributing to our purpose to advance discovery.
 
Youâ€™ll be working in close collaboration with product leads and managers to understand strategic priorities and partnering with the Product organisation developing customer-driven and evidence-driven decision-making, enhancing customer experience and delivering growth impact.
 
 
Role Responsibilities Will Include
 
 
Empowering product teams to easily make data-informed decisions via self-serve solutions such as visualisations, dashboards and automated data models
 
Contributing to the learning and experimentation culture of the Product and Platform Group by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation
 
Collaborating on a cross-functional level to define, track and monitor metrics for tactical and strategic needs
 
Exploring and analysing customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities
 
Performing statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses on feature usage to advise on feature adoption and evolution
 
Providing insights in the form of recommendations and action items to ad-hoc analyses
 
Enhancing data collection and drive consistency and best-practice for front-end tracking approaches, team up with respective teams for implementation
 


 
Role Requirements
 
 
University degree in Business, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a similar field
 
Working experience in Consulting / Data Analytics / Product Analytics
 
Strong knowledge of SQL (experience with Google BigQuery and Google Cloud Platform is a beneficial)
 
Hands-on experience of implementation and analysis from web analytics tools like Amplitude, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Mixpanel etc.
 
Self-starter with ability to work with minimal direction and high level of ownership
 
Passionate about working with data
 
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving
 
Desire to work in an international environment, with highly engaged individuals
 
Familiar with Agile practices
 


At Springer Nature, we value the diversity of our teams and work to build an inclusive culture, where people are treated fairly and can bring their differences to work and thrive. We empower our colleagues and value their diverse perspectives as we strive to attract, nurture and develop the very best talent.

Springer Nature was awarded Diversity Team of the Year at the 2022 British Diversity Awards. Find out more about our DEI work here.

If you have any access needs related to disability, neurodivergence or a chronic condition, please contact us so we can make all necessary accommodation.

job_desc:
London & Partners is the business growth and destination agency for London. Our mission is to create economic growth that is resilient, sustainable and inclusive.
 
 
We are a social enterprise,Â combining purpose with commercial rigour. We areÂ funded by grants, partners and our portfolio of commercial ventures.
 
 
We support high-growth businesses to scale â€“ both international businesses expanding into the UK and London-based businesses growing internationally. We develop London as a destination and attract visitors and events. We grow Londonâ€™s global reputation to support economic growth.Â We create partnerships and profit-making ventures that enable us to scale our impact.
 
 
The International Scale Up ProgrammeÂ aims to support high growth London based companies to internationalise, enable aspiring exporters to prepare for internationalisation and support bespoke cohorts in different themes to scale their businesses.Â This could include specific sub sectors such as low carbon or themes such as underrepresented Founders.
 
 
This programme will act as a single front door for companies who have global growth ambitions.
 
 
Purpose of role
 
 
Working closely with the Programme Manager (Events) and wider delivery team to support planning and delivery of programme content for scale ups expanding into new international markets.

Working closely with the compliance team to maintain records as per grant guidelines including data collection for client activities, project reporting and feedback collection and collation.
Deliver ad hoc operational and administrative support for the wider team.


 
 
Youâ€™ll have/bring

Experience of project-based work

Process driven with ability to work independently
Ability to use Microsoft Office.

Youâ€™ll Get
 
 
 
 
To join a fast paced, flexible and inclusive social enterprise
Hybrid working environment
30 daysâ€™ holiday in addition to UK public holidays
 
Excellent employer pension contribution and private medical health insurance

job_desc:
Gopuff is the go-to solution for immediate everyday needs, fulfilling customer orders of cleaning and home products to food and drinks, and in some markets, alcohol - in just minutes.
 
To make our model work, data needs to be at the heart of every decision we make. As such, we are looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our UK/EU Inventory Management team to develop models, tools and insights across all aspects of our inventory and supply chain. This is a crucial role in helping optimise our inventory management processes and policies, that balance maintaining great availability for our customers while holding optimal levels of inventory.
 
You will support the rapid growth of our business by developing models, tools and analysis that drive improvements across our supply chain, with a particular focus on demand forecasting, replenishment optimisation, experimentation and root-cause diagnostics. You will have the opportunity to develop innovative approaches to the complex problems we need to solve, and will work alongside other UK/EU Analysts and our centralised Engineering teams to play a role in our wider data community.
 
Tech Stack:
 
 
Infrastructure: Snowflake, Spark, Databricks, Azure
ETL: dbt, Dagster, Stitch
BI: Looker, Sigma and Tableau


 
You will:
 
Partner with our Inventory Management Product team to enhance and develop new existing models used for our instock management, such as our demand forecast model, replenishment allocation model and
Oversee item level demand forecasting for our EU markets, partnering with our central US Data Science team to influence and adopt their global best practices
Develop innovative measurement and analytical approaches that root cause and build our understanding of all aspects of our in-stock management performance - such as forecasting accuracy, availability metrics, supplier performance, waste & cost management, etc
Answer complex business questions through detailed quantitative analysis and experimentation, extracting meaningful and actionable insights for in-stock managers to inform our replenishment policies and ways-of-working
Partner with our central Data Science, Analytics & Data Engineering teams to implement reliable & scalable data pipelines to put your models into production, and to gather the information you need
Help improve buyer workflows through automation and tool development, working alongside our Tech teams here in Europe and the US
Support and mentor the other analysts in the team to help them develop their skills and deliver great results


 
You have:
 
3+ years of hands-on experience in an analytics or data science role - preferably in fields related to grocery, trading, marketing, or consumer product.
A deep understanding of statistical analysis particularly approaches to forecasting, optimisation methodologies and experimentation design
Expertise in SQL and Python/R, having worked with large and fast-moving data sets.
Experience with dbt is a strong plus.
Experience developing automated workflows and interacting with APIs is a strong plus.
A strong and confident communicator, with good knowledge of data visualization and storytelling.
High degree of curiosity, comfortable gathering and analyzing large amounts of data across a variety of business dimensions.
The role will be UK based, with the candidate ideally based in/around London or able to visit on a regular basis.

And now, weâ€™re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

job_desc:
What the Hiring Manager Says
 
The Product Analyst provides subject matter expertise in the given technology
 
product to ensure that solution operates effectively. The role is responsible for
 
supporting system functionality and/or trouble shooting, system analysis, supporting system design, assisting with user-testing and documenting business processes / procedures in partnership with business functions.
 
In this particular role you will provide subject matter expertise in the Quilter Cheviot CRM solution (built on MS Dynamics 365 and provided by Wealth Dynamix) to ensure that solution operates effectively.
 
About The Role
 
Product Analyst
 
Level
: 3
 
Department:
 
Quilter Cheviot, GTS
 
Location
: London, England

: Permanent
 
You will provide first line support for user queries on Quilter technology products, applications functionality, and data within the assigned business area.

Youâ€™ll be responsible for small change documentation, such as business requirements, system designs and test plans.
 
You will seek opportunities for continuous improvement, optimisation and innovation in technology products, data and applications functionality.
 
Youâ€™ll maintain a forward looking schedule of actions related to Product enhancements.
 
About You
 
Applications from people with diverse backgrounds enables our inclusive organisation to thrive. If you feel you don't match our job description exactly, why not take a chance on yourself and apply? You could be exactly what this role needs.
 
Our ideal candidate will have direct experience of working within the Wealth / Asset Management or Vendor space.
 
Youâ€™ll have a Product or Business Analysis qualification and hands on experience in defined product and or specific industry processes.
 
Youâ€™ll have an excellent knowledge of business processes, systems and data flows.
 
You will have a demonstrable technical aptitude for troubleshooting and problem solving. Knowledge of managed systems and working with third party support.
 
The successful candidate will have proven experience supporting business users to explore small change requests and resolve BAU issues.
 
You will have experience of working with MS Dynamics 365 or WDX and JIRA.
 
Our purpose is to help the generations today and tomorrow to prosper. That means we must guide people through the complexity of planning for their future, with the right financial advice and investment solutions, so that they can have more secure financial futures.
 
In this ever-changing world, we see that our role in society has never been more meaningful, and we are committed to using our expertise and care to guide our customers through these challenging and unprecedented times.
 
Our impressive talents and capabilities set us apart, but our unwavering commitment to our customers is what defines us. We truly believe that we have all the ingredients to be the very best in our industry, and we want great people with the care and creativity that we need, to help us get there.
 
We are passionate about building an inclusive culture where everyoneâ€™s contribution is valued, and our people can thrive. No matter what your role is or where you sit, your voice will matter. We hope you like what you hear and are interested in learning more about joining us.
 
Core Benefits
 
Holiday: 26 days
 
Quilter Incentive Scheme: All employees are eligible to participate in our incentive scheme, based on the company's performance and their contribution to it
 
Pension Scheme: 10% non-contributory company pension scheme that can be boosted through personal contributions
 
Private Medical Insurance: Single cover as standard, cover can be increased at your own cost
 
Life Assurance: 4x your salary, cover can be increased at your own cost
 
Income Protection: 75% of salary payable after 26 weeks of absence
 
In addition to our core benefits we offer a range of flexible benefits that you can choose from and pay for conveniently via a salary deduction.

job_desc:
Weâ€™re looking for a data analyst to join us here at GWI. Not just any data analyst though. Someone ambitious and genuine, who works best in the midst of a collaborative and forward-thinking team. Thatâ€™s because as a GWIer youâ€™ll be immersed in the fast-moving world of data tech. We
 
think big
 
to make an impact, weâ€™re not afraid to
 
ask why
, and we always
 
show respect
. Those values are what got us where we are today, and theyâ€™re a big part of what weâ€™re looking for in you.
 
About The Job
 
Our newly formed Business Data & Analytics department is on a journey to empower every area of the business with quality data, insights, automated efficiencies and analytics. Our goal is to enhance business performance and to give every GWIer the opportunity to make the best, timely decisions to move at the pace that makes GWI special. GWI is a data company where we power insights for some of the biggest global businesses, but the BD&A team is all about looking inwards and unlocking huge opportunities to work cross-functionally across departments to power up our internal teams with internal data.
We are hiring an experienced data analyst to support the build of our new data and analytics platform as well as varied projects and initiatives across the business. You should be able to extract, integrate and blend data and look for trends and patterns for both system needs and business analysis needs. You will have experience in setting up data management processes, establishing standards and building data models, through to profiling and analysing data in any system, internal or 3rd party, including data lakes and data warehouses. You will be comfortable working with metadata, data lineage and master data and confidently be able to advise the business on these areas.
 
What Youâ€™ll Be Doing
 
 
Learn and understand how the data works and be ready to answer questions of the data
Take ownership of data management, data dictionaries and setting standards on data
Document data, data flows, processes and data models
Analyse and document system data for integration into Data Lake and Data Warehouse
Collaborate with Enterprise Data Architect, business experts, and analysts to integrate systems and automate data collection processes
Work with data ingestion pipelines built by Data Engineers and be hands on to support data issues or questions raised on data
Problem solve issues through deep-dive data investigation and present back your findings
Be an advocate for data quality
Setup proactive monitoring of data to support either data quality or timely insights for departmental action
Produce MI and dashboards which help users understand key pressure points in data or processes
Support data testing activities across business and technical areas
Ensure data is available in a fit-for-purpose and timely manner for business and analytics consumption
 


About You
 
First things first, as a disruptor in the global market research industry, we havenâ€™t come this far without entrepreneurial spirit and a get-up-and-go attitude. You are joining a small team at the early stages of our greenfield journey. We are looking for someone who is ready and willing to roll sleeves up and get stuck into setting up our data management capabilities. You will have experience with the journey to build up a modern data framework and with your drive and innovation you are ready to deliver data management and data quality for the business. So if you think weâ€™ll see that in you, then youâ€™re already halfway there. Hereâ€™s the rest of what weâ€™d like you to bring to the table.
 
Technical
 
 
Highly proficient in SQL and able to write complex queries utilising CTEs and Window functions
Data manipulation and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise and analyse large amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience in data reconciliation against any systems, data platform or BI reporting sources
Experience in designing and implementing workflows for management of data to support business areas as well as the BD&A team
Highly proficient in Excel and/or Google Sheets
Experience with Tableau highly desirable
Experience with Python highly desirable
 
Preferable experience with GCP and the GCP data components
Experience with DBT, Stitch or similar highly desirable
Experience supporting QA and User Acceptance Testing processes
Knowledgeable on modern data architecture such as Data Lake, Data Warehouse, Lakehouse, Data Mesh etc.
Delivering incremental value through Scrum and Kanban methodologies
 


Competencies
 
 
Ability to find solutions when faced with challenges and be articulate when offering viable recommendations
Ability to interpret impact of changes to business rules on the data and data integration pipelines
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and able to write up and present findings
Self-driven and constantly striving to improve data
Analytical and agile mindset and ability to see the big picture alongside the value of incremental delivery
Natural problem solver who can make recommendations at pace
Ability to scope, estimate and deliver committed work on time, on own and as part of Agile team
Understand, if not live and breathe the mantra, that good quality data is the backbone of every business
 


Our Benefits
 
Great benefits make a big difference. Not just to employees, but to the whole vibe of a business. Thatâ€™s why when you work for us, youâ€™ll enjoy a full spectrum of generous perks, rewards and office benefits.
 
 
Competitive salary and performance-based bonus
Generous training budget
25 days holiday and Christmas office closure days on top
Allocated shares according to GWIâ€™s share scheme
 
A range of discounts and freebies
Accredited learning and development programs
Enhanced primary caregiver and co-caregiverâ€™s benefits
Flexitime and a great work-life balance
Health Cash plan
Referral bonus scheme
Mobile phone contract
Early finishes on Fridays
A well-stocked fridge and plenty of snacks (some healthy, some not so healthy)
Commit a working day to charity each year
Social activities and team outings
 


Who We Are
 
GWI was founded with the knowledge that understanding your audience is really important for business. When you know who youâ€™re speaking to and why, you can create content and campaigns that stand out to the people that matter.
Through our global online survey, we gather data on the behaviour and perceptions of consumers across the world. This provides businesses with deep, actionable insights on their audience, revealed from data they trust.
Itâ€™s been going well, too. Since launching in 2009, weâ€™ve become one of the UKâ€™s fastest growing target audience companies. Weâ€™re not about to stop growing any time soon. As a business, weâ€™re on a mission to re-engineer data-driven marketing, and weâ€™re on the lookout for talented people to join us.
 
Diversity & Inclusion
 
Imagine if our data came from just one kind of person. Weâ€™d get a very nuanced view of the world. And we definitely wouldnâ€™t have got off the ground as a business.
Although things certainly arenâ€™t perfect, we live in a society where differences are increasingly celebrated â€“ so weâ€™d expect nothing else from our teams. In fact, the GWI office is as diverse as our global data, itâ€™s really important to us that it stays that way. This is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely and make your mark.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
This clients mission is to establish the foremost Business Visa and Document Procurement company globally. They are leveraging top-tier expertise, cutting-edge technology, and extensive knowledge to deliver the industry's premier travel document management program to their clients.
 
Their team thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced, and visionary setting, and is deeply committed to providing unparalleled customer service with a combination of expertise and dedication.
 
As a Data Analyst, you will have the critical responsibility of maintaining and managing specific data within our Dynamics 365 CRM platform. In close collaboration with our research teams, you will ensure that records within our CRM accurately reflect changing requirements. Your role will encompass mapping data between the CRM and external systems that generate business documents, and integrating them into new and existing RPA processes. You will also leverage your expertise in XML language, utilising it within Dynamics CRM to create queries that enable data mapping and export.
 
To succeed in this role, a strong attention to detail is essential, along with the ability to work effectively with remote teams globally. You will work with technologies such as ActivePDF and DocumentCorePack to produce intricate documents, driven by the data stored within the CRM. Your role will require a keen interest and aptitude for data handling and technical problem solving.
 
Responsibilities:
 
 
Collaborate with internal research teams to update data stored in the CRM system in response to changes in visa processes and requirements.
Develop an understanding of the Microsoft Dataverse data structure and its mapping to fields within the CRM and our customer-facing portal.
Apply XML to map data fields from the CRM system to fields on web-based government portals or PDF application forms, allowing the fields to be leveraged by RPA processes.
Identify and report discrepancies between the fields captured within our CRM and the data required for visa application processes to relevant teams.
Analyze large data sets to identify discrepancies and recommend best practices for maintaining data effectively across all systems.
Use data contained within the CRM to generate or modify letters/forms with ActivePDF or DocsCorePack.
Conduct testing on data mapping and document creation to ensure accurate results, working closely with IT and research teams.
Communicate the outcomes of testing to other teams within the business.


 
The Ideal Candidate will possess the following qualifications:
 
 
A comprehensive knowledge of MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
Proven experience in data mapping, entry, and upkeep.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to gather, structure, and evaluate data.
Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Comfortable working remotely and in virtual environments.
Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM/Dataverse and reporting tools such as PowerBI is an advantage.
Capability to analyze large data sets and present findings in a concise format.
Aptitude for comprehending business processes and the impact that data has within these processes.
Previous experience with tools like ActivePDF, DocumentCorePack, and XRM Toolbox is also advantageous.


They are offering a competitive salary of up to Â£35K depending on experience plus benefits. This is a Hybrid role based in their Sheffield office asking you to go into the office 3 days a week.
 
If this sounds like the role for you apply now!
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:

We thrive on the challenge of working across different projects, user needs and technologies and our teams and people live this every day. Our people-first approach and culture is central to our growing success as a consultancy.

Benefits
