job_desc:
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to earn while you learn?
 
The L&G Apprentice programme has been designed to help you reach your potential. You will develop your skill set, gain valuable work experience and complete a fully funded professional qualification, all whilst earning a competitive salary with access to outstanding employee benefits.
 
With support every step of the way and access to core skills training, you will contribute to the success of the Retail Data Operations team and be supported by a dedicated line manager. As part of a cohort of apprentices, you will also have the opportunity to connect with your peers and colleagues though networking opportunities and social events.
 
Joining L&G is the beginning to a future that will be anything but familiar. So take a closer look, get involved, be curious and find out how we will enable you to be at your best no matter who you are.
 
Join us on an 18-month programme in which you will complete a Level 4 Data Analyst qualification, whilst building your business acumen.
 
Youâ€™ll receive on the job training and coaching from your line manager to help you gain the professional, personal, social, and methodical skills needed to succeed as a data analyst. Alongside this youâ€™ll complete training workshops and assignments, delivered by a leading apprenticeship training provider. Combined, these will fully equip you to be successful in your role, with the knowledge and skills required to apply to real world business challenges.
 
During your apprenticeship you will:
 
 
Develop your skills in data analysis, coding and data visualisation software
Work with business stakeholders to design and deliver analytical solutions and reports
Work with other data professionals including and business stakeholders to automate and productionise outputs
Communicate with stakeholders in a non-technical manner, providing advice, understanding and insight
Collaborate with individuals across the organisation
Have guidance from your team and manager who will support you and teach you the day-to-day role
Apply the knowledge and skills that youâ€™ve learnt from your training into the role
Have the opportunity to meet and network with new colleagues within your team, but also across the wider organisation
 


 
The person who would most benefit and enjoy this programme is hungry to learn and eager to get started in the world of work. Weâ€™re not expecting prior industry experience, but weâ€™ll want to see that you have the aptitude, potential and desire which will ultimately lead to you being successful. Weâ€™ll teach you the rest!
 
To qualify for the programme, you will need:
 
 
GCSE Maths grade C/4 or equivalent
GCSE English grade C/4 or equivalent
Minimum 96 UCAS points from your Level 3 Qualifications e.g. A 'levels or equivalent
 
To not currently be on a government funded training course, e.g. on apprenticeship
The right to work in the UK and have lived in the UK or EEA for the past 3 consecutive years.
 
To have an awareness and interest of Data both in business and the wider world
 
Passion and commitment to solving problems and improving ways of working in business
 


 
To be confirmed as part of your offer letter.
 
As a company, to be one of the world's largest Asset Managers, homebuilders, pension providers and insurances brands, we are diverse by our very nature. And we're a company that wants to use our diversity and influence to make society better in the long term - for everyone. To do this we need to be a company that welcomes everyone, where everyone can succeed. That means we're committed to building an inclusive culture in L&G where we can all perform at our best, no matter who we are, what we do or where we do it. So, whoever you are, wherever you are, whatever your story, we'd love to hear from you.
 
Our Data Analyst Apprenticeship Programme spans across the Legal & General Divisions. Successful applicants will join one of the following business areas and develop their data skills there. While both of these teams have different areas of focus, they all provide the opportunity for apprentices to work on a wide variety of projects and learn from data experts. The teams all strive to use data to support planning, decision making and drive great customer outcomes to deliver safe, secure, and innovative data solutions to drive sustainable value for a competitive and modern L&G.
 
Retail Data Operations -
 
This teamâ€™s goal is to deliver data products (reports, models, analysis) to the business and key stakeholders.
 
Retail Operational Planning -
 
Retail Operational Planning - This team handles complex and varied data/analysis requests from stakeholders across Retail Operational. Theyâ€™re responsible for the development, build and roll out of new reports as required by stakeholders. Co-ordination, running and maintenance of systems, existing reporting to ensure data integrity whilst meeting all governance requirements.
 
Great minds donâ€™t have to think alike, so we welcome voices from all backgrounds. Bringing together people with different life experiences helps us build empathy with our customers and drive innovation.
 
We donâ€™t just talk about it, we actively promote diversity and equitable opportunities for all. That means our employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status. In fact, we embrace every dimension of diversity to reflect the customers and communities we serve.
 
We think itâ€™s important to create an inclusive environment where we can all belong, contribute and drive progress, where you can develop and grow, and be empowered. We want you to use your voice to help us build a better tomorrow.
 
We all work differently, and have different needs, which is why. weâ€™re always open to discussing flexible working arrangements. Likewise, weâ€™re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs during our recruiting process.
 
So whoever you are, wherever you are, whatever your story, we'd love to hear from you.
 
We believe that good businesses are built on doing the right thing and strive to do what is best for both our people and our customers. This means enabling you to bring your best self to work by giving you what you need, when you need it.
 
This is why weâ€™ve designed a process that puts you in control, because we recognise that your time is valuable. At each step, make sure you take time to pause and reflect before progressing to the next, as each subsequent step will ask for a bit more of your time.
 
 
We want you to feel comfortable that this process is as fair and inclusive as possible, so please let us know if you have an illness or disability that you think may affect your performance during the process, so that reasonable adjustments can be made.
 
At each step weâ€™ll give more information and clear instructions on what actions you need to take and how you can prepare. Youâ€™ll be assessed at each of these steps.
 
In brief, our assessment stages process will include:
 
CV Application:
 
This will be reviewed to ensure you meet the basic requirements for the role, we do not require work experience for entry level roles and understand that C.Vs may not have huge amounts of detail at this stage of your career
 
Video Interview:
 
This will take approximately 20minutes, we will ask some questions that will help us understand your motivation for L&G and the Apprenticeship we are offering
 
Assessment Centre:
 
Comprised of a competency-based interview, group activity and an individual work based activity
 
Provisional Offer subject to enrolment:
 
If you are successful in the assessment centre, you'll receive a provisional job offer, the final step will be for you to enrol on the training course. Once this is complete, we can officially offer you the job!
 
Please note that we are recruiting on a rolling basis for this role and therefore the position may close sooner than the advertised date. We would encourage you to apply as soon as possible so as not to miss out on this opportunity.
 
The start date for the programme will be September 2023.
 
For any queries, please contact futuretalentrecruitment.landg.com. Please noteâ€¯weâ€¯are unable to accept email applications.

job_desc:
Company Description
 
 
At AECOM, weâ€™re delivering a better world.
 
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether itâ€™s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. Weâ€™re one global team â€“ 47,000 strong â€“ driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
 
 
About Digital @AECOM
 
 
As a member of the Europe digital consulting services team you will work with leaders from around the world to define and position the digital consulting services, to share best practices, to leverage global capabilities and to support global opportunities and projects. While services and solution management will be set globally, they will be tailored for implementation within the region and for each client.
 
Job Description
 
 
AECOMâ€™s
 
Data and Analytics Team are looking for a
 
Data Engineer
 
to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams.
 
The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
 
 
Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and Azure â€˜big dataâ€™ technologies.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and regions.
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Showcasing proof points and case studies


Qualifications
 
 
Minimum Requirements:
 
 
 
We are looking for a candidate who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Advanced working SQL/nosql, ADLS, Databricks, ADF, Azure DevOps
Experience building and optimizing â€˜big dataâ€™ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.

Your role with us
This role is responsible for defining, collating, requirement gathering and analysis of data within The Royal Mint to support the design of data repositories and analytical warehouses.

Highly experienced with an intimate understanding of data and analytics in the context of real world uses in a fast-moving business

job_desc:
Acteon provides a range of industry-leading products and services to support marine and subsea projects for renewable energy, nearshore construction and oil and gas sectors across all phases of the lifecycle. We engineer solutions and integrated services using data and knowledge-based insight across our customers' floating and fixed marine infrastructure.
 
The market in which Acteon operates is shifting in favour of data-driven companies. Leading this transition, Acteon has a cross-discipline Digital team to promote development of new data-driven insights into our services and our customers' assets to drive increased performance and safety to personnel and environment.
 
We are looking for a dynamic Data Analytics Specialist to join this core team and be an integral part of our Digital Centre of Excellence. Awaiting the successful candidate are novel projects in marine installation optimisation, geo-data visualisation, and many others. Acteon Group is at an exciting point in its digital journey and the Data Analytics role will play a key part in its future development.
 
 
Key Responsibilities
 
Transform domain expertise of technical authorities into intuitive, insightful digital products
Build and deploy models and data pipelines which support those and other digital services
Quickly prototype nascent digital concepts to build up value propositions
Work closely with Acteon's cloud IT Ops team to put prototypes into production
Establish and maintain governance processes for analytics models


 
Available Opportunities
 
Be seen as a transformative leader in data science within Acteon and by our clients
Gain domain knowledge in marine engineering
Grow our Data Analytics Centre of Excellence
Publish papers and attend industry conferences
Mentor Masters students and interns


 
Candidates Must Come Armed With
 
Analytical, inquisitive mindset
Exceptional listening skills and ability to translate concepts to non-technical audiences
Data science / advanced statistical analysis experience
Strong Python programming skills, focused on engineering and/or data science applications
Drive and ability to self-deliver work from concept to production
Knowledge of cloud analytics services and infrastructure (Azure preferred)
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases


 
Traits of a Successful Candidate
 
Degree in engineering, computer science, or similar (or equivalent industry experience)
Plan, organise and prioritise work; balance skills, priorities and timescales to achieve objectives
Ability to fully plan, build, and deploy Azure data analytics pipelines
Strong desire to be a digital promoter and transformer
Experience developing data models to aggregate data streams and delivering semantic layers to users
Familiarity interacting with IOT transport protocols and REST APIs
Understanding of ERP systems, e.g. Microsoft Dynamics 365
Experience working with engineering and operations teams in marine construction, renewables, or offshore oil & gas industries

job_desc:
Splendid Hospitality Group is one of the UKs fastest growing privately-owned hotel groups. As a family run business, people are at the very heart of its success, a place where everyone becomes parts of the Splendid family. An opportunity has arisen for an Assistant Data Analyst at Splendid Hospitality. The primary responsibilities of this role will be to support the Data and IT Manager in delivering accurate, timely and informative reports and insight to help drive business decisions. This role allows you to partner with all aspects of the business, deriving insights from our data and presenting this back to inform our leaders. This role is fundamental to our growth and ability to change and react quickly and the work you do will impact on our direction and decisions.
 
What We Offer

The team offers a wealth of experience across a variety of talents ensuring that the Group is well positioned to achieve its vision to be a Centre of Global Excellence for Hospitality.
 
Role in our Family

â€¢ Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to explain analytic results and models to a non-technical audience.

We are looking for someone who is proactive, with a good attitude, and is looking to develop their skills and grow within a multifaceted role.

Reporting into the central Digital & Technology team, we are seeking a highly skilled data analyst to assist our Private Credit team in their digital & transformation journey. In this role, you will be responsible for collecting, processing, and analysing data to inform business decisions related to the businessâ€™s leasing and lending activities. job_desc:
Job description
We are looking for a Research Analyst to join our Asia-Pacific team at Chambers and Partners.
 
 
This role will require night shift work for a total period of 16 weeks, with a total of 12 weeks of nightshift. Work is carried out in three 4 week night shift periods followed by 2 week day shift periods. The work will be carried out from April to July.
 
Research Analysts are the core of the Chambers research process. Through effective interview techniques they gather feedback on the legal market from clients and lawyers. The role involves the close analysis of interviews and submissions to develop an accurate ranking table as a result of this research. Researchers also write informative editorials providing an overview of the strengths of a particular law firm.
 
Research Analysts are responsible for researching the practice areas and jurisdictions that are assigned to them. This includes gathering factual information â€“ via law firm submissions, deal reports or business press â€“ and ensuring that useful clients and lawyers are identified and interviewed. They take ownership of each section assigned to them and discuss their findings with their Deputy Editor when research is complete.
 
Main Duties and Responsibilities:
Research
 
Background research to understand their assigned practice areas and jurisdictions.
With the support of the Deputy Editor, determining which lawyers to contact for interview.
Conducting probing interviews with lawyers, asking open-ended questions.
Interviewing in-house counsel and other third-party experts by telephone or via an online questionnaire.
Accurately logging communications and continually assessing progression of their research.
Pursuing research leads gained via materials provided by the Chambers team, or through their own research.
Building an understanding of, and relationships with, the key market participants.


 
Analysis
 
Analysing the data collected during the research phase to create accurate and impartial ranking tables that reflect the market.
Developing an understanding of your assigned jurisdictions/practice areas through interviews and desk research.
Seeking out and acting upon new developments and opportunities for expansion in the areas they are responsible for.
Assessing both law firms and individual lawyers - their key strengths and weaknesses - to provide an accurate hierarchical ranking


 
Editorial
 
Producing an informative, business-focused editorial for the Chambers website and print versions of our guides
Fully responsible for the comprehensive nature of this editorial e.g. ensure accuracy, respect the confidentiality of material we handle etc.
Identify what makes each firm different, and why it might appeal to a particular type of client.
Understand the personalities and key strengths of leading lawyers within the profession.
Working to the editorial deadlines i.e. meeting deadlines for research, ranking and editorial writing.
Taking ownership of the process i.e. proactively reporting any challenges faced when producing accurate and informative editorial etc.
Writing internal reports at the end of a research phase that are called upon to direct research in the future.


 
Person Specification:
 
Ability to work night shifts.
Excellent communication skills (verbal & written).
Organised and methodical.
Demonstrates the ability to meet set deadlines.
Attention to detail.
Intellectually curious.


 
Equal Opportunity Statement
We are committed to fostering and promoting an inclusive professional environment for all of our employees, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion are integral values of Chambers and Partners and are key in our culture. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals regardless of age, disability, race, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity. This commitment applies across all of our employment policies and practices, from recruiting and hiring to training and career development. We support our employees through our internal INSPIRE committee with Executive Sponsors, Chairs and Ambassadors throughout the business promoting knowledge and effecting change.
title: Research Analyst - Night Shift Position

job_desc:
Company Description


Syngenta is a world-leading plant science company committed to promoting sustainable agriculture through innovative research and technology. In more than 90 countries around the world, our employees enable millions of farmers to improve global food security by making better, more sustainable use of available resources.


Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.


We are offering a 3-year scheme for young talents with keen interest in science, data, and technology as well as passion for sustainability and agriculture. Our scheme will offer various role opportunities for graduates, with well-established rotations each year to provide a comprehensive overview of the IT technology landscape, diverse R&D and IT teams and their ways of working, including how to use Agile methodology and cloud computing


Job Description


Role Purpose: 


We are looking for recent graduates and final year undergraduates, as we are offering you the first step in your career. Prior work experience is useful but not essential as we will support you from day one. You will have a leadership ambition, self-motivation, and desire to build a successful career in Syngenta. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain real IT experience in an exciting R&D environment working alongside technical, scientific, and data-driven colleagues.


Moreover, you will be able to individually shape your roles in the next 3 years. You can decide to pursue a technical specialist journey by exploring roles such as Developer, DevOps Engineer and Solution Architect, or decide for a managerial path such as Business Analyst, Project/Product Manager and Scrum Master, or combine both depending on your development plans.


Your experimentalist mindset, curiosity, and willingness to try things out will inspire others as you innovate and learn together. We will need you to communicate well and be happy to spend time researching information when required. You will also need to be comfortable with working remotely via Zoom.


In return we will provide training and mentoring to support your longer term personal and professional development and speed up your leadership journey.


Accountabilities


Direct accountabilities will differ depending on the specific role that you will take on each year. You choose!


In general, in each role you will be accountable for:


Bringing fresh perspective and experimental mindset to inspire and challenge established teams 
Promoting and actively implementing Agile methodologies and internal standards 
Liaising with Communities of Practice to gain and share experiences, skills, and innovation across IT 
Contributing to various initiatives that bring value to our communities and stakeholders 
Highlighting risks as they become evident 
Asking questions when things are not clear 


Qualifications


Requirements: 


Minimum bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in computer science or STEM degrees (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) 
Some knowledge of either IT infrastructure (cloud or physical), application or data management 
Keen interest in technology and science in the external world 
Awareness of emerging technologies 
Ability to work autonomously with suitable guidance and support, in a complex scientific or business sustainability environment while still ensuring full compliance with all internal and external standards 
Ability to manage complexity and uncertainty, including self-driven research and learning 
Good communication skills with a willingness to ask questions 
Strong customer focus and teamwork skills 
Self-motivated, organized, and proactive 
Fluency in English 


Additional Information


What we offer: 


We offer a position which contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment 
Flexible working arrangements and environment with an open culture and diverse workforce 
The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees 
Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options 
You will profit from an onsite doctor, gym, canteen, and other benefits 


Interested?


We look forward to receiving your online application by February 20th including all relevant documents (cover letter and CV, diploma, certificates). Interviews will take place in March and the position starts after graduation on Sept 4th 2023.


Please be aware that the job title may differ from the position title.


Did you know? Syngenta has been ranked as a top employer by Science Journal.


Learn more about our team and our mission.


Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

job_desc:
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to earn while you learn?
 
The L&G Apprentice programme has been designed to help you reach your potential. You will develop your skill set, gain valuable work experience and complete a fully funded professional qualification, all whilst earning a competitive salary with access to outstanding employee benefits.
 
With support every step of the way and access to core skills training, you will contribute to the success of a team and be supported by a dedicated line manager. As part of a cohort of apprentices, you will also have the opportunity to connect with your peers and colleagues though networking opportunities and social events.
 
Joining L&G is the beginning to a future that will be anything but familiar. So take a closer look, get involved, be curious and find out how we will enable you to be at your best no matter who you are.
 
Join us on an 18-month programme in which you will complete a Level 4 Data Analyst qualification, whilst building your business acumen
 
Youâ€™ll receive on the job training and coaching from your line manager to help you gain the professional, personal, social, and methodical skills needed to succeed as a data analyst. Alongside this youâ€™ll complete training workshops and assignments, delivered by a leading apprenticeship training provider. Combined, these will fully equip you to be successful in your role, with the knowledge and skills required to apply to real world business challenges.
 
During your apprenticeship you will:
 
 
Develop your skills in data analysis, coding and data visualisation software
Work with business stakeholders to design and deliver analytical solutions and reports
Work with other data professionals including and business stakeholders to automate and productionise outputs
Communicate with stakeholders in a non-technical manner, providing advice, understanding and insight
Collaborate with individuals across the Group
Have guidance from your team and manager who will support you and teach you the day-to-day role
Apply the knowledge and skills that youâ€™ve learnt from your training into the role
Have the opportunity to meet and network with new colleagues within your team, but also across the wider organisation
 


 
The person who would most benefit and enjoy this programme is hungry to learn and eager to get started in the world of work. Weâ€™re not expecting prior industry experience, but weâ€™ll want to see that you have the aptitude, potential and desire which will ultimately lead to you being successful. Weâ€™ll teach you the rest!
 
To qualify for the programme, you will need:
 
 
GCSE Maths grade C/4 or equivalent
GCSE English grade C/4 or equivalent
Minimum 96 UCAS points from your Level 3 Qualifications e.g. A 'levels or equivalent
 
To not currently be on a government funded training course, e.g. on apprenticeship
The right to work in the UK and have lived in the UK or EEA for the past 3 consecutive years.
 
To have an awareness and interest of Data both in business and the wider world
 
Passion and commitment to solving problems and improving ways of working in business
 


 
To be confirmed as part of offer letter.
 
As a company, to be one of the world's largest Asset Managers, homebuilders, pension providers and insurances brands, we are diverse by our very nature. And we're a company that wants to use our diversity and influence to make society better in the long term - for everyone. To do this we need to be a company that welcomes everyone, where everyone can succeed. That means we're committed to building an inclusive culture in L&G where we can all perform at our best, no matter who we are, what we do or where we do it. So, whoever you are, wherever you are, whatever your story, we'd love to hear from you.
 
Our Data Analyst Apprenticeship Programme spans across the Legal & General Divisions. Successful applicants will join one of the following business areas and develop their data skills there. While all of these teams have different areas of focus, they all provide the opportunity for apprentices to work on a wide variety of projects and learn from data experts. The teams all strive to use data to support planning, decision making and drive great customer outcomes to deliver safe, secure, and innovative data solutions to drive sustainable value for a competitive and modern L&G.
 
Group Data Science -
 
This team works across all aspects of the Group to create data visualisations, insightful analytics and predictive models to support informed business decision making and assess commercial performance
 
HRâ€™s People Data & Insight team -
 
This team is part of the Group HR function. They work to enable L&G to use people data for good and people analytics as a competitive advantage. The team covers consulting, scoping and prioritisation of work, data engineering, development of products and solutions, modelling and insights.
 
Group Risk -
 
This team works closely with the different businesses to monitor, manage and control group-wide risks. They take data from the core risk systems to build data solutions and intuitive dashboards for our executives, board members and businesses to glean insight on how our businesses are operating and find areas to improve our resilience and operational effectiveness.
 
Retail Operational Planning -
 
This team handles complex and varied data/analysis requests from stakeholders across Retail Operational. Theyâ€™re responsible for the development, build and roll out of new reports as required by stakeholders. Co-ordination, running and maintenance of systems, existing reporting to ensure data integrity whilst meeting all governance requirements.
 
Great minds donâ€™t have to think alike, so we welcome voices from all backgrounds. Bringing together people with different life experiences helps us build empathy with our customers and drive innovation.
 
We donâ€™t just talk about it, we actively promote diversity and equitable opportunities for all. That means our employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status. In fact, we embrace every dimension of diversity to reflect the customers and communities we serve.
 
We think itâ€™s important to create an inclusive environment where we can all belong, contribute and drive progress, where you can develop and grow, and be empowered. We want you to use your voice to help us build a better tomorrow.
 
We all work differently, and have different needs, which is why. weâ€™re always open to discussing flexible working arrangements. Likewise, weâ€™re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs during our recruiting process.
 
So whoever you are, wherever you are, whatever your story, we'd love to hear from you.
 
We believe that good businesses are built on doing the right thing and strive to do what is best for both our people and our customers. This means enabling you to bring your best self to work by giving you what you need, when you need it.
 
This is why weâ€™ve designed a process that puts you in control, because we recognise that your time is valuable. At each step, make sure you take time to pause and reflect before progressing to the next, as each subsequent step will ask for a bit more of your time.
 
 
We want you to feel comfortable that this process is as fair and inclusive as possible, so please let us know if you have an illness or disability that you think may affect your performance during the process, so that reasonable adjustments can be made.
 
At each step weâ€™ll give more information and clear instructions on what actions you need to take and how you can prepare. Youâ€™ll be assessed at each of these steps.
 
In brief, our assessment stages process will include:
 
CV Application:
 
This will be reviewed to ensure you meet the basic requirements for the role, we do not require work experience for entry level roles and understand that C.Vs may not have huge amounts of detail at this stage of your career
 
Video Interview:
 
This will take approximately 20minutes, we will ask some questions that will help us understand your motivation for L&G and the Apprenticeship we are offering
 
Assessment Centre:
 
Comprised of a competency-based interview, group activity and an individual work based activity
 
Provisional Offer subject to enrolment:
 
If you are successful in the assessment centre, you'll receive a provisional job offer, the final step will be for you to enrol on the training course. Once this is complete, we can officially offer you the job!
 
Please note that we are recruiting on a rolling basis for this role and therefore the position may close sooner than the advertised date. We would encourage you to apply as soon as possible so as not to miss out on this opportunity.
 
The start date for the programme will be September 2023.
 
For any queries, please contact futuretalentrecruitment.landg.com. Please noteâ€¯weâ€¯are unable to accept email applications.

job_desc:
The Government Internal Audit Agency (GIAA) provides an invaluable Internal audit service, delivering a large programme of annual risk-based assurance reviews across a wide range of government departments, including 14 main departments and most of their related armâ€™s length bodies. Supporting our customers to meet their objectives, roles at this level present a fascinating and stimulating challenge.
 
GIAA has the ambition to be a leader in the use of data analytics in internal audit and counter fraud and investigation. This role is to be a specialist in the application of data analytics in our data analytics team. You will develop and run scripts using R and Python to conduct data analytics and present findings through impactful visual formats.

You will support auditors and investigators to use software tools such as Power BI and IDEA, to prepare data, run advanced analysis and report this to internal audit colleagues and customers. You will provide training and support to increase data analytics capabilities across the organisation. You will use data analytics to analyse GIAA organisational data to provide insightful management information.

You will work with data specialists across government, in the private sector, and support research and development activities to learn the latest innovative techniques in data analytics. You will apply these to GIAA activities to improve the efficiency of the organisation.
 
 
 
Develop scripts and applications using R and Python to carry out advanced data analytics to support internal audit and counter fraud and investigation activities
 
Produce reports detailing outputs and graphical representations of data analysis for GIAA colleagues and customers
 
Maintain, collaborate, and share code using tools such as DevOps and Docker
 
Collaborate with other data analytics specialists across government and the private sector to develop new approaches to data analytics suitable for internal audit and counter fraud and investigation activities
 
Lead activities to mentor and coach members of the GIAA data analytics network, and promote the benefits and use of data analytics across the agency
 


What are we like as an employer?

To hear first-hand how our people feel about working here please watch the video on www.GIAA.gov.uk. We strive to be an Agency where people feel valued for the breadth of experience they bring, and where continued development is encouraged, supported by a comprehensive learning & development offer and career pathways. In addition, we value work-life balance and offer hybrid working along with a flexi-time option and alternative working patterns.

We look forward to receiving your application.

Some of the Benefits our people love!
 
 
 
Competitive salaries and in-year rewards
 
Flexible working
 
A Civil Service Pension with an average employer contribution of 27%
 
Discount on big brands
 
Volunteering days
 
Season Ticket Loan and Cycle to Work Schemes
 
Free eyesight tests
 
Family-friendly HR policies
 
25 daysâ€™ annual leave increasing by one day per year of service to 30 days after 5 yearsâ€™ service
 
Geographically based Agency
 


If you need any reasonable adjustments to take part in the selection process, please tell us about this in your online application form, or speak to the recruitment team at GIAARecruitment@giaa.gov.uk

Our recruitment process is underpinned by the principle of appointment based on fair and open competition and appointment on merit, as outlined in the Civil Service Commissionersâ€™ Recruitment Principles. If you feel your application has not been treated in accordance with these principles and you wish to make a complaint, you should in the first instance contact HMT by email.

If you are not satisfied with the response you receive, you can contact the Civil Service Commission, which regulates all Civil Service recruitment.

Binance is the global blockchain company behind the worldâ€™s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

About Binance Accelerator Programme
 
Binance Accelerator Programme is a concise 3 - 6 months programme designed to have an immersive experience in the rapidly expanding Web3 space. You will be given the opportunity to experience life at Binance and understand what goes on behind the scenes of the worldsâ€™ leading blockchain ecosystem. Alongside your job, there will also be a focus on networking and development, which will expand your professional network and build transferable skills to propel you forward in your career.

Current students, fresh graduates, and candidates who are mid-career switchers.

job_desc:
Kharon is a highly disruptive and incredibly innovative organization that navigates risk at the intersection of global security threats + international commerce.
 
 
What does that mean? Great question.
 
We take
 
really complex data
 
as it relates to global security and empower our clients to not only understand the risk associated with their potential business relationships but to operationalize that data so that they can make the best and most informed decisions possible. From financial crimes and sanctions to export controls and threat identifications, our tools optimize protection against the types of security threats that could otherwise be incredibly dangerous and excessively costly to any business. Serving many of todayâ€™s leading global financial and multinational institutions, Kharon products are the most powerful in the space with a precision and depth that is absolutely unparalleled. Full stop.
 
 
When you look at any major global crisis event, weâ€™re providing information thatâ€™s at the heart of those circumstances. We connect the dots in a way thatâ€™s meaningful. This year in particular, weâ€™re experiencing unprecedented growth. The impact of recent global events, especially, has resulted in heightened demand for our products and services which is why weâ€™re looking for our next Data Scientist, particularly in the GMT time zone or West Europe!
 
Data science is what propels our ability to
 
do what we do
. It fuels our decision making, drives our business outcomes, and enables us to improve our processes as we build scalable systems that power our products. Because of this, itâ€™s time to expand our small but mighty Data Science team so that we can continue to support our incredible growth! Pivotal to our success, this is a role that will require you to analyze datasets, both structured and unstructured, to quantify risk exposure. Responsible for accessing and cleaning these datasets (of various formats, size, and complexity), youâ€™ll extract key insights and deliver those in a way that empowers us to make the most informed and data-driven decisions possible.
 
 
Leaning on your computational, analytical, and statistical expertise, the insights you draw will support our product optimization, predictive analytics, and decision-making speed. Not only identifying the risks but creating and implementing the solutions, youâ€™ll work cross-functionally to collect, possess, analyze, and interpret large amounts of data that inform our choices. It should be noted that your understanding of data visualization techniques should be
 
strong
. Working closely with our Technology, Engineering, and Data teams, you will implement data pipelines and machine learning solutions that solve complex problems, while writing well-designed, maintainable, and testable code.
 
 
While we are considering all applications, you will most likely find success if you have 1-3 years of experience under your belt and a strong understanding of statistics and machine learning methods ( including linear and nonlinear models, hypothesis testing, and Bayesian approaches). Experience working with the Python data stack, including data cleaning, analysis, and visualization will be required knowledge in your day-to-day work as well as an understanding of data querying languages such as SQL. If you have familiarity with or interest in global security threats and other issues impacting commerce and finance, that is only an added bonus!
 
 
The person filling this role must be located
 
in the GMT time zone or West Europe
, as youâ€™ll be working closely with our team in those areas. Unfortunately, we will not consider applications outside of those regions at this time.
 
 
To better break down the position, hereâ€™s a bulleted list of what you could most closely expect your day-to-day responsibilities looking like:
 
 
Accessing and cleaning datasets in all shapes and sizes, including large-scale tabular data, knowledge graphs, and complex text corpora.
Producing and maintaining analyses, reports, and visualizations to discover and explain valuable insights.
Implementing data pipelines and Machine Learning solutions to solve complex problems while writing well-designed, maintainable, and testable code.
Collaborating with backend engineers for the development, deployment, scaling, and maintenance of the data systems and services you build.
Closely working with product and other subject matter experts to understand problems and design original solutions.


 
Consider yourself a leading candidate if you have experience with or an understanding of:
 
Natural Language Processing;
Graph Theory, Statistical Analysis of Networks, and Graph ML;
Graph Databases or Semantic Knowledge Graphs;
Big data technologies like Spark and Databricks;
Container-based deployment experience using Docker and Kubernetes;


 
So, thatâ€™s the role and to the right person, this will be the perfect kind of challenge. Our mission is compelling, our product is powerful and weâ€™re growing at a rate that makes us unstoppable. If youâ€™re looking to be surrounded by people who will inspire you to think and challenge you to grow then look no further! Our team is made up of some of the most visionary and uncompromising individuals you will ever meet. We donâ€™t take ourselves seriously but weâ€™re serious about the work we do and there is absolutely no slowing us down!
 
 
To keep that momentum going, we do our very best to make sure that each and every team member is completely taken care of. From generous time off and fully paid medical plans to daily catered lunches and full-loaded break rooms, weâ€™re nothing without our people so we provide benefits and perks that reflect that. You can count onâ€¦
 
 
 
All the equipment you need to be successful in your role, including a MacBook Pro.
 
Fully remote environment (HQ is in Los Angeles, California. Hubs are in Washington D.C., New York, and London)
Generous paid holiday, including paid bank and public holidays.
 
Fully sponsored health benefits
 
Various retirement packages
Fully catered lunches in the London office


 
We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. provides continuous glucose monitoring technology to help patients and their clinicians better manage diabetes. Since our inception, we have focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions for people with diabetes - while empowering our community to take control of diabetes.

The Dexcom Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems are aimed at people with diabetes who need to monitor their sugar levels. Our Dexcom CGM system consists of a sensor, inserted under the skin to measure the level of glucose in the interstitial fluid (fluid in the tissue), eliminating the need for fingersticks. Our Dexcom CGM Systems have customisable alerts to warn users of dangerous glucose levels, even while they are asleep.
 
We are looking for a Data Science intern for up to 6 months, commencing May / June 2023 (You must have completed your studies when you start your internship). You will be based in the UK and must have the Right to Work in the UK. You will be a key contributor to Dexcomâ€™s core Data Science Team, collaborating to serve as the center of a best-in-class data science capability that augments and applies the whole of Dexcomâ€™s data assets to drive value creation across the business, develop innovative data products, and enable a tailored Dexcom experience for all of our customers.

You will be working with the latest big data technologies and cloud computing platforms to query real-world data for commercial and clinical insights, support ad hoc data requests, develop ingestion pipelines for data modeling, and operationalize predictive model pipelines in a collaborative environment.

Possibility for internship to become permanent after the initial 6 months.

Due to existing partnerships with some universities, students currently studying a BSc (in a technical field such as data science, computer science, computer programming, information technology, or similar) from these universities are preferred: University of Edinburgh, Imperial College London, UCL (University College London), University of Leeds

Sign up and watch our recording from last year, to give you a real flavour of what to expect during your internship with us: https://dexcomconnections.com/
 
Your main responsibilities will be to:
 
 
 
Work under the guidance of Data Science mentor to write data ingestion pipelines, perform ad hoc analytics, operationalize model pipelines, and communicate results to data science team.
 
 
Use techniques from statistical analysis and predictive modeling to build knowledge of Dexcom products, processes, and customers.
 
 
Query and analyze data in support of existing apps and other products in commercial use.
 
 
Support stakeholders across the business by executing advanced forms of analytics on diabetes-centric and other Dexcom data.
 
 
Work with team under agile development methods.
 
 
Munge, clean and interpret raw data into analysis-ready data sets.
 
 
Perform high quality research in collaboration with other functional teams at Dexcom into the patterns and properties of diabetes centric data from the individual to population scale to inform product, digital services and business development.
 
 
Document code in shared repositories and communicates project results to department on completion of program.
 


To perform this job successfully, you must be able to perform each essential duty to a satisfactory standard. The successful candidate will have:
 
 
 
BSc qualification in a technical field such as data science, computer science, computer programming, information technology, or similar, which will conclude prior to starting the internship.
 
 
Typically requires 1-2 years of related experience (desirable)
 
 
Familiarity working with high level programming languages (Python, SQL), databases, distributed computing platforms and their query interfaces.
 
 
Familiarity with algorithms, the mathematical methods used to extract information from data, and with visualization software and techniques.
 
 
Knowledge of statistical methods & good understanding of database systems .
 
 
Demonstrated track record of collaboration.
 
 
Ability to conduct independent research, motivated by hard technical challenges and results-driven.
 
 
Excellent written and verbal communications skills, with a proven ability to translate complex methodologies and analytical results to business insights.
 


 
 
Experience working with GCP BigQuery, Jupyter Notebook (or Jupyter Lab)
 
 
Experience in continuous glucose monitoring and related data
 


 
 
0-5%
 


Dexcom Offers / Why Dexcom?
 
 
 
A front row seat to life changing CGM technology. Learn about our brave #dexcomwarriors community .
 
 
A full and comprehensive benefits program, once you are a permanent employee.
 
 
Growth opportunities on a global scale.
 
 
Access to career development through in-house learning programs and/or qualified tuition reimbursement.
 
 
An exciting and innovative, industry-leading organization committed to our employees, customers, and the communities we serve.
 


The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The duties and responsibilities in this job description may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.

To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Dexcom. Only authorized staffing and recruiting agencies may use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes on specific requisitions. Dexcom does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to the Talent Acquisition team, Dexcom employees or any other company location. Dexcom is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

job_desc:
Weâ€™re looking for enthusiastic and passionate data scientists to join us here at GWI. Not just anyone though. Someone ambitious and genuine, who works best in the midst of a collaborative and forward-thinking team. Thatâ€™s because as a GWIer youâ€™ll be immersed in the fast-moving world of data tech. We
 
think big
 
to make an impact, weâ€™re not afraid to
 
ask why
, and we always
 
show respect
. Those values are what got us where we are today, and theyâ€™re a big part of what weâ€™re looking for in you.
 
About The Job
 
Our Data Science department at GWI is committed to maintaining the highest quality in our survey data and to helping our customers arrive at the insights they need to understand their audiences. From automated testing and intelligent product features to custom analytical solutions and data observability, we are supporting the business at every level as data is at the very core of what we do. We are actively engaged throughout the entire data life cycle including data cleaning, data processing, data validation, designing and automating data workflows, and investigating new trends and unexpected findings.

Our team values learning and keeping abreast of the latest research very highly and as a result weâ€™re applying a wide range of techniques across machine learning, statistics and natural language processing to the services and features we build. We are a diverse team with different backgrounds spread across two locations, Athens and London, and growing rapidly.
 
What Youâ€™ll Be Doing
 
There are a variety of data modelling tasks performed on our survey data necessary for extracting insights from our growing data assets. From forecasting forthcoming results, to constructing regressions and determining causalities between our different surveys, to understanding multi-scale clustering phenomena.

You will report directly to our VP of Data Science as well as working closely with the rest of Data Science, Engineering and Product leads on long-term initiatives.
 
About You
 
First things first, as a disruptor in the global market research industry, we havenâ€™t come this far without entrepreneurial spirit and a get-up-and-go attitude. So if you think weâ€™ll see that in you, then youâ€™re already halfway there. Hereâ€™s the rest of what weâ€™d like you to bring to the table.
 
Technical
 
This role requires someone with strong technical coding proficiency, who is confident working with large, complex datasets, with understanding of a range of contemporary statistical techniques.
 
The Essentials
 
 
Suitable educational qualifications in mathematical / computational / statistical sciences.
Excellent communication and presentation skills in English.
 
Familiarity working with high-dimensional categorical data, in particular panel and survey data
Experience with statistical methodologies including:
 
Hypothesis testing
Regression analysis
Correspondence analysis
Cluster analysis
Non-parametric statistics


Knowledge of the use of large language models for use in natural language processing.
High level of coding proficiency in a technical language.
A good understanding of the relevant software stacks for data analytics, statistics and machine learning.
 


Competencies
 
 
Gain a strong understanding of the business strategy and be able to apply it to your own projects.
Escalate any problems to senior leaders in a timely fashion, and ensure all projects are appropriately resourced and managed.
Enjoy working as part of a team, enjoy collaborating and spearhead open and honest communication.
You really enjoy working with others to establish and maintain collaborative relationships, you value all feedback and youâ€™re always eager to learn.
Working knowledge of delivery tools and other collaborative tools.
Familiarity with cloud data wrangling and data analytics services is beneficial.
 


Our Benefits
 
Great benefits make a big difference. Not just to employees, but to the whole vibe of a business. Thatâ€™s why when you work for us, youâ€™ll enjoy a full spectrum of generous perks, rewards and office benefits.
 
 
Competitive salary and discretionary bonus
25 days annual leave (prorated)
Hybrid working, flexitime and a great work-life balance (donâ€™t just take our word, check out Glassdoor)
 
Allocated shares according to GWIâ€™s share scheme
 
Work from Anywhere policy
A range of discounts and freebies
Accredited learning and development programs
Simplyhealth cash plan for everyday healthcare
Auto-enroll pension plan with GWI matching up to 4%
Cycle to work scheme and commuter season ticket loan
 
Commit a working day to charity each year
Early finishes on a Friday
A well-stocked fridge, plenty of snacks (some healthy, some not so healthy)
 
Regular social activities, including free online yoga and team outings
 


Who We Are
 
GWI was founded with the knowledge that understanding your audience is really important for business. When you know who youâ€™re speaking to and why, you can create content and campaigns that stand out to the people that matter.

Through our global online survey, we gather data on the behaviour and perceptions of consumers across the world. This provides businesses with deep, actionable insights on their audience, revealed from data they trust.
 
Diversity & Inclusion
 
Imagine if our data came from just one kind of person. Weâ€™d get a very nuanced view of the world. And we definitely wouldnâ€™t have got off the ground as a business.

Although things certainly arenâ€™t perfect, we live in a society where differences are increasingly celebrated â€“ so weâ€™d expect nothing else from our teams. In fact, the GWI office is as diverse as our global data, itâ€™s really important to us that it stays that way. This is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely and make your mark.

job_desc:
As a member of a team of Research Analysts focused on generating market and industry insights from demand-side methodologies, this role is responsible for the effective scoping and execution of primary research projects across various sectors of industry coverage and the creation of insights through quantitative analysis techniques.
 
The Research Analyst (Primary Research & Customer Insight) will coordinate and partner with industry analyst staff, clients, and research partners to develop quality survey instruments that produce high-value insights and be responsible for their successful execution and delivery.
 
The right candidate will take an integral role in the development of a new research panel that will be cultivated/managed as a community and designed to produce ongoing insights for new research services that deliver a pulse on the business and technical requirements of targeted industry sectors.
 
Participate in managing the on-going membership requirements of a growing research community, including:

Experience in market research and data analysis

Technology market experience is useful
Comfortable interacting with senior stakeholders at large customers

Employee experience is very important to us at Informa. On top of joining a supportive, diverse and ambitious team that welcomesall types of candidates.We are alsoflexiblewithdifferent working patternsandprioritize promotions internally. Our benefits include:
 
 
Learning and development plan to assist with your career development
25 days annual leave, 4 days for volunteering and a day off for your birthday!
Competitive Benefits
Work with high quality specialist products
Bright and friendly staff who are all â€œexpertâ€™s expertsâ€ and additional training and development for helping you achieve your career aspiration
Share-Match options - become a shareholder
Regular social events and networking opportunities


We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't fit all the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have most of the skills or experience we're looking for, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need! We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed.As such, Informa is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics.

job_desc:
Are you a forward-thinking undergraduate keen to apply your skills in an innovative environment where you are encouraged to act like an entrepreneur? Join our Intern Development Programme and see for yourself how it differs from any other. Could this be the next exciting step on your journey to your career? What else do I need to know?

Siemens recognise that building a diverse workforce is essential to the success of our business. We strongly encourage applications from a diverse talent pool and welcome the opportunity to discuss flexibility requirements and workplace adjustments with all applicants to encourage agile working, flexibility and innovation.

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Methods Analytics is currently recruiting for a Data Engineer to join our teamon a permanent basis. This role will require flexibility to travel to client sites, and is expected to be based in Sheffield or Bristol.
 
About Methods Analytics:
 
Methods Analytics exists to improve society by helping people make better decisions with data. Combining passionate people, sector-specific insight and technical excellence to provide our customers an end-to-end data service. We use a collaborative, creative and user centric approach data to do good and solve difficult problems. And ensure that our outputs are transparent, robust and transformative.
 
We value discussion and debate as part of our approach. We will question assumptions, ambition and process - but do so with respect and humility. We relish difficult problems, and overcome them with innovation, creativity and technical freedom to help us design optimum solutions. Ethics, privacy and quality are at the heart of our work and we will not sacrifice these for outcomes. We treat data with respect and use it only for the right purpose. Our people are positive, dedicated and relentless. Data is a vast topic, but we strive for interactions that are engaging, informative and fun in equal measure. But maintain a steely focus on outcomes and delivering quality products for our customers.
 
The Data Engineer will be:
 
 
Working with other members of the delivery team across a mix of large and small projects and be responsible for translating data into valuable insights that inform decisions for small to large transformation projects and programmes
Working with other members of the delivery team you will be responsible for identifying and using the most appropriate analytical techniques, developing fit-for-purpose, resilient, scalable and future-proof data services that meet user needs and design and write and iterate code from prototype to production-ready.
Communicating effectively across organisational, technical and political boundaries to understand the context and how to make complex and technical information and language simple and accessible for non-technical audiences.
Creating effective data visualisation, appropriate to the audience
Working with the Lead Data Engineer to support the growth and development of the team
Aware of, and keep up to date with advances in digital analytics tools and data manipulation products.
Collecting, collating, cleansing, synthesising and interpreting data to derive meaningful and actionable insights.
Understanding of how to expose data from systems (for example, through APIs), link data from multiple systems and deliver streaming services.
Producing data models and understand where to use different types of data models.
Provide training, support and mentoring to a team of Data Engineers and helping to grow the Engineering team
Ensuring that risks associated with deployment are adequately understood and documented.


 
Ideal Candidates will demonstrate:
 
 
Experience of creating PowerBI solutions and dashboards from row level data including data structure optimisation through to visualisation and dashboard creation.
Strong T-SQL Development including debugging & troubleshooting
Experience in SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Solid Relational Database design skills with an eye for performance optimisation
An ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications
Attention to detail and ability to QA own and other team member's work
Good experience with ETL
Infrastructure, Azure Data Factory/SSIS, SQL (On-prem/Cloud),
Good experience with Analytical/Reporting
SQL (On-prem/Cloud), Analysis Services/Tabular Data Model, Power BI/Tableau/T-SQL
Understanding of analytical tools; you are numerate.


 
Desirable Skills & Experience:
 
 
Experience with NoSQL type environments, Data Lakes, Lake-Houses (Cassandra, MongoDB or Neptune)
Have experience with Python, Scala or Java
Have cloud based experience, preferably with AWS and/or Azure
Knowledge of statistics principles necessary to interpret data and apply models. For example, knowledge of errors and confidence intervals to understand whether a relation seen in the data is real.
Exposure to high performing, low latency or large volume data systems (ie 1 billion+ records, terabyte size database)
Working within a continuous integration environment with automated builds, deployment and unit testing
Exposure to iterative/agile development methodologies such as SCRUM
Experience of working in a consultancy
Knowledge of Healthcare data, specifically NHS Data sources such as HES, SUS PbR


 
Methods Analytics is passionate about its people; we want our colleagues to develop the things they are good at and enjoy.
 
By joining us you can expect
 
 
Autonomy to develop and grow your skills and experience
Be part of exciting project work that is making a difference in society
Strong, inspiring, and thought-provoking leadership
A supportive and collaborative environment


 
As well as this, we offer:
 
Development access to LinkedIn Learning, a management development programme and training
Wellness 24/7 Confidential employee assistance programme
Social - office parties, pizza Friday and commitment to charitable causes
Time off 25 days a year
Pension Salary Exchange Scheme with 4% employer contribution and 5% employee contribution
Discretionary Company Bonus based on company and individual performance
Life Assurance of 4 times base salary
Private Medical Insurance which is non-contributory (spouse and dependants included)
Worldwide Travel Insurance which is non-contributory (spouse and dependants included)

And More:

Application architecture and reporting from underlying databases or APIs
Ability to present reports and information in a variety of ways
 
Experience of gathering user requirements and producing appropriate documentation/specifications


 
Why work for us
 
Balfour Beatty VINCI (BBV)
 
is responsible for designing and building part of the most exciting and challenging infrastructure project in Europe: HS2.
 
We are building the West Midlands section of HS2's Phase One route, spanning approximately 90km from Long Itchington in Warwickshire to the centre of Birmingham and on to Handsacre in Staffordshire. We will be employing thousands of people from the region to design and build the civil infrastructure for HS2 and we are looking for a wide range of skills to join the team and support this unique and ground breaking project.
 
Diversity and Inclusion:
 
We aim to be a leader in equality, diversity and inclusion by creating a safe inclusive working environment for all - living our values of Safety, Respect, Integrity and Leadership. We are positive and inclusive about making adjustments, providing flexible working, encouraging all staff to engage in a diverse range of year round learning opportunities and provide personal development opportunities. Our aim is to attract more people from diverse backgrounds to help us build on our inclusive culture.
 
Flexible working:
 
Flexible or agile working is encouraged at BBV and we recognise the value and diversity of candidates which this can bring to our business operations. Not every role can provide a variety of working patterns to suit people's personal needs however we are happy to discuss agile working opportunities at BBV with you.
 
Disability confident:
 
We care about being inclusive and that means we encourage applications from people with diverse set of backgrounds and experiences. BBV is Disability Confident committed and we welcome applications from candidates with a disability.
 
About Us
 
Balfour Beatty VINCI is a long established joint venture between two global leaders in the delivery of critical infrastructure. Working together for over 30 years, we have been successful in delivering a number of significant infrastructures; creating unrivalled expertise and capability across rail, highways and aviation sectors in the UK and beyond.
 
In 2008, we announced our formal alliance with the aim of delivering modern and innovative solutions to the UK's infrastructure needs. Since then, our collaboration has gone from strength to strength. We've successfully bid and delivered many key projects for Crossrail and Highways England Smart Motorways Programme. Balfour Beatty VINCI is a powerhouse for critical infrastructure.

title: Senior Manager, Mobile User Acquisition

job_desc:
About us
 
Innovation is fuelled by the power of possibilities. A few years ago, it was virtually impossible to innovate because building software needed a degree, it was simply too expensive, too complex, too risky and ultimately too inefficient. That's why only 16% of projects were ever done on budget and 78% failed.
 
We're changing that. We're flipping software development on its head and kicking out the notion that you need to be an expert or do boot camps to learn how to make your app. Builder.ai's platform lets you order the perfect software app for whatever problem you're trying to solve. Our AI powered assembly line brings together Lego-like reusable features and experts from around the world to bring world-class ideas to life - ANYONE's world-class ideas.
 
Building software needs to be like ordering pizza - pick what you want, get recommendations for the features you need and simply wait till it's cooked and ready for you.
 
Our human-assisted AI platform helps anyone build, run & scale tailor-made software. Everyone from the bakery in Riyadh and nursery in London, to large fortune 100 companies like the BBC or Pepsi.
 
Life at Builder.ai
At Builder.ai, we're looking for team players with a point of view, a sense of humility and a let's-get-stuff done attitude. We celebrate diversity and encourage everyone to do more with less, while creating and championing a culture that empowers everyone to experiment, push boundaries and learn by doing. Every Builder runs to our core value system of HEARTT (Heart, Entrepreneurship, Accountability, Respect, Trust & Transparency). Our scale-up is at the intersection of a quirky startup where designers and machine learning specialists work on problems together and savvy commercial teams working with finance folks to invent new business models.
 
Why We Need You and The Role
Our team is expanding and our business is growing stronger daily and so is the number of applications we manage. As an specialist in data, you act as a data-driven advisor for Product leaders and partner with them on strategic decisions to drive product offerings. You'll work on both new & existing product offerings to improve them. You'll work with people, educate the whole team about important product metrics, and perform rigorously statistical analyses & data deep dives.
 
This role is a mixture between data analysis & technical product manager role where your main objectives will be to come up with strong KPIs for every launch of a new feature for every single product and move into a full Technical Product Manager role in the near future.
 
Roles & Responsibilities
 
 
You'll perform quantitative analyses that translate data into actionable insights and provide analytical, data-driven decision-making support for key projects.
You'll provide reporting and performance monitoring to product teams using data drawn from diverse sources.
You'll own and evangelize data-driven experimentation in the team to improve the product offerings, and document it.
You'll enable product reviews, deep dives, and analyses through the effective use of data and communicate and report insights and recommendations to shape product strategy.
You'll ensure that any data required for carrying out the other responsibilities for the product/features you're working on is properly instrumented and logged.


 
Requirements
Key technical skills
 
Ability to write and run optimised SQL/PostgreSQL queries
Ability to present data in easily digestible manner
Knowledge of Qlik and ability to convert them into Data dashboards


 
Key Soft Skills
 
Curiosity to deep dive into the whys and whats of a data request
Ability to identify new patterns /inferences from the presented data
Ability to understand different data frameworks and deep dive into multiple database architecture to derive the query needed
Identify lead & lag indicators of any given product
Convert non-technical requirements to data requirements which would fetch the result
Strong communication and presentation skills
Ability to work across multiple functional teams & timezones


 
Requirements
 
Bachelor's degree in Math, Statistics, Comp Science, Engineering, or other technical field required; advanced degrees strongly preferred.
Comfortable manipulating, transforming, and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources.
2+ years' experience performing quantitative analysis, preferably for an Internet or technology company.
Strong hands-on experience with SQL.
Experience in reporting and dashboards involving very large datasets and multiple data sources, with the ability to interpret data and produce meaningful insights.
Good understanding of statistical analysis, data warehousing, data modeling.
Preferred experience BI/visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Qlikview, Google Analytics etc.
Ability to execute research projects and craft actionable recommendations.
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment, meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects.
Excellent organizational, communication, presentation and interpersonal skills.
Enjoys working in both individual and team settings.


 
Benefits
The best benefit of the role is working with an awesome team to build something unique, along with this you will also get:
 
Performance-based bonuses; paid quarterly
Stock options in a $100 million funded Series C scale-up company
Remote working, with occasional team days in one of our offices
24 days annual leave + bank holidays
Private medical & dental insurance provided by AXA
Access to our Perkbox
A "work from home" equipment allowance
The ability to work towards relevant industry certifications

product team. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing and building scalable and robust data pipelines and automate ML models and algorithms in a multi-functional Data Science Engineering product team. You can either be based in London or our headquarter Billund.

you
 
have
 
what

Description
 
The Role:

Charlotte believes that beauty is not an exclusive club and makeup is everyoneâ€™s secret weapon! She has decoded her expertise into essential makeup tricks, tips and tools that are EASY TO CHOOSE, EASY TO USE and IRRESISTIBLE, Charlotte is determined to revolutionise beauty.

At Charlotte Tilbury, we love what we do and strive to be the best. Dare to dream, make it happen, break all the rules - join us in our revolutionary journey and challenge the status quo of the beauty industry.
 
Benefits

At Charlotte Tilbury, our mission is to empower everybody in the world to be the most beautiful version of themselves.
