job_desc:
Job Reference #
 
267999BR
 
Job Type
 
Full Time
 
Your role
 
Are you an innovative thinker who enjoys building tools/ models to solve business problems? Are you confident at iteratively refining user requirements and building prototypes to advance their requirements along the way? Can you provide solutions that will solve business problems without over complication and unsupportable designs? Most importantly, do you appreciate the power of data and the business value that it brings to end users?
 
We are looking for someone like that who can:
 
 
 
assist the team with a broad set of analytics and visualization skills to build out analytics capabilities for Group Treasury (GT) and ALM ideally in Python
 
work on the existing Big Data environment primarily in Pyspark to synthesize large amounts of data
 
build new models/ tools as well as support and enhance existing
 
work to tight timelines and produce weekly deliveries. The team work in a production lab meaning refinements can happen quickly and a true agile working environment is expected from our stakeholders
 
collaborate with Group Treasury and ALM stakeholders to develop tools/ models and show results in Tableau
 


 
Your team
 
Group Treasury is responsible for the efficient management of UBS's financial resources and Asset and Liability Management (ALM) is a trading business that manages UBS's balance sheet portfolio risks. Together, they manage and optimize the Banks consumption of balance sheet capacity, capital, liquidity and funding and manage the risk exposure of the consolidated balance sheet.
 
Your team focuses on Group Treasury Quantitative modelling within the department applying statistical methods to add real business value. We are a team of Quants/ Data Scientists who build models in a production lab then successful prototypes are industrialized to comply with production standards within UBS. We have a close collaboration with IT Dev Ops who also support in the entire process and maintain/ enhance the production platform along with partnering closely with the Treasury business.
 
Your expertise
 
You have:
 
 
 
a Masterâ€™s degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline
 
numerical agility and ability to work with a large amount of data ideally experience in Pyspark/ scala (a willingness to learn Python/ Pyspark is a must)
 
strong analytical skills, mathematical fluency, and programming abilities and familiarity with some Data science libraries such as numPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras and ideally with the Databricks ecosystem for Big Data technologies
 
hands-on experience with big data analytics and working with unstructured data â€“ it is vital that the candidate can demonstrate their approach to analyzing and understanding data coming into the environment
 
good understanding of big data exploration, data modelling, predictive analytics and time series analysis using statistical methods (decision trees, regression techniques, pattern recognition, time series prediction etc.)
 
ability to explain, visualize and work with large volumes of data but explain in a concise and compelling, manner findings to a non-technical user
 
ideally some experience within a software development capacity with an appreciation for supportable and scalable code in a production-controlled environment
 
Tableau experience is a plus (or other UI) as is experience with Cloud computing (Azure/AWS)
 


 
You are:
 
 
 
willing to take care of the full lifecycle of gathering user requirements, prototyping, iterating through designs with users, testing, deploying and supporting finished tools/ models â€“ communicating with end users at all times
 
results driven with ability to work with agile teams across IT, Business Change , Business SMEs
 
strong team player who can contribute to data science and analytics community
 


 
About Us
 
UBS is the worldâ€™s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.
 
With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
 
Join us
 
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.
 
From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together weâ€™re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?
 
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
 
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

title: Research Data Scientist

job_desc:
Itâ€™s an exciting time to join one of our Early Careers programmes at QinetiQ. We are always looking for great people to join our team, whether you are taking your first steps in starting a career or you are looking to make a career change, we have a wide range of exciting opportunities for you.




About The Team




Data Analytics:




Our role is to ensure our customers gain the maximum advantage from their data. We are involved at all stages of the data lifecycle from the initial gathering & processing stage, through the analysis phase, leading to actionable outputs & advice.



Our aims are to ensure: that starting data is of the highest quality; that it is quickly and efficiently processed into clear, meaningful information; that we extract deeper insight from it; and that we provide robust, data-led advice and take sound, evidence-based actions.



We have a strong pedigree in data science, data analysis and data fusion. We are at the cutting edge for designing tools, software and automation techniques that enable the rapid and timely transfer of relevant data and information.




What will I be doing?




The Data Analytics teams within AMS consist of a mix of data scientists (exploring data sets and algorithms) and data engineers (building the infrastructure to capture and process the data) and many roles in between. Our daily work involves applying both conventional and novel machine learning techniques to customer problems as appropriate and can cover everything from numerical data to natural language processing and signals analysis through to imagery interpretation. Where necessary, we also collect or simulate data using mathematical models. We frequently work with colleagues from Human Behaviour, Autonomy and Applied Science and other areas to provide cross-domain insight and we are increasingly using deep neural net-based AI and cloud technologies (AWS/Nebula) to build solutions.



In this role you will gain practical experience in the data analytics process from data collection and data wrangling through to generating conclusions and results. This includes the exploration and visualisation of data to answer real-life questions. You will gain knowledge of statistical techniques such as supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms, develop programming skills in Python and for the Cloud, as well as general data analysis techniques. You will also gain experience in the soft skills of planning, technical report writing, and presentation.




Academic Requirements




You will need to have obtained or be studying towards at least a 2:2 in a degree with a key focus on any of the disciplines listed below:


 Computing / Data Science
 Mathematics
 Physics




Additional Requirements


Good understanding of statistics (statistical analysis) is beneficial
Experience in Python, cloud computing &/or machine learning is an advantage
Practical experience (including hobbies & academic projects) of analysis data / AI / Machine learning / neural networks / cloud technologies is beneficial
Please be aware that many roles within QinetiQ will be subject to both security and export control restrictions. These restrictions mean that factors including your nationality, any previous nationalities you have held, and your place of birth may limit those roles you can perform for the organisation. 
You must be prepared to go through the Government Vetting process, for further details please refer to United Kingdom Security Vetting - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk,




Location(s):


Farnborough, Hampshire, ENG
Malvern, Worcestershire, ENG




#ECG24JC




Why join QinetiQ?




As a global company of over 6,000 dedicated people providing technological and scientific expertise, we are excited to recruit the most talented and enthusiastic people to become key parts of our business. Our Early Careers programmes give you the opportunity to be at the heart of impactful projects.




Diversity and inclusion




In our unique working environment, teams from different backgrounds collaborate widely on some of the worldâ€™s most complex defence and security challenges. Whatever part you play, youâ€™ll get to experience what happens when we all share different perspectives, blend disciplines, and link technologies. Itâ€™s a diverse and inclusive environment where you can be authentic, feel valued and realise your full potential. Together, weâ€™ll explore new ways of protecting the world around us.




Your wellbeing




Looking after the health and wellbeing of our employees are our top priority. We offer a host of services designed to support your wellbeing. They range from our Thrive app and Employee Assistance Programme to Mental Health First Aiders. The wellbeing of our employees is critical to our collective and individual success.




Rewards And Benefits




We offer global career progression and the opportunity to work on a broad range of interesting projects along with a wide range of rewards and recognition. Our highly competitive salaries come with a raft of benefits, from a performance-based Employee Incentive Scheme to Thank Q, our global recognition scheme. Thereâ€™s also a Share Incentive Plan, Life Assurance and Benefits+, our flexible benefits package. Itâ€™s all designed to make life easier for you.




About QinetiQ




Being part of QinetiQ means being central to the safety and security of the world around us. Partnering with our customers, we help to save lives; reduce risks to society; and maintain the global infrastructure on which we all depend.



With a focus on protecting the world around us, we have a target to reduce our greenhouse gas emissions by 2025 and we are developing a global plan for net zero by March 2022. Being a responsible and sustainable business is at the heart of our identity.



Come and find out how you can play your part.

Work with Legal, Privacy and Data Security teams to ensure that CRM are fully compliant with GDPR and other relevant legislation for the capture, storage and use of customer data.

Strong understanding of data models, data transformations and identity management, who can work with technicians and subject experts to improve overall data management.

Â£51,500 - Â£56,500
 
Help shape the future of data in Macmillan! Join our expanding Engineering at Macmillan and help us deliver better services to support people living with cancer.
 
About the role
We're expanding our engineering function to form a new data engineering team.
 
Within this role, you'll solve the challenge of distributed data in Macmillan in a large-scale data transformation programme to give us a single source of truth.
 
You will help us create a Data Lake, build data pipelines to help extract data from various sources within the Macmillan tech stack and transform and maintain the data. You will assist with integration, consolidation, data cleansing and data structuring for use in analytics applications.
 
About you

Strong SQL skills.

Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Knowledge of programming languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) is a bonus.


 
Flexible location, flexible hours
We want every individual to feel empowered to bring their best to work, and that's why we offer flexibility in our working locations, working hours and benefits so we can support you in your life and career. We welcome a conversation about how these options can best support you.
 
 
We offer a range of flexible working patterns, such as compressed hours, e.g. 34.5 hours in 4 days instead of 5, and flexibility to work earlier or later around our core working hours of 10 am - 4 pm.
 
About us
Our values are at the heart of who we are and everything we do, inspiring our thinking and guiding our actions. We strive to build a more diverse organisation, where everyone feels empowered to be their best self to work.
 
We are striving to do everything we can to ensure that our workforce is representative of the people we support, and those who support us. We advocate for being an inclusive organisation, where everyone can feel that they belong and where there are no barriers to success.
 
Recruitment Process.

In order to ensure fairness and consistency to select the best candidate for this role, all of our applications are anonymised up until an interview has been confirmed so that shortlisting is based solely upon the suitability of the candidateâ€™s experience.

job_desc:
Company Description
 
 
At AECOM, weâ€™re delivering a better world.
 
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether itâ€™s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. Weâ€™re one global team â€“ 47,000 strong â€“ driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
 
 
About Digital @AECOM
 
 
As a member of the Europe digital consulting services team you will work with leaders from around the world to define and position the digital consulting services, to share best practices, to leverage global capabilities and to support global opportunities and projects. While services and solution management will be set globally, they will be tailored for implementation within the region and for each client.
 
Job Description
 
 
AECOMâ€™s
 
Data and Analytics Team are looking for a
 
Data Engineer
 
to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams.
 
The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
 
Key Responsibilities:

Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and regions.
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Showcasing proof points and case studies


Qualifications

We are looking for a candidate who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.

Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.

Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable â€˜big dataâ€™ data stores.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.


Attributes/skills:
 
 
 
Commitment to building a diverse and inclusive team
Self-starter with the ability to work as a positive, energized and adaptable team member
Highly developed written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and influence senior leaders
Extremely strong relationship building skills
Demonstrated ability to champion and drive ideas/programs/solutions
Excellent organizational and time management skills, able to work under pressure and prioritize effectively
Able to demonstrate passion, energy and drive, especially in the face of resistance


Additional Information
 
 
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and thereâ€™s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and youâ€™ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm â€“ access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
 
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. Weâ€™re the worldâ€™s trusted global infrastructure firm, and weâ€™re in this together â€“ your growth and success are ours too.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each personâ€™s potential, and weâ€™ll help you reach yours.
 
Join us and letâ€™s get started.

title: Junior SQL Developer

job_desc:
Tessian protects every businessâ€™s mission by securing the human layer ğŸ’«
 
We're building intelligent security that works for human beings
 
as they are
, not how security policies would like them to be. Using machine learning technology, Tessian automatically predicts and eliminates advanced threats on email caused by human error - like data exfiltration, accidental data loss, business email compromise and phishing attacks - with minimal disruption to employees' workflow. As a result, employees are empowered to do their best work, without security getting in their way. You can read more about Human Layer Security here.
 
Tessian has raised a $74m Series C led by renowned security investors, March Capital (Crowdstrike, Knowbe4), with follow-on from Sequoia, Accel, Balderton, Latitude, Okta, Sozo, Citi & Schroder Adveq, to further our mission to secure the human layer.
 
Founded in 2013, Tessian is backed by world-class venture capital investors, has hubs in London, San Francisco, Boston, and Austin, and London, and is one of the Top-3 2021 Best Places to Work for Women.
 
As a high-growth scale-up, our email datasets are growing at an exponential rate. This is a great problem to have as it allows us to train best-in-class machine learning models to prevent previously unpreventable data breaches. We have scaled to the point where there are so many emails flowing through our system that need more human eyes to understand some more advanced patterns and feed them back into our algorithms.
 
You will sit in our Threat Intelligence team and work day-to-day with Threat Analysts, Data Scientists and Engineers to build out the flow of identifying any weak points in our algorithms and coming up with ways - in collaboration with our data scientists - to detect these types of emails. You will also work with Sales Engineers, identifying a better flow to surface the value of what Tessian does to our customers, which requires you to deeply understand the product and the way our customers benefit from it.
 
We view this role as a hugely impactful, high-leverage role and strongly believe that if we can have a smooth and robust feedback flow from incoming emails to outgoing ideas that we can deliver more value to our clients through the data breaches we prevent.
 
Some interesting projects weâ€™re working on:
Building an advanced threat intelligence infrastructure
Training and Deploying advanced ML models on a combination of structured and unstructured (NLP) data.
Improving the deployment flow of algorithm changes to decrease time from idea to production
Automating reporting to surface product value to our customers
Designing the next generation data-lake setting ourselves up to handle massive future scale
 
Summary of day to day activities
Look at advanced email attacks and understand the underlying tactics used to try to bypass our systems
Label these emails to their correct categories to help the Algorithm teams to improve their ML Models
Take insights from these emails and leveraging our threat intelligence infrastructure to block similar threats in the future
Surfacing these ideas back to the Data Scientists so they can deploy more robust ways of blocking these tactics
Presenting to the wider company about threats weâ€™re seeing to keep them informed
Taking calls with customers using our product to understand and surface the value of Tessian
Improving the tooling for reporting this value back to customers
 
Qualifications:
Have basic+ Python knowledge and the ability to look at datasets in Python
Ideally have experience with distributed data systems such as Spark
Have a real hunger for learning and pushing Threat Intelligence around Email Security to the next level
Ideally have experience in the email security field
Ideally have some experience with Machine Learning systems
Has an ability to break down ambiguous problems into concrete, manageable components and think through optimal solutions
Enjoys â€œgetting their hands dirtyâ€ by digging into complex operations
Takes a high degree of ownership over their work
Is a clear communicator with professional presence
Has strong listening skills; open to input from other team members and departments
Has great attention to detail
 
Why we think you'll love it here ğŸ˜....
 
 
Itâ€™s important to us that all Tessians are part of the journey weâ€™re on, so we offer
 
equity options with every role
 
and benchmark to provide
 
above market rate salaries
 
- thereâ€™s plenty more tooâ€¦.
 
 
Be at your best, both inside and outside of work
 
 
â€¢ 25 days of paid holiday (plus 8 bank holidays,
 
and
 
an additional day for every year you've worked at Tessian!)
â€¢ Private health insurance provided through Vitality Health and mental health support through our Employee Assistance Program
â€¢ Up to 60 days of working abroad, limited to 30 days per trip a year
â€¢ Spill - employee mental health support through Slack
â€¢ Classpass - subsided access to gym time and classes all across London
â€¢ Choice First: Do your best work, in the way that works best for you
â€¢ Flexible working hours and working from home (if you're not already remote!)
â€¢ Enhanced pension contributions, matched up to 5%
â€¢ Weâ€™re family friendly, with policies built to support you in all stages of life
â€¢ High-quality tech kit provided for you to work on, plus Tessian ANC headphones
â€¢ If you're relocating to join the team, we'll provide a contribution to help with your costs
 
â€¢ Fertility support via Carrot covering adoption, surrogacy support, fertility treatments, support during pregnancy and more
 
Beyond work
 
 
â€¢ Elite membership of the Tessian House System...
â€¢ Every other Wednesday we get together to share team updates and drinks
â€¢ Monthly team socials & a big, whole company extravaganza every quarter
â€¢ Never-ending ping-pong tournaments
 
,,,and here are another 200 reasons!
 
Equality & diversity âš–ï¸
 
Our mission to empower and protect people is a reflection of two of our values: Human First and We Do the Right Thing. For us, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion is also a reflection of these core values.
 
 
As a human first company, we are committed to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment where all our Tessians have the opportunity to thrive. We strive for a better Tessian, and a better world. We're working inside and outside Tessian to improve diversity and equity in our industry, and foster an environment where everyone feels a sense of belonging.
 
Our strategy touches each part of a Tessianâ€™s life cycle, from applicant to employee, ensuring that we keep DEI at the core of every point in our candidate and employee experience. Read more about our DEI commitments here.
 
Obligatory small print
 
Please note that we do not accept applications or rÃ©sumÃ©s from recruiters. Any unsolicited CVs, profiles, or names, submitted in any format, by any channel, to any of our team, will be deemed to fall outside any terms and/or conditions with either the person submitting the information or their company of employment/representation.
 
By submitting your application to Tessian, you consent to Tessian retaining your information and contacting you about future job opportunities, that may be of interest, for up to 2 years in accordance with our Privacy Policy
 
Please note, that any job offers will be subject to the candidate passing background screening checks.
 
We're a #LI-Remote company offering Choice First working practices where possible.

GlobalData is a leading market research and analysis firm serving an extensive list of blue chip clients in the Consumer, Retail, Healthcare, Financial services and Technology industries on a global basis. We provide comprehensive, timely and accurate research reports and datasets to support cutting edge industry analysis and strategic planning. With 23 offices across Asia Pacific, EMEA, Latin and North America and over a 1,800 employees strategically located around the world, our mission is to build and maintain and unique desktop information services to help our clients decode the future to be more successful and innovative.
 
 
Our Databases and Analytics team within
 
GlobalData Healthcare, Pharma
 
is looking for an
 
Analyst
 
for Drugs databases, who has an interest, experience and passion for enhancing our databases for furthering the client experience. As an
 
Analyst
 
your key responsibilities will be to support comprehensive coverage, quality maintenance, and continuous enhancements of the Drugs databases.
 
What you will do:
Key responsibilities: Product Support

What you will bring to the table:

Excellent organizational skills

Company Description
 
 
At AECOM, weâ€™re delivering a better world.
 
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether itâ€™s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. Weâ€™re one global team â€“ 47,000 strong â€“ driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

About Digital @AECOM
 
 
As a member of the Europe digital consulting services team you will work with leaders from around the world to define and position the digital consulting services, to share best practices, to leverage global capabilities and to support global opportunities and projects. While services and solution management will be set globally, they will be tailored for implementation within the region and for each client.
 
Job Description
 
 
AECOMâ€™s
 
Data and Analytics Team are looking for a
 
Data Engineer
 
to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams.
 
The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.

Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and regions.
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Showcasing proof points and case studies


Qualifications

We are looking for a candidate who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.

Strong project management and organizational skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.

Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.


Attributes/skills:

Self-starter with the ability to work as a positive, energized and adaptable team member
Highly developed written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and influence senior leaders
Extremely strong relationship building skills
Demonstrated ability to champion and drive ideas/programs/solutions
Excellent organizational and time management skills, able to work under pressure and prioritize effectively
Able to demonstrate passion, energy and drive, especially in the face of resistance


Additional Information
 
 
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and thereâ€™s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and youâ€™ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm â€“ access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
 
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. Weâ€™re the worldâ€™s trusted global infrastructure firm, and weâ€™re in this together â€“ your growth and success are ours too.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each personâ€™s potential, and weâ€™ll help you reach yours.
 
Join us and letâ€™s get started.

job_desc:
Job Title: Data Analyst
Location: Hatfield, Hertfordshire
Permanent â€“ Full time
Salary: UH7 Â£35,333 pa to Â£38,592 with potential to progress to Â£42,155 pa on achieving designated skills and experience
Reference Number: 046297
 
The University of Hertfordshire is looking for a skilled and experienced Data Analyst to join our Insight Team on a full-time basis.
 
 
The Data Analyst plays a key role in analysing and visualising data to support key strategic decisions across a range of areas including course portfolio recruitment performance and potential applicant to student conversion activity, entry tariff and fee setting.
 
 
Working within the Marketing and Communications department, you will be proactive in identifying areas of growth for the University and provide professional marketing advice to a wide range of stakeholders including Student Recruitment, academic colleagues and directly to the office of the Vice Chancellor.
 
At the University of Hertfordshire, we are passionate about powering all of our students and staff to achieve their potential and you would be encouraged to explore new ideas and opportunities that would support the university strategy and grow our appeal to prospective students. Your development and training as a data analyst would also be strongly supported.
 
The University offers a range of employee benefits including generous annual leave and pension contribution, personal and professional development, and family-friendly policies.
 
Main duties and responsibilities
As a member of the Insight team, your key responsibility will not only be to report on existing trends and ongoing recruitment performance but to identify and evaluate opportunities.
 
 
To achieve this, you would be expected to be able to interpret and convert large complex data sets, using a range of methods and data transformation tools, create data visualisation, typically in Tableau, or equivalent software such as Power BI, and communicate key findings.
 
 
Most commonly, this would involve analysing data published by UCAS, HESA or our own admissions data.
 
Using historical data and trends analysis, you will also be asked to create forecasts and models on university applications and acceptances and summarise findings in easily digestible reports to inform Departmental or University policy and decision-making.
 
The Data Analyst would additionally undertake bespoke research and analyses in response to requests from the department
 
Skills and experience
 
You will have proven experience as a data analyst in another role, including understanding of different tools and techniques used in data transformation and data visualisation, ideally within a marketing context. At least some experience using Tableau, or equivalent software such as Power BI, is required.
 
 
You would be expected to bring a proactive and professional approach to working as a member of a team including the sharing of knowledge and expertise and taking ownership of areas of responsibility.
 
An understanding and knowledge of Higher Education would be desirable but is not essential.
 
 
Qualifications required
You will hold an undergraduate degree or equivalent qualification or have proven professional work experience.
 
Contact details/Informal enquires:
 
Informal enquiries can be sent to Aditi Rana (a.rana4@herts.ac.uk)
 
Our vision is to transform lives and UH is committed to Equality, Diversity and Inclusion and building a diverse community. We welcome applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of their protected characteristics.
 
 
We offer a range of employee benefits including generous annual leave and discounted Sports Village memberships, personal and professional development, and family-friendly policies.
 
 
Closing date: 23 February 2023.

job_desc:
Do you want to learn while you earn, a job that pays you while you train????
 
 
Do you enjoy working with data, and have a strong attention to detail?
 
 
Who are we??
 
 
For almost a decade Sparta Global have been designing careers, coaching future leaders, and promoting a more diverse and equal landscape within the tech industry across the UK. We work with over 100 public and private business, partnering to power both their short- and long-term business plans and technical projects, with the help of our Spartan Consultants. Our work has garnered us with over 10 awards across the ED&I and Training arenas and has positioned us a Top 20 Employer for Social Mobility.??
 
We want you to view your time at Sparta as an investment into your future, that pays dividends along the way. The longer you stay with Sparta the wider the breadth of experience you will have, along with increasing opportunities to develop and earn more. No two career paths look the same at Sparta.??
 
What's the Job?
 
 
 
As a Junior Data Engineer, you'll be designing, building, maintaining, and troubleshooting the data pipelines that enable organizations to store, process, and analyse their data, and ensuring the data is reliable through testing and debugging. Looking for efficiencies and optimising the data pipelines for scalability and performance will be a focus.
 
You'll be handling and working with large sets of structured and unstructured data and will be responsible for ensuring that the data is organized and available for data scientists and analysts to use.
Working with others is key, you could be working with other engineers, developers, data scientists, analysts and even stakeholders to understand their data needs.
 


 
We're not expecting you to be an expert right away - that's where our award-winning Academy comes in. We're experts in building skills and confidence in a fun and supportive environment that will not only challenge but develop you into a confident and capable consultant. All we ask for, when everything is over, is an invite to the gala dinner in your honour.??
 
What we're looking for?
 
 
To be successful in this role, you should have skills in either C#, Java, Python or similar. You will be passionate about technology and eager to learn and grow your skills.??'?
 
Professionalism - How you present yourself to the wider business is important to you, to be seen as a credible and reliable individual that can handle responsibility.??
 
Organisation and Time Management- Nothing gets past you; you know what you're doing when and why. You meet your deadlines, plan-ahead and can even get-ahead with tasks!??
 
Problem-Solvers - No challenge is too big, and you get a thrill from solving them creatively.??
 
Communication and Collaboration - You can always find the right words to say and are able to work with others effectively in cross functional teams.??
 
Curious and Passionate- You're naturally curious about why things are the way they are and stay on top of new technologies and programming languages.??
 
Why should you apply??
 
 
We value respect and kindness and look for individuals with a growth mind-set and a passion for learning. We see ourselves as a people-powered business with vision and purpose and take every opportunity to recognise and reward the hard work of our Spartans. This includes putting them forward for individual industry awards, including Rising Star of the Year, Rising Digital Hero, and specific awards around their skill specialism. We promote continuous learning and development with increasing earning potential for everyone who joins us.???
 
On top of that we can offer;??
 
 
21 days annual leave + bank holidays??
An extra day off for your birthday!???
Bonuses and structured pay rises???
% Penson Contribution???
Employee assistance program???
Vitality health insurance???
Discounted gym memberships???
Yearly budget for personal development??
Access to alumni and community networks???
An opportunity to work as a brand ambassador?


 
What do I need to have to apply???
 
 
We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from candidates from all backgrounds and levels of experience.??
 
To be eligible to apply, all you need is to...??
 
 
Be able to relocate as necessary throughout the UK for client projects??
Hold the full rights to work in the UK without sponsorship??


 
Please note, unfortunately we cannot accept applications from candidates who require visa sponsorship or are on a Visa that will require sponsorship after it expires. We also can only accept applications from candidates currently living and residing in the UK.???
 
Once you have applied, you will be contacted by a dedicated Talent Coordinator to provide careers advice an application support and guidance.?

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
London, UK /
 
Centre for Net Zero ğŸŒ â€“ Data /
 
Full-time
 
/ Hybrid
 
 
 
Centre for Net Zero (CNZ) is an impact-driven research unit established by Octopus Energy in 2021. We deliver pioneering research to make the future energy system a reality and work at the intersection of tech, energy and climate. Through our access to millions of Octopus Energy data sets and customers globally, we use field trials, experimentation and modelling to design a people-centred future energy system.
 
As an innovative and high growth global company, Octopus Energy has access to millions of progressive energy customers with billions of corresponding data points. This gives us unprecedented insight into the energy behaviours of tomorrow, today. We are also starting to see the genesis of open data, modelling and tools from the energy community that can be leveraged to build confidence in a better vision for the energy system. We believe that through transparent research, opening up data and building tools in a tech-first and modern way, we can work together to co-design the future energy system.
 
Our work this year will focus on building models and tools for academic researchers, grid operators and policy stakeholders (including building on open-source models). We will also run a series of real-world trials and experiments with subsets of the Octopus Energy customer base, collecting data that can inform behavioural insights based work.
 
Applicants should note that we are an autonomous team that sets our own research agenda. Whilst we work closely with Octopus Energy, we are a separate organisation that is part of the Octopus Energy group of companies.
 
About The Role
 
We are looking for a Data Engineer whose primary focus will be helping to build our modern data stack, and ensure other projects around the team are supported with tooling and applications that fit their needs. We want to ingest the latest data, and build robust, well-tested pipelines that give us confidence in our data modelling. You will have the autonomy to choose the right tools for the given use case, and maintain our architecture as we scale our research at Centre for Net Zero.
 
Experience working in energy is beneficial, but not necessary. Experience working at smaller organisations, such as a startup, is beneficial.
 
Our Data stack...
 
 
Python-based
Terraform - our infrastructure-as-code repo for GCP
Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Run, Cloud Storage, â€¦)
Prefect - data orchestration, ingestion and loading
Bigquery and dbt - data warehouse and transformation
Lightdash - data visualisation
Notion - documentation and knowledge hub


 
What You'll Need...
 
 
In-depth experience developing data pipelines/data platforms to solve real-world problems
Fluency in Python, SQL
Experience with Terraform
An understanding of the â€œmodern data stackâ€ (tools such as Airflow and dbt and Airflow)
A love for automation, building a tech stack that enables a variety of projects to be successful and deploying good, maintainable code
Experience setting up and working within a start-up like environment - including shaping ways of working as well as leading on technical knowledge sharing and tool selection
Experience working with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is heavily desirable, but other Cloud Platforms with Terraform are fine too.
Attention to detail and curiosity, with an eagerness to learn more about the energy industry


 
It would be great if you had an understand or interest in...
 
 
Making sure a data warehouse doesnâ€™t become a data swamp
Test-driven development
Open source modelling and communities
Clear documentation of processes, on Github and using tools like Notion
Deployment experience of a scalable modern-data stack on GCP at a startup
Experience of deploying serverless containerised applications in the cloud


 
If you are interested in the Centre for Net Zero please send us over your details along with a bit about you and why you're interested.
 
Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

job_desc:
Turtl is an exciting software company with more than 300 customers around the world and 120+ employees based in London, Boston and Ljubljana.
 
Our software enables anyone to create, personalize, publish and track digital documents - with no need for specialist design or coding skills. Turtl is used by businesses of all sizes, from small organizations to big names, such as Cisco, Nestle and Lexus. We think thereâ€™s huge potential for growth given the wide applicability of our software and the clear benefits weâ€™re hearing from customers.
 
Itâ€™s a fast-paced work environment, so weâ€™re looking for talented people who want to continuously learn and actively embrace challenges. Youâ€™ll find Turtl a straightforward and open place to work, where colleagues can be relied on to help.
If youâ€™re ready to take that next step in your career, then itâ€™s a great time to be joining the team!
 
LONDON
Our London office is located within Second Home, Spitalfields, a unique coworking space in the heart of East London's tech hub. With an open-plan space, ideal for collaborative working and networking, this is home to a broad range of teams including Marketing, Customer Success, Sales, Account Management, Finance, Legal and People teams. We have on-site cafe, rooftop terrace/bar, weekly wellness and cultural events, as well as fully stocked kitchens within the building.
 
THE ROLE
Reporting to the Data Acquisition Manager, and sitting within the Marketing Operations function, you will be responsible for collecting and updating information about prospects and customers and ensuring the data in the CRM is kept up to date. You will also have the opportunity to support other areas of the business on research related activities and special projects.
 
WHAT YOUâ€™LL DO

You will use research tools such as Zoominfo and Linkedin Navigator to find relevant personas and contacts to add to the CRM/Database.
You will maintain the CRM/Database to ensure contact information is complete and up-to-date, and that invalid records are removed.
You will provide accurate and timely reporting on your activity to meet challenging research targets.
You will uphold the values and cultural ethos of Turtl in all dealings internally and externally.


 
WHO YOU ARE
 
You are a great problem solver who can combine analytical capabilities and creative thinking to generate practical insights and solutions.
You are highly organised and can prioritize workload effectively and have excellent attention to detail.
You have strong communications skills, and are able to engage with people across multiple geographies, and at different levels.
You are a proficient user of Excel.
You have great research skills.
We are particularly keen to hear from ambitious candidates who are looking to progress further within our company as several others have done in this role.


 
BENEFITS
We offer a competitive base salary, share options within Turtl, plus up to 25 days of holidays (plus bank holidays), as well as a birthday day off. Funded by Turtl, youâ€™ll be enrolled in our workplace pension, life assurance and Perkbox schemes. We offer our employees a flexible approach to hybrid working where they can split their time between working from home and the office.
 
Turtl is an equal opportunity employer and are committed to growing a diverse workforce that represents all people regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity. job_desc:
Newcastle University is a great place to work, with excellent benefits . We have a generous holiday package; plus the opportunity to buy more, great pension schemes and a number of health and wellbeing initiatives to support you.
 
Salary: Research Assistant starting from Â£29,619 to Â£31,411 per annum
 
Research Associate starting from Â£32,348 to Â£34,308 per annum
 
Closing Date: 10 March 2023
 
 
The Role
 
 
Working alongside Prof Clare Bambra and Dr Courtney McNamara, you will design and conduct quantitative studies of health inequalities â€“ using UK and international survey data, routinely collected data, mortality and morbidity data.
 
You will be expected to manage large secondary datasets; undertake advanced quantitative analysis; meet project milestones; prepare papers and reports for publication; and disseminate findings to academics, policymakers and the public.
 
This is a full-time fixed term post available for 30 months.
 
Further information can be obtained by contacting clare.bambra@newcastle.ac.uk
 
Key Accountabilities
 
 
 
Conduct work related to the design, management and analysis of advanced quantitative social science and/or econometric and/or epidemiological studies related to health inequalities
 
 
Carry out research within agreed timelines, meeting project milestones and to an appropriate standard
 
 
Prepare papers for publication, and disseminate findings at academic, policy and public conferences/events as required
 
 
Manage large datasets
 
 
Work with local, national and international research and policy partners
 
 
Ensure that research activity and data is consistent with current research governance instructions and Data Protection legislation; ensure that research activity and data management meet the demands of new instructions and legislation as these come into effect and keep appropriate records
 
 
Attend meetings and other events appropriate to the projects
 
 
Assist with the preparation of grant applications
 
 
Identify and undertake a programme of professional development, including further training in research methods and other transferable skills.
 
 
Carry out administrative and teaching tasks and other duties to support the institute as required by line manager
 


 
 
The Person - Research Associate
 
 
Knowledge, Skills And Experience (Essential)
 
 
 
Experience of conducting advanced quantitative analysis using quantitative social sciences and/or econometric and/or epidemiological techniques
 
 
Evidence of carrying out research within agreed timelines, meeting project milestones and producing research to an appropriate standard
 
 
Ability to work independently and as part of the research project team
 
 
Evidence of potential to write for high quality peer reviewed publications and present findings at conferences
 
 
Evidence of skills in empirical research involving secondary data and using quantitative social science and/or econometric and/or epidemiological techniques
 
 
Evidence of skills in using relevant statistical modelling packages (such as SPSS and/or STATA and/or R) and the ability to undertake advanced modelling of health inequalities data
 
 
Experience of conducting research in the area of health inequalities and/or public health and/or social determinants of health
 


 
Knowledge, Skills And Experience (Desirable)
 
 
 
Interest in the teaching of health inequalities
 
 
Experience of research on methodological aspects of quantitative research
 
 
Experience of preparing research proposals and securing grant income
 


 
Attributes And Behaviours (Essential)
 
 
 
Ability to prioritise key tasks
 
 
Excellent organisational, communication and interpersonal skills
 
 
Ability to meet deadlines and to manage conflicting priorities
 
 
Ability to work flexibly and cooperatively with others
 
 
Commitment to own personal development
 


 
Qualifications (Essential)
 
 
 
PhD in a quantitative social science (e.g. economics or epidemiology or sociology or health sciences or social policy or human geography or a closely related subject)
 


 
Qualifications (Desirable)
 
 
 
Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. health economics, economics, epidemiology or sociology or health sciences or a closely related subject)
 


 
 
The Person - Research Assistant
 
 
Qualifications (Essential)
 
 
 
Good first degree (1st or 2:1) in quantitative social science (e.g. economics or epidemiology or sociology or health sciences or social policy or human geography or related quantitative discipline)
 
 
Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. economics or epidemiology or sociology or health sciences or psychology or epidemiology or a closely related subject)
 


 
Qualifications (Desirable)
 
 
 
Submitted PhD in a quantitative social science (e.g. economics or epidemiology or sociology or health sciences or social policy or human geography or a closely related subject)
 


 
Newcastle is an inclusive global University community where everyone is treated with dignity and respect. As a University of Sanctuary, we aim to provide a welcoming place of safety for all, offering opportunities to people fleeing violence and persecution.
 
We are committed to being a fully inclusive Global University which actively recruits, supports and retains colleagues from all sectors of society. We value diversity as well as celebrate, support and thrive on the contributions of all our employees and the communities they represent. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from everybody, regardless of race, sex, ethnicity, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital status/civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, as well as being open to flexible working practices.
 
The University holds a silver Athena SWAN award in recognition of our good employment practices for the advancement of gender equality. The University is also a member of the Euraxess initiative supporting researchers in Europe.

The individual should be able to understand the business needs and use a variety of modelling techniques to deliver strong sustainable growth, within risk appetite, and to ensure best outcomes for customers.

Work on the creation and deployment of best in class segmented credit models that are appropriate for unsecured consumer lending products
Work closely with the wider Analytics team to drive improvement to the overall value of the portfolio by adapting data sources, modeling strategies, cut-offs and application processes
Interact with external parties such as credit reference agencies
Produce written summary of analysis and recommendations and present those to senior technical or non-technical audiences
Produce MI in order to monitor the adequacy of models already in place
Alert the management team of any model degradation, propose and own remediation actions
Work closely with colleagues across the group to deliver projects and the change agenda


 
Who you are:
You will have a very strong, hands on background in Data science and Statistics, ideally from a lending institution, with knowledge of external data sources such as Credit Bureau data. You should be able to understand business needs and use a variety of modelling techniques to deliver strong sustainable growth, within risk appetite, and ensure best outcomes for customers.
 
What you'll need:
 
Experience:
 
 
 
Prior experience of modelling, data science, or decision science in the context of risk management within the financial services industry

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to convey complex concepts to non-technical members of the team

Extremely self-motivated and ability to operate independently


 
Qualifications:
 
 
 
Degree educated or equivalent in technical numerical field (e.g. statistics, mathematics, physics, operational research)


 
Whatâ€™s in it for you?
 
 
A competitive salary
Company bonus scheme - if the business does well, you should get rewarded for your hard work
25 days' annual leave, (plus bank holidays) increasing to 27 after two years service and 30 after five â€“ your balance stars from day 1 so donâ€™t delay and start planning your time off!
Company pension scheme â€“ we provide an enhanced pension scheme with generous employer contributions to set you up for the future which includes life cover of 4x your base salary

A strong ethos of equality, diversity, and inclusion
Wide business exposure, in terms of business disciplines, projects and stakeholders

Like what youâ€™ve heard? Great - apply now!

We will do all we can to make sure you are fully informed and excited by our story so we get to see the best from you. Following your application, we will want to learn more about you, your motivations, experiences, and values. In turn, you get to learn about our business, our culture, the role and what we can offer you.

Equal Opportunity Employer
 
At 118 118 Money we are passionate about equality, diversity, and inclusion. We are committed to being representative of different cultures, background, lifestyles, and groups, where everyone has an equal chance to succeed. DIVERSITY AT BABYLON

job_desc:
Verisk Maplecroft is a global risk intelligence company providing unparalleled insight into sustainability, resilience and ESG issues, underpinned by best-in-class geospatial data and analytics. Verisk Maplecroftâ€™s combination of expert insight and data-driven solutions enable multinational companies and investors to identify and successfully manage salient political, economic, human rights, and environmental risks.

As part of the Verisk Analytics family, we are aligned with the worldâ€™s leading data analytics organization. Together, we aim to give our clients the insight they need to make better, data-driven decisions through unrivaled analysis and advice.
 
About the role
 
Verisk Maplecroftâ€™s datasets are the core of the companyâ€™s offering and your numeracy skills and attention to detail will ensure that the datasets are delivered on time to clients with the highest level of accuracy. You will have the opportunity to be creative through supporting the development of new datasets with other members of the Analytics team. As someone with quantitative skills from your education or work experience, you will support colleagues in the wider Research and Consulting teams with client work and support the Sales team in helping clients to understand and use the companyâ€™s data. You will be based in Bath, Edinburgh or London and report to the Head of Country Data.
 
About the day-to-day responsibilities of the role
 
 
Support colleagues with updates and improvements to the companyâ€™s thematic datasets.
Supporting colleagues and clients with questions on these datasets in collaboration with the wider Analytics team.
Using your quantitative skills to help colleagues in Consulting deliver projects on time, on budget, that meet the clientsâ€™ needs.
Degree level (or equivalent) qualification in a subject with a quantitative element (required)
Strong Excel skills (required)
This is an entry-level role, so no work experience is required but it is preferred
Domain knowledge in one or several of human rights, politics, the environment, economics, or commodities is advantageous (preferred)
 


Verisk Maplecroftâ€™s data-driven approach to risk enables multinational organizations to understand how and where political, human rights and environmental risks impact their assets, investments, reputations and supply chains. We give our clients the tools to pinpoint and quantify their risk across 150+ issues for any location worldwide, and the expert analysis and advice they need to make better, risk-adjusted decisions that will improve the commercial performance, resilience and sustainability of their business. â€¯To learn more about â€¯please visit us at:â€¯www.maplecroft.comâ€¯ We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!

At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.

Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.

But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.

Itâ€™s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. Itâ€™s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. Itâ€™s the aim of our â€œreturnshipâ€ program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, itâ€™s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customersâ€™ problems.

At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.

At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to WorkÂ® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. Weâ€™ve been recognized by
 
Forbes
 
as a Worldâ€™s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Veriskâ€™s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Data and Insights Analyst
London. Hybrid working pattern.
Competitive Salary + Bonus & Benefits
 
 
Interested in using your business analytics knowledge to assist in the continued growth of an International business?
 
 
 
Markel International (MINT) are looking for a Data and Insights Analyst to join our Portfolio Development Solutions (PDS) team within our Wholesale Division. You will assist in providing valuable insights, solutions, services and operational improvements across MINT Wholesale through the use of data & insights. The core part of your role will be to improve and augment underwriting and claims enabling data driven decision making. It will also include creating business MI for the various other support functions. Activities include, but are not limited to, data analysis, automation of data flows, creating tooling and visualisation solutions.
 
 
 
The PDS team sits across all areas within the Wholesale business, which operates across London and Asian platforms. It is embedded within the underwriting business and is represented within the Wholesale Leadership Team. It concentrates on the areas that are key in achieving profitability and performance targets for a specialty lines insurer: Data and Insights, Portfolio Management and Pricing Model development.
 
The team provides support to the following
 
Divisions
 
within MINT Wholesale:
 
 
Marine & Energy
 
provides coverage for liability, hull, war, terrorism, specie, cargo risks, all aspects of upstream, midstream and downstream oil and gas activities as well as renewable energy.
Professional and Financial Risks (PFR) and Cyber
 
underwrites business worldwide and covers traditional and emerging professional indemnity, management liability, financial institutions, specialist risk areas such as patents and libel & slander, as well as many differing types of business and industry areas for cyber coverage.
Trade Credit, Political Risk and Surety (TCPRS)
 
underwrites a variety of trade and investment-related risks using expert knowledge of commercial counterparty and country risks across a wide range of trade sectors and geographies.
Equine
 
provides coverage for Bloodstock and Livestock risks worldwide.


 
 
What youâ€™ll be doing:
 
 
 
Develop business analytics solutions across all areas of the Wholesale division, supporting the Data, Analytics and Insights pillar in PDS.
Design and implement automated reporting solutions. Be an advocate for the utilisation of data to support decision making.
Develop strategic tools and practical insights to enable better underwriting and claims decisions that will augment existing processes.
Maintain and develop data models using industry standard coding.
Maintain and update business intelligence dashboards in Power BI.
Source new data and create conformed views of data in the PDS SQL server. Assist in database management and administration.
Represent the PDS team, as appropriate, providing accurate and timely management information to MINT leadership, wholesale leadership and meetings as the need arises.
Work with other functional areas including: actuarial, IT, finance, underwriting operations, legal and regulatory, compliance, credit control, reinsurance, delegated and underwriting support services to resolve issues and support the achievement of PDS and wholesale business priorities.


 
 
What weâ€™re looking for:
 
 
Business analytics: Experience creating business insights and automated reporting solutions. Be comfortable working with data visualisation programmes such as Power BI, Tableau or Qlik. Power BI is the tool used at Markel.
Experience of coding in DAX, Power Query (M-Language) and creating data models within Power BI preferred. DW experience with Kimball methodology a plus.
Database development: Be able to transform and summarise data in SQL. Knowledge of database maintenance and administration a plus.
Automation: Have a process improvement mentality. Have experience implementing process automation.
Excel: Possess a thorough understanding of Excel and be comfortable with manipulating, analysing and visualising large, complex data sets.
Have demonstrable experience in influencing and engaging with business partners using effective communication and interpersonal skills to acquire their consensus.
Organised with ability to multi-task.
Adaptable and comfortable with fast pace and shifting priorities.


 
About Markel:
 
 
Markel Corporation (NYSE â€“ MKL) a fortune 500 company with over 60 offices in 20+ countries, is a holding company for insurance, reinsurance, specialist advisory and investment operations around the world.
 
In each of our businesses, we seek to deliver innovative products and adaptable customer service so that we can be a market leader. Our time horizon is long-term, our approach is disciplined, and our focus is on continuously improving the quality of the customer experience.
 
 
Whatâ€™s in it for you?
 
 
 
A very competitive basic salary plus bonus & benefits.
25 daysâ€™ holiday plus Bank Holidays, with the opportunity to buy / sell extra leave.
Company matched pension scheme, private medical and dental cover, life assurance, travel insurance cover, income protection, Green car benefit scheme, a cycle2work scheme, season ticket loan, Employee Assistance Programme (EAP), parental, adoption and shared parental leave payâ€¦..and plenty more.
Voluntary benefits designed to suit your lifestyle â€“ from discounts and cash back on retail and socialising, to health & wellbeing, travel and technology.
Depending on the role there is the possibility of working from both the office and from home (hybrid) and flexible working requests are supported.
Youâ€™ll get the chance to follow your chosen career path anywhere within Markel.
Youâ€™ll be joining a global network of experienced, innovative and dedicated individuals across multiple teams and countries. There are countless opportunities to learn new skills and develop in your career, and weâ€™ll provide the support you need to do just that.


 
What we hope youâ€™ll do next:
 
 
Choose â€˜Apply nowâ€™ to fill out our short application, so that we can find out more about you.
 
Weâ€™re an equal opportunity employer, which means weâ€™ll consider all suitably qualified applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, ethnic origin, nationality, religion or beliefs, age, sexual orientation, disability status or any other protected characteristic.
 
We recruit and develop our people based on merit and their passion and weâ€™re committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
 
We are a Disability Confident Committed employer which means we want to ensure that you have a positive experience applying for a role at Markel and are able to perform at your best. If there are any adjustments we can reasonably make to ensure that the process is accessible for you at every stage please contact us on: rec@markel.com.

title: (NIMS) Junior Data Scientist

job_desc:
Working Hours:
 
Monday to Friday (37.5 hours per week)
 
Location:
 
Bath/Hybrid (working from our Bath office 3 times per week)
 
We are expanding our Digital Product Team with an Analyst, to assist with the end-to-end execution of experiment and CRO initiatives across our portfolio of websites.
 
 
The purpose of this role is to ensure our storefront and experimentation teams are provided with proactive and regular analysis and reporting to measure performance and act where appropriate.
 
 
You will help shape and influence the design and flow through the Lovehoney websites to support the optimisation of user experiences that are intuitive, engaging and provide value to the business. You will be assisting the team in the discovery, design, and development of a wide variety of products, features and journeys, including optimising page layouts, promotional devices, campaign pages, user self-service tools, loyalty engagement journeys and more.
 
 
Youâ€™ll be responsible for undertaking exploratory analysis to uncover new opportunities for optimisation, pre-launch analysis to support the prioritisation framework and reporting on the impact new code releases have on key metrics and user journeys for each website.
 
 
Youâ€™ll be a true advocate for the customer, putting your understanding of ecommerce, evidence gathering, statistical analysis and reporting to full use to help form best-in-class website features and functions that will improve the user experience and deliver on business objectives. Youâ€™ll thrive on seeing the value added by your work and will develop and hone your technical skills to have maximum commercial impact and relevance to the business.
 
 
To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be exceptional at providing clear actionable insight. Youâ€™ll love ecommerce, statistical analysis and customer behaviour and have a drive to continuously improve our performance to exceed targets.
 
 
If you love working with data, strive to improve business performance and have hands-on experience of experimentation within an ecommerce context then weâ€™d love to meet you.
 
 
Key Responsibilities
 
 
Regularly review and interrogate the Lovehoney analytical packages to identify emerging user struggles and to measure & report on the performance of newly deployed features and products
 
Gather and evaluate user feedback, transaction and clickstream data using tools such as GA, ContentSquare and Tableau in collaboration with UX, product managers and developers
 
Use familiar web analytics tools such as GA360, GA4, GTM and Contentsquare as well as develop bespoke analytics tools and data pipelines using SQL, Python and R
 
Help develop experiment plans and help shape the experiment roadmap
 
Deliver insights to Product Managers to inform their decisions and help them prioritise their backlog
 
Design effective experiments (A/B tests) with data driven hypotheses, calculating appropriate sample sizes & run times and ensure they are run in a scientifically valid way
 
Analyse experiment data when ready using techniques such as Bayesian inference and Null-hypothesis t-testing
 
Report on results and test outcomes & keep stakeholders informed, producing clearly articulated summaries of research & testing activities for relevant business stakeholders and the wider business.
 
Collaborate with our Digital Analytics Implementation Team and Data Teams to help define what we need to measure on our sites to quantify the successes & failures of product features & initiatives
 
Ad-hoc exploratory analysis of user journeys
 
Create dashboards in R, Tableau and Google Data Studio to present data drawn from multiple sources in a meaningful
 
Set up and run data pipelines alongside our BI team, connecting data sources as required for analysis and monitoring
 
Assist in improving our processes and tooling to enhance our testing & analytics capabilities.
 
Advise teams on the right metrics to use when setting up experiments and the right way to retrieve those metrics from our data sets during the evaluation phase.
 
Seek to challenge stakeholders to drive accountability and ownership.
 
Work closely with our Data/BI and Commercial Insights teams
 
Deliver ongoing support to product teams to assist them at every stage of the experiment lifecycle, from helping them to decide on the right type of experiment to use, all the way through to making sure they reach the right conclusions when analysing the results.
 


 
Skills Knowledge and Expertise
 
 
A Statistics or Science degree (or similar qualification)
 
Curious and proactive with a strong attention to detail
 
1 - 2 years' experience working in a commercially driven team
 
Advanced in the use of Google Sheets or Excel
 
Experience in online retail analytics
 
Strong working knowledge of Google Analytics
 
SQL, Python, ETL Systems and R for data analysis
 
Experience with BigQuery and Tableau or similar visualisation tools.
 
Technical experience of analytical tracking, website tagging and creating intricate funnels.
 
Experience of A/B/n and Multivariate Testing including a solid understanding of Bayesian & Frequentist statistical approaches
 
Knowledge & experience with R (ideally including the Tidyverse), SQL and Excel in an experiment analysis context
 
Be an expert at data storytelling with the ability to distil complex quantitative and qualitative data down to key insights and present actionable recommendations in an accessible and coherent way
 
Work with the wider analytics teams to ensure we have the correct instrumentation in place to answer business questions. For example, working with the GTM team to support the definition and briefing of site analytics tracking improvements
 
Strong interest in Digital and/or Agile Product Development
 
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, changing environment
 
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.
 


 
Benefits
 
Besides the opportunity to join our talented workforce (and amazing team - if we do say so ourselves) we offer a wide variety of benefits including a competitive salary, pension scheme, health cash plan, generous staff discounts, gym membership and a fantastic annual bonus scheme. You will also have the opportunity to work in our amazing new office in central Bath which is a stone's throw from Bath train station.
 
 
About Lovehoney
 
The Lovehoney Group is one of the world's leading companies in the sex toy market. Weâ€™re proud to promote sexual happiness and empowerment through design innovation, research development and great customer service. After an exciting 2021 merger bringing together Lovehoney, Amorana and WOW Tech, weâ€™re stronger than ever in our mission to destigmatize sexuality and help more people to enjoy a fulfilling love life.
 
 
Our award-winning, globally recognized brands include Fifty Shades of Grey, Happy Rabbit, Womanizer and We-Vibe. With over 700 employees spread over our offices in Bath and Berlin and all over the world, the Lovehoney Group is a market leader in the pleasure industry.

THG is a fast-moving, global technology business that specialises in taking brands direct to consumers. Our world-class proprietary tech and infrastructure powers our extensive portfolio of beauty, nutrition and lifestyle brands and is now helping drive exponential growth of our clientsâ€™ brands globally.
Weâ€™re powered by a global team of over 10,000 ambitious people around the world. Our culture is fast-paced and entrepreneurial, itâ€™s this DNA that has supported our incredible growth.

Operational Excellence at THG delivers world-class Operations Transformation across the nutrition division and the wider group, identifying and implementing operational efficiencies and enabling global growth.

job_desc:
