job_desc:
Do you get excited when hearing about trademarks and brand protection news? YES?! So do we! At Corsearch, thereâ€™s no pushing trademark solutions and brand protection from our thoughts. Weâ€™re thinking about coined trademarks in the car, a detailed design search over lunch, counterfeits while sitting with the in-laws, and anti-piracy while working out.
 
We are a mission-led company, driven by a passion for making the world better and safer for our brand customers and their consumers. Itâ€™s what we do. And people come to Corsearch to be challenged, developed, supported, and valued.
 
 
 
 
âœ…The Role
Data is at the core of our business and the value we provide to our customers, and we are looking for a Strategic Data Analyst who can help leverage that data to provide strategic insight for the business. The role will work across all business units, and engage with leadership across multiple functions, to provide insight from our extensive data sets that can drive real business impact. The role will require a combination of technical and strategic capabilities to interrogate and present analysis to help support decision-making and identify opportunities for growth. This role is an exciting opportunity to drive real impact in a fast-growing, global technology business.
 
 
 
 
âœ…Responsibilities and Duties:
 
Support key strategic decision-making through analysis of the extensive datasets in our Trademark, Brand Protection and Content Protection solutions
Extract and analyze big data sets to provide insight on growth opportunities across the three business units based on market and customer information to support commercial effectiveness
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity
Interpret analyses to identify trends and insights that can support our continued growth and operational optimization
Add value to our current customer solutions by providing market insights based on our data to help inform customer strategy
Support decision making in Product Strategy through analysis of system data on market trends, customer usage, and other internal data sources
Provide analyses of big data sets to enhance the impact of our Thought Leadership content
Prepare reports for executive leadership that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources


 
 
 
 
âœ…Essential:
 
BSc. in Mathematics, Computer Science, or related subject
3+ yearsâ€™ experience in an analytical role working with Big Data
Proven analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information from multiple data sources
Strong SQL skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools
Experience working with Python
Excellent capabilities in Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent ability to present data analyses in a clear and compelling manner to senior leaders
title: Strategic Data Analyst

job_desc:
Position Purpose:
 
The Data Scientist role plays an integral role in decision-making at Stericycle Compliance Solutions. This individual is responsible for providing strategic recommendations grounded in data analysis and statistical models. A commitment to continuous improvement is critical as it will ensure the continued success of our data analytics initiatives which drive increased revenue, cost reduction, and customer retention.
 
 
Reporting/Analysis â€“ Develop and publish reporting and analytics as a result of tested hypotheses and provide user-friendly outputs for various departments (e.g., Sales, Marketing, and Executive leadership). Design reporting to provide insight into customer segments, campaign effectiveness, business initiatives, and the relationships.
 
Predictive analytics - Test business hypotheses across various departments to construct predictive models. Work in cross functional team to identify new hypotheses. Test sensitivity/impact of current and proposed business initiatives on various customer segments.
 
Data Model Management â€“ Set up experimental designs to answer business questions and opportunities. Continuously measure model effectiveness and performance against business KPIs. Regularly conduct data validations to ensure models remain relevant.
 
Business Management â€“ Participate in various business improvement activities and deep-dive initiatives adding insight where predictive analytics are required to forecast impact/results. Develop partnership with Information Systems to gain insight into upcoming data changes or new data availability.
 
Data Quality - Execute different data analytics to ensure the completeness, quality, and consistency of data used for analytics across systems. Works across departments to understand inputs and ensure reliability while providing feedback/recommendations to improve quality.
 
 
Performs other related duties as required or requested.
 
Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, mathematics, information systems, computer science, or economics. Masterâ€™s or PhD Degree in an analytics related field such as statis-tics is a plus.
 
 
Have strong statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling, or machine learning skills.
 
Two to four years of experience in working with large datasets, and relational databases (SQL).
 
Experiencing using Tableau, SAP, TM1, and Business Objects would be an asset
 
Experience using Microsoft Office applications, in particular, PowerPoint and Excel, is a requirement.
 
Ability to articulate and present complex data in a user-friendly format is critical to the success of this role.
 
Must have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
 
Must be subject matter expert with a passion for digging into any dataset by researching the relevant information on the subject to use the data effectively.
 
Comfortable and proficient in managing projects, including the use of Business Analyst skills.
 
Proficiency in Python (Pandas, NumPy) is a requirement, including strong data cleaning and manipulation skills.
 
Data visualisation using Python (Matplotlib/seaborn/plotly/bokeh), Tableau, and Excel.
 
Building production level machine learning models using Python (scikit-learn, TensorFlow/keras, flask).
 
Cloud computing (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
 
 
Certifications and/or Licenses:
 
 
The above description is meant to provide a summary of the nature and level of work being performed; it should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and requirements of the job. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise. Stericycle will consider requests for workplace accommodations for protected physical or mental limitations in accordance with its human resources policies and local laws. To the extent permissible under local law, and consistent with business necessity, Stericycle reserves the right to modify the content formally or informally, either verbally or in writing, at any time with or without advance notice.
title: Data Scientist

job_desc:
OUR ROLE
 
We're looking for someone from a technical background with some experience in applying data analysis to real world problems, either within a commercial or academic setting. We'd like you to be curious, engaged and willing to learn, with the aim of helping clients make better, insight-driven decisions. You'll help answer questions such as 'where should we locate our next stores?' or 'how should we segment our audience to optimize marketing messaging?'.

Joining the Decision Science team will provide you with the training and opportunities to acquire a range of skills:
 
 
Data Analytics: you'll be exposed to the entire ELT process, with a focus on getting your hands on the data and implementing models to answer commercial questions. In our team, we are using a variety of languages, such as SQL, Python, SaaS and Alteryx, depending on client needs.
 
Visualisation and storytelling: data on its own does not drive value, so we place a high importance on how we communicate our findings, also making sure that our dashboards are user-friendly and get the point across. You'll be learning Tableau / Power BI / other visualisation tools, as well as how to structure and deliver an effective PowerPoint presentation.
 
Business acumen: because our focus is delivering data-driven strategies for the best possible customer experience, we constantly take the commercial implications of our analysis into account. This, combined with client exposure will allow you to gain a good understanding of the marketing industry and businesses in general.
 


We work closely with the Data Science and Experience Science teams which makes it possible to move in either direction if you want to be more or less exposed to data / clients.

This is an excellent opportunity for a bright, ambitious individual to be part of the strongest Marketing Sciences team in the country. There is a lot to do, a lot to learn, a lot to create, but it will put you at the forefront of our discipline.
 
YOUR RESPONSIBILTIES
 
 
Build relevant analysis and models using Alteryx / SQL
Write data briefs and perform data extracts
Create effective visualisations and user-friendly Tableau dashboards to facilitate decision-making
Collate insights and add value to develop core strategic hypotheses for the client
Contribute to the Decision Science and wider Marketing Science team culture and ways of working
 


Skills And Experience
 
 
Excellent communication skills
Programming knowledge and some experience in applying it to real-world problems
Demonstrable passion for generating new ideas and insights
Imaginative, with a practical approach to problem solving
Capable of building good working relationships with clients and other team members across the company
Interest in consumer behaviour and marketing effectiveness
Conscientious, reliable, with a strong desire to learn and personal integrity. Curiosity is key!
 


SPEAKING UP ON RACISM AND DIVERSITY
 
At Code we take a strong stand against racism and any type of discrimination. Our mission has always drawn strength from diversity and welcomed people from every walk of life around the world. We are committed to creating an equitable work environment and leading progress forward on inclusion and diversity. We hope that you have the same position and will also attempt to bring positive change in this endeavour and to transform marketing.
 
LASTLY, BUT IMPORTANTLY
â€¦

What we need from you: jump in, find problems. Fix them and build relationships. Imagine new solutions, invent them and manage them. Do whatever it takes to go above and beyond. And stand up for individuality.
title: Junior Decision Scientist

job_desc:

Internal applicants are required to be in "good standing" in your current role, which is defined as a performance rating of Good Performance or higher. You cannot be on a current performance improvement plan or written warning for any reason and must have been in your current role for a minimum of 6 months, unless otherwise approved for an early transfer by your current leader and Human Resources.

Why work for us?

Our team exemplifies our values of putting clients first, acting like owners and succeeding as a team. Our culture is high-energy, collaborative, and forward-thinking with opportunities to grow in an exciting career. We invite you to consider joining our dynamic, global team!

What to expect when you join our firm

Excellent Health and Wellbeing benefits including corporate membership to ClassPass

Maternal/paternal leave benefits and family services
Complimentary subscription to Headspace â€“ the mindfulness app
All employee events including networking opportunities and social activities
Lunch allowance for use within our subsidized onsite canteen
 


Must have skills
 
 
Expertise in asset management process-related data, with the ability to fluently communicate with investment management business professionals to gather and understand requirements and solve problems
Significant data management experience within the asset management services sector (preferably in the buy side)
A proven team player with strong collaboration skills
Self-motivated, driven and solution-oriented mindset, with a proven track record of execution
Knowledge of data governance practices and processes
Strong analytical background
Experience working with business, operational data and technical teams to clearly document data governance and metadata requirements
Experienced in data governance approaches, practices and learnings in large financial organization(s)
Experience in contributing to business requirement documentation
Experience working with large data sets
 
Proficiency with MS Office suite and familiarity with tools such as Alteryx, SQL, Python, Power BI and other technologies that assist in manipulating and visualizing data
Bachelorâ€™s degree in mathematics, business administration, statistics, or computer science (or similar)
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Ability to build effective relationships at all levels of the business
Approachable and open minded
Strong analytical mindset
Enjoys problem solving
Proactive in establishing processes and the best ways of working
 


Nice to have skills
 
 
Knowledge and experience with some or all of the following data domains: corporate risk, corporate compliance, investment compliance, and front office asset management functions
Experience in a risk and/or compliance role is a plus
Some project management experience
Some experience of Informatica data governance tools would be beneficial
 


Supervisory responsibilities
 
 
No
 


Potential for growth
 
 
Mentoring
Leadership development programs
Regular training
Career development services
Continuing education courses
 


Janus Henderson (including its subsidiaries) will not maintain existing or sponsor new industry registrations or licenses where not supported by an employeeâ€™s job functions (as determined by Janus Henderson at its sole discretion).

All applicants must be willing to comply with the provisions of Janus Henderson Investment Advisory Code of Ethics related to personal securities activities and other disclosure and certification requirements, including past political contributions and political activities. Applicantsâ€™ past political contributions or activity may impact applicantsâ€™ eligibility for this position.
 
Janus Henderson is an equal opportunity /Affirmative Action employer.
 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. All applications are subject to background checks.
title: Data Steward

job_desc:
Job Title
: Data Analysts, Data Engineers, Data Scientists, BI Analysts, Decisioning Analysts
 
Location:
 
Edinburgh or Birmingham (Hybrid and flexible working)
 
Salary and Benefits:
 
Competitive plus bonus up to 16%, private medical cover, 38 days annual leave, excellent pension, 12x salary life assurance, career breaks, income protection, 3x volunteering days and much more
 
Closing Date:
 
03/03/2023
 
 
We have numerous openings and the opportunity to join us here at Phoenix Group as Data Analysts / Analytics Engineers to join our Group Data office.
 
We are looking for early career or career changers who are either out of university with a degree in data related subject or started to upskill themselves to establish a career in data. The aspiring analysts and engineers weâ€™re looking for will be naturally curious will have the opportunity to get exposure to several disciplines in the Group Data Office through involvement in multiple squads across the area.
 
Who are we?
 
 
We want to be the best place that any of our 8,000 colleagues have ever worked.
 
Weâ€™re the UKâ€™s largest long-term savings and retirement business. We offer our 13 million customers products across our market-leading brands, including Standard Life, SunLife and ReAssure, with c.Â£310 billion of assets under administration. Weâ€™re a FTSE 100 organisation that is tackling key issues such as transitioning our portfolio to net zero by 2050, and weâ€™re not done yet.
 
The Role
 
 
We are looking for analysts to support 4 key data functions in our Group Data Office: Data Engineering, BI, Data Science and Decisioning. During the interview we would together establish which area you would like to be aligned to. The Group Data Office came together in 2022 and is an extremely ambitious function that sits across the Phoenix group, works closely with stakeholders to leverage the value of data to drive business and customer benefits.
 
We are appreciative that people will develop in different ways and we want to support your progression by opening-up career pathways within the team. We will support your development by exposing you to various data disciplines, coaching and mentoring, training and upskilling.
 
 
 
Collect and analyse large datasets to identify trends and patterns

Create and maintain data pipelines for data analysis
 
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for key stakeholders
 
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders

What are we looking for?
 
 
 
 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Science, Applied Maths or a related field OR equivalent data courses/qualifications you have pursued
 
Some experience in data analysis or business intelligence
 
Some proficiency in SQL and Python
 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 
Good communication and presentation skills
 


 
 
 
Experience in pension industry or financial services is a plus
 
Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus
 
Familiarity with cloud-based data storage and processing platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.
 


 
The analysts that succeed in joining us will have the opportunity to work with a team of experienced analysts and learn from industry experts. The role offers a competitive salary and benefits package, and opportunities for growth and development within a leading UK financial services provider.
 
 
We are committed to ensuring that everyone feels accepted and welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If your experience looks different from what weâ€™ve advertised and you believe that you can bring value to the role, weâ€™d love to hear from you.
 
If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process, please let us know so we can help you to be at your best.
 
Find out more about #LifeAtPhoenix
 
 
Guide for Candidates: thephoenixgroup.pagetiger.com/guideforcandidates
 
Find or get answers from our colleagues: www.thephoenixgroup.com/careers/talk-to-us
title: Data Analysts

job_desc:
About The Role
 
Balfour Beatty Vinci has an exciting opportunity for an Data Analyst to join our team in Coleshill.

There has never been a more exciting time to join Balfour Beatty Vinci in the delivery of Europe's largest major infrastructure project.

We are currently looking to recruit an Data Analyst as part of our core team.
 
What We Can Offer You:
 
Joining the countries largest infrastructure project there are a whole host of opportunities to develop, progress and gain experience that will last a lifetime.

Our employees are at the heart of everything we do and as such we realise they are the reason we are able to achieve the performance expected from our clients.

In addition to a competitive base salary, we can also offer a wide range of benefits, including:
 
 
Company Pension scheme;
Share Scheme opportunities;
Competitive annual leave;
Company car/allowance;
Flexible Benefits;
Flexible Working.


What you'll be doing
 
 
Support BBV Data Model, including process and procedures for onward management and communication to the project team.
 
Resolving/directing issues logged with our central helpdesk regarding PowerBI
Map chosen and delivered systems to the data model.
Managing the model and interfaces into other systems "Common Coding"
Support processes in place for data lake ingestions and common coding feeds
Power platform and similar tools to support master data management and reporting solutions


Who we're looking for
 
 
 
Database development (SQL)
 
 
Application architecture and reporting from underlying databases or APIs
 
 
Ability to present reports and information in a variety of ways
 
 
Experience of gathering user requirements and producing appropriate documentation/specifications
 


Why work for us
 
Balfour Beatty VINCI (BBV)
 
is responsible for designing and building part of the most exciting and challenging infrastructure project in Europe: HS2.

We are building the West Midlands section of HS2's Phase One route, spanning approximately 90km from Long Itchington in Warwickshire to the centre of Birmingham and on to Handsacre in Staffordshire. We will be employing thousands of people from the region to design and build the civil infrastructure for HS2 and we are looking for a wide range of skills to join the team and support this unique and ground breaking project.
 
Diversity and Inclusion:
 
We aim to be a leader in equality, diversity and inclusion by creating a safe inclusive working environment for all - living our values of Safety, Respect, Integrity and Leadership. We are positive and inclusive about making adjustments, providing flexible working, encouraging all staff to engage in a diverse range of year round learning opportunities and provide personal development opportunities. Our aim is to attract more people from diverse backgrounds to help us build on our inclusive culture.
 
Flexible working:
 
Flexible or agile working is encouraged at BBV and we recognise the value and diversity of candidates which this can bring to our business operations. Not every role can provide a variety of working patterns to suit people's personal needs however we are happy to discuss agile working opportunities at BBV with you.
 
Disability confident:
 
We care about being inclusive and that means we encourage applications from people with diverse set of backgrounds and experiences. BBV is Disability Confident committed and we welcome applications from candidates with a disability.
 
About Us
 
Balfour Beatty VINCI is a long established joint venture between two global leaders in the delivery of critical infrastructure. Working together for over 30 years, we have been successful in delivering a number of significant infrastructures; creating unrivalled expertise and capability across rail, highways and aviation sectors in the UK and beyond.

In 2008, we announced our formal alliance with the aim of delivering modern and innovative solutions to the UK's infrastructure needs. Since then, our collaboration has gone from strength to strength. We've successfully bid and delivered many key projects for Crossrail and Highways England Smart Motorways Programme. Balfour Beatty VINCI is a powerhouse for critical infrastructure.

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Job Reference #
 
256919BR
 
Job Type
 
Full Time
 
Your role
 
Do you have proven experience in data visualisation and analytics solutions? Are you adept at data analytics, automation and visualisation? Are you interested in a new challenge in the Compliance space? We are looking for a Tableau Developer /Data Analytics Developer like you to:
 
 
 
prototype and develop innovative data analytics solutions and visualisation tools for Monitoring Surveillance & Control (MS&C) using data from our surveillance systems
 
perform application development for database core component.

provide the full application development life cycle service for MS&C, including specifications, prototypes, development, support, quality assurance and deployment
 
present findings to key stakeholders and work with our IT teams to bring solutions into production
 
work with SMEs across our Group Compliance and Regulatory Governance (GCRG) organization to analyse problems and propose technical solutions
 
collaborating with business representatives to understand requirements, value, prioritization and business intelligence needs
 


 
Your team
 
 
 
You'll be working in our Group Compliance and Regulatory Governance COO Data Analytics and Automation team, which is part of our Monitoring, Surveillance and Control (MS&C) Analytics, Automation & Platforms function in London. We are a positive-minded team of Data Analytics, Automation Engineers, Data Scientists and Business Analysts who are responsible for the design and delivery of new trade surveillance tools, analytics platforms, automation and visualisations for our client-across trade surveillance, eComms, AML transaction monitoring and conduct compliance functions and associated teams.
 
Diversity helps us grow, together. Thatâ€™s why we are committed to fostering and advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion. It strengthens our business and brings value to our clients.
 


 
Your expertise
 
 
 
Professional experience or a BS/BA degree in Computer science, Engineering, Data Science or related numerical field.
 
At least 2-3 years minimum of Practical development experience in programming languages such as Python, R, SQL or SAS
 
Exposure to designing, developing web app and BI solutions and implementing/supporting enterprise-level analytics solutions,

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 
Strong written & verbal communication in English and organization skills
 
Technical writing, documentation, and presentation skills
 
Hands on experience in data extraction, transformation, analysis and loading using ETL tools
 
Good understanding of cloud technology concepts or working experience in relational and dimensional data modelling
 
understanding of code versioning and associated tools (e.g. GitHub, Mercurial, Subversion)
 


 
About Us
 
UBS is the worldâ€™s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.
 
With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html
 
Join us
 
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.
 
From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together weâ€™re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?
 
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
 
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.
title: Data Analytics Developer

job_desc:
Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.
 
Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to authoritative figures in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.
 
Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our worldâ€™s toughest obstacles.
 
As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.
 
We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we strive to iterate in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth. Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.
 
Planet is a global company with employees working remotely world wide and joining us from offices in San Francisco, Washington DC, Germany, and The Netherlands.
 
 
An exciting opportunity to grow your data career has arisen in Planetâ€™s Business Insights team. We need someone who can move easily up and down the data chain. The objective of our growing team is to surface actionable data so the business can make strategic, data-based decisions. Because weâ€™re a young team, this will require you to be part business / data analyst, part data engineer & part report builder.
 
You will be working with origin, staged, and modeled data. Youâ€™ll need to manipulate large, complex data sets derived from a broad spectrum of systems. You should be able to demonstrate experience and knowledge of analysis and data engineering concepts, tools and techniques. The successful candidate should be able to articulate and present complex information and data clearly. To contextualize the data being processed, you should be able to liaise with subject matter experts. By maintaining high standards of data quality, reliability, and governance, you will deliver trusted metric packs which may be consumed directly or contribute to further, more complex analysis.
 
 
 
You should be able to turn complex information into clear facts helping internal consumers interpret data to take action
 
Perform ad hoc analysis
 
Self-starter and quick learner with excellent analytical skills
Always have the business in mind facilitating speed, accuracy, quality and a service attitude
 
Translate business requirements into functional specifications
Perform robust validation and triangulation of data
Design, develop & build data models and reports
Contribute to the signaling of process improvement


 
 
 
Advanced SQL knowledge
Good Git and DBT knowledge, able to work comfortably in a git/dbt framework
Superior analytic foundation with background in numerate discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Finance, Economics)
A graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or similar quantitative field
 
Prefer 3+ years of experience in analysis (emphasis on Finance if possible)
Be experienced working with a variety of databases but have deep knowledge in at least one
Excellent organizational skills
Experience with coding language principles : logic, scripting, system configuration, scheduling and monitoring


 
 
 
Experience with YAML, Bash, Python, VisualStudio and/or JSON
 
Experience with visualization solutions like Qlik, Tableau, PowerBI or Looker
 
Experience analyzing market ERP & CRM solutions such as NetSuite and Salesforce
 
Google Cloud knowledge, especially BigQuery
 


 
 
 
Additional company winter holidays and regular global days off
Remote friendly work environment and flexible working hours
Contribution to our growth by offering equity options for employees
Giving back to the community - one day per quarter for charitable work
Learning and Tuition Reimbursement
Regular hack-weeks and meetup events to exchange knowledge
Home office budget
Employee Resource Groups providing empowering spaces for connection and mentorship


 
 
Weâ€™re dedicated to helping the whole Planet, and to do that we must strive to represent all of it within each of our offices and on all of our teams. job_desc:
Jaxxson Ltd is looking for a collaborative, detail-oriented Data Engineer to join our small team. 


As a Data Engineer, you will build data pipelines and backend cloud-based infrastructure to run the business. You will use Python to access data from supplier APIs, to store data in MongoDB efficiently, and to create APIs with GraphQL and FastAPI ready for Data Scientists to build models and to power our B2B and B2C products which you will have an influential hand in designing and deploying. You may also be seconded to / advise our clients remotely.


As a small business, you will have opportunities to contribute to all business areas and show your entrepreneurial skills.


About Jaxxson Ltd


Jaxxson Ltd provides Strategic advice and development resources to its clients in Sports Analytics and Blockchain applications.


We are expanding our offering by developing in-house data and analytics products for B2B and B2C products. 


Our clients are usually Sports Governing Bodies, Clubs, Startups or SMEs that need help to improve their current data infrastructure or build it from scratch. We also have several exciting in-house projects that you will contribute to developing around client work.


Required Skills and Experience:


Python
MongoDB
GraphQL
FastAPI
Postgres or MySQL
AWS Tools and Services (RDS, EC2, Lambda, etc)
A passion for Sports, including but not limited to Football (Soccer).


Other Useful Skills and Experience:


A Degree in a Quantitivate Subject or Computer Science
Strong verbal/written communication & presentation skills.
Airflow or other Data Pipeline Tools
Mongo DB Atlas setup and management
Securing cloud databases and APIs
Git / Github / Github Actions
Kubernetes
Docker
Web Scraping
Familiarity with Tableau
Desire to be flexible and entrepreneurial to help grow the business


Location:


The role is Hybrid, you will be expected to attend face-to-face meetings in Central London twice weekly.


We are happy to consider applications for part-time work (60% FTE or more).


Legal:


Before starting, you will need to:
Provide proof that you have the right to work in the UK.
Provide two references.


Benefits Include:


Base Salary of Â£45k - Â£50k plus bonus determined by company performance.
25 days holiday (+8 bank holidays)
Opportunity to influence laptop choice




Closing Date and Timescales:


Applications will be open until Noon on the 28th of February initially.


No Agencies.


Please apply via LinkedIn.

Â£30,022 (National Framework) or Â£35,191 (London Framework â€“ if you are London office based or homebased and live within the boundary of the M25). There is also an additional homeworking allowance of Â£529 per annum for those working from home.

What youâ€™ll be doingâ€¦
 
As our Analyst, you will extract relevant information and insight from multiple data sources relating to the health and social care sector, presenting it in a clear and actionable manner.
 
Developing measures of quality and risk about health and care services, you will use large volumes of quantitative data and apply the most appropriate analytical methodologies.
 
You will also incorporate the views of the public and people using health and care services into the design and delivery of Data & Insight outputs.
 
Next stepsâ€¦
 
If you require any support or assistance with the recruitment process, please get in touch with our team or include a note in your application.

job_desc:
Description
 
At award winning company AXA Health, we are passionate about helping all our customers be the best version of themselves. That applies to our employees too!â€¯We are excited to be launching our Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship programme within the Digital and Data area of AXA Health.â€¯

Within our digital transformation, our use of data is crucial. AXA Health is striving towards data-driven decision making and action at all levels, and we are helping to achieve this. We need to leverage our data, empowering our workforce and partners to use and treat data as an asset to drive decision making, support prioritisation and enable fast-paced delivery of products and services that benefits our customers

In addition, we need to manage our data with appropriate controls, governance, accountabilities and oversight, in order to ensure regulatory, legal and policy compliance and drive improvements in the availability and quality of data.

Along with our government approved technical training provider, you will be supported by, and work alongside, experienced Analysts to learn core analysis, modelling and data interpretation skills. To supplement your learning, you'll have the fantastic opportunity to rotate around our teams spending time supporting both business-as-usual activities and also getting involved with project team deliveries that take us closer to meeting our Digital transformation ambitions.
 
What you will be doing:
 
 
You will work internally, and with wider AXA Health stakeholders, to identify how data can solve business problems and contribute to end-to-end solutions from requirements gathering, getting data and turning this into business insights.
 
You will contribute to the design, creation, execution and maintenance of policies, guidance and wider solutions that help drive data led decision making and comply with relevant data legislation.
 
Become familiar with data regulations and ensure data is appropriately stored and archived, in line with relevant legislation e.g. GDPR
 
Develop data modelling skills to create data models in-line with business requirements across multiple transactional and analytical use cases and domains.
 
Support the development of dashboards and reports in the Visualisation and Model Building Phase.
 


At AXA weâ€™re adopting a Hybrid way of working, empowering our people to balance their time between home and our office in a way that works best for them, their team and our customers. For this role, you will be expected in one of our AXA Health offices for collaborative working on an ad hoc basis.
 
Working Hours & Shift Pattern:
 
Full time, 37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of your learning pathway, weâ€™re unable to fulfil part-time or flexible work patterns.
 
Induction & Training:
 
When you join us, you'll have 4 - 6 weeks of training, having the opportunity to meet and observe your team, attend external meetings, all whilst learning about our products and services as you go.

This apprenticeship is all about maximizing your potential. Youâ€™ll be working with Insurance professionals providing you with every opportunity to thrive. If you put in the hard work, youâ€™ll find plenty of opportunities to further your career with AXA, as earlier apprentices have all done. This will include the chance to study for more advanced qualifications.
 
This position will commence in September 2023, and interviews will be carried out at the end of April/ Start of May 2023.
 
Qualifications
 
Education Requirements:
 
 
3 A Levels (or equivalent) at grades A*-C in any subject but preferably one in a numerical or computing subject (e.g., maths, Science, Computer Science etc.)
 
In AXA Health, we value your potential, so we will also consider applications from those with a more diverse range of qualifications who are passionate about pursuing a career as a Software Test Engineer and committed to completing the Level 4 apprenticeship in Software Testing.
 
Apprentices without level 2 English and maths will need to achieve this level prior to taking the End-Point Assessment.
 
For those with an education, health and care plan or a legacy statement, the apprenticeshipâ€™s English and Maths minimum requirement is Entry Level 3.
 
A British Sign Language (BSL) qualification is an alternative to the English qualification for those whose primary language is BSL.
 


All applicants must reside in England to be eligible for the Government apprenticeship funding

To be eligible for this apprenticeship you must reside or spend 50% of your working time in England, and been a resident in the UK, the British Overseas Territories, or Crown Dependencies (Channel Islands and Isle of Man) for at least the previous three years before the start of the apprenticeship.

Due to the number of applications we expect to receive for this role, we reserve the right to close this advert earlier than the listed closing date to ensure weâ€™re able to effectively manage interest. Therefore, if youâ€™re interested in joining us at AXA, please donâ€™t hesitate to apply.
 
What We Offer
 
One of the best things about joining AXA is our rewards package. At AXA UK, weâ€™re appreciative of the people who work for us and our rewards package is reviewed regularly to reflect that. You can expect to receive:
 
 
Accredited apprenticeship qualification
Competitive annual salary up to Â£26,000
Annual company & performance-based bonus
Contributory pension scheme (up to 12% employer contributions)
Life Assurance (up to 10 x annual salary)
25 days annual leave plus Bank Holidays
Opportunity to buy up to 5 extra days leave or sell up to 3 days leave
AXA employee discounts
Gym benefits
 


Our ambition is to become one of the most inspiring companies to work for, as such weâ€™re committed to supporting employee needs, providing meaningful career development and celebrating differences. We understand that everyone has individual work and home life responsibilities, therefore weâ€™re happy to discuss flexible working arrangements for this role, should this be a requirement for you. We look for candidates with the right skills and values to join us and selection is based on a fair and equal process. As a regulated financial services company, all successful candidates will be subject to preemployment checks. Weâ€™re committed to providing equal opportunities for all, therefore we welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. As a disability confident employer, weâ€™re pleased to offer our support and access to the AXA Accessibility Concierge should you require an alternative method of applying or any reasonable adjustments to be made during the recruitment process.

To apply, click â€˜Apply Nowâ€™ and youâ€™ll be able to upload your profile/CV from there. If youâ€™d like to discuss this role further or would like to engage with our Accessibility Concierge, please send an email to emma.watson@axa-uk.co.uk
 
About AXA
 
With a presence in over 60 countries, and 165,000 employees serving the needs of 107 million customers, AXA is big.

But never too big to care for every single person who works here. So when you join us, we promise to put our collective might behind you and your career.

Youâ€™ll work in an open and supportive environment where youâ€™ll be developed, challenged and encouraged to move around to achieve even bigger and better things â€“ nationally and internationally. Youâ€™ll learn directly from senior leaders, from the best in our business. And youâ€™ll enjoy real responsibility, really early on.

Every large company today talks about supporting diversity and inclusion. But at AXA UK, these values form an integral part of everything we do. For us, itâ€™s about bringing together the best talent, helping people to realise their full potential by being 100% themselves at work and delivering outstanding service to everyone â€“ regardless of difference.

AXA Health is the UK healthcare specialist for the AXA Group. Whatever our customersâ€™ health goals, we help them get there. That could be getting someone physio for an injury thatâ€™s holding them back, or finding them the right specialist to take their treatment forward. Our team are experts in their fields: from experienced cancer nurses to pioneering data analysts; from our highly respected customer service team to our wide-ranging in-house team of clinicians. We all work together to be the best we can be.
title: Apprentice Data Analyst

job_desc:
About Us
 
We are looking for an experienced analyst to join DLG in our Commercial Pricing Team within the Packages space.

Direct Line Group employs thousands of people throughout the UK. We're proud to be one of Britain's leading general insurers, offering millions of customers decades of experience.
 
 
What you'll be doing:
 
Reporting to our Pricing Manager, you'll be part of the Commercial Packages Pricing team; a varied role where you might assist with projects with other teams within the department. You will focus on Landlord, Tradesman and other SME products. You'll need to balance longer-term projects with fulfilling smaller requests, and be prepared to adapt your work as our business needs adapt. As with any of our pricing roles you'll have a responsibility to analyse product performance and provide insight to support our business managers in achieving their targets. You may also be involved in projects that implement new factors, data or risk model improvements into our rating algorithms, or aid development of our long-term pricing capabilities.

You'll build relationships and represent the team. We need great presenters to communicate pricing ideas to colleagues from other departments. We also need someone who can develop trust, and influence decisions when there are difficult choices to be made. Commercial Lines are transforming their pricing capability, and investing in technology and data to support this. As a result, there is plenty of opportunity for you to affect how we do things in the future, and have an impact on current product pricing.

This is a department that is always looking to improve, and your insight will be very valuable in our efforts to deliver a robust product which delivers great customer value. In addition you will...
 
 
Provide analytical support and insight to inform wider decisions and strategy, ensuring robustness of output and clear recommendations
Create impactful solutions to improve DLG's pricing performance and longer-term pricing capability, whilst maintaining underwriting discipline
Create meaningful and collaborative relationships to produce and deliver aligned outcomes across a variety of requirements
Analyse trading performance and create and track KPIs, including producing and analysing tactical MI, and develop recommendations to support the trading objectives. Identify gaps in existing MI and develop improvements
Develop yourself to maximise your personal contribution to the team and identify opportunities to gain additional skills, including through secondments or rotations
Play an active role in the induction and training of new members to the team thus ensuring a personal feel to their integration into the team; act as a first contact on technical and process issues
Communicate with peers and team managers promptly where you have discovered price, model or data issues and suggest appropriate remedial actions
Ensure compliance with core DLG policies, statutory and regulatory requirements, governance controls (including all relevant risk minimum standards) and completion of risk and audit actions, ensuring reputational risk is minimised


 
What you'll need:
 
 
1-2 years experience in a similar role
Problem solving skills and a mathematical background
Underwriting or pricing experience is desirable


 
Ways of Working
 
Our mixed model way of working offers a 'best of both worlds' approach combining the best parts of home and office-working, offering flexibility for everyone. How much you'll be in the office depends on your role, and we'll consider the flexible working options that work best for you.

Read our flexible working approach here .
 
Benefits
 
We recognise we wouldn't be where we are today without our colleagues, that's why we offer excellent benefits designed to suit your lifestyle:
 
 
9% employer contributed pension
50% off home, motor and pet insurance plus free travel insurance and Green Flag breakdown cover
Additional optional Health and Dental insurance
Up to 10% annual bonus
EV car scheme allows all colleagues to lease a brand new electric or plug-in hybrid car in a tax efficient way.
Generous holidays
Buy as you earn share scheme
Employee discounts and cashback
Plus many more


 
Being yourself
 
Direct Line Group is an equal opportunity employer, and we think diversity of background and thinking is a big strength in our people. We're delighted to feature as one of the UK's Top 50 Inclusive Employers and are committed to making our business an inclusive place to work, where everyone can be themselves and succeed in their careers.

We know you're more than a CV, and the things that make you, you, are what bring potential to our business. We recognise and embrace people that work in different ways so if you need any adjustments to our recruitment process, please speak to the recruitment team who will be happy to support you.

job_desc:

As a full service law practice, we act for the public and private sector across the UK, Europe, Middle East, Africa, Asia and the US providing legal advice to clients across the Company Commercial, Employment, Labour & Pensions, Litigation and Dispute Management, and Real Estate practices.
 
With
 
74 offices
 
across
 
35 countries
 
worldwide, we have become one of the largest law practices in the world and a great place to work and develop your career.
 
Overview of the role
There has been significant investment in new HR systems â€“ SAP EC, SAP Onboarding & Recruitment, SAP Performance & Goals & ECP, together with the need to leverage the data held in LMS, Perform & Qualtrics systems as well as other SAP solutions where are currently being implemented. Increased demand from the business for useful trends and insights on people and HR data to support strategic decisions for the firm.
 
The position will report directly to the Senior People Analytics Manager, based in our Birmingham Office.

:
 
To work within the HR systems and analytics team within HR Operations, providing support and knowledge to strengthen the capability and capacity within the team.
 
To play a key role in the delivery of service improvements regarding HR data together with creating intelligent business analytics and people reporting for the firm across multiple international locations.

Key contact for all people reporting requirements - including (but not limited to) employee and partner data, headcount reporting, HR KPIs & dashboards, annual and ad hoc pay, bonus and benefit reporting, benchmarking analytics, diversity and inclusion reporting, organisational structures etc.

Developing and maintaining a bank of self-service reports available to the HR team and wider business based on specified user requirements.


 
 
Acting as key user of all HR information systems and to feed performance and data integrity to the Service Operations / Programme Manager

Identifying opportunities to digitise and streamline HR data handling and optimising the Data and MI capability for the wider HR function. Provide ongoing support on the maintenance of Success Factors and other SAP modules.


 
Skills, Qualifications and Experience
 
Experience in development of MI reports, including working with complex data structures across a variety of different systems
Confidence working with large data sets as a highly competent advanced MS Excel User.
Experience of data analysis to identify trends and provide a summary of key findings
Knowledge of HR systems and HR business processes
High level analytical, problem solving, design and implementation skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work on own initiative with minimal supervision and to plan workload of other team members effectively to ensure targets are delivered on time
Experience in application support or development environment would be advantageous
Experience of reporting in SuccessFactors desirable or other similar Enterprise or HR system tools
Good knowledge of HRIS systems and processes would be advantageous
Proactive in providing solutions and improvements
Highly organised with a high level of attention to detail, to ensure an accurate efficient service is delivered at all times

We are seeking an experienced Azure Data Engineer with expertise in Synapse, Event Hubs, and Databricks to join thier team.
 
The ideal candidate will have a strong background in big data technologies and a deep understanding of the Azure platform.
 
You will be responsible for designing and implementing data solutions that meet the needs of their organization and drive business value.
 
Responsibilities:
 
Design and implement scalable data solutions using Azure services such as Azure Synapse, Azure Event Hubs, and Azure Databricks.


 
 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.


 
 
Build and maintain data pipelines to collect, store, process, and analyze large and complex data sets.


 
 
Continuously evaluate and optimize the organization's data architecture to ensure it meets the changing needs of the business.


 
 
Develop and implement data security and privacy policies and procedures in the context of Azure.


 
 
Evaluate new data technologies and determine their potential to improve the organization's data architecture.


 
 
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to other members of the data engineering team.


 
 
Communicate the organization's data architecture and strategy to stakeholders and ensure they are aligned with the overall business goals.


 
Requirements:
 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.


 
 
3+ years of experience in data engineering, specifically with Azure.


 
 
Strong understanding of big data technologies and architecture patterns.


 
 
Experience with data storage technologies such as Azure Blob Storage.


 
 
Strong programming skills in Scala or Python.


 
 
Experience with data streaming technologies such as Apache Kafka and Azure Event Hubs.


 
 
Strong understanding of SQL and database concepts.


 
 
Excellent understanding of Azure services such as Azure Synapse, Azure Event Hubs, and Azure Databricks.


 
 
Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.


 
If you're a talented and experienced Azure Data Engineer with expertise in Synapse, Event Hubs, and Databricks, and a passion for big data and the Azure platform, we'd love to hear from you.
 
Please submit your resume or reach out to Danielle.devilliers@cititec.com

The DST will provide access to deeper analysis, modeling, and predictive analytics based on large and complex datasets. The Data Scientist - Machine Vision role is fundamental to extending Locus capabilities relating to machine learning and object classification based on data from multiple sources.

Developing multiple classification models for various data sources - finding features and objects of interest in a warehouse environment
Streamlining and optimizing models onto limited resource platforms with strong performance obligations
Influencing and shaping the direction of machine vision and deep learning applications within the team, and also in the larger company
Coordinating development and research aims with internal and external partners to fully leverage available expertise
Demonstrating excellent verbal and written communication skills
Using an evolving range of data analysis tools and techniques, including open source, some of which must be learnt quickly, as and when required
Working with other teams and groups to understand where data science can add value at an organizational level
Helping to grow data science skills in other teams, understanding the variety of functional roles relating to data science and how they can be most effectively applied to solve business problems
Adapting to the exciting challenges provided by a cutting edge and fast evolving solution at a global leader in robotics


 
Qualifications
Technical skills should include, but not be limited to:
 
MSc or PhD level qualification in a machine vision, computer science, data science, or related discipline
3+ years experience using image-centric Deep Learning to solve real world problems
Demonstrable experience with techniques involving Object Detection, Image Classification, Convolutional / Recurrent Neural Networks, and Hyperparameter Tuning
Solid Python programmer, including (Pandas, Numpy, SKLearn) and PyTorch or Tensorflow

Demonstrable experience with cloud e.g. AWS, Azure
Comfortable using version control for software e.g. Git-related services
 
Ability to adhere to technical standards and follow procedures rigorously
Flexible and capable of adapting to new technologies as needed

About Mettler Toledo

METTLER TOLEDO is a leading global supplier of precision instruments and services. We are recognized as an innovation leader and our solutions are critical in key R&D, quality control, and manufacturing processes for customers in a wide range of industries including life sciences, food, and chemicals. We operate throughout the world with a culture shaped by innovation and international flair.



Our Opening and Your Responsibilities

* Conducting thorough detailed analysis on specific service processes and actions to improve service efficiency and output

 * Engaging and collaborating with all areas of the service division throughout all stages of the service delivery process

 * Providing ad hoc analysis and reports relevant to service requirements as and when required

 * Taking ownership of providing ongoing detailed analysis of key service topics (e.g., pricing/travel) at defined intervals

What You Need to Succeed

* Highly capable in advanced MS Excel

Our Offer to You

For more information on our commitment to Sustainability, Diversity and Equal Opportunity please visit us [2] here.

job_desc:
Associate Analyst/Analyst â€“ UK Public Sector Technology
 
Background
GlobalData Public Sector covers the Â£18bn market for technology and telecoms products and services across the UK and Irish public sectors. Through our intelligence centre, we provide an opportunities feed, market sizing and forecasts, market share data, news and strategic reports to many of the leading ICT suppliers to the sector, as well as government departments. Our team of analysts delivers research and advisory services, covering central government, local government, health and social care, criminal justice, education, defence, and transport.
 
We are looking for an Analyst to join our growing team to support coverage across all our markets purchase and use ICT. The role is suited to either a recent graduate or someone early in their career currently working in a market analysis role, or similar research or analysis focused role. Ideally, they will have an interest in how government bodies and other public sector organisations purchase and use technology, plus knowledge of or a willingness to develop using Python to collect and manipulate data.
 
What will you do:
Â· Researching and writing strategic reports and analysis on technology topics for our subscribers.
Â· Keeping on top of the latest developments in government policy, key technologies, relevant suppliers, news and procurement opportunities.
Â· Fostering strong relationships with key suppliers in this space, as well as industry organisations and the public sector.
Â· Writing short commentary and news articles for our subscribers.
Â· Advising clients via telephone and face-to-face briefings, and responding to client queries.
Â· Contributing to consulting projects and custom research.
Â· Supporting our sales team to engage current and prospective clients.
Â· Promoting GlobalDataâ€™s and your personal brand by commenting to journalists and speaking at conferences.
Â· Supporting GlobalDataâ€™s wider team of India-based researchers who gather data on technology contracts and opportunities.
 
Who are we looking for:
 
An undergraduate university degree as a minimum (ideally with an MA or MSC, or other postgraduate qualification).
A broad understanding of how the UK Public Sector is structured and related policy.
Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
Proven ability to produce analysis reports in Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
Numerate and data-literate; ability to use diverse sources of data to create compelling analysis.
Curiosity and willingness to learn about emerging technology topics.
Knowledge of using Python for data collection and manipulation (desirable).
Experience in market research (desirable).


 
What we offer:
 
Options for flexible and hybrid working.
The option to work up to 3 weeks of the year abroad.
25 days of annual leave and a day off for your birthday.
A portal with discounts on things like restaurants, gym membership and Apple products.
Bonuses when you refer us to successful applicants from your network.
Access to a range of health and wellbeing programs and advice.
Season ticket loans and cycle to work scheme.
A company laptop.
A pension scheme that both you and the company contribute to.


 
About GlobalData
GlobalData is a world leading data and analytics company. 4,000 of the worldâ€™s largest companies make better and timelier decisions thanks to our unique data, expert analysis and innovative solutions delivered through a single platform. At GlobalData, our mission is to help our clients decode the future to be more successful and innovative.
 
Reporting To:
Research Director, Data & Forecasting

job_desc:
Summary
 
Weâ€™re Lowell. You may not know us, but our reputation is growing. We believe that becoming debt free should be simple and affordable for everyone. Every year, we help thousands of people take control of their finances.
 
We buy debts from lots of different companies in all kinds of sectors. Our mission is to help customers on the path to becoming debt free; with a real focus on helping our customers pay off their debts in practical and affordable ways. We do this honestly, ethically and by treating our customers with dignity and respect.
 
Location: Leeds (Hybrid). Balancing your time between remote and office.
 
So thatâ€™s us, now letâ€™s talk about your role:
 
Job Description
 
Decision Science Analyst
 
Hybrid role
 
from LS10 1AB (1-2days in the office)
 
UK perm role - no sponsorship for this role
 
We are actively seeking a Graduate Entry Level applicant with a background in modelling with numeric ability.
 
You'll deliver high-quality statistical and machine learning models for our UK business, including our Operations, Pricing & Investments, and Finance teams.
 
In your role, youâ€™ll:
 
 
Build, enhance, and maintain predictive models using the most appropriate statistical and machine learning methodologies.
Be responsible for presenting analysis to stakeholders within the team and across the wider company.
Gain understanding of Lowellâ€™s core business model and identify opportunities to drive significant value through analytic intervention.
Work closely with other members of the team to build upon existing machine learning knowledge.


 
What we need from you?
 
Essential:
 
 
Degree in a quantitative discipline with a focus in statistics or econometrics.
Experience building one or more of logistic regression, generalised linear models, or categorical data analysis.
Experience with one or more machine learning methods (e.g., random forest, k-means clustering).
Hands on experience of numerical programming (using, e.g., Python, R).
Solid critical thinking skills, intellectual curiosity, and a willingness to keep looking for better answers.


 
Nice to have:
 
 
Relevant professional experience in a model building environment.
 
Experience of database programming (using, e.g., SQL, PySpark, SAS).


 
How we say thank you?
 
An exciting career is much more than just a salary. We also understand that everyone, regardless of culture, gender identity, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, or disability status, can contribute to our goal to make credit work better for all. Our strength is in our people. So, at Lowell we have a range of benefits that include:
 
 
A discretionary annual bonus for a job well done.
Life assurance, Private Medical Assurance & Group income protection.
28 days holiday + bank holidays
3% flexible benefits; pick additional benefits or take as cash each month. Whether this is extra holiday or dental cover there will be something for you.
A fantastic culture with more little perks along the way including flexible working, family leave and recognition awards.
Wellbeing support


 
At Lowell this doesnâ€™t end there, #WeSeeYou when youâ€™re performing your best, or living our values. So we want to ensure that once you get here, youâ€™ll still be going places.
 
Take the next step and apply

job_desc:
BI Analyst â€“ Derby (Office Based Role) - Â£40,000 - Â£50,000
 
Do you enjoy taking multiple systems, getting them to work together and taking those clunky data sets out of Excel into a great dashboard, visualisation in Power BI?
 
If so, this could be right up your street.
 
Itâ€™s an awesome opportunity for someone who wants to be the right hand person to the MD of this business. Your dashboards, insights and analytical reports will be the pulse of the business. Decisions will be made on them. Youâ€™ll truly help guide the business.
 
At present, they work using a combo of Netsuite and Excel.
 
They want to use Power BI, or similar. Theyâ€™re not wedded to Power BI, they could be open to Tableau for example too. An awesome part of this job is, youâ€™ll play a vital part in deciding that.
 
So, Power BI experience isnâ€™t essential. If youâ€™ve not used it but want to, theyâ€™ll train you on it. Theyâ€™ll pay for a license for it. Same with Tableau or another alternative.
 
They do though, need someone with complex ERP experience. Preferably Net Suite, but, they realise that's a big ask, so, they'll absolutely consider other systems. They want to someone eager to be a part of the Netsuite project though. The implementation of that system is still going through, and itâ€™s not quite perfect yet. So, they need someone who can dive into Netsuite, link it with their sales systems and then produce the visuals with the right software. Itâ€™s a role you can truly make your own, and a role you can really make a name for yourself in.
 
It will be office based 95% of the time. Theyâ€™re a close knit team. The leadership team who youâ€™ll work extremely closely with, are in every day working together and collaborating so itâ€™s going to be hugely beneficial to be in the office. That being said, on those days you just need to get your head down every once in a while, of course work from home. Same goes if the boiler breaks, or kids are off school etc. Theyâ€™re not a long hours culture and they will be as flexible as they can for the right person. So, things like nursery drop off, school drops etc wonâ€™t be a problem if you need to do those things.
 
 
 
Production of insightful dashboards and analysis for the board / leadership team in the business
Development of existing KPI and MI reporting suites
Development of Netsuite system to ensure the sales information is reported correctly and the correct reports are produced
Management of internal stakeholder requests and queries
Working closely with sales teams to understand sales numbers per product line etc to produce insightful reports


 
 
 
Strong experience working with a large ERP system


 
Distinct Recruitment Privacy Policy
