job_desc:
Job Description
 
 
Location: Spalding
 
 
Contract Type: Permanent
 
 
Business Area: Bakkavor Ltd - Finance
 
We're the biggest name you've never heard of. You've probably eaten our food- you just didn't realise it. Because as global leaders in the fresh prepared food industry with over 19,000 employees, we create innovative products, including meals, soups, dips, salads, desserts, pizzas and bread for customers including Tesco, M&S, Sainsbury's and Waitrose in the UK. Our customers include Harris Teeter and Home Chef in the US, and in China, we make food for Starbucks, Yum! and Pret. We're ambitious. We're full of ideas. And we're ready for more people who share our passion for quality to join us.
 
 
Data Analyst
 
We have a fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our FP&A Team.

In this busy and exciting role your main focus will be co-ordinating and standardising the collation, processing and reporting of data - to support the Central Technical function and wider FP&A team reporting processes.

Providing guidance and support for site stakeholders to ensure data and reporting is consistent and continually improved, will also be high on your agenda.
 
Accountabilities
 
 
Data collection
 
 
 
Ensuring business data required for reporting purposes is collected, consolidated and reviewed on a weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual basis
 
 
Undertaking data checks to ensure robustness whilst liaising with sites to understand and correct variances
 


 
Data Reporting
 
 
 
Co-ordinating to ensure all relevant inputs are collated, processed and reviewed with other functional stakeholders to safeguard consistent and timely reporting
 


 
Relationships and Teamwork
 
 
 
Developing effective cross functional relationships to enable reporting requirements
 
 
Challenging where information is inconsistent and feeding back outcome, so all data sets are aligned
 


 
Maintenance of Standard operating processes (SOP)
 
 
 
Maintaining and improving the central SOP for data consolidation and reporting processes
 
 
Providing support for site stakeholders to improve source data accuracy and consistency
 


 
Performance Reporting
 
 
 
Ensuring robust verification of governance / performance reporting
 
 
Reporting in line with pre agreed timetables to allow Managers allocated time to review pre submission
 


 
People Management
 
 
 
Day to day management of small data team.
 


About You
 
Ideally, you will bedeadline focused, articulate and highly organised with good timekeeping skills.

Proficiency using MS products (Excel, Word and Outlook) and excellent attention to detail will be key, as will the ability to work comfortably with multiple priorities across multiple stakeholders.

If you have a can-do attitude, good influencing skills, an analytical mindset and a passion for service delivery - this could be the perfect role for you.

Team leader experience, e.g., organising and managing team deadlines, appraisals etc is required.
 
What You Can Expect From Us
 
When joining us you can expect a highly competitive rewards package including group pension, private medical insurance, and other flexible benefits - alongside excellent career progression prospects across the Bakkavor group.
title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
A perfect opportunity for a management information and data analysis professional with a few years of experience within any insurance or wider financial services field, and strong Excel skills.
 
 
If you're looking to continue growing your career in an innovative company and have passion for travel insurance, we'd love to hear from you.
 
The key purpose of the role will be supporting the pricing and underwriting strategy and development of the current portfolio as well as new business.
 
Come join an organisation with a strong market presence and great internal culture!
 
Collinson is a global loyalty and benefits company.
Collinson is a privately-owned entrepreneurial business with 2,000 passionate people working in 17 locations worldwide. Our solutions include Priority Pass, the worldâ€™s best known airport experiences programme, while we are also the trusted partner behind many of the leading financial services, airline and hotel brandâ€™s insurance, reward programmes and loyalty initiatives.
While specialising in Financial Services, Travel and Retail, we also support clients in multiple sectors. We have worked with over 90 airlines, 20 hotel groups and more than 600 financial institutions and banks, with clients including Accor Hotels, Air France KLM, American Express, British Airways, Cathay Pacific, Diners Club, Mandarin Oriental, Mastercard, Radisson Hotel Group, Sephora, Visa and Vhi.
 
Our insurance business incorporates our UK and EEA based authorised and regulated insurers and, for our travel insurance proposition, a full claims and assistance operation. We currently possess c20% market share of the UK travel insurance market, 30% share of all D2C travel insurance sold online in Italy via our Columbus Direct brand and our travel insurance is sold in 15 EEA countries today.
 
We have a wide range of clients taking products such as Dental and Health Insurance in our Accident & Health line of business and similarly across products such as Home Emergency, Gadget, Mobile, Bicycle Insurance and Warranty in our Multi-Lines business. Our range of SmartDelay propositions build on our Lounge capability to offer real differentiation to clients across Europe. We have exciting plans to grow our business further across UK & Europe.
 
What does MI and Data Analyst do at Collinson?
This is an opportunity to work closely with one of the UKâ€™s largest travel insurance books, supporting the pricing and underwriting strategy and development of the current portfolio and new business.
 
The role will be part of a multi-disciplined commercial and technical team with the potential to have a client facing aspect to it that includes a range of audiences and levels of seniority.
 
Key responsibilities
 
Production of regular MI reports for both internal and external customers, for example monthly performance trackers and client presentations, across the Travel Insurance line of business (LOB)
Ensure all data used is current and accurate and act as the primary point of contact for data related issues and queries for the Travel Insurance LOB
Work with key stakeholders to ensure all requirements gathering and analysis tasks are accurately planned within overall agreed timeframes
Work with stakeholders (both internal and external) to elicit requirements for data to support the Travel Insurance LOB
Work with Development, QA and Production Support teams to communicate, verify, and support testing and data related functionality changes
Manage downstream data quality issues with Underwriters, Commercial teams, and Partners
Stewardship of all data for Travel Insurance LOB


 
Knowledge and Skills required
 
Microsoft Office, especially Excel
Experience of Microsoft Power BI and Alteryx would be beneficial
Experience working with data in general insurance
Comfortable working on their own initiative to support the whole team in achieving success
Strong focus on delivery, cutting across different job levels and departments
Ability to manage multiple stakeholders internally and externally
Effective relationship builder
Strong communication skills


 
Collinson is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone to our team. We strongly encourage people of any colour, race, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, neurodivergence, family status, age, individuals with disabilities
 
and people from all backgrounds, cultures and experiences to apply. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.
 
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
 
If you need any extra support throughout the interview process, then please email us at ukrecruitment@collinsongroup.com.
 
We also have our very own Beacons (Domestic Abuse Advisors) supporting within each of our global offices. Our Beacons will be your point of contact if you or someone you know needs support.
title: MI and Data Analyst

job_desc:
Methods is currently recruiting for a Data Engineer to join our team on a permanent basis.
This role will include some work on client sites and frequent visits to our main offices in London.
 
Please note:
This role will require you to have or be willing to go through Security Clearance. As part of the onboarding process candidates will be asked to complete a Baseline Personnel Security Standard; details of the evidence required to apply may be found on the government website Gov.UK. If you are unable to meet this and any associated criteria, then your employment may be delayed, or rejected . Details of this will be discussed with you at interview
 
Requirements:
 
The Data Engineer will:
 
Work with other members of the delivery team across a mix of large and small projects and be responsible for translating data into valuable insights that inform decisions for small to large transformation projects and programmes.
Be responsible for identifying and using the most appropriate analytical techniques, developing fit-for-purpose, resilient, scalable and future-proof data services that meet user needs and design and write and iterate code from prototype to production-ready.
Communicate effectively across organisational, technical and political boundaries to understand the context and how to make complex and technical information and language simple and accessible for non-technical audiences.
Work with the others to support the growth and development of the team


 
Ideal Candidates will demonstrate:
 
Experience of creating PowerBI solutions and dashboards from row level data including data structure optimisation through to visualisation and dashboard creation.
Experience with Relational Databases and Data Warehousing experience such as SQL Server and/or Azure SQL
SQL development experience including debugging and troubleshooting
Have solid Relational Database design skills with an eye for performance optimisation
Experience of programming in languages such as Python, Scala or Java
Experience processing large volumes of structured/semi-structured data (CSV/JSON)
Experience producing data models and understand where to use different types of data models
Knowledge of data cleaning, wrangling, visualization and reporting, with an understanding of the best, most efficient use of associated tools and applications to complete these tasks
Have cloud based experience, preferably with AWS and/or Azure
Have experience with ETL / ELT
Infrastructure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Have experience with Analytical/Reporting tools
SQL, Analysis Services, Power BI
DevOps experience, such as using Git, CI/CD and Unit Testing
Have attention to detail and ability to quality assure their own and other team membersâ€™ work
Understanding of how to expose data from systems (e.g. through APIs), link data from multiple systems and deliver streaming services.
Know how to ensure that risks associated with deployment are adequately understood and documented.
An ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications
Experience of iterative/agile development methodologies such as SCRUM
A good understanding of Data Governance principles and the safe handling and processing of Personal Identifiable Data


 
Desirable Skills & Experience:
 
Streaming and real-time data
Knowledge of statistics principles necessary to interpret data and apply models. For example, knowledge of errors and confidence intervals to understand whether a relation seen in the data is real.
Exposure to high performing, low latency or large volume data systems (i.e. 1 billion+ records, terabyte size database)
Understanding of distributed computing, columnar type databases, partitioning, map reduction
Big Data Frameworks experience, such as Hadoop and Apache Spark
Experience with NoSQL type environments, Data Lakes, Lake-Houses (Cassandra, MongoDB or Neptune)


 
Benefits
Methods is passionate about its people; we want our colleagues to develop the things they are good at and enjoy.
 
By joining us you can expect
 
Autonomy to develop and grow your skills and experience
Be part of exciting project work that is making a difference in society
Strong, inspiring and thought-provoking leadership
A supportive and collaborative environment


 
As well as this, we offer:
 
Development access to LinkedIn Learning, a management development programme and training
Wellness 24/7 Confidential employee assistance programme
Social - office parties, commitment to charitable causes
Time off 25 days a year
Pension Salary Exchange Scheme with 4% employer contribution and 5% employee contribution
Discretionary Company Bonus based on company and individual performance
Life Assurance of 4 times base salary
Private Medical Insurance which is non-contributory
 
(spouse and dependants included)
Worldwide Travel Insurance which is non-contributory
 
(spouse and dependants included)
title: Data Engineer

job_desc:
Xander Talent
We are a rapidly growing young firm, just starting our scale-up year! This is an exciting time to join our consultancy and become a part of our expansion. Xander Talent is an emerging consulting business, but our vision goes beyond consultancy.
 
As a company who balances profit and social purpose, our mission is to work with organisations to create a workforce that is truly diverse and inclusive. We were founded by experienced consultants who are passionate about delivering blended teams that are diverse, resilient, and meet our clients capability requirements.
 
We were established to provide Technical (STEM) and business-related consulting solutions to global corporates across the UK, European and North American markets.
 
We source and recruit individuals from diverse backgrounds, train and equip them with business or technical skills through our in-house training academy and then embed them with clients on a 2-year work placement.
 
Why join us?
Our Data Engineer Training Programme equips you with an understanding on how to create and manage technological infrastructure of a data platform to enhance business insights, and thereby optimise performance.
 
This role is ideal for individuals who have an enthusiasm for learning the latest programming languages and manipulating data sets.
 
Our fully funded 9-week training programme is delivered by expert trainers focusing on key technical and business skills, in keeping with client demand. We blend traditional learning methods such as lectures, desk learning and team projects with a holistic learning approach to equip you with essential technical and social skills for the workplace, such as resilience, curiosity, and emotional intelligence.
 
Working directly with our founders and clients, themselves with extensive data engineering and entrepreneurial experience, you will be trained up into fully fledged Data Engineers. Successful completion of the training academy will lead to 2-year placement with our clients, where associates will transfer this knowledge and specialist skillset.
 
Joining Xander Talent as a Data Engineer, you will learn to:
 
Work with our clients within a multi-disciplined team to improve data transparency by integrating, cleansing, consolidating, and structuring data for use in analytics applications
Build and maintain data pipelines, pulling together data from different systems
Work with stakeholders to develop an understanding of their requirements to reach solutions
Contributing to more effective business decisions facilitated by data modelling, visualisation and cloud computing
Break down complex data into useable formats so it can be interpreted by relevant stakeholders
Contribute to the ever-evolving technology strategy at Xander Talent


 
 
This is a fully funded but unpaid training programme so would require you to support yourself financially during the training period
 
and upon successful graduation from the academy and subsequent placement, you will be expected to work with a client and deliver various projects internally and externally within the clientâ€™s organisation.
 
 
We are an equal opportunities employer with a key focus on Diversity and Inclusion, you do not need to have previous education/experience in Data Engineering or Technology to join our Academy. We encourage applications from aspiring data engineers from non-traditional backgrounds, who have an interest in technology and its impact.
 
Key traits our successful associates have in common include:
 
Experience in coding languages. You donâ€™t have to have a degree. However instead, you will come from a STEM background or attended a programming Bootcamp. You will have a passion for technology, with solid experience in a programming language, such as: Python, SQL, Cloud (AWS/GCP), PowerBI/Tableau.
Being a self-starter, with a passion for technology, personal growth and development
Have a willingness to learn new technologies and their practical applications. Comfortable alternating between different technologies
Comfortable working and communicating with multiple stakeholders in busy environments.
Strong attention to detail and high accuracy
A team player that can work in an ambiguous environment, with excellent problem-solving skills and resilience towards setbacks
Proactive in growing professional and technical capabilities by attending in-house and external training and educational opportunities


 
 
This is a hybrid role, based in the UK (mainly London) and regular travel
 
may
 
be required when on a client placement.
 
The role represents an unrivalled opportunity to develop a skill set in the ever-growing STEM and data engineering markets to launch your career within the global corporate community. Additionally, this is an opportunity to join a people-centric organisation in its crucial growth phase, and to participate in that growth to develop your skills, experience and career at your own pace.
 
 
Xander Talent is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, where Diversity and Inclusion is our key value. We welcome applications from all sections of the community, to create a diverse and inclusive environment, and provide equal
 
employment
 
opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Military status.
 
 
Please note you must hold current right to work in the UK without the need for sponsorship now or in the future to be eligible for this role. Unfortunately, this would include those on a PSV/Graduate VISA, due to the nature of our consultancy.
title: Data Engineer - Training Programme - March 2023

job_desc:
Company Description
 
 
At AECOM, weâ€™re delivering a better world.
 
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether itâ€™s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. Weâ€™re one global team â€“ 47,000 strong â€“ driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
 
 
About Digital @AECOM
 
 
As a member of the Europe digital consulting services team you will work with leaders from around the world to define and position the digital consulting services, to share best practices, to leverage global capabilities and to support global opportunities and projects. While services and solution management will be set globally, they will be tailored for implementation within the region and for each client.
 
Job Description
 
 
AECOMâ€™s
 
Data and Analytics Team are looking for a
 
Data Engineer
 
to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams.
 
The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
 
 
Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and Azure â€˜big dataâ€™ technologies.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and regions.
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Showcasing proof points and case studies


Qualifications
 
 
Minimum Requirements:
 
 
 
We are looking for a candidate who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Advanced working SQL/nosql, ADLS, Databricks, ADF, Azure DevOps
Experience building and optimizing â€˜big dataâ€™ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.

Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable â€˜big dataâ€™ data stores.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:
 
 
 
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.

Commitment to building a diverse and inclusive team
Self-starter with the ability to work as a positive, energized and adaptable team member
Highly developed written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and influence senior leaders
Extremely strong relationship building skills
Demonstrated ability to champion and drive ideas/programs/solutions
Excellent organizational and time management skills, able to work under pressure and prioritize effectively
Able to demonstrate passion, energy and drive, especially in the face of resistance

With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and thereâ€™s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and youâ€™ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm â€“ access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.

First Derivative provides a range of managed services and consulting worldwide to its clients in the capital markets sector, including many of the worldâ€™s leading banks, focused on supporting mission-critical systems as well as helping them to achieve and maintain regulatory compliance.
 
Options Program â€“ Systems Analyst:
 
The Systems Analyst stream offers a unique opportunity for graduates to gain specialist experience working with market leading technology systems and applications across the Financial Services sector. You will have the opportunity to work with major financial institutions and the worldâ€™s top trading technology vendors such as Calypso and Murex. This stream offers an accelerated entry point to a career in capital markets trading and risk management platforms.
 
 
In this role, you will work with a team of trading technology experts to design, develop, implement and support a broad range of mission-critical data and trading systems for the benefit of our clients. You will combine your technical skills and financial knowledge, which will be further developed through the Capital Markets Training Program, to help our clients address their challenges or implement new systems.
 
Those chosen for this stream will:
 
 
Receive a highly sought after transferable skill set in a trading system such as Calypso/Murex used by the majority of the leading global financial institutions
Experience accelerated career development, underpinned by our continuous investment in learning world-renowned third-party trading and risk management technologies
Receive on-going mentoring and learning opportunities through our detailed Capital Market Training program
Be given an outstanding opportunity to apply their learning to immediate, real-world issues with internationally recognised clients


 
 
What we look for:
 
 
A strong technical or finance background, with a combination of both being highly sought after
A passion for learning, with a particular interest in financial systems
Excellent communication skills to engage with stakeholders at different levels of seniority
Strong academic background â€“ ideally ABB or above at A-Level (or equivalent) and a 2.1 degree in Finance, Economics, Computing, Engineering, Statistics, or similar discipline
Commitment to the 2-year training programme and continual training beyond this, as part of long term career progression
Willingness to travel to various parts of the world to work with clients where required
Experience with SQL & UNIX is preferred but not essential


 
Working for FD:
 
At FD, you will embark upon a career with life-long learning at its core, facilitating rapid professional and personal development and the opportunity to design your own path. We support a variety of external training courses and accreditations and are truly passionate about our Mentor Program, through which our senior colleagues generously set aside personal time to coach and support others in their career progression.
 
We are delighted to have several active internal networks, social committees, and charity initiatives, designed with the intention of meeting the holistic needs of our employees and giving back to our communities.
 
 
Candidate personal data will be processed in line with our Global Candidate Privacy Notice

title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Weâ€™re Landsec
Sustainable places. Connecting communities. Realising potential. We live by these principles to create great experiences for people, now and in the future. We create places that make a lasting positive contribution to our communities and our planet. We bring people together, forming connections with each other and the spaces we create. And we provide our customers, partners, and people with a platform to realise their full potential.
 
Having a diverse workforce at all levels will empower us to make better decisions. We know that employing a diverse mix of people makes us a stronger and more sustainable business and one that reflects the diverse society around us. Thatâ€™s why we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.
 
Purpose of job
As the availability of data becomes more prevalent, our challenge is to ensure we are using it to provide value, enhance the experiences of our Customers by being more attuned to their changing needs and using data to help guide our future decisions, while also being selective about the data we collect, rather than collecting data for the sake of it.
 
This role is both exciting and pivotal to supporting our transition to a data led business, working within our â€œAspireâ€ Team, who oversee the â€œBrilliant Basicsâ€ and exceptional service delivery across our portfolio in partnership with our amazing service partners.
 
 
Youâ€™ll be instrumental in pulling together all the various data streams across operations, including helpdesk performance, footfall, energy intensity, among many others, both existing and future data we are yet to collect or know we need, consolidating, analyzing, and reporting on these data streams to provide insights to optimise and improve our working process and share data internally to inform and support our Customer propositions.
 
Utilising these historical data sets to develop future trend and pre-emptive strategies, to be the Operations â€œdata storytellerâ€ and guide what we do and how we do it as the way we work and interact with our environments change.
Primary duties of this role include:
 
 
Collect, clean and curate all relevant sources of data available across our managed portfolio, or where required recommend data that could add value that is not currently being collected or in a form that can be utilised.
Using data to discern future trends, predicting future outcomes from historic data sets.
Provide analysis and reports on this data that can be openly shared with our internal team and service partners that aids continuous improvement through behavioural changes or transformation processes.
Be the go-to person for data insights for the operations team, creating bespoke reports to help start conversations or guide ideas to ensure they are supported by customer sentiment or objective metrics.
Use technology to get the most out of our data, create user friendly dashboards or visual mediums to share data across our portfolio, including in Customer facing areas to share positive messages and demonstrate process improvements through data.
To be successful, you will possess an interdisciplinary set of skills across data modelling, data visualization and mathematical and statistical analysis. You will also have the communication skills required to understand business requirements and translate and present data insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.


 
Principle accountabilities
 
 
Work with Aspire Service Delivery Manager and Operations Team to prioritise business and information needs, support in defining new process improvement opportunities
Interpreting data, analysing results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Mine and analyse data from existing and new databases to drive optimisation and improvement or our operational delivery models
Use predicative modelling to increase, improve and enhance our customer experiences, revenue generation through targeted cross selling of products and services.
Developing and implementing data analysis, data collection systems and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality.
Work with Visualisation and Analytics Director and Digital and Data Modernisation Team to support Landsecâ€™s Digital Transformation journey and showcase the use of best-in-class data analysis and visualisation to drive decision-making and create business value for Landsec. Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems, generating reports from single or multiple systems, providing analysis on output.
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
Evaluating changes and updates and to source industry leading systems. To undertake periodical benchmarking against peer groups.
Commissioning and decommissioning of data reporting sets in line with corporate and legislative guidelines.
To own user access and provide training to end users on new reports and dashboards. Providing technical expertise to all stakeholders.


 
 
Key competencies
 
 
Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Able to use mathematical, analytical, and statistical techniques to analyse data and draw out insights in support of a business aim.
Communication Skills: Actively listens, analyses, and interprets information from stakeholders, questions to confirm intent, and works to communicate company needs and goals. Clearly and concisely explains data analysis results to technical and non-technical audiences.
Data modelling, cleansing, and enrichment skills: Able to produce data models and apply techniques related to data base design development and data modelling patterns. Able to respond to problems in database and data processes as they occur.
Data visualisation: Identify the most appropriate ways to visualise data to tell relevant, compelling, and actionable business insights
Accuracy, attention to detail
Adaptability and team-working skills


Knowledge, experience, and qualifications
Essential
 
 
Experience as a Data Analyst (e.g., database management, data mining, analysis, reporting)
Proven hands-on experience in data analysis using a programming language (e.g., Python, R)
Experience creating or managing databases (e.g., SQL)
Expert knowledge of spreadsheet tools (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets)
Sound knowledge of data visualisation software (e.g., PowerBI, Qlik, Tableau)
Strong communication skills to collaborate with stakeholders and articulate the value of data analysis
Team-working
Undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Operational Research, or similar quantitative subjects


Desirable
 
 
Experience of Agile development methodologies
Experience with Cloud Technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP). Azure preferred.
Understanding of big data tools, e.g., Apache Spark, Hadoop
Masterâ€™s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Operational Research or similar quantitative subjects

The role involves leveraging geospatial data to perform analysis, mapping, and optimization, to inform design strategies and requires strong programming skills and proficiency with SQL and geospatial tools. Familiarity with ESRI technology and data visualization is a plus.
 
 
 
Able to demonstrate ability to undertake the above responsibilities

Strong programming skills in one of more of the following languages: Python, C#, JavaScript
Proficient with SQL and experience with DB query clients
Proficiency with a suite of geospatial tools.

Working knowledge of how to leverage geospatial data Experience creating bespoke interactive maps
title: Data Scientist

job_desc:
Trilateral Research have a fantastic opportunity for a
 
Data Scientist
 
to join the Sociotech for Good business unit in providing ethical AI solutions to customers in the public and private sector.
 
Within this role you will focus on supporting the advancement of our ethical AI data products, which including Trilateral's law enforcement focussed solutions to aid tackling child exploitation (CESIUM), organised crime (IRON) and human trafficking (Honeycomb), Trilateral's work in Air Quality Monitoring to help address environment and climate issues, and Trilateral's data science and analytics platform (STRIAD). As such, this post is particularly suited to those with a passion for applying data science in a real-world setting, which have a large positive impact on large scale societal problems, and packaging data science work into software products.
 
Our company and what we do
At Trilateral Research we provide ethical AI solutions for tackling complex social issues, from human trafficking and child exploitation, citizen security in crisis to pollution and climate change. We transform research into innovation and sustainable impactâ€‹, focusing our efforts where we can enhance societal wellbeing.
 
We apply rigorous, cutting-edge research when developing and accessing new technologies to ensure they achieve sustainable innovation and measurable impact. Our teams include humanities specialists, social scientists, data scientists, ethical, legal and human rights experts who work across the technology-social disciplinary divide.
 
What are your responsibilities?
The successful candidate will have some expertise in one or more of the following fields:
 
 
 
Data Science â€“ Operational Level
 
Contribute to the delivery of Data Science related tasks in products and/or projects in line with specified requirements, demonstrate abilities to lead data science tasks from ideation through to delivery.
Perform tasks relating to data management: collection, curation, cleaning, analysis, presentation, visualization activities.
Lead technical reports, technical documentation, deliverables, and content for proposals.
Work in an interdisciplinary Sociotech manner, ensuring an understanding and engagement with data ethics, data privacy, data security and algorithmic transparency considerations.


 
Coding and Documentation
 
Write good quality, maintainable code.
Provide clear and useful technical documentation.


 
General
 
Contribute to discovery efforts under supervision of senior staff.
Participate in the data science tribe supporting knowledge exchange efforts.
Begin to demonstrate expertise through contributions to collaborative peer-reviewed publications and/or conference papers and marketing collateral.


Job requirements
What skills and experience will I need for the role?
 
Interpersonal Skills:
 
Good organizational, verbal and written communication skills
Willingness to learn, knowledge share, and improve
Display a problem focused mindset.


 
General Knowledge and Technical Skills:
Essential:
 
Demonstrable experience of completing data science projects.
Demonstrable experience in working on collaborative software projects.
Good understanding of statistics - hypothesis testing, p-values, confidence intervals, regression, classification, and optimization.
Knowledge of machine learning evaluation methodologies
Background knowledge of, and experience with, a variety of machine learning approaches, such as linear/logistic regression, SVM, random forests, and deep learning (ANN, RNN, CNN, LSTM, etc.)
Good experience manipulating large data sets (structured and unstructured data) through statistical software or other methods
Good technical skills (Python â€“ essential).
 
Note: we use Python, SQL, ElasticSearch, Neo4J, pandas, scikit-learn, Keras, PyTorch among others.
Ability and willingness to discover, use, and learn new technologies.


 
Desirable:
 
Demonstrable experience and interest in the realization of ethical AI.


 
Required Education and Experience:
Essential:
 
2+ yearsâ€™ experience in data science.


 
Desirable:
 
Masters/PhD in a technical subject such as Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, or related subject.


 
What else do I need to know?
Location:
 
This position is open to candidates based in England
Contract type:
 
Permanent, full-time Employment Contract
Salary:
 
Commensurate with experience
Hours:
 
Full time
 
Our compensation package includes:
 
Flexible working hours
Pension scheme
Remote working/working from home options
A friendly and enthusiastic team of experts in the field


 
How to apply
Please submit
 
 
your CV and a cover letter, linking your experience to our requirements in order to have your application considered. References will be required prior to appointment and candidates must be eligible to work in the UK
 
About us
We are an Equal Opportunities employer and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates, regardless of their age, sex, race, disability, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital/civil partnership status, or pregnancy and maternity. We are a Disability Confident committed and Living Wage employer.
 
At Trilateral Research, we value privacy and data protection rights. We have a longstanding data protection culture and promote robust ethical standards in data management and research ethics. Please read our Recruitment Privacy Notice in relation to our recruitment activities before submitting your application to work with us.

job_desc:
Role Title:

Analysis Technical Specialist

Your role at a glance
The team
This is a 12 month internship as part of TPRâ€™s established internship programme, based in the Analysis and Insight team. In your placement, you will gain valuable experience of working on real world analytical projects that both matter to TPR and help us get the best value for pension savers.


Although we canâ€™t say what your exact projects will be yet, with 2 rotations you will have the opportunity to acquire diverse analytical and data skills. With your first 6 months spent in analytics and your second 6 months working as an intern in our Data Science team, your work will range from data visualisation to statistical modelling.
Working within a large team, you will also have the opportunity to grow your analytical network, both learning from and contributing to the wider teamâ€™s work. With demand for analytical projects across TPR, you will work collaboratively with stakeholders to provide analytical insight and evidence that supports our organisationâ€™s strategy.


What youâ€™ll do
Whilst in the Analytics role, you will learn and develop skills to:
Use SQL to manipulate large, complex datasets providing key information to internal and external stakeholders including public Freedom of Information requests.
Apply analytical techniques, such as regression and hypothesis testing in a business environment to inform an evidence base for regulatory strategy, activity and policy.
Create PowerBI dashboards to visualise data


Whilst in the Data Exploitation role, you will:
Work closely with an experienced Data Scientist on a Data Science project covering Machine Learning or Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Gain experience using open source scripting languages like R or Python
Use Power BI, Shiny or Dash to visualise data


In both teams you will learn to work directly with stakeholders to identify their requirements, agree milestones and communicate your results.


What youâ€™ll bring
Essential Criteria
Currently undertaking an undergraduate degree programme in a STEM subject.

Awareness/knowledge of bivariate / multivariate statistical modelling, time series analysis, and forecasting.
Awareness/knowledge of evaluating data sources for suitability, reliability & accuracy.
Awareness/limited experience of communicating complex concepts in a clear and accurate manner.
Desirable Criteria
Desire to use data to provide clarity and insight to a complex business problem.
Awareness/knowledge of basic mechanisms of the economy, the financial system and relevant inter-linkages.
Awareness/knowledge of the implementation of robust standards and quality assurance procedures in analytics.


We put you first
Weâ€™ll give you a chance to put your theory into practice as you work alongside a diverse, friendly and experienced team. Youâ€™ll develop your skills in a safe and supportive work environment that values your thoughts, perspectives and ideas. Youâ€™ll receive regular feedback on your performance to help you learn, develop and improve throughout your time with us.


What youâ€™ll get
As well as a starting salary of Â£18,965, we offer:
A Civil Service Pension with an average employer contribution of 27%
25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Flexi leave - take up to two days flexi leave a month
Flexible working arrangements (hybrid)
Career development opportunities
Enhanced parental leave
Free employee assistance programme
Brighton location with excellent transport links


What we do
More than half the UK working population rely on us to regulate their retirement savings. With a career at The Pensions Regulator (TPR), youâ€™ll be joining an organisation that will impact on millions of lives for decades to come.


Everyone plays an important role in helping to keep more than Â£2trn of savings safe. We put UK savers at the heart of what we do. So, if youâ€™re ready to make a difference, then we want to hear from you.


Find out more about us.


Kick-start your career
Who can apply?
If youâ€™re an undergraduate looking for a placement year, then why not join our team!
Weâ€™re having an assessment day on 
29
 
March 2023
, this will take place in our office. Make sure youâ€™re free on this date - as youâ€™ll need to take part in group/individual assessments, as well as an interview.


Supporting diversity and inclusion
We are an inclusive employer and want applications from all backgrounds. We champion equality, diversity and inclusion and through our Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy, have set out how we will embed diversity and inclusion throughout our organisation and support our regulated community to do the same.


We can provide reasonable adjustments if you have a disability. Please get in touch at any stage of the recruitment process, so we can find out what this may look like for you please email recruitmentteam@tpr.gov.uk. If you do meet the minimum criteria, we will offer you an interview.


Location
We operate a hybrid working model, with regular attendance in our Brighton office to connect with colleagues.


Right to work
Under Home Office guidance, weâ€™re required to establish if future employees have a right to work in the UK before they start employment with us. Currently, weâ€™re not able to offer sponsorship. We are a UK-based organisation, and you must live in the UK to be employed by us.


Screening
The Pensions Regulator is an armâ€™s length government body and part of the public service.


Any offer of employment will be subject to us receiving satisfactory background screening checks and criminal record checks (BPSS).


Weâ€™d love to hear from you
Email your CV to recruitmentteam@tpr.gov.uk, adding the role reference number above.

job_desc:
Integrum ESGâ€™s purpose is to make professional investors aware of how the companies in which they invest are managing ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) issues. We do that by offering investors a subscription to our online machine-learning and NLP powered customisable dashboard; a SaaS cloud-hosted platform which offers company-specific and country-specific ESG data and ratings.
 
The opportunity:
We are now looking for a Data Engineer (junior/mid) to join our Central London office.
 
We offer the chance to work in a fascinating and expanding area that is taking ESG into mainstream investing, making capitalism more inclusive, and more responsible. You will report directly to the CTO (a vastly experienced individual from whom you will learn a great deal) and to the Lead ML (a former Harvard Research Fellow). Working with us there is opportunity to gain experience in cutting-edge NLP, advanced statistics and automated data flows while getting exposure to an important business area.
 
This exceptional opportunity will super-charge your career, and you should expect to progress as the company and the team expand. You will have a direct impact on the product technical design and work in an autonomous, creative environment.
 
Package:
 
A competitive salary of Â£30,000 or higher
Flexible working hours
25 days' holiday
Gym membership


 
Skills and experience required:
 
You will have a STEM degree (upper-second or first class) from a well-regarded University and data engineering experience (academic or professional)
Python programming
Pandas and scipy
Data storage technologies, SQL databases
Web technologies for fetching data
Cloud deployment of industrial strength data code
Testing strategies for all of the above
Preparing data sets
Building training and inference pipelines


 
Secondary skills we consider:
 
NoSQL databases
NLP frameworks, such as Spacy, NLTK, Bert


 
The successful candidate should also:
 
Have a high IQ with a thirst for knowledge
Have an innate sense of accountability and an obsession about product quality
Be critical of development processes and always look to improve them
Have an interest and pride in being part of an ESG business
Understand what the product means to the user so that they can engineer for that
Have good communication skills


 
Interview Process
Given the opportunity available, the selection process will be challenging:
 
Background/Introductory video call interview with the CTO or Lead ML
Technical Test
Technical interview with the CTO and Lead ML
Challenging interview with the founder


 
You will also meet all other members of our tight-knit small team and be asked to sit a straightforward 40-minute multiple choice IQ test (verbal and non-verbal reasoning questions that one cannot revise for).

job_desc:
How will your role contribute at NewDay?
 
This position needs someone with energy and passion to complement and grow within our existing development team to be part of the transition of our analyst and reporting team to an AWS cloud based environment where SQL, Python and Airflow are used to deliver key reporting and information provision to the business.
 
In this role you must have a growth mindset with a desire to deliver high quality output for yourself and the team and challenge the status quo. The ability to hit the deck running and contribute quickly will be important.
 
What will you be doing day-to-day?
 
Working on reporting and analytical solutions using Python and SQL skills, scheduling them in Airflow.
 
Performing analysis with key business users to identify the data requirement, sources for the data, and any derivations or business rules to be applied
 
Build and test processes using SQL tools over AWS, Python in Jupyter notebooks, balancing the data as required, and building automated quality checks into the process
 
Scheduling productionised jobs into the existing production schedule using Airflow
 
Working with the AWS Data Lake Engineering and Dev-Ops team to performance tune processes, recommend design changes and validate data
 
The role has these core areas of focus
 
 
Document all solutions being built with clear business requirements and solution.
 
Ensure solution is peer reviewed and signed off by the BI reporting manager
 
Become a key expert in the Big Data toolset for analysis and reporting, driving automation into the Business intelligence team
 
Work with the broader team to convert existing SAS processes to Python using pandas in Jupyter Hub


 
Essential
 
Your Skills and Experience
 
Experience working within a SQL relational development environment , using physical or virtual database systems
 
Knowledge of AWS cloud solutions
 
Analytical and customer focused approach
 
DESIRABLE
 
Knowledge of Python pandas
 
Experience of Juptyer notebooks
 
Your Personal Attributes
 
Loves to code, and proud about code quality.
 
Structured, organised, process driven and outcome oriented
 
Personable, credible, with good interpersonal skills
 
Good interpersonal & written communication skills. Ability to clearly articulate ideas in business-friendly language
 
Self-motivated, able to work in a fast paced environment
 
Strong organizational, planning and time management skills
 
Ability to build strong and effective working relationships on an ongoing basis
 
Ability to adopt company culture and embed into day-to-day interactions
 
Hard-working, keen and upbeat with shown passion and dedication.

job_desc:
Working for a global social app, alongside a high-calibre User Research team. London-based office but open to fully remote - so long as UK-based.
 
My client is looking for a Quantitative Research Analyst Contractor to support their internal research team to continue to provide the right level of support to help the business reach its objectives.
 
Contract will be for 6 months initially. Outside IR35. Up to Â£520 per day.
 
 
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
 
 
This company operates what is essentially an internal research agency â€“ most of their work is done in-house, from briefing to questionnaire creation to scripting to analysis and reporting. This role is primarily to support their senior researchers and research managers. The role includes:
Providing support across the research process. That could mean scripting, detailed analysis or helping to pull together a presentation.
Full engagement as a member of the research team during the time they are in contract. This includes participation in weekly meetings, keeping team up to date on work and generally supporting the team in its objectives.
Help with or take lead on analysis and reporting on both bespoke research projects and large scale data sets which already exist but for which they have limited capacity to interrogate
Depending on experience, there may be some stakeholder engagement with BI teams, their CRM team or possibly the product and marketing teams


 
 
EXPERIENCE NEEDED
 
 
Sampling â€“ Experience designing balanced sampling methodologies accurately measure customers or target audiences (experience using owned sample or client sample is a plus).
Data Analysis â€“ Creating data tables, recoding variables, experience with or a good understanding of weighting. Experience with research analysis tools. Experience with large scale multi-market studies is a plus.
Report Writing â€“ Creating clear reports and charts that bring to life complex data in simple ways. (Google Slides experience preferred. If only PowerPoint experience they would want you to self train in Slides for the job)
Survey Writing â€“ Experience writing ad hoc surveys based on stakeholder briefs strongly desired but not essential.
Survey Scripting experience desirable but not required


 
Software:
 
Q strongly preferred, strong evidence of proficiency in similar analysis tools required. Google Office Suite (Slides, Sheets, Docs)
 
 
ABOUT YOU
 
 
You are comfortable in a fast-paced environment
You are detail-oriented, and maintain the highest standards of accuracy and statistical rigour
You are positive and committed with a â€˜can-doâ€™ attitude and a flexible approach
You are a problem solver and a forward thinker
You are a self-starter: you thrive on taking ownership of initiatives with limited oversight
You have excellent time management skills and you know how to manage multiple priorities, breaking large projects into manageable pieces


 
 
INTERVIEW PROCESS
 
 
1-2 Stages â€“ video calls with the Research Director and potentially more of the team


 
 
If this sounds like you then please apply ASAP with your CV to stand the best chance of getting an interview.
title: Quantitative Research Analyst

Company Description
 
 
At AECOM, weâ€™re delivering a better world.
 
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether itâ€™s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. Weâ€™re one global team â€“ 47,000 strong â€“ driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
 
 
About Digital @AECOM
 
 
As a member of the Europe digital consulting services team you will work with leaders from around the world to define and position the digital consulting services, to share best practices, to leverage global capabilities and to support global opportunities and projects. While services and solution management will be set globally, they will be tailored for implementation within the region and for each client.
 
Job Description
 
 
AECOMâ€™s
 
Data and Analytics Team are looking for a
 
Data Engineer
 
to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams.
 
The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
 
 
Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and Azure â€˜big dataâ€™ technologies.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and regions.
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Showcasing proof points and case studies


Qualifications
 
 
Minimum Requirements:
 
 
 
We are looking for a candidate who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Advanced working SQL/nosql, ADLS, Databricks, ADF, Azure DevOps
Experience building and optimizing â€˜big dataâ€™ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable â€˜big dataâ€™ data stores.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:
 
 
 
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.


Attributes/skills:
 
 
 
Commitment to building a diverse and inclusive team
Self-starter with the ability to work as a positive, energized and adaptable team member
Highly developed written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and influence senior leaders
Extremely strong relationship building skills
Demonstrated ability to champion and drive ideas/programs/solutions
Excellent organizational and time management skills, able to work under pressure and prioritize effectively
Able to demonstrate passion, energy and drive, especially in the face of resistance


Additional Information
 
 
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and thereâ€™s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and youâ€™ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm â€“ access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
 
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. Join us and letâ€™s get started.

job_desc:

Requirements:
 
 
Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis and visualisation tools such as Python, R, or SQL
Experience with both extracting (API/Webscocets) and analysing on-chain data
 
Experience in producing Dune Analytic dashboards or similar
 
Familiarity with cryptocurrency and blockchain markets and data sources
Experience working with large and complex datasets
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills
We Excellent communication and collaboration skills

Experience with dashboard development using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Metabase or others
A Masterâ€™s or PhD degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or similar quantitative/research background is a plus
Deep interest and knowledge of Web 3.0 and blockchain is a must â€“ crypto, NFTs, DAOs
Experience in designing token economies or writing litepapers/whitepapers is a plus
Skilled at modelling and comfortable with building complex spreadsheets/simulations or computer modelsHighly motivated self-starter and fast learn


 
The Perks:
- Dynamic and Multi-cultural work environment (15 nationalities and counting!)
- Token and NFT incentive schemes provided by Animoca Brands

This is a new role for us in the Society and will be responsible for the development, support, administration and documentation of the Societyâ€™s enterprise level databases and data pipelines - most typically using Oracle, Google Cloud Platform (PostgrSQL), Talend ETL and Google Big Query.
 
Working collaboratively across the business you will deliver changes and new data structures to support the work of the Systems Development and Business Intelligence teams as well as providing technical support for business as usual requests relating to the Society's enterprise databases.
 
We know the ways of working are evolving so whilst we are offering this role as a hybrid opportunity trips to our hub will be at key times when the team comes together for core collaboration - this could be as little as once per month.
 
 
Hereâ€™s some of the key work youâ€™ll be doing:
 
Design, implement, and maintain complex data engineering solutions to acquire and prepare data.
 
Create and maintain data pipelines to connect data within and between data stores, applications and organisations.
 
Develop and configure tools to enable automation of database administration tasks.
 
Monitor performance statistics and creating reports.
 
Identify and investigate complex problems/issues and recommend corrective actions.
 
Plan your own data modelling and design activities, selecting appropriate techniques and the correct level of detail for meeting assigned objectives.

Data modelling skills
Experience of applying data quality standards

Share knowledge and experience in your own specialism to help develop others.
Confidence in your ability to make decisions which influence the success of projects and team objectives.


 
So if you thrive in an environment where you facilitate collaboration between stakeholders who share common objectives - weâ€™d love to hear from you!
 
 
Our values:
 
We are compassionate * We are inspirational * We are committed * We are expert * We act with integrity.

Great Annual Leave benefits

Hybrid working
Dog friendly offices
Generous pension scheme
Private healthcare


 
 
We review applications as they are received, so early submissions are highly encouraged. We reserve the right to close this advert once sufficient applications have been screened and progressed.

We strongly believe in being an innovative, diverse, and inclusive organisation and recognise that diversity in all of our people will help achieve that purpose and our mission more effectively. We actively encourage and seek applications from a wide diversity of candidates and in particular welcome applications from minority ethnic, black, and candidates with disabilities, who are currently under-represented at the RSPCA.

job_desc:
Company Description
 
 
At AECOM, weâ€™re delivering a better world.
 
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether itâ€™s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. Weâ€™re one global team â€“ 47,000 strong â€“ driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
 
 
About Digital @AECOM
 
 
As a member of the Europe digital consulting services team you will work with leaders from around the world to define and position the digital consulting services, to share best practices, to leverage global capabilities and to support global opportunities and projects. While services and solution management will be set globally, they will be tailored for implementation within the region and for each client.
 
Job Description
 
 
AECOMâ€™s
 
Data and Analytics Team are looking for a
 
Data Engineer
 
to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams.
 
The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
 
 
Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and Azure â€˜big dataâ€™ technologies.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and regions.
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Showcasing proof points and case studies


Qualifications
 
 
Minimum Requirements:
 
 
 
We are looking for a candidate who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Advanced working SQL/nosql, ADLS, Databricks, ADF, Azure DevOps
Experience building and optimizing â€˜big dataâ€™ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable â€˜big dataâ€™ data stores.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:
 
 
 
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.


Attributes/skills:
 
 
 
Commitment to building a diverse and inclusive team
Self-starter with the ability to work as a positive, energized and adaptable team member
Highly developed written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and influence senior leaders
Extremely strong relationship building skills
Demonstrated ability to champion and drive ideas/programs/solutions
Excellent organizational and time management skills, able to work under pressure and prioritize effectively
Able to demonstrate passion, energy and drive, especially in the face of resistance


Additional Information
 
 
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and thereâ€™s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and youâ€™ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm â€“ access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
 
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. Weâ€™re the worldâ€™s trusted global infrastructure firm, and weâ€™re in this together â€“ your growth and success are ours too.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each personâ€™s potential, and weâ€™ll help you reach yours.
 
Join us and letâ€™s get started.

title: Data Engineer

job_desc:
Company Description
 
YouGov is an international market research and data analytics group.
 
Our mission is to supply a continuous stream of accurate data and insight into what the world thinks, so that companies, governments and institutions can better serve the people and communities that sustain them.
 
We have the best data and the best tools. We continuously challenge conventional approaches to research, and we disrupt our industry to ensure that our clients always get the best solutions.
 
We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics and proven methodologies. We respect and trust each other, and bring these values into everything that we do.
 
Each day, our highly engaged proprietary global panel of over 15 million people provides us with thousands of data points on consumer opinions, attitudes and behaviours. We combine this continuous stream of data with our research expertise to provide insights that enable intelligent decision-making and informed conversations.
 
With operations in the UK, North America, Mainland Europe, the Nordics, the Middle East, India and Asia Pacific, YouGov has one of the worldâ€™s largest research networks.
 
The Culture
 
Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to YouGov. We are committed to giving the world a voice by capturing the opinions of all groups, including the ones that are often under-represented in research. We are also committed to making sure that our products and tools are free from any bias, as accuracy is key to what we do. None of the above can be done without having a truly diverse workforce, in an inclusive workplace. We are very keen on attracting and retaining the best talent. And best talent also means a diverse pool of talent, with various backgrounds and perspectives.
 
Supporting the wellbeing of our staff, including maintaining a good work and life balance, is important to us. We support flexible working arrangements where appropriate for a role, with many locations offering a hybrid office-and-remote working approach.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. All employment decisions are made on the basis of occupational qualifications, merit, and business need.
 
Job Description
 
Your mission is to build high-quality, automated data pipelines and infrastructure to serve YouGovâ€™s syndicated data products, including YouGov Profiles â€” one of the largest market research datasets in the world.
 
Working inside the Syndicated Data Infrastructure team, you will collaborate with data-minded people to convert vast troves of raw consumer data into meaningful insight by developing automated ETL applications, streaming data processors, RESTful microservices and browser-based user interfaces.
 
Day to day you will:
 
 
Build new features for our automated data infrastructure and the associated web interfaces, for example to support new sources of data
Optimise ETL and web applications to increase performance, reliability and visibility
Support existing data pipelines, ensuring every deliverable reaches its intended destination
Collaborate with other teams to design appropriate, automated solutions for new data delivery and integration needs


 
Qualifications
 
You must:
 
 
Love writing beautiful, idiomatic Python
Be comfortable in the modern realm of test-driven, version-controlled software development
Have experience in building substantial ETL pipelines and web applications
Enjoy solving complex technical problems
Be eager to develop new skills and expertise
Be proactive, positive and professional


 
Experience with the following technologies is desirable:
 
 
Luigi, Flask, SQLAlchemy, Pandas
Docker, Kubernetes
JavaScript, HTML, CSS
SQL, Postgres
Redis, RabbitMQ
Amazon S3, EC2, Redshift
Airflow, dbt
Snowflake


 
Additional Information
 
This role can be based in the UK or any EU country in which we have an entity (Spain, Italy, Poland, Germany to name a few) and is 100% remote.
 
To find out how we collect and use your personal data when you apply for a role at YouGov, please read our privacy notice at https://jobs.yougov.com/privacy
