title: Data Analyst

job_desc:
Find your Future with Amazon Apprenticeships

Investment in Apprentices is in our DNA. We look to constantly innovate and create. In order to do this, we recognize that whilst technology is a partner, itâ€™s our people that power us.

We offer a broad range of Apprenticeship opportunities to suit all candidates with different backgrounds, qualifications and career aspirations, so whether you are embarking on your career or want a change of direction, we have an Apprenticeship program for you, that will support your development in an innovative environment.

Weâ€™re looking for those with a passion for learning. Youâ€™ll need to be committed to your own development whilst implementing what you are learning as you progress through your program. In return we provide first class on the job coaching, specialist partner training and unparalleled experiences. Youâ€™ll be working within a diverse, innovative environment where you will be challenged to excel and contribute.

You will be working with one of our logistics teams, adding value to improve the customer experience within delivery operations

Apply today to be part of the story.

Key job responsibilities

As a working student your primary focus is to complete your studies by learning and developing your skills, knowledge and behaviors to work towards successful graduation. You will be set objectives and goals by your training provider and hiring team to support your studies.

A day in the life

Your role is to ascertain how data can be used in order to answer questions and solve problems. You will be responsible for requirement-gathering, inspecting, cleansing, transforming and modelling data with the goal of discovering useful information, informing conclusions and supporting decision-making. You will need to have strong communication skills as you will be liaising and sharing your work with different stakeholders. You will also need a good eye for details as you will be working with a lot of data and information that requires accuracy when handling the workload.

Across the program youâ€™ll develop and gain skills in the following areas:
 
 
 
Implement the stages of the data analysis lifecycle
 
apply principles of data classification within data analysis activity
 
analyze data sets taking account of different data structures and database designs
 
assess the impact on user experience and domain context on data analysis activity
 
identify data sources and the risks and challenges to combination within data analysis activity
 
select and apply the most appropriate data tools to achieve the optimum outcome
 
Plus, many more.
 


As a Data Analyst Apprentice at Amazon, youâ€™ll gain a vast range of useful experiences and skills. You will work towards the L6 Data Analyst apprenticeship standard and also work towards the BSc (Hons) in Digital & Technology Solutions.

You will build your skills over a 36-month period, starting in September, which will help you develop personally and professionally. Your apprenticeship will be made up of;
 
 
 
Classroom/virtual based training to cover knowledge
 
On-the-job training at your Amazon base location â€“ either within a corporate office or in an operations warehouse
 
Online learning
 
Mentoring from our experienced team members
 


Alongside extensive development of your technical skills, you will also grow your abilities in crucial complementary areas like organization, prioritization, data and problem-solving techniques, teamwork, communication, presentation skills and document writing.

You will work alongside the team, supporting with day to day tasks learning how Amazon works and delivers for its customers. As your knowledge and skills increase over the duration of the scheme you will have opportunities to be part of and lead projects, making a difference for customers. The on the job experience will help you build a portfolio of evidence towards your apprenticeship. You will be given dedicated time to focus on your studies to help you stay on track and work towards successfully completing your qualification(s). Once you have successfully completed your Data Analyst Degree Apprenticeship you will be able to apply for relevant roles across the business.

You will attend a number of workshops across the duration of the apprenticeship, workshops will be a mix of face to face and online delivery by a training provider. You will also attend internal workshops/ trainings to support you in developing Amazon related skills and knowledge. Depending on the scheme and location of the training provider you may be required to travel and stay overnight. (costs will be supported by Amazon)

The Working Environment

You will be working in either one of our operations warehouses or at one our corporate offices both of which are incredibly fast paced and dynamic, successful candidates will therefore be required to maintain a flexible approach to change and be comfortable dealing with ambiguity, which will allow you to thrive in either of these environments.
 
Amazon is the perfect place to start your career as Data Analyst. Our Data Analyst apprentices can work across a number of tech and non tech teams in Amazon supporting the business team in completing ad hoc data requests and analyses as needed, develop reporting using Tableau and Quick sight for repetitive data tasks where data pipelines/queries are already in place (concessions, CS metrics, operations), automation of manual processes and undertaking deep dive on metrics to help the business team understand metric changes, utilizing trend analysis.
 
Candidates should be 18 years or over before the start date and have the right to live and work in England

For the apprenticeship program we prioritize applicants eligible to government funding for their apprenticeship and for this you need to:
 
 
Have lived in the UK or in the European Economic Area (EEA) for the last 3 years
Be a resident of the UK for the entire duration of the program
Not be registered to study on a UK government funded course ending August 2023 or later
 


 
2 A Level passes (A-E) in 1 or more STEM subject, or
BTEC extended diploma in a similar subject or STEM T-Level Grades in a similar subject, or
Level 3 Apprenticeship at Pass in an appropriate discipline
 


Note: â€œSimilar subjectâ€ relates to areas directly relevant to STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) subjects

Please not, if you have received educational qualifications outside of the UK then we will require a Statement of Comparability to confirm your eligibility for the scheme. Please ensure you obtain one during the application process, through UK ENIC: https://www.enic.org.uk/

Note: This Apprenticeship assumes the candidate has some or little knowledge/ experience of the occupation, and is NOT suitable for candidates who already have a similar or higher-level qualification in the same or similar subject of the apprenticeship. If you already have related qualifications or 2 years plus experience in this field please visit amazon.jobs
 
Preferred Qualifications

Ideal applicants will already possess a solid foundation of knowledge within the IT field.

They will have a passion for data analysis, as well as be able to demonstrate proficiency with Microsoft Office products including Outlook, Excel and Word.

Application Process

Your recruitment process will start with your online application (providing your CV as well as answering questions about the above basic qualifications) and will then take you onto online testing.

As a last step, we will invite successful candidates to an assessment center where they will participate in a group exercise, execute a practical exercise and get a chance to present their profile, motivation and skills 1-on-1 during interviews or presentations.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need an adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please contact the Applicant-Candidate Accommodation Team (ACAT), Monday through Friday from 7:00 am GMT - 4:00 pm GMT. If calling directly from the United Kingdom, please dial +44 800 086 9884 (tel:+448000869884). If calling from Ireland, please dial +353 1800 851 489 (tel:+3531800851489).
 
Company
 
- Amazon UK Services Ltd.

job_desc:
Come join us to design and build a ground-breaking approach to Life & Health (L&H) Valuation!
 
We aim to build a fully automated production process that continuously updates valuation results with the latest actuarial assumption and cedent data. The team will be working with experts from different business areas and specializations to deliver the benefits of real-time financial updates, reduced work effort and increase in value-added analysis.
 
 
This is a one-year intern role based in London.
 
We are looking for a hardworking and motivated individual to join as an Actuarial Intern. In this role you will help shape the future of financial reporting in L&H Reinsurance at Swiss Re. This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a successful team across a varied reinsurance business.
 
You will be working as an Actuarial Intern in the Global Actuarial Systems and Process team alongside qualified actuaries and other actuarial students.
 
 
 
Making actuarial (e.g. assumptions) and business recommendations based upon data analysis
Contributing to improving the efficiency and quality of reinsurance reporting processes.

Teamwork; willing to support the team to meet changing priorities and requirements. Able to build effective working relationships with colleagues in other teams and across technical fields.
Curiosity and problem-solving approach.

job_desc:
Data Quality Analyst
Permanent, Full-time [34.5 hours]
 
Location: Home-based
 
Salary: Â£31,500 - Â£35,500
 
Are you passionate about the value and impact of data? Do you want to use your analytical skills to improve operational data, processes and effectiveness, for a team that supports front lines services for people affected by cancer across the UK? If this sounds like you, read on.
 
About the role
Our Data, Quality and Process Team is looking to recruit a new talented member. This role is part of our operations team and involves undertaking analysis and reporting of operational insight, performance, processes and quality measures, across many platforms. Further to this leading on the continuous improvement activity of data collection, data quality and stakeholder experiences of data processes. In turn ensure we deliver accurate insight to our stakeholders as and when they need it to inform operational decision making.
 
In this role you will also support the development and maintenance of our data, quality frameworks and dashboards for analysis of the operational workflows, performance, processes and impact.
 
About you
To be successful in this role you will have strong analytical experience. Be a self-starter who can work as part of a team and independently. Have strong initiative and ability to learn new systems. Have a positive, can-do attitude and be adaptable to working in a changing environment. We are looking for someone with the following experience and skills:
 
Excellent IT skills and in particular Excel to an advanced level.
A working knowledge of Power Query or PowerBI systems or other technical analysis tools would be also be desirable.
Experience of creating operational visual tools, dashboards and reports.
Experience in analysing and reporting data and insight.
Analytical skills to manage and resolve complex and ongoing data integrity issues.
A high level of numeracy and attention to detail.
Great communication skills and experience in stakeholder collaboration.


 
About us
 
Our values are at the heart of who we are and everything we do, inspiring our thinking and guiding our actions. We strive to build a more diverse organisation, where everyone feels empowered to be their best self to work.
 
We welcome applications from everyone who meets the criteria and strongly encourage individuals to apply who have a disability, impairment or health condition or individuals who identify as Black, Asian or from another ethnic minority background, as these groups are currently under-represented at Macmillan. Our Equity, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy, along with our internal employee representation body, â€˜Our Voiceâ€™ and 8 Employee Network groups help us promote fairness and belonging, becoming an engaged and inclusive organisation for all our people.
 
 
So we can support you to be your best during the application or interview process, please contact Macmillan People Services Team on Peopleservices@macmillan.org.uk for advice and recruitment adjustments.
 
 
Recruitment Process
The application deadline is Sunday 5th of March 2023, with virtual interviews aiming to be on Tuesday 14th of March 2023 (but maybe subject to change).
 
In order to ensure fairness and consistency to select the best candidate for this role, all of our applications are anonymised up until an interview has been confirmed, so that shortlisting is based solely upon the suitability of the candidateâ€™s experience.
 
Please submit your application as soon as possible as we reserve the right to change the closing date of our vacancies.

Location Middle Engine Lane/Newcastle and home working
Salary band 6 â€“ Â£25,707 â€“ Â£27,690
 
Are you an experienced data analyst and research assistant looking for your next challenge?
 
Do you have strong analysis and research skills?
 
Do you have the ability to translate data into meaningful insight?
 
Our Corporate Development Department is at the forefront of developing the Performance Framework across Northumbria Police. We provide performance data and insight to executive and operational levels to support delivery of the Forceâ€™s strategic objectives
 
An excellent opportunity has arisen to join our Corporate Development Department as a Data Analyst and Research Assistant.
 
This is an exciting time to join a team that leads on the development and analysis of business intelligence to inform organisational change and Force improvement. It also supports the Forceâ€™s performance management framework, ensuring that organisational risks to performance are identified.
 
What will I be doing?
 
 
Provide research and analytical support to the department, in order to facilitate the development, maintenance and delivery of effective and quality data reporting, research and analysis.

What do I need?

Ability to utilise data to problem solve and create opportunities for improvement.

job_desc:
Job Description


GHD Insights & Analytics â€“ Graduate Advisor, Data Science and Analytics, UK Region


Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the worldâ€™s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation.


We are seeking people with curious minds and who have a passion for data-driven problem-solving to join and shape our growing Insights & Analytics team. You will support delivery of some of the most challenging and exciting problems within the sector, from Rail and Highways to Telecoms and Future Energy. Hence, experience or passion in pursuing economic and community enhancements in infrastructure is key.


As we are a small team, your responsibilities will vary across the entire project lifecycle. We operate a start-up mentality and pace, with the support and resources of a global corporate. As a result, you must be comfortable working in an agile and evolving environment. You will be expected to bring fresh ideas based on your previous experience and contribute to shaping our team from both a cultural and technical perspective. In return we will support and encourage you to develop your capability and experience across many sectors, giving you the freedom to explore and pioneer your interests across a broad project and client base.


 Graduate Development at GHD 


You will be part of the Graduate Development Program which is an integrated approach to developing future leaders and technical specialists.


During the two-year program, you will learn about our business and our values, your team, and most importantly, yourself. You will develop your decision-making, communication, technical and leadership skills. We offer mentoring and a variety of development activities, providing on the job experience and exposure to a diverse range of projects.


 Your anticipated responsibilities include: 


 Supporting technical project delivery 
 Structuring, performing, and overseeing domain-centric analyses 
 Exploring and modelling financial, economic, engineering and/or operational data develop insight and test hypothesis 
 Understanding and considering the impact of technical delivery within the client organisation 
 Clear and concise presentation of results through a variety of mediums, adapting the level of technical content to suit the intended audience 
 Supporting the team with identifying, pursuing and securing additional opportunities for work that will deliver tangible customer benefit 
 Articulating your views and honest perspectives through active listening and engaged participation 
 Actively engaging with team growth activities and operational tasks 
 Pursuing, with support, opportunities to improve your technical and non-technical skills 
 
 About you: 


To deliver against these responsibilities you will demonstrate:


 Studies in a relevant subject including but not limited to data science, computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, operational research, information management 
 Understanding of statistical methods and concepts such as regression-based techniques, quantifying and evaluating uncertainly, sampling methods and probability distributions 
 Previous use of one or more data engineering/science languages, preferably, Python, R, or SQL in both a data manipulation and programming capacity, experience with data visualisation programmes 


It will support your application if you can also demonstrate 
any combination of
 the following technical skills:


 Preparing deliverables such as analytical reports, dashboards, or presentations 
 Domain-driven and hypothesis-driven data analytics and modelling 
 Contributions and improvements to project templates, documentation, and technical playbooks 
 Version control (preferably though git) 
 Requirements capturing 
 
 What we offer 


We offer a professional, friendly and inclusive culture based on our core values of Safety, Teamwork, Respect and Integrity.


We are committed to the success of our people which is why we want to create the best employee experience that supports each member through all the stages of their career.


 A competitive salary 
 A comprehensive benefits package; pension, medical insurance, income protection, 25 days holiday with the option to buy an additional 4 weeks 
 Enhanced parental leave 
 Voluntary benefits designed to suit your lifestyle â€“ cycle to work, discounted gym membership, season ticket loan, discounts on retail & wellbeing classes 
 Access to our Employee Network Groups, which represent every strand of diversity and allow colleagues to connect and learn from each other on an open, inclusive platform 
 Wellbeing resources and tools, and demonstration of our commitment to wellbeing by signing up to the Mental Health at Work Commitment 
 Team led flexible working 
 Attractive career options including professional development via our GHD Business School 
 Opportunities to grow your skills and shape your career towards technical expertise, developing the market or leading a business or team. 
 International, multi-cultural team of highly motivated individuals 
 An exciting referral program; bring people with you! 
 
 About GHD 


Being the best that we can be is in our culture.


We are a team of inquisitive, innovative, and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come.


 Our commitment to you 


 Commitment 
 is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business.


 Equality, diversity, and inclusion lies at the heart of our team culture 
 . We operate a flat intellectual hierarchy meaning every voice is heard and has genuine influence. We believe deeply in diversity of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin, and experience, and we recognise the value this brings our collective team approach to solving challenging client problems.


 Inclusion 
 is hugely important to us and we want to ensure every team member can balance work around their unique personal circumstances. In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a wide variety of benefits to support you, including: 24 days paid leave with opportunity to purchase additional leave, matched pension contributions and family-friendly flexible working. We will advocate for your professional development and provide access to formal education through the GHD Business School and practical application through technical delivery. We actively promote 
inclusion-focussed initiatives
, with the most recent example being the 
STEMazing accelerator
 mentoring programme for women in STEM.


 What next? 


If shortlisted, our interview approach is a two-way learning experience. We will give you access to the leadership team and technical leads throughout the application process.


For more information about GHDâ€™s Insights & Analytics offering, and bios of selected team members, visit our page at: https://www.ghd.com/en/expertise/strategic-insights.aspx


About Us


Why GHD?


Being the best we can be is in our culture.


We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come.


 More about Life and Work @GHD 


Our commitment to you


Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business.


 Our Commitment to you 


Who we are


We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation . GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly â€˜One GHDâ€™ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents â€“ Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.


 GHD Expertise and Service Lines 


Organization


GHD Advisory


Our Advisory practice supports clients throughout their business lifecycle from capital deployment, investment optimisation and value preservation through to resilience and liability transformation. We create value and a competitive edge for our clientâ€™s businesses by delivering commercially driven outcomes.

Summary
 
We are the public body that looks after Englandâ€™s historic environment. We champion historic places, helping people understand, value and care for them.
 
Join us at Historic England as our SharePoint Online Project Administrator and Data Analyst working in our Information Management and Technology Departments.

We are an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusion. If you have a disability or neurodiversity, we would be happy to discuss reasonable adjustments to the job with you.

Why work for Historic England
 
We offer a wide benefits package including a competitive pension scheme starting at 26% contributions, a generous 28 days holiday, corporate discounts, free entry into English Heritage sites across the country and development opportunities to ensure you achieve your goals.
 
We are committed to promoting equality of opportunity for everyone. Diversity helps us to perform better and attract more people to support our work. We welcome and encourage job applications from people of all backgrounds.

Quantexa
 
Start Date: 31st March 2023

Do you relish a challenge and want to take your coding experience to the next level? Do you want to work for an innovative company that has received national recognition for their diversity and inclusion efforts? We want to hear from you!
 
 
Xander Talent:
 
 
We are a rapidly growing young firm, just starting our scale-up year! This is an exciting time to join our consultancy and become a part of our expansion.
 
Xander Talent is an emerging consulting business, but our vision goes beyond consultancy.
 
 
As a company who
 
balances profit and social purpose
, our mission is to work with organisations to
 
create an environment that is truly diverse and inclusive
. We were founded by experienced consultants who are passionate about delivering blended teams that are diverse, resilient, and meet our clients capability requirements.

Who/What is Quantexa?
 
 
Quantexa was built with a purpose that through a greater understanding of data and context, better decisions can be made. Their award winning technology manages, transforms and cleanses high volume data, helping clients solve business problems in the area of fraud, compliance and financial crime. Their internationally acclaimed products process huge volumes of data with the ultimate aim of detecting anomalous and suspicious activity. The user interface they provide enables users to conduct complex investigations into fraud and financial crime cases and visualise complex networks of criminal activity.
 
 
Reasons to Apply:
 
 
 
Free Training
 
- This is a fully funded hybrid training programme, so we take on the cost of your training but you would require you to support yourself financially during your 9-week training academy (after the 2 week onboarding our Quantexa programme is self-study).

for the workplace, such as resilience, curiosity, stakeholder and project management.
 
Client Placement -

- you will not be required to travel/relocate outside of Greater London.
 
Support
 
â€“ Within Xander, we understand that for some individuals, undertaking a new career can be daunting. Through our People Team, we support you at every step of the way. Our mental health support, incentives, exercise classes and social opportunities show that we care! Your journey with us is for the full 2 years post training not just the Academy.
 
Inclusivity
 
â€“ Our core value at Xander Talent is balancing social purpose and profit. We evidence this through our flexible and adaptive environment, which embraces diversity. Donâ€™t take our word for it, find out what our consultants have to say https://www.xandertalent.com/case-studies/. What we are looking for:
 
 
 
You donâ€™t have to have a degree
 
but if not, you will come from a STEM background, have relevant commercial experience and/or have attended a programming bootcamp.
 
You will have a passion for technology
, with strong experience in a programming language, such as: Python, Scala, SQL, Cloud (AWS/GCP), PowerBI/Tableau. Donâ€™t worry, you donâ€™t have to be experienced in all these languages â€“ proficiency in one these languages, or something similar, will be enough. Python/Scala preferred
 
You will be proactive in learning new technologies and their practical applications

The climate crisis means that now, more than ever, we need to act.
 
Here at Piclo, we believe we are not powerless against climate change and are focused on enabling the transition to a decarbonised future. Our team is on a mission to make our energy systems smart, flexible and sustainable.
 
Weâ€™re hiring a Data Engineer to work alongside our friendly team of data engineers, software developers, product managers, designers and more that are at the forefront of transforming the energy sector.
 
Who we are looking for
 
Weâ€™re looking for a Data Engineer to work on our data and analytics services. Our data stack is based in AWS and utilises a range of cloud technologies to coordinate data ETL processes. The platform software stack comprises a single-page app and a microservice backend running on serverless infrastructure.
 
In a typical week, you will be central to developing our ability to make better, data-led decisions and handle ever increasing volumes of data. At Piclo, the Data team is an enablement team, and as such you will be expected to collaborate with the majority of the other teams within the organisation.
 
About you
Our ideal candidate meets many - but not necessarily all - of the below criteria:

You are an excellent communicator who can build relationships with teammates from different disciplines, making sure that everyone is clear about whatâ€™s required of them.
 
Youâ€™re fluent in English, even if itâ€™s not your first language.


 
Also desirable:
 
You have worked with cloud-based platforms such as AWS.
You have specific experience with PostgreSQL, AWS RDS/Aurora, docker, serverless architecture, microservices.
You have experience with NoSQL, event stream processing, data lakes.
You are familiar with BI tooling (e.g. Tableau, Looker) fundamentals, or willing to learn.
You have a background / interest in advanced data science concepts such as machine learning.


 
About the role
As a member of the Data team, you will be central to developing our data analytics infrastructure to deliver accurate data in order to support the wider business.
 
Responsibilities will include the following:
 
Building and maintaining our internal data warehouse (we use AWS and Postgres) and support associated business analytics tools (we use Tableau and Looker Data Studio).
Innovating on our infrastructure and the technical implementation underpinning our data projects.
Advise and assist both internal and external stakeholders with data processing and analytics.
Communicate and document solutions and design decisions.
This role will be expected to align with our standards for information security and quality as they are relevant to the role.


 
What we can offer
 
 
Â£57-81k, with standard share options and bonus scheme
25 days holiday (plus Bank Holidays)
35 hour week - with flexible working hours (within core business hours)
Hybrid working - with a minimum requirement to come into the office twice per month, to meet with your team
 
Life Assurance, Income Protection and private Healthcare with Vitality (medical history disregarded)
A monthly expense budget for the extra kit or tools you might need to get your job done to the best of your abilities at home
 
Annual allowance to spend on professional development
Regular off-site - where the whole company gets together
A super welcoming, supportive, collaborative and transparent culture where the priority is to help shape your role to find the best balance between what we need as a business and your career progression plans.


 
Who we are
Founded in 2013 by Andy, Alice and James, we are a quickly growing
 
team
 
of +60. Backed by Clean Growth Fund and Mott MacDonald Ventures, Piclo is a tech company poised to disrupt the way that electricity grids are run worldwide.
 
Piclo Flex
 
is the leading independent marketplace that enables technologies, such as electric vehicles, to provide flexibility to electricity grids. With the rise in demand for renewables and clean technologies, our grids come under more stress and face challenges in maintaining the delicate balance of supply and demand. Piclo Flex smooths out the complex transition, delivering low-cost and resilient grids.
 
We know â€œflexibilityâ€ can be quite complex to understand at first, hereâ€™s a short video that explains â€œ
what are flexibility services
?
â€
 
Inclusivity
Our team welcomes everyone to work together on our mission. We are all in this together after all. We donâ€™t believe that anyone should be discriminated against for any reason, be that age, nationality, gender, race, sexual preferences, religious beliefs, political leanings or disabilities. We welcome diversity among our colleagues and see it as important that everyone is supported and comfortable working with us. Piclo is expanding internationally, so English doesnâ€™t have to be your first language, but we would like you to be fluent.
 
How to apply and interview process
To apply, email jobs@piclo.energy with â€˜Data Engineerâ€™ in the subject line (or click the Apply button below) and tell us about your skills and experience, and why you think youâ€™d be a good fit for this role.
 
 
Please include either a copy of your CV, the URLs for your personal site or Linkedin profile, as well as URLs to any relevant public repositories that might support your application. Please note that, at this stage, weâ€™re more interested in hearing why you think youâ€™re a good match for us and the role.
 
We conduct interviews in three stages
 
Introductory call: weâ€™ll invite you for a short video call to discuss your experience and what youâ€™re looking for in your next role.
 
Challenge: If successful, applicants will be invited to complete a challenge relevant to the skills required in your role
Final interview: if successful, applicants will then be invited to a final, in-depth interview to meet additional members of the team

An exciting new opportunity has arisen within a global sales organisation for a talented Data Analyst, with excellent report building skills with Power BI. This role will be sitting on the sales floor within their IT department, in a unique, fast-paced, lively environment.

job_desc:
THE FIRM
 
Walkers is a leading international law and professional services firm providing legal, corporate and fiduciary services to global corporations, financial institutions, capital market participants and investment fund managers. With a global presence spanning the Americas, Europe, the Middle East and Asia, we advise on the jurisdictions of Bermuda, the British Virgin Islands, the Cayman Islands, Guernsey, Ireland and Jersey.
 
Walkers treat everyone as the intelligent grown-ups they are. We take a grown-up approach to getting the job done â€“ trusting and empowering our people to deliver consistently, and enabling them to succeed. Diversity is our secret weapon â€“ itâ€™s the sheer breadth of Walkers people that makes us who we are â€“ gathered from across the globe and fluent in languages, jurisdictions and cultures that help us to mirror our clients and keep our own thinking in tune with the world we operate in.
 
 
The HR Team operates globally, led by the firm's Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) based in the London office. The team supports the firm's law firm business and professional services business (registered office, corporate and fiduciary services).
 
THE ROLE
 
 
 
The HR Data Analyst is a new role, supporting the HR Business Systems Lead in the strategic replacement of the firm's HR system enabled by simplified, standardised, global processes supported by a global system accessible anytime, anywhere, on any device, and in the ongoing support of the HR system after the completion of the transformation project.
 
This is an exciting opportunity to use continuous improvement and process optimisation skills and industry knowledge to deliver business value by identifying opportunities for improved efficiency and service to our people.
 
The role will help ensure the HR strategy is adequately supported by the new HR system, working directly with HR leadership, Project Management Office, and other key stakeholders to ensure timely delivery and enhancements to the system. During the HR system replacement project, the HR Data Analyst will work closely with the HR Systems Lead providing project support, working on a backlog of essential tasks to build and refine the delivery of transformation and services that underpin the organisationsâ€™ HR operations, with specific focus on data migration.
 
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
 
 
Responsible for supporting the data migration including data collection, data cleanse and data loading during the HRIS transformation project
Responsible for defining and supporting the implementation of reporting requirements
Responsible for data analysis, reporting and visualisation
Identify, manage and resolve critical information and data quality issues.
Responsible for HR data management
Responsible for reviewing current HR metrics and reporting provisions
Responsible for the management of data in and out of the HRIS
Responsible for understanding the wider HR agenda in order to provide relevant insights
Provide subject matter expertise to solve functional incidents and problems in the digital solutions, and contribute to solution release changes and improvement activities.


 
KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE
 
 
 
HR data analysis experience
HR reporting experience
HR data migration experience
HR transformation / HR system migrations
HR system management in BAU
The ability to interpret and present data in a simple and meaningful way, with experience of storytelling using metrics and using data to make informed recommendations
Agile delivery / Continuous Improvement / Lean


 
TECHNICAL / PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
 
 
Advanced Excel & data analysis skills
Ideally, database / SQL experience including MS Access
HR systems knowledge such as Workday, SAP or Oracle.


 
 
EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES
 
Walkers global is an equal opportunity employer. Equality and diversity are key to our global identity and an integral part of our goal to continue being an employer of choice. We are committed to a work environment that supports all individuals irrespective of gender, ethnicity, nationality, race, religion, marital status, age, disability, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other applicable legally protected characteristics. We make every effort to ensure that employment opportunities are open and accessible to all purely on the basis of personal ability.
 
Please note that Walkers will not accept any applications received from agencies at this time. Only candidates selected for interview will be contacted.

The role:
 
Graduate Product Analyst
 
We are looking for a
 
Graduate Product Analyst
 
 
to join the growing Analytics team in our Leeds office.
 
Are you our next star player?
 
"Data driven product decisions are key in improving and measuring the quality of the poker product and our customers experience."
 
â€“ Sjors, Product Manager
 
We want to understand all aspects of the customer journey. We want to know what our players enjoy and which parts of our product we should improve. As a Product Analyst you will be the analytical partner to our product managers and owners. You will be a key contributor in the on-going improvement of our product by combining data analytics with the industry knowledge of our product managers/owners.

Data Engineer


Location: Work From Home - UK Permanent Contract: Full Time (37.5 hours)


Williams Lea seeks a Data Engineer to join our team!


Williams Lea is the leading global provider of skilled business-critical support services to financial, legal and professional services firms.


Sound good so far? Then this is the perfect position for you and you are just the individual that we are looking for!


The Data Engineer will create and maintain reporting data stores, data pipelines, and transformations that support business critical reports for internal and external customers. The Data Engineer works collaboratively with the Data & Analytics team as well as other technical SMEs to solve organizational problems through reporting data products, analysis, and data visualization. The Data Engineer will provide enterprise-wide expertise on ETL and data storage best practice including query logic, automation, optimization, and integration. The candidate will need to be a creative problem-solver, contribute to the entire life cycle of product development, and be able to maintain organized environment documentation. These reports will be used at the highest levels of the organization for making decisions that contribute to net revenue gains. The successful candidate will be an individual contributor, self-starter, and comfortable working in a global environment.


Key Responsibilities


Participate in requirements gathering and feasibility analysis
Design, develop, and maintain reporting data stores, data pipelines, and transformation packages supporting internal reports as well as reports embedded in client-facing portal
Create and maintain a homogenous self-service reporting environment integrated with multiple source systems
Continuously maintain knowledge of the latest developments in ETL tools, capability, and best practices.


Personal Attributes


Team player with ability to communicate and interact at all levels of the business
Capable of working through competing priorities and delivering on time
Drive, energy, and enthusiasm
Ability to find solutions to problems by thinking â€œoutside of the boxâ€
Continually develops self and domain expertise
Resilience and flexibility
Self-managed and disciplined

Ability to work unsupervised and on own initiative - a self-starter who can manage their time effectively against the objectives of the assigned projects
Clear, confident, and professional communicator


Qualifications and Experience


3-5 years experience designing, building, and maintaining relational databases, complex queries, stored procedures, and data models in cloud computing environment.
1+ years experience with AWS cloud services including RDS and Redshift
1+ years experience cloud ETL tools such as AWS Glue or Azure Data Factory
Advanced proficiency with SQL required
Experience connecting various source systems using APIs and/or ETL pipelines required
Experience with metadata tools such as Collibra, a plus
Experience with Power BI or other enterprise BI platforms, a plus
Experience with Python / R, a plus
Knowledge of Agile development principles


Competencies


Ability to convert business requirements into functional requirements
Excellent logical decision-making capabilities
Adaptability and ability to manage stressful situations
Strong communication skills, both written and oral
Ability to communicate complex ideas in simple, easy to understand terms
Business analysis and problem-solving skills

Private Medical Insurance, Life Insurance/Life Assurance, Company Pension, Corporate Eye Care, Personal Accident and Company Sick Pay. Additional benefits such as Dental Insurance, Childcare Vouchers, Gym Membership, Charity Donations, Employee Offers, Retail Vouchers and Season Ticket Loan are offered at a discount on a salary sacrifice basis. You will also have the opportunity to work for a global employer; and dedicated to offering each and every employee an enjoyable, challenging and rewarding career with future career development prospects.
The Company values the differences that a diverse workforce brings to the organisation and will not discriminate because of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race (which includes colour, nationality and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation (each of these being a â€œprotected characteristicâ€ in discrimination law). It will not discriminate because of any other irrelevant factor and will build a culture that values openness, fairness and transparency.

job_desc:
As the UKâ€™s leading provider of environmental compliance, Valpak strives to work together towards a profitable, sustainable, waste-free world. To date, our teams work in partnership with more than 400 customers, in nearly every corner of the globe.
 
You will assist in driving this goal by supporting the delivery of accurate and timely data declarations as specified by environmental legislation and voluntary commitments. You will help support our customers to comply with environmental legislation and give insights to the packaging they handle, allowing them to make meaningful changes with confidence.
 
The International Data Consultant will work alongside our International Compliance Advisors/Consultants who act as the customer facing touchpoint, to ensure all international data submissions are submitted to a high standard. The successful candidate will be responsible for manipulating and collating final data submissions under a variety of different country regulations, including but not limited to, waste packaging, waste electrical and electronics (WEEE), waste batteries and textiles. With support from International Compliance Advisors/Consultants, they will quickly develop a good knowledge of the relevant environmental waste compliance regulations, ensuring that all international data obligations are met for accounts.
 
 
The candidate will work closely with the International Compliance Advisors/Consultants and will maintain a good knowledge of the relevant account in order to ensure data submitted to the relevant authorities complies with legal requirements and regulations. They will also work together to ensure that the customer is receiving a high level of service overall.
 
 
The ideal candidate will be confident working in both a busy team environment and on their own initiative. As a newly developed team, this will be an exciting opportunity to develop and contribute towards a rapidly growing Valpak service.
 
 
Management Of Data for Allocated Accounts
 
 
Work alongside the customer facing account manager to ensure that international compliance data is accurate and submitted on time
 
Work with the UK data team to ensure all data submissions are completed to a high standard
 
Ensure that all required environmental data (including but not limited to weights information) is collated appropriately
 
Ensure data received from customer contains necessary information
May involve some telephone/email support to suppliers
 


Data Cleansing and Maintenance
 
 
Become an export in utilising in house software system (EPIC) which inputs and analyses weights information
 
Manipulate data into relevant format for each country/regulation
Use various tools to consistently check and improve on the accuracy of international data
 
Use data skills to provide useful information for accounts such as swings analysis and trends
 


Maintain a strong knowledge of the international environmental regulations across a variety of countries
 
Work alongside the International Compliance Advisors/Consultants to understand and maintain a strong knowledge of data requirements and scoping in relevant countries
Develop and maintain a good knowledge of activities and obligations for relevant accounts
Perform data checks for all accounts, to ensure all submissions are as accurate as possible and consistently improved
 


Contribute to consistently improving and innovating the International Data Service
 
Proactively seek out opportunities to make efficiencies and further develop the service
Inspect and advance current procedures
Optimise data automation practices


 
 
Advanced IT skills, particularly Microsoft Excel (VBA or other coding knowledge desirable)
Ability to quickly take on large quantities of technical information
Excellent planning, scheduling, and organization skills
A customer focused approach
Collaborative working style
Solution orientated problem-solving ability
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
A knowledge of analysing and manipulating large volumes of data is desirable
An interest in environmental issues is desirable
Educated to Degree Level


 
 
Dual Location / Hybrid worker Status
Participation in our annual Incentive Plan (VIP) - up to 10% bonus
25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Option to buy and sell up to 10 days annual leave
 
Access to voluntary benefits including private medical insurance, cycle to work scheme, subsidised gym membership
 
Automatic inclusion in Life Assurance, Critical Illness and Disability Income protection schemes
Pension scheme up to 8% employer contribution
Access to reward & discount platform
Wellbeing initiatives
 
Volunteering day
 


 
We reserve the right to bring forward the closing date of our job vacancies if we receive a suitable number of high-quality applications from which to make a shortlist. We recommend that you apply for our roles as soon as possible rather than wait until the published closing date.

job_desc:
JOB TITLE: Data Engineer
 
POSTING END DATE: 31/03/2023
 
LOCATION: Gaydon
 
LINE MANAGER: Baljinder Ghuman
 
SALARY: Competitive
 
The successful candidate for the above role will retain their current employer, i.e. if you are a Jaguar employee you will continue to be administered on the Jaguar grading structure with the associated terms and conditions. If you are currently on BAC or EMC terms, you will retain your current employer but will transfer to a JLR contract and the associated terms and conditions.
 
WHAT TO EXPECT:
 
To enable Jaguar Land Rover to meet future sales volumes and customer delivery expectations, in this unprecedented era of global supply chain disruption, our Enterprise needs live, accurate & precise insights derived from our data on which to make decisions in this highly dynamic period. It is critical that we have access to these insights at all times and shift our approach from insight generation based on offline / batch data analysis to online /live data insights.
 
The newly forming Supply Chain Reporting & Insights Team is responsible for providing analytics and actionable insight to the Supply Chain Planning team, in the context of the wider Industrial Operations Function. This Reporting & Insights team will seek to support the relevant supply chain, purchasing and manufacturing teams in determining supply chain best practise and optimise issues such as inventory turn & dwell (sub-component, tier 1 & finished vehicle) at each of the stages along the E2E supply chain to maximise supply performance to meet current demand. The focus of the team is to work with all teams to provide a holistic journey both in terms of providing the analytics to help set rules to optimise the plan, make & buy value creation stage but also guide on the reporting technology required to support this.
 
This role will be responsible for reviewing the current data infrastructure around the end to end supply chain function, supporting the development, design and delivery of key reports, dashboards through creating and implementing data pipelines and maintaining a single source of truth dataset.
 
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
This role will see you working with the wider Reporting & Insights team to maximise the use of available analytics and reporting technology. You will be involved with creating data pipelines, engineering data to help drive business improvement across the end-to-end supply chain â€“ from suppliers to end customers.
 
WHAT YOU'LL NEED:
 
The ideal candidate will have relevant previous experience in Project Management and Agile working in sprints as well as knowledge of the latest technology, data sources and methodologies with a view to driving best-in-class reporting & insights.
 
Essential Skills
 
 
 
Experience of designing data models / data architecture
 
 
Previous experience and knowledge of modern programming languages & scripts;
 
 
Advanced experience of using Python or equivalent
 
 
Previous experience using Airflow
 
 
Previous experience using GIT
 
 
Previous experience using Dataform
 
 
Advanced experience in Google Cloud Platform or equivalent
 
 
SQL experience
 
 
Ability to communicate complex data or technical concepts to non technical internal clients
 


 
Desirable Skills:
 
 
 
Previously working in Agile project management environment using Scrum
 
 
Process oriented with great documentation skills
 
 
Data exploration, visualisation in Tableau, Looker, Power BI or similar
 
 
Experience of working within Supply Chain
 


 
If you are an existing Jaguar Land Rover employee at the same grade as this position, please be aware that no pay increases are applied to lateral moves. For promotions, the salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including the size of and skills required for the role, the external market value of the role and your individual knowledge and experience.
 
Please note that if you elect to apply for a role in another country and are successful you would need to be hired as an external candidate on local terms and conditions rather than transferring on your existing terms.
 
JLR considers that this role meets the criteria to be considered for a Skilled Worker Visa. Therefore, JLR will support an application for visa sponsorship. The SOC code is 3543
 
Please be aware that we may close this vacancy for applications before the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of interest. We strongly advise you to submit your application as early as possible.Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all.

job_desc:
We strongly encourage applications from people of colour, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, parents, carers, and people from lower socio-economic backgrounds.

About Cleo
Most people come to Cleo to do work that matters. Every day, we fight for the worldâ€™s financial health, building a beloved AI that empowers people to make better financial decisions.
 
Backed by some of the most well-known investors in tech, weâ€™ve reached over 4 million users and plan to double that number each year...which is where you come in.
 
Whatâ€™s the role all about?
As an Analytics Engineer at Cleo you will develop and maintain data models that will amplify the productivity of our analysts, empower machine learning models, and be the backbone of self-serve discovery throughout the company. As Cleo grows rapidly towards 100M worldwide users, you will take the lead on ensuring we can move fast in making data driven decisions..

We passionately believe in forming autonomous, cross functional teams who are empowered to deliver our ambitious strategy. Youâ€™ll work embedded in squads alongside our engineering team to help us collect, transform, store, and serve data across the company. The role:

What do you get for all your hard work?

We're hiring at AE3 level and we can pay Â£65,004 - Â£83,376 p.a depending on experience.

Work where you work best. Weâ€™re a globally distributed team. If you live in London we have a hybrid approach, weâ€™d love you to spend one day a week or more in our beautiful office. If youâ€™re outside of London, weâ€™ll encourage you to spend a couple of days with us a few times per year. And weâ€™ll cover your travel costs, naturally.


 
Other benefits;
 
25 days annual leave a year + public holidays (+ an additional day for every year you spend at Cleo)

UK App access:
The Cleo app is no longer downloadable in the UK (but only until next year). If youâ€™re an existing user, youâ€™ll still have access to the app. But some features wonâ€™t be available (just for a little while). Why? 99% of our users are based in the US â€“ where financial health is often overlooked. Weâ€™ve decided to shift our focus to where we can provide the most value and make the greatest impact for users who need it most. Then weâ€™ll be able to apply what we learn to better support our UK users in the future. Check out this page for more information.
 
Company Benefits

job_desc:
Who we are
 
The Workshop is a tech company that develops intuitive software for the online gaming industry. Our motto is to move â€œFearlessly Forwardâ€ together. Cooperative innovation is at the center of everything we do â€“ from our games, new products and technologies, to how we collaborate and share inspiration with one another.
 
Your mission
 
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Sportsbook team and provide insight and analysis for our Sports products. In this role, you will combine your expertise in quantitative and statistical methods with your knowledge of sports to ensure our overall product and business strategies are firmly data driven. You will merge data from sports feeds, wagers, web, and customer sources to provide a comprehensive view of our Sportsbook product performance for internal stakeholders and customers. Your deliverables will include analysis, insights, and recommendations on product performance, impact of new releases, and monitoring of sports feed performance.
 
You will be a part of our Analytics team, who are responsible for driving insight into the performance of our digital gaming products. Their analytics drives all of TWSâ€™s decision-making, informs product & feature strategies, and delivers detailed critiques of product feature performance. You will be responsible for major analytics and reporting deliverables and will work closely with senior Sports and Analytics leadership. This position may require limited international travel.
 
What you'll do
 
 
Take ownership of the end-to-end delivery of Sports Analytics requests, including introducing and instilling data best practice, integrating new data sources, visualizing data and presenting outputs.
Actively provide feedback on product performance/functionality and make thoughtful recommendations on ways to improve Sports products and influence the roadmap.
Collaborate with Sports leadership to clearly understand their major business problems and help resolve them using data & analytics.
Develop and implement new KPIs for monitoring business & feature success.
Contribute to requirements for data architecture to create a robust and long term data solution based on the reporting needs.
Use data queries (SQL), statistical analysis (Python) and visualization (Tableau) to structure, analyze and report on performance.
Participate in projects outside the core area, connecting to new and unexplored datasets, based on the overall needs of the organization.


 
What you'll bring
 
 
Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field.
Have experience/keen interest in Sports & Sports betting.
Advanced knowledge of statistical analysis, data mining, and predictive modeling.
Be a driven learner, capable of identifying your own areas of self-development and then leveraging the teamâ€™s expertise to build your analytical knowledge and skills.
Have proven experience of understanding and solving business problems.
Be an experienced communicator, able to communicate complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Proficient in Tableau, Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Experience with SQL and relational databases.
Data manipulation and analysis skills.
Experience with Python.


 
Nice to have
 
 
Experience in multi-channel analytics, connecting to a variety of data sources with different data quality availability.


 
What's in it for you
 
 
Inspiring and fulfilling work at an innovative and values-driven company creating cutting-edge tech.

Contemporary and accessible office environments with a range of workplace perks.

Description
 
With over 27 MAGICAL years of making people FEEL and LOOK their most confident, Charlotte Tilbury MBE - the worldâ€™s No1 makeup artist - launched her ICONIC beauty company in September 2013 to record-breaking results and critical acclaim. The success since has been truly phenomenal. One of the fastest growing beauty companies GLOBALLY, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty has been a heavyweight TECH DISRUPTOR from Day 1, winning countless awards and breaking records. NOW, weâ€™re on a mission to go from leading beauty company to cementing our place as the LEADER in BEAUTYTECHâ€¦and we have an exciting opportunity for you to join the Dream Team!

OUR PEOPLE

Our culture is one of high energy and proactivity. We leave ego at the door, strive to be candid and open, believe in exploratory thinking, constructive dissent, and trust-building. We dare to dream it, dare to believe it, dare to do it!

have a hunger to learn

September 2023

19 March 2023
 
Insurance is so much more than you think!
 
Are you looking for a career that will excite, challenge and inspire you? If so, this apprenticeship could be the ideal role for you! Your Opportunity
 
Are you someone who loves data and using it to help solve problems or to identify useful trends? Our apprenticeship programme is just the start of your professional learning with your career at Zurich. The topics you will learn vary from:
 
 
 
Developing an understanding of data enabling you to make informed evidence-based decisions
 
 
Effective automation of manual, repetitive data tasks to increase productivity and allow focus on impactful work
 
 
Data visualisation tools and communicating data insights
 
 
Introduction to machine learning
 


Our Data & Insight Apprenticeship is a great opportunity for someone who would like to start a career with one of the worldâ€™s most successful insurance companies.

The length of your apprenticeship will vary dependant on course provider and scheme. Rest assured; we will support your study time alongside your permanent role.
 
Whatâ€™s in it for you?
 
As well as joining a company that is passionate about our people, sustainability and our customers, we also have a competitive rewards and lifestyle benefits package. Weâ€™re also the #1 best place to work in the insurance industry (Glassdoor Employeesâ€™ Choice award, 2022).

Youâ€™ll receive:

25 days holiday plus an additional 3 volunteering days

12% company pension contribution
 
 
Annual company bonus
 
 
Discounted gym membership
 
 
Discounted gadget insurance
 
 
Discounted technology offers

A minimum of 5 GCSEs (or equivalent) at grade C/4 including Maths and English.
 
 
A professional attitude with a positive â€˜can doâ€™ approach to your work
 
 
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
 
 
Ability to build strong working relationships
 


Are you ready to create a brighter future?
 
At Zurich our brand purpose is to create a brighter future together, for our customers, our partners, our employees and the planet. Itâ€™s a promise that for our customers, we will put their needs at the heart of everything we do and for our employees, to grow and develop together. For our partners, to collaborate to create mutual value and for the planet, to drive positive impact by integrating our sustainability work into how we do business. We put our customers at the heart of everything that we do, and weâ€™re looking for like-minded people to join us on our journey.

Weâ€™re passionate about diversity and inclusion, we want our people to bring the whole of themselves to work. Youâ€™ll have every opportunity to use your drive and enthusiasm to innovate the future of Zurich. Everybody is made to feel welcome, different opinions are valued, personal needs are respected, and opportunity is equal for all
 
So, make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported, Love what you do. Work for us.
 
Please note

job_desc:
Job Reference #
 
269828BR
 
Job Type
 
Full Time
 
Your role
 
Are you interested in using data and the latest technologies to solve real world business problems? Does the prospect of collaborating with different areas to deliver business value excite you?
 
Weâ€™re looking for an innovative, and detail oriented collaborator to help the surface opportunities to improve data as a result of a new platform, Cumulus. Cumulus will transform how we acquire and manage data that is mission critical for our business.
 
In this role you will partner with UBS business divisions and group functions, the Cumulus platform team and product owners to identify opportunities to improve data.
 
We are looking for a data analyst to:
 
 
 
identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using structured analysis techniques and tools
 
use data analytics to surface opportunities to improve the quality of reference data
 
use data visualization to educate stakeholders on the scale and impact of data issues to gain buy in for investment and improvement
 
use data analytics to evidence when benefits are realized as a result of change
 


 
Your team
 
Youâ€™ll be working in the Reference Data Services team in UK, reporting to the Reference Data Advisory Lead. This global team continually challenges and enhances the way reference data is managed at UBS. We do this is by engaging closely with our clients, developing our people and harnessing new technology.
 
Our currently technology stack is highly fragmented with many systems that manage data. This leads to inconsistent data quality, duplication of efforts across teams, high costs, and impacts our ability to adapt to new data requirements.
 
We aspire to solve these problems with Cumulus â€“ a cloud native platform that will become the single place where we acquire and manage reference data, built using microservices that give flexibility to our clients.
 
Having all of the reference data in one place for the first time presents an exciting opportunity in surfacing and quantifying the impact of data challenges in a way that we have never been able to before.
 
Your expertise
 
 
 
data analytics experience in global programs cutting across business divisions, functions and locations, preferably in the Financial Services sector across multiple relevant reference data domains (e.g. External Legal Entity, Client, Counterparty, Instrument, Product, Static)
 
experience in using data in order to identify issues, trends or exceptions to drive improvement and find solutions
 
experience using common reporting and analytics solutions e.g. PowerBI, Alteryx, Databricks, Qlik, Tableau
 
proficient in one or more scripting languages e.g. SQL, Python, R, Scala
 


 
You are:
 
 
 
an effective self starter who excels in a lean and fast paced organization with a diligent and detail oriented work style
 
highly driven and motivated with a can do attitude
 
a strong written and verbal communicator, able to simplify and explain complex problems for various levels of stakeholders, interested in building a network across a global organization
 
eager to continuously learn and solve complex problems, focusing on practical and implementable solutions
 


 
About Us
 
UBS is the worldâ€™s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.
 
With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
 
How We Hire
 
This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html
 
Join us
 
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.
 
From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together weâ€™re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?
 
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
 
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

job_desc:
Administrative Support
 
 
 
Graduate Scheme
 
 
 
Discipline: Information Technology
 
 
 
Location: Desford, Leicester, UK
 
 
 
Salary
 
 
:
 
 
Â£32,480, Â£1000 Sign on Bonus, 10% Annual Bonus, Share Scheme, Pension, Flexible working, and 27 days annual leave (plus bank holidays)
 
 
We currently have lots of exciting opportunities for Graduates to join Caterpillar across the UK!
 
New graduates are critical to the success of our business. You power our success, and we are committed to empowering yours. After all, when your work can impact the entire world, itâ€™s important to do work that matters.
 
We are looking for talented, ambitious people from various backgrounds who are interested in setting out on the road to success and in return, we will provide you the training, mentoring, and support you need to have a successful career at Caterpillar.
 
 
At Caterpillar, you build what mattersâ€”whether itâ€™s the career you want, crucial work skills, strong relationships, or new technologies â€“ Our work is powered by our people.
 
 
 
What do we do?
 
 
Caterpillar Inc. is the worldâ€™s leading manufacturer of construction and mining equipment, diesel and natural gas engines, industrial gas turbines, and diesel-electric locomotives. Since 1925, weâ€™ve been driving sustainable progress and helping customers build a better world through innovative products and services. Throughout the product life cycle, we offer services built on cutting-edge technology and decades of product expertise. These products and services, backed by our global dealer network, provide exceptional value to help our customers succeed.
 
Caterpillarâ€™s Desford facility is part of the Building Construction Products (BCP) division, manufacturing a range of world class Backhoe Loaders and Compact Wheel Loaders, as part of the wider BCP range of products. Desford is more than just a production facility â€“ it is home to a range of functions with global scope, including HR, Finance, Engineering, Purchasing, Manufacturing and Marketing.
 
 
Our Solutions Help Our Customers Build a Better World
 
 
Customers use our products to build the basic infrastructure that enables higherâ€¯standards of living so that people have access to water, electricity, roads, bridges, hospitals, schools and so much more
 
We have a clear vision to be the global leader in providing customer value in the markets in which we operate. Our core values (Integrity, Excellence, Teamwork, Commitment and Sustainability) are key to our success.
 
 
Diversity at Caterpillar
 
 
When we leverage our people's experiences, backgrounds, and cultures in an inclusive environment, we enable every individual to achieve their full potential, which drives business success. We are proud to be named in the Forbes list of Best Employers for Diversity (2019) and to be the employer of one of the top 50 Women in Engineering (WE50 2021). Caterpillar is an equal opportunity employer, and we welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds.
 
 
What experiences can we offer you?
 
 
From day one, youâ€™re set up to thrive at Caterpillar: helpful training, relatable mentors, global experience, competitive salary package, work-life balance, and the growth opportunities you expect with a Fortune 100 company and one of â€˜Forbes: Worldâ€™s Best Employers 2021â€™!
 
From day one you will engage in challenging work, solving real-world customer engineering and business problems through collaboration with our global team. You will be assigned a home department which acts as a touch point throughout the scheme. Your two-year Graduate Development Programme will be tailored to ensure you gain a broad understanding of your chosen field and build the foundations of a successful career. You will get the support, guidance and training you need to be successful at Caterpillar. You will also have opportunity to gain experience working with our global Caterpillar customers.
 
You will have the opportunity to work with other facilities across our global organisation and you will be directly involved, and at the heart of our business, participating on strategic projects.
 
We hold a Meet and Greet day for all new UK Graduate students to provide you with an opportunity to meet fellow new starters across the UK before you start your placement.
 
 
Job duties and responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
 
 
 
 
As part of the team, you will have the opportunity to work on multiple IT projects across multiple business functions, for example within Engineering, Supply Chain, Finance and Manufacturing groups.
 
 
The role will involve you having responsibility for gathering requirements, analysis, functional design, development specifications and testing.
 
 
As part of this project team, you may be called upon to work with people across the globe as the business functions serve CAT facilities in the UK, US, China, Brazil, Mexico, and India.
 
 
As part of the team, you will be required to provide operational support across multiple globally used applications using ITIL processes including incident, problem and change management.
 


 
 
What happens after the graduate scheme?
 
 
Upon successful completion of the scheme, you will progress into a key role where you will directly contribute to the operational and project activity that is at the heart of our business. We will provide you with the training and support you need to have a successful career at Caterpillar, in a global organisation there are so many possibilities!
 
 
Who are we looking for?
 
 
As the type of roles within our business are becoming more diverse, we are looking for people who are open minded, excellent problem solvers and who have an ability to learn quickly. You will be motivated, hard-working, and will embrace change. In return for your dedication and hard work, you will be provided with excellent career opportunities and strong support for your personal and career development to pursue a career within Caterpillar.
 
 
 
Applicants will be on target to achieve a minimum of 2:2 honours degree level in a relevant discipline. Please check the job advertisement for confirmation of what disciplines are accepted.
 
 
Relevant degrees include - Computer Science, Business Information Technology, Software Engineering/Development and Data Science
 


 
 
There are big jobs to be done worldwideâ€”building critical infrastructure, bolstering local economies, meeting the demand for energyâ€”and that work is powered by our people. Our talented team creates sustainable, world-changing solutions that impact lives around the globe.
 
 
 
Come join us!
 
 
 
How do I apply?
 
 
Go to catukgraduates.com for more information.
 
 
NOTE:
 
 
Only one application is required, please do not apply for multiple roles. You may be given the opportunity of being considered for other roles/locations at a later stage.
 
The panel cannot make assumptions when shortlisting therefore please demonstrate your qualifications and experience on your CV relevant to the criteria outlined.
 
Pending the number of applications, the criteria for the position may be enhanced to facilitate shortlisting.
 
 
Click the apply button today and one of our friendly recruiters will be in touch.
 
 
Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).
 
Not ready to apply? Submit your information to our Talent Network here .
