job_desc:
WHO WE ARE
 
 
The Jamie Oliver Group is the dynamic and diverse business that supports and delivers Jamieâ€™s commercial and campaigning vision.
 
We have creative teams who work on Jamieâ€™s award-winning books, TV and digital content; industry experts who develop Jamieâ€™s range of kitchenware, food products and partnerships; a passionate restaurant team delivering amazing dining experiences for our international restaurants; plus the campaigns team who lead the way on Jamieâ€™s ambitious goal to halve childhood obesity by 2030.
 
Every day is a bit different at the Jamie Oliver Group â€“ weâ€™re always keen to try new ideas, we love working together and with other people, and we have an ambitious plan to change the world for good, through food. We want to inspire individuals, businesses and governments to join us and make positive changes in the home, on the high street, at the workplace, in hospitals and in schools. Weâ€™re on a journey, but weâ€™re trying to do the right thing.
 
WHAT YOUâ€™RE HERE TO DO
 
 
We have a new and very exciting opportunity for a tenacious and curious Financial Analyst to support the Financial Planning & Analysis Manager, and the wider JO Strategy & Finance team during a very exciting period of business change and growth. This role will play an integral part in providing key research analysis to the Chief Finance Officer and CEO, with the support and guidance of the Financial Planning & Analysis Manager. The main deliverables from this role will be; conducting business performance data analysis, producing financial frameworks and models (which underpin the long range plan for the Jamie Oliver business), and supporting and often leading on the design and execution of new strategic programmes. If you have 3-4 years experience with a reputable bank, exceptionally strong technical and analytical skills, then this could be the role for you!
 
Your responsibilities will include:
 
 
Conduct research and analysis of market trends, consumer behaviour, sales and other topics relevant to the business
Analyse and evaluate business performance, including production of regular Board-level reports and collection and management of underlying data
Lead on the organisation, management and reporting of key business-critical datasets
Build concerted financial, demand and performance models for key business areas and initiatives
Support the development and implementation of Group-wide performance, risk and other management frameworks used to inform strategic decisions
Support the development of improved data management capabilities and systems within the business
Support the implementation of decision-making processes, frameworks and materials including business cases, delivery plans
Support the design and execution of new programmes and strategic projects, leading on these in some instances


 
WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW
 
 
Excellent numerical and analytical skills
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to see the bigger picture
Ability to build complex business models
Ability to distinguish between reliable and unreliable data
Good Office 365 skills, especially Excel, PowerPoint,Word and similar skills with Google Suite
Good general IT skills
Excellent writing skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to build good relationships with colleagues at all levels
Ability to learn new skills quickly
Ability to quickly understand complex information and communicate key points succinctly and in simple language
Ability to adapt to changing priorities, demands and circumstances
Ability to thrive and deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


 
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
 
 
Someone who is proactive and takes initiative
Someone with high emotional intelligence, who can work with minimal direction and supervision, who can be trusted to deliver
Someone who takes ownership of their work and takes pride in its quality
Enjoys solving complex problems
Someone who works collaboratively with others and enjoys working as part of a team
Someone who is intellectually rigorous, and has a curious mind and a desire to learn
Someone who is tenacious, driven and relentless in pursuing the completion of a task


 
WHAT WE OFFER IN RETURN
 
 
A friendly and supportive company culture in a creative office
Hybrid working
Competitive salary, bonus, pension, life insurance and medical cover
Lots of training and development opportunities
Great holiday allowance, plus half a day for Christmas shopping
Fabulous food perks including free breakfast at the office, subsidised lunches, foodie forums, cooking classes and the opportunity to test out Jamieâ€™s new recipes!
Social events, discounted gym membership, plus massage and nail appointments on site


 
At Jamie Oliver, we celebrate the fact that everyone is different and treat every colleague with dignity and respect. As a creative business we know that diverse teams help us deliver our best work. We love to see applications from groups who are currently underrepresented in the creative industries.

job_desc:
Annalect is the data, technology, and analytics division of Omnicom.
We help CMOs and their teams harness data, technology, and advanced analytics to grow their brands. We have built a variety of innovative product and specialist service solutions for clients and agency partners. 


We build and maintain the Omni platform which gives agency and client teams access to these capabilities as well as the ability to integrate and combine their own data and technology with Omni. Omni has over 20,000 active users and is recognized in the industry as a leading marketing platform. We continuously innovate the platform to ensure our clients stay ahead of their competitors in data driven marketing. 


Our team of Annalectuals is growing rapidly and are based in over 80 countries around the globe, supported by global and regional team hubs in NY, London, Singapore, Gurgaon, Bangalore, and Hyderabad. The EMEA team is responsible for global and regional relationships clients led from London, as well as the development of new data-driven marketing capabilities. They form part of our global team and collaborate closely with local market Annalect teams across EMEA as well as regional Omnicom agency partners. 


The Advanced Analytics team has three core responsibilities focused on delivering incremental client impact now and in the future through effective analytics and applied data science solutions:


Deliver on advanced analytics outcomes to clients across a mix of solutions.
Support capabilities across the region, ensuring that media agencies and local Annalect teams can utilize the capabilities to drive client outcomes. 
Develop new 
proof-of-concept
 (POC) advanced analytics and data science capabilities to address new client/agency challenges, and scaled global tools from local innovation.


Core capabilities:
 
Advanced Audience Analytics â€“ advanced analysis of various granular data sets to understand consumer behaviour using a variety of future facing data connectivity techniques to ensure that audience insights can then be fed directly into campaign targeting to drive efficiency and effectiveness.
Activation Algorithms â€“ algorithms leveraging machine learning to support the optimisation of campaign activation using a variety of contextual factors to automatically improve bidding and targeting selection to drive improved performance.
Measurement Suite â€“ a range of increasingly connected measurement solutions (e.g. MMM, Attribution and Incrementality testing) designed to support clients and agency partners make optimised investment decisions from a strategic level all the way through to a more tactical level to deliver incremental ROI.
Planning Suite â€“ Omni platform makes a dynamic optimisation tool available for 100+ markets across the world, enabling planners to define budgets based on any client campaign brief. The Annalect team supports advanced use cases, helping clients customise their internal results to the tool, and apply advanced methods to enable better planning. 


ROLE SUMMARY:
 
The role is a rare opportunity to be right at the forefront of media and brand analytics, leveraging a leading global platform and working with a regional Data Science and Advanced Analytics team to aid the biggest marketers with the measurement, optimisation and planning of media. Through cutting edge solutions in analytics and data science that will be at your disposal, you will help the biggest brands in their industries with understanding the value of their media, define their optimal media plan, and feed insights straight into their media buying strategies. 


 You will:
Impress clients:
 Work on client engagements, helping run analysis to understand media impact like (e.g. MMM or attribution), and custom projects on how to optimise media plans to maximise a clientâ€™s KPI. 
Facilitate the best in class:
 Whether it is being the expert on a new regional data set, or training other analysts on a new solution, you will help ensure that our best practice marketing solutions are supported and effective.
Learn and share
: As a specialist in the region with dozens of markets, you will learn and share your work in a wide community of data scientists, marketing scientists and analysts. 


This role is appropriate for a graduate analyst or junior analyst, with experience in either capabilities like MMM, attribution or advance optimisation of media plans, that wants to broaden their tool box and perfect how measurement capabilities should be combined to drive real outcomes for brands. Role is perfect for as a steppingstone to a senior analyst or lead consultant in the regional Advanced Analytics or Data science team, with the team growing from one to 10 in span of a few years. What is essential is a self starter, passion for unearthing the truth behind media investments and turning that into actionable recommendations. 


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Delivering analyses to clients across variety of solutions, e.g. MMM, attribution, and media plan optimisations.
As an analyst on key client projects, uphold the standards of delivery and meet important milestones, ensuring that we are best in class for a specific client.
Become an expert, both technically and in client delivery, on solutions that are being developed by our Data Scientists.
Own your clientâ€™s needs and problems â€“ you will be imbedded in of a few clients that we will ask you to grow with and maintain a multi-year view of the relationship.
Effectively communicate marketing science/data science concepts and the results of analyses to both internal, and client teams.
Attend training sessions, seminars and workshops, and generally be abreast to the latest in tracking, measurement, mar-tech and ad-tech space.


IDEAL CANDIDATE:
Understanding the marketing funnel and mix, and how it relates to KPIs and optimisation and planning processes.
Experience working with reach or media curves.
Has keen eye on bringing analysis to life.
Working experience with R, Eviews, or VBA Excel.
Interest in broadening skillset in R and Python and other technologies that become relevant to the role in future.
Grasp of statistical models, including time series analysis and logistic regression.
Minimum one year in a media agency or an internal marketing analytics team or equivalent.
Familiar with Google suite of advertising tools, e.g. including CM and GA360.
Have serviced internal and / or external commercial clients.
Hungry for creating something new and making a mark.
Self starter who wants to get stuck in and not afraid to ask questions / ask for help.
Strong presentation skills written and verbal; client and internal facing.


FLEXIBLE WORKING 
We are committed to supporting and helping Annalectuals have a great work/life balance and a positive attitude to well-being. As part of this we have a flexible and hybrid working model as a core part of how we operate. 


We believe flexible & hybrid working can increases individual motivation, improves performance and productivity, and reduces stress as well as helping manage wellbeing generally. We will work with you to implement the best flexible working solution for you without compromising team performance and client delivery. 


DIVERSITY 
At Annalect, we are focused on equality and believe deeply in diversity & inclusion of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different.

Hill Dickinson acts as a trusted adviser to a wide portfolio of clients across a wide range of specialist sectors: from transport and logistics and international trade, through to retail, insurance, marine, health, education, manufacturing, public sector and banking and financial services.

SQL / BI Data Analyst
 
Hours:
 
35 hours per week, Monday to Friday
 
As the winner of two Working Familiesâ€™ awards for â€˜Best UK employer for Flexible Recruitment 2022â€™ and â€˜Best UK employer for Flexible Working Award 2020â€™, we are happy to consider flexible working opportunities to help you balance your work and home life.

Location:
 
Liverpool

You can contact the HR team at hrteam@hilldickinson.com should you require any adjustments to the application or interview process.

job_desc:
Working at Adaptavist
 
Adaptavist is a global software innovator, enabling organisations to digitally transform how they collaborate and get work done. Founded in 2005 and with a growing global reach, our customers cut across every major industry and include more than half of all Fortune 500 companies.

Today, Adaptavist leverages its deep technical understanding of Atlassian and innovative partnership with Slack to help organisations embrace new ways of working to achieve competitive advantage.

Through trusted consultancy, app development, training, hosting, and licensing solutions, Adaptavist has established itself as the go-to partner of choice within the Atlassian Ecosystem.
 
 
About The Team
 
When you join Adaptavistâ€™s data engineering team, youâ€™ll be joining a group of fun, collaborative and exciting professionals! This talented and welcoming team has been growing over the years and is continuing to grow this year, with expertise spanning platform engineers, software engineers and data engineers. At the moment, some of the team are based around the UK, Canada and in Malaysia!

The hiring manager for this role is Dominic Martino , our Data Engineering Lead. Check out his LinkedIn!
 
 
About The Role
 
Are you interested to build and scale reliable data pipelines infrastructure using both batch and streaming data sources? Do you want to work with an industry leader and an expanding customer base from SMBs to Fortune 500 in scale? If so, this role might be the perfect next step in your career journey.

This role is pivotal to the growth of the organisation, and you will work closely with our Analytics, Data Science, Product and Platform teams. We have team members across the globe so you will be working remotely!
 
 
What You'll Be Doing
 
Working closely with various teams across the company, the successful candidate will be responsible for growing Adaptavistâ€™s data processing implementations. This involves working with different types of data sources each with different considerations - logs/events/metrics. The infrastructure and the software that sit behind all this is built and managed by the data engineering team. Using modern technologies (Serverless, AWS, S3, Kinesis, SQS) and languages such as Java and Python, our Data Engineering team are focused on building a best-in-class implementations to ensure the continued growth of Adaptavist. Our Data Engineers own these implementations from gathering the data from the producers through to the consumers, ensuring that data flows to the right team, at the right time. We build solutions to work reliability and alert us when they don't.

Our Data Engineer teams build on modern development practices, so comfort with continuous delivery and deployment infrastructure such as code (Terraform), and agile experience are a must. The team values the autonomy that modern development teams thrive in, and give teams the space to build and grow in their own ways.
 
 
What We're Looking For
 
 
 
Proven experience in the field of Data Engineering or Software Engineering
 
Experience with Java (and common frameworks like Spring and Spring boot) or strong Python experience.
 
Passion for delivering large-scale Data Pipelines solutions
 
AWS Experience (we use S3, Lambda, Kinesis, SQS, and more)
 
Experience with modern development tooling like git and CI/CD
 
Experience with both batch processing and streaming architectures
 
Experience working with event driven architectures is an added advantage
 


At Adaptavist, we are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community, and believe this positively impacts both the creation of our innovative products and our delivery of bespoke solutions to our global customers and our own unique culture. We encourage all qualified applicants, regardless of age, disability, race, sexual orientation, religion or belief, sex, gender identity, pregnancy and maternity, marriage, and civil partnership status. From our family-friendly policies to our flexible work environment we offer a range of benefits and policies in order to support staff from all different backgrounds. If you have any questions, please do ask us.

We look forward to your application!

job_desc:
Reporting and Visualisation Analyst
With Hybrid and flexible working offered
 
Based in the heart of Shoreditch, we are an award winning digital content agency and media network who are currently on the lookout for a
 
Reporting and Visualisation Analyst
 
to join our Insights Team. The role requires someone with experience of working with stakeholders to understand requirements, and translating these into data pipelines and dashboards. You will work across a range of clients and categories so you must be confident working with large datasets and keen to find new and exciting ways to use data for optimisation and insights.
 
 
This role involves working both independently and with other members of the team (including developers). You need to be comfortable with extracting and manipulating data and designing a suitable presentation layer with BI tools. We are redesigning our data model and part of this role will be working with developers on requirements and testing to improve the reports and insights for stakeholders.
 
Why join us?
As a Great Places to Work certified workplace, we believe in a working environment where people can flourish, develop and reach their full potential. We deliver work sustainably, in spaces we enjoy working from and in a flexible way that helps maintain a strong work-life balance. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce that encourages and values all voices - Everyone is welcome
 
 
HOW YOU'LL SPEND YOUR TIME
 
 
 
Design and develop data pipelines and models to support reporting and data visualisation outputs
Work within DBT and SQL BigQuery to manipulate data for business intelligence
Gain a deep understanding of our data sets to come up with solutions to data problems for internal teams and clients
Production of accurate and meaningful datasets and dashboards
Introduce new dashboards that will deliver additional value to stakeholders
Contribute to the design and development of the new data model (requirements and testing)
Collaborate with stakeholders to improve teams data knowledge and technical skills across the organisation


 
WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED
 
 
Skills matter, experience is useful, attitude is everything.
 
 
 
Previous experience in a similar role
 
Good technical data manipulation skills with SQL (Python or R would be a plus)
Strong numeracy and analysis skills
Experience of designing and building dashboards with BI tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI etc
Experience of writing scripts to test the accuracy of data pipelines
Experience of designing requirements and working with developers to enhance data models
Able to explain the technical details of data in a non-technical way to people
Somebody keen to think outside the box, and eager to think of new & innovative ways to solve problems
Demonstrate an understanding of the following (hands-on knowledge advantageous):
Digital analytics data, ideally including search
Social Media platforms, particularly Youtube


 
THE PERKS OF THE JOB
Employee wellbeing is at the heart of everything we do. We offer hybrid and flexible working patterns for all roles, online medical services, mental health and wellbeing programmes, enhanced gender neutral parental leave, interest free financial support and a digital nomad policy that allows you to work from abroad two weeks a year. Plus all the usuals such as pension contributions, generous annual leave, weekly socials and office perks like free yoga and health treatments!
 
ABOUT US
 
Little Dot Studios specialises in creating meaningful connections between premium content and digital audiences. Since 2013, weâ€™ve been partnering with world-renowned brands, broadcasters, distributors and sports rights holders â€“ helping them grow, engage and monetise digital audiences with broadcast-quality content. To learn more about us, our values and our commitments please visit our website www.littledotstudios.com for more information.

job_desc:
This role is eligible for our five day flex office work model
 
Data Scientist
 
We are a data-driven organization, where machine learning powered products provide a core competitive edge over our competitors and they also contribute to the success of our business partners. We take pride in being excellent at our craft and employing our skills to the benefit of our customers.
 
As a data scientist you will have the opportunity to design new machine learning models and build new machine learning products in a growing team within a large organization. Work at an organization where the business is increasing investment in machine learning solutions and sees the solutions as a competitive advantage. Solve real world problems that span various domains within our business such as: Price optimization, NLP, Computer Vision, Sales forecasting and Hypothesis testing

Work alongside machine learning engineers and developers to integrate machine learning solutions into production platforms
Understand business requirements from non-technical team members

Train models using AWS Sagemaker and deploy services in Kubernetes
Process large quantities of data streamed from many different applications to test and build our models
Leverage AWS Augmented AI to assist in labeling tasks
 


 
Experience in implementing artificial intelligence/machine learning solutions in Python and Tensorflow
2+ years of commercial/academic experience with demonstrated technical skills in one or more of the following areas: NLP, Computer Vision, Deep Learning
Masters or PhD qualification in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Machine Learning / AI, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, etc
Experience evaluating and improving existing machine learning models
Eagerness to learn new techniques, technologies, solve problems and contribute in a team environment
Experience with Tensorflow, Keras, Pandas, Numpy, SQL

current employees

job_desc:
Salary:
 
Â£55,000 - Â£62,000, dependent on experience, plus Â£963 allowance per annum
 
Location:
 
This role is based at the Trust Office - London, Victoria, with infrequent travel to other GDST sites and is suitable for hybrid working arrangements.
 
If you offer extensive experience of data analysis, along with specialist knowledge of data visualisation software and storage, then an exciting opportunity exists at the Girls' Day School Trust (GDST) for a Data Architect.
 
You will play an integral role in dictating and developing the GDST's data strategy, focussing on reporting analysis and data governance, whilst integrating these strategies across a range of platforms.
 
 
You will set organisation data standards for the GDST, advising and educating on policy and process, whilst monitoring adherence to these standards. This will include the developing of data management policies and processes, as well as overseeing the GDST's data sets including building their data warehouse and reporting tools. In assuming responsibility for these duties, you will lead improvements in the way the GDST uses data and insightful analytics, to support informed strategic decision making.
 
Key responsibilities will include:
 
 
To develop and maintain responsibility for data integrations strategies across business platforms
To develop and maintain responsibility for data reporting strategies across a range of platforms
To be the expert advisor on data requirements for business systems
To build strong relationships with Functional Heads, schools and SMT members to ensure detailed understanding of business needs across the functions


 
You will possess experience of developing data standards, as well as knowledge of designing and implementing a data warehouse/data lake. You will also demonstrate proven experience of managing larger data sets, using data analysis tools and building data visualisations. You will exhibit a broad knowledge base including in-depth knowledge and understanding of Microsoft PowerBI, as well as knowledge of database design and data reporting tools. In addition to your expert knowledge and experience, you will possess a range of professional skills and attributes, including excellent communication, negotiating, team working and leadership skills.
 
In return, the GDST offer a great working environment and a very rewarding benefits package, which includes:
 
 
Competitive salaries and pay progression
Access to extensive professional development opportunities
Training grants for qualifications
Generous pension scheme
Free life assurance benefit
A discount of up to 50% on fees for children at GDST schools
Interest-free loans for travel season ticket
A Cycle to Work scheme
Competitive terms and conditions of employment
30 days annual leave (plus statutory holidays)


 
About the GDST:
 
 
The GDST is the UK's leading network of independent girlsâ€™ schools, with over 3,500 staff, and nearly 19,000 students between the ages of 3 and 18. As a charity that owns and runs a network of 23 schools and 2 academies in England and Wales, it reinvests all its income in its schools. Founded in 1872, the GDST has a long history of pioneering innovation in the education of girls and is the largest single educator of girls in the UK (and the UKâ€™s largest educational charity).
 
For the full job description and to apply please click the apply button.
 
Closing date: 10am on the 6th March 2023
 
Interviews are scheduled to be held the week beginning 13th March 2023.
 
The selection process will involve a panel interview and a presentation, full details will be sent to successful candidates.
 
For a discussion or queries about the role, please contact Richard Bailey at r.bailey@wes.gdst.net
 
The GDST is committed to diversity, inclusion, and real change: a family where every individual is valued, respected, and included.
 
The GDST is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, and applicants must be willing to undergo child protection screening appropriate to the post, including checks with past employers and the Disclosure and Barring Service.

job_desc:
A Data Science vacancy exists within The Fast Jet Support FJS department in the Data Services Team for an experienced data Scientist. Someone who has applied their analytical skills to real business problems successfully, has a portfolio of Data Science tools and techniques at their fingertips and is keen to apply them in the pursuit of benefit and real value.

This role will be at the heart of a team charged with improving business and customer air force operator performance through the application of data leverage strategies. This is an exciting opportunity for the new incumbent to develop their analytical skills against real problems and work with customers directly to achieve a better way. Any experience within the aircraft operational or support organisational domains would be beneficial as these are the areas, we receive most requests for solutions from. Due to the agile working method, we employ, great communication skills are required to maintain momentum and deliver on time.

The role holder will have access to a dedicated data warehouse and tech stack ready to work and an opportunity to utilise them to best effect against datasets we are uniquely afforded access to from our MOD and Air Force Customer groups we serve. Some travel and access to Air Force sites may be required where appropriate.
 
 
The successful candidate will be required to perform tasks suitable to the internal level of this role. The role will contain, but will not be limited to, the following:
Working with Customer groups to elicit new requirements
Designing efficient solutions to Customer data issues and problems
Collecting, cleansing, harmonising (engineering) data on corporate servers.
Working in AGILE process to iterate development of solution to reach Production standard
Share experience / knowledge with peers and colleagues in a collaborative knowledge sharing environment
 


 
The role holder should normally be fluent in the use of a core number of standard data science toolsets and methods. SQL/ matlab/ python and some of the latest self serve products too, like powerBI / tableau. But the key to success is as much about following the dev life cycle and producing solutions that actually work and stay working long term with minimum support. Driving the dev life cycle to conclusion, managing customers, keeping to plan, working around obstacles is all in a days work and people who can do that do best.
Great communication, ability to assimilate customer issues, work around obstacles, work to plan, choose / use right technology and be part of the team
The candidate must be good with Microsoft Office Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, tableau/PowerBi/SQL and matlab/python
Communication, Customer Focus, Motivation/drive and planning are Essential
STEM Engineering Degree or equivalent

job_desc:
AI Specialist
Fully Remote â€“ you can be based anywhere in the UK â€“ But must have full UK right to work.
 
Salary: 60k to 80k DoE with a 10% bonus
 
 
 
Are you interested in the practical application of Artificial Intelligence to solve problems in the real-world?
Are you interested in being part of a team that quickly brings new ideas to life?
Do you thrive on the challenges related to exploring the art of the possible?
Are you experienced in getting new products and solutions to the market quickly?


 
If so, consider joining our Global Technical Innovation Team.
 
 
The role of AI Engineer / Analyst / Specialist (depending on seniority) will join our team of technologists responsible for incubating new and novel software/data initiatives that drive growth and explore new markets.
 
 
This role operates within the technology organisation who are driving Artificial Intelligence Innovation.
 
 
We are looking for an experienced AI practitioner to join the team, using data science, machine learning and AI technologies to help us improve various business outcomes and drive innovation.
 
 
Our focus is on Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Neural Networks, Large Language Models, Knowledge Graphs, and Multi-Modal Generative AI.
 
Key Accountabilities
 
Collaborate with a cross-functional team to experiment with different ML/AI technologies, in large part related to Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Knowledge Representation (KG), to solve crucial business problems.
Understand and help refine the requirements of new products, services, and concepts.
Support the development of AI/ML-based prototypes, MVPs, and new products.


 
Knowledge and Qualifications
Hands-on prototyping and R&D in AI -- but we will look at candidates of exceptional skills and acumen independently of their seniority (compensation will be related to seniority).
 
Essential:
 
Proven knowledge of AI and NLP, including Python and common tools such as Github, Pandas, Numpy, Sklearn, NLTK, PyTorch, Tensorflow, GPT, BERT, SageMaker, etc.
 
Also required:
 
Entrepreneurial spirit, autonomy, teamwork, explorative skills (agile / lean, need discovery), comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty, problem solving, results oriented, a doer. Must have a proven history of progressing from concept to MVP quickly and iteratively.
 
Proven expertise in one or more of the following areas will capture our attention:
 
Knowledge Graphs, Graph DBs (neo4j, AWS Neptune), graph AI (e.g., PyKEEN, neo4j DS, etc.);
AI-based data deduplication, conditional merging, entity disambiguation and linking;
Mastering of AWS MLOps (SageMaker Studio, S3, ECR, Lambda), DVC, data engineering and big data technologies (e.g., ELT/ETL, Hadoop, Spark, AWS EMR, etc.);
Text generation (GPT 3/3.5, etc.), advanced text summarization, multi-modal generative AI.


 
Also appreciated:
 
ElasticSearch, Mongo DB, Postgres, Java, Scrum, Jira, knowledge of academic publishing processes
title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist

job_desc:
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to earn while you learn?
 
The L&G Apprentice programme has been designed to help you reach your potential. You will develop your skill set, gain valuable work experience and complete a fully funded professional qualification, all whilst earning a competitive salary with access to outstanding employee benefits.
 
With support every step of the way and access to core skills training, you will contribute to the success of the Retail Operational Planning team and be supported by a dedicated line manager. As part of a cohort of apprentices, you will also have the opportunity to connect with your peers and colleagues though networking opportunities and social events.
 
Joining L&G is the beginning to a future that will be anything but familiar. So take a closer look, get involved, be curious and find out how we will enable you to be at your best no matter who you are.
 
Join us on an 18-month programme in which you will complete a Level 4 Data Analyst qualification, whilst building your business acumen.
 
Youâ€™ll receive on the job training and coaching from your line manager to help you gain the professional, personal, social, and methodical skills needed to succeed as a data analyst. Alongside this youâ€™ll complete training workshops and assignments, delivered by a leading apprenticeship training provider. Combined, these will fully equip you to be successful in your role, with the knowledge and skills required to apply to real world business challenges.
 
During your apprenticeship you will:
 
 
Develop your skills in data analysis, coding and data visualisation software
Work with business stakeholders to design and deliver analytical solutions and reports
Work with other data professionals including and business stakeholders to automate and productionise outputs
Communicate with stakeholders in a non-technical manner, providing advice, understanding and insight
Collaborate with individuals across the organisation
Have guidance from your team and manager who will support you and teach you the day-to-day role
Apply the knowledge and skills that youâ€™ve learnt from your training into the role
Have the opportunity to meet and network with new colleagues within your team, but also across the wider organisation
 


 
The person who would most benefit and enjoy this programme is hungry to learn and eager to get started in the world of work. Weâ€™re not expecting prior industry experience, but weâ€™ll want to see that you have the aptitude, potential and desire which will ultimately lead to you being successful. Weâ€™ll teach you the rest!
 
To qualify for the programme, you will need:
 
 
GCSE Maths grade C/4 or equivalent
GCSE English grade C/4 or equivalent
Minimum 96 UCAS points from your Level 3 Qualifications e.g. A 'levels or equivalent
 
To not currently be on a government funded training course, e.g. on apprenticeship
The right to work in the UK and have lived in the UK or EEA for the past 3 consecutive years.
 
To have an awareness and interest of Data both in business and the wider world
 
Passion and commitment to solving problems and improving ways of working in business
 


 
To be confirmed as part of offer letter.
 
As a company, to be one of the world's largest Asset Managers, homebuilders, pension providers and insurances brands, we are diverse by our very nature. And we're a company that wants to use our diversity and influence to make society better in the long term - for everyone. To do this we need to be a company that welcomes everyone, where everyone can succeed. That means we're committed to building an inclusive culture in L&G where we can all perform at our best, no matter who we are, what we do or where we do it. So, whoever you are, wherever you are, whatever your story, we'd love to hear from you.
 
Our data analyst apprenticeship scheme within Retail Operational Planning provides the opportunity to work on a wide variety of projects and learn from data experts. They strive to use data to support planning; decision making and drive great customer outcomes. They deliver safe, secure, and innovative data solutions to drive sustainable value for a competitive and modern L&G. This team handles complex and varied data/analysis requests from stakeholders across Retail Operational and ensure they are delivered in accordance with the requested specifications and deadlines. Theyâ€™re responsible for the development, build and roll out of new reports as required by stakeholders. Co-ordination, running and maintenance of systems, existing reporting to ensure data integrity whilst meeting all governance requirements.
 
Great minds donâ€™t have to think alike, so we welcome voices from all backgrounds. Bringing together people with different life experiences helps us build empathy with our customers and drive innovation.
 
We donâ€™t just talk about it, we actively promote diversity and equitable opportunities for all. That means our employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status. In fact, we embrace every dimension of diversity to reflect the customers and communities we serve.
 
We think itâ€™s important to create an inclusive environment where we can all belong, contribute and drive progress, where you can develop and grow, and be empowered. We want you to use your voice to help us build a better tomorrow.
 
We all work differently, and have different needs, which is why. weâ€™re always open to discussing flexible working arrangements. Likewise, weâ€™re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs during our recruiting process.
 
So whoever you are, wherever you are, whatever your story, we'd love to hear from you.
 
We believe that good businesses are built on doing the right thing and strive to do what is best for both our people and our customers. This means enabling you to bring your best self to work by giving you what you need, when you need it.
 
This is why weâ€™ve designed a process that puts you in control, because we recognise that your time is valuable. At each step, make sure you take time to pause and reflect before progressing to the next, as each subsequent step will ask for a bit more of your time.
 
 
We want you to feel comfortable that this process is as fair and inclusive as possible, so please let us know if you have an illness or disability that you think may affect your performance during the process, so that reasonable adjustments can be made.
 
At each step weâ€™ll give more information and clear instructions on what actions you need to take and how you can prepare. Youâ€™ll be assessed at each of these steps.
 
In brief, our assessment stages process will include:
 
CV Application:
 
This will be reviewed to ensure you meet the basic requirements for the role, we do not require work experience for entry level roles and understand that C.Vs may not have huge amounts of detail at this stage of your career
 
Video Interview:
 
This will take approximately 20minutes, we will ask some questions that will help us understand your motivation for L&G and the Apprenticeship we are offering
 
Assessment Centre:
 
Comprised of a competency-based interview, group activity and an individual work based activity
 
Provisional Offer subject to enrolment:
 
If you are successful in the assessment centre, you'll receive a provisional job offer, the final step will be for you to enrol on the training course. Once this is complete, we can officially offer you the job!
 
Please note that we are recruiting on a rolling basis for this role and therefore the position may close sooner than the advertised date. We would encourage you to apply as soon as possible so as not to miss out on this opportunity.
 
The start date for the programme will be September 2023.
 
For any queries, please contact futuretalentrecruitment.landg.com. Please noteâ€¯weâ€¯are unable to accept email applications.

job_desc:
Description
 
We are looking for driven, talented Software Engineers with knowledge of Machine Learning to help us build our SaaS-based anti-money laundering solutions, which help organizations fight financial crime! We are building cutting edge solutions that help reveal the truth for a safer world and stop money ending up in the hands of terrorists. You will join the Entity Resolution team within the ComplyData group, engineering machine learning models, tooling and data pipelines for our linked data ecosystem.
 
About Us
 
Since launching in 2014, we have been on a mission to neutralize the risk of money laundering, terrorist financing, corruption, and other financial crime on a global scale. In that time, we have raised over $100m in funding, have four global hubs located in New York, London, Singapore and Cluj-Napoca and are backed by Ontario Teachersâ€™, Index Ventures, Balderton Capital and Goldman Sachs.

We aim to grow to over 350 employees in the next 12 months, as we continue to fight the good fight against financial crime and help make compliance less painful for our client base of over 500 enterprises across 75 different countries. We're leveraging game-changing tech to help us on our mission as the financial industryâ€™s leading source of AI-driven financial crime risk data and detection technology.

No fight against crime is complete without the right values, and we take ours very seriously!
 
 
Focus on the Team - We're Collaborative, Human, and Humble
 
 
Kaizen - We're Curious, Proactive and Agile
 
 
Deliver Results - We're Tenacious, Accountable and Focused
 
We can only defeat financial crime if we have the right people with the right values in place to do so, and we're committed to investing in passionate people who are experts in their field. Our culture and working environment is second to none - Don't believe us? See what our employees have to say on Glassdoor.
 
The Role
 
Software Engineers / Machine Learning Engineers on the Entity Resolution team will:
 
 
Work alongside Data Scientists to develop and productionize machine learning models for Entity Resolution
Build out the software ecosystem for Entity Resolution, including feature extraction and storage, workflow management, model delivery and more
Help the team to make the right technical and architectural decisions as we evolve and scale our systems
Integrate ML models into new and existing data pipelines to drive positive impacts for CAâ€™s customers
Undertake prototyping and research work to determine the best approach to achieve the teamâ€™s goals
 


What does success look like after 3 months?
 
Youâ€™ll understand some of our customerâ€™s pain points, how your work impacts them and what weâ€™ll be delivering in the months ahead. Youâ€™ll also know enough about the data and software ecosystem at ComplyAdvantage to take ideas from prototypes to production.

You will have been involved in the development of new models and improvements to ER pipelines, resulting in improved data quality and satisfied customers.

Youâ€™ll have contributed to our internal tooling, enhancing the experiment management, MLOps and data management capabilities of the team, helping accelerate model delivery safely.

You will have participated in design and architectural conversations, shared ideas and advocated for both good engineering practice and customer value, making your mark on the team and its projects.
 
The Requirements
 
Weâ€™re looking for a smart and motivated individual that takes pride in their work and contributes to a positive and engaging working environment. You will be confident in your ability to deliver on the points covered above, taking into account the following:
 
Your ability to:
 
 
Communicate capably, and translate business requirements into technical solutions
Work as part of a cross-functional team in an agile environment
Analyse and problem solve effectively
 


Your experience of:

job_desc:
Company Description: 
Adoreboard is a software start-up based in Belfast, Northern Ireland that provides â€˜predictive emotion analysisâ€™ for text data. We work with some of the worldâ€™s leading brands such as Procter & Gamble, Allstate, and Amazon to help transform their employee and customer experience by using our text analytics platform. 


Our clients typically use the platform entirely self-serve, but there are cases where they do not have enough internal resources to allocate to qualitative analysis. This role will bridge the gap between the data our customers have collected and the insights ready to be drawn out. The applicant will be successful in the role by understanding client business objectives and translating the corresponding data into high impact decision-ready insights. 


Job Title:
 Qualitative Data Insights Analyst
Location: 
Remote, Belfast 
Job Description:
 We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled individual to join our team as a Qualitative Research Analyst. The ideal candidate is a fast learner who will use the Adoreboard platform to mine for key insights in a (qualitative) data-heavy environment. The successful candidate will work on behalf of our customers to produce meaningful reports and provide actionable recommendations (â€œdecision-ready insightsâ€) based on their findings.


Roles & Responsibilities: 


Performing qualitative research using the Adoreboard platform to identify, analyse, and interpret patterns and trends in complex text-based datasets that will be helpful for problem diagnosis and prediction
Using the Adoreboard platform to upload, analyse and create insights that meet customer needs
Work with customers to understand their business needs and research objectives, undertaking analysis and presenting back key insights to answer the research objectives 
Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources
Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time 
Preparing reports and presentations for stakeholders stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Working with the Adoreboard team across product and customer success to identify process improvement opportunities and propose system modifications
Analysing local, national, and global trends that impact both our customers organisation and their industries to match the business context of the customer to key insights that meet their needs
Undertake ad hoc internal research projects that support the growth and development of current customers 


Key Skills Required:


Proven working experience in qualitative research or data analysis as well as reporting actionable insights
Excellent communication, professional report writing and presentation skills (with an emphasis on data visualisation and storytelling using data)
Strong critical thinking - a systematic and logical approach to problem solving that is first and foremost solution-oriented
Ability to work well under pressure and meet tight deadlines
Experience working in a fast-paced, data-heavy environment
A focus on accuracy and strong attention to detail (grammatical and numerical) along with the ability to work independently 
Adept at boolean logic and constructing database-like queries
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages (specifically Excel, but R or Matlab would be helpful) to be used as additional support in analysing data
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organise and analyse data
Ability to work within a diverse team
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Oracle, R, and Python is helpful but not required




Experience Requirements:


1+ year(s) experience in qualitative research or agency would be highly beneficial
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g. psychology, sociology, data analytics, market research)
We offer a dynamic and challenging work environment, competitive compensation, and opportunities for growth and advancement. If you are a motivated and talented individual with a passion for qualitative data analysis, we encourage you to apply.


What You Get In Return: 
Full time role 
Remote, flexible working with office for use based in Belfast 
25 days annual leave + public holidays 
Birthday Off 
Private Medical Insurance
Pension scheme 
Competitive salary 
A team working environment that promotes healthy work life balance
title: Qualitative Research Analyst

job_desc:
You know that company youâ€™ve heard about that has invested a shed load of time and money into being â€˜One of the UKâ€™s best companies to work forâ€™, a business that invests in technical skills development, flexible working and brilliant benefits and culture - well this is that company.
 
Of course, as a Data Engineer, you might not give a hoot about that. For you it might just be about the tech, well then this lovely team also tick that box as well.
 
With serious data know-how, using emerging technologies, AI and machine learning, these guys are the envy of others in their space but theyâ€™re also really down-to-earth and up for a few laughs along the way!
 
The sector they operate in is largely irrelevant, all you need to know is that it's a world-class tech business that is building an exciting data strategy that your career and skills will benefit from and that the competition will be envious of!
 
 
So what will you do - here comes the normal boring job spec bit!
 
 
 
Youâ€™ll design, build and deploy data products and pipelines and architectural vision and roadmaps - obviously
Youâ€™ll be right in the centre of a talented team of engineers that listens to each other's ideas!
Sure youâ€™ll work to exacting quality standards but this is because you want to set an industry benchmark, that will disrupt the status quo and be part of something really distinctive
 
Of course, youâ€™ll have alignment with the business stakeholders but because youâ€™ll want to blow them away with your technical vision and put their ideas into production!


 
Here is a long list of technical skills we hope youâ€™ll come with, but you may also see this as a list of skills your gain or strengthen in this role!
 
 
 
Highly proficient in building and maintaining data pipelines in Databricks
Highly proficient in data engineering technologies, such as Delta Lake, Apache Spark, Azure Data Factory etc.
Highly proficient in big data engineering programming languages such as Python and/or Scala
Experience with cloud technologies, especially GCP and Azure
Experience in T-SQL and maintenance of SSIS packages
Highly proficient in ETL Process Development
Experience of Data Modelling
Experience of Data Warehousing dimensional modelling techniques.
Some experience in .NET C# or Terraform would be useful
Experience in the usage of a continuous delivery system and related concepts
Experience in the usage of data reporting tools, such as PowerBI
Strong understanding of application security concepts, including securing production applications and delivery pipelines
Strong understanding of systems required in delivering commercial finance products, and how they fit together (i.e. loan origination systems, loan management systems, collections systems)
Strong understanding of data governance concepts such as data ownership, data stewardship etc


 
And as for a list of non-technical skills, weâ€™re just looking for committed and collabotative people that have a positive attitude and little or no ego!
 
 
Hereâ€™s the thing, if youâ€™re looking to work in a great company that cares about you, if you want to work with a team of people you can respect and can learn from, and if youâ€™re looking for the right mix of home/office work this could be the perfect role.
 
 
The tech speaks for itself and we know you wonâ€™t work here for millennia, so if you want to hang out with some cool people, develop some great data-driven products and learn skills that will increase your market worth in the future, this is the right place.
 
 
And if you find the directness and candour in this post unappealing then this is probably not the right place for you either!! Fancy a grown-up, frank and friendly conversation - reach out to me Simon Bucknell! There is a bunch of stuff I need to explain about this company and this role!!
 
 
Open to candidates requiring sponsorship providing you have at least 2 years of UK work experience.

job_desc:
Are you looking for an exciting new challenge? Want to work on cutting-edge technology with a team of talented professionals? Look no further than our latest job opportunity! We are currently seeking an exceptional candidate to join our dynamic team and make a meaningful impact on our industry.
 
Position: Data Tester
Location: West Midlands
Salary: Competitive
 
Office attendance: 2-3 days per week
 
Who we are:
 
dig-x is an IT consultancy based in Stafford, where innovation, creativity, and a passion for excellence drive everything we do. We are a dynamic, forward-thinking organization that is dedicated to making a positive impact on the world through our cutting-edge products and services. Our company is built on a foundation of innovation, driven by a team of talented and passionate professionals who are committed to pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We are always striving to be at the forefront of our industry and to make a real difference in the lives of our end clients.
 
At our company, we believe that our success is driven by the talent, dedication, and creativity of our team members. We are committed to fostering a collaborative, inclusive, and supportive work environment that empowers our employees to excel and reach their full potential. We offer a range of opportunities for professional development, as well as competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits packages.
 
The Role:
We are looking to add to the team, by adding a skilled Data Tester. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis and quality assurance, with experience in testing large data sets and identifying data quality issues. The Data Tester will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of our data, working closely with our data engineering and development teams to identify and resolve issues promptly.
 
Responsibilities:
 
 
Develop and execute test plans for data validation and data integrity
Identify data quality issues and work with the data engineering team to resolve them
Design and execute test cases for functional, integration, and regression testing of data
Develop and maintain test data sets for testing purposes
Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency across various systems and platforms
Communicate test results and findings to development teams, management, and stakeholders
Work with the development team to prioritise and resolve identified issues


 
Requirements:
 
The following gives examples of the essential skills the Data Tester would need to succeed and also the desirable skills that would benefit in the long run...
 
Essential Requirements:
 
Understanding of relational databases and data warehouses.
Ability to write complex SQL including joins, subqueries, aggregations, window functions, CTEs, etc.
Working with source code management tools, e.g. git, dimensions.
Analysis, design, and execution of test cases, procedures, and suites.
A strong understanding of the Software Development lifecycle.


 
Desirable experaince:
 
Ability to create a test schema/repository using ETL tools.
Automated testing frameworks.
Teamwork management tools such as Jira, and Azure DevOps.
Usage of Azure DevOps pipelines for release via CI/CD processes.
Test data management techniques: synthetic data, anonymisation, sampling.
Operating within a self-organising Agile team.
Risk-based approach to testing in a cost-effective and timely manner.
Test environment provision and configuration management.
Working across functional and non-functional test phases.
Impacting, estimation to link into a master project plan.
Mentoring other staff in the use of SQL.
Working with non-relational data, JSON, XML, CSV, Parquet


 
If you are passionate about data and have a strong desire to ensure data accuracy and integrity, we encourage you to apply. We offer a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits package, and a collaborative work environment that encourages growth and learning. If you would like to apply, please apply via this job ad or our website on Careers | dig-x IT.
title: Data Tester

job_desc:
Junior Data Management Consultant
 
United Kingdom
 
 
The Company
 
 
m-hance are a one of the UKâ€™s leading Microsoft partners, we specialise in implementing innovative and functionally rich software solutions into businesses in the charity and non-profit sector. As a business we passionately care about our customers and the communities they serve and customer service is at the heart of everything we do. We work in close partnership with our customers to transform their business and improve their operations.
 
m-hance are an organisation who have fully embraced home / hybrid working with the majority of our employees working remotely to provide improved employee wellbeing and work life balance. We have office bases in Manchester and Dublin and whilst the offices are available to those that wish to work from there, we support a fully remote workforce, and have focused to put wellbeing at the forefront of the business.
 
In order to support our remote workforce, collaboration and communication are key at m-hance creating a culture where every employee feels included and valued. All m-hance employees are given time for learning and development as we strive to not only challenge our staff in the work that they do, we want our people to continue to grow, and to have a fun time doing it too. We provide an excellent benefit package to support our employees with everyday healthcare costs as well as providing tailored mental health service, gym, and retail discounts thereâ€™s something for everyone at m-hance.
 
We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Junior Data Management Consultant to join our team. This is a great opportunity to join m-hance at a time of ongoing growth and success. As a Junior Data Management Consultant at m-hance you will join our expanding Data Team. The work is varied and will be primarily focused on some of the following areas: - Integration/Migration/Enrichment of data using ELTL pipelines - Dimensional Modelling/Data Warehousing - Analytics/Reporting/Machine Learning
 
The Perks
 
Along with a highly Competitive salary package, We offer a great range of additional benefits and discounts through our various partnerships
 
- 23 days' holiday (rising to 28 days with service)
- Company contributory pension
- Life assurance benefit (4 x Salary)
- Health and Wellness Benefits (medical, dental, eye - health cash back scheme with fast access to private care)
- Income protection scheme, and a cycle2work scheme
- Volunteering Leave - Be Good, Do Good days - the opportunity to take a paid day out of the office, volunteering for our charity partners or a cause of your choice
- Employee Assistance - 24hr Counselling and Advice Line
- Mental Health Support - Free access to a fully tailored mental health service online -providing confidential support from a team of health professionals
- Access to discounted membership at participating gyms and shopping discounts offers
 
The Role
 
 
As a Data Management Consultant, you will work on a variety of customer-facing projects, primarily but not exclusively centered around Microsoft Dynamics 365, and based upon Microsoftâ€™s Azure stack.
 
These may include:
 
- Identification, Analysis and Ingestion of data from source repositories to suitable staging environments
- Mapping, Cleansing, Validation and enrichment of such data before onward loading to primary applications (such as D365)
- Replication/Archival of Data to Azure Data Lake Storage â€“ potentially via technologies such as Azure Synapse Link
- Analysis of customer requirements around Analytics/Reporting and Design & Implementation of appropriate Dimensional Models/Hubs/Warehouses
- Potential Involvement in further Analytics/Forecasting/Machine Learning
- Collaborating with Project Teams in relation to Validation, Testing and Documentation of such solutions and in relation to all data-related project activities
- Coaching and Mentoring/Training of clients in relation to relevant aspects of Data Management
 
About You
 
To be considered as a Junior Data Management Consultant, you will need:
 
 
- Are passionate about Data Transformation technologies
- Have some previous qualifications or experience around data management (integrations/migrations, data manipulation/analysis/reporting etc.)
- Have good problem-solving, organizational, interpersonal & communication skills.
- Are able to form strong and lasting relationships with clients and colleagues, and key stakeholders at every level
 
Desirable skills include experience with:
 
- SQL Server, Azure SQL or Azure Data Lakes
- Microsoft D365 CRM and/or Business Central
- Microsoft Power BI
- Data Mining/Machine Learning
 
Diversity and Inclusion
 
m-hance is dedicated to making sure that every applicant is assessed solely on personal merit and qualifications. We actively celebrate the diversity of our colleagues and provide an inclusive work environment free from all forms of discrimination and harassment, a culture based on inclusivity and mutual respect.
 
We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce among our teammates is critical to our ongoing success. We believe that a more inclusive workforce is a more collaborative and productive one. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate.
 
As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that we make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion, or belief. We recognise that diverse teams make the strongest teams and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.
 
To apply for the role of Junior Data Management Consultant, please apply via the button shown. This vacancy is being advertised by Webrecruit. The services advertised by Webrecruit are those of an Employment Agency.

What you'll need:

To be successful in this role, youâ€™ll have:

Ultimately, we keep the electricity flowing directly to where itâ€™s needed, second by second.
 
This role can be based from Wokingham or Warwick ( 2 days a week onsite), and we continue to offer hybrid working from office and home. We are open to full time and part time applicants, as well as flexible working arrangements.

This Business Analyst role will work within a small team in one of our core operational business areas â€“ Data and Analytic team. The role consists of project-based business analysis, consisting of a Data transformation initiative. A successful candidate will be given support, guidance and mentoring by Senior Business Analysts and the Principal Business Analyst for this business area.
 
Key Accountabilities

Experience Required
 
 
BA experience
A strong analytical mindset
Good stakeholder engagement skills
Good data skills

Desirable Knowledge

More Information

25 days holiday, plus eight statutory days â€“ and options to buy extra holiday days

A work-life balance, with part-time applicants encouraged
 
Genuinely interesting analytical work!
 
You will also have access to a number of other flexible benefits such as share incentive plan, salary sacrifice car and technology schemes, support via employee assistance lines and matched charity giving name to a few.

job_desc:
TruRating â€“ be part of something which will change the world.
 
Take the plunge. Live the dream. Do something which you know will touch the lives of millions of people the world over every single day and will change the way businesses and consumers think. Get out of bed in the morning for that adrenalin hit, love the pace, love the challenge, love doing what has never been done before â€“ and love being the best youâ€™ve ever been. And whatâ€™s more, owning part of what youâ€™ve created.
 
TruRating is a hypergrowth software as a service (SaaS) company that improves businesses, benefits consumers, and donates to charities. Our starting point is using patented technology to collect feedback from 80%+ of customers at the point of payment and linking this to transaction and product data to provide unique mass, real-time insight to merchants.
 
This feedback can also be pointed towards consumers - providing transparent, representative, and validated information to help us all make better decisions. Whilst we also â€˜do our bitâ€™ as for every question we ask, TruRating donates to childrenâ€™s charities.
 
Working with our retail partners we can also provide data & insights to 3rd parties including FMCGs via ground-breaking â€˜intelligent questionsâ€™ which allow us to send questions in real time that relate to specific products or behaviours.
 
We partner with the biggest payment and technology companies in the world, and our unique integrations mean we are delivering an unprecedented dataset. No other business in the world is combining online and offline sentiment and consumer behaviour data in huge volumes, at near to real time.
 
Our customers include some of the best performing and highest-profile retailers in the world â€“ and the group is growing all the time. We are collecting nearly 5 million ratings and 250m data points every week now and are â€˜liveâ€™ in the UK, Europe, North America, Australia, and NZ. With almost 450m ratings under our belt and global patents granted / registered, the world is there for the taking.
 
We need to grow our passionate team to help us live out the dream and deliver on our incredible opportunity. TruRating is a global organization with US headquarters in Atlanta GA, UK headquarters in London and ANZ headquarters in Sydney. We are actively growing our team and invite you to check us out!
 
 
The role in a nutshell:
TruRating is set to grow quickly in 2023 â€“ and the TruRating Data Services team is key in enabling and supporting this growth. Weâ€™re on a mission to modernise our data pipelines and adopt the latest DataOps approaches. We help deliver new capability for our external data and insight products every day. We provide critical data and reports internally for day-to-day operations and product decision making. In short, variety is the norm. Our Data Engineers are â€˜full-stackâ€™, working on pipelines one day and BI reports the next.
 
The right candidate will have experience delivering scalable data solutions to ingest, process and serve a massive amount of data. They will have a passion for new technology advances in the big data, analytics and insight space. In addition, they will have exposure to the full â€˜BI stackâ€™ and be happy to roll up their sleeves and take on the full range of Data Services that the team provides.
 
 
Key responsibilities
Working with the Data Services team:
 
To establish the data architecture that can enable TruRating to grow across the globe, meeting the requirements of the individual territories and merchants of all shapes, sizes, and sectors.
Developing and managing end to end data pipelines from initial acquisition through to analytical storage and processing.
Working with the wider development team to deliver both internal and external-facing data products and systems.
Providing an internal analytical ecosystem for deep dive analytical activity and reporting.
Supporting data integration services for product analytics and between operational systems (CRM, finance etc.).
DataOps â€“ we build, deploy and support all data infrastructure.
Evaluating multiple solution options and presenting findings to key stakeholders.
Designing and documenting solutions.
Research and experiment with emerging data technologies and industry trends.


 
 
We would love to bring on board someone who has/is:
Previous Experience in a Data Engineering or BI Engineering Role and is:
 
Delivering scalable data solutions using cloud services (Azure preferred but AWS & GCP also considered).
Self-reliant, resilient and proactive with high levels of motivation to make things happen, deliver effectively and efficiently.
A growth and learning mindset.
Loves being part of a high performing team and adds enthusiasm and the drive to overcome challenges and turn them into opportunities.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, collaboration and communications skills.
Strong SQL skills with in-depth SQL RDBMS experience, including understanding/ writing complex queries and automating the build of analytical models.
Strong experience with ETL, data warehousing and BI technologies.
An understanding of agile development practices, having worked successfully with agile delivery teams.


 
Technical Skills
 
Azure Platform: Azure SQL DB, Azure SQL DW, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Data Factory, Azure Function Apps, Event Hubs.
Strong experience with ETL, data warehousing and BI technologies (Power BI â€“ desirable).
Source control with git and experience using CI/CD solutions including Azure DevOps.
Programming/scripting experience, e.g., C#, Python, PowerShell;
DAX and/or MDX query language â€“ desirable;
Legacy MSSQL BI Stack, SSAS, SSIS, SSRS[A3] â€“ desirable.
Snowflake experience â€“ desirable.


 
TruRewards
In addition to our enviable company culture at TruRating, we offer 25 days holiday, Private Medical Healthcare with BUPA (medical history disregarded), a SMART pension, Wellbeing support packages with â€œWeCareâ€ and group life insurance with Canada Life.
 
As with everyone in the team, you will have share options and therefore own a part of the company and benefit directly from its success.
 
If you are excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, please apply anyway :-) Studies in this area report that some groups of us â€“ like people of colour, people with disabilities and people from LGBTQ2+ communities, women etc. are less likely to apply to jobs unless we meet every single qualification. Here at TruRating we are committed to providing the most welcoming and inclusive work environment - free from any form of discrimination and inequality. What makes TruRating is us all thriving as part of a diverse and supportive culture â€“ and we would love to welcome you to it :-)

job_desc:
The quality of our customer data is critical, and so we are looking for Analysts to join our newly created Data Quality team in Belfast to play a key role in ensuring the accuracy and consistency of our data. You will be an advocate for data quality and enjoy solving data problems through root cause analysis to help drive business action.




About The Team




The Data Quality team is focused on improving the accuracy, actionability and scalability of Rapid7â€™s Customer data across core systems such as Salesforce, Netsuite and our internal customer platform.




This Team Currently Works To Action This Goal In 4 Primary Ways




Our goal is to build a strong, sustainable data foundation that enables our â€˜Go to Customerâ€™ teams to consistently execute activities that drive customer achievement.


Proactive Efforts to Ensure Customer Data Consistency - Automated data cleanup processes to prevent customer issues from happening, plus activities to ensure critical data is accurate and available (HQ Address, Website, 3rd Party firmographics, R7 Platform mapping)
Resolution of High Priority Issues - Risk Management - Efficient remediation of high priority customer-facing issues when they do happen (i.e. Support Case visibility, Platform access issues)
Root Source Foundational Analysis - Identification of core improvement areas needed to effectively scale our customer data model (i.e. validations to support DUNS matching, Platform -> SFDC integration improvements)
Key Business Initiative Support - High value data activities to ensure success of core projects and/or reduce manual work for operational teams (i.e. Acquisition data migration support, Customer Value Realization data mapping, streamlining EOQ reporting activities by ensuring customer data quality, etc.)


About The Role




The Data Quality Analyst role provides a vital role in ensuring that Rapid7 maintains control over our data quality. You will proactively work on data cleanup processes and business initiatives to continuously improve our data quality to drive confidence in business decisions and improve our customer experience.




In This Role, You Will


Identify optimal approaches for resolving data quality or consistency issues to achieve set goals 
Diagnose sources of data quality issues by performing root cause analysis - evaluate core systems and processes and analyze data to reach conclusions and identify trends (i.e. is our overall data quality improving over time?) and â€˜problem areasâ€™ (where is more focus needed?)
Monitor and measure ongoing data fidelity (quality and consistency) as well as progress of key data quality initiatives and report progress regularly to data governance business functions 
Perform tactical high priority clean up activities when they arise (i.e. priority 3rd party data matching, account merging, customer data checks)
Manage an inbound queue of Data Quality requests that span across multiple tools and systems such as Salesforce, Netsuite and internal applications
Partner with internal IT and business teams to resolve data quality issues when they arise and take actions such as:
Identify system gaps and articulate business requirements where necessary
Perform UAT functions
Ongoing analysis and maintenance of key system processes (i.e. Lead to Account matching, Platform <-> SFDC mapping, etc.)


The Skills Youâ€™ll Bring Include


2-3 years experience performing analysis on large datasets - identifying consistency issues, trends, and assessing overall accuracy and quality to help drive appropriate business action 
Technical knowledge of core business systems such as Excel, Salesforce, Netsuite
Ability to work effectively with 3rd party data tools and services such as D&B Optimiser, Hoovers, LinkedIn Sales Insights and optimize their integration with core systems
Ability to understand integration tools such as Workato, Syncari and partner closely with internal teams on optimising data flows between systems
Collaborative team player who has the ability to partner cross functionally to resolve data quality issues and create customer outcomes 
Strong problem solving skills with an analytical approach 
Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate â€˜big pictureâ€™ trends
Customer centric approach, puts the customer needs at the forefront of all decision making 


Nice To Haves


Ability to use Google Scripts or SQL to create and deploy solutions to automate recurring data quality tasks and functions 
Knowledge or ability to use data cleansing tools such as Cloudingo or Syncari to execute â€˜mass-actionsâ€™ on data (i.e. auto merging, data enrichment, archiving processes)
Experience with reporting tools such as Tableau 


We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. Thatâ€™s because these teams reflect a variety of backgrounds and professional experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please donâ€™t be shy - apply today.




About Rapid7




Rapid7 (NASDAQ: RPD) helps organizations across the globe protect what matters most so innovation can thrive in an increasingly connected world. Our comprehensive technology, services, and community-focused research simplify the complex for security teams, helping them reduce vulnerabilities, monitor for malicious behavior, be in 10 places at once, and shut down attacks. Weâ€™re on a mission to make security solutions easier to use and access so we can bring safety and resilience to more people. With more than 10,000 customers across 140+ countries, Rapid7 is a leader in cybersecurity that has earned numerous industry accolades and recognition for our technology and culture.
