job_desc:
Job Description
 
ABOUT THE TEAM
 
Itâ€™s an exciting time in the Consumer Panel UK team at NielsenIQ, with a global investment commitment in â€˜Consumerâ€™ fully underway and our UK business growing in strongly.
 
The consumer panel landscape in the UK is undergoing significant change, with both leading players adopting new technology & techniques to arrive at solutions for clients. This dynamic presents a huge opportunity for NielsenIQ as clients reassess previously held assumptions and seek to reassess how ROI can be delivered to their businesses in this fast-changing competitive landscape.
 
NielsenIQ are already seeing a significant increase in the number of clients interested in our Panel proposition and our healthy performance demonstrates the growing appetite in the client community for integrated solutions and an increasingly compelling ROI proposition.
 
This landscape, combined with our own product development roadmap, means we can see a clear pipeline of innovation & opportunity that will step-change growth.
 
About This Job
 
The role will report directly to the commercial lead for Consumer Panel Services in the UK, it will be a dual focussed role supporting the Consumer Analytics Team in both delivery and commercial support. The CAS team had an exceptional year during 2022 selling to existing NIQ clients and new Clients and therefore the commercial part of this role will be supporting the Commercial Consultant on prospecting, proposal writing and revenue admin while the delivery part of the role will be to support the delivery team in liaising with clients during the process and supporting the client delivery. As there will be analysis and insight understanding required in this part of the role the candidate will need to have an understanding of consumer panel and ideally Homescan analysis. It is a new role within the team so therefore the successful candidate will be able to craft it how they see fit.
 
The role will have responsibility towards the CAS revenue target and ensuring a healthy pipeline of opportunities and management of these in Microsoft Dynamics. The successful applicant needs to have an interest in selling, however most important is the ability to engage with clients and internal teams at NIQ to seek out potential CAS opportunities.
 
Please see more detailed role responsibilities below.
 
Responsibilities
 
Supporting CAS (Consumer Analytics Solutions)
 
revenue generation:
 
 
The role will have joint responsibility for the CAS (Consumer Analytics Solutions) UK revenue target working alongside the existing Commercial Consultant
This will involve creating new opportunities, following up on sales leads and ensuring client proposals are well matched to business needs and that delivery can be accommodated in a timely fashion


 
Pipeline management & forecasting:
 
 
The candidate will be responsible for building a healthy pipeline of opportunities and management of these in Microsoft Dynamics
If required, the candidate will be requested to support the wider Consumer panel team for proposals in the broader portfolio if there is an opportunity elsewhere


 
Insight Delivery
 
 
Working with the Delivery consultant to understand the CAS (Consumer Analytics Solutions) delivery process, our technology, how the data is used, the products we offer â€“ the successful applicant will support on projects and ultimately lead their own projects delivering analysis and insight to the client


 
Matrix working:
 
 
The CAS (Consumer Analytics Solutions) team has a unique working structure working with off shore modelling and insight teams, therefore the successful applicant will need to develop relationships with these teams as well as UK based operations and commercial teams


 
Requirements
 
 
Solid experience working within the FMCG industry, ideally with experience of working with Consumer or Shopper panel data Panel. Experience of working with and/or selling NielsenIQ Homescan, other consumer panel (e.g. Kantar Worldpanel), or loyalty card data would be a strong advantage
Experience or working with, or within, FMCG client insight departments and internal customers
Ideally, the candidate will have strong Consumer Panel knowledge, FMCG Manufacturer & Retailer insight
Strong business and commercial acumen (including business environment and client)
In interest in Consumer Analytics and how clients use the insight to drive and develop strategies
Solid proficiency in decision-making and problem resolution in a highly client-focused fashion
Highly proficient project management and time management skills, multi-tasking will be key to success in this role.
 
Experience of using NielsenIQ and/or other consumer panel (e.g. Kantar Worldpanel) analytic tools & delivery systems would be an advantage
Highly proficient verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills.
 


 
OUR BENEFIT
 
 
Flexible working environment (a hybrid working mode combining working from home, office and visiting clients)
Comprehensive health insurance
Industry-leading parental leave
Life assurance
Educational support
Pension plan
Volunteer time off
Bonus Plan
Car allowance


 
Additional Information
 
About NielsenIQ
 
NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company providing the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the worldâ€™s population. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and FMCG and retailers, we enable customers to defy whatâ€™s possible. How? We combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industryâ€™s top talent to create insights that unlock innovation. Join us and change the landscape.
 
Learn more at: www.niq.com
 
Want to keep up with our latest updates? Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook
 
Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
 
NielsenIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. job_desc:
How will your role contribute at NewDay?
 
This position needs someone with energy and passion to complement and grow within our existing development team to be part of the transition of our analyst and reporting team to an AWS cloud based environment where SQL, Python and Airflow are used to deliver key reporting and information provision to the business.
 
In this role you must have a growth mindset with a desire to deliver high quality output for yourself and the team and challenge the status quo. The ability to hit the deck running and contribute quickly will be important.
 
What will you be doing day-to-day?
 
Working on reporting and analytical solutions using Python and SQL skills, scheduling them in Airflow.
 
Performing analysis with key business users to identify the data requirement, sources for the data, and any derivations or business rules to be applied
 
Build and test processes using SQL tools over AWS, Python in Jupyter notebooks, balancing the data as required, and building automated quality checks into the process
 
Scheduling productionised jobs into the existing production schedule using Airflow
 
Working with the AWS Data Lake Engineering and Dev-Ops team to performance tune processes, recommend design changes and validate data
 
The role has these core areas of focus

Ensure solution is peer reviewed and signed off by the BI reporting manager

Essential
 
Your Skills and Experience
 
Experience working within a SQL relational development environment , using physical or virtual database systems
 
Knowledge of AWS cloud solutions
 
Analytical and customer focused approach
 
DESIRABLE
 
Knowledge of Python pandas
 
Experience of Juptyer notebooks
 
Your Personal Attributes
 
Loves to code, and proud about code quality.
 
Structured, organised, process driven and outcome oriented
 
Personable, credible, with good interpersonal skills
 
Good interpersonal & written communication skills. Ability to clearly articulate ideas in business-friendly language
 
Self-motivated, able to work in a fast paced environment
 
Strong organizational, planning and time management skills
 
Ability to build strong and effective working relationships on an ongoing basis
 
Ability to adopt company culture and embed into day-to-day interactions
 
Hard-working, keen and upbeat with shown passion and dedication.
 
Inclusion at NewDay
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We want all our colleagues to feel able to bring their whole selves to work. We will not discriminate on the basis of age, physical or mental disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race (including colour, nationality, and ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. job_desc:
Due to the continued growth and success of Ideagen, the Product Operations team continues to recruit, and we are now looking for a Product Data Analyst to join the Ideagen Family!

Data is strategically central in our business to support internal stakeholders in better understanding our customers and markets. It does this by informing and validating our business strategies and goals; inspiring change; tracking our understanding, awareness and customer engagement; and positioning our product brands to maximum effect.

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to own the quality and accessibility of data across the product function. They will work very closely with stakeholders within the product function, as well as from the wider business functions, such as revenue, to understand their data requirements and distil these into agreed actionable reports and projects to help maximise the growth of our business.
 
Key Responsibilities
 
 
Act as the custodian of data across the product function and acting as a consultant to other business teams when required.
 
Work collaboratively with stakeholders across the business
Have an attention to detail to ensure stakeholder requirements are fully met and are delivered to a high quality.
Have a good understanding of where data is captured and used across the business with a focus on Product, as well as who is using it and how.
Manages their time well ensuring expectation of stakeholders are effectively managed and agreed deadlines met.
Supports discussions in technical sessions to be the voice of data and highlight impact and opportunities where appropriate.
You are able to take a pragmatic approach towards requests, balancing delivery complexity against impact.
 


Skills & Experience
 
 
Strong ability in building data dashboards using tools such as Power BI
Comfortable talking in technical detail with the product team to discuss and refine data requirements requests
Able to challenge on stakeholder requirements where necessary
Able to effectively manage stakeholders across the business
Strong communication and soft skills
 
Highly organised collaborator
Be able to confidently examine trends, hidden patterns and discover insights in data that management can use to predict behaviours and improve decision making in product led decisions influence both marketing and business strategies.
 


Behaviours
 
 
Ambitious - Drive, Planning & Execution
Adventurous - Flexibility, Resilience & Savvy thinking
Community - Collaboration & Communication
 


What's in it for you?
 
While we take our work and deliverables seriously, we have a relaxed working environment and we want our people to be rewarded for their hard work. We offer benefits such as 34 days' holidays (inclusive of bank holidays), Enhanced Maternity and Paternity Pay, Contributory Pension Scheme, Free On-site Parking, Private Medical Insurance, and many more!
 
Who are Ideagen?
 
If you have ever flown in a plane, been in hospital, or even given blood, there is a good chance we've helped keep you safe. For nearly a quarter of a century, we have been providing software solutions to thousands of customers such as the UK NHS, Virgin, PwC, Emirates, Heineken and even Harvard University. We are not a large faceless corporation, but we are not a fly-by-night dot com company either. With more than 1150 employees in multiple locations across the UK, USA, Dubai, Malaysia, and Bulgaria â€“ not including our global Partner Network â€“ we're one of the most exciting and fastest growing software companies in the world.

job_desc:
Kantar Worldpanel is a world leader in consumer knowledge and insights based on consumer panels. Our High-Definition Inspiration approach combines market monitoring, advanced analytics and market research solutions that inspire successful actions on our customers. We deliver both the big picture and the fine detail that encourage successful actions by our clients. Our expertise about what people buy or use â€“ and why â€“ has become the market currency for brand owners, retailers, market analysts, and government organisations internationally.
 
Advanced Analytics is the driving engine of global growth, providing huge scope for personal development. Our Analytical Solutions Team provides the opportunity to quickly challenge and grow your expertise in the field of Data Science by working with and learning from a group of expert analysts, our most senior commercial leads, and our biggest clients. Utilising some of the most powerful analysis tools and techniques to power a suite of new technology-led solutions you will play a key part in understanding real-life consumer behaviour.
 
Does the idea of working with large, consumer led data sets, using innovative analytical techniques to answer our biggest and most challenging clientsâ€™ marketing and business challenges attract you?
 
We are looking for a Global Advanced Analytics Data Scientist with a passion for advanced analytics solutions who will make a significant impact on blue-chip companies, embarking on an exciting challenge to significantly improve our global analytical capabilities. Utilising industry-leading consumer information and statistical techniques, you will help our customers address their toughest marketing-related issues and identify opportunities to grow.
 
You will play a pivotal role in supporting the role out and continued development of a new suite of software solutions that require advanced analytical procedures embedded within them to meet the increasingly complex needs of our clients. To do so, you will work with an international community of experts combining best-in-class data collection and preparation through top-end, efficient analytical thinking culminating with dynamic final client results. We are embarking on an exciting new challenge to significantly improve our analytical client driver offer and this position will play a pivotal role in bringing this to market.
 
Throughout 2022 we have been rolling out globally a new suite of over 20 software solutions built with best-in-class advanced analytical procedures embedded within them. These will be linked to a new question led narrative putting the Kantar Worldpanel consumer data at the heart of addressing the ever increasingly complex needs of our clients. Our need is for someone who can support the analytical roll out of these solutions, as well as manipulate methodologies where required, working with a wider community of experts both internally across Kantar Worldpanel but also across our biggest and most challenging clients. Key metrics will be driving penetration of solutions and clients as well as ultimately growing and nurturing new revenue streams.
 
KEY OUTCOMES
 
 
Work with Kantar Worldpanel local and global advanced analytics team, as well as senior commercial leads and key clients to sell, produce and deliver best in class outputs across our suite of new analytical solutions.
Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data to help deliver innovative solutions to answer our clientsâ€™ business questions.
Work on the development of new skills, new analytical approaches and new ways of representing insight to constantly improve our offer.
Acting as an analytical expert on key global projects, providing advice internally to ensure that our approaches and outputs remain best-in-class and are fully understood by senior stakeholders.
Become an expert in both our clients and the methodologies you apply. Feed this expertise back into the rest of the team and business to drive continue improvement and innovation.
Collaborate with others to help transform consultative project work into repeatable analytics and production applications within our delivery platform.


 
CAPABILITIES
 
 
University degree in a mathematical/scientific discipline, preferably with a statistics element.
A Masters-level degree in a closely related discipline (statistics, data science, etc.) and/or professional experience in analytics and modelling.
At least 2 yearsâ€™ experience in applying statistics, data science and machine learning to solve business questions ideally within a FMCG/Retail/Media setting
Proficiency in data manipulation, analysis and visualisation using R. Additional experience with Shiny and package development desirable.
Experience with other data science languages and frameworks (Python/Spark) as well as coding experience in other languages used across our business (Java, JavaScript, C++) desirable
Experience working with, and deep understanding of the detail behind relevant modelling techniques â€“ clustering techniques, GLMs, decision trees, ensembling techniques etc.
Great organisational skills with the right level of creativity.
Critical thinking and collaborative leadership.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Fluent in English (other languages are advantageous).
Experience working across our tech stack which includes - Java, Spring, Angular, Databricks, Spark, SQL, Docker, and Kubernetes all running in an Azure environment â€“ beneficial.
Applying analytics applications in production settings.
A self-starter working across various levels of stakeholders to form complex briefs while pushing back where appropriate to achieve best outcomes.
Working well as part of wider project teams.


 
At Kantar, we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career thatâ€™s out of the ordinary and join us. We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well-being is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.
 
Privacy and Legal Statement
PRIVACY DISCLOSURE: Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by The Kantar Group Limited (â€œKantarâ€). Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is necessary for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager(s) and for consideration for potential future opportunities by Kantar and its affiliate Kantar group companies. For full details of our privacy policy please visit www.kantar.com. At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity, therefore we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.

job_desc:
At Bitfount our goal is to make the worldâ€™s intractable data interactable. Societyâ€™s data superpowers are gathering dust due to a problem that is easy to describe but hard to solve: The data required to solve the world's most pressing problems isn't the kind that's easily shared.
The limitations of current data infrastructure have created painful, slow, expensive and often ineffective workarounds for what should be seamless collaborations between trusted partners. But it doesn't have to be this way. â€So we're building a missing piece of global infrastructure: a secure network to enable organisations to send algorithms to data. This means they can share the benefits of their data with each other, without having to go through the painful and risky process of moving it around, without compromising its privacy, and without even needing to expose any raw data.
 
Right now, weâ€™re heads-down on applying our platform to the problem of clinical trial recruitment in the Healthcare space. Weâ€™re enabling privacy-preserving collaboration between healthcare providers and pharmaceutical companies, which will remove a major friction point in the process, and help ensure critical medicines make it through trials and into the hands of those who need them much sooner.
 
We believe that great software is built by great people working in great teams, and weâ€™re working hard to make Bitfount a home for both. Weâ€™re committed to building an organisation that people are proud to be part of, where everyone can learn and grow, where everyone is supported, and where everyone can do the best, most meaningful work of their careers in a cross-disciplinary environment. Everyoneâ€™s viewpoint is valued and we work hard to foster a culture of open discussion. Weâ€™re backed by top UK and international investors and a stellar advisory team.
Learn more about how we work at bitfount.com/company/careers
 
The role
Bitfount is looking for a motivated, experienced, mid or senior-level Python Software Engineer to join our Engineering team and contribute to the development of the federated ML and analytics python framework, which is a crucial component of our SaaS product. We're tackling lots of really interesting problems at the intersection of AI, ML and Analytics workflows, privacy, security, and enterprise functionality (e.g. for healthcare) across a number of apps and use-cases. You'll be part of a strong cross-functional team (product, design, engineering).
You should be comfortable with high quality software practices (including code-reviews, testing practices, and software design), happy to work in a diverse team, be willing to participate in our team-led discussions, and generally be interested in making sure artificial intelligence and data are used to make the world a better place.
 
Your work will include:
 
Working with product managers, front-end and full-stack engineers to build and grow the python backend that powers our app and web products
Developing a flexible yet robust backend that allows users to build machine learning models and perform data analytics whilst preserving privacy
Contributing to the process of planning, scoping and fleshing out projects we tackle during our development cycles
Supporting customers where necessary, ensuring theyâ€™re able to use the platform effectively for their use-case
Helping to shape engineering standards, practices and culture at Bitfount


 
You may be fit for this role if you:
 
3+ years of relevant experience designing and building software applications at a tech-forward software company
Have an excellent working knowledge of Python
Either have some experience using PyTorch/TensorFlow for machine learning or using NumPy for general data science tasks
You either already have a solid understanding of machine learning theory and practical challenges around training and deploying machine learning models or are enthusiastic about working on a ML-driven product team and learning about these topics
Bonus points for experience with privacy, security
Bonus points for qualifications in machine learning
Can pick things up quickly and adapt
Have solid knowledge of python unit testing
Have experience developing and running build, test, and deployment tools in production environments
Strong communication skills to bridge the gap between design, product, and engineering
Highly curious; not satisfied with getting something to work, you want to understand why it works and how to improve the quality of the product/software


 
Bitfount is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.
 
Please note:
 
all successful applicants will be subject to a DBS reference check in line with industry norms.
 
We look forward to hearing from you!
 
Company Benefits
 
 
ğŸ–ï¸ What we offer
 
 
Compensation package
 
Salary based on experience and market rate
Share options


Flexible work and tools
 
Hybrid Working policy - 1 day in the office
A personal budget for any equipment you need to do your job


Holidays and family time
 
25 days holiday a year, plus bank holidays - please use them all!
Enhanced paid maternity, paternity and adoption leave


Learning and development
 
Personal learning budget to use on books, courses, conferences and more


Health & Wellbeing
 
Private Medical Insurance including optical, dental and mental health.
Cycle to work scheme


Community
 
Great colleagues: we value a culture of authenticity, humility, and excellence. We want you to make an impact on our culture.
Regular (optional) team and company events in and out of the office
Lunch on Bitfount once a week if youâ€™re office-based


 
Interview Process
 
CV Review: we review your resume to see if we might be a good fit
Getting to know you: 30 min chat with our People and Operations manager to talk about your experience and to answer questions about the role
Technical Screen: 45 minute coding interview with an engineer
Leadership interview - 45 minute chat with our Head of Engineering about your prior accomplishments and the challenges youâ€™ve faced as an engineer
Offer call ğŸ‰
title: Python Developer

job_desc:
About Us
 
Loveholidays is on a mission to build the next generation of online travel agents. We let millions of customers search through over 36 billion offers that we curate and are constantly exploring new and innovative ways to create that perfect holiday-finding experience.
 
In 2019 we were the fastest growing company in the UK, and since the beginning of 2022 we have been processing a booking every ~30 seconds.
 
About The Role
 
ğŸŒ± Our Data Scientists use data to help boost an already rapid business growth trajectory, to make better decisions, faster by using machine learning and data science techniques. This encompasses data cleaning/joining, feature engineering, model training, data pipelines/scheduling, and communicating results to the business.
 
ğŸ“ˆ We need you to set up, monitor and track large scale experiments and come up with machine learning techniques to drive business outcomes. Our Data Scientists work closely with other business units to deliver day to day trading results and engage with stakeholders and the team to plan meaningful steps to increase conversions, traffic and margins.
 
âœ… With the high maturity of our infrastructure you will have a high level autonomy, working with interesting and challenging data sets, thinking about what can be implemented for growth and do it with NO red tape.
 
About You
 
We are looking for an ambitious individual with a passion for leveraging a scientific approach to data to drive business transformation. Domain knowledge and expertise are important, but the following core attributes are essential:
 
 
Excellent problem-solving: apply their mind to many and varied problems and looks for the impactful solving of them through a combination of individual contribution and working with a range of parties
Innovative and curious: engage with colleagues from across the business, to understand their business issues, and facilitate practicable solutions
Self-starter: proactively seek out issues and opportunities and tackle them to learn and find new and better ways of doing things
Team player: work with other people in the team, take in feedback and mentor other people
Communication skills: able to influence and coordinate well with business stakeholders and present data science work to non-technical audiences


 
Required experience for this role:
 
 
Design experiments and implement models to produce practical insights and improve business performance
A deep understanding of Machine Learning and statistical techniques for predictive modelling and forecasting - we apply machine learning and statistics to achieve business outcomes
Write high-quality Python for feature engineering and model training.
 
Solid grounding in SQL


 
Youâ€™d get bonus points if you have:
 
 
Previous experience working in e-commerce, retail, or the travel industry.
 
Experience with time-series forecasting
Worked with Airflow
Conducted and analysed large scale A/B experiments
Experience with technologies such as:
 
Google Cloud Platform, particularly Vertex, Looker, and Datastudio
Docker and Kubernetes


Understanding of causal inference and/or reinforcement learning


 
Benefits
 
Other than an amazing environment for you to grow, have impact and show the world your incredible skills, we offer the following benefits:
 
 
Company pension contributions at 5%
Training budget for you to learn on the job and level yourself up
 
Discounted holidays for you, your family and friends
 
25 days of holidays per annum (plus 8 public holidays) increases by 1 day for every second year of service, up to a maximum of 30 days per annum
 
Ability to buy and sell annual leave
 
Subsidised gym memberships
 
Cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan and eye care vouchers
 
Hybrid working - we work 2 days per week from our office in Hammersmith
 
Monthly office based social events
 
Weekly Wednesday drinks in the office kitchen
 
Sustainably sourced fruit baskets in the office kitchen
title: Data Scientist

job_desc:
Be part of something great
 
Maximus is a global organisation that specialises in providing health and employment services to millions of people every year. Here in the UK we employ around 5,000 people across the country to deliver services that have a profound impact on peopleâ€™s lives. From assessments and health services to employability programmes and specialist support, we do work that matters with people who care.
 
Job Summary
 
This role will be recruited in anticipation of Contract Award.
 
The HRIS TUPE Data Analyst (HR Data Analyst) will work on the extraction, manipulation, mapping and management of HR data relating to the incoming and outgoing TUPE transfers at Maximus UK and support BAU (Business As Usual) when required.
 
Drawing on considerable analytical and technical skills, the primary responsibilities of this role will be working with the HR Operations TUPE Lead and the HRIS team to manage both incoming and outgoing HR data. The data is stored within the suite of HR systems including core HRIS, Recruitment, Performance Management, Compensation and Benefits and Learning Management applications.
 
As part of the TUPE cycle this individual will work with the HRIS team and Partner teams such as Payroll, Compensation and Benefits, to ensure both incoming and outgoing HR data fits within the Maximus UK HR data model enabling efficient integration or migration of TUPED Employees into or out of Maximus UK.
 
Salary Range
Non London: Â£35,000 - Â£40,000
London: Â£40,000 - Â£45,000
 
12 month FTC.
 
 
Key Requirements
 
â€¢ Coordinating, prioritising and processing TUPE transfer reporting requirements
â€¢ Populating CASCADE specific Data Template of input employee information
â€¢ Building mapping tables to structure input employee data with existing system list values
â€¢ Developing and supporting new reports and HRIS BAU activities
â€¢ Change requests to existing reports and issue resolution
â€¢ Producing scheduled reports which serve as interface files for internal and external systems
â€¢ Ensuring the security of sensitive HR data during distribution
â€¢ Supporting the development of a strategic vision and future state road map for HRIS Data & Analytics function
 
Actions essential for performing the role include, but are not limited to:
â€¢ Requirements gathering â€“ working closely with HR and other teams to understand the reporting requirements, ensuring data confidentiality and alignment to the strategic goals of the business, and the objectives of HR projects at all times
â€¢ Design and build â€“ using the Cascade (core HR system) query builder and enhanced reporting functionality to develop and publish new or improved reports for key stakeholders. Manage and combine data from external sources, as necessary. Ability to manipulate the data using basic SQL within query builder and present in a meaningful and presentable format using MS Excel
â€¢ Testing â€“ to carry out documented bespoke built test procedures ensuring the data presented is at all times accurate.
 
Working closely with users to ensure the reports correctly represent the requirements and verify the accuracy and integrity of the data
â€¢ Documentation â€“ to document requirements, to create and maintain specification documents, user guides and update of master HRIS Reporting Tracker
 
Experience Required
 
â€¢ Advanced working knowledge of MS Excel and medium-level SQL.
â€¢ Experience of HR processes & systems
â€¢ Experience of managing large volumes of HR TUPE Data
â€¢ Hands-on experience of BI tools and data manipulation in a business intelligence role, working with HR information systems to perform analysis of key HR data
â€¢ Experience of working with Cascade HR or similar HRIS Systems
â€¢ Excellent analytical and technical skills in an HRIS Reporting role
â€¢ An ability to generate reports and queries, and interpret data
â€¢ MS 365: Teams, Excel (to an advanced level)
â€¢ Experience working within a fast-paced change environment
â€¢ Experience of helpdesk ticketing systems
â€¢ Applied use of requirements-gathering techniques and system development methodologies
â€¢ University Degree in an IT or business degree, or equivalent experience
â€¢ Experience of One Model HR Analytics Solution
 
Individual Competencies
â€¢ Excellent communication skills at all levels, with the ability to adapt to and communicate with multiple stakeholders
â€¢ Aptitude for easily understanding and working with new software and technical solutions
â€¢ A strong team player with a positive and flexible approach to work and colleagues
â€¢ Able to work well under pressure, challenge and adapt to ever changing priorities
â€¢ A Strong problem solver with an ability to take ownership and accountability to manage a problem to resolution
â€¢ Able to apply critical thinking in a fast paced environment and work under minimal supervision
â€¢ Ability to drive HR System & Data design decisions
â€¢ Proactive in seeking information, challenging norms and driving efficiency
â€¢ Drive to continuously improve
 
MAXIMUS is committed to developing, maintaining and supporting a culture of equality and diversity in employment in which our employees as well as candidates for employment are treated equitably. We understand that a diverse workforce adds to our competitive advantage; and as such, we aim to ensure that job applicants do not receive less favourable treatment on the grounds of sex, race, marital status, disability, age, part-time or fixed term contract status, sexual orientation or religion, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements that cannot be shown to be justifiable. Advertisements for posts will include sufficiently clear and accurate information to enable potential applicants to assess their own suitability for the post. Where reasonable, MAXIMUS will review and consider adjustments for those applicants who express a requirement for them during the recruitment process.
title: HR Data Analyst

job_desc:
We believe in better. And we make it happen.
 
 
Better content. Better products. And better careers.
 
 
Working in Tech, Product or Data at Sky is about building the next and the new. From broadband to broadcast, streaming to mobile, SkyQ to Sky Glass, we never stand still. We optimise and innovate.
 
 
We turn big ideas into the products, content and services millions of people love.
 
 
And we do it all right here at Sky.
 
 
What you'll do:
 
 
You will work closely with Product Owners, Solution Designers, Scrum & Business Analysts, Principal Engineers and Technical Leads to ensure that Sky continues to deliver innovative new products and maintains its position as a market leader in television, broadband, mobile and business services
Your focus will be on designing data driven solutions to support the operation of Sky's data driven CRM platform from sales through to fulfilment
You will work with our design and engineering teams to translate commercial requirements into system rules consumed by our software services
You will co -ordinate between multiple businesses using shared platforms to create one fit for purpose solution
Your designs will be used by Data Developers within the team to provide catalogue data & rules as well as be integral to the development of the software components consuming that data
You will work with Agile teams delivering real time solutions in a fast-paced dynamic working environment that allows the flexibility and support to perform at your highest level
Every member of the team is encouraged to actively participate in suggesting ideas for new innovative solutions to complex problems. We take pride in making sure everyone has the opportunity to learn, grow and take on exciting new challenges
Your wellbeing and career progression is core to everything we do; you will play a pivotal role within a close and collaborative team


 
What you'll bring:
 
 
The ideal candidate will have a working knowledge in SQL, Java EE and JSON
A passion for data alongside a grounded understanding of interaction between data and software
Experience in object-oriented analysis and design using common design patterns
You will be required to demonstrate your knowledge and understanding of data and complex logic-based rules that we use at the core of our CRM systems decisioning engine
Excellent communication skills are essential with the ability to provide written & verbal updates tailored to your audience
You should be a team player; always willing to assist others; always ready to make suggestions for improvement Ownership and pride in your work is essential you must be self-motivated and have a can-do attitude
You should be comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative, dynamic environment with many often-conflicting demands


 
Team Overview:
 
 
UK&I Technology
 
 
Ground-breaking projects. Innovative tech. Top innovation. Join our UK&I Technology team and you'll work across technology projects that drive our TV, broadband, mobile and Sky Connect services. You'll be at the heart of delivering the technology roadmaps that support our UK and Ireland businesses, with a focus on customer innovations for Sky Glass. That's not all. You'll also design, develop and deliver digital services for millions of customers across the UK.
 
 
We bring the best from the global market into Sky - we buy technology, marketing, corporate, operational services and editorial production solutions. We are an international team working with our stakeholders our partners to curate the most effective and efficient customer-led operating model. High ethical standards are embeded in our team, and we engage our supply chains in creating a sustainable future!
 
 
The Rewards:
 
 
There's a reason people can't stop talking about #LifeAtSky. Our great range of rewards really are something special, here are just a few:
 
 
Sky Q, for the TV you love all in one place
 
A generous pension package
 
Private healthcare
 
Discounted mobile and broadband
 


 
 
How you'll work - hybrid working:
 
 
The world has changed. And so have we. We've embraced hybrid working and split our time between unique office spaces and the convenience of working from home.
 
You'll find out more about what hybrid working looks like for your role later on in the recruitment process.
 
 
Where you'll work:
 
 
Livingston Watermark House
 
 
Our lively campus is a free shuttle bus away from Livingston South train station and the town centre. Plus there's onsite parking available for cars, motorbikes and bicycles.
 
You'll be well fed at our subsidised canteen, and you can keep in shape at our onsite gym - or play a game of pool or table tennis.
 
 
Inclusion:
 
 
Recognised as an 'Inclusive Top 50 Employer' and a 'Times Top 50 Employer for Women', we're working hard to ensure we're a truly inclusive place to work. This means we don't just look at your CV. We're more focused on who you are and the potential you'll bring to Sky. We also know that everyone has a life outside work, so we're happy to discuss flexible working!
 
 
And we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. If you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process, speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to support you
 
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

job_desc:
Weâ€™re Dojo
 
Since launching Dojo in 2019 to address business ownersâ€™ pain points across the UK, weâ€™ve seen incredible growth as a scaling fintech, welcoming over 60,000 new customers and growing the Dojo team to 900+ people across five locations. In that time, weâ€™ve also introduced Dojo Virtual Queues & Bookings and the Dojo restaurant finder app, formerly known as WalkUp and loved by 600 restaurants and 600,000 diners across the UK. Find out more about the journey weâ€™ve been on
 
.
 
Today, we work towards our mission to empower businesses to thrive in the Experience Economy by creating the tools and technology that turn transactions into meaningful relationships. For our business customers, that means fast funding, the fastest payments, smart integrations, and efficient virtual queues & bookings - all with instant insight across the board. For over 600,000 diners across the UK, that means getting seated at their favourite restaurants in just a couple of taps on the Dojo app. Whether itâ€™s for busy business owners or hungry diners, every Dojo product is built to address real customer pain points by our dedicated teams in London, Bristol, Hull and Belfast.
 
The Role
 
This is your chance to join embed within one of our tribes to take their data-driven decision making to the next level. You will be the in-house expert on all things data - from gathering business requirements & problem statements to proactively driving solutions by taking stakeholders on a data-backed decision making journey.
 
If youâ€™re the kind of person who loves to sit in the sweet spot of harnessing the power of data and technology, delivering rigorous scientific insights and having a direct impact on the digital landscape - this is the role for you.
 
What Will You Doâ€¦
 
 
Being customer-first is our primary ethos and youâ€™ll be at the vanguard of this. Bringing our customers to life through data wherever decisions are being made, whether itâ€™s participating in product refinements, working with our functional experts or presenting to our executive team.
You will own stakeholder relationships and deliver game-changing insights that drive the conversation and tribe objectives.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to define, refine, and measure KPIs which contribute to the company mission - To Empower the Experience Economy.
Craft powerful visualisations and dashboards in Looker that tell a story and empower stakeholders to self-serve with actionable insights so that we scale effectively.
 
As you acquire an in-depth understanding of one or more areas of the business, youâ€™ll act as an expert mentor and develop and lead training and workshops to raise the standards of our utilisation of data across the company. Improve performance outcomes through the use of data and technology. Youâ€™ll be raising the bar.
 


 
What You Will Bringâ€¦
 
 
Youâ€™ve got experience with data wrangling/manipulation techniques and comfortable writing SQL queries to surface the data you need. You understand the concepts of data governance and stewardship, ensuring our sales and operations teams have access to useful and accurate data.
 
You'll have experience with Python.
You have previous exposure to Pricing analytics and/or Pricing experimentation.
You have an understanding of predictive and prescriptive analytical concepts whilst being solutions-oriented with the vision to anticipate how inefficient processes might become problematic at scale.
Youâ€™ll have the willingness to roll sleeves up - equally happy when building a hacky spreadsheet or state of the art Looker dashboard - and the foresight to know which one is appropriate.
Ability to work cross-functionally in an embedded framework. You have the expertise with technology and experience of solving product problems working alongside other experts from different domains.
You care about impact and are constantly seeking the necessary conversations to ensure that you are doing the right data analysis at the right time. You see your job as making a positive business impact, not completing tasks.


 
Our Technology Stackâ€¦
 
BigQuery / Snowflake
 
Scripting language: Python/R
 
DBT
 
Segment & Snowplow
 
Looker
 
Google Suite
 
Our values
 
At Dojo, weâ€™re
 
curious
. We have an insatiable desire to learn and innovate. And weâ€™re
 
relentless
. We persevere even when itâ€™s easier not to. But, weâ€™re nothing without our customers, who drive everything we do. From day one, Dojo was built on real customer pain points and every one of us is
 
customer-obsessed
.
 
Creating a more diverse, equitable and inclusive Dojo
 
Dojoâ€™s 60,000+ customers reflect the diversity of the UK High Street. Building diverse teams that are representative of that to develop and deliver our business strategy is fundamental to continuing to create innovative products at Dojo. As a result, together, we achieve better outcomes for our customers and for Dojo.
 
Regardless of age, disability, race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, culture, educational background, parental status, neurodiversity or disability - whoever you are, if youâ€™re passionate about your work, curious, relentless and customer-obsessed, we want to hear from you.
 
We pride ourselves on fostering a sense of community, which is only made stronger by each individual at Dojo, so you'll have the opportunity to meet a variety of people across levels, teams, and experiences throughout the interview process.
 
Find out more about our benefits and what itâ€™s like to work at Dojo at
 
.

job_desc:
Our team helps clients measure the marketing effectiveness or ROI of their advertising investment, as well as advising on pricing strategy, brand development and other commercial topics.
 
The Analyst role is suitable for people with a quantitative background in statistics, economics, operational research, finance, or data science. Experience building econometric or MMM models is advantageous but not essential. We are interviewing for people across three grades including Graduate Analyst, Analyst and Senior Analyst.
 
The job will give you hands-on experience in econometric modelling and data manipulation using Excel and R / tidyverse. This role will put you on a client facing career track in consultancy but will also give you opportunity to hone your analytic and coding skills with the support of our data science team.
 
Ebiquity have an impressive roster of blue-chip clients in retail, automatic, financial services and FMCG providing excellent learning opportunities to those wishing to apply their technical skills to real world problems.
 
 
 
 
Delivering outstanding analytical projects for our customers based upon excellent data exploration, econometric analysis, and interpretation.
Automate and simplify data processing using existing tools and scripting tasks in R / tidyverse.
Create concise, insightful customer communications (presentations, documentations etc)
Continually accumulate and develop marketing effectiveness knowledge and sector expertise.
Take responsibility for keeping tasks on deadline and managing client stakeholders.
Provide clarity in communicating results to clients both verbally and using Powerpoint.


 
 
 
At least a 2.1 in a relevant quantitative degree (Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Economics, Econometrics or Data Science).
Coding skills in either R or Python. The preferred language at Ebiquity is R.
Competent with Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
Be able to communicate in a professional environment.
Intellectually curious with an open mind, a self-starter, genuinely interested in data.
A team player, happy working in small groups

We are a global fast-growing company which offers a variety of opportunities for you to develop your skill set and career. In exchange for your contribution, we can offer you:

Ebiquity aims to create a workplace that is open and supportive, and free of discrimination and prejudice.

job_desc:
We're at the start of an incredible journey. At Our Future Health, we're building products and services that reach all parts of society so we can identify how diseases begin and progress in people from different backgrounds. We're committed to building a resource that truly reflects the UK population.
 
 
To achieve this, we're harnessing genetic and clinical data to create the most detailed picture we've ever had of people's health. This presents big challenges in privacy, security and processing data.
 
We are recruiting a Data Engineer to support us in building a data platform to manage the integration, processing and transformation of large volumes of self-reported, genetics and healthcare data. This platform will deliver research-ready, well curated and well documented data for a wide range of scientific studies.
 
 
What you'll be doing:
 
 
 
Supporting the build of data pipelines from data providers to our primary data store and trusted research environment.
Producing logic for data transformation steps as code, which meet the requirements for our end users and builds well curated, accessible and quality controlled data for analysis.
Developing prototypes for pipelines for complex transformations drawing on existing workflows developed in industry and academia.
Documenting source-to-target mappings.
Keeping abreast of best practice in data engineering across industry, research and Government and facilitating the adoption of standards.
Providing technical input into the upstream parts of the data pipeline, including the specification and transfer of data from data providers.
Ad-hoc data curation activities requiring hands on development of bespoke ETL cleaning scripts using languages such as SQL and Python.
Working with researchers to understand the data requirements and helping them to deliver the data needed for their projects.


 
What you won't be doing:
 
 
 
Working in a siloed environment with no freedom to make decisions.
Working in a place where you can't see the impact your expertise makes.


 
The environment
 
 
We're an agile team who work in short, product focussed development cycles, solving complex technology problems in collaboration with a ground-breaking team of Behavioural Scientists, Epidemiologists, Clinical Operations specialists, and Ethicists. We've come from start-ups, tech companies, universities, the NHS and health charities. Together we're experienced in building and scaling big consumer products, working with different kinds of health data.
 
Requirements
 
To succeed in this role you will have some of the following skills:
 
 
The ability to communicate to and between technical and non-technical stakeholders as well as facilitate discussions within a multidisciplinary team, managing different perspectives.
A good knowledge and understanding of NHS data such as hospital administrative data, disease registries or primary care data, and how they can be used to support research.
 
Experience with the design and deployment of complex data schemas.
 
Ability to design, build and test pipelines based on feeds from multiple systems using a range of different technologies. You will understand how to create repeatable and reusable products.
 
Comfortable in designing an appropriate metadata repository and presenting changes to existing metadata repositories. You understand a range of tools for storing and working with metadata.
 
Knowledge of health record coding systems and data standards (e.g., ICD, READ and SMOMED codes).
 
Proficient in a variety of data engineering programming languages and environments such as Python and SQL.
 
An understanding of the impact of emerging trends on the organisation in data tools, analysis techniques and data usage.
 
Understanding and working knowledge of information governance and data security approaches appropriate for sensitive health data.
 


Benefits
 
 
Generous company pension package with employer contributions of up to 12%.
30 days annual leave (plus bank holidays.)
Individual development budget
Flexible and remote working arrangements and a lovely new office in Holborn, Central London.


Join us - let'sâ€¯prevent disease together.




Desired Skills and Experience


Clinical
Clinical Data
Data Engineer
NHS
NHS Data
Python
R
SQL
title: Data Engineer

job_desc:
POWERVAULT
 
Powervault is seeking an Analyst whose primary responsibilities will be to research, analyse and evaluate qualitative and quantitative data about the behind the meter energy storage market to support the company's growth.
 
You will initially be reporting directly to the Managing Director and will work closely with the sales team.
 
The Analyst should be committed, hard-working, numerate and be able to demonstrate a can-do attitude in a collaborative environment. You will be learning on the job with support from the management team. We invest in our colleagues and want to see the role holder grow and assume more and more responsibility as they develop and learn.
 
 
Powervault is a leading home energy storage company based in London. We believe in a 100% clean energy system, and our mission is to make this possible by maximising home energy flexibility. We design and develop advanced home energy storage devices that help our customers reduce their bills and carbon emissions by maximising on-site use of solar and low cost electricity from the grid.
 
 
The Analyst will be responsible for activities such as:
 
 
Managing grant funded projects, being responsible for all analytical and reporting actions in the project and coordinating the projects to meet their goals
Researching, analysing and evaluating domestic, SME and industrial and commercial energy storage, solar PV and technology energy data and commercial market information to identify and quantify opportunities
 
Keeping track of competitor, market and policy intelligence
Support lobbying of Government by attending relevant trade association and other meetings to help to achieve Powervaultâ€™s lobbying goals
Maintaining, developing and manipulating quantitative pricing, financial, and market models to provide estimates of customer benefit to support the sales team, and to establish opportunities to increase benefit through grid services contracts
Developing an excellent understanding of electricity markets and develop relationships with electricity suppliers and other market stakeholders such as DNOâ€™s and aggregators to develop the market for smart tariffs and grid services
Writing customer materials including product specifications, web-site content, user manuals
Providing sales support by identifying and maintain list of prospective customers, installers, resellers and other partners and by writing of sales proposals to help the sales team secure new business
Supporting the operational team with planning and supply chain analytical tasks
Managing and implementing PR and marketing campaigns through social and other media
Preparing contracts for customer and supplier relationships
Winning grant funding to support the business by identifying project opportunities, finding partners, writing grant bid proposals and securing grant contracts


 
 
Potential candidates will be expected to exhibit some or all of the following characteristics:
 
 
highly numerate with good analytical skills and commercial judgement with knowledge of excel / other numerical analysis tools
good at writing concise and convincing business proposals
experienced working in a start-up environment
have strong commercial and interpersonal communication skills


 
 
 
a highly motivated self-starter, prepared to operate in a dynamic and ever changing environment in the transitional early growth stages of the venture
adaptable and self managing, high achiever, tenacious and driven
able to work under pressure while delivering to high standards
a team player
happy to "get hands dirty" as is normal in a small company


 
A commitment to meeting the challenge of sustainable development in the UK is welcome but not critical. The candidate will be expected to appreciate and understand the principles, benefits and barriers to the deployment of distributed storage.
 
 
The job is based at the company head quarters in Hendon, North London.
 
Powervault is an equal opportunities employer.
title: Analyst

job_desc:
Weâ€™re Dojo
 
Since launching Dojo in 2019 to address business ownersâ€™ pain points across the UK, weâ€™ve seen incredible growth as a scaling fintech, welcoming over 60,000 new customers and growing the Dojo team to 900+ people across five locations. In that time, weâ€™ve also introduced Dojo Virtual Queues & Bookings and the Dojo restaurant finder app, formerly known as WalkUp and loved by 600 restaurants and 600,000 diners across the UK. Find out more about the journey weâ€™ve been on
 
.
 
Today, we work towards our mission to empower businesses to thrive in the Experience Economy by creating the tools and technology that turn transactions into meaningful relationships. For our business customers, that means fast funding, the fastest payments, smart integrations, and efficient virtual queues & bookings - all with instant insight across the board. For over 600,000 diners across the UK, that means getting seated at their favourite restaurants in just a couple of taps on the Dojo app. Whether itâ€™s for busy business owners or hungry diners, every Dojo product is built to address real customer pain points by our dedicated teams in London, Bristol, Hull and Belfast.
 
The Role
 
This is your chance to join embed within one of our tribes to take their data-driven decision making to the next level. You will be the in-house expert on all things data - from gathering business requirements & problem statements to proactively driving solutions by taking stakeholders on a data-backed decision making journey.
 
If youâ€™re the kind of person who loves to sit in the sweet spot of harnessing the power of data and technology, delivering rigorous scientific insights and having a direct impact on the digital landscape - this is the role for you.
 
What Will You Doâ€¦
 
 
Being customer-first is our primary ethos and youâ€™ll be at the vanguard of this. Bringing our customers to life through data wherever decisions are being made, whether itâ€™s participating in product refinements, working with our functional experts or presenting to our executive team.
You will own stakeholder relationships and deliver game-changing insights that drive the conversation and tribe objectives.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to define, refine, and measure KPIs which contribute to the company mission - To Empower the Experience Economy.
Craft powerful visualisations and dashboards in Looker that tell a story and empower stakeholders to self-serve with actionable insights so that we scale effectively.
 
As you acquire an in-depth understanding of one or more areas of the business, youâ€™ll act as an expert mentor and develop and lead training and workshops to raise the standards of our utilisation of data across the company. Improve performance outcomes through the use of data and technology. Youâ€™ll be raising the bar.
 


 
What You Will Bringâ€¦
 
 
Youâ€™ve got experience with data wrangling/manipulation techniques and comfortable writing SQL queries to surface the data you need. You understand the concepts of data governance and stewardship, ensuring our sales and operations teams have access to useful and accurate data.
 
You'll have experience with Python.
You have previous exposure to Pricing analytics and/or Pricing experimentation.
You have an understanding of predictive and prescriptive analytical concepts whilst being solutions-oriented with the vision to anticipate how inefficient processes might become problematic at scale.
Youâ€™ll have the willingness to roll sleeves up - equally happy when building a hacky spreadsheet or state of the art Looker dashboard - and the foresight to know which one is appropriate.
Ability to work cross-functionally in an embedded framework. You have the expertise with technology and experience of solving product problems working alongside other experts from different domains.
You care about impact and are constantly seeking the necessary conversations to ensure that you are doing the right data analysis at the right time. You see your job as making a positive business impact, not completing tasks.


 
Our Technology Stackâ€¦
 
BigQuery / Snowflake
 
Scripting language: Python/R
 
DBT
 
Segment & Snowplow
 
Looker
 
Google Suite
 
Our values
 
At Dojo, weâ€™re
 
curious
. We have an insatiable desire to learn and innovate. And weâ€™re
 
relentless
. We persevere even when itâ€™s easier not to. But, weâ€™re nothing without our customers, who drive everything we do. From day one, Dojo was built on real customer pain points and every one of us is
 
customer-obsessed
.
 
Creating a more diverse, equitable and inclusive Dojo
 
Dojoâ€™s 60,000+ customers reflect the diversity of the UK High Street. Building diverse teams that are representative of that to develop and deliver our business strategy is fundamental to continuing to create innovative products at Dojo. As a result, together, we achieve better outcomes for our customers and for Dojo.
 
Regardless of age, disability, race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, culture, educational background, parental status, neurodiversity or disability - whoever you are, if youâ€™re passionate about your work, curious, relentless and customer-obsessed, we want to hear from you.
 
We pride ourselves on fostering a sense of community, which is only made stronger by each individual at Dojo, so you'll have the opportunity to meet a variety of people across levels, teams, and experiences throughout the interview process.
 
Find out more about our benefits and what itâ€™s like to work at Dojo at
 
.

job_desc:
We are looking for an expert SQL Developer to help us with querying complex clinical databases and supporting our BI platform with results. The role focuses on transforming front-end search logic created within clinical systems into a set of SQL queries.


This is an excellent time to join the Business Intelligence team, as you will play a pivotal role in shaping the technical landscape.


You will be responsible for configuration, maintenance, optimisation, and updating SQL queries over time and ensuring data quality to store results in the Data Warehouse.


You will typically work with other team members regarding Azure Data Factory, Synaps, on-premises and cloud DW to take ownership of major deliverables. In addition, you should liaise with the Director of Quality Management to update SQL criteria and structure upon changes.


Taking the lead on project work, you will be continually encouraged to devise SQL cloud solutions to help our teams maximise the value of their clinical data assets and help them transform data into insights. You will also assume absolute ownership of projects and enable the BI team to synchronise the Clinical System search library with the SQL statements and DW data.


Roles and Responsibilities:


Developing SQL queries and reports from large databases extracted from major clinical systems: EMIS and SystmOne.
Replicating EMIS/S1 search logic and specifications into SQL queries. Over 2000 searches have been developed in our front-end search repository that is required to be translated into SQL.
Collecting, validating and screening specifications used to develop front-end searches within primary care areas by understanding the companyâ€™s priorities and tasks. Also, working towards efficient data collection/integration processes.
Working with clinical and corporate teams and subject matter experts to understand their problems and translate their needs. Also, interacting with system architects and developers to ensure the specification and amendments are correctly implemented.
Utilising Azure tools to extract, analyse and report relevant, quality-assured information, focusing on delivering information to support key areas of business.
Producing ad-hoc reports for submitting such data to external bodies, ensuring the data is accurate and robust, and submissions are completed on time.


For more information please contact recruitment@operosehealth.co.uk
title: SQL Developer

The Group:
 
Morningstarâ€™s Data group provides data and analytics on hundreds of thousands of investment offerings, including stocks, mutual funds, and similar vehicles, along with real-time global market data on millions of equities, indexes, futures, options, commodities, and precious metals, in addition to foreign exchange and treasury markets. This includes business analysis on market trends & regulatory changes & liaising with associations or working groups in order to design data collection plans & bring back the voice of the client.

Requirements:
 
 
 
Solid understanding of the local UK investment management industry and passionate about investment data.

Experience within data methodology/quality and processes.

job_desc:
Senior Data Governance Adviser
Salary: Â£45,669 plus excellent benefits package
Location: hybrid with weekly travel to Brighton
 
 
Would you like to work on digital transformation by being part of a rapidly maturing Data environment? Weâ€™ll give you the opportunity to:
 
Be part of a talented and versatile Data Team that gives business support to the entire organisation and helps us to become more data driven.
Support Business data subject matter experts with applying features and functionalities to make their jobs get easier by providing them with the right tooling.
Have a role in the continuous maturing data governance program, improving digitalisation and automation across the organisation.


 
Our client is looking for an experienced Senior Data Governance Adviser to be part of their Data Governance Team, within the Central Data Team who as Service Owners are delivering a transformation program to enable us to become more data-driven as an organisation.
 
The Data Governance Team is accountable for the governance, monitoring and improvement of data (quality) by ensuring data accountability within the organisation and enforcing policies, processes and procedures, supported by the Data Governance solution.
Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Data Governance Adviser to help to deliver the Data Governance Programme and lead on data governance activities across the organisation.
 
They will have responsibility for implementing technical controls for managing the protection of sensitive data and focus on establishing and ensuring adherence to data governance policies and standards to achieve a level of data quality and protection to support the strategic objectives of the organisation. They will work with stakeholders up to Senior Leadership Team level to develop the data ownership framework for core data assets.
 
As a Service Owner you will develop and configure data governance tooling, and develop and train key Users, to raise awareness of the capabilities so that we optimise the use of this data governance tooling. In addition, you will follow developments and continually evolve and improve the use of the tool as it is progressed.
 
Within your role you will provide technical and functional support for the business. You will work closely with the Data Team and business data subject matter experts to further integrate within our data landscape.
 
You will focus on the following areas:
 
Responsible for building and strengthening technical data governance controls through the Data Governance Tools to ensure effective and efficient standardised and centralised Data Governance of cloud/applications/systems.
Defining the operational standards to support enterprise wide data governance; providing assurance to the Head of Data and Data Governance Lead of alignment with the data strategy, data quality and architectural principles.
Responsible for the execution and improvement of services enabling capability.
Taking a pro-active approach to creating Data Governance reporting as Data Governance is embedded across the organisation.
Leading on customer/user engagement to understand business data requirements and use cases, working in partnership with other teams to identify solutions.
Working with colleagues in the Data Governance Team, and project teams across the business measuring and recording business data quality and compliance, cost and efficiency benefits.


 
Essential Skills:
 
Proven experience in the use of data governance tooling solutions, and managing data using APIâ€™s
Technical and functional understanding of Data Governance and Data Management functions and solutions. Knowledge of data protection legislation.
Experience of large-scale data programmes and ability to implement and configure data governance tooling
Significant experience of the application of Data Governance in an operational environment.
Ability to cooperate & collaborate with e.g. Data Owners, Business Domain Data Stewards and Product Owners and Analytics Managers
2 years in a senior role/change/transformation leadership experience.
Strong communication and problem-solving skills. Experience in training, presenting to stakeholders.

job_desc:
Overview of Department
The Human Resources department provides support and advice to managers and staff on HR and Development matters. Some of our key focus areas include recruiting staff, providing support for team and personal training and development, anticipating future resource needs of the organisation and ensuring that our reward and benefits packages are competitive.
 
 
Purpose of Role
We are looking for a Reward & Data Analyst to support the firmâ€™s remuneration processes. Youâ€™ll be responsible for maintaining remuneration data within the HRIS (Workday), providing reporting and analysis on reward data and supporting the delivery of the annual salary and bonus review processes.
 
 
This is an integral role within the team and would suit someone who is comfortable managing large volumes of data. Attention to detail is critical in this role so we are looking for someone who is committed to quality in their work and has a high level of numerical and technical competence. You need to be able to build strong relationships across the firm and have excellent verbal and written communication skills. This role would suit someone who loves to get lost in the data and can bring this to life for others, spotting patterns and trends.
 
Responsibilities
 
Provide technical and analytical support to the team and our reward processes.
Review and maintain reward data to ensure that it is accurate, complete and supports the firmâ€™s requirements.
 
Develop and maintain awareness of reward best practice and latest thinking, ensuring Baillie Giffordâ€™s approach is as effective as possible.
Support the maintenance of the reward process within Workday.
Support the annual cycle of reward activity, including the annual salary review and bonus calculations.,
 
Review, maintain and develop business processes to ensure that they are effective and that service to stakeholders is optimised.
Contribute to the development of current standards and procedures, including the development of supporting materials for end users.
Maintain appropriate governance controls and arrangements for the firmâ€™s reward practices
Support employee communications and help develop awareness and understanding of the firmâ€™s rewards and benefits.
Support the administration of the DC pension plans and employee benefits.


 
Experience and knowledge
Ideally, you will have experience of reward analytics or reporting. It would be great if youâ€™ve worked with an HRIS (ideally Workday) and have experience of using ServiceNow.
However, if you donâ€™t tick all of these boxes, donâ€™t let that put you off applying. We are happy to consider candidates without an HR or Reward background for this role. If you have data analytics or reporting experience, experience of working with large datasets and you have the following abilities and skills, weâ€™d like to hear from you.
 
 
Advanced Excel skills
A proactive, flexible approach to work
Innovative thinker
Analytical mindset
Solution provider
Good team worker


 
Competencies (not limited to)
 
Communication
Technical Competence
Team Working
Client Focus
Process Management

March 2, 2023
 
At Baillie Gifford we are committed to fostering an inclusive and respectful culture in which each of our colleagues can thrive and develop. We believe that our clients are best served by a diverse workforce with the experiences, ideas and perspectives that this brings.

job_desc:
Job description:
 
Digital Data Analyst
 
 
 
London (Hybrid Working)
Permanent
Full Time
Grade 3
 
 
 
Our passion at Currys is helping everyone enjoy the latest tech. Weâ€™re proud of the service levels we provide for our customer â€“ online, in-store or in their homes. And itâ€™s all down to our people, 30,000+ capable and committed colleagues, learning together, growing together, making us amazing and celebrating the wins.
 
 
 
 
Do you have a logical approach to problem solving? An inquisitive mind that doesn't take facts at face value? Are you able to clearly communicate sophisticated ideas to non-experts? We're looking for applicants who can answer yes to all of these questions.
 
 
 
 
The Digital Analyst will perform a robust, statistics-led approach to developing new frameworks for effectively evaluating the impact of A/B test experiences on customer journey and personalisation campaign. The role will develop machine learning models to segment user behaviours to support personalisation. Communicating performance on a macro scale and looking at contributing factors that are changing the customer experience and financial performance.
 
 
 
Key Role Responsibilities
 
 
 
Apply advanced statistical analysis, such as correlation, regression, for data validation or performance review
Provide data analysis and interpretation for model implementations, continue testing, and evaluation of the results
Build machine learning models to determine the behavioural triggers which premeditate certain user behaviours as intent to purchases, product category preference
Combine data sources into custom reports and dashboards, diagnosing problems to provide actionable insights
Liaise with the Optimisation team to ensure appropriate measurement, tracking and understanding of test results, and how they influence the wider business


 
Key Skills, Qualifications & Experience
 
 
 
Numerical and analytical skills, capable of using multiple data sources to analyse complex problems, identify cause and effect and deliver insightful and practical solutions
Strong problem-solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise good judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analysis
Working with large data sets and using quantitative analysis/modelling to drive business results
Experience with Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics
Experience with coding languages or process automation tools such as SQL, Python, git
Experience with Cloud (preferably Google Cloud Platform)
Degree or equivalent in Science in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or related subject
Visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio.
 


 
 
 
Weâ€™re one team and we celebrate all of the great things you do. One way we show our gratitude is by giving you access to a range of lifestyle benefits including:
 
 
 
Competitive pension scheme
Access to discretionary company bonus scheme
Life Assurance
Staff discounts and offers
Employee assistance programme
Cycle to work scheme
