job_desc:
Company Description
 
 
At AECOM, weâ€™re delivering a better world.
 
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether itâ€™s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. Weâ€™re one global team â€“ 47,000 strong â€“ driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
 
 
About Digital @AECOM
 
 
As a member of the Europe digital consulting services team you will work with leaders from around the world to define and position the digital consulting services, to share best practices, to leverage global capabilities and to support global opportunities and projects. While services and solution management will be set globally, they will be tailored for implementation within the region and for each client.
 
Job Description
 
 
AECOMâ€™s
 
Data and Analytics Team are looking for a
 
Data Engineer
 
to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams.
 
The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
 
 
Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and Azure â€˜big dataâ€™ technologies.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and regions.
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Showcasing proof points and case studies


Qualifications
 
 
Minimum Requirements:
 
 
 
We are looking for a candidate who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Advanced working SQL/nosql, ADLS, Databricks, ADF, Azure DevOps
Experience building and optimizing â€˜big dataâ€™ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable â€˜big dataâ€™ data stores.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:
 
 
 
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.


Attributes/skills:
 
 
 
Commitment to building a diverse and inclusive team
Self-starter with the ability to work as a positive, energized and adaptable team member
Highly developed written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and influence senior leaders
Extremely strong relationship building skills
Demonstrated ability to champion and drive ideas/programs/solutions
Excellent organizational and time management skills, able to work under pressure and prioritize effectively
Able to demonstrate passion, energy and drive, especially in the face of resistance


Additional Information
 
 
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and thereâ€™s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and youâ€™ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm â€“ access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
 
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. Weâ€™re the worldâ€™s trusted global infrastructure firm, and weâ€™re in this together â€“ your growth and success are ours too.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each personâ€™s potential, and weâ€™ll help you reach yours.
 
Join us and letâ€™s get started.

DCS

Europe & India

job_desc:
Centre delivery: Data analyst â€“ 2 Months Interim Contract role Flexible Locations.
 
 
 
About the company
 
IWG has been at the forefront of the flexible workspace revolution for more than 30 years. We have made it possible for organisations and individuals everywhere to take a new approach to the traditional working day. We have over 3,400 locations across over 110 countries allowing millions of people every day to have a great day at work.

They want workspaces and communities to match their needs. We provide them with choice through our portfolio of brands, covering serviced offices (Regus, Spaces, HQ, Signature), commercial real estate brokerage and managed office solutions.
 
 
Join us at
 
www.iwgplc.com
 
 
Job Purpose
 
The centre delivery data analyst is responsible for creating, validating, and updating construction costing tools. The construction costing tools are critical to articulate our costs and sell our product to landlords and partners and therefore the centre delivery data analyst will add measurable value to the organisation. The centre delivery data analyst will be working as part of a small, tight-knit team focussed on innovation, data and development.
 
 
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
1. Perform cost analysis on completed construction projects (2021 and 2022) by country and cost category
 
2. Where cost analysis is not available, obtain costs from external cost benchmarking platform
 
3. Create database of project costs, by country and category
 
4. Create Excel macro to automatically pull costs from database into bill of materials template
 
 
Experience / required skills:
 
 
 
2-3 yearâ€™s experience in data analysis at big 4, top tier consulting practice, investment bank, private equity, corporate grad scheme

Excellent communication skills
Fluent knowledge of the English language
Self-starter, bringing a valuable contribution to a small team
Motivated to challenges the way things are currently done
title: Data Analyst / Temp 2 Months

job_desc:
Our Organisation

The Football Association [The FA] is the not-for-profit governing body of football in England. It is responsible for promoting and developing every level of the game, from grassroots through to the professional game, and generates significant revenue to support investment into English football each year.

The FA oversees England international teams across men's, women's, youth and disability football, as well as running the National League System and FA Competitions including the Emirates FA Cup, Barclays FA Women's Super League, FA Women's Championship, and Vitality Women's FA Cup, and the world-class facilities of Wembley Stadium and St. George's Park,
 
all with a purpose to Unite the Game and Inspire the Nation.
 
The Role

Support The FA's Grassroots division in its ever-growing demand on data and reporting, especially in relation to Sport England funded activities. This role will primarily work on data visualisation through Power BI dashboard builds, alongside translating business requirements into business value.

This opportunity would be ideal for someone in the earlier stages of their career, looking to develop and grow in this key role.

Key Accountabilities
 
 
Gather, understand, and document detailed business requirements then manipulate complex data sets relating to grassroots football to meet these requirements
Develop management reports, KPI reports, and dashboards that enable Grassroots Football and County FA colleagues to understand and transform the impact of their activities
Transform raw data into intuitive and impactful visuals, working with business owners to ensure they are confident using the reports to gain insight
Communicate data analysis findings to stakeholders across the organisation in an engaging and impactful manner
Collaborate with other members of the Grassroots Digital & Data Strategy Team and the Data Architecture Team to identify and resolve data and reporting issues
Proactively improve processes around reporting: set-up and maintain automated data processes, improve quality assurance approaches, and implement new testing processes
Execute additional tasks as required in order to meet FA Group changing priorities.
Comply with all company policies and procedures to ensure the highest standards of health, safety and wellbeing can be maintained.
 


What we are looking for
 
Experience
 
 
You have experience working with data visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker, etc.)
You have experience managing complex datasets and working with relational databases to produce insights
You have experience building strong relationships with collaborators and engaging stakeholders from across business divisions
 


 
Communicative: You can convey complex, technical concepts simply and effectively, adapting your communication for different audiences
Organised: You are comfortable managing recurring and ad-hoc reporting queries and working to deadlines
Collaborative: You're a team player and you are energised by working with colleagues across the business
Driven by quality: You strive for data quality with structured and accurate working methods.
Proactive: You have an ability to identify and act on issues and opportunities before they arise.
Technical: You have basic SQL and/or DAX skills
 


 
You have played a role within grassroots football â€“ as a player, referee, and/or team/club admin â€“ or another sport
You have experience gathering requirements from the business and translating them into dashboards and reports that meet the business' needs
You have experience with Google Analytics
 


 
Technical: Intermediate SQL and/or DAX skills (ability to query data across multiple tables, etc.)
 


What we can offer you
 
 
An exciting and challenging role within a changing, dynamic and world-renowned sports organisation.
Attractive benefits and a competitive salary.
 


Please be aware that unless you are on a homebased contract, your contract with The FA will specify a fixed location of either Wembley Stadium, St. George's Park or our Processing Centre.

We currently work within a hybrid working model whereby the expectation is to work from your contractual location for part of the week, and as and when required by the team. The remaining days can be worked remotely. We will continue to monitor this model and it may be adjusted in future if deemed necessary.

job_desc:
Description




Locations available: Bristol and Leatherhead




What We Do In Consulting




Frazer-Nash offers excellent opportunities for graduates and postgraduates to experience challenging and interesting work that makes a difference in the world. Working within a consultancy environment offers the chance to experience a wide variety of projects and you'll be given the opportunity to manage projects, win work and use cutting edge methods to find the missing piece of the puzzle. Youâ€™ll join highly performing teams and we will help you to develop and nurture your potential as you grow within your role, leading to exciting future career prospects. Team information




Our teams use data and computational methods. We are interested in building robust, agile and scalable systems which help our customers to â€˜do more in less timeâ€™. As consultants we pair our technical data and software skills with strong communication and management skills to ensure our work has an impact. We work across the full range of markets that Frazer-Nash operates in, including Transport, Health, Industry, Energy and Defence.




Requirements




What youâ€™ll be doing at Frazer-Nash?




Working within a consultancy environment offers the chance to experience a wide variety of diverse projects across a range of industry sectors; you'll be given the opportunity to develop yourself at each step of the project lifecycle, designing software and hardware solutions to customerâ€™s complex problems, managing project delivery, winning work and having the opportunity to work directly with our clients.



Some examples of the types of work that you could be involved in include:




Using mathematical modelling techniques for customers who have limited amounts of data to help fill in the gaps with data driven forecasts.
Using analytical techniques for customers who have large quantities of data to get insight into what is happening in their systems.




Throughout our projects we aim to build long-term relationships with our customers and keep helping them with their problems as they evolve over time.




What youâ€™ll need?




We are interested in hearing from excellent candidates who want to work in data science and systems. As a minimum requirement youâ€™ll need to have obtained, or be predicted to obtain, a 2:1 in your Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree. Computer Science
Cyber Engineering
Psychology
Systems Engineering
Physics
Mathematics
Mechanical Engineering
General Engineering




When submitting your application, please describe detail of your degree, educational background and working experience in your CV and Cover Letter. Show us that you are organised and methodical in your approach to meeting deadlines and managing internal and external requirements. Highlight collaborative qualities and experience you have which will help you excel in a consultancy environment.



Due to the nature of the work that Frazer-Nash Consultancy undertake, candidates will be required to undergo pre-employment screening and must be able to satisfy clearance criteria for UK National Security Vetting. Candidates will be required to be UK nationalâ€™s who are resident in the UK to be eligible to apply




What can Frazer-Nash offer you?




You will join us with an excellent academic record. However, this is just the first step, we want to support your career development so that you can achieve relevant professional qualifications including Chartership; All our graduates join our Professional Development Scheme, which is accredited by five professional institutions (IMechE, RAeS, IET, RINA & IoP). You will be assigned a mentor who will work with you to develop your own individual development plan so that you can gain the necessary skills and experience to become Chartered. To enable you to achieve your full potential we will give you the opportunity to spend extended periods of time working across the disciplines within our technical groups as well as spending time on our clientsâ€™ sites, which is so important for becoming the great consultant that you could be.




Benefits




Competitive salary: [Â£31,000 + 2k joining bonus]
25 days holiday + sale and purchase scheme 
Happy to talk flexible working 
Company bonus potential 
Generous company pension scheme 
Opportunity to join our company share scheme
Private healthcare membership 
Paid membership fees to a professional membership 
Cycle to work scheme
Season rail ticket loan 
Bonus linked to company performance




We are committed to fostering a working culture that brings out the very best in our people, regardless of their circumstances, identity or background. We want our people to be themselves, feel empowered to achieve their personal and professional goals, and know that we respect the unique value they bring to the company. In support of this, we encourage thoughtful behaviours and work to foster a collaborative working environment

job_desc:
About us:
We create a sustainable future through innovative chemistry.
Infineum is a world leading formulator, manufacturer and marketer of additives for fuels and lubricants. Infineum additives are in 1 in 3 vehicles worldwide, and are designed to improve fuel efficiency, reduce emissions and enable cleaner transportations. With production facilities worldwide and regional business and technology centreâ€™s in the UK, US, Singapore and China, there has never been a better time to start a career at Infineum.
 
Infineumâ€™s successes are built on the exceptional talents of our bright and highly skilled colleagues.
Infineum brings together individuals from different backgrounds, cultures, and thinking styles providing remarkably different talents, perspectives, life and career experiences. We recognize that a diverse talent base creates an environment rich with innovation. Weâ€™re looking for motivated colleagues to join us where you can participate in relevant and challenging projects and we can offer the right environment for a high-performance career.
 
Position Summary:
The Digital & Analytics Centre of Excellence (D&A CoE) is an independent team that helps fast track and spearhead our digital & analytics capabilities across the organisation. The D&A CoE is designed around key pillars, with Delivery and Execution being the one responsible for Infineumâ€™s effective use of data to provide high value solutions to the business.
 
The Data Engineer is responsible for collaborating across the business and working with heterogenous data sources to build, manage and optimise data pipelines on Infineumâ€™s Data and Analytics Platform to maximise the business value from our data. The Data Engineer will also ensure compliance with data governance and data security requirements.
 
The Data Engineer will play a pivotal role in operationalising prioritised data and analytics initiatives within Infineumâ€™s digital portfolio. This role will require both creative and collaborative working with Data Architects, Data Scientists, Analytics Developers, IT experts as well as directly with key business stakeholders. This role will involve evangelizing effective data management practices and promoting better understanding of data and analytics.
 
The Data Engineer position is an emerging role in Infineumâ€™s Digital and Analytics CoE and as such the successful candidate will have the opportunity to drive the development of data engineering tools, processes, and procedures by collaborating with D&A CoE and broader IT teams.
This Data Engineer role is accountable to the Delivery and Execution Leader within the Digital and Analytics Centre of Excellence.
 
Key Outputs: What we can expect from you
 
Collaborate closely with business users, domain experts, architects, analytics developers, and data scientists to rapidly design, build and embed data pipelines
Design and maintain data models to support business analytics
Drive automation using modern data and analytical tools to develop repeatable data integration and data preparation flows from multiple source systems into our data lake and enterprise data warehouse systems
Maintain data pipelines ensuring on-going adoption of automation and incorporation of best practice
Work side by side with Data Scientists to understand business problems and support the integration of diverse data sets to support data science and advanced analytics activities
Collaborate with business, D&A CoE, and broader IT colleagues to evangelise data management. Act as a â€˜data guruâ€™ and work across business silos to promote better understanding of data and analytics.


 
What will you gain from this role?
 
Opportunity to influence the build of a new data and analytics platform
Work closely with the Architecture Working Group to define data engineering and data architecture strategies
Skills in defining and developing data engineering processes and best practices for use internally and with our technical partners
Exposure to a wide variety of technologies and data engineering challenges as we continue to further develop our digital capability
Work in a global environment interacting with all regions and functions at Infineum


 
A successful candidate is likely to have the following skills:
 
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or equivalent discipline
Significant experience in a Data Management discipline including experience in data warehousing concepts and data modelling
Strong experience working with heterogeneous datasets in building and optimizing data pipelines, pipeline architectures and integrated datasets. Use of Talend and Azure Data Lake a plus but not compulsory
Experience of working with Snowflake to build data warehouses / data marts, and experience of working with data from SAP, manufacturing, or research systems is strong plus but not compulsory
Basic understanding of popular open-source and commercial data science tools and platforms such as Python and Azure ML is an advantage
Experience working in a virtual team setting and self-driven with desire to take the lead and drive tasks to completion in a remote environment
Detail-oriented and strict attention to details and the ability to quickly spot and fix problems
Able to stay abreast of Data Engineering industry trends


 
Infineum is an Equal Opportunity Employer
 
 
Infineum operates a flexible working policy and will work with colleagues to accommodate their needs wherever appropriate

job_desc:
Weâ€™re Dojo
 
Since launching Dojo in 2019 to address business ownersâ€™ pain points across the UK, weâ€™ve seen incredible growth as a scaling fintech, welcoming over 60,000 new customers and growing the Dojo team to 900+ people across five locations. In that time, weâ€™ve also introduced Dojo Virtual Queues & Bookings and the Dojo restaurant finder app, formerly known as WalkUp and loved by 600 restaurants and 600,000 diners across the UK. Find out more about the journey weâ€™ve been on
 
.
 
Today, we work towards our mission to empower businesses to thrive in the Experience Economy by creating the tools and technology that turn transactions into meaningful relationships. For our business customers, that means fast funding, the fastest payments, smart integrations, and efficient virtual queues & bookings - all with instant insight across the board. For over 600,000 diners across the UK, that means getting seated at their favourite restaurants in just a couple of taps on the Dojo app. Whether itâ€™s for busy business owners or hungry diners, every Dojo product is built to address real customer pain points by our dedicated teams in London, Bristol, Hull and Belfast.
 
The Role

Description
 
Locations available: Bristol and Leatherhead
 
What We Do In Consulting
 
Frazer-Nash offers excellent opportunities for graduates and postgraduates to experience challenging and interesting work that makes a difference in the world. Working within a consultancy environment offers the chance to experience a wide variety of projects and you'll be given the opportunity to manage projects, win work and use cutting edge methods to find the missing piece of the puzzle. Highlight collaborative qualities and experience you have which will help you excel in a consultancy environment.

Due to the nature of the work that Frazer-Â­Nash Consultancy undertake, candidates will be required to undergo pre-employment screening and must be able to satisfy clearance criteria for UK National Security Vetting. Candidates will be required to be UK nationalâ€™s who are resident in the UK to be eligible to apply
 
What can Frazer-Nash offer you?

However, this is just the first step, we want to support your career development so that you can achieve relevant professional qualifications including Chartership; All our graduates join our Professional Development Scheme, which is accredited by five professional institutions (IMechE, RAeS, IET, RINA & IoP). job_desc:
Location: Dubai, UAE (We provide visa sponsorship & relocation assistance)

Starting salary of USD 60,000 per annum + performance based bonus' - 0% tax environment.
 
About Cobblestone Energy
 
Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading.

We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. In doing so, we help to balance the electricity grid, lowering the cost to end consumers, and aiding the transition to a renewable future. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.

At Cobblestone Energy, we are a diverse team of over 50 people from 20+ nationalities - we believe in hiring extraordinary talent from all around the world. Our flat organizational structure helps us in giving our team members complete ownership of the work and ensures ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people alongside constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways. With the right performance and potential, you could be managing the power desk for an entire country within eighteen months in your role. Come join our dream team!
 
Cobblestone Values
 
 
Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
The team is more important than the individual.
 
Being the best in any market we enter
Hiring and keeping only the most effective people
Others must benefit from our existence.
 


What We Offer In This Role
 
 
A full-time position on our Commercial team
Committed and remarkably talented colleagues.
 
Highly competitive compensation dependent on performance
An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career.
 
Investment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in business.
 
Equity participation for strong contributors, ensuring our interests are all aligned long term.
 


Do you have a passion for data and a solid foundation in mathematics and computer science? If you are a recent graduate or early career professional, Cobblestone Energy, a high-speed energy trading company in Dubai, is looking for you to join us as a Junior Data Scientist. Help drive informed decision making throughout the organization.

As a Junior Data Scientist at Cobblestone Energy, you will play a critical role in supporting our energy trading operations. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, analysing, and interpreting large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that will drive our business decisions. You will also have the opportunity to develop predictive models to forecast energy prices and trends and collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
 
Developing deep understanding of the industry and delivering key insights by analysing data
Forecasting different fundamentals such as wind power generation and demand
Researching and implementing new trading strategies
Building and developing new or existing data infrastructure
 


Your background:
 
 
Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python and R
Experience with data analysis and manipulation tools such as Pandas, NumPy, and SQL
Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Matplotlib and Seaborn
Experience that demonstrates your team-oriented, innovative, and strategic working styles.
 
Pro-active and flexible work mentality
Interest in data-driven trading
Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
 


About the Role:
 
This is an exciting opportunity for a Junior Data Scientist to join a growing and innovative energy trading company. You will have the opportunity to work on challenging projects, gain valuable industry experience, and develop your skills in a supportive and dynamic environment.
 
The Hiring Process
 
Your application will undergo evaluation, followed by psychometric tests, a trading simulation, a research project, and remote interviews. Successful candidates will then be extended an offer to join our Dubai office as full-time Commercial Graduates through our Commercial Development Program (CDP). We will cover all relocation expenses, including flights, visas, housing, and necessary paperwork. The CDP provides a comprehensive rotational experience in data science, trading, and analytics, with guidance from our experienced commercial team. Throughout the program, you will receive mentorship and training in market fundamentals, leading to the development of strong analytical skills. Upon completion of the program, you will be a Junior Data Scientist

If you are eager to learn, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are passionate about using data to drive business decisions, we want to hear from you! Apply now and take the first step in your career as a Junior Data Scientist at Cobblestone Energy.

You'll analyse and identify key data and information, evaluating and transforming data to meet the organisation's system needs and requirements. You'll also be reconciling the data to prove the integrity of any data loads.

About Capita Pensions Solutions:
 
At Capita Pension Solutions (CPS), we create and implement resilient and responsible pension strategies to help your organisation and your people look forward to a more secure financial future.
 
From pensions administration and consultancy, to the latest technology and engagement techniques, we help ensure sustainable investments which support your success. Join us and discover better ways to engage with and value today's employees.

job_desc:
About Low Carbon
 
Low Carbon is a leading renewable energy company committed to the development, investment and operation of renewable energy at scale. Low Carbon invests into both renewable energy developers and projects across a range of renewable energy technologies including solar PV, wind, energy storage, waste-to-energy and energy efficiency.
 
Low Carbon, a certified B Corp, has a proven track record in the development, construction, financing and management of renewable energy assets and remains involved in the projects for the long term with a dedicated asset management team that manages assets on balance sheet and for third parties. With a significant international renewable energy pipeline in development, Low Carbon is well-positioned to capitalise on opportunities as the need for renewable energy and energy security increases.
 
 
Now with over a decade of operation, Low Carbon has formed a strategic partnership with the Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company (MassMutual) to build a leading global renewable energy Independent Power Producer (IPP), targeting 20GW of renewable energy capacity by 2030.
 
We are extremely proud of the highly professional and talented team at Low Carbon. We have built a positive learning culture that incorporates respect, trust, collaboration, and a shared passion to combat climate change. It is an open, friendly and supportive environment, and we are proud to say we work here. As we grow, we are committed to increasing diversity in the team, and continuing to foster an inclusive environment where we can learn from each other.
 
Our Team
 
Our UK Development team consists of a small group of experts, working closely together to develop a portfolio of subsidy-free solar, onshore wind and battery storage projects throughout the UK. We are looking for ambitious independent people who are driven, collaborative, creative and fun to work with. This is a great opportunity to make a significant difference in the take up of renewable energy in the UK.
 
This role is based in Gloucester and you would need to be in the office c3-4 days a week.
 
Role Description
 
We are looking for someone to join the origination team to progress development opportunities with specific focus on connection design and project inception. Using your knowledge of distribution networks and working alongside the wider development team you will build and submit grid applications, deliver technical review of grid offers and maintain Network company communications through the pre and post application process.
 
You will support the wider team on all aspects of the identification and securing of development opportunities and ensure project management systems are updated regularly with new data as itâ€™s provided. You will be passionate about applying your skills to the development and build out of a portfolio of new utility scale solar and battery storage projects throughout Great Britain.
 
Key Responsibilities
 
 
Analyse and deliver new grid opportunities, submitting connection applications to the relevant network businesses to secure capacity
Support the origination team in the identification of possible challenges and opportunities within grid connection scenarios to expand the businesses project portfolio
Identify and mitigate issues with grid offers and support the relationship between the business and network operator representatives to maintain an industry leading portfolio of projects
Maintain the expansion and update of our internal GIS systems to support the technical analysis of grid connection applications
Produce high quality reports and assessments for the grid elements of new projects
Maintaining a continued focus on process improvements â€“ the way that it was done yesterday is not necessarily the best way to do it tomorrow
Inputting into the wider development strategy for each project and providing project information to both internal and external stakeholders


 
Experience / Requirements
 
 
Degree qualified or equivalent with level of experience in data led role
Have strong analytical skills, ability to identify key information from a range of sources and collate into well defined, accessible outputs.
Knowledge of the distribution and/or transmission networks would be advantageous, as would experience in planning, design or project/account management roles.
Experience in the connection application process and knowledge of the industry policies and legislation which govern how this process works would be beneficial
Be proficient in Microsoft office applications with a great degree of IT literacy
Hold a passion for using technology to better processes and strive for improvement
Possess strong communication and report building skills with experience in producing evidence-based recommendations
Full driverâ€™s license
Proven ability to work and communicate with remote colleagues


 
Person Specification
 
 
 
You will need to be a confident and professional self-starter capable building trusting and positive relationships with your team members
Youâ€™ll be adept at understanding new topics quickly
Youâ€™ll have great verbal communications skills and have the ability to convey key points to audiences at all levels
Youâ€™ll be highly organised and be comfortable working with multiple projects and priorities
Youâ€™ll be adept at using technology to increase efficiency with a passion for risk analysis and mitigation
You wonâ€™t sit back and wait for things to happen, youâ€™ll be comfortable taking on responsibility and making decisions
You will have strong written communications and presentation skills


 
Our Benefits
 
 
26 days holiday plus your birthday off
Discretionary Bonus
Annual Bupa Health Check
Private Healthcare for you and your family (medical history disregarded)
Contributory Pension
Cycle scheme
Sodexo for commercial discounts and perks

job_desc:
Who we are
 
 
We are Hastings Direct - an agile, data and digitally focused general insurance provider who offer services to the UK car, van, bike and home insurance markets.
 
 We have the ambition of becoming the UKs leading digital insurer and believe that we're built for the way that customers buy general insurance both today and in the future; with our key focus being around the use of data and digital capabilities going forwards.
 
 Therefore we are looking for an enthusiastic Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join us on our journey to transform our data landscape through the use of cutting edge tools and techniques.
 
The Role
 
 
As a BI Analyst you will work across all aspects of our Data Warehouse and Reporting Infrastructure; from analysing requirements for data, information and insights to making design recommendations to meet those requirements.
 
 You will ensure that the required data and insights are available where needed and find ways to structure and present this information in order to maximize its value and usability across the business.
 
What you will do
 
 
 
Interact with other business functions to understand/identify their data needs/requirements and then design and build reports and visualisations (sometimes moderately large/complex) from the supplied specifications; using agreed standards and tools to achieve stable, reliable and easy-to-use output.
Carry out analysis of data requirements to establish, modify and maintain reports and visualisations that translate objects and data models into appropriate reporting within design constraints.
Create, amend, and keep track of reports and visualisations to ensure these remain in accordance with design and architectural guidance. As well as remaining compliant with the latest data protection/privacy rules.
Provide technical and application knowledge on data concepts, objects, data modelling techniques and design principles.
Where relevant, provide input into the evaluation/recommendation of BI tools, definition of hardware requirements and system configurations - including development of reporting models.
Design solutions that provide fair outcomes to ensure customers' reasonable expectations are met. Challenging peers and managers alike where processes and procedures do not meet these customer expectations or place our customers' interests at the heart of what we do.


What we are looking for
 
 
 
2-5 years of practical experience working within a data, technology or reporting role, either within a project or corporate environment applying data analysis and data modelling techniques.
BI Reporting and Visualisation Tool knowledge/experience - Cognos
Good SQL skills
Problem solving capabilities/critical thinking
Agile development techniques
Business Analysis techniques


Qualifications
 
 
IT academic qualifications e.g. BSc in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or a related field and some practical experience
 
(
desirable but not essential)
 
Benefits for you
 
 
Please find some of the great benefits we offer here at Hastings Direct;
 
Salary -
 
Attractive base salary dependant on experience
 
Bonus
 
 
 
On target bonus up to 5%
Max target bonus up to 10%


Pension
 
- 1:1 match up to 10%
 
Holiday
 
- 25 days holiday and bank holidays (plus buy and sell up to 5 days)
 
Health & Wellbeing -
 
Life Assurance / Wills Service / Income Protection (75% of base salary for 2 years. Covered after 1 year of service
 
 Plus a lot more that we'd love to bring to life with you!
 
Hastings Group is an equal opportunities employer which means we treat people fairly. We welcome applications from all suitably skilled persons regardless of their gender, age, race, disability, ethnic background, religion/belief, sexual orientation, gender reassignment or marital/family status. Please also note that we have a thorough referencing process, which includes credit and criminal record checks.

Analytical Research and Development (ARD)
 
Department Overview
 
Analytical Research and Development (ARD) is accountable for providing a wide range of analytical testing to support the development, testing and release of materials to be used in clinical trials. The department comprises laboratory scientists, ably supported by data analytics specialists who use their understanding of key enterprise applications to help manage and automate data â€œflowâ€ around the department efficiently. We manage and interpret the data we generate, to convert it into knowledge that establishes the quality of new medicines.

We encourage applications from students thinking about pursuing careers in data science, both with and without a specific chemistry focus.
 
What can I achieve and what will I be accountable for whilst completing a placement at Pfizer?
 
A placement year in ARD provides excellent industrial experience and practical use of contemporary laboratory information systems, and semantic tools to better comprehend data. Our data scientists have a strong interest in pushing the boundaries of how we use our systems, and are good at translating user needs into data management solutions. During the year, there will also be opportunities to work on established and emerging data modelling/machine learning applications, if that is an area of interest to the student.

You will be assigned one or more projects based on needs at the time of joining our fast-moving department, and will develop both strong team working and technical skills. It is expected that you will provide creative input and direction into your work, and present your progress and achievements to both technical and non-technical audiences throughout your placement.

Pfizer offers a diverse environment which allows employees numerous opportunities to grow and develop. This is a great chance to be part of the bigger picture, and to assist in ensuring Pfizer maintains a strong and diverse workforce as well as developing a talent pipeline of future Pfizer colleagues. It is also a fantastic way to obtain a better appreciation of the pharma industry and the type of roles it has to offer.
 
What other opportunities and benefits do Pfizer offer?
 
In this data science role, you will network with colleagues locally and globally, as our enterprise systems have users in both UK and USA. In addition to developing your communication and project delivery skills, many students find the time to support Pfizerâ€™s outreach activities, at Science Fairs, and through our STEM networks. We also support colleagues who wish to develop their presentation skills to a high level through giving scientific lectures to a department with groups in both the UK and US.

You will receive a competitive salary along with benefits including 25.5 days annual leave.
 
When can I start?
 
Placements will start on 4th September 2023 and will run for 12 months.

Skills
â€™, â€˜

â€™ and â€˜

Good communication skills and able to understand the language of both computing and science professionals
 
Interested to explore the pharmaceutical industry as a career choice
 
Self-assured to work freely, with good team working abilities
 
Quick to learn, and flexible approach to assigned activities
 


Who can apply?
 
Applicants must be completing placement as part of a degree course at a UK University, either through Year in Industry/Industrial Placement or Gap Year.
 
This position will close for applications on 5th March 2023.
 
Please note that we only accept application forms. Please do not send over your CV or cover letter as they will not be considered.
 
Please access the Word version of the Application Form here: Undergraduate Vacancies | Pfizer UK and find instructions as to how to complete your application and more about eligibility criteria.
 
Breakthroughs that change patients' lives
... At Pfizer we are a patient centric company, guided by our four values: courage, joy, equity and excellence. Our breakthrough culture lends itself to our dedication to transforming millions of lives.
 
One bold way we are achieving our purpose is through our company wide digital transformation strategy. We are leading the way in adopting new data, modelling and automated solutions to further digitize and accelerate drug discovery and development with the aim of enhancing health outcomes and the patient experience.
 
We aim to create a trusting, flexible workplace culture which encourages employees to achieve work life harmony, attracts talent and enables everyone to be their best working self. Letâ€™s start the conversation!
 
We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is crucial to building a successful business. As an employer, Pfizer isâ€¯committed to celebratingâ€¯this,â€¯in all itsâ€¯forms â€“ allowing for us to be as diverse as the patients and communities we serve. Together, we continue to build a culture that encourages, supports and empowers our employees.
 
We are proud to be a Disability Confident Employer and we encourage you to put your best self forward with the knowledge and trust that we will make any reasonable adjustments necessary to support your application and future career. Our mission is unleashing the power of our people, especially those with unique superpowers. Your journey with Pfizer starts here!

Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
School of Health Sciences
 
 
Research Associate
 
Ref: RA2074
 
 
Salary on appointment will be Â£27,929 per annum, with an annual increment up to Â£34,308 per annum
 
 
We are seeking a highly motivated Research Associate to join the iACT4CARERS project team (https://iact4carers.com/). This project is funded by the National Institute for Health and Care Research (https://fundingawards.nihr.ac.uk/award/NIHR150071).
 
 
The iACT4CARERS project aims to evaluate the clinical and cost effectiveness of internet-delivered Acceptance and Commitment Therapy for family carers of people with dementia in a full-scale randomised controlled trial. The trial will be delivered across 20 NHS services across England with support from the Norwich Clinical Trials Unit.
 
 
You will be based at the University of East Anglia in Norwich, working with a team of researchers and clinicians in the UK and internationally. You will be involved in collecting data and monitoring research progress, ensuring the achievement of research objectives. You will also contribute to the data analysis and the research projectâ€™s dissemination. In addition, the iACT4CARERS project emphasises reaching out to a wider group of family carers including families from ethnic minority groups and you will have the opportunity to work with various patient and public representatives.
 
 
This post is suitable for researchers with experience in mental health or dementia studies, or applied health studies in the related areas. Experience in working with vulnerable populations and active involvement with research is essential.
 
 
 
This full-time post is available from 1 April 2023, or as soon as possible thereafter, on a fixed term basis until 30 September 2024. The post may be extended until 31 March 2026 subject to confirmation of further funding.

We are looking for a person with analytical skills that takes keen interest in data, the insight they can provide and the opportunities they unlock. The role gives the opportunity to work in a well-established pricing, analytics and data science team in a fun, informal environment, working together with hard-working, likeminded people that have â€œa thingâ€ for data and how it can be used to enhance business practices.
 
 
3 best things about the job
 
 
 
You will have the opportunity to work on new, exciting projects within one of the largest media businesses in the UK.
You will be working in a team with kind, supportive people that look out for you and help you to do the best work that you can. We put a lot of energy into our team culture and ensuring that everyone is fulfilled with their work.
 
We are investing a lot in the personal development of our people with individualised personal development plans and a generous training budget for supporting training modules and personal coaching for technical and soft skills.
 


 
Measures of success
 
 
 
In the first few months, you would have:
 
 
 
Gained a good understanding of our business operating model in all primary business streams: Audio, Digital, Outdoor.
Knowledge of our main data warehouses, systems, and data workflows that we are working with.
Full understanding of our pricing systems and identified ways to further automate pricing processes.
Delivered Ad-Hoc analysis and insight for various critical business questions.


 
Responsibilities of the role
 
 
 
Gained a deep insight into Globalâ€™s business model â€“ focusing on our Outdoor business to understand and effectively articulate industry and competitor best practice, and actual performance
Understood client and wider partner requirements and aspirations and how these might align with Globalâ€™s future strategies
Developed Globalâ€™s environmental strategy, having gained enthusiastic support from senior leadership
Supported the Commercial and Outdoor teams in commercial tenders, including PPN 06/21 readiness for large government contracts
Established Globalâ€™s Net Zero roadmap in line with Ad Net Zero, including Scope 3 measurement and approach
Engaged Globallers and our wider supply chain to review current activities and adopt balanced operational practices


 
What you will need
 
 
As the ideal candidate, you are proactive and willing to develop and implement innovative solutions. You will bring the following with you too
 
 
The ability to identify trends and extract insights from complex and incomplete data sets and understand the importance they play in decision-making.
 
The ability to identify key metrics and create â€œWhat-Ifâ€ scenarios to drive growth for our business and facilitate decision making.
Experience in data manipulation and exposure to relevant tools (e.g. SQL, Alteryx)
Enthusiasm for data visualisation (Tableau experience would be desirable but not essential).
An exceptional eye for detail, ability to work under pressure and deliver time-sensitive work to a high standard.
A professional manner with the ability to interact with senior management.
The ability to explain analysis to non-numerate people and empathise with their perspective.
A can-do attitude, positivity around data challenges and a natural inclination for extrapolating business problems and provide solutions utilising data.
To deliver in the role we would ideally like you to have a relevant BSc degree or relevant experience gained through your career to date.


 
 
Everyone is welcome at Global
 
 
Just like our media and entertainment platforms are for everyone, so are our workplaces. We know that we canâ€™t possibly serve our diverse audiences without first nurturing and celebrating it in our people and thatâ€™s why we work hard to create an inclusive culture for everyone. We believe that different will set us apart, so no matter what you look like, where you come from or what your favourite radio station is, we want to hear from you.
 
Although we cannot make guarantees, we welcome conversations about flexible working for all roles at Global.
title: Junior Pricing Analyst

job_desc:
Department:
 
Research and Insights
 
Employment Type:
 
Contract / Temp
 
Location:
 
London, UK
 
 
You'll be working to put users at the centre of our design process, helping to deliver digital experiences that sports fans can't live without. Acting as an ambassador for data within Pulselive, you'll be championing the value and benefits the practice can bring to our clients and our products. In collaboration with other teams, you'll be defining analytics requirements, compiling actionable findings and recommendations, uncovering user insights, building dashboards, optimising digital performance, and delivering increased ROI.
 
As part of our rapidly growing Research & Audience Insights chapter, you'll need to thrive in a fast paced environment. With a few years of experience under your belt, you're ready to come in quickly and get stuck into client and internal workstreams. You'll embrace the opportunity to lead from the front, helping your colleagues understand the importance of data in design and development. In turn, you'll get to work with some of the biggest names in sports on products that bring enjoyment to millions of people worldwide.
 
 
 
 
Developed analytics frameworks across multiple clients. You've worked to level up clients' analytics programs, informing them on best practices and empowering them to do more with their data. Understanding that maturity varies, you've provided support in defining OKRs, capturing analytics requirements, and designing/developing analytics implementations. Most importantly, you've interpreted and distilled clients needs into data they can easily understand and act upon. From automated dashboards to regular health checks, you've found ways to tell a compelling story.
 
Driven forward data as a key pillar of Pulselive's offering. You developed clear business cases, synthesized quantitative research findings, and demonstrated value across the board. Within Pulselive, you've challenged the business to consider new investment opportunities when it comes to fan data â€” you might even be working on a new proprietary software through our Research & Development program.
 
Helped drive forward our testing culture. You helped mentor cross-functional teams on the value of analytics and experimentation, encouraging and empowering individuals to start thinking about data in new ways. Whether for an entirely new product or a simple feature release, you've worked collaboratively to find ways to measure the impact of what we built and demonstrate ROI.
 
Demonstrated the power of data in design. You identified and acted upon opportunities to integrate data into the creative process and development cycle ä¸€ shaping the way that we build products and educating other members of the team. By identifying actionable patterns and trends, you've consistently impacted the way we design digital products.
Informed overarching analytics strategy. As part of the Research & Audience Insights chapter, you've helped develop a company wide analytics strategy, advancing the way we track and monitor user behaviour across digital platforms. Your work has ingrained analytics as a core part of every project, ensuring enough time and budget is dedicated to do things right.
Implemented best practices and streamlined our processes. You've optimised data collection systems, enabling more efficient data analysis and enhanced digital performance. Across clients, you've provided developers with clear instructions for analytics implementation, supported QA pre-release, and monitored post-launch to ensure everything is coming in smoothly.


 
Illustrated the possibilities of data visualisation. You've found innovative ways to capture, manipulate, and display data, uncovering new insights and driving innovative product development. In addition, you've helped the creative team to showcase data to fans in new ways, enhancing player profiles, match centres, and statistics across client products.


 
 
 
In the past, you have...
 
Worked with Google Analytics, Firebase, Google Tag Manager, Data Studio, and BigQuery (and/or similar digital analytics tools)
Have experience with quantitative UX research methods, like survey analysis, A/B testing, and Multivariate testing
Applied your knowledge of Python and SQL to analyse large data sets, run custom queries and set-up personalised, automated reporting dashboards
Leveraged the power of statistical computing (through R or some other tool) to produce tangible insights and actionable product recommendations
Worked in collaborative, cross-functional teams. You know how to work with designers, developers, and product managers to turn data into recommendations and requirements that feed directly into product development
Helped stakeholders translate objectives and questions into analytics requirements, ensuring that meaningful data are captured
Managed relationships with clients and stakeholders, telling compelling stories through data
Been exposed to the interplay between business requirements, product strategy, technical constraints, and user experience




 
It would be great if you...
 
 
Have experience with other analytics tools like Adobe Analytics, Segment, Data Studio, HotJar, Tableau, Conviva, Qualtrics, etc.
Have Google Analytics certifications
Have a good understanding of data layers and app/web data collection
Love sports and have a strong understanding of the different stakeholders in the space


 
 
At Pulselive we truly value our team and have developed our approach to ensure you are not only rewarded for your contribution but have access to unique benefits along with a positive approach to wellness. We want to ensure that your career, health and well-being are of the utmost importance at all times.
 
 
Benefits & Wellness
Flexible & Remote Working
Buy and Sell Annual Leave
Pension Scheme
Sporting Events and Tickets
Health & Wellness Activities
Complimentary Headspace Access
Annual Wellness Contribution
Mobile Phone Contribution
Sony Discounts

are fundamental to our culture, and Synechron is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. title: Data Scientist

job_desc:
Department:
 
Marketing
 
Employment Type:
 
Full Time
 
Location:
 
Remote - UK
 
Compensation:
 
Â£40,000 / year
 
Description
 
Insight Analyst
 
Marketing | Up to Â£40k pa | Remote (but a London office if you wish to use it)
 
At Pod Point we're changing the way people drive. We fundamentally believe that travel shouldn't damage the Earth so we've made it our mission to install a Pod Point (an Electric Vehicle charging point) everywhere you park.
 
We remain #1 in the UK home sector and are making significant progress in the UK commercial sector with 86% year-on-year revenue growth, increasing our headcount from 247 to 500+ since early 2021.
 
More importantly we are making progress on our mission having delivered 171.5 million kWh by our charge points in 2021, avoiding the equivalent of 127,267 tonnes of CO2e.
 
We're looking for an Insight Analyst to join our marketing team as we grow our insights capability. Your work will inform decision making across brand & marketing, sales, product development and other key business areas.
 
What You'll Do
 
 
Define and establish processes to capture, analyse and share insight across Pod Point.
Provide consumer, customer, industry and competitor insight that's timely, accurate and supports decision making across brand, marketing, sales, product and beyond.
Gather and prioritise requirements from key stakeholders and then scope and deliver insight, analysis and recommendations against the brief.
Develop a specialist understanding of one of our three customer groups (B2B, B2C or B2B2C).
Help establish and embed an insight culture within the marketing team and the wider business.
Be part of a growing team with the chance to make a big impact!


 
What You'll Need
 
 
Previous experience working in an insights role (ideally 3+ years).
Excellent data analysis skills with a high level of numeracy and strong excel proficiency.
Understanding and experience of best practice qualitative and quantitative data collection, sourcing and synthesis.
Ability to effectively manage a diverse set of stakeholders.
Experience enabling others to make robust decisions with data and insight.
The ability to handle ambiguity and work in a fast paced environment.
Excellent written and oral communication skills


 
Bonus Points
 
 
Experience working in an agile team or framework.
You're passionate and knowledgeable about climate change, sustainability and/or the EV industry.
You have a pet (our office is dog friendly and we have an internal slack channel for sharing photos of your beloved pets!)


 
If you're interested in our mission but none of our current vacancies suit your skills, why not connect with us to be notified of any future vacancies by clicking here.
 
Our culture is electric
Our culture is one of the many reasons we were recently voted to be in the top 100 organisations to escape to in 2022 via Escape The City (out of 13,000 nominations).
 
At Pod Point we like to think we are anything but conventional. We have worked hard to create a rapidly-growing, constantly innovating, flat-structured world, where each employee can see the vital contribution they are making to the company.
 
We knew from the very beginning that a rigid, corporate environment was never going to work for us, and we have stayed true to our word - we're anything but.
 
We work hard but we're not clock-watchers and you will be given plenty of guidance and very few rules. We'll pay you well, give you complete ownership to shape your role, give you ground-breaking projects to work on and surround you with fantastic, talented people.
 
We also provide the following benefits:
 
 
Salary Sacrifice Electric Vehicle Scheme
Flexible working hours and a casual dress code
Remote first working approach
25 days holiday (plus Bank Holidays)
Very generous maternity and paternity leave scheme
Pension scheme
Eyecare scheme
The odd Pod Point puppy to cuddle if you come into the office
Employee Assistance Program


 
Remote first
 
We're a "Remote first" company, so we conduct all interviews on Google Meet and are pretty good at onboarding new starters remotely (if we do say so ourselves). We do have our dog friendly (!) London office which you will be welcome to use for work if you prefer - although there will be no requirement for you to do so.
 
Bring Your Whole Self To Work
 
We embrace different perspectives and experiences and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to join us. That unique mix of people is what makes a place great!
 
We're a Disability Confident Level 1 employer and we recognise that people work in different ways, so if you need any adjustments to our recruitment process, please speak to the recruitment team who will be happy to support you.
 
To join us you must be legally able to work in the UK. Any data you provide us will be stored and disseminated in accordance with Pod Point's Privacy Policy.
 
We like to deal directly with our candidates so no agencies please!
 
â€
 
â€

title: Machine Learning Engineer

job_desc:
Senior Data Scientist - Semiconductor Service
 
 
We have an exciting new role within our Engineering Analytics team. We are looking for an experienced data scientist to join the Semiconductor Service Division at Edwards, part of the Atlas Copco Group. Reporting into the Semiconductor Division Analytics Manager, the role will require an interest in the fundamentals of how the business works and understand how to contribute to business success.
 
Your mission in Semiconductor Service
 
 
The candidate will explore the data, and engage with other domain experts, to research and develop models and algorithms, whilst also developing visuals and dashboards to convey model predictions.
Demonstrating a genuine interest in accurately understanding and acting on customer needs and expectations is a key skill needed for this role, alongside this, having the ability to prioritise work and timely address customer requests.
The insights produced by the Data Scientist are used within the Semiconductor Service Operational Excellence framework, to provide value-added aftersales services to customers, this includes guidance for predictive or condition-based maintenance, the avoidance of unplanned downtime, or the proactive management of spares/inventory or service effort.
This role involves actively collaborating with others and openly sharing knowledge and experiences. Making productive contributions to the team, and being inquisitive and creative is a necessity, whilst also making sure to take a structured approach to executing data science projects, being hypothesis driven, and using rigorous scientific and data analysis methods to uncover potential bias in the data. It is important to be able to maintain and foster relationships with other subject matter experts too, including product Technical Support, and Customers.


 
 
 
Build and develop hypotheses and models for data, which accurately predict aspects of equipment condition or performance, and can be used to underpin valuable service products.
Present and communicate findings to stakeholders, using a media appropriate to the audience.
Collaborate, to build the subject matter expertise of others into your work.
Develop data analytic code, adopting and extending re-usable design patterns and modules across prototype and production models.
Specify or develop requirements for data linkage and tests for data quality, so the required pre-processing can be automated by Data Engineers.
Participate in team design and code peer-reviews, to help establish and share best practice.
Keep up-to date with state-of-the-art data science methods and technology, maintaining internal and external peer networks, to facilitate professional development of yourself and the team.


 
 
 
Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering or Physical Sciences, or other Mathematics-based discipline
3+ years in a Data Analytics or Data Science role, ideally using data to study the performance or condition of physical/industrial assets. You may also have experience with the use of NLP to extract labels or other information from free-text records, or image processing to identify and classify features in still images or video.
Self-reliant software developer, using mainstream data analytics languages: e.g. Python or R, Matlab, Scala. Experience with version control systems such as SVN or Git. Experience of Industrial IoT (IioT) platforms â€“ e.g. SCADA â€“ would be an advantage. Experience of scalable cloud computing environments, and the use of containers to build and deploy applications, would be an advantage.
Excellent spoken and written English. An additional European or Asian language is beneficial.


 
 
We want to be a workplace for everyone. At Edwards, part of the Atlas Copco Group, we know that diversity and inclusion are critical to our long-term success. We know that diversity and inclusion helps us to understand our customersâ€™ needs and strengthen employee motivation, productivity, innovation and results. We will continue to invest in our people, celebrating diversity, encouraging individual growth, and making sure Edwards is a place where everybody is proud to work.
 
 
My pay:
 
 
We empower you to reach your full potential in your role and reward you with your salary and a discretionary bonus to ensure your performance is rewarded in a fair way. We care for our people, value diversity and inclusion and ensure our offering is relevant, transparent, and attractive.
 
My wellbeing:
 
We have a number of services and programmes to help you be the best you can be.
 
 
Hybrid working / discretionary flexi-hours
Employee assistance programme
Health cash plan and / or private medical insurance (dependant on grade)
Pension employer contributions up to 8%
Enhanced maternity pay
Life assurance - 4x salary
Electric car lease scheme via salary sacrifice
Ride to work scheme via salary sacrifice
Discounted Pure Gym membership
Free Fiit app
Upskilling opportunities around physical, mental, social and financial wellbeing framework
 


 
My future:
 
We are a culture-first organisation, relying on passionate and capable people with a growth mindset. We believe there is always a better way of doing things, so we will always inspire you to take charge of your career and personal development, so you continuously learn and grow.
 
Location:
 
We have a flexible working culture, with an opportunity to work from home or as a hybrid worker out of our head office in Burgess Hill, West Sussex, there will also be global travel.
 
 
Michael Mooney (Analytics Manager, Customer Projects)
 
 
Emma Stevens (HR Advisor)
 
If you require any support during the recruitment process, please let us know.
 
 
Edwards is a leading developer and manufacturer of sophisticated vacuum products, exhaust management systems and related value-added services. Edwards solutions are integral to manufacturing processes for semiconductors, flat panel displays, LEDs and solar cells. They are also used within an increasingly diverse range of industrial processes including power, glass and other coating applications; steel and other metallurgy; pharmaceutical and chemical; and for scientific instruments in a wide range of R&D applications.
 
Edwards has over 4,000 employees worldwide engaged in the design, manufacture and support of high technology vacuum and exhaust management equipment. Edwards has state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in Europe, Asia and North America.

job_desc:
Zapp is building the future of convenience with a full stack approach to on-demand essential items, 24/7, delivered in minutes. We are backed by the world's leading investors and our team has scale-up and exit experience at companies such as Amazon, Jumia, Deliveroo, Tesco, Stuart and Just Eat. Benefits

Job Title
 
- Software Engineer - Data


 
 
Reports Into
 
- Senior Data Science Core Developer


 
 
Location
 
- Hybrid / Leamington Spa


 
A Little Bit about Kwaleeâ€¦.
Kwalee is one of the worldâ€™s leading multiplatform game developers and publishers, with well over 900 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Letâ€™s Be Cops 3D, Airport Security and Makeover Studio 3D. We also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade and Scathe.
 
Whatâ€™s In It For You?
 
Hybrid working - 3 days in the office, 2 days remote/ WFH is the norm


 
 
Flexible working hours - we trust you to choose how and when you work best


 
 
A dog friendly office (Thereâ€™s dog-free areas too, if pooches arenâ€™t your thing)

An amazingly well equipped office with ping pong, darts, pool tables and video games while keeping refreshed with free snacks and a stocked kitchen (we have every kind of milk imaginable)â€‹


 
Are You Up To The Challenge?
As a Software Engineer in the Data Science Team, you will build tools and develop technology that deliver data products to a team of strategists, marketing experts and game developers. You will design, build, test and deploy products which serve a company fuelled by data.
 
Your Team Mates
The Data Science team is central in developing the technology behind the growth and monetisation of our games. We are a cross functional team that consists of analysts, engineers and data scientists, and work closely with the larger engineering team to deliver products spanning our modern, cloud first, tech stack.
 
What Does The Job Actually Involve?
As a Software Engineer in the Data Science Team, you will build tools and develop technology that deliver data products to a team of strategists, marketing experts and game developers. You will design, build, test and deploy products which serve a company fueled by data.

Your Hard Skills

Experience dealing with data pipelines and ETL processes


 
 
Desire to learn new technology and solve hard problems


 
 
Ability to work in a fast paced environment


 
 
An avid interest in the development, marketing and monetisation of mobile games


 
Your Soft Skills
Kwalee has grown fast in recent years but weâ€™re very much a family of colleagues. We welcome people of all genders, races and backgrounds - and all we ask is that you collaborate, work hard, ask questions and have fun with your team and colleagues. We donâ€™t like egos or arrogance and we love playing games and celebrating success together.
 
If that sounds like you, then please apply.
 
A Little More About Kwalee
Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts.
