job_desc:
Advertising Start Date: 03 Feb 2023
Vacancy: 2679
Salary Details: Band 5 - Â£27,055 - Â£32,934
Location: Leeds or Exeter
Vacancy Type: Permanent
Hours Per Week: 37.5
Working Pattern: Full-time, flexible working options considered
Closing Date: 12 Feb 2023
 
About the role
 
We believe in improving lives through data and technology. We engineer digital health and care services and solutions, using our technical expertise to drive beneficial change at pace, without compromising on user experience, privacy, and confidentiality.
 
During the pandemic, we played a crucial role, working around the clock to deliver data and insight used by key decision makers to tackle the pandemic and to plan for recovery.
 
Word-Class Security Frameworks
 
An extraordinary health and care service deserves exceptional talent to support its delivery.
As such, we are seeking Cyber Security Trainee Analysts to support our Cyber Operations. Itâ€™s a position of real purpose, integral to our strategic plans, delivered across a national Health and Social Care system which includes 220 individual NHS Trusts; 13 Armâ€™s Length Bodies and over 40,000+ primary care organisations.
 
Important: Please be aware there are residency requirements you need to meet:
 
 
All of our Cyber Security personnel must hold security clearance SC level as a minimum. To meet National Security Vetting requirements,
 
you must have resided in the UK for a minimum of 3 out of the past 5 years for SC clearance.
 
Candidates who were posted abroad for service with HM Government, Armed Forces or within a UK government role - will still be considered. More information on SC clearance can be found here.


 
Please make sure you meet these requirements before applying for this role. You donâ€™t need to have SC already, however, failure to achieve the requirements for SC after offer, will result in the job offer being withdrawn.
 
 
The role
 
As a Cyber Security Trainee Analyst, you will:
 
 
Work within the Cyber Security Operations Centre (CSOC), rotating through different teams in the CSOC to learn different Security Operations and Threat Operations specialties.
Provide an initial analysis on security data to identify potential threats and formulate recommendations and actions to consider in order to remediate and respond.
Support senior colleagues in assessing, planning, and advising stakeholders on security measures that will help protect us from security breaches and attacks on its computer networks and systems.
Keep up to date with the latest security and technology developments, including researching and evaluating emerging cyber security threats and ways to manage them.


 
About you
 
To succeed in this role, you need to have experience in
 
some
 
of the following competencies:
 
Information Technology (IT) Security Policies
Basic knowledge of IT security policies, standards, and procedures; ability to utilise a variety of administrative skill sets and technical knowledge to ensure cyber security compliance.
 
Information Security Management
Basic knowledge of the processes, tools and techniques of information security management, ability to deploy and monitor information security systems, as well as detect, resolve and prevent violations of IT security, to protect organisational data.
 
Information Security Technologies
Basic knowledge of technologies and technology-based solutions dealing with information security issues; ability to apply these in protecting information security across the organisation.
 
Digital Threat Management
Basic knowledge of techniques, approaches and processes of digital threats; ability to detect, monitor, analyse and prevent digital threats.
 
Intrusion Detection and Prevention
Basic knowledge of tools, techniques and processes of intrusion detection and prevention; ability to detect, resolve and prevent intrusion behaviours to protect organisational networks.
 
Computer Crime
Basic knowledge of concepts, tools and practices of dealing with computer crime; ability to detect and prevent business crimes that involve computers/networks as instruments.
 
Digital Forensic Tools
Introductory knowledge of and ability to utilise a variety of specific tools for collecting, analysing, and presenting digital-related evidence.
 
Information Security Operation Centre (ISOC)
Basic knowledge of modules, processes and technologies of Information Security Operation Centre (ISOC); ability to detect, response and utilise related platform and applications to perform cyber security initiatives.
 
Penetration Testing
 
Basic knowledge of penetration testing concepts, approaches, and tools; ability to find vulnerabilities on network, mobile application, servers, operating system, etc.
 
As part of our application process, you are asked to complete a supporting statement; within this we look for you to highlight how you meet some the competencies above.
 
What's in it for you
 
 
 
a role as part of a dynamic team using data and digital technology to transform health and care
a range of opportunities to build your experience in an environment where your
work has a direct and positive impact
a real commitment to your personal and professional development with access
to a broad range of learning opportunities


 
About us
 
NHS Digital merged with NHS England on 1 February 2023 to help us to better support the NHS as one, streamlined organisation with digital, technology and data at the heart of our plans. Successful applicants should be aware that roles will be subject to change in the new organisation, but our mission, to use data and technology to improve lives, will remain.
 
We are a great place to work. What we do matters.
 
Our outstanding teams are passionate about technology and public service, making use of everyoneâ€™s skills to improve peopleâ€™s lives.
 
We collaborate to deliver world class tech and intelligence, so come and join us. We are committed to sustainability, diversity and inclusion; our people are at the heart of what we do.
 
Find further information on the current work we are undertaking meeting the challenges of the pandemic here: https://digital.nhs.uk/coronavirus
 
Why you should apply
 
We value the different experiences our people bring to their work. We're working to create an environment where everyone can make a full contribution no matter their background, identity, or circumstances. Which means, we encourage applications from people of all backgrounds and abilities.
 
Our work matters. You matter.
 
What we offer you:
 
 
we're moving to a hybrid working approach which offers you an informal, flexible way of blending home and office working
flexible working opportunities - we value and respect the diversity of our employees, and applications from prospective candidates who require flexible working arrangements are welcomed; these include part-time hours, job sharing, flexible hours and part-remote set ups
27 days annual leave increasing to 33 days with service
ability to buy and sell annual leave
a generous pension (with our contribution equal to 20.6% of your earnings)
NHS Discounts including shops, restaurants, gym, mobile phones, and insurance
employee benefit schemes including our Season Ticket Loan, Car Lease and Bike to Work schemes


 
Next steps
 
All applicants will be asked to complete an immersive lab which will be used alongside our shortlisting criteria. Candidates who progress to the next stage will be invited to attend interview which consists of a technical assessment and a set of core competency questions. Additional information about the assessment will be sent to those candidates who progress to interview.
 
Remote interviews will take place
 
via Microsoft Teams
. Applicants who are shortlisted for interview will be contacted by email. Applicants who are shortlisted for interview will be contacted by email, and asked to complete an online technical test and prepare a short presentation to be delivered at interview.
 
Please note that we may close this role early due to a high volume of applications.
 
To view further information please see the attached role profile.
This post is not exempt from the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974. We only ask applicants to disclose convictions which are not yet spent / unspent under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974. Following an offer of employment, we will carry out a Basic Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check as part of the pre-employment check process.

The Opportunity

Key Accountabilities

Specialising in complex infrastructure, process and built environments across the full project life cycle, our disciplines range from initial architecture to civil and structural, building services, specialist high voltage and process engineering services, programme management and CDM consultancy, using the latest innovations in Building Information Modelling (BIM) for the most efficient and cost-effective design.

We are now looking for a passionate and dynamic Sales Operations Analyst to join our global Adaptive team.

curious

page :)

job_desc:
OPEN Health brings together deep scientific knowledge, global understanding, and broad specialist expertise to support our clients in improving health outcomes and patient wellbeing.
 
 
We are united as one flexible organization, harnessing the power of the collective to solve complex challenges. Being built from cohesive partnerships across a range of specialist sectors gives us the ability to approach opportunities from fresh perspectives, creating solutions and innovations for market access and medical communications that are informed by the experience and knowledge of the many.
 
 
Our global team of experts â€” many with PhD and PharmD degrees â€” work strategically alongside our client partners in Medical Affairs, Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR), Market Access, and Commercial teams across a wide range of therapy areas.
 
 
You will love this role if you:
 
Have a passion for making complex data palatable for your audience
Like working closely with front-end developers and data analysis teams to produce cutting-edge reports
Enjoy working within health informatics or have a keen interest in this area


 
As part of the OPEN Health Real World Evidence team, you will be responsible for the following activities:
 
Providing expertise regarding SQL queries including writing, indexing, optimisation, and best practice
Extracting, transforming and loading data from raw text files into MS SQL Server and providing data from MS SQL to My SQL
Working alongside our development team to provide support and data expertise
Managing the overall structure of the data warehouse databases, including import/export processes and data accuracy
Securing backup of the data and data models and providing basic MS SQL server administration
Working independently and as part of the data analyst team to provide data insights
Working in Excel including pivot tables and cell calculations/functions
Ensuring all data imported and produced are factually correct and meet the requirements of the data specified
Ensuring all data import tasks are delivered within pre-agreed timelines to meet the specification
Making suggestions to improve the data warehouse through enhanced processes


 
What youâ€™ll bring:
 
Experience with SQL Server 2016+ with Excellent T-SQL skills
Experience across MS BI Stack â€“ SSAS, SSIS, SSRS with particular strength/experience in SSAS (Tabular & Multidimensional)
Experience with scripting DAX is desirable
Strong data modelling and data warehousing development experience
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and effectively use teamwork skills to interact and collaborate on alternative approaches to issues
Excellent communication and listening skills
Experience with NHS data a plus


 
What we offer:
As a global organization, OPEN Health is committed to supporting our employees and their families through a comprehensive benefits program
 
Competitive pay, generous paid vacation and holidays, and health insurance programs across all our locations
Ongoing training and development opportunities which foster and shape your individual career path
An active and growing commitment to bettering the communities our employees call home through our Corporate Social Responsibility program
The opportunity to thrive in a global, collaborative environment while working every day to improve health outcomes and patient wellbeing
Diverse, inclusive culture that encourages you to bring your whole self to work


 
If we sound like the sort of business environment in which you would thrive, then we would love to hear from you.
 
Key Words: Structured Query Language (SQL), SQL, MS BI Stack, SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, SQL Developer, Data Engineer Tableau, DAX, MDX, ETL, TSQL,
title: SQL Developer

job_desc:
Our Purpose

Arcadis Gen is the new SaaS business from Arcadis, backed by a â‚¬3bn+ revenue, 27,000-person, 70-country, 130-year-old company. We are bold, dynamic, and disruptive, revolutionizing the future of digital asset management through our 250+ colleagues in over 10 countries worldwide.

Gen has one purpose: to unlock the power of data for a more sustainable, efficient, and resilient world. The world is rapidly changing, and the potential of boundless data and transformative technologies brings countless challenges. And no-one is meeting these challenges quite like we are. Our customers want digital solutions that will optimize their businesses â€“ for better performance, reliability, and improved quality of life for everyone. And that is what we do.

The Opportunity

The Junior Analytics Consultant will be an integral part of the team that delivers projects to clients. These projects empower our clients to improved decision making, underpinned by data, resulting in improved business outcomes.

The Data & Decision Science group collects, processes and interprets corporate data to produce optimised long-term strategic investment plans and advanced analytics tools for companies to improve management of their physical assets.

Client projects range from one-off consultancy pieces to the development of systems and applications that become business as usual, and enduring solutions.

You will work autonomously and within project teams; you will collect and transform data, analysing it to provide regression style relationships and assess their confidence. You will populate and configure the analytics software and solutions in order to produce an optimised strategic plan and disseminate results via client workshops and reports.

Your Responsibilities

Core responsibilities include:
 
 
Deliver projects to our clients:
 
Develop the project scope to ensure we deliver value to the customer, managing outputs and quality.
Collect, assess, and transform data as required to support the project.
Derive predictive models using appropriate statistical techniques.
Ensure the data that supports the project recommendations is verified, analysed, and modelled effectively in collaboration with other team members using Enterprise Decision Analytics (EDA) software and other open source platforms within agreed project scopes, to the standards required by clients.
 
Configure the EDA and other open source software and generate optimised investment plans.
Report and present the outputs to ensure the clients have a full understanding of the project process and deliverables.
Investigate trends within the data and present results.
Develop Analytics based applications for cloud deployment.
Author client reports & technical notes to draft stage.
Produce final versions of client reports based on colleaguesâ€™ review recommendations.
Adhere to business and Project Management process and requirements to ensure auditability and quality assurance are maintained.
 
Brief colleagues prior to meetings.
Communicate with clients within Project Scope to the professional standard deemed acceptable by Gen.
Ensure that any project risks/issues are reported with immediate effect to the Project Manager / Consultant
 




 
 
Exceptional skills in data collection and interpretation
In-depth understanding (and ideally real-world implementation) of:
 
Sensitivity and scenario analysis of analytical models.
Mathematical and statistical analysis and modelling skills.
Data and Analysis tools; R, MATLAB, Python, SAS, SPSS, MS Access, MS Excel, SQL or similar
Data visualisation tools such as Qlik, Power BI etc.
Predictive and / or prescriptive analytics.


Understanding of investment models, assets and systems of assets, understanding of Optimisation (linear & non-linear), Prioritisation and Monte Carlo analysis.
Experience of working for a large asset owning company or consultancy on data analysis / modelling / investment planning would be advantageous.
 
Experience of presenting methodologies and results in a business environment would be advantageous.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and organisational skills.
Ability to adhere to project milestones and meet challenging deadlines.
Accurate attention to detail
 


We Offer
 
 
Hybrid working model, delivering face-to-face collaboration for rapid training and mentoring.
An environment with the innovative culture and entrepreneurial spirit of a start-up, but with the security of a new venture backed by a large publicly listed company.
 
A commitment to the principles of flexible working to enable you to have your ideal work-life integration.
A series of Healthy Working Practices across Gen, including Thinking Thursdays, a day dedicated each week to minimising meetings and maximising opportunities to reduce the cognitive load.
Social events (virtual for the time-being) and gratitude programmes, including vouchers on your birthday.
 


And of course,
 
 
Compensation and discretionary performance incentive schemes which acknowledge and reward your contribution, informed by market data provided by leading global experts Willis Towers Watson.
Leading healthcare, financial and wellbeing benefits, including financial support for your professional registration and accreditation.
 


Equal Opportunity Statement

The community of the future is a place for everyone, and Arcadis Gen is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We know itâ€™s tough, but please try to avoid the confidence gap. You donâ€™t have to match all the listed requirements exactly to be considered for this role. All employment is based on merit and business need.

job_desc:
Job Description
 
Oxford Nanopore Technologies is headquartered at the Oxford Science Park outside Oxford, UK, with satellite offices and commercial presence in many global locations across the US, APAC and Europe.
 
Oxford Nanopore employs from multiple subject areas including Nanopore science, molecular biology and applications, informatics, engineering, electronics, manufacturing and commercialisation. The management team, led by CEO Dr Gordon Sanghera, has a track record of delivering disruptive technologies to the market.
 
Oxford Nanoporeâ€™s sequencing platform is the only technology that offers real-time analysis (for rapid insights), in fully scalable formats from pocket to population scale, that can analyse native DNA or RNA and sequence any length of fragment to achieve short to ultra-long read lengths.
 
Our goal is to enable the analysis of any living thing, by anyone, anywhere. We offer real-time Nanopore-based DNA/RNA sequencing technology: accessible, easy to use and fully scalable for any requirement.
 
We are looking for a highly motivated individual to join our Machine Learning Research group as a Scientific Data Analyst / Algorithms Researcher. This exciting and challenging role involves exploratory analysis of nanopore sequencing data and development of new data analysis methods!
 
The Details...
 
As a member of the Machine Learning Research group you will:
 
 
Perform exploratory analysis research projects to identify leads to improving platform accuracy.
Prototype and implement new algorithms and machine learning methods to follow up leads.
Consolidate analyses into reproducible, standardised, and scalable tools when they become routine.


 
Examples of projects you might work on include analysing sequencing data to inform research priorities, developing consensus and variant callers, or crafting nanopore-tailored bioinformatics tools.
 
The ability to interact with scientists to propose a hypothesis, help plan an experiment, provide custom analysis to examine a dataset, and refine the hypothesis, is crucial along with a strong understanding of scientific methods and excellent interpersonal skills.
 
What We're Looking For...
 
We expect you to have a PhD (or equivalent industry experience) in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Bioinformatics or a related subject!
 
Knowledge, skills and abilities in the following areas are essential:
 
 
Excellent working knowledge of applied statistics.
Fundamentals of experimental design, training and validation of statistical models.
Substantial experience of developing new methods to analyse data in bioinformatics/computational biology or the physical sciences.
Strong programming skills (Python)
Development of software containing a substantial numerical component.
Use of Linux/Unix environment and associated development toolchain.
Working in a time-critical environment with responsibility for reporting progress.
Ability to carefully document your work.


 
Ideally, you will also have knowledge or familiarity in the following areas:
 
 
An appreciation of techniques fundamental to bioinformatics including sequencing data analysis methods.
Prototyping new algorithms, implementing methods directly from research papers.
Exposure to high-level machine learning frameworks (e.g. keras).
Familiarity with C.


 
You should be able to quickly understand complex scientific problems and work with a high degree of independence.
 
We are looking for an innovative and pragmatic candidate who is keen to learn new skills, be willing to listen and adapt with the changing requirements of the department.
 
Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job.
 
About Us
 
Oxford Nanoporeâ€™s goal is to bring the widest benefits to society through enabling the analysis of anything, by anyone, anywhere. The company has developed a new generation of nanopore-based sensing technology enabling the real-time, high-performance, accessible and scalable analysis of DNA and RNA. The technology is used in more than 100 countries to understand the biology of humans and diseases, plants, animals, bacteria, viruses and whole environments.
 
Oxford Nanopore was founded in 2005 as a spin-out from the University of Oxford and now employs around 650 employees around the world.

job_desc:
Company Description
 
 
At AECOM, weâ€™re delivering a better world.
 
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether itâ€™s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. Weâ€™re one global team â€“ 47,000 strong â€“ driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
 
 
About Digital @AECOM
 
 
As a member of the Europe digital consulting services team you will work with leaders from around the world to define and position the digital consulting services, to share best practices, to leverage global capabilities and to support global opportunities and projects. While services and solution management will be set globally, they will be tailored for implementation within the region and for each client.
 
Job Description
 
 
AECOMâ€™s
 
Data and Analytics Team are looking for a
 
Data Engineer
 
to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams.
 
The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
 
 
Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and Azure â€˜big dataâ€™ technologies.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and regions.
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Showcasing proof points and case studies


Qualifications
 
 
Minimum Requirements:
 
 
 
We are looking for a candidate who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Advanced working SQL/nosql, ADLS, Databricks, ADF, Azure DevOps
Experience building and optimizing â€˜big dataâ€™ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable â€˜big dataâ€™ data stores.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:
 
 
 
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.


Attributes/skills:
 
 
 
Commitment to building a diverse and inclusive team
Self-starter with the ability to work as a positive, energized and adaptable team member
Highly developed written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and influence senior leaders
Extremely strong relationship building skills
Demonstrated ability to champion and drive ideas/programs/solutions
Excellent organizational and time management skills, able to work under pressure and prioritize effectively
Able to demonstrate passion, energy and drive, especially in the face of resistance


Additional Information
 
 
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and thereâ€™s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and youâ€™ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm â€“ access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
 
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. Weâ€™re the worldâ€™s trusted global infrastructure firm, and weâ€™re in this together â€“ your growth and success are ours too.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each personâ€™s potential, and weâ€™ll help you reach yours.
 
Join us and letâ€™s get started.

Communicate and present data derived insights to business stakeholders
Analyse existing claims and projecting future claims using actuarial forecasting techniques, including basic pricing techniques
Forecasting performance and supporting Service Contract Managers in pricing
Monitor internationally received data checking for accuracy and reporting exceptions
Collaboratively work across the business functions. Liaising with clients, senior stakeholders, IT developers, underwriters, account managers, claims, finance and actuaries


 
Due to the uniqueness of the Automotive Protection business, a definitive role cannot be scheduled. You will therefore need to be versatile, having the ability to adapt to any eventuality that might come about. You should have the ability to think for yourself and act when confronted with unique situations.
 
 
 
 
Demonstrable experience as a Business Analyst
Excellent knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Very good knowledge of MS SQL Server and Access (strong understanding of relational databases and ability to write SQL queries and macros is a must)
Strong analytical skills - methodical, logical and rational approach to problem solving
Ability to capture and document business requirements in a structured and efficient manner to key stakeholders across the business.


 
 
 
Experience with generalized linear modelling techniques and the Emblem software package will be an advantage
Experience in the insurance industry, particularly the automotive sector


 
QBE Cultural DNA
 
 
â€¢ Everything we do at QBE is underpinned by our DNA (which interlinks seven cultural elements) â€“ because we know it's not just what we do that matters, it's how we do it that makes the difference. We expect all employees to role model and inspire the right behaviours that link to our cultural elements:-We are customer-focused-We are technical experts-We are inclusive-We are fast-paced-We are courageous-We are accountable-We are a team. All employees are expected to adhere to QBEâ€™s Code of Ethics and Conduct and apply sound risk management practices
Why QBE? At My Best
 
At QBE, we want our people to feel rewarded and inspired to perform at their best, thatâ€™s why we have created â€œAt My Bestâ€. Itâ€™s our connection, our way of showing we have your back. We understand that one size doesnâ€™t fit all and that priorities can change depending on your life stage. That is why our blend of wellbeing initiatives and benefits offer flexibility to suit what matters most to you. Itâ€™s in the culture of our business, our QBE DNA, to support our people. Everything we do is underpinned by our QBE DNA - because we know itâ€™s not just what we do that matters, itâ€™s how we do it that makes the difference. In addition to this, we also offer flexible parental leave for both parents and have several employee network groups that support and empower our diverse workforce.
 
At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job, we have adopted flexible working across the company and welcome this conversation.
 
Some of the awardâ€™s QBE are proud to have won, been a finalist for, and shortlisted for include;
 
Employer of the Year 2022 Winner â€“ Insurance Insider
 
British Claims Awards 2022 Winner - InsurTech Award

Working Families Best Practice Awards 2021 Finalist for: Best COVID-19 Response

We are proud to have partnerships with organisations such as Stonewall and Working Families, and our commitment to the Women in Finance Charter, the UN Womenâ€™s Empowerment Principles and Race at Work charter helps keep us accountable and transparent
 
Inclusion of Diversity
 
We are striving to create a workplace culture where all our people feel included, and we are committed to building a diverse workforce that is reflective of the communities we operate in.
 
We know that diversity of thought, background and experience enables better decision making, improves the quality of our delivery and helps us to meet the needs of our customers.
 
What next?
 
If you have a passion to contribute to QBEâ€™s vision of enabling a more resilient future for our customers and the community, we encourage you to APPLY NOW! title: Pricing Data Analyst

job_desc:
Our Purpose

Arcadis Gen is the new SaaS business from Arcadis, backed by a â‚¬3bn+ revenue, 27,000-person, 70-country, 130-year-old company. We are bold, dynamic, and disruptive, revolutionizing the future of digital asset management through our 250+ colleagues in over 10 countries worldwide.

Gen has one purpose: to unlock the power of data for a more sustainable, efficient, and resilient world. The world is rapidly changing, and the potential of boundless data and transformative technologies brings countless challenges. And no-one is meeting these challenges quite like we are. Our customers want digital solutions that will optimize their businesses â€“ for better performance, reliability, and improved quality of life for everyone. And that is what we do.

The Opportunity

The Junior Analytics Consultant will be an integral part of the team that delivers projects to clients. These projects empower our clients to improved decision making, underpinned by data, resulting in improved business outcomes.

The Data & Decision Science group collects, processes and interprets corporate data to produce optimised long-term strategic investment plans and advanced analytics tools for companies to improve management of their physical assets.

Client projects range from one-off consultancy pieces to the development of systems and applications that become business as usual, and enduring solutions.

You will work autonomously and within project teams; you will collect and transform data, analysing it to provide regression style relationships and assess their confidence. You will populate and configure the analytics software and solutions in order to produce an optimised strategic plan and disseminate results via client workshops and reports.

Your Responsibilities

Core responsibilities include:
 
 
Deliver projects to our clients:
 
Develop the project scope to ensure we deliver value to the customer, managing outputs and quality.
Collect, assess, and transform data as required to support the project.
Derive predictive models using appropriate statistical techniques.
Ensure the data that supports the project recommendations is verified, analysed, and modelled effectively in collaboration with other team members using Enterprise Decision Analytics (EDA) software and other open source platforms within agreed project scopes, to the standards required by clients.
 
Configure the EDA and other open source software and generate optimised investment plans.
Report and present the outputs to ensure the clients have a full understanding of the project process and deliverables.
Investigate trends within the data and present results.
Develop Analytics based applications for cloud deployment.
Author client reports & technical notes to draft stage.
Produce final versions of client reports based on colleaguesâ€™ review recommendations.
Adhere to business and Project Management process and requirements to ensure auditability and quality assurance are maintained.
 
Brief colleagues prior to meetings.
Communicate with clients within Project Scope to the professional standard deemed acceptable by Gen.
Ensure that any project risks/issues are reported with immediate effect to the Project Manager / Consultant
 




 
 
Exceptional skills in data collection and interpretation
In-depth understanding (and ideally real-world implementation) of:
 
Sensitivity and scenario analysis of analytical models.
Mathematical and statistical analysis and modelling skills.
Data and Analysis tools; R, MATLAB, Python, SAS, SPSS, MS Access, MS Excel, SQL or similar
Data visualisation tools such as Qlik, Power BI etc.
Predictive and / or prescriptive analytics.


Understanding of investment models, assets and systems of assets, understanding of Optimisation (linear & non-linear), Prioritisation and Monte Carlo analysis.
Experience of working for a large asset owning company or consultancy on data analysis / modelling / investment planning would be advantageous.
 
Experience of presenting methodologies and results in a business environment would be advantageous.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and organisational skills.
Ability to adhere to project milestones and meet challenging deadlines.
Accurate attention to detail
 


We Offer
 
 
Hybrid working model, delivering face-to-face collaboration for rapid training and mentoring.
An environment with the innovative culture and entrepreneurial spirit of a start-up, but with the security of a new venture backed by a large publicly listed company.
 
A commitment to the principles of flexible working to enable you to have your ideal work-life integration.
A series of Healthy Working Practices across Gen, including Thinking Thursdays, a day dedicated each week to minimising meetings and maximising opportunities to reduce the cognitive load.
Social events (virtual for the time-being) and gratitude programmes, including vouchers on your birthday.
 


And of course,
 
 
Compensation and discretionary performance incentive schemes which acknowledge and reward your contribution, informed by market data provided by leading global experts Willis Towers Watson.
Leading healthcare, financial and wellbeing benefits, including financial support for your professional registration and accreditation.
 


Equal Opportunity Statement

The community of the future is a place for everyone, and Arcadis Gen is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We know itâ€™s tough, but please try to avoid the confidence gap. You donâ€™t have to match all the listed requirements exactly to be considered for this role. All employment is based on merit and business need.

you
 
have
 
what
 
it

job_desc:
Weâ€™re looking to grow our team of talented individuals to help optimize the automated support experience and lead our customers to success. Youâ€™ll be pivotal in delivering an awesome product and service experience for customers using our online suite of products.
 
In this role you will evangelize the value of customer centricity within the team by telling the story of customer pain. You will do this through the analysis of key contact drivers and identify insights to tell the story of what happened and why it happened. You will collaborate within the CX team and across the CS and cross-functional teams to help eliminate customer friction and improve customer experience.
 
The insights you surface, and champion will drive alignment and change across the local market teams. You will communicate and inï¬‚uence opportunities to improve the customers experience across all parts of the customer journey with special focus on product improvements.
 
You will form part of a community with the CX Program led to ensure Global learnings are aligned. Works with local go to market and product teams to remove customer pain and â€˜badâ€™ contact volume, looking to drive value interactions at each touch point across Customer Success and the wider business.
 
What you'll bring
 
 
Ability to use CRM Salesforce
Ability to use data analysis and reporting tools such as Qualtrics XM, Tableau, QlikSense
Strong SQL
Ability to use analytics tools such as Amplitude and Decibel
Ability to link data sets and use data to inform and shape business decision
Familiar with research methods: Quantitative, qualitative, and behavioral
Making arguments in a compelling manner
Understand how to get to the root cause of an issue
Have strong planning, organizing and project management skills
Experience in stakeholder management and engagement


 
How you will lead
 
The responsibilities of this role require several different data lenses
 
The Descriptive lens
 
What did customers contact us about?
 
 
Own contact driver data and reporting
Create, maintain, and further develop contact driver dashboard
Analyze and report on Top Contact Drivers on weekly, monthly and adhoc basis to CS team, product team(s) and SLT
Generate training guides and provide training materials on reporting suite
Identify process improvements to enhance the overall quality of contact driver data captured


 
The Diagnostic lens
 
Why did customers contact us?
 
 
Analyze contact driver data with other customer datasets and operational data sets and analytics to establish greater context into customer actions prior to contacting support
Partner with CX peers to determine root-cause of contacts and actionable insights
Partner with CX peers to create customer problem statements, ideal states and generate recommendations for solutions to customer pain-points
Run and participate in or run D4D workshops in partnership with CS and / or X-functional teams to generate innovative solutions to customer problems and reduce contact to CS
Work with CX peers to create a key customer contact backlog to share with go to market and product teams â€˜to enable common understanding of key customer contacts and associated friction, recommended actions and an aligned focus around customer needs
Share contact drivers (descriptive and diagnostic) reports, recommendations and initiatives with in-country product and engineering teams
Partners with horizontal contact driver analyst / customer contact data analyst community and analytics team to share learnings
Act as a driver of recommendations and initiatives identiï¬ed to solve customer problems
Work with CX team to measure and report on impact of change to contact drivers as a result of pain elimination improvements made
Advocate for process and technology improvements to enable richer diagnostic data to be captured


 
The Predictive lens
 
What will they contact us about?
 
 
Monitor contact driver data for increases to enable CS team to prepare for and mitigate future contacts
Analyze contact driver data with product and customer data to identify customer behaviours and enable proactive mitigation of future contact drivers
Advocate for process and technology improvements to enable richer predictive data to be captured


 
 
 
Generate customer list pulls on an adhoc basis for CS team
title: CX Data Analyst

job_desc:
TerraQuest
QA Analyst
Location: Birmingham office with agile working 3 days per week from home
Salary cÂ£50k based on experience.
 
Who we are...
TerraQuest Solutions Ltd, is an award winning and a market leading specialist provider of planning, land, property and business solutions. We are an established and trusted organisation which is renowned for its expertise in providing innovative and cost-effective solutions to both public and private sectors. Our team deliver bespoke, flexible and efficient services through a process-orientated delivery structure. We pride ourselves on strong customer relationships evidenced by the high proportion of referrals and repeat business.
 
What we need...
Based in our Birmingham office, The primary purpose of the QA Analyst is to assure the quality of software delivered by the Solutions team, in projects throughout the entire TerraQuest product suite. The primary function of this role is to perform analysis, design and execution of functional and non-functional testing of software. QA Analysts participate in reviews, workshops and triage, with the objective of improving quality and applying a quality first mentality, shifting the identification of issues and defects as early as possible in the SDLC. They feedback results and progress, and escalate any risks, issues or decisions to QA Manager or Lead.
 
 
What you will be doing...
 
Perform analysis, design and execution of functional and non-functional testing of software.
Understand requirements to determine recommended test coverage in terms of new functionality and regression testing.
Attend all sprint events, including contributing to refinement, planning and review.
Perform QA on project artefacts (eg. user stories) to feedback to allow improvements on these artefacts and on the process as a whole.
Manage own usage of test data, capture test evidence, and ensure test results are accurate.
Create and maintain test artefacts to the defined standards, as well as supporting others in the same pursuit by performing peer test artefact reviews.
Participate in reviews and workshops to develop, improve the quality of, and sign-off specifications and other documentation.
Identify, log and track defects that contain sufficient information to support their resolution.
Attend triage meetings, support the teamâ€™s understanding of the defects under discussion and feed into the QA Leadâ€™s decisions.
Manage own workload; understand priorities and commitments in order to plan work.
Keep up to date on current technologies, tools and software test methodologies (both those used by TerraQuest and those used in the industry).
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues and stakeholders across the TerraQuest Solutions and delivery teams.
Adherence to all Regulatory, Security and Compliance requirements.


 
What we are looking for.....
The ideal candidate will have demonstrable QA experience and an excellent understanding of software testing best practices and their applications. Experience of agile methodologies across multiple projects is also preferred and experience in Cypress or related automated tool is also desirable. In addition we are looking for somebody who has a passion for QA and the desire to learn
In return you will receive a competitive salary of cÂ£50k based on experience and a generous benefits package which includes private health insurance, pension and DIS.

Your expertise in programming, particularly in Python, and experience with AI and ML libraries and toolboxes, make you the ideal candidate to help us deliver a wide range of exciting research projects for customers in the space, defense, security, and commercial sectors.
 
At this company, you will have the opportunity to work with a diverse range of teams and techniques, including reinforcement learning, NLP, knowledge graphs, graph-based neural nets, and deep learning. You will also have access to mentors at the forefront of AI and ML, and the chance to develop your own technical research interests. With strong links to academic partners, you will have the chance to work on groundbreaking projects and publish your work in leading journals and conferences.
 
Responsibilities include preparing technical reports and proposals, delivering novel research, developing prototypes, working on projects both independently and as part of a team, and presenting results to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will have excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as experience in software development and the ability to work in a secure environment.
 
If you are seeking a challenging and rewarding opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and build your expertise in AI and ML, this is the role for you! The right to work in the UK is essential. Apply now to take the next step in your exciting research career!
title: Research Scientist

job_desc:
Location: Belfast
 
Workplace: Hybrid
 
The opportunity:
 
An exciting opportunity has arisen for an investigative candidate to join our Analytics team as a People Analytics Specialist.
 
In this creative team you will provide functional expertise in the establishment and operationalisation of People Analytics function globally, and partner with People and Functional leaders to drive data-based decision-making by integrating data into tactical operations and strategic planning across the employee lifecycle.
 
This opportunity is ideal for someone with a background in research who is looking to work with colleagues globally and play an important role in this teams continued success.
 
Working at Baker McKenzie:
 
Baker McKenzie is the worldâ€™s leading law firm with offices all over the world. Our Belfast Centre is home to over 400 teammates in both legal and professional services such as finance, IT, marketing and business support.
 
We offer one of the best workplace benefits packages in the business with comprehensive private health cover, income protection, life assurance and a full employee assistance plan. These and a host of other benefits make us one of the most desirable companies to work for in Belfast.
 
We are committed to promoting inclusion, diversity and equity for all and are confident we can provide a career as individual and as exceptional as you.
 
About the role:
 
As part of this role, the successful candidate will:
 
 
Provide functional expertise in people research, quantitative and/or qualitative data analysis, interpretation, and presentation of results to help inform, influence, support, and execute talent decisions across the employee lifecycle
Partner with the talent management, recruitment and mobility, careers and performance, leadership and learning, and diversity and inclusion work-streams to identify and clarify people/functional issues, deeply understand people processes, and analyze data to drive improvements and automation
Lead the execution of people research and analytics project/s from client engagement to delivery using systematic data gathering (e.g., survey, system-generated data), appropriate analytical techniques (e.g., descriptive, inferential, modelling), and action-oriented reporting
Generate insights based on analyses and communicate the results, along with their implications, to technical and non-technical audiences
Design, architect, and implement standard people metrics dashboard by leveraging standard tools (e.g., Tableau Desktop/Prep Builder, SQL, VBA) in collaboration with the Global Reporting function to enable client self-service for routine queries
Build relationships and collaborate effectively with People Systems and Data Architects/ Engineers to ensure data integrity and accuracy, and reliability of data access to people's information
Contribute to the operational redesign, development, and implementation of people analytics function globally
Perform other functions as may be assigned by the immediate manager from time to time


 
Essential Criteria:
 
To be successful in this role you will need:
 
Skills and Experience:
 
 
Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in Psychology, Behavioral Science, Applied Statistics, Social Sciences, Industrial Engineering, or other relevant courses, or equivalent work experience
Good relevant experience in people research (e.g., survey design), quantitative/ qualitative analysis, and reporting (or other related quantitative/qualitative analysis roles)
Deep domain knowledge in most HR practices and processes, HR systems (data inflow and outflow), and management, preferably proven functional knowledge on D&I programs, succession planning, and leadership
Advanced proficiency or practical knowledge in data/process automation tools (Tableau Prep Builder, SQL, VBA, PowerQuery, Power Apps), statistical data analysis tools (Excel, SPSS, JASP, R, Python), and presentation and visualization tools (PowerPoint, Tableau, Power BI)
Experience and proficiency in business/process analysis, developing standard metrics/dashboards, and workforce plans in multinational or global organizations, preferably from professional services organizations
Independent thinking and very light supervision is required; very good analytical and critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Excellent executive presentation skills; should have the ability to distil and present actionable information derived from complex data
Experience in process redesign and project management (requirements gathering to delivery)
Working knowledge of data privacy law
Experience working in a shared services/captive environment is preferable
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills


 
What happens next:
 
Click the button above to submit an application online before 5pm on the 21st of August 2022.
Once received, our recruitment team will review and if shortlisted will contact you for a preliminary informal discussion of your application and to arrange a first stage interview with the department manager where relevant.

job_desc:
Role Title: MI Analyst Internship
Reporting to: MI Analysis Manager
Directorate: Frontline Regulation
Starting Salary: Â£18,965 plus excellent benefits package and flexible working
Contract: 12 month fixed-term contract (placement)
Location: Brighton/hybrid
Closing date: 12 March 2023
To Apply Email your application to recruitmentteam@tpr.gov.uk quoting role reference 148165
 
The role
The team
The MI analytics team supports the Frontline Regulation Directorate through a number of means all related to data, data analytics and strengthening our ways of measuring performance internally within the business. As a team we all share a passion for analysis and technology, as well as a strong culture towards learning and development. We support one another and strive to create a friendly, welcoming, and inclusive working environment.
 
What youâ€™ll do
We're looking for someone passionate about analytics to join our team of MI Analysts and assist in the measurement of corporate performance and provide actionable insight to managers and decision makers. You will start with the easier, more templated tasks, but as your abilities grow you will have opportunities to take on bigger projects. The role incorporates coding, data visualisation and stakeholder management, allowing the intern to apply and develop a wide range of skills. you will work closely with our experts to:
 
With training and support from the team you will work on large data sets, using SQL code, Excel and Power BI, to create reports providing actionable insight to managers and decision makers in Frontline Regulation.
Support analysts in measurement of our corporate key performance indicators and other internal performance measures.
 
Manage the production of the monthly performance pack for the senior management team in Frontline Regulation, liaising with managers across the directorate.
Work with the support of experienced analysts to answer Freedom of Information requests and supply information on core regulatory activities.
Find opportunities to use your analytical skills and techniques to make valuable contributions to business problems.
Be a contributing and proactive member of the Frontline Regulation directorate and the TPR analyst community


 
What youâ€™ll bring
 
Ability to analyse complex information
Ability to apply skills to unseen business problems and work with new tools
Ability to deliver and explain complex information clearly in words, tables, graphs, visualisations and as concepts.
Good command of Microsoft Office, including organising and charting data in Excel.
Some understanding of SQL or another coding language, and Power BI or another data visualisation tool desirable but not essential (training will be provided)


 
We put you first
Weâ€™ll give you a chance to put your theory into practice as you work alongside a diverse, friendly and experienced team. Youâ€™ll develop your skills in a safe and supportive work environment that values your thoughts, perspectives and ideas. Youâ€™ll receive regular feedback on your performance to help you learn, develop and improve throughout your time with us.
 
What youâ€™ll get
As well as a starting salary of Â£18,965, we offer:
 
A Civil Service Pension with an average employer contribution of 27%
25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Flexi leave - take up to two days flexi leave a month
Flexible working arrangements (hybrid)
Career development opportunities
Enhanced parental leave
Free employee assistance programme
Brighton location with excellent transport links


 
What we do
More than half the UK working population rely on us to regulate their retirement savings. With a career at The Pensions Regulator (TPR), youâ€™ll be joining an organisation that will impact on millions of lives for decades to come.
 
Everyone plays an important role in helping to keep more than Â£2trn of savings safe. We put UK savers at the heart of what we do. So, if youâ€™re ready to make a difference, then we want to hear from you.
 
Find out more about us.
 
Kick-start your career
Who can apply?
 
If youâ€™re an undergraduate looking for a placement year, then why not join our team!
 
Weâ€™re having an assessment day on 29 March 2023, this will take place in our office. Make sure youâ€™re free on this date - as youâ€™ll need to take part in group/individual assessments, as well as an interview.
 
Supporting diversity and inclusion
We are an inclusive employer and want applications from all backgrounds. We champion equality, diversity and inclusion and through our Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy, have set out how we will embed diversity and inclusion throughout our organisation and support our regulated community to do the same.
 
We can provide reasonable adjustments if you have a disability. Please get in touch at any stage of the recruitment process, so we can find out what this may look like for you please email recruitmentteam@tpr.gov.uk. If you do meet the minimum criteria, we will offer you an interview.
 
Location
We operate a hybrid working model, with regular attendance in our Brighton office to connect with colleagues.
 
Right to work
Under Home Office guidance, weâ€™re required to establish if future employees have a right to work in the UK before they start employment with us. Currently, weâ€™re not able to offer sponsorship. We are a UK-based organisation, and you must live in the UK to be employed by us.
 
Screening
The Pensions Regulator is an armâ€™s length government body and part of the public service.
 
Any offer of employment will be subject to us receiving satisfactory background screening checks and criminal record checks (BPSS).
 
Weâ€™d love to hear from you
Email your CV to recruitmentteam@tpr.gov.uk, adding the role reference number above.

job_desc:
Are you our next Research and Analytics Manager? We are looking for someone who can help us redefine what's possible for the key research programmes for Gatwick and our External stakeholders.

As part of our â€˜Grow with Gatwick' initiative you'll be provided with plenty of training and support to ensure you're developing and growing your career.

This role requires a strong understanding of research (qual & quant), data analysis and ability to effectively communicate insights, so, if you enjoy solving commercial problems, driving projects independently and possess a high level of attention to detail this could be the right role for you.
 
What is the role?
 
The role will be responsible for managing key research programmes from inception, data collection, analysis, and delivery of insights. This will involve working independently & liaising with Gatwick's in-house survey team, external agencies, and colleagues within other Gatwick departments to deliver key Customer experience metrics and insights.
 
 
What will you do?
 
(Accountabilities)
 
 
Manage high-quality research projects (continuous & bespoke) to industry standards incorporating questionnaire design, methodology, data analysis/weighting and reporting.
Deliver Core Service Standard (CSS) data in accordance with CAA regulatory framework, ensuring all aspects of survey process and reporting requirements are adhered to.
Provide key performance metrics from Gatwick's CX surveys to Operations Team to enable performance tracking and improvements.
Implement bespoke quantitative research projects in response to requests from internal stakeholders to drive and support business decisions.
Ability to prepare research brief and manage external agencies to deliver ad-hoc research studies.
Develop new ways of delivering customer insights to decision makers (e.g. live data portals, dashboards) to enable self-service where appropriate.
Manage relationship with external service providers to ensure they deliver to contract and drive improvements in service in the most costs effective way.
 


 
Do you have what we're looking for?
 
(Skills & experience)
 
 
Experience could be client or agency side
Experience of leading qualitative and quantitative research projects with solid understanding of research methodology, data analysis and reporting.
Ability to articulate complex numerical issues in simple terms and extract conclusions & insights to drive business decisions.
Demonstratable management of external suppliers, especially regarding data processing & reporting services.
Experience with designing and delivering research projects via market research software platform (preferably Qualtrics) is essential.
Evidence of successful delivery of work in a project-based environment.
Experience with dashboard software (e.g. Tableau, Power BI) and/or statistical language (e.g. Python, SPSS, Access) to facilitate bespoke analysis
Degree-level qualification, in a relevant or numerical subject such as statistics
Market Research qualifications (academic or professional)
 


What's it like to work here?
 
Our employees tell us that working here is something special. Everyone is looking to deliver what matters to our passengers. There is so much that makes air travel possible. No day is like another. Our employees enjoy a range of personal, health and financial benefits, including annual leave and high street discounts. We offer a performance-based bonus scheme, and our people can request professional training to support them to Grow with Gatwick

We want our people to reflect our local community and the passengers we serve. We know we are all at our best when we feel comfortable and included. We want our people to feel like they can be who they want to be at work, and we work hard to provide them with the respect and flexibility to do so.

We aim to be an equitable, diverse, and inclusive employer. We encourage and support our people to be their best. We seek different perspectives that redefine what's possible. Together we are a team.
 
Click apply and complete your application. We'll be in touch soon.

job_desc:
We use technical and business knowledge to solve our clientsâ€™ problems. And because we offer so many different technology services we need people with different experiences to help us deliver them effectively. Digital is the new normal, transforming how we work and live.

At PwC, as we focus on future innovations, weâ€™re investing in the best and most diverse workforce of today and tomorrow. Weâ€™re pushing forward with the use of technology within our own business - enabling our people to work more efficiently and collaborate more easily. All this is part of our commitment to put technology at the centre of our strategy as we continue to help our clients navigate the future digital landscape.
 
Financial Crime Data Analytics
 
Financial Crime Data Analytics sits within our Forensics practice and involves the analysis of vast quantities of data using cutting-edge technologies and advanced statistical techniques in order to discover insights for our worldwide clients. Our remit is broad and our aspiration clear: to be the unavoidable voice in the ongoing and urgent fight against financial crime. There can be no place in a trusted financial system for terrorists, drug traffickers, market abusers and money launderers.
 
Programme

You'll learn from hands-on coaching and an outstanding variety of work, picking up business, personal and technical skills you can use across the network, and throughout your career.
 
What You'll Do
 
Join us and you could be looking for hidden patterns within the global payments of a bank accused of money laundering, searching for evidence of fraud and abuse within a companyâ€™s finance system or helping track down rogue traders in their attempts to manipulate global financial markets. You may also be researching new tools and technologies and developing new propositions to take to our clients.

As a valued member of the team you will gain exposure to a wide variety of analytical techniques, providing you with a solid foundation for your career in data analytics.
 
What You'll Gain
 
When you join the Financial Crime Analytics team, youâ€™ll receive training in a wide range of technical and non-technical skills. We have a strong focus on learning and development, and provide the opportunity to take professional qualifications in technical skills such as programming languages, and to develop subject matter expertise in different areas of Financial Crime.
 
What You'll Need

Candidates should also be prepared to travel as some of our opportunities can require team members to work at other PwC offices or client sites across the UK or overseas on a temporary basis (subject to government advice/guidelines).

You'll need to have achieved or be on track to pass an undergraduate degree or above in a STEM related subject (Science/Technology/Engineering/Maths) and demonstrate a passion for a career in technology and how organisations use it. Programming or scripting experience.
 


Find out more
 
 
Our people

Please note that PwC is unable to sponsor any candidates for some roles as the Home Office's eligibility criteria will not be satisfied. For a list of these roles, please review the 'Important information' section of the work permit page on our website.

job_desc:
Job Description
 
At abrdn, our purpose is to enable our clients to be better investors.

Clients worldwide trust us to find future-fit investment opportunities to deliver the outcomes they want. Our technology and insight help empower them to make better decisions, while the powerful partnerships we build help to enhance the expertise that we offer. And by enabling clients to invest responsibly, it helps us to build a better world.
 
About The Department
 
Public Market Operations plays a key role in powering the investment management process. Our aim is to provide our stakeholders with best in class services that support the end to end investment process, new capabilities to support growth in investment outcomes, exceptional value from our platform/data vendors and an enabling innovation partner. All underpinned by a service culture and a focus on our customers.
 
About The Role
 
The role will report to the Index Data Manager in Edinburgh and will demand a large amount of autonomy and motivation to deliver a high level of service and contribution to the investment process.

The public market data universe consists of investment data covering all of our investments. The universe also contains a large number of benchmarks, and many of these are stored at constituent level, along with the top level index value. Additionally a large number of custom blended benchmarks are created and maintained.

Data is fed from a variety of suppliers including FactSet into Markit EDH, where data is validated and cleansed before it is released to our data warehouse. From there data is published to systems used throughout abrdn across our Global offices.

The team provides cover to our customers from 8am each day, so there is a requirement for flexible start times.
 
Key Outcomes
 
 
Ensure relevant data is delivered accurately to downstream systems on a timely basis
Validate benchmarks prior to their use in production of unit prices for Abrdn Funds.
Analyse and resolve complex data anomalies in a creative and timely manner.
Responsible for setting up new benchmarks and maintaining existing benchmarks, including blends and custom benchmarks.
Deliver continuous improvement initiatives within the team
Develop a good understanding of the end to end abrdn business operating model, and of the individual systems within abrdn.
Proactively stay abreast of industry and regulatory (BMR) best practice in Data Management.
Build and maintain relationships with customers and suppliers, both internal and external.
Represent the Index Data Team both internally and externally as required.
 


About The Candidate Requirements
 
Experience of the below is advantageous:
 
 
Previous experience in Benchmark/Index Analyst or Performance Management type role with the ability to display exceptional analytical skills.
Knowledge of indices/Index Vendors, e.g. MSCI, S&P, JP Morgan, FTSE etc.
Knowledge of Index construction & maintenance
Experience of Markit EDM, CRIMS, FactSet, DataStream and Bloomberg would be preferable.
An understanding of the end to end functions of an investment management company and the investment process.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Power Automate, Power BI etc. is desirable.
Proven track record of operational improvement.
Track record of providing ideas and solutions to support the progression of a team.
 


Our Benefits
 
There's more to working life than coming home with a good salary. We have an environment where you can learn, get involved and be supported.

When you join us, your reward will be one of the best around. This includes 40 daysâ€™ annual leave, a 16% employer pension contribution, private healthcare and a range of flexible benefits â€“ including gym discounts, season ticket loans and access to an employee discount portal. You can read more about our benefits here.
 
Our business
 
Enabling our clients to be better investors drives everything we do. Our business is structured around three distinct areas â€“ our vectors of growth â€“ focused on our clientsâ€™ changing needs. You can find out more about what we do here.
 
An inclusive way of working
 
Whatever way you like to work, if you have the talent and commitment to join our team, weâ€™d like to hear from you.

At abrdn weâ€™ve adopted a â€˜blended workingâ€™ approach. This approach combines the benefits of face-to-face collaboration, coaching and connecting in our offices with the flexibility of working from home. It enables colleagues to find a balance that works for their roles, their teams, our clients and our business.

An inclusive culture, where diverse perspectives drive our actions, is at the core of who we are and what we do. If you need assistance with your application, or a reasonable adjustment to your interview arrangements â€“ for example, because you are neurodivergent, or have a physical, sensory, cognitive, mental, visible or invisible disability â€“ please let us know and weâ€™ll be happy to help.

Weâ€™re committed to providing an inclusive workplace where all forms of difference are valued and which is free from any form of unfair or unlawful treatment. We define diversity in its broadest sense â€“ this includes but is not limited to our diversity of educational and professional backgrounds, experience, cognitive and neurodiversity, age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion or belief and ethnicity and geographical provenance. We support a culture that values meritocracy, fairness and transparency and welcomes enquiries from everyone.
 
If you need assistance or an adjustment due to a disability please let us know as part of your application and we will assist.

job_desc:
Your Journey
 
At Sweaty Betty, weâ€™re more than just a global activewear and lifestyle brand for women.
 
Weâ€™re also a community that believes fitness is a flip-the-switch trigger for becoming the woman you want to be. Leggings and sports bras wonâ€™t change the world on their own. But with a grab-my-hand, letâ€™s-go-for-it-now spirit, the women who wear them can.
 
If you want to join us on the next chapter of our adventure, youâ€™re in the right place. This is an exciting opportunity for a Data Technology Lead to join us on our mission to empower women through fitness and beyond by helping us define and build all elements of our data technology from the availability and quality of our data sets and data pipelines and automation to the Business Insight Reporting we provide to our stakeholders. You will be working with both the data platform and Power BI Reporting Teams and working closely with the wider technology team and various stakeholders across the business such as E-Commerce, Planning, Performance Marketing, Finance & Operations.
 
The ideal candidate will be passionate about working with all elements of data technology and be comfortable working across multiple data sets, having the expertise to utilise data to drive one truly integrated system, develop coded automation in business insight and forecasting. They will proactively seek to understand the wider business requirements and provide support and advice to analysts and BI developers to help our teams and operations become more agile, scalable and efficient.
 
This is a high-exposure and critical role, reporting directly to the Technology leadership team
 
SB Values
 
âˆ™ We Really Care âˆ™ First, Best, Bravest âˆ™ Our Strength is in Each Other âˆ™ Stand Up, Speak Up, Shout Out
 
What Youâ€™ll Be Doing
 
 
Provide leadership to the inhouse and 3 rd party data engineers and Power BI developers
Design, develop and maintain scalable, automated, insightful data tables and pipelines which will be the main input for the models, reports and dashboards
Work with Data Analyst and Power BI developers to use analytical and statistical rigor to solve complex problems and drive business decisions and automation

Must Haves
 
 
Experience in leading data engineering teams
Experience of
 
Modern data platform technology stack e.g FiveTran, dbt, Snowflake or similar technologies
Typical Data Engineering constructs, e.g. Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, ETL, APIs.
 
Power BI, and additional experience with other visualisation tools


Bachelors/Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field or an exceptional self-taught candidate.
Working with integrations with ERP Platforms, namely Business Central/Dynamics desirable
Advanced SQL skills with proficiency in JSON a benefit. Strong proven experience and credibility working with big data and cloud technologies and third party ETL tools ingesting data from disparate sources (e.g. digital analytics/social media/customer engagement platforms).
Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including ROI prioritisation, objectives/roadmap setting, agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing and operations
Knowledge of DataOps desirable
Background in supporting data analysts in conducting large scale data analysis and modelling to support business decision making

Highly collaborative and where relevant, adopt a coaching approach with team
An ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
 


The Extras

60% off all Sweaty Betty merchandise
25 days holiday, plus 8 flexible bank holidays
Sample sales
10 days work from anywhere policy
Company bonus scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Health Cash Plan benefit with Medicash available to all Sweaty Betty UK Employees (Following successfully passing probation)
Enhanced Family Leave policy
Discounts at the best Studio Classes
SB Flexible Working: we currently work flexibly between the office and home
 


Our D&I Commitment
 
Our mission is to empower all women. This means doing more and working harder to make the long-lasting changes necessary to become an inclusive, diverse and actively anti-racist company. We care about our people, our community, our world. And we want to stand up for what we believe in.
We want to give our people a platform to use their voice. And actively listen and learn from what they have to say. This involves focusing on learning, development and progression across the business. Training our leaders, managers and teams about their rights under our equality, diversity and inclusion policy. And being clear on the responsibilities we hold to each other and our community. It also means being committed to equal employment opportunities. Ensuring we consider ALL applicants for jobs. And work harder to make our job advertising more inclusive.
Ultimately, weâ€™re working to create a culture and team that represents our customers, our community and our mission of empowerment. We want to celebrate our diversity and the power it gives our team and our business.
We know weâ€™re on a journey. And far from perfect. But we want to be a part of the solution to the problem. It might not be comfortable or straightforward. But if we werenâ€™t up for doing the hard work and breaking the mould, we wouldnâ€™t be Sweaty Betty. We are committed to working across our business and with our Internal Diversity & Inclusion Collective to be champions, allies and inclusive, always. Because when we say All, we mean it.
