job_desc:
Exciting Challenges
 
Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a leading position in the development and production of systems and products for waterproofing, bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protecting in the building sector and motor vehicle industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 101 countries around the world and manufactures in over 300 factories. Its more than 27,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 9.3 billion in 2021.
 
The role centres around the investigation of cutting-edge data science techniques to drive operational efficiency and sustainability initiatives in the manufacture of cementitious products. As part of the R&D network, you will be instrumental in ensuring Sika's trajectory towards becoming the standout low-emissions, high-efficiency supplier of cement-based systems.
 
The R&D/Data Science student internship has been running for a number of years and has become a critical component of our operations. Students split their time between leveraging data science techniques in order to improve our understanding of industrial raw materials and streamline our portfolio and processes, and working in the laboratory to test their predictions, improving old products, and even designing new ones.
 
The Opportunity-
 
 
Actively pursue an understanding of data science techniques and how they can be utilised in chemical and industrial processes
Spend time working in a research environment, developing a strong knowledge of how different ingredients affect the properties of final products, and the interplay between them
Ideate with a focus on how we can aid in the solution of complex problems using data science, machine learning or AI
Design testing protocols and scrupulously adhere to them, ensuring that your data collection is consistent and complete
 


The Rewards-
 
You will be rewarded with a competitive salary, and a sweep of great benefits. We pride ourselves on our total reward package-
 
 
Holiday 25 days rising to 28 days with service, plus bank holidays
Hybrid Working
 
Core Hours Working between 10.00-16.00
A company pension contribution of up to 10%
Private healthcare for you, with option to add family
 
Group life cover at 6x your annual salary
 
Global Income Protection (PHI)
 
Enhanced maternity and paternity pay
Staff discount platform & Cycle to Work scheme
 
Dedicated Service Awards for reaching key milestones
Selected discounted Sika products
 


The Support-
 
You will join the data science unit of Sika UK, which is nestled inside the greater R&D team. Your primary mentorship and supervisor will come from the members of the Data Science unit, but the R&D team will be constantly present, teaching you laboratory techniques and ensuring the social aspect of your hybrid working experience is not lost. The manager of R&D will be your senior line manager. Sika R&D operates under a no doors policy, meaning we are always available to talk.
 
Joining the R&D / DS team will give you an insight into the different worlds of industrial research, operational logistics and data science. You will come away with a multitude of new skills, in areas including data manipulation; the fundamentals of machine learning; knowledge of cementitious chemistry; understanding of standards and safe manufacturing processes, not to mention significant experience in laboratory and digital work. Each intern has been a success story, boasting achievements from designing new product lines to finding new raw materials that could revolutionise national industry. A significant commitment to professional and personal development from day one.
 
The Future-
 
The possession of deep knowledge in the topics of machine learning and data science is an invaluable skill in today's employment landscape. Moreover, despite their prevalence in logistics and manufacturing, such advanced techniques have yet to see sufficient permeation into industrial R&D, especially in the world of construction materials. The pairing of experience in both of these worlds sets you up excellently for a bright future.
 
We welcome expressions of interest from all eligible applicants. The Construction Industry and the Sika salesforce remain disproportionately under-represented by women and we therefore particularly welcome applications from women interested in a sales career in the building supplies and materials industry. Accordingly, we aim to provide an enabling and inclusive working environment for all.
 
We Need Your Skills
 
 
You must be pursuing an undergraduate degree in a field strongly linked to chemistry or process engineering
A strong willingness to learn about completely new, and perhaps unintuitive subjects
Mathematical fluency - a minimum of A-Level is preferred
Excellence in the presentation of complex topics and data to non-expert audiences
No prior coding skills are required, but they are appreciated
Good knowledge of standard laboratory practices, safety and etiquette
 


CLOSING DATE-
 
28th February 2023
 
Job Category
 
Chemistry / Research & Development / Laboratory
 
Job ID
 
12452BR
location: Welwyn Garden City, England, United Kingdom

job_desc:
Full time, London or remote (GMT +/- 3 hours)
 
About us:
 
BeZero Carbon is a global ratings agency for the Voluntary Carbon Market. Our ratings allow all market participants to price and manage risk. BeZeroâ€™s ratings and research tools support buyers, intermediaries, investors, and carbon project developers.
 
Founded in April 2020, our 120+-strong team combines climatic and earth sciences, sell-side financial research, earth observation, machine learning, data and technology, engineering, and public policy expertise. We work from five continents.
 
www.bezerocarbon.com
 
Background on the role:
 
BeZero is looking for a mid- or senior-level data engineer to join our data engineering & data science team. The team currently consists of 7 experienced data engineers and scientists, who are building data and machine learning products for our client-facing platform and internal teams. The team sits at the heart of the business, working across our ratings, product and technology teams.
 
As a data team, we have a bias towards shipping products, staying close to our internal and external customers, and owning our infrastructure and deployments end-to-end. This is a team that follows software engineering best practices closely: no production code found in Jupyter notebooks here! Our data stack looks as follows
 
 
 
AWS as our cloud infrastructure provider.
 
Snowflake as our central data warehouse for tabular data. AWS S3 is used for any non-tabular data (e.g., satellite imagery data). We also use PostGIS for querying geospatial vector data.
 
dbt for building SQL-style data models and taking care of the â€˜Tâ€™ in ELT.
 
Python jobs for non-SQL data transformations, using packages like NumPy, Pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch, and many more.
 
Prefect as our workflow orchestration manager, with our jobs executed on AWS ECS.
 
Metabase as a dashboarding solution for end-users.
 
GitHub Actions for CI / CD.


 
Youâ€™ll be responsible for building productionised data pipelines that handle a variety of data types: we process a lot of tabular data but increasingly process large geospatial data sets (think different types of satellite imagery) as well. Youâ€™ll play a key role in building out further our data infrastructure, and there will also be opportunities to contribute to building our machine learning operations infrastructure.
 
Youâ€™re welcome to work in our London-based office, but we very much welcome applications remotely if you can work GMT +/- 3 hours. Youâ€™d be reporting into our Chief Data Strategist Thomas, who joined recently from data and machine learning consultancy QuantumBlack and McKinsey & Co, and represents the data organisation at the executive level.
 
Responsibilities:
 
You will be an individual contributor on our central data team, focused on developing and maintaining our cloud-based (AWS) data infrastructure used to build data products to be deployed on our carbon markets platform.
 
You will build automated pipelines that collect, manipulate and extract structured and unstructured information about voluntary carbon market projects.
 
You will be charged with finding ways to monitor and maintain data flows, enable self-service analysis to business users, and to create and improve scalable data pipelines.
 
You will develop a suite of production data models using dbt to transform our internal data into a form suitable for analytics and reporting work.
 
Youâ€™ll be our ideal candidate if:
 
You care deeply about the climate and carbon markets and are excited by solutions for decarbonising our economy.
 
You have 3+ years of experience for the mid-level role, or 5+ years of experience for the senior level role, in building ELT pipelines in production for data engineering and machine learning use cases.
 
You have hands-on experience with workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Prefect, Dagster, Airflow, Luigi), containerization, a cloud platform (we use AWS but any cloud platform will do) and the Python scientific computing stack (NumPy, SciPy, matplotlib, pandas, etc).
 
You have experience working with a modern data warehouse such as Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift, and know how to write production-grade SQL.
 
You can write clean, maintainable, scalable, and robust code in Python and SQL, and are familiar with collaborative coding best practices (e.g., for Python PEP8 code style, unit testing, continuous integration tools such as flake8, black, isort, etc). You are a highly collaborative individual who wants to solve problems that drive business value.
 
Bonus points (but weâ€™d still like to hear from you if you donâ€™t have experience in any of these)
 
You have experience in deploying cloud resources using tools such as AWS Cloud Formation, Terraform, etc.
 
You have experience working with raster and vector geospatial data sets, and are familiar with the packages for processing such data (e.g., rasterio, geopandas, xarray, gdal)
 
You have practical knowledge of software engineering concepts and best practices, inc. DevOps, DataOps, and MLOps.
 
You have experience in building and deploying deep learning models for computer vision use-cases.
 
Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for a role if they donâ€™t have experience in 100% of the requirements outlined in a job description. Please know that even if you donâ€™t have experience in all the areas above but think you could do a great job and are excited about shaping company culture, finding great people, and building great teams, weâ€™d love to hear from you!
 
What weâ€™ll offer:
 
 
Competitive salary and opportunity for equity in a rapidly growing VC-backed start-up through share options
Ability to learn and develop alongside a range of sector specialists from the scientific, economic and business community
Opportunity to work in a cross-cutting role, interacting with lots of different parts of the business
Growth opportunities that come from working at a fast-paced VC-backed technology business
Opportunity to work remote or in our Central London office space (Old Street) with flexibility to work from home + some flexibility over working location during the summer
Regular social events
25 days leave (with additional time off between Christmas and New Year, and for your birthday)
Private medical insurance, dental, critical illness cover, income protection, life assurance, medical cash plan, cycle to work scheme, and a health and wellness cash allowance


 
We value diversity at BeZero Carbon. We need a team that brings different perspectives and backgrounds together to build the tools needed to make the voluntary carbon market transparent. Weâ€™re therefore committed to not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, age, or disability.

job_desc:
Great that you're thinking about a career with BSI!
 
Are you a
 
Data Scientist
 
looking for a permanent role that offers you the opportunity to work in a new team to demonstrate the value data science can bring to an organisation, providing the ability to help shape the strategic direction of data science in BSI? This could be the role for you.
 
The Data Science team will have access to a wide variety of data sets to analyse and projects to be involved with. In addition to creating a new data science team, we are also excited to be opening our new Innovation Lab in Cambridge where the team will be based.
 
We are looking for an enthusiastic individual who likes seeking new data challenges in a proactive manner where the opportunities to make a difference are there to be grabbed!
 
We cover a wide variety of sectors such as Food, Healthcare, Built Environment, Aerospace, and partner with both public and private organisations to make our world safer, more secure, and resilient.
 
Why not come and work for the organisation that is creating standards on disruptive technologies, including AI?
 
In this Data Science role, you will partner with the global key data owners and technology partners to further our goals of providing solutions designed at increasing Trust, Sustainability, and Resiliency. This role will be a member of our Innovation team which is creating solutions that redefine digital assurance and advanced predictive analysis. You will work closely on data experiments, projects and solution builds across multiple business units and industries and will report to the Director of AI and Data Science.
 
About The Company
 
BSI is the UKâ€™s National Standards Body, but we are much more than that. We are an international organisation that tackles the problems businesses have by leading the development and embedding of best practices. We help companies access new markets, accelerate innovation, become more resilient and sustainable, and build trusted customer relationships.
 
Standards protect and create trust, but they are only one aspect of our work. Ensuring conformity with standards and regulatory frameworks accelerates our clientsâ€™ ability to improve and grow. Our consulting expertise and insights create a rich environment for innovation. Our work across these interconnected areas unlocks value for clients that is not always apparent when we start.
 
Key Responsibilities
 
 
Engage with data owners across the organisation to identify data analysis opportunities to ethically leverage BSI business data and drive solutions.
Mine and analyse BSI-wide data to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes scoping, data gathering, ongoing deliverables and presentation. Develop and present demonstrations and prototypes to communicate the opportunities presented by data analysis in BSI.
Maintain a portfolio of tools and technologies to ensure that BSI is prepared to leverage a diverse range of both structured and unstructured data and continually assess their efficiency and accuracy.
 
Continually review BSI's portfolio of projects to identify where data generated can contribute to insights.
Develop a companywide testing framework, as well as testable hypotheses in conjunction with domain experts from the business followed by appropriate algorithms and data models. Perform speculative analysis of data sets.
Advise the business about metrics and the collection of data.
Engage with stakeholders to ensure that data insights are effectively communicated through the most appropriate data visualisation and navigation tools.
Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize business outcomes.
Horizon scan to stay up to date with the latest technology, techniques, and methods, conduct research to develop prototypes and proof of concepts, as well as look for opportunities to use insights/datasets/code/models across other functions in BSI.


 
Education/Qualifications
 
What we are looking for:
 
 
Educated to degree level in mathematics, computer science, or engineering
A relevant postgraduate qualification (Essential)


 
Knowledge & Experience
 
 
Strong statistical analysis skills
Knowledge of Mathlab or R
Knowledge of predictive models
Strong scripting skills (Python, NumPy)
Knowledge of ETL techniques and tools
Knowledge of 'big-data' architectures such as Hadoop
Strong relational database skills - SQL, stored procedure, development, and a knowledge of database development
Knowledge of open-source tools such as Elasticsearch, Kibana
Experience in the analysis of both structured and unstructured data


 
Skills & Abilities
 
 
Proven ability to take initiative in a data analysis role
Ability to quickly assimilate data structures and relationships across data sources
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Strong interpersonal skills and a proven ability to elicit requirements from both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to align data analysis research with BSI's goals and objectives
A passion for identifying value in data
Solutions orientated problem solver
High attention to corporate and departmental reputation
Ability to function in a fast-moving environment and to meet stringent deadlines for completing tasks


 
What we offer!
 
We offer a highly competitive starting salary with 27 days annual leave with the opportunity to increase this to 30 days, company-paid private medical insurance, an excellent company-contributed pension scheme, and a wide range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your lifestyle.
 
Our Excellence Behaviours: Client-centric, Agile, Collaborative. These three behaviours represent how we do things at BSI. They help us ensure that BSI is a great place to work and a highly successful business.
 
BSI is conducting face-to-face interviews where appropriate and possible. If you are invited to a face-to-face interview but feel more comfortable with conducting the interview virtually, please speak to a member of our recruitment team.

job_desc:
Recently acquired by Inspired Plc - 
Businesswise Solutions 
remains a standalone challenger brand within the Inspired Group but belonging to the wider group brings greater security and potential for development and growth within the largest and most successful energy consultancy group in the industry.


BWS is a business that does the right thing, with a focus on the environment, our people and our clients, who in turn let us look after their energy.


BWS has built a market-leading energy management solution, that is underpinned by technology platforms that can deliver exceptionally good information to help companies reduce cost and carbon emissions.


We are totally committed to delivering an exceptional customer experience. We take our clients on a journey with us and the passion and expertise of our people, alongside our technology solutions, enable us to eliminate their business energy waste so that our clients can focus more energy on powering their business.
We are looking for a 
Energy Analyst
 to join our successful Energy Management team. This role is 
hybrid 
and requires travel to
 Nelson
 twice a week. 


About the role 


The Energy Analyst will report directly to the Team Leader: Energy analytics & Reporting and support them with the analysis and reporting requirements of the wider team including the Head of Energy Management and Senior Energy Managers.


Their key focus will be to assist the S/EMs with the data gathering, analysis and periodic reporting for the various services the team delivers. They will also be responsible for completing Desktop Audits, reviewing their results for data errors, periodically reviewing energy insights data (raising any issues with the EMs) and providing any requested data and administration for services like the CCA management, SECR, ESOS or EMaaS, etc.


Being predominantly office based, the Energy Analyst will be the field teamsâ€™ best point of contact for any data requests or any quick, bespoke analysis. Furthermore, they will be manning the energy control Centre and be responsible for reviewing the systems alarms. Furthermore, they would be best placed to screen clients identified by the Business Generation team for services like, CCA â€“ Min/Met, SECR, etc.


Within this role you will be responsible for:
â€¢ Data provision and management of ongoing reporting for our clientsâ€™ various legislative requirements including: CCAs, SECR, Efficiency projects, load shifting and storage.
â€¢ Liaise with customers & Account Managers to obtain site specific data such as, production, occupancy, Operational times etc, to support the delivery of Energy Management as a Service (EMaaS) contracts.
â€¢ Collect and screen data Carbon reporting (SECR or Netzero).
â€¢ Undertake triage of data alerts for the Energy Control Centre and raise relevant alerts to the Energy managers & Customers.
â€¢ Provision of automatic reports for energy usage patterns to support audit team in identifying energy and carbon reductions.
â€¢ Support in the delivery of feasibility studies, the creation of digital twins for various clients.
â€¢ Collaborate with sales team on business development, acting as a point of reference for EMT services.
Read and comply with the company Health & Safety Policy; taking reasonable care for the Health & Safety of themselves and others; co-operate with managers and other employees in fulfilling our objectives and statutory duties.


Essential Skills and Qualifications:
â€¢ A demonstrably high level of IT literacy with the ability to manipulate, analyse and present data effectively.
â€¢ Experience of explaining data analysis and presenting reports to colleagues both on paper and in person.
â€¢ Experience of data quality management within a working context, working logically within set procedures and regulations.
â€¢ Ability to set own objectives, review progress, work within timescales and determine priorities to see tasks through to a successful outcome.
â€¢ Proven ability to work with others to discuss and agree project scope, deliverables, and timelines.
â€¢ Strong analysis skills and the ability to analyse and interpret data to draw meaningful conclusions.
â€¢ A high level of attention to detail with the ability to implement checks and measures to ensure the quality and integrity of data.


What we offer:
Competitive salary package
Training and development opportunities
Company pension
Flexible work hours
Life insurance


If you are interested in the role and would like to be considered, please apply now and a member of our In House Recruitment Team will be in touch. Good Luck!

The BBCâ€™s world-class online products (iPlayer, News, Sport, Sounds, and more) reach millions of audience members every week. To be able to help us make the right decisions to make our experiences even more valuable for that audience, our teams need to unlock the potential of the vast amounts of data we have.

.

We donâ€™t focus simply on what we do â€“ we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure youâ€™ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.

We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC â€“ whether thatâ€™s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.

This is an excellent opportunity to work within a business with an exciting IT Strategy and roadmap.
 
 
The successful candidate will work closely with the Architecture team and the wider business to design and develop new and extend existing SQL based systems and processes.
 
 
This is a permanent, full-time role working 37.5 hours per week, Monday â€“ Friday on a hybrid basis working from home, with travel to our Manchester (and/or Wigan) office at least 2 days per week. The salary is to be discussed with the successful candidate dependent on previous experience.
 
 
Excellent Benefits
 
25 Days holiday (incremental to 30 days with yearly service) + Bank holidays & Birthday
Competitive pension scheme.
Vitality Private Health Insurance & Rewards including Gym membership, cinema, nutritional advice, health checks, travel & more.
Private Medical Insurance.

Charity Day.
Employee Assistance Programme.
Employee Wellbeing Strategy including Team/Company Away Days, Charity Partnerships, and Company social activities.
Career Development.
Discretionary bonus.


 
 
Key Responsibilities
 
 
Create, develop, and maintain SQL Server systems and processes ensuring optimisation and stability
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security
Database design and documentation
Proficient in creating SQL queries that integrate with other applications
Following change management processes for development, code review, and release.
Testing database processes and performing bug fixes
Fixing any issues related to performance
Implementing best practice for SQL authentication and security
Develop best practices for database design and development activities
Supporting the business in extracting information


 
 
What we are looking for
 
 
5 Years SQL server programming experience; Error Handling, Transaction Management
Query optimisation
Experience of ETL/ELT data processing techniques
Able to challenge the â€˜as isâ€™, look for improvement opportunity
Excellent team working skills

Work with external partners and resources
Microsoft SQL Server training and qualifications plus any previous experience in AZURE; SQL, Data Factories, Power Platform, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) would be desirable


 
 
Calisen is a leading owner and manager of essential energy infrastructure assets, as well as a provider of installation, meter reading, electric vehicle charging, maintenance, and ancillary services through its 3 business units (Calvin Capital, Lowri Beck, and Plug Me In), whose purpose is to accelerate the use of smarter energy for all.
 
 
We will use the information you provide to us to assess your suitability for the role you have applied for. If you are successful, we will carry out a right to work check, background checks including global sanctions, politically exposed persons, adverse media, and basic DBS check. We also have a zero-tolerance approach to the use of alcohol and illegal drugs in the workplace therefore you may also be subject to testing.
 
 
 
Please note this role is being handled by our internal recruitment team and no agency support is required at this time

Overview:
 
Your primary objective will be to support the media workstream by ensuring we are leveraging 1st and 2nd party data through our new Martech tools. You will own our Liveramp Data Connection agenda and create audiences using a wealth of own and partners data to answer brand growth objectives and campaign briefs. Our team is spread across several offices so you can be based either in Nottingham or London to work with the rest of the Digital acceleration team.
 
About the opportunity
 
You will be working with the wider media and digital team to drive and support the data driven marketing mission, working closely with the Media Managers and the Head of Data Strategy. We recently invested in several Martech tools, including Liveramp for Data connection, a CDP and the Adobe suite.
 
We are looking for a Data Analyst to help maximise the investment into this technology by testing and learning about different audiences and segments. You will deliver the implementation of our media and personalisation use cases based on audience insights and performance measures.

â€¢ Partner with our key agency partners (ie: WPP) to ensure they have access and can readily leverage segments created. Optimise media buys along the funnel by leveraging data and supporting the local teams
 
About you

â€¢ SQL Proficiency (ability to write queries and interrogate data)
â€¢ Experience with media and web analytics tools and tag manager

Benefits

â€¢ Onsite staff shop, opticians, gym, coffee shops, cafeteria, dry cleaning service and excellent travel links

No7 Beauty Company is the new face of beauty and creates the best in beauty for everyone.
 
We bring a collection of trusted, affordable beauty brands for every skin type, ethnicity, age, and texture. Weâ€™re proud of our stand-out portfolio of iconic, global beauty brands, including No7, Liz Earle Beauty Company, Botanics, Soap & Glory, Sleek MakeUp and YourGoodSkin.
 
Our collection of inclusive and innovative beauty brands has a rich heritage of over 85 years in beauty and skincare. We are powered by our diverse people, these loved brands and - with listening at the heart of our strategy - a deep understanding of our customers.

job_desc:
Marketing & Data Analyst
 
 
About Gumtree
 
 
Our purpose is to make good finds happen, whether thatâ€™s finding the right buyer for your vintage collectibles or finding a local upholsterer to breathe new life into your sofa.
 
 
As a company we are on a mission to help people trade locally by making buying and selling
simpler, safer and more enjoyable, because we believe everything can find a new purpose (thatâ€™s good for you and the planet).
 
 
Role Outline
 
 
We are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Marketing & Data Analyst to support the Gumtree Marketing proposition, ensuring we are reporting the impacts of our marketing as effectively and as accurately as possible. You will report to the Senior BI Analyst with a dedicated focus to our talented Marketing Team.
 
 
The role will support the enablement of accurate, easy and timely data driven decision-making. Working with stakeholders and the wider teams to generate insights from our in-house data, identify new opportunities and actionable insights across the various marketing channels.
The role of Marketing & Data Analyst will define, monitor, interpret and adjust marketing metrics together with relevant stakeholders and make recommendations as needed to ensure we are optimising campaigns effectively and driving overall marketing effectiveness. Supporting the A&R (Paid / CRM) and Brand team with tracking, reporting and campaign evaluation through robust reporting, attribution modelling real time dashboards and econometric modelling.
 
 
The role will also be required to support on market and competitor insight and analysis, supporting the team strategically with longer term marketing initiatives.
 
 
This role acts as Marketing's voice, working closely with stakeholders to communicate effectively the contribution marketing makes to business performance (vibrancy and revenue), communicating activities, successes and strategy to the wider company, as well as managing questions on performance and ROI.
 
 
You will be well versed in the marketing landscape, and have the ability to connect different data sources for a 360 view of marketing performance. You will understand the balance between long and short term marketing and the full funnel mix.
 
 
Core Responsibilities
 
 
 
Provide analytical insight to channel specialists across the team, with the aim of improving performance, this includes creation and management of dashboards as well as analysis
Determine the best way for Marketing to track performance across all channels, and build out the required models and resources to achieve this (attribution and econometric modelling)
Forecast performance and key metrics
Help design, run and interpret campaign and channel tests
Understand the Gumtree audience and the key customer journeys to feed back insights to Marketing and Product
Understand and help measure the market, competitor performance & future trends


 
 
Skills / Experience Required
 
 
 
Previous experience as a Marketing Analyst working with a diverse set of marketing channels including SEM, CRM, marketing attribution, brand marketing, content marketing and conversion optimization
Solid skills and hands on experience in data retrieval and analysis of complex data sets (e.g. SQL, R or Python)
Previous experience in attribution/mmm/econometric modelling
Experience around visualisation & dashboard design with a focus on business stakeholders needs (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Google Data Studio)
Knowledge of and the challenges of attribution in a modern ecosystem
Strong analytical skills
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to translate concepts for both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with conducting competitive research and analysing benchmarking data is an advantage


 
 
Perks
 
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether youâ€™re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, we offer a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.
 
That's why we're pleased to offer all employees full access to our comprehensive benefits package.
 
This includes:
 
Â· 25 days holiday per year increasing with length of service. ğŸ–ï¸
Â· Company bonus scheme. ğŸ’·
Â· Private health insurance. ğŸ¥
Â· Private dental insurance. ğŸ¦·
Â· Income protection policy. ğŸ’°
Â· Conference & education budget. ğŸ«
Â· Remote / Hybrid / Office based working available* ğŸ’»
 
Diversity & Inclusion at Gumtree
 
Here at Gumtree.com we are on a mission to create a culture where all our teams are inspired to share their passion, talents and ideas with equal opportunities for growth and career development throughout both of our brands.
 
We know that a diverse and inclusive team drives creativity and makes both our brands stronger. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re committed to discovering new talent and employing people who reflect the nature of the society around us, so that when you join Gumtree.com you can be you!

job_desc:
Great that you're thinking about a career with BSI!
 
We are looking for an
 
Insight & Data Specialist
 
to join our Marketing Data & Insight team.
 
This is a new permanent role and a chance to provide a dedicated resource focused on providing the timely and best quality data outputs/extracts to the Group Marketing BI team, streams, sectors, regions, countries, and functions.
 
We are looking for an individual who is passionate about unlocking value from data. The role will also be an excellent opportunity for someone who wishes to build a career in data analysis and provision of strategic insights that drive commercial strategy
 
About The Company
 
BSI is the UKâ€™s National Standards Body, but we are much more than that. We are an international organisation that tackles the problems businesses have by leading the development and embedding of best practices. We help companies access new markets, accelerate innovation, become more resilient and sustainable, and build trusted customer relationships.
 
Standards protect and create trust, but they are only one aspect of our work. Ensuring conformity with standards and regulatory frameworks accelerates our clientsâ€™ ability to improve and grow. Our consulting expertise and insights create a rich environment for innovation. Our work across these interconnected areas unlocks value for clients that is not always apparent when we start.
 
Key Responsibilities
 
 
Accountable for cleansing and preparing data available from our marketing and sales data sources to increase the quality, accuracy and speed of the analysis provided by the BI team to the organization.
Accountable for the extraction of contacts, client data and reports from SQL database (and possibly other BI tools such as Tableau or PowerBI) as per defined criteria received from stakeholders across the organisation.
Responsible for liaising and communicating with stakeholders to ensure their business insight requirements have been understood and captured correctly and data is provided efficiently and effectively within the data governance policy.
Responsible for liaising with the BSI Data team - to report/monitor/follow up on data quality issues, to ensure the accelerated, efficient and effective delivery of business insight reports.
Assist the Data Science Team including the provision of data support to the stakeholders and assistance in the reporting of key insights.
Supported to deliver ad hoc analysis projects â€“ Provision of insight to help stakeholders understand commercial and competitor performance to calculate market share and help identify growth trends.


 
Education/Qualifications
 
What we are looking for:
 
 
Degree in Maths or Statistics or Economics or Engineering or any data-related field
Demonstrable experience in relevant data field


 
Knowledge, Skills & Experience
 
 
Python and SQL - comfortable with both languages
Advanced Excel - handling large data sets for manipulation and aggregation using complex functions
Experience of using data from a variety of sources
Any experience in extracting key insights from data will be favourable
High level of computer skills with excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office software

Knowledge of Tableau or Power BI and B2B data (Desirable)
Data Insights and storytelling (Desirable)
High level of computer skills with excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office software
Ability to interact with stakeholders, understand their requirements and translate them into data outputs


 
What we offer!
 
We offer a highly competitive starting salary with 27 days annual leave with the opportunity to increase this to 30 days, company-paid private medical insurance, an excellent company-contributed pension scheme, and a wide range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your lifestyle.
 
#LI - IF1
 
#LI - HYBRID
 
Our Excellence Behaviours: Client-centric, Agile, Collaborative. These three behaviours represent how we do things at BSI. They help us ensure that BSI is a great place to work and a highly successful business.
 
BSI is conducting face-to-face interviews where appropriate and possible. If you are invited to a face-to-face interview but feel more comfortable with conducting the interview virtually, please speak to a member of our recruitment team.

job_desc:
Tadaweb is a scale-up technology company providing an open-source intelligence (OSINT) platform that magnifies the impact of investigative and analytical teams. Over the past 11 years, Tadaweb has become a leader in the collection and enrichment of information to effectively scale analystsâ€™ impact. Our SaaS platform follows ethical principles, only relying on publicly available information.
 
 
 
Scope of work:
 
 
You will build and maintain relationships with our users and key customer stakeholders.
 
You will train and mentor our customers on our platform to deliver value on open-source data collection and analysis.
 
You will be problem solving daily and helping customers with use cases that push what is technically possible.
 
You act as the voice of the customer internally to communicate feedback and requests to a cross-functional product team.
 
You will research, explore and help implement new technologies to help our customers.
 


 
Your profile:
 
 
Experience with collection of publicly available information, production of OSINT, internet investigations, or thorough online research.

Experience working within a SaaS or digital consultancy environments.

Our offer:

This role will be based in the Tadaweb London office with initial training requiring some travel to our Luxembourg HQ , to meet colleagues and learn the product differentiators, and then ongoing regular travel inside the UK to see customers.
 
Tadaweb is an equal opportunities employer and we strive to have a team with diverse perspectives, experiences and backgrounds. Tadaweb is a supporter of the Armed Forces Covenant and we actively support Service leavers transitioning from the Public to Private Sector.
 
Our culture:

What we can offer you:

That said, we fully appreciate that everyone leads busy lives and we canâ€™t always be in the office. This is why we embrace flexible working. Development:
Your development is key and is a top priority for the team. We offer 3 types of training: externally run consulting courses, externally run bespoke courses and internal courses. Everyone has different training requirements which means everyone has their own training plan. A bespoke training plan will be created for you when you join.
 
 
 
Benefits:

title: Digital Analyst

job_desc:
Are you looking to build your career in one of the worldâ€™s largest research Organisations?
 
Are you curious about how we consume technology, content and entertainment? The Audience Measurement team at Ipsos use deep understanding of people to make sense of audiences and how they consume technology, content and entertainment. We use these to influence media strategy, helping clients to answer crucial questions, such as how to target audiences, maximise attention across platforms, enhance audience experience, and demonstrate or increase audience value.
 
Keen to work on complex mathematical/scientific problems? Have experience using a range of advanced mathematical / physical models / statistical models /machine learning methods? If this is what you are looking for from your next role, then please read on....
 
 
We are recruiting for a
 
Data Scientist
 
who is passionate about solving problems specifically for our Out of Home Advertising team. We are seeking someone with a passion and high competence for mathematics, statistics modelling/understanding and programming skills working on production quality collaborative projects with emphasis on understanding and use of methods algorithms.
 
This is not your average data scientist role, this role is about giving you the autonomy to solve problems which directly impact our daily lives whether it is our television viewing habits, radio listening habits to other forms of media consumption. Creative, innovative, passion, flexibility, adaptability, tenacity and agile, these are just some of the words that describe the culture of our team. This is an opportunity for you to make an impact whilst also having a realistic chance to learn and develop your skills further.
 
 
Audience Measurement is one of Ipsos' global specialisms. Its core research expertise lies in counting and profiling viewers, listeners, readers and users of media. The Audience Measurement data and service is used by marketers and media agencies to manage and measure their advertising investment in media and by the media to help price their product, trade with advertisers and schedule content.
 
Data science is at the very heart of Ipsos projects and provides an important central resource covering large media industry measurement contracts, syndicated surveys and
 
ad hoc
 
insight projects.
 
The Data Science Unit has been created in Ipsos in direct response to the way the converging media and advertising market is moving. Their remit reflects the growing industry importance of Big Data, passive measurement technologies, complex modelling, data visualisation, data integration and calibration methodologies.
 
The roleâ€¦.
You will be an integral member of a team delivering advanced analytics and data science elements of complex research projects and you will continuously develop and extend your skill set.
 
Reporting to a Principal Data Scientist, the role will involve working on state-of-the-art out-of-home audience measurement solutions for domestic and international media markets.
 
What will I be doing?
 
 
This role is a central role in the day-to-day work of our specialised audience measurement data science team. Working in this role, you will be:
Developing and maintaining production quality data science software and pipelines systems for our out-of-home audience measurement contracts
 
Using mathematical modelling and machine learning to model human travel behaviour and demographics
Manipulating complex data from different sources and data processing in R, Python, SQL and Google Cloud Platform
Developing machine learning models with senior data scientist guidance
Writing and maintaining production quality code
Engaging with stakeholders across the business (internal and external).
Managing good professional relationships with clients and internal stakeholders
Advising the product team and stakeholders on how to use the data and analysis and communicating methodology and results


 
What do I need to bring with me?
 
 
Interest in and understanding of a range of mathematical / physical models / statistical models / machine learning methods, including:
Supervised and unsupervised learning, simulation, optimisation, graph theory and model validation
Strong intuition and enthusiasm for data including statistical and machine learning principles
Keen to work on hard mathematical/scientific problems with perseverance important
Competence in and interest in using multiple data sources, including wrangling of complex data
 
Strong programming and desirable experience of deployment of production standard code as part of data science workflows: Python or R - writing functionally and/or OOP
Experience in git with collaborative development of data science workflows / products desirable
Strong team player with ability and willingness to work independently, learn and to share knowledge
An interest in enriching data sets and modelling human and consumer behaviour
Bachelors or Masters in mathematically oriented discipline


 
About us ...
 
Ipsos is one of the worldâ€™s largest market research companies with offices in 90 countries. We are an innovative, entrepreneurial, client-focused organisation, providing research services to over 5,000 clients worldwide. Proudly, we are the only global market research company that is still controlled and operated by market researchers. We aim to be intellectually curious and passionate researchers who set ourselves high standards and aim to work collaboratively to service our clients most effectively.
 
Our culture is unique - we have the entrepreneurial spirit and quirkiness of a small boutique, but we also have the resources, scale and diversity of a large global agency. We have more bright, friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic people, from more backgrounds, with more interests, skills and experiences to learn from. Our values are based on our diverse cultural backgrounds, helping us to be responsive, client-focused and flexible.
 
We are committed to equality, treating people fairly, promoting a positive and inclusive working environment and ensuring we have diversity of people and views. We recognise that this is important for our business success - a more diverse workforce will enable us to better reflect and understand the world we research and ultimately deliver better research and insight to our clients. We understand the importance of choice and offer a blended work environment, office and work from home. We also realise you may have commitments outside of work and will consider all flexible working applications - please highlight what you are looking for when you make your application.
 
If this is what you are looking for from your next role, we look forward to hearing from you!

At Lowell this doesnâ€™t end there, #WeSeeYou when youâ€™re performing your best, or living our values. So we want to ensure that once you get here, youâ€™ll still be going places.

Experience working with Sitecore XP and Sitecore analytics would be a bonus, but not essential.


 
Attitude

Enthusiastic, highly organised and collaborative.

Skills

Technical Skills

st

nd

job_desc:
We are looking for a Financial Crime Analyst to join our team on a full-time basis. We are a friendly team committed to delivering consistent, high-quality client service to the Firmâ€™s offices globally. This role offers an opportunity for someone wanting a career in Financial Crime. In this role you will report to the Head of Financial Crime within the London-based team. You will be part of the Financial Crime Team but will regularly liaise with various teams including New Business Intake team, Conflicts team, Business Intelligence team and wider Risk and Compliance team.
 
Summary of duties
The role will be divided into four core functions â€“ AML, Sanctions, General Financial Crime, and record keeping. The main duties will include but are not limited to:
 
AML:
 
Conducting AML and CDD reviews on a variety of client structures â€“ trusts, corporates, funds, offshore entities etc.
Identifying any potential issues such as AML, bribery as well as potential reputational risks to the business
Carrying out adverse press research, assessing its relevance and excluding false positives
Carrying out searches to identify whether a client is a politically exposed person (â€œPEPâ€) and advising partners and other fees earners on source of wealth and funds checks, in addition to maintaining/updating a PEP register
Carrying out risk assessments at client inception to see whether the prospective client presents a higher than usual risk of money laundering
Applying a suitable risk categorisation for all clients/matters according to the Firmâ€™s Policy, Legal Sector Affinity Guidance, Joint Money Laundering Steering Group Guidance and appropriate national legislation in the relevant EMEA jurisdictions
In addition to AML, understand risk flags associated with tax evasion. Clearly identifying such flags and adjusting the risk rating accordingly
Assisting with regulatory audits
Building effective working relationships with fee earners across the firm, acting as a go to person regarding AML queries
Providing bespoke CDD compilation / business partnership services to various departments and partners in London
Liaising directly with clients either by phone or email, ensuring that an excellent service is delivered at all times
Effectively managing workflow and promptly pushing through new matter requests
Swiftly escalating complex AML issues to the Senior Analyst and Head of Financial Crime
Maintaining an up-to-date knowledge of changes to legislation and regulations
Providing support on key AML / compliance projects
Understanding the Firmâ€™s different practice areas


 
Sanctions:
 
Review escalations from the New Business Intake team related to all EMEA matters
Escalate any potential matches to Head of Financial Crime
Assist Head of Financial Crime in gathering further information to help notify OFSI
Identify matters affected by sanctions and initiate file closure process
Instruct conflicts/NBI teams to insert appropriate block flags in the system
Maintain detailed records of notifications made to OFSI and sanctions regulators in other jurisdictions


 
General Financial Crime:
 
Assisting the Head of Financial Crime with formatting and updating polices relating to different areas of financial crime i.e., Anti-Bribery and Corruption policy, Tax evasion policy, Sanctions etc.
Maintaining annexes and registers related to these policies
Recording and updating tasks involving financial crime work streams
Advising on basic queries relating to financial crime matters


 
Record Keeping:
 
Producing reports on key CDD metrics for all UK clients â€“ automating any manual processes
Analysing data entered in the spreadsheets manually and intelligently converting it into useful metrics using pivot tables, charts and diagrams
Advising on and maintaining a register of ongoing monitoring of clients/matters in accordance with legal/regulatory requirements
Assisting the Risk and Compliance team to create efficient frameworks
Ability to be proactive and suggest improvements to existing methods
Any other ad-hoc tasks as reasonably requested


 
KEY SKILLS:
 
IT Skills:
 
Prior experience of using/implementing Intapp Advance module â€“ testing, liaising with the developers, is a highly preferred skill
Ability to use Microsoft Teams to manage projects/deadlines
Proficient in Excel, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Recording data and effectively reporting on the data collected
Accurately inputting large volume of data into spreadsheets
Ability to efficiently convert numbers and metrics into visual representations using pivot charts, tables, pie charts, graphs and diagrams


 
General
 
 
Experience working in a Financial Crime / AML role, preferably within the legal sector desired but not essential
Ability to communicate with all levels of the firm professionally and tactfully
Flexible and able to adapt to new situations, processes and new technology
Ability to handle a high volume of tasks while maintaining attention to detail and prioritising as necessary
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to provide a high level of service in a fast paced environment
Organisational skills
Project management
Self-motivation with an ability to work independently
Ability to handle confidential information in a discreet manner
Proactive and the ability to prioritise and coordinate work
Ability to think critically and analytically in a pressured environment


 
Education and experience
 
University degree or equivalent
Legal and/or research experience preferred

job_desc:
About Us
 
The world isnâ€™t standing still, and neither is Allstate. Weâ€™re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customersâ€™ evolving needs. Thatâ€™s why now is an exciting time to join our team. Youâ€™ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
 
Youâ€™ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards â€“ a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
 
Allstate operate a very flexible hybrid working policy that will allow you to design your working week in collaboration with your manager with a blend of remote and office working for NI based employees as well as condensed working patterns (4 day week/9 day fortnight) or other part-time working. Employees based in GB will be employed on a permanent remote working contract.
 
Join our team and youâ€™ll find challenge and reward in a culture of innovation, support and balance.
 
 
Location
 
 
Belfast/ Derry â€“ Londonderry/ Strabane/Remote GB
 
 
Your role in the team
 
 
Data, Discovery, and Decision Science (D3) is the research and analytics organization at Allstate. In D3, youâ€™ll be surrounded by 360+ tenacious and intellectually curious colleagues in an inclusive culture that encourages you to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good. We are solving some of todayâ€™s most complicated analytics problems, making the lives of our Allstate colleagues easier and more productive, and driving our mission to deliver targeted insurance solutions to our customers.
 
 
We are partnering to incorporate analytics into every aspect of the enterprise. We are avid about learning new ways to get the most value from our massive data resources and leading-edge technology. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team where everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed. We strive to hire people from different backgrounds so that we can better serve our diverse customer needs.
 
 
This role is responsible for the use and development of data infrastructure projects & proof of concept business solutions for users in analytics and Data Science. This person works directly with data scientists and analytic engineers on needs and tactical solutions. This role will execute new data engineering work tracks for Data Science and analytics from inception and prototyping to fully developed solutions. This role will also manage projects of medium complexity.
 
Want to know more about our department and what we do? Hear what our team has to say about the roles and our work: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T6EC4FXe4Bw
 
 
Key responsibilities include:
 
 
 
 
Work closely with Data Science and business partners requiring subject matter expertise in the business as well as advanced analytics.
 
 
Participate in requirement development, breaking down business problems into solvable components and assists in documenting requirements
 
 
Participates in developing test plans and scripts, preparation of test data, reconciliation of data sources, and execution of functional tests.
 
 
Help develop and deliver the data infrastructure required to support needs of predictive modeling and analytics with minimal supervision
 
 
Execute rapid development of new data and analytic work tracks with fast iteration over quick sprints
 
 
Leverage â€œagileâ€ data analysis with technology fluency in parallel processing/programming, software/programming languages and technologies (i.e. Oracle, MongoDB, SQL, Python, Spark, Kafka, Scala and Hadoop) paired with a high degree of analytic agility to be able to meet fluid and dynamic business needs in this space.
 
 
Provide input on the development of enterprise data assets, information platforms or data spaces designed for exploring and understanding the data. Participate in supporting the data engineering environment, and execute monitoring, quality and validation processes to ensure data accuracy.
 
 
Execute data exploration, data engineering, testing and implementation.
 
 
Participate in and help execute the development of new concepts, proof of concept designs, and prototypes for business or research data solutions so that business users or predictive modelers may visually understand and explore a new feature or functionality before implementation to expose design assumptions and drive ideation.
 
 
Mentor other team members in a business technical environment and promote an environment that supports innovation and process improvement.
 


 
 
So, what are the essential criteria to apply?
 
 
 
 
All candidates must evidence an existing right to work in the UK
 
 
3+ yearsâ€™ experience in a related field developing sophisticated big data pipelinesâ€¯in support of machine learning and advance analyticsâ€¯in industry or postgraduate experience.
 
 
Experience leading technical projects.
 


 
 
We also have some desirable criteria
 
 
 
 
Distributed computing or big data frameworks such as Spark, Mesos, Hadoop, AWS, Scality, etc.
 
 
Programming in Python, Scala, Java or C/C++
 
 
Working with structured relational databases and writing queries (e.g. SQL), nested data structures, stream processed data, or unstructured data
 
 
Machine learning or statistics to solve real-world problems
 
 
Conducting data analytics and root cause analysis to answer business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
 
 
Leading & managing teams of technical individuals
 
 
A degree of any level in a quantitative field such as mathematics, physics or computer science with classification of 2:1 or higher (or equivalent
 


 
 
Previous applicants in the last 12 months need not apply.
 
 
What We Offer
 
As Digital DNAâ€™s Workplace of the Year 2020 & 2022 winners, we offer a generous benefits package that includes flexible annual leave entitlement, dental and healthcare insurance, an attractive pension package and discounts on gym memberships, public transport and parking.
 
Allstate invests heavily in your development, as an employee you will have access to multiple world-class learning platforms and courses from our award-winning in-house Learning & Development team.
 
We pride ourselves in providing clear career paths and opportunities for internal mobility allowing you to further develop within the organisation.
 
We encourage a better work life balance and youâ€™ll have the opportunity to apply for various flexible working arrangements.
 
 
Statement on Fair Employment and Equal Opportunities
 
 
Allstate NI wishes to ensure equal opportunity is given to all job applicants. This company will not discriminate on the grounds of race, gender (including gender reassignment status), sexual orientation, religious belief, political opinion, marital status, age or disability.
 
We are an equal opportunities employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons. However, as women are currently under-represented in our workforce, we would particularly welcome applications from women. All appointments will be made on merit.
 
Applicants should note Allstate NI complete AccessNI background checks on all candidates offered a position.
 
 
The closing date for receipt of applications is Friday 3rd March 2023

job_desc:
About us
 
At HENI we believe in the importance of art, and the power of technology to radically advance and democratize the art industry. Our mission is to make art accessible to everyone, by engaging with and innovating within all aspects of its creation and distribution.
 
HENI prides itself on a connection with and commitment to cutting-edge technology across all our platforms. This is exemplified by our NFT Studio and marketplace, which have launched several fine art NFTs to date, starting with Damien Hirst's The Currency. The Currency NFT collection has been very successful, with over $90M+ USD of secondary market trading since 27 July 2021, a significant amount of which has gone through the HENI NFT marketplace.
 
But HENI is much more than NFT's!
 
HENI has a history in the physical art world and has developed platforms that focus on trading art, art education, art production, and publishing.
 
We also develop apps that use huge quantities of art-related data from across the globe. These apps are both web and mobile and use a variety of machine learning techniques to sort through and make sense of the data. One launched recently was HENI News, an art news aggregation service.
 
Moreover, HENI also has a number of interactive and dynamic customer-facing websites, including e-commerce and streaming services.
 
Everything we develop is in-house and we have very strong engineering and data teams to make all this possible.
 
Technology at HENI
 
Our growing technical team contains a set of very capable Engineers, Data Scientists, DevOps, and supporting staff. We constantly tackle new and challenging problems - some of these solutions have involved developing our own in-house tools using machine learning, artificial intelligence, and augmented reality. Utilising modern cloud infrastructure and coding practices, we pride ourselves on exceeding the expectations of internal and external stakeholders. Using the very best tools, frameworks, and programming standards, including TDD, BDD, and Acceptance Criteria Testing, we aim to create a technical team that leads by example and excels in clean, readable, and modular code.
 
Position overview
 
We are looking for Data Engineers to help manage the massive amounts of data produced in the digital age. You would be joining a strong team of roughly 20 people (data scientists, engineers, and analysts), in a fast-paced and collaborative team environment. Responsibilities include gathering data around art and crypyto-art, to expand our database and allow for commercial insights.
 
Responsibilities will include:
 
 
Writing and maintaining software for digital data collection for hundreds of websites
Developing software to allow for scaling of data gathering across thousands of sources and across multiple team members
Implementing and deploying data acquisition pipelines (e.g. Scrapy, written in Python), process and clean the data, and store accurately into our databases and data lake.
Running and monitoring spiders in the cloud, fixing any bugs or issues when websites changes


 
Your experience should include:
 
 
Ideally at least 2 years' experience in data collection - we largely use Scrapy but experience with other tools and techniques are a plus (such as BeautifulSoup, XPath, Regular Expressions, Selenium, JSON, REST and GraphQL APIs, cURL, etc.)
Proven familiarity with the Scrapy scraping framework and architecture: items, item loaders, pipelines, writing custom middlewares.
Solid knowledge of SQL - safe insertions, aggregating, filtering etc.
Proficient in Python and familiar with best practices in modern software engineering: 12factor, CI/CD, Agile


 
It would be great if you also have:
 
 
Not Essential but advantageous: understanding of Blockchain technologies
Additionally, we'd love to see that you've run and monitored multiple spiders in the cloud, so an understanding of Kubernetes, AWS, data lake (e.g. S3, parquet and jsonl formats) and experience with spidermon would be a great plus.
Knowledge of JavaScript, using rotating proxies and overcoming bot protection mechanisms will be useful
Strong academics in computing or quantitative fields would be advantageous


 
Benefits:
 
 
ğŸ’¸ Competitive Salary
ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’» Dynamic and fast-paced environment
ğŸŒ Fully flexible and remote working options
ğŸ– Competitive and flexible holiday allowance
ğŸ©º Full private healthcare
ğŸ“š Learning budget for personal development
ğŸ¦ Pension matching contribution


 
Our recruitment process
 
The interview process will be conducted remotely. This will involve an interview with our Talent Partner for a short intro video call. Followed by a technical task, a meeting with our Data team, and the final interview with stakeholders between Tech and Data
 
If this sounds like the right place for you please apply and include your GitHub profile and any relevant open-source contributions to illustrate.
 
HENI is an equal-opportunity employer, and we value diversity and inclusion. We welcome people of different nationalities, backgrounds, abilities and perspectives. Please let us know if there are any considerations to help provide fair and equal access.

job_desc:
Join an established international biotech. Process Data Scientist - Slough - Â£22 Per hour 

 Your new company
 
 Our client are an internationally renowned biopharmaceutical company focussing on improving the lives of people living with severe neurological and immunological conditions. Due to an exciting and varied portfolio of antibody therapeutic programmes, there is an opportunity for a talented individual with an interest and in biological process development to work alongside our process development scientists.
 
 Your new role
 
 This role will be responsible for contributing to the generation and analysis of process development data for our antibody-based therapeutics. The work will support the process data evaluation across the various stages of antibody drug process development through to commercial scale, with some attention to micro-scale models and developing their applicability for larger scale.
 
 Successful candidates will be expected to:
 
 * Undertake small-scale process development experiments for fundamental understanding of individual unit operations that may support in silico modelling
 * Assist with the evaluation of new bioprocess technologies
 * Be able to perform the analysis and visualisation data, with the goal of automating the data handling.
 * Able to work as part of a cross-functional team and being an effective two-way communicator
 
 What you'll need to succeed
 
 
Basic knowledge of biological processes and the various processing tools.
Understanding of data analysis with an interest in automation of data processing and in-silico modelling.
Some experience of cell culture and/or antibody chromatography, with an understanding of analytical methods
Strong Bachelor's degree or Masters in a related field (or equivalent experience).
Ideally, we are looking to identify candidates who are currently working within the Pharmaceutical Industry, or who have completed a placement year in a similar field.


 
What you'll get in return
 
 
The role will offer the successful candidate an invaluable opportunity to develop their career within the Biopharmaceutical industry.
Join an international biopharmaceutical.
12 Month contract Â£22 per hour/Â£165 per day
Inside IR35
 


What you need to do now
 
 If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
 If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.
 
Desired Skills and Experience
 
Basic knowledge of biological processes and the various processing tools.
Understanding of data analysis with an interest in automation of data processing and in-silico modelling.
Some experience of cell culture and/or antibody chromatography, with an understanding of analytical methods
Strong Bachelor's degree or Masters in a related field (or equivalent experience).
Ideally, we are looking to identify candidates who are currently working within the Pharmaceutical Industry, or who have completed a placement year in a similar field.

job_desc:
We are seeking an immediately available Data Protections Analyst for a global automotive organisation.
 
The main role is to ensure ongoing compliance of data protection policies and also work on improving the efficiencies across the European Regions, Africa and the Middle East Youâ€™ll help to foster and create a data protection culture and help deliver the Global Data Privacy Initiatives.
Based in the Bracknell Head office on a hybrid basis, youâ€™ll be pivotal part of the compliance team helping to support the annual plan on Data Protection is followed and prepared in line with the quarterly and annual cycles.
The role
In addition to the above, you will also be:
 
Providing ongoing support to all the European Branches and entities in region on data protection regulations, related guidance and internal policy & rules
Facilitating prevention and problem solving of data protection issues and risks within the business.
Managing the email inboxes related to Data Privacy including fulfilling data subject right requests and responses.
Communicating information on other company data breaches, including changes to data protection regulation, guidance, and expectations in the region
Supporting the Data Protection Managers to take appropriate action in the event of data breach within required timescales, including reporting to relevant stakeholders, authorities and regulators.
Software administration and configuration including dashboards and reporting is an advantage, especially OneTrust
 


This role is also responsible for all documentation and guidance needed to evidence and ensure understanding & correct operation of processes ensuring compliance with Regional Privacy Policy, regulations and laws, including how and when to report breaches to the regulator.
So, if you want to work for a global automotive business, assisting the Head of Risk whilst overseeing and managing their Privacy Impact Assessments, highlighting the risks to data subjects and working with the business to reduce risk to the rights and freedoms of data subjects and operation then this would be the perfect opportunity.
What we are looking for:
This role is ideal for someone who is looking to progress their knowledge and understanding, so we are ideally looking for someone who has begun their studying towards a recognised accredited qualification to at least foundation level in Data Protection Act 2018 or the GDPR .
It is also important for candidates to have a good, sound knowledge and working background in data protection; Data Protection Act 2018 and The GDPR across Europe Economic Area states, awareness of privacy across Africa and Middle East would also be useful.
The role is initially for 3 months with the potential to become a permanent opportunity.
 
A brilliant opportunity to join a progressive organisation who are experiencing continued success. This is a real chance to experience a fast paced, ever-changing environment where you will be an integral member of some exciting projects! The role is inside IR35 and the equivalent annual salary is Â£41k.
You will enjoy a 35 hr week and a hybrid working model which requires 50% of the working month based at the Bracknell office.
 
Excellent working environment and 1pm finish on a Friday!
title: Data Protection Analyst

job_desc:
The Fraud Data Analytics team has a fantastic opportunity for a Financial Crime Analytics Analyst to join the team on a permanent basis. The role can be based in Birmingham, Bournemouth, Brentwood, Croydon, Ipswich or Leeds. This is a hybrid contract and you will be required to work from the office a minimum of 2 days a week with the flexibility to work from home for the rest of the week.
 
About the Role
 
The position is full-time but we recognise that a number of our employers work flexibly in many different ways, from part-time, flexi-time, job shares, an element of working from home or compressed hours. If you are interested in applying but currently work flexibly, let the resourcing team know. If itâ€™s right for our customers, our business and for you, then we'll do everything we can to make it happen.
 
As an Analytics Analyst you will use data tables and analysis techniques to identify fraud risk for our claims and policy fraud teams. You will assist with the development of strategic analytical solutions that provide added value to customers and key stakeholders and complete root cause analysis on policy / claims fraud to combat current, emerging and future risks.
 
About You
 
Do you have an understanding of General Insurance end to end processes and products? Or experience in a Financial Crime team? Or experience of SQL coding, BI report writing and strong presentation skills?
 
Or are you a recent graduate with a keen interest in Fraud Insurance with a degree/equivalent in either Data, Statistics or Mathematics?
 
You will have excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to be persuasive or influencing and respond objectively when challenged.
 
Experience working in a data intensive environment with good problem solving, decision making or an analytical mind set â€“ thinking objectively with good numerical and analytical skills with an interest to develop and learn new data analytics skills.
 
You will have the ability to learn and keep abreast of new developments in the regulatory environment, with excellent time management skills â€“ being able to manage your own workload and prioritise accordingly.
 
The Details
 
 
Carryout MI analysis to identify fraud trends, establish key risk indicators and provide recommendations.
Deliver action control reports and profiling requests from internal stakeholders within SLA
Assist with the delivery of fraud technology projects
Assist with the development of fraud risk validation models and scorecard production
Identify areas for change delivery, reducing leakage, improving the customer journey and optimising department efficiency
Provision of training, support and development of the fraud teams on the use of intelligence tools, machine learning models and data sources
Produce ad-hoc and regular reports with recommendations to mitigate fraud risk


 
Skills required
 
 
 
Knowledge of Excel / Power Pivot / BI reporting tools essential
Knowledge of Python and/or SQL or the desire to learn a coding language essential
Knowledge of fraud in an insurance policy or claims setting advantageous
Experience using the SIRA platform / Other fraud detection software desirable
Understanding of relational database structures and basic data architecture desirable
Experience using Databricks desirable
Basic understanding of machine learning techniques desirable


 
Why Work for Us?
 
 
Exciting things are happening at LV=General Insurance (LV=GI). Having recently become part of the Allianz family, weâ€™re proud to be one of the largest personal insurers in the UK.
 
Driven by our pride and passion, we will always do the right thing to inspire trust in our people and our customers. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™ve made it our mission to become Britainâ€™s best-loved insurer, by helping people look after what they love.
 
About the Rewards
 
This role is an Associate Cluster in the LV= Structure. We want you to love what you do thatâ€™s why weâ€™ve put together a benefits package that recognises and rewards a job well done.
 
 
Weâ€™ll give you:
 
 
Flexible working opportunities â€“ many of our employees job share or work part-time, flexi-time, or compressed hours. Our new hybrid working model now offers all employees the option to work from home 3 days a week and 2 days in the office.
26 days' holiday â€“ which increases after two yearsâ€™ service to 28 days
A competitive pension for which LV= will pay twice the amount you pay, up to 14%
 
An annual bonus scheme based on company and personal performance
A flexible benefits package (e.g. discounted retail vouchers, great value dental insurance)
Gympass
A generous 25% discount off our general insurance products including home, pet and travel as well as up to 50% discount on your car insurance.


 
LV= is an equal opportunities employer who values a diverse and inclusive workplace. We recognise that people work in different ways, and we value alternative viewpoints, celebrate individuality and foster a culture where everyone can bring their true self to work. We are committed to creating a diverse workforce, we accept applications from everyone regardless of your background, beliefs, culture, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disabilities and long term health conditions.
 
Here at LV= we always love to hear from great people, so donâ€™t forget to follow us on Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn and become a fan on Facebook.
 
Apply
 
If you share our ambition and our passion, join us on our journey. You can help us shape our new future together.
