job_desc:
Company Description
 
As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
 
At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
 
You're
 
an Individual.
 
We're
 
the team for you.
 
Together
, let's transform the way the world pays.
 
Job Description
 
If you think you could support Visa as a Consulting Analyst in the Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA) team, we want to hear from you â€“ together, letâ€™s make Visa a great place to work.
 
What's it all about?
 
Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) drives tangible, impactful and financial results for Visa clients. Drawing on our expertise in strategy consulting, data analytics, brand management, marketing, operations and technology, VCA solves strategic problems and identifies opportunities for Visaâ€™s issuers, acquirers and merchants.
 
Typical projects may include:
 
 
How does an issuer expand or increase market share in consumer market?
How should a credit card issuer use emerging technology to acquire the best customers?
How does an issuer expand their credit card portfolio while mitigating credit risk?
How does an issuer optimize their revenues?
How do we enable increases spend in specific segments?


 
What we expect of you, day to day:
 
 
Support the VCA team in the delivery of projects for Visa clients across various domains, from payments, digital, products to strategy.
 
Assist in the delivery of detailed data gathering and analysis to obtain valuable insights.
 
Support our project managers in the delivery of projects to understand effective project management
Perform market and trend analyses using Visaâ€™s comprehensive global market research capabilities and data tools
Support in developing Thought Leadership to learn about the future of payments and retail banking
Act as part a global team experiencing the power of big global technology company
Support strategy to market activities including but not limited to workshops, client meetings, content development etc.
 
Support the development and maintenance of VCA service sales and delivery collateral (toolkit)
Support the VCA team with ongoing operations, administration and team building activities


 
Qualifications
 
What we're after...
 
 
Previous experience at a large management consulting firm or similar role at Banks/FIs, with proven project deliveries and expertise in consulting methodologies
Bachelor's or Masterâ€™s degree or equivalent
 
International student exchange would be an asset
Proactive, curious, with experience of being a self-starter and has a willingness to learn
Presenting attitude to think creatively and identify new ways to innovate
Problem solver with demonstrated thought leadership
Flexible, adaptable and able to think quickly
Comfortable juggling multiple projects while quick to adapt to shifting priorities
Demonstrated teamwork and relationship-building skills
Evidence on excellent communication skills
Confident communication style and ability to appropriately engage with senior stakeholders
Proven ability to thrive in high pressure situations and a fast paced and matrixed environment
 
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills - highly proficient in PowerPoint, Word, and Excel
Comfortable managing spreadsheets, devising formulas, and performing data analysis, while also building Executive presentations
Additionally, an internship experience in financial or payment services gained ideally in consultancy practice, payment scheme or retail bank would be an asset


 
Additional Information
 
This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office two days a week, Tuesdays and Wednesdays with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% of the time based on business needs.
 
Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.
title: Consulting Analyst, Visa Consulting

job_desc:
OPEN Health brings together deep scientific knowledge, global understanding, and broad specialist expertise to support our clients in improving health outcomes and patient wellbeing.
 
 
We are united as one flexible organization, harnessing the power of the collective to solve complex challenges. Being built from cohesive partnerships across a range of specialist sectors gives us the ability to approach opportunities from fresh perspectives, creating solutions and innovations for market access and medical communications that are informed by the experience and knowledge of the many.
 
 
Our global team of experts â€” many with PhD and PharmD degrees â€” work strategically alongside our client partners in Medical Affairs, Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR), Market Access, and Commercial teams across a wide range of therapy areas.
 
 
You will love this role if you:
 
Have a passion for making complex data palatable for your audience
Like working closely with front-end developers and data analysis teams to produce cutting-edge reports
Enjoy working within health informatics or have a keen interest in this area


 
As part of the OPEN Health Real World Evidence team, you will be responsible for the following activities:
 
Providing expertise regarding SQL queries including writing, indexing, optimisation, and best practice
Extracting, transforming and loading data from raw text files into MS SQL Server and providing data from MS SQL to My SQL
Working alongside our development team to provide support and data expertise
Managing the overall structure of the data warehouse databases, including import/export processes and data accuracy

Working independently and as part of the data analyst team to provide data insights
Working in Excel including pivot tables and cell calculations/functions
Ensuring all data imported and produced are factually correct and meet the requirements of the data specified
Ensuring all data import tasks are delivered within pre-agreed timelines to meet the specification
Making suggestions to improve the data warehouse through enhanced processes


 
What youâ€™ll bring:
 
Experience with SQL Server 2016+ with Excellent T-SQL skills
Experience across MS BI Stack â€“ SSAS, SSIS, SSRS with particular strength/experience in SSAS (Tabular & Multidimensional)
Experience with scripting DAX is desirable
Strong data modelling and data warehousing development experience
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and effectively use teamwork skills to interact and collaborate on alternative approaches to issues
Excellent communication and listening skills
Experience with NHS data a plus


 
What we offer:
As a global organization, OPEN Health is committed to supporting our employees and their families through a comprehensive benefits program
 
Competitive pay, generous paid vacation and holidays, and health insurance programs across all our locations
Ongoing training and development opportunities which foster and shape your individual career path
An active and growing commitment to bettering the communities our employees call home through our Corporate Social Responsibility program
The opportunity to thrive in a global, collaborative environment while working every day to improve health outcomes and patient wellbeing
Diverse, inclusive culture that encourages you to bring your whole self to work


 
If we sound like the sort of business environment in which you would thrive, then we would love to hear from you.
 
Key Words: Structured Query Language (SQL), SQL, MS BI Stack, SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, SQL Developer, Data Engineer Tableau, DAX, MDX, ETL, TSQL,

job_desc:
Job Title:
 
Market Data Analytics Specialist
Location:
 
London
Corporate Title:
 
Vice President
The Chief Risk Office function has Group-wide responsibility for the management and control of all credit, market, operational, enterprise and liquidity risks and has the responsibility of continual development of methods for risk measurement, frameworks and creating a Bank wide strong risk culture. Deutsche Bank has been named Bank Risk Manager of the Year by the publication risk.net for the second consecutive year (2020 & 2021).
You will be working in the Market Data Strategy and Analytics (MDSA) team in Market & Valuation Risk Management. As part of the MDSA team, you will have the opportunity to work on Fundamental Review of the Trading Book (FRTB) on a fast-paced and high-impact project. Our market data analysts are working with cutting-edge methodologies to provide best-in-class market data time series as inputs into the risk models. You will work on innovative projects involving Machine Learning and statistical techniques, not only to generate high quality historical market data but also to forecast trends.
What weâ€™ll offer you
A healthy, engaged, and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. Thatâ€™s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its centre.
You can expect:
 
Hybrid working arrangements with the opportunity to work in the office and remotely from home
Competitive salary and non-contributory pension
30 daysâ€™ holiday plus bank holidays, with the option to purchase additional days
Life Assurance and Private Healthcare for you and your family
A range of flexible benefits including Retail Discounts, a Bike4Work scheme and Gym benefits
The opportunity to support a wide-ranging CSR programme + 2 daysâ€™ volunteering leave per year


Your key responsibilities
 
Quantitative modelling of market risk data using machine learning and statistical techniques
Provide subject matter expertise related to market data especially in the Interest Rate asset class
Developing proxy methodologies for risk factors across asset classes
Data validation and forecasting
Prototyping leading to deployment in production
Design and implement market data framework compliant with principles of FRTB, working closely and collaborating with Front Office, Risk Methodology, and information technology teams


Your skills and experience
 
Educated to Masters/PhD degree level in a numerate field (such as Quantitative finance, Mathematics, Physics) or equivalent qualification/work experience
Strong quantitative skills including a good mastery of Probability, Statistics, Derivatives Pricing Theory
Strong understanding of Market Risk framework underlying Pillar 1 and Pillar 2 models including new regulations (such as FRTB)
Experience in designing system use cases, testing new methodologies
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal


How weâ€™ll support you
 
Training and development to help you excel in your career
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
We value diversity and as an equal opportunitiesâ€™ employer, we make reasonable adjustments for those with a disability such as the provision of assistive equipment if required (for example, screen readers, assistive hearing devices, adapted keyboards)


About us and our teams
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. Click here to see what we do.
Our values define the working environment we strive to create â€“ diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
 
Click here to find out more about diversity and inclusion at Deutsche Bank.

job_desc:
Puffy
 
is one of Americaâ€™s fastest-growing e-commerce retailers. Our award-winning mattresses are developed with unrivaled attention to detail and are loved by millions of sleepers in America and Canada.
 
Since entering the bed-in-a-box market in 2016, we have experienced consistent and considerable year-on-year growth. . With this role, you will help guide our team into the future of digital marketing and e-commerce. You will proactively analyze data from different sources to optimize investment, audience, and content mix ultimately driving ROI.

Puffy Perks & Benefits:
 
 
â€œWe challenge the status quo.â€ Work with young and supportive colleagues. The leadership team are highly entrepreneurial, it reflects. Ideas, challenges, think tanks, it is all in your day to day.

job_desc:
Aston Martin is built upon the passion, skill and creativity of the people who dedicate their working lives to the most iconic brand in the world. Every intricate stitch beautifully expressed line, and the stirring noise of our engines is a manifestation of the desire and collective spirit to create the most beautiful cars: the soul of Aston Martin made real.
 
To ensure the Parts Supply function supports business critical customs compliances, to optimize material planning and material flow, and to provide an associated analytical function.
 
 
To take the lead role in Aston Martin Parts Operations to collate all Customs compliance data that is required to enable the export of parts to any markets where trade barriers exist or may exist in the future, to ensure the avoidance of legal infringements in respect of Customs regimes. This will include Country of Origin data, Commodity Code, safety data, China CCC, WEEE data
To support the Logistics function with any queries relating to customs compliance to ensure the parts are shipped to the dealer network in a timely and efficient manner, this will include liaison with Suppliers, Customs bodies, and the Chamber of Commerce
Support the Inventory management objectives by taking a lead in identifying Parts where supersessions need implementing and stock can be given to production to reduce to cost of inventory and optimise warehouse capacity
Assist the Senior Planner in supporting Aston Martin Racing parts requirements, to include analysis of stock availability, weekly reporting on availability to AMR, expediting orders, and liaising with Gaydon MP&L to ensure AMR parts requirements are fully supported in line with build requirements
Take ownership and day to day running of Parts internal scheduled requirements on Gaydon assembly areas incl. Tub, Trim, BIW facilities, to include provision of weekly schedule, ensuring urgent customer requirements are built into the weekly call requirement, liaison with MP&L to ensure all parts are available on time as required.
Support the buying team with QAF analysis, analysis of ordering patterns to ensure batch/cost optimisation, ad-hoc analysis as required
Prepare and distribute essential Key Parts Supply team metrics, including Back-order reporting and critical parts availability reporting
Analysis of these data sets and the creation of workstreams to manage identified trends and concerns
 


 
Previous experience in a data analysis role
Excellent attention to detail
 


Belong at Aston Martin

We understand that the incredible beauty, craft and art that defines an Aston Martin comes from the inclusion of our amazing people.

We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, opinions, culture, ethnicity, race, sex, gender identity and expression, nation of origin, age, languages spoken, colour, religion, disability, sexual orientation and beliefs. We celebrate diversity and are seeking applicants who can bring something different. Please speak to us if there is anything you need to support making an application with us.

We are looking for an experienced Salesforce Business Analyst to join the programme team of a leading global media tycoon in their London Office.

job_desc:
About Smart Data Foundry
Smart Data Foundry has a purpose to unlock the power of financial data as a force to improve peopleâ€™s lives.
We are mission-led, looking to tackle big issues such as climate, the cost of living and inspiring financial innovation to improve peopleâ€™s lives across the economy, society and the environment.
Joining Smart Data Foundry on this journey is about being part of a not-for-profit organisation where youâ€™d be welcomed in an inclusive environment, learning and collaborating with some of the most talented people in the industry.
Smart Data Foundry is on the lookout for a talented people that share this ambition and can make a real difference in helping deliver our missions.
What we do
â€¢ Research: We carry out research into financial lives by unlocking the power of financial data.
â€¢ Consultancy: Collaborating with leading financial services institutions to deliver on our missions
â€¢ Innovation: Making change happen through data-driven innovation, empowering Fintechs and institutions in the financial services ecosystem.
Data is at the heart of our company with focus on the safe and secure provision of commercial data for research as well as the creation and provision of advances synthetic data for research and innovation.
 
Role Purpose
Our Data Engineer develops data management tooling and processes which will support the Data Science team and other users of our research data environments, and will contribute to our Data Synthesis capabilities by helping us process, package, and generate large amounts of synthetic data
 
Key Responsibilities
Â· Working as part of the scrum team to build a cloud-based data driven SaaS platform from the ground up.
Â· Contributing to the design and development of a data processing architecture and ongoing pipeline optimisation.
Â· Working with data scientists, product owners and customers to elaborate and deliver on team commitments.
Â· Undertaking development and evaluation of rapid prototypes to test features with end users and support tool selection.
Â· Working with customers and partners to integrate APIs and integration of data from multiple data sources.
Â· Monitoring system performance and contributing to infrastructure optimisation considering utility and cost.
Â· Testing, documentation and mentoring of less experienced software engineers and quality engineers.
Â· Delivering exceptional customer support.
 
Essential Know How
Essential
â€¢ Proven programming experience with Python and SQL.
â€¢ Good understanding of software development practices such as code reviews, unit testing, TDD, source management, continuous integration, and releasing software to live environments.
â€¢ Knowledge of large-scale data processing technologies, for example: Hadoop, Cassandra, Spark, Hive, or Databricks.
â€¢ Strong experience of batch ETL, data warehousing, database querying and building secure and scalable applications in a cloud-based environment, preferably AWS.
 
Nice to have
â€¢ Experience of working with infrastructure and containerisation tools such as Terraform, Kubernetes and Docker.
â€¢ Experience with modern software architecture paradigms such as microservices, event-driven, & serverless.
 
Right to Work in the UK
Applicants must have the existing and ongoing right to work in the U.K. without restrictions as sponsorship for visas is not provided.
If invited for interview you will be required to evidence your right to work in the UK.
 
Benefits
A collaborative, innovative and impactful place to work. We give you support, nurture your talent and reward success. You will benefit from a competitive reward package which includes 40 days annual leave (including 6 bank hols), a defined contribution pension scheme (14% employer and 4.5% minimum employee contribution rates), family friendly initiatives and flexible working.
Smart Data Foundry is currently based in the Bayes Centre, Potterrow, Edinburgh and our employees work flexibly with a mix of home and office working to suit the needs of the role and the individual. Our future long term home will be the Edinburgh Futures Institute Building on Lauriston place.

Collaborate with colleagues & translate insights into metrics that can be integrated into our customer-facing dashboards & marketing resources.

 Strong ecological statistics background with experience of exploring & analysing large ecological community datasets.

We are advocates of a healthy work life balance and mental wellbeing. We are happy to look at flexible working options for all our roles.


At NatureMetrics diversity and inclusion are part of our DNA. Together, we continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. Job description:
 
INTRODUCTION
 
At Burberry, we believe creativity opens spaces. Our purpose is to unlock the power of imagination to push boundaries and open new possibilities for our people, our customers and our communities. This is the core belief that has guided Burberry since it was founded in 1856 and is central to how we operate as a company today.
 
 
We aim to provide an environment for creative minds from different backgrounds to thrive, bringing a wide range of skills and experiences to everything we do. As a purposeful, values-driven brand, we are committed to being a force for good in the world as well, creating the next generation of sustainable luxury for customers, driving industry change and championing our communities.
 
 
JOB PURPOSE
 
We are looking for a Business Analyst to work across multiple Product projects, bridging the gap between business needs and technical requirements on technology and reporting projects in the portfolio.Â  You will work in partnership with business experts and technology teams to identify & implement solutions to meet the needs of evolving business models.Â  This role is reporting to the Senior Business Analyst â€“ Core Product
 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
 
 
Prepare and facilitate workshops by assimilating existing process content, identifying knowledge gaps, setting up the workshop agendas, identifying participants & creating workshop materials.
Work at varying levels of detail, ranging from high level discussion at the start of the project, to capturing detailed requirements and working with the testing teams to scope and document test scripts.
Communicate requirements to enterprise data and information leads, solution leads and development teams working collaboratively to develop solutions.
Understand and visualise process changes in collaboration with business stakeholders
Understand and uphold enterprise data and information principles in the development of both system and reporting solutions.
Liaise closely with project/programme managers and Solution Architects to govern scope and manage any change requests.
User Acceptance Testing of all solutions and reports working with project/Programme managers to prioritize defect fixes.
Maintain and help to govern consistent Business Analysis methodology and ways of working across your stream and the wider domain.
Deliver end-user training and hyper care support.
Transfer knowledge to BAU owners at close of projects.


 
PERSONAL PROFILE
 
Qualifications and Skills
 
 
 
Business systems analysis experience and related Product and Raw Material Development experience
Knowledge of PLM processes (preferably FlexPLM) and SAP

Our CEO & Board have positioned â€˜using data to better serve customersâ€™ as one of our 4 strategic pillars of our business and this investment intends to keep us ahead of the curve in the pet care industry.
To achieve this, we have built an internal analytics capability, the Petcare Analytics Group, that creates value by helping our business to make better decisions that improve pet welfare, enable a brilliant customer experience and optimise the working practices of our colleagues and partners.
 
About the role
As part of our expansion of the Petcare Analytics Group, we are looking for a Data Scientist to join our existing Data Science team.
As a Data Scientist, you will help deliver transformational projects centred around predictive modelling, optimisation and marketing personalisation.
Key responsibilities will include:

About your experience

Strong SQL skills and extensive experience of working with large-scale data warehouses is essential. You'll also have experience of analytical programming languages such as R/ Python/ Scala.
Further key experience/attributes includes;

Experience with Geographic Information Systems and an understanding of geospatial analytics methods is (desirable but not essential)
Experience with attribution modelling within a marketing context (desirable but not essential)
Highly numerate with a solid understanding of statistics and the ability to translate complex analysis to non-technical stakeholders.
Demonstrable experience of managing end-to-end data science projects, from understanding business needs, combining relevant data sources and building solutions, to creating commercial success through measurable deployment


 
Our diversity and inclusion vision is that everyone is welcome and feels part of our group. About the Pets at Home Group
At Pets at Home we have an ambitious plan, to become â€œThe Best Pet Care Business in the worldâ€ and a key part of delivering this in sustainable way will be our most cherished assets: our People and our Culture. We are a business built on strong values and behaviours which guide everything we do. These are our foundations which will help us to deliver our better world pledge to create a better world for pets and the people who love them.
The Pets at Home Group includes over 450 stores, over 310 Groom Rooms and 440 First Opinion Vet Practices. Itâ€™s fast-paced, innovative, fun and we put people at the very heart of everything we do. We are committed to developing a culture of inclusivity where everyone is able to come to work and be themselves, a culture which welcomes everyone irrespective of what makes us all unique.

Autonomous solutions design and implementation


 
Unconventional Industrial Solutions
 
The UIS team consists of over 40 specialist practitioners located across the UK, Southeast Asia and Australia, and provides data-driven solutions for complex industrial problems.
 
We complement conventional engineering approaches to solving problems, by leveraging subject matter expertise and domain knowledge alongside simulation-driven design, data science and machine learning.
 
Our solutions increase operational safety and protect against losses, while optimised asset designs, operational parameters and maintenance strategies deliver significant savings.
 
 
Machine Learning
 
 
Skilled at building predictive models to solve a wide range of problem types, choosing the right approach(es) to maximise performance. Seeks constantly to broaden repertoire of ML approaches used. Able to work in a variety of machine learning applications and coding libraries.
Can demonstrate hands-on experience in at least four of the following machine learning applications: Regression, Classification, Clustering, Dimensionality Reduction, Deep Learning (AI), Reinforcement Learning, Optimisation.
Au fair with current machine learning tools and platforms such as Python, IBM, Knime, Github, R, Spark, Weka, Amazon ML, Azure ML etc.


 
Analytical Knowledge
 
 
Design an analytical project incorporating the right approaches and datasets to solve a given problem
Mine data to understand its quality and distribution, informing model choice and transformations needed
Perform statistical tests on model output to assess performance and ensure the validity of conclusions.


 
Applied Analysis and Insight
 
 
Draw on domain expertise to choose the most appropriate analytical approach.
 
Work with customers and subject matter experts throughout a project to ensure data is interpreted correctly and solutions are viable.
 
Present models to non-technical audiences in compelling business-oriented terms.
Present data in a visually compelling and elegant way making it easy to interpret and draw conclusions
Experience in analysis of IOT/Sensor Data to solve problems in an industrial setting.


 
Technical
 
 
Write code to access and process diverse data types from a range of on-prem and cloud sources.
 
Familiar with cloud computing and big data technologies (Azure, AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Snowflake etc).
Comfortable working on data platforms, such as Snowflake or Databricks, to manipulate data to engineer model features.
Familiarity with the technologies used to validate, monitor and deploy ML models (Tensorflow, ML Flow, AWS Studio, Docker, Kubernetes etc).


 
Softer Skills
 
 
Spend time with customers to fully understand the challenges and the nuances of their organisation and data.
Develop generalised approaches to solving problems in models and code.
 
Bring data and analytics to life through storytelling, and excellent written and verbal skills
Be comfortable working in Agile project-management frameworks.


 
 
Undergraduate/Masters degree in STEM or other numerate subjects. Plus 3 or more years relevant working experience.
 
OR
 
PhD in a relevant field (Machine Learning, Industrial Analytics etc.) plus one year commercial experience
 
 
Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.
 
Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.
 
If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.
 
 
Worley
 
Primary Location
 
GBR-GL-London
 
Other Locations
 
GBR-GC-Glasgow, GBR-NWE-Manchester, GBR-AC-Aberdeen, GBR-SOT-Stockton, United Kingdom
 
Job
 
Digital Platforms & Data Science
 
Schedule
 
Full-time

Employee

Experienced

Feb 10, 2023

Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning
Job Type:
 
Permanent

London, United Kingdom
 
 
Ready to utilise your extensive
 
Machine Learning experience
?

the charge of the AI/ML
 
domain across an industry solutions unit?
 
Join Tata Consultancy Services as an
 
Article Intelligence Machine Learning!
 
Careers at TCS: It means more.
TCS is a purpose-led transformation company, built on belief. We donâ€™t just help businesses to transform through technology. We support them in making a meaningful difference to the people and communities they serve - our clients include some of the biggest brands in the UK and worldwide. For you, it means more to make an impact that matters, through challenging projects which demand ambitious innovation and thought leadership. For you, it means more to make an impact that matters, through challenging projects which demand ambitious innovation.

Influence the development and enhancement of services, products, and systems.
Work across diverse teams, perspectives and opinions and quickly build consensus.


 
The Role
 
 
Research, evaluate, and implement artificial intelligence algorithms specific to the use cases relevant to the solutions unit.
Diagnose high level business needs, analyse business processes, data flows, IT / technical artifacts and extract understanding of how the system or business process works as input for solution development. Identify high-value ML business opportunities and work with Business and IT stakeholders to realize business benefit.
Use deep subject matter/ technical expertise, influence, and process skills to help internal/external customers and stakeholders. Identify and meet their high priority needs while considering important external and sustainability implications.
Proactively develop, maintain, and evangelize technical knowledge in Machine Learning and adjacent technologies.
Drive an â€œAI driven and AI embedded product development cultureâ€ across the unit by installing the core principles and propagating them across the unit. Guide and support the junior data scientists / machine learning engineers on the team.
Ensure POCs and solutions are delivered in-line with best-in-class architecture, road map and to the industry leading standards and best practices. Build ML architectures that follow green development initiatives aligned with sustainability goals.
Practice and ensure code quality and standards, deployment and change management processes, and ML Ops practices (like retraining, feature engineering, monitoring).
Maintain a solid understanding of up and downstream impacts implementing solutions using ML technologies.
Engage early in project efforts to analyse current solutions, provide solution options and recommendations, understand business process impact, and provide accurate estimates.
Establish development and delivery best practices for ML implementations to minimize rework and maintenance cost. Build ML architectures that work at scale.


 
 
Your Profile
 
Key skills/knowledge:
 
 
 
Possess deep functional and technical understanding of the Machine Learning technologies (Googleâ€™s Cloud Platform, Azure cloud platform) and leverage it across the complex and diverse landscape of the solution unit.
Strong understanding of how business operates, and how to harness data and analytics to meet business needs).
Ability to develop and deploy advanced analytical models and algorithms that drive profitable growth, predictable patterns, and areas of opportunity.
Aide adoption of ML solutions within the business by conducting training, coordinating demos.
Extensive Machine Learning experience and involvement in packaged platform delivery and management.
Strong working knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (Regression, Clustering, Decision Tree, Probability Networks, Neural Networks, Bayesian models etc.).
Experience with Machine Learning and related technologies such as Python, TensorFlow, Torch, Amazon Sage Maker, Databricks, Snowflake, Jupiter Notebooks.
Understanding of cloud platforms, cloud data engineering and integration concepts.
Understand of big data, handling, and processing.
Good to have:
Extensive experience in the retail and/or supply chain systems and deep knowledge of their business practices.
Delivery experience in Data Movement Technologies and Cloud Data Warehouse technologies including but not limited to experience with Azure, GCP, Databricks, Big Query, Google Cloud Storage.
Agile development skills and experience.


 
Rewards & Benefits
TCS is consistently voted a Top Employer in the UK and globally. Our competitive salary packages feature pension, health care, life assurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources and discounts within the larger Tata network.
 
Diversity, Inclusion & Wellbeing
At TCS, we believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity motto is â€˜Inclusion without Exceptionâ€™.
 
Youâ€™ll find a welcoming culture and many internal volunteering and social networks to join. Our diversity, inclusion and social activities include LGBTQ+ and mental health networks, as well as health and wellness initiatives and sports events (we even sponsor the London Marathon).
 
TCS celebrates inclusion without exception. We are open to all and treat applications equally, regardless of ethnicity, disability, gender, age, sexual orientation, or beliefs.

s.neha30@tcs.com

Join us and do more of what matters. Apply online now.

job_desc:
Junior Data Engineer
 
Alvarez & Marsal
 
London
 
Alvarez & Marsal (â€œA&Mâ€)
 
has, over recent years, become one of Europeâ€™s most vibrant and dynamic providers of Restructuring, Turnaround and Performance Improvement advisory services to a multitude of clients across the region. As a result of several high profile and headline worthy acquisitions of senior staff, new clients and leadership mandates, A&M is now considered a market leading and highly sought-after professional services firm.
 
The opportunity
 
Over the past year, A&M Europe has transformed its internal Management Information systems creating new data pipelines and building out analytical and visualisation capabilities to provide real-time insight to the business. Due to an increasing demand from the business for these tools and insights we are now looking for a
 
recent Graduate
 
to join the team to continue this journey.

Junior Data Engineer
, you will be responsible for collecting business requirements, building out ETL processes and, creating and developing Management Information Systems. You will work with all our practice areas including Private Equity Performance Improvement, Corporate Transformation Services, Disputes & Investigations, and Financial Services Advisory.

Will have an entrepreneurial spirit and not be afraid to challenge the status-quo


 
 
 
A 2:1 Bachelorâ€™s degree from an accredited university or equivalent work experience
Experience building and maintaining relational databases especially within MS SQL Server
Experience in SQL and/or another coding language (Python, R)
An understanding of technologies involved in data management (Database management systems, data services, data lakes, etc.).
Experience in utilising data to solve business/financial problems
Previous use of Microsoft Power Platform
Data focused masterâ€™s degree or relevant analytical work experience preferred but not essential
Finance or accounting experience advantageous


 
What can we offer you?
 
 
A&M expects high performance and rewards individual contributions to the teamâ€™s success with solid career progression in a highly meritocratic environment.
The opportunity to work for a dynamic global organization and deal with the complexities of a pan-European business.
The ability to learn by working closely with senior management in a flat structure.
The chance to develop independent thinking and challenge the status quo through minimal layers of management.

job_desc:
Picture yourself at one of the world's most innovative companies providing life-saving AI solutions that can make a real difference in helping to combat one of the worldâ€™s biggest health burdens. Surrounded by teams and people who challenge you, support you, and inspire you to be extraordinary. Are you ready to join the fight against heart disease?
 
We are redefining Cardiology through transformational AI solutions and work alongside major collaborations such as Mayo Clinic and the NHS England, with one shared ambition, to save lives.
 
Ultromics is a global technology firm that is unlocking the full potential of cardiac ultrasounds with ground-breaking SaaS solutions that empower healthcare professionals to make fast, accurate decisions when diagnosing cardiovascular disease. Our core product, EchoGo, is the worldâ€™s first autonomous echocardiography service which provides cloud-based artificial intelligence services to support cardiac imaging diagnosis.
 
Ultromics was born at the University of Oxford, built-in partnership with the UKâ€™s NHS, and is now government backed, raised over Â£35 million - with the likes of Blues Ventures, Optum and Google Ventures - and has expanded to 50+ global sites.
 
 
We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Junior Product Manager to support the development and adoption of our technology in the clinical market.
 
The ideal candidate will have experience working in the Medical Device arena and have an understanding of EU and FDA regulations. Supporting the Chief Product Officer and working at the interface between key stakeholders within the company including the R&D, Software and Commercial teams, your role will assist in defining and delivering our product solutions to our customers. This is a fantastic opportunity to take full ownership of, and help shape the product portfolio, of a fast-growing start-up company.
 
 
 
 
Define tasks, manage and track project status for specified projects
Support in the development of design control documentation, manage their revision, review and approval (project plan, validation plan, release documentation, user manuals)
Appraise new product ideas and strategize appropriate to-market plans
Facilitate in the development of the processes for product implementation to ensure products meet service and customers' needs
Drive the execution of all product lifecycle processes for products, including product research, market research, competitive analysis, planning, positioning, roadmap development, requirements development, and product launch
Assist in the costing and budgeting of product development and implementation activities
Communicate with executive management to better understand the companyâ€™s target market and overall business strategy
Translate product strategy into detailed requirements for prototype construction and final product development by engineering teams
Assist in assembly of submissions to regulatory bodies (FDA, EU notified bodies)
Liaise with key stakeholders within the company including R&D, QA/RA, Operations, Software and Commercial teams
Analyse productsâ€™ UX needs, define user stories, create wireframes and mock-ups of product user interfaces
Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates Ultromics and its features across primary market segments
Follow good information governance practice throughout this job role and ensure compliance with Ultromicsâ€™ information security and data protection policies in all applicable assigned tasks
This list of duties is not exhaustive, and the post holder may be asked to carry out other duties through discussion with their line manager.


 
 
Your skills and experience
 
 
BSc in Business Administration, Marketing, or similar field
Project Management
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication
Plans, organises, schedules in an efficient, productive manner. Focuses on key priorities
Excellent listening skills - lets others speak and seeks to understand different viewpoints
Remains calm under pressure and maintains performance
Persistent -demonstrates tenacity and willingness to go the extra mile to get something done
Works effectively with others, contributes strongly, recognises the value of differing contributions, supportive and collaborative


 
Your desired skills and experience
 
 
MSc in an economic field and preferably experience in a similar position
Experience of affinity with Product Management is an asset
Experience working in health-tech
Product management for health-focused research
Experience in a venture capital-backed start-up
Adaptability, flexibility - adjusts quickly to changing priorities and conditions. Copes effectively with complexity and change
Python, JavaScript, SQL, SAS, Swift, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Previously worked in a start-up
Knowledge of working in the US


 
 
We are committed to promoting work-life balance and offer a range of benefits to encourage this, including:
 
 
Flexible working hours between 7am-7pm
Hybrid working options
Bonus scheme
PMI
Life assurance
Company-wide events (COVID permitting)

5% company pension contribution
Sabbatical policy
Employee referral reward
Generous personal learning budget on our online learning marketplace, Learnerbly
Cyclescheme
A well-stocked kitchen with free snacks - and great coffee!


 
 
We start with compassion
; We do this by communicating with empathy and welcoming different opinions and experiences. This means we can better identify and leverage each otherâ€™s strengths and talents to deliver. We are inclusive and are always mindful of our colleaguesâ€™ wellbeing.
 
We spark creativity
; We do this by being adventurous, curious and innovative in spirit. Whilst also helping each other to evolve and progress. This means we question the status quo and, by doing so, shape our business and influence the field of science and healthcare.
 
We show courage
; We do this by stepping out of our comfort zone, welcoming challenges and encouraging feedback at all times. This means we are relentless in our pursuit of excellence to grow a progressive, responsible and transformational culture
 
We stay connected
; We do this by relying on the increasingly connected globe to unleash learning support and teamwork from anyone and anywhere.
This means we collaborate with healthcare professionals, patients and partners to stay ahead of the curve. We depend on each other and grow together as one team.
 
We serve our customers
; We do this by honouring our commitments, listening and responding to our internal and external customersâ€™ needs. This means we are a trusted partner in the support of advancing healthcare in Echocardiography, support each other's needs and make a meaningful contribution to peopleâ€™s lives.

job_desc:
Nisbets celebrates its 40th anniversary this year and we have come a long way from humble beginnings in 1983 to the international company we are today. We constantly look for ways to expand our reach and deepen our impact further into existing markets, so the entrepreneurial spirit is alive and well still!
 
A key role in this strategy will be to appoint an additional UX Analyst to help us improve the user experience of our ecommerce websites. As our UX Analyst, you will operate multiple digital analytics tools to analyse and provide insight into user behaviour. You will work really closely with the other digital teams to support the best possible user experience, so collaboration is key in this role. Working as a UX Analyst for Nisbets, you will have a really broad role where you will work on set monthly tasks but also deep dive into research and project based work. This is a fantastic team who share their expertise freely and are extremely approachable, so you can expect to feel supported and able to further develop your skill set.
 
We fully support a hybrid working model and are happy to discuss a working pattern that suits your need's but we would like contact time in the Bristol office once a month.
 
What will I be doing as a UX Analyst?
 
 
Produce low fidelity UX/CRO outputs such as wireframes, interactive prototypes and user journeys
Improve the user experience of our ecommerce websites.
Operate multiple digital analytics tools to analyse and provide insight into user behaviour.
Utilise user research such as survey setting to collect qualitative data.
Develop a data driven approach and user insight to develop into ideas for improvement.
Communicate ideas using relevant documentation, using wireframing tools.
Assist in delivering the A/B and MVT test roadmap
Collaborate with technical and non technical audiences to share ideas and inputs


 
What can I expect as a UX Analyst?
 
We recognise that people are our biggest asset and we aim to offer a supportive work environment in which all people can thrive. As a family owned business we have very much maintained that sense of family in all our teams, where we all pull together to achieve success. We look after you too, as an employee you will receive a really good range of benefits which includes:-
 
 
Competitive base salary with an annual performance related bonus which can be up to 6%
25 days holiday plus your birthday off with the option to earn 4 additional days holiday or a cash bonus, based on your attendance.
Heavily subsidised canteen on site serving a range of hot food and drinks
Access to discounts and cashback across hundreds of retailers via our platform called The Kitchen
Access to a confidential Employee Assistance Programme with Health Assured offering 24/7 advice and guidance
Huge discounts on our full range of products, with up to 60% off our own brand labels
Option to purchase private healthcare at a subsidised rate
On going training and support through our learning management system which houses a broad range of courses and content, with the chance to also take industry recognised qualifications
Liftshare scheme, share your commute to work with a colleague and save money, and the planet
Charity giving, do your bit by donating to charity through salary sacrifice


 
Nisbets is committed to providing equality of opportunity for all colleagues. We aim to ensure our workplaces are free from discrimination and that not only colleagues but also our potential future colleagues are treated fairly and with dignity and respect. Therefore, please inform us of any reasonable adjustments that we may need to make to the application or interview process.

 to work as a part of our growing Information Security team here within PPS.


This is a varied, and dynamic position, which is critical to the overall InfoSec and Compliance strategy within PPS. Working alongside our Security Operations Manager, you will be liaising with both our technical and non-technical stakeholders to ensure the Information Security and Compliance requirements are incorporated into the PPS BAU and change delivery processes, making risk-informed decisions supporting our internal and external legal/regulatory commitments across PCI DSS DPA 2018, FCA and NBB are addressed.


This role would suit somebody with a background in a previous InfoSec position, and ideally who has had exposure to Payments and/or Banking environments, with knowledge of highly regulated and PCI DSS compliant requirements. In return, you will get to work with a talented team, in a DevSecOps environment.


PPS operates on a hybrid working model, and you will be required to attend our Swindon/London office 1 â€“ 3 days per month, but the need to be flexible is required as we continue to scale and grow.


Role and Responsibilities 


Review and Manage the configuration of the SIEM event repository and Use Cases working with our SOC service provider and collaborate on daily log reviews

Promote security awareness across the business, alongside creating and updating security communications/documents 


Skills & Experience


Proven operational experience in information security analyst or similar role 
Exposure to Cloud Security controls and management 
Exposure to vulnerability and risk management processes 
Experience with PCI DSS, DPA 2018, GDPR, and/or other regulations/privacy standards 
Knowledge of Linux/Windows, SIEM, network controls
Knowledge of Information Security standards, frameworks; NIST, ISO/IEC, NCSC
Documenting security policies, procedures, and standards, and championing Information Security to the business 
Strong communicator with excellent relationship-building skills 
Ability to work independently and manage own time, working to deadlines in a fast-paced priority changing environment
Strong stakeholder management skills 


Employee Benefits 


25 days annual leave plus Bank Holidays (or equivalent for shift roles)
Company sick pay & Income protection

Social events

Discretionary bonus scheme based on company and personal performance
Holiday trading scheme (buy or sell up to 5 days)
Medical & international travel cover with AXA PPP
Subsidised gym membership or Â£20 monthly gym allowance
Employee referral bonus scheme
Interest free travel loan for bus and rail

Diversity


Edenred UK and PPS are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, colour, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, citizenship, marital status or civil partnership/union status, disability, pregnancy, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable country or local laws.

job_desc:
We're looking for people who are passionate about Geoscience and looking to start a career in Quantitative Interpretation. If this sounds like you, then apply here!
 
About us
Ikon Science is a global provider of geopredictive and knowledge management software and solutions to optimize subsurface discovery and production. For over 20 years, Ikonâ€™s dedicated service-minded teams have applied deep scientific expertise and technology innovation to help customers extract more actionable knowledge from sophisticated subsurface data. Ikon helps customers make the best moves â€“ improving accessibility and accuracy, accelerating results and lowering costs.
 
 
With ofï¬ces located around the world in including; London, Houston, Kuala Lumpur, Calgary and Rio de Janeiro, Ikon services all major hydrocarbon geographies â€“ delivering global solutions with local service and support. Award winning RokDocÂ® geopredictive software, Curate knowledge management software, QI Solutions, GeoPressure and GeoMechanics Consultancy, and Roknowledge Studies make Ikon the proven partner for subsurface success.
 
About the role
This is an entry level position for a graduate geoscientist with an interest in a career in quantitative applied geoscience including well log analysis, seismic analysis and using seismic inversion for reservoir characterisation.
 
The main responsibilities are the accurate and timely delivery of quantitative seismic interpretation services as part of an integrated project workflow using RokDoc technology, within the EAME Services team.
 
Quantitative Interpretation of seismic encompasses Geophysics, Petrophysics, Geology and Reservoir Engineering disciplines. Activities include rock physics analysis of well logs, AVO modeling of seismic response to fluid fill and lithology variations, deriving reservoir properties from seismic data using various techniques such as seismic inversion and AVO analysis, and integration with other geophysical techniques such as Geopressure and Geomechanics. Training will be provided in both theory and applied workflows in geoscience.
 
Requirement
 
Working as part of a team to complete projects to client requirements, to a high technical standard, whilst also working to tight deadlines.
Liaising with the Project Manager and internal/external clients.
Interpretation of well log data.
Maintenance of our project database.
Seismic analysis QC, conditioning and interpretation.
Learn and perform advanced Rock Physics analysis.
Prepare data for seismic inversion and parameterize steps to condition seismic data for inversion.
Deliver high quality presentations and reports to internal/external clients. Actively promoting and selling Ikon Science services and software.
Assisting with the testing of Ikon Science software.
The Junior Geoscientist will be responsible for ensuring that policies and associated requirements are complied with, within their area of responsibility and operation.
 
Work on ad hoc projects and tasks as directed by the line manager.


 
Experience
 
Up to 2 yearsâ€™ experience as a geophysicist/interpreter.
Knowledge of theory and application of Rock Physics and AVO.
Working knowledge and understanding of regional geology, geophysics, petrophysics and basic reservoir engineering concepts.
Some experience/exposure with Well to Seismic ties, AVO modelling and analysis, Seismic Data processing techniques, reservoir characterization.
Training will be provided in both theory and applied workflows in geoscience.


 
Qualifications
 
Degree: BSc / MSc / PhD in one of the following disciplines: Geoscience, Earth Sciences, Geophysics.


 
Technical Competences
 
Must possess technical excellence in relevant discipline.
Proficient in MS Office.
Knowledge of Ikon Science software, Kingdom, Petrel, VoxelGeo, Geolog, GeoProbe.


 
Behavioural Competencies
 
Possess excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent attention to detail and able to interpret complex data sets.
Diligent and passionate.

job_desc:
Description
 
Locations available: Bristol and Leatherhead
 
What We Do In Consulting
 
Frazer-Nash offers excellent opportunities for graduates and postgraduates to experience challenging and interesting work that makes a difference in the world. Working within a consultancy environment offers the chance to experience a wide variety of projects and you'll be given the opportunity to manage projects, win work and use cutting edge methods to find the missing piece of the puzzle. Team information
 
Our teams use data and computational methods. We are interested in building robust, agile and scalable systems which help our customers to â€˜do more in less timeâ€™. As consultants we pair our technical data and software skills with strong communication and management skills to ensure our work has an impact. We work across the full range of markets that FrazerÂ­-Nash operates in, including Transport, Health, Industry, Energy and Defence.
 
Requirements
 
What youâ€™ll be doing at Frazer-Nash?
 
Working within a consultancy environment offers the chance to experience a wide variety of diverse projects across a range of industry sectors; you'll be given the opportunity to develop yourself at each step of the project lifecycle, designing software and hardware solutions to customerâ€™s complex problems, managing project delivery, winning work and having the opportunity to work directly with our clients.

Some examples of the types of work that you could be involved in include:
 
 
Using mathematical modelling techniques for customers who have limited amounts of data to help fill in the gaps with data driven forecasts.
Using analytical techniques for customers who have large quantities of data to get insight into what is happening in their systems.
 


Throughout our projects we aim to build long-term relationships with our customers and keep helping them with their problems as they evolve over time.
 
What youâ€™ll need?
 
We are interested in hearing from excellent candidates who want to work in data science and systems. As a minimum requirement youâ€™ll need to have obtained, or be predicted to obtain, a 2:1 in your Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree. You may have relevant experience from University courses that are similar to any on the following list:
 
 
Computer Science
Cyber Engineering
Psychology
Systems Engineering
Physics
Mathematics
Mechanical Engineering
General Engineering
 


When submitting your application, please describe detail of your degree, educational background and working experience in your CV and Cover Letter. Show us that you are organised and methodical in your approach to meeting deadlines and managing internal and external requirements. Highlight collaborative qualities and experience you have which will help you excel in a consultancy environment.

Due to the nature of the work that Frazer-Â­Nash Consultancy undertake, candidates will be required to undergo pre-employment screening and must be able to satisfy clearance criteria for UK National Security Vetting. Candidates will be required to be UK nationalâ€™s who are resident in the UK to be eligible to apply
 
What can Frazer-Nash offer you?
 
You will join us with an excellent academic record. However, this is just the first step, we want to support your career development so that you can achieve relevant professional qualifications including Chartership; All our graduates join our Professional Development Scheme, which is accredited by five professional institutions (IMechE, RAeS, IET, RINA & IoP). You will be assigned a mentor who will work with you to develop your own individual development plan so that you can gain the necessary skills and experience to become Chartered. To enable you to achieve your full potential we will give you the opportunity to spend extended periods of time working across the disciplines within our technical groups as well as spending time on our clientsâ€™ sites, which is so important for becoming the great consultant that you could be.
 
Benefits
 
 
Competitive salary: [Â£31,000 + 2k joining bonus]
25 days holiday + sale and purchase scheme
 
Happy to talk flexible working
 
Company bonus potential
 
Generous company pension scheme
 
Opportunity to join our company share scheme
Private healthcare membership
 
Paid membership fees to a professional membership
 
Cycle to work scheme
Season rail ticket loan
 
Bonus linked to company performance
 


We are committed to fostering a working culture that brings out the very best in our people, regardless of their circumstances, identity or background. We want our people to be themselves, feel empowered to achieve their personal and professional goals, and know that we respect the unique value they bring to the company. In support of this, we encourage thoughtful behaviours and work to foster a collaborative working environment
.

job_desc:
HR People Analyst
London, England - Data Science - Full time
 
About Tripledot Studios
 
Tripledot Studios was founded by a team of industry veterans from some of the biggest names in mobile games such as King, Peak Games, Facebook, and Product Madness. Tripledot recently won Tech Growth Business of the Year!
 
We are a rapidly growing mobile games studio, offering a great environment to attract the top talent. Our mission is to bring the knowledge and experience of a chart-topping mobile games company into a close-knit, collaborative environment.

LOVE
 
making games!

Skills and experience

As a Data Engineer you will be responsible for maintaining, governing, and growing the Overdales MI and database infrastructure, utilising your expertise of SQL, SSIS and Power BI environments. You will maximise the use of data, visualisations, reporting and automation within Overdales to understand and influence business strategy & performance. You will work closely with other leaders within Overdales and across our UK Group to provide information, insights, and forecasts, supporting a positive culture for our people, our clients, and our customers.
These are split into three core areas â€“ Telephony, Data & MI, Governance & Controls
 
Telephony
 
Full end to end administration and deployment of the telephony system including all aspects of development, setup, and advanced configuration
Management & maintenance of telephone numbers, there allocation, and use within live environments

Data, MI & Analytics
 
Ensuring the integrity of all data within the SQL data warehouse & Power BI instances.
Managing the ETL processes within SQL and SSIS to populate and grow the data warehouse.
Designing, building, and maintaining infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data.

Governance & Controls

Ensuring regular reviews are undertaken for access & permission levels to systems within line of control
Supporting the training and front-line support to all colleagues for systems in line of control
Lead crisis management with intermediate/advanced knowledge of IT infrastructure to enable prompt resolution
Encourages and drives an atmosphere of continuous improvement

New starters have appropriate system access granted and provided in a timely manner
Lead in ensuring systems are operational in line with agreed internal and external regulatory requirements
Availability for support out of hours testing, critical trouble shooting, and issue resolution either planned or at short notice


 
How we say thank you?
An exciting career is much more than just a salary. We also understand that everyone, regardless of culture, gender identity, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, or disability status, can contribute to our goal to make credit work better for all. Our strength is in our people. So, at Lowell we have a range of benefits that include:
 
A discretionary annual bonus for a job well done.
Life assurance, Private Medical Assurance & Group income protection.

Weâ€™re on an exciting journey to get us there by recruiting the very best talent to join us regardless of race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or other characteristics.
 
Be you! Join us today, so we can achieve amazing things together and build a sustainable tomorrow.

Bodhi have an excellent opportunity for a Digital Analyst working for a high-end education group specialising in hospitality management and the culinary arts, who attract students from over 100 different countries to their 5 schools/universities in prestigious locations in London, Switzerland, Paris, China and India.
 
As a Digital Analyst, you'll have a key role in driving growth in digital demand generation activities globally. You'll be responsible for promoting a data-driven approach to optimize campaign and channel spend efficiency. 3-5 years' experience in digital marketing as Digital or Paid Media analyst, supporting various marketing tactics including digital lead generation, web, SEO, and paid advertising.
Experience with digital sales lead generation and funnel optimization.
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences
Experience producing analysis from digital data sources to inform decision-making.
Ability to identify and analyze data and translate it into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with paid media, channel attribution, and other digital analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Salesforce, Google Tag Manager, Marketing Automation/omnichannel platforms and PowerBI.

Proficiency in developing complex media plans that mix different types of activities.
Ability to use tools for bid management and A/B testing.


 
 
The role pays a basic salary of up to Â£55k plus excellent benefits.

Position Description
 
Discover where complex meets meaningful as a Senior Data Scientist in our Advisory Services team. You will be part of a team that combines subject matter and technical expertise with business understanding, providing our clients with the insights to build next generation IT services and operating models.
 
Help tackle once-in-a-generation challenges across the public and private sector. Work alongside clients as we shape the future of how fundamental technologies connect and transform the user experience in the UK.
 
CGI was voted â€˜Best Workplaceâ€™ by Great Place To Work in 2021, and offers a competitive salary, excellent pension, private healthcare, plus a share scheme (3% + 3% matching) which makes you a member, not just an employee.
 
Your future duties and responsibilities
 
As a Senior Data Scientist, youâ€™ll join a small forward-thinking team focused specifically on the evaluation, assurance and acceptance of secure IT services. You will work closely with selecting features, data-mining using state-of-the-art methods, extending CGIâ€™s data with third party sources of information and enhancing data collection procedures relevant for building analytic systems.
 
You will be involved in the end-to-end sourcing, processing, cleansing, visualisation and verification of the integrity of data used for analysis. You will also be able to create automated anomaly detection systems, track performance and extract meaningful insights. Youâ€™ll also discover:
 
 
A unique level of variety across different clients and industry sectors

Impactful work that makes a real difference across the UK

arenâ€™t a perfect match, we can provide the training and further development to help you

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

learning techniques and algorithms (neural networks and some of: k-NN, Naive Bayes,

be ideal

Our working approach is built around our clientsâ€™ needs. Thatâ€™s not to say yours arenâ€™t important too and in a post-pandemic world, we want to extend the offer of an open discussion to you as to whether a role can be office or home-based, flexible or hybrid.
 
We celebrate and reward our members through a variety of methods, and we promote their health and well-being through a range of programmes and activities. job_desc:
IT Audit Intern
 
 
R019683
 
 
Your Platform
 
Activision Blizzard plays a central role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain.
 
Based in Soho, the cultural heart of Londonâ€™s West End with a vast array of classic record shops and leading film companies, media offices and great restaurants. Regentâ€™s Park is close enough for a lunchtime run, as are the delights of Piccadilly Circus and the shopping mecca of Oxford Street. It is conveniently walking distance from a number of London tube stations and mainline train stations.
 
To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB.
 
Your Mission
 
This is a very rare opportunity to join a dynamic IT audit team, providing objective assurance on ABKâ€™s organisationâ€™s risk management, governance and internal control processes.
 
This role will give an intern a platform to develop practical IT Auditing knowledge and skills.
 
We expect hard work and passion from the successful candidate and commit ourselves to giving you real duties and training/mentoring with a goal to springboard you into a career in IT Audit.
 
 
Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities
 
 
Test IT controls for Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance across the group
Assist in risk-based planning for IT and finance-integrated audits
Support end-to-end IT audits of cybersecurity, privacy, applications, underlying infrastructure, and other technologies supporting business processes
Develop data analytics knowledge and intelligently applying this to develop RPA, continuous monitoring, and operational audits across the group
Work with the business and technology stakeholders to provide assurance on key projects and critical change activities
Work with process owners to develop solutions to issues and provide guidance on areas of change within the business
Develop IT security and audit knowledge through on-the-job experience and training
Build a good working knowledge of the gaming industry, especially across ABKs divisions/businesses, from mobile platforms to AAA publishing
 


 
This role will initially be remote due to lockdown requirements and candidates can benefit from flexible working arrangements once we return to the office.
 
Player Profile
 
 
 
Should hold or study towards a university degree of at least 2:1 or equivalent
A familiarity with the basics of IT infrastructure and security
A passion to develop knowledge of IT security, compliance and risk
Operating in a fast-changing environment and industry; you should be keen to constantly learn and have an analytical view of the business
The successful candidate will work across the group, being exposed to multiple businesses, departments and teams. As such they should be confident at presenting and communicating to new audiences
Able to self-motivate, prioritise work and meet deadlines
Strong communication skills and natural curiosity


 
Our World
 
Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including

job_desc:
We are seeking to appoint a Junior Project Manager to join the Jenner Institute, at the Nuffield Department of Medicine.
 
You will be responsible for supporting the research group in a variety of administration activities as well as undertaking project specific tasks. You will also provide PA services to the Group Leader, and you will work very closely with the Institute administration team including the Business Manager, the Finance Manager, and the centralised Finance, Human Resources and Grants Team. You will be expected to meet regularly with both Principal Investigator and members of the research group to develop and maintain an efficient research administration service. You will support the day-to-day management of the Gonococcal Vaccine Project grant portfolio including pre- and post-award activity as well as taking responsibility for financial reporting to the funding bodies.
 
It is essential that you are educated to degree level or equivalent qualification and have knowledge of research grants and contracts. You will have experience of using costing tools for grants application and have the ability to analyse and understand financial data. You will be a natural team player, with the ability to work well within a team as well as be adept at working independently. You will have high levels of organisational and strong interpersonal skills, together with a desire to develop in the role, and actively seek improvements.
 
Applications for this vacancy are to be made online and you will be required to upload a supporting statement and CV as part of your online application. Your supporting statement must explain how you meet each of the selection criteria for the post using examples of your skills and experience.
 
This post is offered full-time on a fixed term contract for 24 months and is funded by CARB-X.
 
Whilst this role is a Grade 6 position, we would be willing to consider less experienced candidates who might be suitable to the role with adjusted duties to then be offered as an under fill at Grade 5: Â£27,131 - Â£32,348 per annum, with discretionary range to Â£35,333 per annum. This would be discussed with applicants at interview/appointment where appropriate.
 
Please quote
 
163561
 
on all correspondence. Only applications received before 12.00 noon Monday 6 March 2023 will be considered.

 is a global analytics and digital solutions company that partners with clients to improve business outcomes and unlock growth. Permanent

Experience of designing warehouses, ETL pipelines and data modelling.

Good SQL skills with any mainstream database â€“ Oracle, MySQL, Postgres.
Proficient Linux skills.
Agile exposure with Scrum using tools such as Jira and Confluence.
Strong analytical, technical, organizational and communication skills.

As part of a leading global analytics and digital solutions company, you can look forward to:

EXL
, we are committed to providing our employees with the tools and resources they need to succeed and excel in their careers. As an Equal Opportunity Employer,

 is committed to diversity. Our company does not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, age, or disability status.

 EXL
, we offer a flexible hybrid working model that allows employees to live a balanced, healthy lifestyle while strengthening our culture of collaboration.
