job_desc:
We are seeking a talented Data Engineer to be part of an ambitious, newly formed quantitative investment team. This means the role will sit within a revenue-generating team. The team seeks to research and implement strategies across several different disciplines including systematic fundamental, sector specific and statistical arbitrage. This remit will involve multiple greenfield technology buildouts on cloud-based environments including projects around: machine learning, data warehousing, analytics engineering, ETL & ELT, containerization, and infrastructure-as-code.
 
The Data Engineer will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining functionality across various elements of our cloud-native data platform. As a member of a growing investment team, you sit next to the Quantitative Researchers and Data Scientists and work with them to define data outputs needed for research. This is a role that will require you to own the design and implementation of new data processes â€“ this could be data modelling and pipelining for new data sources, creating analytic tools, creating data for downstream analyses and dashboards, enhancing parallel compute capabilities for machine learning, feature engineering and automating quality checks.
 
What you need:
 
 
Experience with Python and SQL
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Experience with cloud-based data warehouse technologies (Databricks, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.)
Experience with cluster compute (Spark, Dask, etc.) and schedulers (Airflow, Dagster, Prefect)
Experience working with data analysts to define data models, publish metrics, and build dashboards
Highly skilled and analytical problem solver with logical thought processes and quantitative aptitude
Strong sense of project ownership and a track record of delivering results
 


 
Experience within a quantitative trading firm/hedge fund or experience with timeseries/market/alternative data
Interest or experience in analytics engineering (with dbt or other ELT frameworks)
Experience working with machine learning or NLP data pipelines.
 


The firmâ€™s ethos is embedded in our people. â€˜Talent is our strategyâ€™ is our mantra and drives how we approach all initiatives at the firm. We believe our success is because of our people, so putting our talent above all else is our top priority.

Schonfeld strives to create an environment where our people can thrive. We foster a teamwork-oriented, collaborative environment where ideas at any level are encouraged and shared. The development and advancement of our talent is honed through interactions with each other, learning & educational offerings, and through opportunities to make impactful contributions. In our agile environment, engineers are expected to self-organize and collaborate on the best way to solve problems, and they are collectively responsible for the entire team's delivery. Engineering teams are small and cross-functional, and value learning and knowledge sharing.

At Schonfeld, we strive to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout all of our employees with Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at the forefront of this mission. As a firm we are committed to creating a hiring process which is not only fair, but also welcoming and supportive. On a daily basis, our employees welcome diversity across identity, thought, people and views which serves as the foundation of our culture and success. You can learn more about our DEI initiatives here - Belonging @ Schonfeld .
 
Schonfeld Strategic Advisors is a multi-manager platform that invests its capital with Internal and Partner portfolio managers, primarily on an exclusive or semi-exclusive basis, across four trading strategies; quantitative, fundamental equity, tactical trading and discretionary macro & fixed income. We have created a unique structure to provide global portfolio managers with autonomy, flexibility and support to best enable them to maximize the value of their businesses.

Over the last 30 years, Schonfeld has successfully capitalized on inefficiencies and opportunities within the markets. We have developed and invested heavily in proprietary technology, infrastructure and risk analytics and continue to capitalize on new opportunities. In 2021 we launched our newest strategy, discretionary macro & fixed income as part of the continual growth of Schonfeldâ€™s investible universe. Our portfolio exposure has expanded across the Americas, Europe and Asia as well as multiple asset classes and products.

job_desc:

At EY, youâ€™ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. To qualify for the role you must have

Experience with data transformation and wrangling tools ranging from SSIS, through to Talend and Alteryx.

Ideally, youâ€™ll also have

Expertise in an industry or ERP system.
Awareness of techniques for handling large data sets, ~1bn records in a single table.

What We Look For
 
 
People who demonstrate integrity, respect, and teaming.
People with energy, enthusiasm, and the courage to lead.
People who build relationships based on doing the right thing.


 
What We Offer
 
 
Continuous learning: Youâ€™ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: Weâ€™ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: Weâ€™ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: Youâ€™ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


 
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. Itâ€™s yours to build.

Apply now.
 
Please note;
 
Prior to finalizing your application, you will be asked to provide personal information across several dimensions of diversity and inclusiveness. The information you provide is kept entirely confidential and will not be used to evaluate your candidacy. We collect this data to help us analyse our recruitment process holistically and implement actions that promote diversity and inclusiveness. While optional, we encourage you to provide this information to hold us accountable towards our goal of building a better working world. Read more about our commitment to diversity& inclusiveness here . We ask because it matters!
 
EY | Building a better working world
 
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

job_desc:
ABOUT PHASTAR
 
PHASTAR is a multiple award-winning global biometrics Contract Research Organisation (CRO). We partner with pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device organizations to provide the expertise and processes to manage and deliver on time, quality biostatistics, programming, data management and data science services. Operating across the UK, US, Canada, France, Spain, Germany, Kenya, Australia, India, China, and Japan, PHASTAR is the second largest specialised biometrics provider globally, and the largest in the UK.
 
WHY PHASTAR
 
Accredited as an outstanding company to work for, PHASTAR is committed to employee engagement, workplace satisfaction and ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We offer flexible working, involvement in developing company-wide initiatives, structured training and development plans, and a truly supportive, fun, and friendly environment.
 
Whatâ€™s more, when you join our team, PHASTAR will plant a tree in your honour, as one of our Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives. So, not only would you get your dream job, youâ€™ll also be helping to save the planet!
 
THE PHASTAR GRADUATE SCHEME
 
PHASTARâ€™s graduate scheme has been successfully running for the past nine years. We offer comprehensive, tailor-made training that will equip you with the industry knowledge, technical and soft skills youâ€™ll need as you begin your rewarding career as a statistical programmer within clinical research.
 
The scheme begins with a six-week intense SAS training course, where youâ€™ll learn fundamental programming techniques and clinical trial reporting requirements from our expert trainers. This is followed by our unique internal mentorship programme, where youâ€™ll receive individual support and encouragement as you continue to learn and develop beyond the initial graduate scheme.
 
Â· Develop SAS programming skills in order to deliver high quality study results for clinical research
Â· Manipulate, summarise and analyse clinical trial data using a variety of methods
Â· Develop SAS programs to produce datasets according to agreed industry or client standards
Â· Function as programming support for studies across a variety of phases and therapeutic areas
 
Requirements:
 
Â· BSc in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Programming, or related discipline
Â· Previous experience using programming languages (not essential)
Â· Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
Â· Enthusiastic, ambitious and a strong team player
Â· Ability to work in either our London, Glasgow, Sheffield or Macclesfield office on a hybrid basis without any restrictions
 
WHAT WE OFFER
 
PHASTAR is a company where hard work and fun coincide! You will have the opportunity to develop your career within a dynamic, challenging and intellectually stimulating environment, learning from industry-leading colleagues with specialist PhDs and statistical expertise, all within a relaxed and friendly atmosphere where fun is encouraged and renowned social events are organised throughout the year.
 
Â· Six-week training course
Â· Structured training and development throughout your career at PHASTAR
Â· Continuous learning
Â· Opportunity to attend conferences and courses
Â· Excellent benefits package (competitive salary, pension, healthcare, life assurance)
 
Please note that the interview process for the PHASTAR graduate scheme will begin in March 2023 and the start date for the graduate positions will be September 2023. Please also note that we can only consider candidates that have the right to work in the UK and do not require sponsorship.

job_desc:
Manchester, UK /
 
KrakenFlex ğŸ’ª â€“ Technology /
 
Full-time
 
 
 
The energy industry is undergoing the largest transformation since industrialisation at an unprecedented rate of change and we are positioning ourselves to be at the heart of that change.
 
Our aim is to be the leading global provider of solutions that enable customers to release Â£30bn of value per annum from distributed energy resources (DERs). We are building a Software as a Service (SaaS) subscription business with a global addressable market of Â£2.4 billion per annum, by digitally connecting hundreds of thousands of DERs with energy markets.
 
We have already attained a market leading position and KrakenFlex is a recognised thought leader and innovator in the industry. Our efforts have not gone unnoticed and we are pleased to announce that we now have the full support and backing of Octopus Energy, an award-winning UK energy supplier who share our passion and values.
 
As we enter the stage of rapid commercialisation and customer account growth, we have a number of exciting new offerings to launch to customers. Weâ€™re looking for an exceptional person to help us continuously deliver features that provide value to our customers. Our ideal engineer would be an individual who loves to engage with interesting software problems, with an interest in data related development and the passion to build and shape the future within a collaborative, community-based environment. We operate a highly agile development approach, giving wide scope to be involved with hands-on system-design, test driven development, deployment and operations.
 
Our data sources and problems are many and varied. We have some simple but high throughput data sources (e.g. over 600,000,000 rows a day and growing rapidly), complex unstructured and semi structured data and complex application data from our various microservices.
 
Our aim is to allow our business and our customers to answer increasingly complex questions, and gain new insights, based on our data, additional external data, and things we can learn and models we can extract from our data.
 
What You'll Do
 
 
Build and maintain data pipelines that deliver key data and insights to the business
Integrate new data sources into the data platform through APIs or bulk data transfer
Build and maintain testing and documentation frameworks for our data sources
Work with the business to scope and deliver new data engineering projects and requirements
Maintain and build on our existing data infrastructure and tools
Support the internationalisation of our data infrastructure as we continue to grow globally
Contribute to the software engineering and data engineering culture here at KrakenFlex
Collaborate regularly with colleagues with many different professional specialities, including software engineers and data scientists, to create innovative solutions that delight our customers and colleagues
Work as part of a team of engineers, regularly seeking feedback and growing your skills as technical professionals.


 
What You'll Need
 
 
In depth industry experience in software development & design
Experience in Python
Experience with data processing and pipeline technologies e.g. AWS Glue, Spark, Databricks, Airflow, dbt, Redshift, SQL, Athena, Parquet (donâ€™t worry, we donâ€™t expect or want you to have them all, and experience with other technologies doing the same jobs is also interesting).
A drive to get things done in a collaborative, agile development environment
An interest in working with data, both processing and analysing
A proven ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment
Excellent analytical and multitasking skills


 
It would be great if you had
 
 
 
Experience with BI and/or Analytics tools, e.g. Athena, Tableau, Quicksight
Experience working with data lakes and data at scale
Experience with AWS or similar cloud providers, and serverless technologies e.g. AWS Lambda, Kinesis, DynamoDB, API Gateway
 
Experience developing, securing or operating cloud scale applications or infrastructure; ideally terraform or cloudformation


 
Ideally you will be based in the Greater Manchester and happy to come into the office a couple of days per week! But we appreciate that things have changed and flexibility is at the top of everyone's agenda, so if you would rather be remote please let us know.
 
If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.
 
 
Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.
title: Data Engineer

job_desc:
Country

United Kingdom

Job Family

Operations

For over 80 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the worldâ€™s biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumerâ€™s life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of ~9,000 employees.

Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future: Currently we are in the latter stages of a transformational journey from a traditional market research company to a trusted provider of prescriptive data analytics powered by innovative technology. This is only possible with extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!
 
Summary of Role
 
The Junior Coding Associate role is collecting and collating specification information on our products in the consumer durables markets tracked by GfK Retail and Technology.

This will involve monitoring product launch cycles from key manufacturers and ensuring new product information is received and passed to pre-coding functions before product launches. You will acquire new product information and resolve queries and issues on new/existing products which are unable to be coded due to lack of information supplied in the retailer data.

Flexibility, prioritisation and strong organisational skills are a must. A good telephone manner and the ability to develop good working relationships with team members are pre-requisites.
 
 
Take ownership and perform analysis to resolve outstanding coding queries where standard approaches have failed
To implement initiatives that will positively improve the quality of the data that we supply to clients
To ensure that the success of the initiatives are quantified through metrics published weekly
Ensure that all queries are handled efficiently and effectively
Develop a good working relationship with team members
Create a high level of product knowledge â€“ awareness of changes in the market and new product launches for key manufacturers
Understand the data management process and work within it
Build a knowledge base for products across manufacturers and retailers to allow the coding functions to code more effectively and to prevent partially coded items
Work with other Operational departments regarding improving data quality of existing retailer data
Where required contact manufacturers or make retailer store visits to source missing product information
Develop knowledge of GfK internal tools
 


 
Highly proficient within Microsoft Office suite of tools; Outlook, Excel, Word
Attention to detail is essential
A logical thinker with excellent problem solving skills and solutions focused
Results driven, ability to work to benchmarks and Key Performance Indicators
Excellent organisational and prioritisation skills, with ability to manage complex and conflicting requirements or multiple tasks/projects
Flawless communication and interpersonal skills; a high standard of both written and spoken English
Adaptable and open to change
Team player encouraging relationships across both teams and departments and external clients
 


Other responsibilities may be allocated by the line manager to ensure the effectiveness of the Group. All employees in GfK are expected to promote the image of the company. This will be done in part, by adopting a professional appearance and maintaining an efficient and effective working environment.

It is expected that employees follow specific deadlines set in respect of company issues relating to professional servicing (internal and external) and objectives. The detail and scope of this job description may be altered to take account of changing our needs.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal opportunity in employment which focuses on all of our employees reaching their full potential. At GfK we work collaboratively with our colleagues but offer a flexible working approach, including dividing our time between office & remote working as well as the opportunity to flex our working hours around team core hours.

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to get to know you!

GfK UK has committed to a net zero carbon emissions policy by 2026.
title: Junior Coding Associate

job_desc:
We're cinch. Our mission is simple â€“ remove the faff from buying and changing cars, giving customers more choice, with more ease. Thatâ€™s it. Weâ€™re putting drivers first and weâ€™ve ripped up the rule book to make sure that happens.
 
Weâ€™re a customer-first ecommerce business with huge ambition, already driving exponential growth. And we have an exciting roadmap of innovative products to grow our customer offering as preference for buying cars online grows.
 
cinch is a new-to-market brand backed by the Constellation Automotive Group. That means weâ€™re part of a family including BCA and WeBuyAnyCar.com. We like to keep good company.
 
Location
 
â€“ hybrid, home based with travel to Corby or Chipping Warden as required.
 
You
 
â€“ So, do you have a faff-free filter? Do you want to work in an energetic team, with open-mindedness and passion? We're looking for people who are agile, full of ideas and want to challenge the norm.
 
This is a new role and so it is a fantastic opportunity to shape the data analysis & insights support for the Retail Operations business.
 
As our
 
Retail Operations Analyst
 
you will be:
Working alongside a Retail Operations team looking to remove cost & time from the vehicle refurbishment process, through targeted and detailed analysis to identify areas of opportunity. Provide relevant and actionable analytics to ensure we are refurbing our vehicles to the right quality.
 
Additionally, the successful candidate will work with the vehicle sourcing function to ensure we are selecting the right cars, delivering them to the right locations at the right time in order to drive maximum profitability & efficiency from the operation â€“ speeding up time to sale for vehicles.
 
What youâ€™ll be working on
 
Use analytical skills to make recommendations for improvements which could be made to add value to the Retail Operations process, focussing on: value enhancement, improving our turnaround time to hit SLAs, providing high quality assurance for our customers, resourcing optimisation analysis & recommendations, insights to ensure we maximise successful vehicle deliveries / reducing vehicle aborts, optimising vehicle selecting based on retail desirability
Work closely with commercial, Customer Experience and Finance Analysts to support the cinch vehicle selection recommendations, optimising selections to maximise margin and vehicle quality at each stage of the process
Work with our Business Intelligence & Performance Reporting team to create alerting and exception reporting for swift action on Retail Operation KPIs
Work with the cinch Retail Operations team to build business cases, define KPIs and then support implementation
Complete impact analysis to ensure that benefits have been delivered and work with business to refine implementation plan if not delivered in full
Gain a strong understanding of the Retail Operations business by engaging and building relationships with key stakeholders to identify how data and insights can support improved operational performance
Work with the wider Decision Intelligence function to establish the most relevant sets of data that and utilise the Data Engineering team to include those sets within the cinch Data Warehouse. Work with Retail Operations to shape new data requirements
Recommend data to be loaded into inventory management system
Build relationships and a strong understanding of the broader teams within Decision Intelligence e.g., Data Engineering, Data Science and Business Intelligence & Performance Reporting so that the most relevant support and tools for analysis can be utilised in the delivery of insight solutions for Retail Operations
Collaborate with the wider Data Analysis & Insights team to share learnings and best practice and participate in team discussions and wider business projects


 
Skills and expertise
 
Expertise in using data to drive operational efficiencies â€“ specifically with regards to value enhancement and people resource planning
Strong expertise in building relationships with stakeholders and understanding business needs
Entrepreneurial/ growth mind-set, capable of handling multiple competing priorities, ready to work both autonomously and within a team
Strong analytical skills with the ability to tell stories with data and explain the rationale to stand behind your recommendations
Must be comfortable with ambiguity as the Retail Operations business evolves and grows.
Experience in developing data analysis solutions and insight from scratch
Experience in working with a variety in quality of datasets
Experience of using SQL to extract data from data warehouses
Experience of using modern BI tools like Power BI
3+ years Data Analysis experience
Excellent communication skills, including the confidence to present to senior management
Positive, â€˜can-doâ€™ attitude
Data management, cleanliness and recommendations to ensure available data can be used for planned Retail Operations projects


 
If you're looking for a career that has great teamwork, training, rewards, long-term scope and is going places - apply now!
 
Our policy is to employ the best qualified people and provide equal opportunity for the advancement of employees including promotion and training and not to discriminate against any person because of gender, race, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion, belief or disability.

At Mondelez Europe, we are proud, not only of the iconic brands we make, but also of the people who make them. chocolates,

,
 
belVita
,
 
LU
 
and

biscuits, and

and

gums get safely into our customers handsâ€”and mouths. Great people and great brands. Thatâ€™s who we are. Join us on our journey to continue leading the future of snacking around the world by offering the right snack, for the right moment, made the right way.

job_desc:
An amazing opportunity to join the Actuarial Team here at Arch in London as a Junior Actuarial Analyst. This role would provide support to our Underwriting teams, exposure to all aspects of the Actuarial function (Pricing, Reserving, Capital Modelling), training on systems and a chance to develop your technical knowledge.
 
Role Summary:
â€¢ Underwriting support: assist underwriters with analysis or interpretation of numbers and reports
 
â€¢ Gradual build-up of exposure to all other aspects of the actuarial function:
Pricing: large accounts with complicated layered structures
Reserving: quarterly using professional package
Capital modelling: assisting in parameterisation and analysis
 
â€¢Understanding, maintenance and development of the in-house Dashboard MI system (Excel, SQL, Power BI, Python), for which necessary training will be provided. This will be a steep but interesting and useful learning curve in a high-profile position!
 
As well as developing your technical knowledge, we will provide you access to excellent benefits as part of your career development e.g. study days to focus on your qualification with a range of study materials
 
Key Tasks and Responsibilities:
1. Underwriting/management support
 
Provide ad hoc reports or data downloads
 
Explain MI reports to underwriters/management
2. Pricing support
 
Development and maintenance of benchmark models (exposure rating)
 
Provide support for large account pricing (experience rating)
3. Reserving support
 
Provide data delivery support
 
Provide support for reserve reporting and outputs
 
Assist the Reserving team in reserving analysis
4. Management information development/maintenance
 
Support dashboard maintenance
 
Provide dashboard training to users
 
Skills/Competencies:
â€¢ Good knowledge and efficiency in the use of Microsoft office package, and willingness to develop expertise in Excel (including VBA), SQL and become proficient in this area
â€¢ Willingness to be a problem solver, be inquisitive and work well both independently and as part of a team
â€¢ Personable and able to communicate at all levels within the organisation.
â€¢ Be able to review/sense-check own work to produce high-quality work
 
Education:
â€¢ A-Levels
â€¢ Degree or final year degree student
â€¢ Actuarial student or intending to take Actuarial exams
 
Experience:
From Graduate level to 3 years insurance/Actuarial experience
 
 
The Company
Arch Insurance is a global insurer offering our clients superior coverage and service. We embody the Arch guiding principle of focusing on retaining experienced and talented employees to differentiate us from the rest of the pack. Our group operates from offices in the US, Canada, Bermuda, UK, and Australia, providing specialty risk solutions to clients worldwide across a wide range of industries. With nearly 20 years of operating history and strong financial ratings, our track record remains solid.
Arch Insurance employs a disciplined underwriting approach and prudent risk selection across all types of business. Our mission is to provide our insureds with superb coverage and claims handling through careful and diligent underwriting of risks and business-friendly solutions. Across our global operations, Arch Insurance employees are ready to meet your needs with professionalism and excellence.
title: Junior Actuarial Analyst

Analytics Consultant
 
ACCELERATION OVERVIEW:
 
 
Acceleration is WPPâ€™s specialist practice for Google Marketing & Cloud Platforms. We are a curious team of highly skilled data and technology practitioners, inspired by experimentation and new ideas. This is the lifeblood of the future-forward solutions we deliver, that empower our clients to compete every day, in a dynamic environment. And it is the reason we have become trusted advisors to CEOs, strategic partners to CMOs, and operational partners to CIOs, around the globe.
 
We help clients leverage the power of Googleâ€™s Marketing and Cloud platforms to transform their marketing organizations and accelerate growth. With access to expert consultancy services and a deep bench of specialized skills, we deliver what marketers need to compete effectively, increase efficiency, and drive growth. We are well known for our open, transparent, and honest relationships with clients. We identify opportunities for innovation while remaining firmly grounded in business reality. We demystify complex tasks and impart knowledge without hype or pretense, and we shape marketing ecosystems to drive growth through the intelligent application of data and technology. Most importantly, we speak in specifics and get the job done.
 
Our contribution is measured by our clientsâ€™ success. We understand that speed to value is critical. This is why we release value at every step of the process. Every day we build our skills and hone our craft to get our clients the results they deserve.
 
We are Acceleration: We turn bold ambition into business reality.
 
ROLE OVERVIEW:
 
Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer - UK, the Analytics Consultant plays a critical role in delivering analytical solutions for Clients. As Analytics Consultant you will work with clients to identify core reporting needs and document and translate those into delivery of analytics project.
 
AREA OF EXPERTIZE:
 
 
Acceleration is part of WPP, the worldâ€™s largest advertising and marketing services group. Clients come to us to solve todayâ€™s biggest challenges, surrounding the use of data and technology, to support delivery of improved digital marketing experiences for their customers, across paid, owned and earned environments. Typically, their biggest area of investment is media, and using data and technology, to un-lock value in this area is critical. You will display a distinctive level of subject matter expertise on how to architect and deliver advertising / marketing technology and data strategies that accelerate client value, by increasing customer engagement and personalization in this area. Google is a key partner of ours, and a primary route to market â€“ knowledge of the Google Marketing Platform as well as how Google Cloud can improve marketing efforts is a strong bonus.
 
IDEAL CANDIDATE:
 
We are looking for an Analytics Consultant to offer domain expertise and client support for our UK market. You will work closely with stakeholders and various client-side departments to oversee design, development, and validation of Analytics data for the Google Analytics platforms.
This role focuses on the design and implementation of customized analytics and attribution strategies as well as creating training and deployment processes that scale globally. This includes the assessment of user-level data and integration with real-time technologies; formulating testing mechanisms to measure and optimize media performance; and overseeing the execution of recommendations for optimal performance across the wide base of paid and unpaid, online and offline media channels our clients leverage.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
 
Hands on implementation of clientsâ€™ analytics accounts including properties, user management, dashboards, and reporting
Plan, design and implement data analytics across a portfolio of digital channels and platforms in the Google Analytics 360/GA4 suite
Escalation point for Digital Analytics Consultants
Architect client-side â€œsource of truthâ€ such as a Site Analytics and Marketing Intelligence platform or dashboard
Source key customer insights through data and testing to define KPIs and inform our digital campaigns
Establish standard process for clientâ€™s digital properties to set up, maintain and track data for reach, engagement, performance and other behavior metrics
Translate the result of the attribution model/testing towards action partner with our internal team, to drive value across the Marketing channels being tracked; support diverse stakeholders by generating custom reports according to business needs
Work with developers and product owners to determine appropriate metrics and behavior to track new and existing properties

job_desc:
Function:

Business Intelligence and Data Science

Closing Date:
 
Location: Hammersmith, Reading or Manchester
 
About Us
 
Virgin Media are on a mission to become the most recommended brand by our customers. At the heart of this strategy is digital innovation and our significant data resources. The Data Development team sits within Virgin Mediaâ€™s forward thinking, fast paced change team. As we move towards an agile approach, weâ€™re looking for a Data Developer who will help drive our move to a quality technical data delivery.

So that's what we're after, but what makes us special?

The telecommunications industry in its current form is pretty uninspiring. But weâ€™re fixated on mixing that up. Our aim is to leave the pack far behind, by delivering some of those once-in-a-lifetime, rocket-to-the-stars ideas that turn the industry and customer expectations on their heads.

And why do we do it? Well, we make no secret of the fact, we want to become the most recommended brand, by our people and our customers. A massive part of that journey is about how we ensure that our forward-thinking people have a working environment in which they can truly belong and thrive. For us, it's critical that every single person can bring, and be, their whole selves at work, and we're working hard every day to achieve this.
 
Tell me more, tell me more...
 
As a Data Developer you will develop clear and well-structured plans that can be presented directly to stakeholders and senior management. Youâ€™ll need to demonstrate great skill in creativity and innovation with the ability to work in a high-pressure environment. You should have proven experience of successfully managing delivery within agile projects. We know that benefits mean so much more than the 'stuff' we can give you, so we offer a wide range of support, rewards and tools - all focused on helping you to prioritise what really matters.

All work and no play just isn't our style! We're already planning our future ways of working, for when life becomes a little more normal again. We're constantly evolving our approach to enable you to find a great work life balance.

Next steps

Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a two-stage interview process including technical and competency assessments.

When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you.

Thanks for your patience in the meantime and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media family.

job_desc:
Position Overview
 
Job Title:
 
Market Data Analytics Specialist
 
Location:
 
London
 
Corporate Title:
 
Vice President

The Chief Risk Office function has Group-wide responsibility for the management and control of all credit, market, operational, enterprise and liquidity risks and has the responsibility of continual development of methods for risk measurement, frameworks and creating a Bank wide strong risk culture. Deutsche Bank has been named Bank Risk Manager of the Year by the publication risk.net for the second consecutive year (2020 & 2021).

You will be working in the Market Data Strategy and Analytics (MDSA) team in Market & Valuation Risk Management. As part of the MDSA team, you will have the opportunity to work on Fundamental Review of the Trading Book (FRTB) on a fast-paced and high-impact project. Our market data analysts are working with cutting-edge methodologies to provide best-in-class market data time series as inputs into the risk models. You will work on innovative projects involving Machine Learning and statistical techniques, not only to generate high quality historical market data but also to forecast trends.
 
What Weâ€™ll Offer You
 
A healthy, engaged, and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. Thatâ€™s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its centre.

You can expect:
 
 
Hybrid working arrangements with the opportunity to work in the office and remotely from home
Competitive salary and non-contributory pension
30 daysâ€™ holiday plus bank holidays, with the option to purchase additional days
Life Assurance and Private Healthcare for you and your family
A range of flexible benefits including Retail Discounts, a Bike4Work scheme and Gym benefits
The opportunity to support a wide-ranging CSR programme + 2 daysâ€™ volunteering leave per year
 


Your Key Responsibilities
 
 
Quantitative modelling of market risk data using machine learning and statistical techniques
Provide subject matter expertise related to market data especially in the Interest Rate asset class
Developing proxy methodologies for risk factors across asset classes
Data validation and forecasting
Prototyping leading to deployment in production
Design and implement market data framework compliant with principles of FRTB, working closely and collaborating with Front Office, Risk Methodology, and information technology teams
 


Your Skills And Experience
 
 
Educated to Masters/PhD degree level in a numerate field (such as Quantitative finance, Mathematics, Physics) or equivalent qualification/work experience
Strong quantitative skills including a good mastery of Probability, Statistics, Derivatives Pricing Theory
Strong understanding of Market Risk framework underlying Pillar 1 and Pillar 2 models including new regulations (such as FRTB)
Experience in designing system use cases, testing new methodologies
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
 


How Weâ€™ll Support You
 
 
Training and development to help you excel in your career
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
We value diversity and as an equal opportunitiesâ€™ employer, we make reasonable adjustments for those with a disability such as the provision of assistive equipment if required (for example, screen readers, assistive hearing devices, adapted keyboards)
 


About Us And Our Teams
 
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. Click here to see what we do.

Our values define the working environment we strive to create â€“ diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.

We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

Click here to find out more about diversity and inclusion at Deutsche Bank.

job_desc:
51,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.


Weâ€™re not just engineers. Weâ€™re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planetâ€™s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?


Whatever your ambition, thereâ€™s a path for you here. And thereâ€™s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com


Worley are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Unconventional Industrial Solutions team on a full time basis in the UK. This is a hybrid / remote working role with limited requirement to travel.


Job Purpose


Analyse and interpret complex data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions. Utilise a wide variety of machine learning techniques, programming, and domain knowledge to develop predictive and prescriptive solutions to business problems.


Your place in the organisation


Unconventional Industrial Solutions is part of the Customer Solutions team which, in turn, is part of the Growth Division of Worley.


Customer Solutions


The Customer Solutions team is part of Worleyâ€™s Growth Division. Our team of consultants, technology experts, data scientists, developers and engineers support our customers as they embrace digital technology and transform their organization.


Our Mission Is To Make Energy Affordable And Accessible To Everyone - Enabled By Providing Our Clients With 5 Key Capabilities


Digital Advisory services & Human-Centric Service Design
End-to-End Digital Twins as a foundation for smart advisory
Take advisory services & breakthrough analytics solutions to the next level by productizing them and serving them to our clients & ecosystem through user-centric B2B marketplace 
Sustainability solutions
Autonomous solutions design and implementation


Unconventional Industrial Solutions


The UIS team consists of over 40 specialist practitioners located across the UK, Southeast Asia and Australia, and provides data-driven solutions for complex industrial problems.


We complement conventional engineering approaches to solving problems, by leveraging subject matter expertise and domain knowledge alongside simulation-driven design, data science and machine learning.


Our solutions increase operational safety and protect against losses, while optimised asset designs, operational parameters and maintenance strategies deliver significant savings.


Skills And Experience


Machine Learning


Skilled at building predictive models to solve a wide range of problem types, choosing the right approach(es) to maximise performance. Seeks constantly to broaden repertoire of ML approaches used. Able to work in a variety of machine learning applications and coding libraries.
Can demonstrate hands-on experience in at least four of the following machine learning applications: Regression, Classification, Clustering, Dimensionality Reduction, Deep Learning (AI), Reinforcement Learning, Optimisation.
Au fair with current machine learning tools and platforms such as Python, IBM, Knime, Github, R, Spark, Weka, Amazon ML, Azure ML etc.


Analytical Knowledge


Design an analytical project incorporating the right approaches and datasets to solve a given problem
Mine data to understand its quality and distribution, informing model choice and transformations needed
Perform statistical tests on model output to assess performance and ensure the validity of conclusions.


Applied Analysis and Insight


Draw on domain expertise to choose the most appropriate analytical approach. 
Work with customers and subject matter experts throughout a project to ensure data is interpreted correctly and solutions are viable. 
Present models to non-technical audiences in compelling business-oriented terms.
Present data in a visually compelling and elegant way making it easy to interpret and draw conclusions
Experience in analysis of IOT/Sensor Data to solve problems in an industrial setting.


Technical


Write code to access and process diverse data types from a range of on-prem and cloud sources. 
Familiar with cloud computing and big data technologies (Azure, AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Snowflake etc).
Comfortable working on data platforms, such as Snowflake or Databricks, to manipulate data to engineer model features.
Familiarity with the technologies used to validate, monitor and deploy ML models (Tensorflow, ML Flow, AWS Studio, Docker, Kubernetes etc).


Softer Skills


Spend time with customers to fully understand the challenges and the nuances of their organisation and data.
Develop generalised approaches to solving problems in models and code. 
Bring data and analytics to life through storytelling, and excellent written and verbal skills
Be comfortable working in Agile project-management frameworks.


Qualifications And Experience


Undergraduate/Masters degree in STEM or other numerate subjects. Plus 3 or more years relevant working experience.


OR


PhD in a relevant field (Machine Learning, Industrial Analytics etc.) plus one year commercial experience


What We Offer You


Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.


Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.


If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.

This is a unique opportunity to join our experienced and multidisciplinary company, which has developed a revolutionary DNA synthesis technology. The successful candidate will have a key role in the development of an informatics pipeline that allows us to scale up our technology towards the production of thousands of genes per week and support innovative research activities.

job_desc:
Addeparâ€™s purpose is to maximize the positive impact of the worldâ€™s capital. More than 850 of the worldâ€™s leading financial services firms trust Addepar to unlock the power and possibility of informed, data-driven investing and advice. These family offices, wealth managers, banks and institutions use Addeparâ€™s tech and data platform to deliver exceptional value to their clients in a modern, scalable and secure way.

Our clients use Addepar to manage and advise on more than $4 trillion in assets. Our board and investors are some of the best in the business: D1 Capital, WestCap, 8VC and Valor Equity Partners have led our last few rounds.

Weâ€™re now expanding Addeparâ€™s business around the globe, with clients in more than 30 countries. Weâ€™re constantly doubling down on tech- and data-fueled innovation, and our product and platform roadmap is more ambitious today than ever. We place our clients at the center of everything we do, and see a virtually unlimited set of opportunities to expand our client footprint and deepen the value we can unlock by building together.

Addepar is a Forbes Fintech 50 company and an honored member of the CB Insights Fintech 250. Addepar embraces a global flexible workforce model with offices in Silicon Valley, New York City, Salt Lake City, Chicago, London, England, Edinburgh, Scotland and Pune, India.
 
 
Marketplace and brokerage services provided by Acervus Securities, Inc., an SEC registered brokerâ€‘dealer and member FINRA / SIPC.
 


The Role
 
Part of the broader Addepar Product organization, the Data Operations team is responsible for ensuring Addepar's clients have timely and high quality data. This will include overseeing the processing of transactions and positions so that it meets client timelines, ensuring data quality through verification checks, and helping clients with their data support questions. The Data Operations team sits at the nexus of Addepar's activity and requires daily communications with data providers, clients, and other personnel within Data Operations and across the firm.

Demonstrates excellent attention to details and a passion for problem solving!
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills for engaging with internal and external stakeholders.

Very team-oriented, solution oriented, and forward thinking.
Technical skills preferred in any or all of the following: Microsoft Excel, VBA, SQL, Python, Salesforce, Jira, Bloomberg, Thomson Reuters, or other common financial services systems and applications.
 


Our Values

Build Together - Collaborate to unlock the best solutions. Deliver lasting value.
 
Champion Our Clients - Exceed client expectations. Our clientsâ€™ success is our success.
 
Drive Innovation - Be bold and unconstrained in problem solving. Transform the industry.
 
Embrace Learning - Engage our community to broaden our perspective. Bring a growth mindset.
 


In addition to our core values, Addepar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We seek to bring together diverse ideas, experiences, skill sets, perspectives, backgrounds and identities to drive innovative solutions. We commit to promoting a welcoming environment where inclusion and belonging are held as a shared responsibility.

WHO WE ARE:
Our Public Sector team has achieved some of the largest growth of both people and projects across NTT Data UK and this position represents a key role within this business unit.

...AND FINALLY:
The focus on Clients First, Teamwork and Foresight is in our DNA and we are looking for someone who shares and embodies these core values, leading by example.
We don't look for finished articles. We look for people who want to continue their career growth alongside NTT DATA 's.
We are proud supporters of Women in DataÂ®. Connect, engage and belong to the largest free female data community in the UK â€“ visit: www.womenindata.co.uk to join our community.

Knowledge of Fraud Prevention processes and an understanding of UK legal system or Industry best practice in relation to fraud
Understanding or knowledge of Skyâ€™s products and services alongside an awareness of current and possible future business trends, as well as their potential impact on the company
A high level of personal integrity, confidentiality and professionalism. You will conduct yourself in a collaborative, confident and professional manner when dealing with the business, industry and stakeholders, and when representing the business, whilst working with sensitive information
The ability to work under pressure whilst ensuring accuracy and meeting tight deadlines, particularly with real-time decision-making requirements
Proactive and self-motivated, proficient in standard Microsoft Office and experience in learning custom IT software, with a desire for continuous improvement


 
Customer Service Group
 
In our Customer Service Group Team, we strive to offer the best customer service through our amazing people. Whether youâ€™re a frontline colleague speaking to a customer, or one of brilliant support people, youâ€™ll have the passion for creating great experiences for our people and our customers. We help connect our customers to the products and entertainment that they love, and as part of our fast-paced team, no two days are the same.
 
The Rewards:
 
There's a reason people can't stop talking about #LifeAtSky. Our great range of rewards really are something special, here are just a few:
 
 
Sky Q, for the TV you love all in one place
A generous pension package
Private healthcare
Discounted mobile and broadband


 
How you'll work:
 
We know the world has changed, and we want to offer our employees the chance to collaborate at our unique office spaces, whilst enjoying the convenience of working from home.
 
We've adopted a hybrid working approach to give more flexibility on where and how we work. You'll find out more about what this means for this role during the recruitment process.
 
Your office base:
 
Osterley:
 
Our Osterley Campus is a 10-minute walk from Syon Lane train station. Or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from Osterley, Gunnersbury, Ealing Broadway and South Ealing tube stations. Thereâ€™s also plenty of bike shelters and showers.
 
On campus, youâ€™ll find 13 subsidised restaurants, cafes, and a Waitrose. You can keep in shape at our subsidised gym, catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema, get your car washed and even get pampered at our beauty salon!
 
Or
 
Dunfermline
 
Weâ€™re just off Forth Road Bridge in a bustling business park 10 minutes from Rosyth train station. If youâ€™re not catching the train donâ€™t worry, thereâ€™s plenty of secure onsite parking for cars, motorbikes and bicycles.
 
Youâ€™ll be well fed at our subsidised canteen, and you can keep in shape at our onsite gym, play a game of pool and make use of our handy corner shop.
 
Inclusion:
 
We take pride in our approach to diversity and inclusion: weâ€™ve been recognised by The Times and Stonewall for this, and weâ€™ve committed Â£30million to support the fight against racial injustice. Weâ€™ve also set ambitious targets for increasing ethnic diversity and representation throughout our organisation.
 
At Sky we donâ€™t just look at your CV. Weâ€™re more focused on who you are and your potential. We also know that everyone has a life outside work, so we're happy to discuss flexible working.
 
And we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. If you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process, speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to support you.
 
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
 
Why wait?
 
Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We canâ€™t wait to hear from you.
 
To find out more about working with us, search
 
#LifeAtSky
 
on social media.
 
A job you love to talk about.
 
Just so you know: if your application is successful, weâ€™ll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have, we might have to withdraw the offer.

job_desc:
Overview
 
You will deliver descriptive, prescriptive and predictive MI products and services for both existing products and work with consultant to conceptualise and execute new product dev.Â  Approaching visualisation with a brilliant mix of art and science, you will create a meaningful, impactful and insightful windows into our clients data warehouses.
 
Key Accountabilities and main responsibilities

You will be our go-to MI Analyst, creating meaningful, impactful and insightful analysis and visual storyboards for our internal and external clients

Intermediate SQL skills
Comfortable working with both internal and external clients.
Up to date knowledge of Power BI ecosystem and new functionality
A good understanding of the Power BI ecosystem
 
Knowledge of data model design for Analytics
A curious disposition, interested in the â€˜whyâ€™ as well as the â€˜whatâ€™
Experience visualising descriptive and predictive models and analytics
Knowledge of financial services, extra points for Pension or Mortgage markets.
Understanding of cloud principles and can optimise appropriately.
 


 
Nice to have
 
 
Experience with Azure, data warehousing principles, Snowflake
Experience with Python
Understanding of CX and visualisation theory


 
Governance & Risk

Support Link Group assurance programs that deliver effective risk management and compliance practices


 
Experience & Personal Attributes
 
Academic & Trade Qualifications
 
 
Qualification in Analytics, Data Science, Data Visualisation, Computer Science or related.


 
Work Experience & Skills
 
 
Excellent knowledge of Data Analysis, MI and visualisation Principles
Experience building data models, algorithms for data warehouse and Management Intelligence solutions
Experience workshopping with business to inform design
PowerBI experience


 
Personal Qualities & Behavioural Details
 
 
Approach work with enthusiasm, positivity and resilience
A strong team player with the ability to work independently and take responsibility for assigned tasks and projects
Highly organised and flexible, with a desire for excellence and attention to detail
A willingness to assist with tasks outside core responsibilities as required
Generous in sharing time and knowledge with colleagues
Outstanding communication skills to handle enquiries in a friendly, patient, efficient and courteous manner

job_desc:
Location:
 
Whiteley or Swindon
 
Salary:
 
Â£21,500 per annum
 
Apprenticeship:
 
Level 4 Data Analyst
 
Start Date:
 
September 2023
 
Closing date for applications:
 
19 March 2023
 
Insurance is so much more than you think!
 
Are you looking for a career that will excite, challenge and inspire you? If so, this apprenticeship could be the ideal role for you! Youâ€™ll find the perfect balance of real life, on the job experience, whilst having time to complete your studies and earn qualifications too. With plenty of support around you, youâ€™ll have lots of opportunities to shape and grow your career and to make a difference to our customers at a time when they need us the most.
 
Your Opportunity
 
On the Data and analytics Apprenticeship programme you will learn the fundamental skills across data and analytics to build a future career across the discipline. You will build knowledge across several technologies in Business Intelligence, Data Engineering and Cloud computing disciplines.

You will work alongside some of the best and most experienced data professionals the industry has to offer across our Chief Data Office. Working on innovative projects for our UK business, you will have the ability to learn and experience the full data and digital journey from acquisition to data led decision making.

You will be at the forefront of change to future-proof our business for our customers and our people â€“ Are you up for the challenge? We put the customer at the heart of everything that we do, and we need like-minded people to join us on our journey.â€¯

The length of your apprenticeship will vary dependant on course provider and scheme. Rest assured; we will support your studies alongside your permanent role.
 
What can I look forward to?
 
Being a Data and Analytics Apprentice, no two days will be the same. You will have the opportunity to use data and the latest technology to solve business challenges and create innovative solutions to drive new opportunities for our business. To achieve this, you will be working closely with stakeholders at all levels from across our business, to deliver value for them and our customers.

There will be a combination of in house and external training, all tailored to your needs. You will learn from extremely talented and knowledgeable colleagues from across the Chief Data Office, who will support you in your apprenticeship journey. .
 
Whatâ€™s in it for you?
 
As well as joining a company that is passionate about our people, sustainability and our customers, we also have a competitive rewards and lifestyle benefits package. Weâ€™re also the #1 best place to work in the insurance industry (Glassdoor Employeesâ€™ Choice award, 2022).

Youâ€™ll receive:
 
 
Â£21,500 per annum starting salary
 
25 days holiday plus an additional 3 volunteering days
 
Contribution to Private medical cover
 
12% company pension contribution
 
Annual company bonus
 
Discounted gym membership
 
Discounted gadget insurance
 
Discounted technology offers
 


What Youâ€™ll Need
 
 
A minimum of 5 GCSEs (or equivalent) at grade C/4 including Maths and English
 
A professional attitude with a positive â€˜can doâ€™ approach to your work
 
Strong communication skills
 
Ability to build and develop strong relationships
 
Keen interest in data and digital technologies
 
Open to learning new skills through â€˜hands onâ€™ experience and classroom learning
 


Youâ€™ll need to decide on your single choice of apprenticeship programme when you submit your application, so please take time to make sure youâ€™ve chosen the one that is right for you.
 
Are you ready to create a brighter future?
 
At Zurich our brand purpose is to create a brighter future together, for our customers, our partners, our employees and the planet. Itâ€™s a promise that for our customers, we will put their needs at the heart of everything we do and for our employees, to grow and develop together. For our partners, to collaborate to create mutual value and for the planet, to drive positive impact by integrating our sustainability work into how we do business. We put our customers at the heart of everything that we do, and weâ€™re looking for like-minded people to join us on our journey.

Weâ€™re passionate about diversity and inclusion, we want our people to bring the whole of themselves to work. Youâ€™ll have every opportunity to use your drive and enthusiasm to innovate the future of Zurich. Everybody is made to feel welcome, different opinions are valued, personal needs are respected, and opportunity is equal for all
 
So, make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported, Love what you do. Work for us.
 
Please note
 
We are unable to progress your application if you don't meet our criteria due the requirements of our apprenticeship providers. Please ensure you have the right to work in the UK before you apply as we are unable to provide sponsorship.
title: Data Apprenticeship 2023

job_desc:
Job Summary
The acquisition, development, construction, and operation of Cubicoâ€™s renewable energy assets, together with the associated business processes, create a diverse mix of data with significant potential for procedural efficiency gains and value add through data analytics and automation.
As a Data Engineer you would support the business to advance its maturity level in relation to data management and help prepare Cubico to face the challenges of the future.
 
You will be a part of small team that is responsible for delivering Cubicoâ€™s Data Strategy: to build data capabilities of teams across Cubico and to apply these capabilities to better achieve their business objectives. Your role will require interaction with colleagues across all regions, departments and seniority levels in Cubico. You will support the identification and realisation of opportunities to use data, analytics, and automation wherever they align with Cubicoâ€™s business strategies.
 
Day to day, you will work closely with the Data Manager while also consulting, collaborating, and enabling various teams across Cubico to streamline business processes and arrive at better business decisions using data and analytics. You will drive projects but also contribute to a change in culture around data.
 
Cubico is in the early stages of a journey towards data maturity. By joining the team at this early stage, you have a unique opportunity to help shape and establish the role of data and related processes throughout Cubico. Further to this, by working across business functions you will have a unique opportunity to learn how an independent energy producer functions. This role will also provide an opportunity to travel internationally to visit various Cubico offices/renewable energy assets all over the globe.
 
The role is based in London, UK, and will report to the Data Manager in a two-person central team which is expected to grow in the future.
 
 
Requirements:
Essential Competencies:
 
Strong communicator with an ability to build strong relationship with people across reporting boundaries and departments and to translate complex problems clearly and in nontechnical terms.
Collaborative and adept at working in cross-functional teams to identify and prioritise data-related needsDriven and able to take initiative while contributing to the ongoing development of our data strategy and envision how data can help Cubico teams achieve their outcomes
An understanding of how tools such as Python/ Power BI or Azure (or AWS) can help teams build capabilities and achieve business outcomes.


 
Technical Capabilities:
 
Experience in data management and analysis and maintaining data management systems
Experience with tools such as: Excel, Power BI and Power Automate
Data visualisation skills (tools such as Tableau and Power BI)
Experience in computing languages such as Python, SQL.
Experience building Data Pipelines preferably through Azure or AWS would be advantageous
Experience in the management of operational data, preferably from renewable energy assets, e.g., Primary/secondary SCADA data, systems, and analysis an advantage.
Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Computer, Data Science, Data Engineering, or related field.


 
 
Behavioural Competencies:
The ideal profile of an individual in this role is open and outward-looking, self-motivated, with well-rounded interpersonal skills and adept at working in different cultures.
 
You know how to use data and analytics effectively, are collaborative, inclusive and passionate about making great products and services that make peopleâ€™s life's easier.
 
A role in the data team often involves identifying problems and finding solutions using data, so being proactive and innovative is important. More than that you get excited to learn new skills while solving very different problems in each project.
 
 
About Cubico Sustainable Investments
Cubico Sustainable Investments (Cubico), a London-headquartered firm, is one of the worldâ€™s leaders in providing renewable energy across the Americas and Europe. Cubico was established in 2015 to manage and invest in renewable energy assets globally. Owned equally by Ontario Teachersâ€™ Pension Plan and PSP Investments, the firm has significant capital to invest and is committed to a long-term growth strategy designed to make it one of the largest and best in class renewable energy investors in the world.
 
Cubico holds a portfolio of around 5 GW, with assets across the wind, solar PV, solar thermal and transmission line technologies. Covering the whole energy chain from development and construction to operation, the companyâ€™s portfolio is located across 12 countries: Brazil, Colombia, Mexico, Uruguay, the United States (USA), France, Greece, Italy, Portugal, Spain, the United Kingdom (UK) and Australia.
 
Cubico is driven by five core values: diversity, respect, integrity, value creation and excellence, which make up our sixth value, DRIVE. These values encourage employees to take pride and satisfaction in their work, strive to achieve their goals and go the extra mile to attain outstanding results. Cubicoâ€™s employees are central to its success and, as a result, the company looks for people who believe in its purpose, will take full account of its impact and are motivated to make a positive contribution to the world.
 
As part of Cubico culture and values, we embrace diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building talented teams that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We particularly encourage applications from under-represented minority groups.
title: Data Engineer

job_desc:
Data Analytics Apprenticeship Trainer
 
Hybrid working (The role is remote with some travel onsite to any QA Learning sites)
 
 
 
You will be teaching Data Analytics programmes at Level 3 & 4 as part of our apprenticeship programme delivery. You will deliver immersive learning experiences, ensuring engagement through the use of collaboration tools.
 
 
 
 
Key Responsibilities
 
Deliver high quality teaching and learning to individuals and groups, as required
Deliver immersive learning experiences, ensuring engagement through the use of collaboration tools
Contribute to improvements to the scheme of learning, lesson plans, teaching and learning materials and resources to meet the qualification requirements
Contribute to business success by identifying and proactively pursuing opportunities for improvement, supporting the sales teams with specialist knowledge where required
Contribute to business success by driving the completion of learner evaluations and identifying and referring opportunities for improvement
Take ownership for own continuous professional development to ensure up to date and relevant delivery
Ensure programme delivery is in line with Apprenticeship Standards


 
 
 
Skills and experiences:
 
 
You will have good experience using data tools such as PowerBi and Tableau
Have proficiency in the use of Python and SQL programming languages
You will also have experience in using and good knowledge of:
Data manipulation & visualisations
Data modelling
Data architecture and cloud
Data analytics and statistics
You will have passion for learning and enabling learner success
A customer-oriented approach to work
Be a team player, able to work virtually and independently
Ability to adapt to rapid change and cope with difficult situations
You will be confident in presenting in front of a classroom and online
title: Data Analytics Apprenticeship Trainer

job_desc:
Nisbets celebrates its 40th anniversary this year and we have come a long way from humble beginnings in 1983 to the international company we are today. We constantly look for ways to expand our reach and deepen our impact further into existing markets, so the entrepreneurial spirit is alive and well still!
 
A key role in our digital strategy is to appoint an additional Digital Implementation Analyst who can work closely with all out digital teams to provide data extraction and tagging expertise. As our Digital Implementation Analyst, you will be own our Digital Analytics from a technical and administrator perspective
.
 
The role requires an excellent knowledge of tag management systems with hands-on practical experience of implementing analytics tagging. This is a growing team and because you interface with all our digital functions, you will get to work with some highly skilled individuals and be involved with key projects across the business. We think this role will suit a Digital Implementation Analyst from either an agency background who is used to working with multiple clients, or someone working in house who is looking for a broader based role with more scope for progression.
 
â€‹
We fully support a hybrid working model and are happy to discuss a working pattern that suits your needs but we would like contact time in the Bristol office once a month. .
 
What will I be doing as a Digital Implementation Analyst?
 
Planning and delivering tracking for both new and existing website features
Ensuring marketing activities are tracked and measured in a robust and efficient manner
Providing ongoing assessment and audit of current analytics tools and our data layer, working to continually improve both new and existing tags
Ensuring all data collected and made available via analytics is GDPR compliant
To provide support to the wider Ecommerce team, enabling best practice reporting, collaborate in the design of dashboarding, segmentation and KPIs
Ongoing data collection hygiene; investigate and fix data accuracy issues
Ongoing maintenance of user groups and users


 
What can I expect as a Digital Implementation Analyst?
 
We recognise that people are our biggest asset and we aim to offer a supportive work environment in which all people can thrive. As a family owned business we have very much maintained that sense of family in all our teams, where we all pull together to achieve success. We look after you too, as an employee you will receive a really good range of benefits which includes:-
 
 
Competitive base salary with an annual performance related bonus which can be up to 6%
25 days holiday plus your birthday off with the option to earn 4 additional days holiday or a cash bonus, based on your attendance.
Heavily subsidised canteen on site serving a range of hot food and drinks
Access to discounts and cashback across hundreds of retailers via our platform called The Kitchen Access to a confidential Employee Assistance Programme with Health Assured offering 24/7 advice and guidance
Huge discounts on our full range of products, with up to 60% off our own brand labels
Option to purchase private healthcare at a subsidised rate
On going training and support through our learning management system which houses a broad range of courses and content, with the chance to also take industry recognised qualifications
Liftshare scheme, share your commute to work with a colleague and save money, and the planet
Charity giving, do your bit by donating to charity through salary sacrifice
 


 
Nisbets is committed to providing equality of opportunity for all colleagues. We aim to ensure our workplaces are free from discrimination and that not only colleagues but also our potential future colleagues are treated fairly and with dignity and respect. Therefore, please inform us of any reasonable adjustments that we may need to make to the application or interview process.
