job_desc:
About Preqin
 
You will be joining the worldâ€™s leading data and insights provider for the alternative assets market. We empower the global financial community with critical information and leading analytics solutions to help them make faster and smarter investment decisions, and to make them with confidence. A forward-thinking company, we lead our industry through innovation. We trust in the power of data, and we use it to increase transparency in alternatives. We believe that access to information leads to more investment in the ideas and infrastructure that build strong communities.
 
Job Overview
 
The Company Intelligence Team aims to analyze, research, and collect sponsored-back company information. The team will be responsible for extracting data points such as executive and board director information, business operating activities, company financial data, shares and equity allotment, and sponsored-back transaction data points. In the long run, we will provide strong company information by building relationships with service providers and investors to obtain information. New hires will have the opportunity to enhance our offerings and to bring innovation and creativity to build and strengthen our new product.
 
The data collected and analysis produced by the researchers will help clients to:
 
Evaluate a GPâ€™s track record at a company level (incl. financial & non-financial metrics, investment partner involvements/ deal team information etc.).
Gain insights on which investments drive fund-level return.
Drive better business development based on portfolio company relationships (incl. service provider involvement, board memberships, GP, and LP collaborations etc.)
Evaluate direct and co-investing opportunities for LPs.


 
The successful candidate will be taking responsibility for the research, input, and quality of deal-related data. This role involves research, data collection and verification of data on deals and exits predominately in the private equity/private debt/venture capital industry. The position will allow you to gain/expand your knowledge of private capital investments globally. With responsibility for the quality and research of â€˜Dealsâ€™ data and with a remit of rapid growth in this area, this role provides an excellent opportunity to make a key difference to the London team and the wider Company Intelligence business unit. Opportunities are also available to contribute towards the production of bespoke data analysis for Preqin users and the financial press, as well as Preqinâ€™s reports and publications.
 
 
In this role you will:
 
 
 
Daily tracking of online news and conducting in-depth online research on private equity and venture capital deals.
Processing and inputting of deal information onto the online databases in a timely manner.
Reviewing large amounts of data from multiple sources and curating the relevant facts.
Performing data quality assurance checks and occasionally liaising with the team in other offices to provide feedback on the quality of their output.
Occasionally communicating with fund managers via phone and email to obtain accurate information on their investments.
Occasionally performing statistical analysis using MS Excel and putting together reports for publications and client data requests.
Writing in the â€˜houseâ€™ style to compose online profiles and occasionally provide input to reports and publications.
With experience, the candidate will be expected be responsible for sections of the data and to become an expert in that research area.


 
 
You are a good fit if:
 
Native fluency in English (other languages are a bonus)
Education level - Bachelorâ€™s Degree (or equivalent)
Excellent research abilities, being able to exhibit persistence, patience, and a keen eye for detail to successfully gather valuable information.
A self-starter with proactive approach to dealing with issues, investigating anomalies and a desire to get to the bottom of a problem.
A keen interest in the alternative assets and/or finance industry.
Comfortable working with numerical data.
Analytical thinker.
Strong team player who can successfully collaborate with colleagues across teams and offices but also has the ability, confidence, and enthusiasm to work independently and take on a project.
Diligence to meet targets and quality standards.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills; able to effectively communicate with high level executives via phone and email.
Relevant work experience in a research-led environment is desirable (particularly experience working in a research capacity covering private equity/venture capital/M&A deals) but not essential. We are looking for individuals who are enthusiastic, confident, and keen to learn.


 
 
Company Benefits:
 
 
The opportunity to work within a well-regarded organisation in a fast-growing sector.
Develop your career in a high growth company with an international presence.
Subsidized Private Medical Insurance via BUPA, after successful completion of 3 months should you wish to.
Interest-free season ticket loans on completion of probation.
A pension plan under auto-enrolment which currently requires a minimum employee contribution of 5% of annual salary. This is matched by an employer contribution of 4%. You can opt to contribute more should you wish to. After your 1-year service with the company the employer contribution will be enhanced to match your contribution up to a maximum of 10% of your pensionable earnings. This means that if you are contributing the minimum contribution of 5%, after your 1-year service, Preqin will automatically uplift the company contribution to 5% of annual salary.
Cycle to work scheme.
Study support of up to Â£900 per annum for relevant business qualifications and enhanced support of up to $2,500 for CAIA.
Excellent Offices in London close to Victoria station and the proximity to many shops and restaurants and Londonâ€™s West End.
Company-sponsored sports teams.
Winter and summer office parties and a company-funded team social budget.


 
 
Our culture and values are:
 
 
Be Customer obsessed
We exist for our customers. We listen to them and understand their challenges. We design best-in-class data solutions for their success.
 
Act with integrity
 
We build trust through honesty and transparency. Weâ€™re committed to doing the right thing for our customers, our company, and each other.
 
Own your success
 
Weâ€™re a high-performance team. We challenge and champion each other in our pursuit of excellence. We never stop learning and strive to become experts in our fields
 
Think forward
 
We lead the industry through innovation. We foster collaboration and creativity to solve our clientsâ€™ next challenge and give them a competitive advantage.
 
Make an impact
 
We drive positive change as individuals, and as a company. Weâ€™re passionate about creating a better tomorrow for our industry and our communities.
 
 
Equal Opportunities at Preqin:
Preqin is an equal opportunity employer where diversity is at the heart of our business. It is the policy of Preqin to ensure equal employment and consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information, socioeconomic status, political affiliation, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Preqin is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, so everyone has the opportunity to be successful. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please let the Preqin recruiter know at the start of the application process. Reasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process.

job_desc:
Systems Analyst
 
Full Time (Hybrid Working)
Paying Â£28,000 - Â£33,000
Permanent
 
 
Our client is looking to recruit a Systems Analyst to develop and offer a specialist management information reporting service to managers, supervisors and members of staff who are required to perform management functions. You will ensure that accurate and relevant management information is available to meet organisational needs and to provide resilience and support in respect of Systems administration and focusing on quality regarding service request information to produce bespoke reports that provide individual score cards and managing the reporting for SLAs and performance for the Contact Centre.
 
Key responsibilities of the Systems Analyst:
 
Design, develop and produce a comprehensive range of management information reports in respect of personnel, sickness absence and all other aspects of the personnel function in order to meet the needs of the Contact Centre.
Undertake analysis, write reports and draw conclusions in respect of personnel management information to ensure that all reported information is accurate, meaningful and correctly interpreted both within the organisation and externally.
Liaise and negotiate with managers and users after analysing business case requirements to produce both corporate and local specialist defined management information reports in order to support the SLAs and performance management for the Contact Centre.
Develop and provide a specialist advisory service for all staff in respect of business systems, processes and management reporting to support all users of the Personnel IT Systems working in a devolved management structure.
Lead the provision, analysis for Freedom of Information requests working with the department Team Leaders.
Assist the Team Leaders in maintaining the quality of data held on the Personnel IT system, creating new users, managing access and security in order to provide resilience and business continuity. Undertaking all systems administration duties whenever required on behalf of the Contact Centre.
Assist the Team Leaders in maintaining user access controls, user accounts and general application administration in respect of Oracle Discoverer to ensure that users have the relevant access. Also working with the Health and Safety systems to ensure all requirements are met such as DSE and highlighting any focus needed on these requirements by the management team.
Provide system administration support in respect of the data analysis tool and to provide advice and guidance for users to ensure that accurate, relevant and timely information is available including team score cards, managing quality checks and providing detailed reporting on all management information.
Develop the relationship with the IT Support Helpdesk and CSD, in order to maximise system availability by assisting with process of identifying and resolving ticket requests on behalf of the Contact Centre. Liaise and negotiate with technical support staff concerning issues such as report scheduling, change control, implementation and testing of upgrades and system customisation in order to provide an efficient up to date system.
To participate and contribute to the Departmental planning process on all aspects of data handling, management information, data protection and information security issues setting targets and goals where appropriate and monitoring performance against objectives.


 
Key requirements for the Systems Analyst:
 
Educated to quality management level in order to advise and make recommendations relating to compliance with relevant legislation
Detailed, wide-ranging knowledge of personnel policies, procedures and systems.
Comprehensive knowledge of computer systems with particular emphasis on Personnel IT Systems applications built up through years of experience in data administration. Must be advanced skill in Microsoft Office especially Excel and Powerpoint.
A detailed knowledge of analytical and reporting software tools to enable effective and accurate reporting of management information for use within the organisation and also for external bodies.
The ability to analyse large amounts of data and information, produce reports and draw conclusions to ensure that information is taken in context, is interpreted correctly and supports the decision-making process for senior managers.
The ability to be able to communicate (both verbally and in writing) confidently and effectively with individuals at all levels ranging from senior management executives to general operative staff both from within the organisation and externally on technical and procedural issues relating to personnel management information including the presentation of recommendations to management.
The ability to analyse specific business requirements within the personnel management environment and where appropriate use the specialist knowledge obtained to influence and recommend procedural and technical solutions to capture data and report accordingly.
A thorough, meticulous knowledge of information handling and data security protocols and the use of audit techniques and functionality to monitor compliance.
 


If you are interested in this
 
Systems Analyst
 
position and feel your experience matches the criteria then please apply now for immediate consideration or for more information please contact Andrew Davison.
 
Medlock Partners are a professional services recruitment specialist operating across the North West of England. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and circumstances, including minorities and those with disabilities. Please note our advertisements use years' experience and salary levels purely as a guide. We are happy to consider applications from all candidates who are able to demonstrate the skills necessary to fulfil the role. If you do not hear from us within 48 hours please assume that your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion.
title: System Analyst

job_desc:
We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet
 
Who We Are
 
Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.
 
About The Role
 
The Audience Strategy team is seeking strong Data Analysts with an interest in commercial/ marketing insights and a strong background in (social) data science to understand, build and optimise our growth strategies and support the marketing automation effort across the company.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in allowing us to create value from our different data sets, by way of in-depth analysis of marketing data, visualisation of results, segmenting and understanding our audiences so we can tailor the perfect experience to them.

You will be turning data into actionable insights according to business and marketing requirements, analyzing customer behaviour, touch points and providing integrated dashboards. All while ensuring data quality to provide improvement to business processes and impact decision-making.
 
What You Will Be Doing
 
 
Work with data streams to bring in the needed data and insights to our CRM and our campaigns.
Query our database to create new audience segments and coordinate with the journey team to create customer journeys for them.
Implement and optimize CRM audience segmentation for growth.
Define and conceptualise scoring and tagging systems.
Work with the Marketing Automation teams to build successful campaigns and create a seamless researcher experience.
Manage data analysis and reporting of our marketing automation and CRM integrations.
Support measurement and campaign effectiveness, generating audience insights using closed-loop reporting between our marketing automation platform, data reporting tool and Salesforce.
Monitor the performance (dashboards and publishing monitoring KPIs), forecast performance through predictive analytics, and recommend remedial actions through prescriptive analytics.
Develop strategies for effective data analysis and reporting, defining measurement requirements.
 


About You
 
Must haves:
 
 
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a data analytics, business intelligence or similar role, ideally working on marketing projects.
Experience building audiences for retargeting, nurturing and growth.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL (BigQuery) and working with large data sets.
Expert knowledge of Tableau and other data visualisation tools, preferably in the Salesforce ecosystem.
Strong understanding of the marketing tech stack (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce CDP, Pardot, Google 360, Advertising Studioâ€¦).
Strong understanding of how databases work, types of data, types of relationsâ€¦
High level of personal initiative and very good strategic and analytical skills.
Excellent communications skills and ability to simplify advanced statistical concepts for a layman audience.
Ability to produce clear and concise data-driven reports and presentations.
Ability to liaise with data engineers.
Fluency in verbal and written English.
 


Preferable:
 
 
Desirable 3+ years of experience working with digital marketing data and marketing automation platforms (Pardot, Marketing Cloud, Advertising Studio).
Basic experience with data sources integration with Salesforce Customer Data Platform.
Basic knowledge of Saleswings and Google Analytics 360 for behavioural analysis.
Working knowledge of integration and data flow between marketing systems and Salesforce.
Working knowledge of APIs, data connectors, and other pipelines.
Experience in marketing operations for technology products.
Data modelling capability with large data sets leveraging an established BI solution (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, CRM Analytics).
Certified in Einstein Analytics is a nice to have.
 


Benefits
 
With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.
 
100% remote working
 
Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).
 
Learning and development
 
All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.
 
Wellbeing
 
We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.
 
Volunteering opportunities
 
Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.
 
Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination â€“ including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

This could be the perfect role for you.
 
Together, we engage with everything we have and are, to help humankind act braver and better.
 
About Great Lakes Insurance SE:
 
As specialty provider of primary insurance services in the UK, Great Lakes Insurance SE, UK Branch is a substantial part of our parent, Great Lakes Insurance SE in Munich. Our interlocked business model is to seize opportunities closely connected to the reinsurance core business and innovation opportunities, in our role as an integral part of the Munich Re Group. Great Lakes Insurance SE (GL) currently operates from its Head Quarter in Munich, and via branch offices in UK, Switzerland, Italy and Australia!
 
In the UK, Great Lakes is currently undergoing the authorisation process from the Prudential Regulatory Authority and Financial Conduct Authority for a Third Country Branch and a Subsidiary. These two entities will secure our future in the primary insurance service market in a post-Brexit world, by enabling us to continue writing our existing business.
 
It is an exciting time to join our growing and evolving organisation, help us shape the future of primary insurance service provision!
 
About the role:
 
The Agency Management Platform (AMP) is the core data platform supporting GLâ€™s delegated authority (DA) business which is one of GLâ€™s major business segments. A key component of the platform is DFEnS, our agent portal/ bordereau intake solution which is closely linked to the agency lifecycle workflow and to our financial accounting and reporting systems. This role is a full time role supporting the AMP data team in all aspects regarding data management on the AMP platform, e.g.: managing regulatory and financial data from insurance intermediaries and supporting the BAU process for DFEnS. The role requires close collaboration with our business teams and deep involvement in various facets of GLâ€™s DA processes. Given the increasing importance of data â€“ and therefore of DFEnS/ AMP â€“ for GLâ€™s business success this role offers a wide spectrum of responsibilities, tasks and learning opportunities, from a technical as well as from a business perspective.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
Working closely with the DFEnS system and GL Data Team you will:
 
 
Support business with their data analysis and reporting requirements
Analyse Data Quality
Support on-board MGAs to our DFEnS system
Resolve data questions/issues
Support the business users with each MGAs go-live
Engage with the business and the internal IT team to raise feature requests thus actively shaping our continuous enhancements process
Perform quality assurance, system and user acceptance testing
Provide support and training to the external and internal users where required
Respond to and resolve escalations with internal and external service providers
Utilise appropriate tools and techniques to support change activities
Actively commit to the improvement of GL data management processes and systems
Undertake learning of IT offerings to identify and provide business units with expertise and advice on how best to utilise within their business processes

Key Skills & Experience:
 
Essential
 
 
Strong data analytics/ data management experience
Background in relational database design, SQL and data visualisation
Strong communication, facilitation & presentation
Experience of stakeholder management at all levels of the organisation, including senior executive.
Strong technical understanding with problem solving abilities.
 


 
Desirable

Strong understanding of IT business architecture design and operating models.
Ability to work with third parties and offshore development teams.

Thought Leader:
 
You are seen as an expert in your field and will be the â€˜go toâ€™ person for your area of specialism within Munich Re. You will be seen as a role model/mentor to others â€“ identifying opportunities to share your knowledge. Demonstrate and role model inclusive behaviour and encourage your colleagues to play an active role in creating an inclusive culture as well. Treat your colleagues and sales and business partners fairly and with respect.
 
Regulatory & Conduct Requirements:
 
In addition to the responsibilities set out above, the Data Analyst, Agency Management role will be responsible for: Ensuring compliance with Munich Reâ€™s Code of Conduct and the FCA Conduct Rules.
 
Benefits
 
You will be rewarded with a competitive salary, on target bonus, 25 days annual leave with the option to purchase more along with private medical insurance and employers contributory pension of 10%. We offer a hybrid working policy with a mix of working from home and our City of London office.
 
About Us

Adding products to system and data dictionary
Working with data vendors to correct inaccurate data points


 
The ideal candidate for this role will have strong data analysis, extensive SQL/python experience and ideally buy side experience with some asset class coverage.
 
A passion for data, SQL and Python is a must.
title: Data Engineer- Hedge Fund

job_desc:
Job Introduction
 
Are you looking for a role that builds on your experience with engineering data systems? Are you keen to learn, grow, and develop? Do you want to work in a nurturing culture where you can flourish and be your best? Would you like to work on services that are used by key BBC products and millions of people each day? If so, this opportunity could be for you.
 
We are currently looking for talented Data Engineers to join our data teams here in the BBC. We are looking for talent at all levels that have a passion for engineering software with a focus on managing the huge amounts of data we manage and the systems that support it all. We currently have roles open in London, Manchester and Glasgow working in a hybrid way.
 
The BBCâ€™s world-class online products (iPlayer, News, Sport, Sounds, Bitesize and many others) reach millions of audience members every week and create billions of rows of data per day. Our data teams enable our audience to receive personalised experiences and enable us to understand our audience better. Data is crucial to our ambitions to making a tailored BBC for everyone.
 
Some of the key benefits youâ€™ll get from working in this role are:
 
 
 
A variety of challenging work â€“ our data teams work on a wide variety of different products and services. We create and maintain numerous data services that scale to petabytes of data.
 
Unrivalled training and development opportunities â€“ we operate a people first culture and pride ourselves on your development. Our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification. We value our engineers, offering regular training and development opportunities, as well as '10% timeâ€™ - allowing dedicated time for self-improvement, learning and innovation.
 
Excellent career progression â€“ the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
 
Benefits - We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days holiday with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.
 
Working with cutting edge technology â€“ We are constantly looking to leverage new technologies to make our systems more effective.


 
Role Responsibility
 
You will be a passionate engineer with a background in either software or data engineering and be keen to enhance your skills in data services and systems. You will be working within one of our Agile development teams to deliver new products, product improvements and enhance our technologies. You will be supported by your team and leaders to deliver value to our audience with an eye on quality, scale, and security. As a data engineer you will be responsible for helping maintain pipelines for ingest, processing and summarisation of data, as well as our improving our recommendations engines using machine learning.
 
 
 
 
Good communication skills - a great candidate will be able to talk to other developers, to non-developers, and is happy to communicate with people remotely across multiple BBC sites
 
The ability to question the way we work, and the tools and processes we use - weâ€™re always aiming to make our team the best it can be
 
An enthusiasm for writing clean, well-documented, and testable code
 
Curious and embraces change - weâ€™re always learning new technologies and requirements often change, youâ€™ll enjoy this challenge
 
Goal oriented - youâ€™ll enjoy finishing the job by developing the final details


 
Are you the right candidate?
 
The Ideal Candidate
 
You donâ€™t need you to be an expert in all these areas, only some of them. If you have a base understanding of the areas and their underlying principles, you will shine. So donâ€™t feel that you canâ€™t apply if you donâ€™t have all these skills. After all, youâ€™ll work with, and be mentored by, a friendly development team, and the BBC will provide many opportunities for learning as you progress.
 
 
 
Knowledge of Big Data pipelines and processing technologies such as Hadoop, Spark and Beam
 
Experience with SQL and relational DBs
 
Familiarity with Data Warehousing technologies (such as Redshift / Big Query / Snowflake)
 
Experience of OO programming languages such as Java 8+ or Python.
 
Experience of cloud computing (preferably AWS or GCS)
 
Experience of Containerisation e.g. Docker / Kubernetes
 
Experience of infrastructure as code e.g. Terraform
 
Experience of Pipeline orchestration e.g. Airflow or Jenkins
 
Software testing practices including unit testing frameworks such as JUnit and/or Mockito
 
Version control systems such as git


 
 
Band: D
 
Contract type: Permanent
 
Location: London / Salford / Glasgow
 
 
Weâ€™re happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application
 
 
.
 
 
There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.
 
 
 
 
Excellent career progression â€“ the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
 
Unrivalled training and development opportunities â€“ our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
 
Benefits - We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.


 
The situation regarding the coronavirus outbreak is developing quickly and the BBC is keen to continue to ensure the safety and wellbeing of people across the BBC, while continuing to protect our services. To reduce the risk access to BBC buildings is limited to those essential to our broadcast output. From Wednesday 18 th March until further notice all assessments and interviews will be conducted remotely. For more information go to https://www.bbc.co.uk/careers/

This is advertised for three roles across the Performance and Priority Projects team. Key responsibilities of the roles include:
 
 
Be the analytics lead in the team, providing reliable and timely analysis to enable tracking of the delivery of an agreed set of core Defence priorities
Cohere data and analysis received from delivery teams across Defence, and translating these into insight for senior leaders
Devise evidence-based metrics to demonstrate benefit to Defence, and supervise over time.
Develop and maintain analytical tools, automating where possible, including Dashboards with the aim of empowering senior leaders to have a better understanding of the delivery landscape
 
Design, build and test digital solutions using Power Apps and other data visualisation platforms
Draw insight from the data, telling the story behind the numbers, and draw on contextual and external information and data sources to improve understanding of the internal delivery landscape

job_desc:
Job Description
 
About us:
 
At Ramsay Health Care we put our patients at the heart of everything we do. We firmly believe in the ethos of â€œPeople caring for Peopleâ€ and want to enable our teams and our patients to have the very best experience when they receive care through Ramsay services.
 
The role:
 
As a Junior HRIS Analyst, you will be responsible for consulting to HR colleagues as well as the wider business, building domain knowledge, gathering requirements and providing solutions and impact analysis.

Experience in working and communicating with stakeholders across the business from different functional areas including ability to break down complex topics for target audiences.
Experience of project planning, prioritisation, management, risk monitoring and mitigation.
Experience of triaging and managing support cases alongside planning new functionality and improvements to systems and processes.
Strong attention to detail


 
Preferred Experience:
 
 
HR functional domain knowledge
Workday experience preferred


 
Benefits:
 
 
Contributory pension scheme
Access to the Ramsay Academy â€“ genuine opportunities to grow, develop and specialise in your career
25 daysâ€™ annual leave plus the opportunity to buy/sell more
Private Healthcare and Life Assurance
Access to our employee Discount Programme
Wellbeing centre and access to 24/7 employee assistance line for free advice


 
We care.
 
Itâ€™s more than what we do, itâ€™s who we are. Everything we do is about striving to deliver the best care. And it's a belief that's as true today as it was when we welcomed our first patients in 1964.
 
â€œThe Ramsay Wayâ€ culture recognises that people â€“ staff and doctors â€“ are Ramsay Health Careâ€™s most important asset and this has been key to our ongoing success.
 
We encourage all Ramsay employees to participate in public health vaccination programmes including flu and Covid 19.
 
We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. This position is subject to background and DBS checks.

job_desc:
Data Engineer
 
About City:
 
At CEF we have a bold ambition for growth. We are passionate about delivering an unrivalled service for our customers and providing a strong culture with career opportunities for our people.
 
Across IT we are on an exciting mission to ensure we harness our growth opportunities by designing our technology architecture and solutions for constant evolution. We recognise that technology and data are at the forefront of enabling our business to better serve our customers today and in the future.
We have a fast-growing technology team delivering a portfolio of transformative work, expanding our digital options, and upgrading and future-proofing our systems to place us at the forefront of the marketplace.
We believe that teams who design, own and run our technology solutions are more connected to the value they create. We are always looking to improve, collaborate and innovate and this is where you come inâ€¦
 
Role Description:
 
CEF are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Business Intelligence & Data Engineering Team in supporting a data warehouse for our wholesale operations on a day-to-day basis.
 
 
The role of a Data engineers works in a variety of settings to build a warehouse that collect, manage, and convert raw data into usable information for BI Developers, data scientists and business analysts to interpret.
 
 
 
The team is beginning the journey to the cloud and you can be part of our major Cloud re-platform
 
 
 
Key responsibilities:
 
 
Using compatible data to build Warehouses for the business to make informed data-driven decisions using SQL Server
Building the infrastructure to allow big data sets to analysed and assessed
Working as part of a team to build best practice and new ways of working in an ever-changing landscape
Finding ways to increase data reliability, efficiency, and quality


 
Essential Skills and Experience:
 
 
Experience working with SQL Server
Able to pull in data with API calls using SSIS
Experience creating data models using the Star Schema method
Strong communication skills, working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver BI solutions
Engineering mindset, looking at the most efficient ways of working


 
 
Desirable Skills:
 
Experience with AWS (Glue or Redshift)
Knowledge or experience with Python
Knowledge or experience with ETL tools like SnapLogic would be highly beneficial!
title: Data Engineer

job_desc:
One of the UKâ€™s largest and foremost law firms is currently recruiting for a highly skilled Data Engineer, experienced working with relational databases, T-SQL, SSMS, SQL Server, SSIS, or similar tools, and developing T-SQL queries, SSIS packages, data pipelines and data sets.
 
Offering an attractive salary of up to Â£45,000 dependent on experience plus excellent benefits including pension scheme, health insurance, critical illness cover, childcare vouchers, and discounted gym membership, this is a fantastic opportunity to join one of the most respected law firms in the UK.
 
Please note:
 
This is a permanent full-time role. You would work from home or the office, or a combination of the two, as part of the companyâ€™s Flexible by Choice policy. Applications from across the UK will be considered, ideally with proximity to one of the companyâ€™s Manchester, Sheffield or Leeds city centre offices.
 
---
 
The Role
As an experienced Data Engineer you will monitor, develop and optimise a data pipeline architecture, as well as design and deliver technical solutions for cross-functional teams. You will work alongside engineers, analysts and data architects to help ensure optimal data delivery and appropriate security procedures and principles are in place, working to optimise the teamâ€™s technical architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives.
 
Key tasks will includeâ€¦
- Supporting the management of infrastructure used for extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a variety of source systems using SQL, Python, SSIS and other Microsoft tools, on-premises and in Azure
- Daily monitoring of data warehouse, ETL process and associated error investigations
- Working with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality and flexibility in our data systems
- Ensuring that required data is provided effectively and within the Service Level Agreement using appropriate tools
 
---
 
The Candidate
- Significant experience in Data Engineer or related role
- Skilled working with relational databases, T-SQL, SSMS, SQL Server, SSIS, or similar tools
- Experience of developing T-SQL queries, SSIS packages, data pipelines and data sets
- Understanding of scripting languages such as Python and C#
- Experience of end-to-end data lifecycle from OLTP database to data warehouse, through to visualisation tools, in order to resolve issues, answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
- Knowledge of configuration / change management tools and processes, DevOps and CI/CD
- Exposure to different testing, development and project management methodologies
 
---
 
The Package
Salary up to Â£45,000. You'll also get the following benefits with the role:
- A huge number of well-being initiatives to encourage positive mental health both in and out of the workplace
- Flexible working options to make sure that youâ€™re fully supported to work the way that best suits you
- Westfield health membership, offering discounted leisure and travel and refunds on medical services
 
----
 
The Company
The business you'll be working for is one of the largest law firms in the UK, operating out of 14 UK offices with over 2,500 members of staff. They are proud of their values and offer a huge number of well-being initiatives to encourage positive mental health both in and out of the workplace.
 
----
 
Interested? If you think you're right for this Data Engineer role, then click the 'Apply Now' button, send us your CV and we'll consider you for the first round of interviews.

job_desc:
Job description:

 At Burberry, we believe creativity opens spaces. Our purpose is to unlock the power of imagination to push boundaries and open new possibilities for our people, our customers and our communities. This is the core belief that has guided Burberry since it was founded in 1856 and is central to how we operate as a company today.
 
We aim to provide an environment for creative minds from different backgrounds to thrive, bringing a wide range of skills and experiences to everything we do. As a purposeful, values-driven brand, we are committed to being a force for good in the world as well, creating the next generation of sustainable luxury for customers, driving industry change and championing our communities.
 
 
 
 
JOB PURPOSE
 
As our
 
HR Data Analyst,
 
you will be working with and supported by a multi-disciplinary HR team that is passionate about creating and delivering exceptional colleague experience at all stages of our colleagueâ€™s career at Burberry. Working closely with key stakeholders within HR and across the wider business functions, you will be responsible for supporting HR data Governance, Reporting and Analytics, delivered through SAP SuccessFactors Reporting and Tableau.
 
 
In addition, you will act as first point of contact for HR data and reporting queries, responsible for activities relating to capturing and documenting of reporting requirements, supporting data governance processes and, research and development of best practice across the HR data landscape.
 
 
You will be working on a global scale, in a positive, supportive, creative, respectful and ambitious team where we value your ideas and everyone can have their voice heard and make a difference.
 
We operate a hybrid working model at Burberry, and we would expect our HR Data Analyst to work from our Leeds office 1 day per week, with the remainder remote.
 
 
 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
 
 
Providing first line support for data and reporting queries and/or issues; a central point of contact in collating, trouble-shooting, resolving and escalating issues
Developing and enhancing reporting capability, ensuring business data needs are met with a view to leveraging/enabling self-service opportunities wherever possible
Supporting data governance by ensuring current controls are adhered to and developing new controls per business requirements
Partnering and collaborating with our Global Employee Services Team to improve data quality and integrity
Performing data quality assurance checks either, ad hoc as required or, in support of annual cyclic events
 
Producing and maintaining data processing and training documentation
 
Remaining solutions-oriented, seeking ways to improve system functionality and reporting capability with a view to enhancing and improving overall user experience


 
PERSONAL PROFILE
 
 
Report development and maintenance experience, preferably in SAP SuccessFactors
Analytics and insights development and maintenance experience, preferably in Tableau
Expertise in defining and analysing business processes and dataflow
A good understanding of HR processes
Proficiency across MS Office suite, particularly Excel
Analytical and solutions-oriented mind-set
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Organised with good attention to detail
Ability to build rapport, persuade and influence others
Project management support experience is desired, but not essential


 
Burberry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and as such, treats all applications equally and recruits purely on the basis of skills and experience.
 
 
Profile description:
 
Permanent

job_desc:
We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet
 
Who We Are
 
Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.
 
About The Role
 
The Audience Strategy team is seeking strong Data Analysts with an interest in commercial/ marketing insights and a strong background in (social) data science to understand, build and optimise our growth strategies and support the marketing automation effort across the company.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in allowing us to create value from our different data sets, by way of in-depth analysis of marketing data, visualisation of results, segmenting and understanding our audiences so we can tailor the perfect experience to them.

You will be turning data into actionable insights according to business and marketing requirements, analyzing customer behaviour, touch points and providing integrated dashboards. All while ensuring data quality to provide improvement to business processes and impact decision-making.
 
What You Will Be Doing
 
 
Work with data streams to bring in the needed data and insights to our CRM and our campaigns.
Query our database to create new audience segments and coordinate with the journey team to create customer journeys for them.
Implement and optimize CRM audience segmentation for growth.
Define and conceptualise scoring and tagging systems.
Work with the Marketing Automation teams to build successful campaigns and create a seamless researcher experience.
Manage data analysis and reporting of our marketing automation and CRM integrations.
Support measurement and campaign effectiveness, generating audience insights using closed-loop reporting between our marketing automation platform, data reporting tool and Salesforce.
Monitor the performance (dashboards and publishing monitoring KPIs), forecast performance through predictive analytics, and recommend remedial actions through prescriptive analytics.
Develop strategies for effective data analysis and reporting, defining measurement requirements.
 


About You
 
Must haves:
 
 
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a data analytics, business intelligence or similar role, ideally working on marketing projects.
Experience building audiences for retargeting, nurturing and growth.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL (BigQuery) and working with large data sets.
Expert knowledge of Tableau and other data visualisation tools, preferably in the Salesforce ecosystem.
Strong understanding of the marketing tech stack (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce CDP, Pardot, Google 360, Advertising Studioâ€¦).
Strong understanding of how databases work, types of data, types of relationsâ€¦
High level of personal initiative and very good strategic and analytical skills.
Excellent communications skills and ability to simplify advanced statistical concepts for a layman audience.
Ability to produce clear and concise data-driven reports and presentations.
Ability to liaise with data engineers.
Fluency in verbal and written English.
 


Preferable:
 
 
Desirable 3+ years of experience working with digital marketing data and marketing automation platforms (Pardot, Marketing Cloud, Advertising Studio).
Basic experience with data sources integration with Salesforce Customer Data Platform.
Basic knowledge of Saleswings and Google Analytics 360 for behavioural analysis.
Working knowledge of integration and data flow between marketing systems and Salesforce.
Working knowledge of APIs, data connectors, and other pipelines.
Experience in marketing operations for technology products.
Data modelling capability with large data sets leveraging an established BI solution (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, CRM Analytics).
Certified in Einstein Analytics is a nice to have.
 


Benefits

job_desc:
We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet
 
Who We Are
 
Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.
 
About The Role
 
The Audience Strategy team is seeking strong Data Analysts with an interest in commercial/ marketing insights and a strong background in (social) data science to understand, build and optimise our growth strategies and support the marketing automation effort across the company.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in allowing us to create value from our different data sets, by way of in-depth analysis of marketing data, visualisation of results, segmenting and understanding our audiences so we can tailor the perfect experience to them.

You will be turning data into actionable insights according to business and marketing requirements, analyzing customer behaviour, touch points and providing integrated dashboards. All while ensuring data quality to provide improvement to business processes and impact decision-making.
 
What You Will Be Doing
 
 
Work with data streams to bring in the needed data and insights to our CRM and our campaigns.
Query our database to create new audience segments and coordinate with the journey team to create customer journeys for them.
Implement and optimize CRM audience segmentation for growth.
Define and conceptualise scoring and tagging systems.
Work with the Marketing Automation teams to build successful campaigns and create a seamless researcher experience.
Manage data analysis and reporting of our marketing automation and CRM integrations.
Support measurement and campaign effectiveness, generating audience insights using closed-loop reporting between our marketing automation platform, data reporting tool and Salesforce.
Monitor the performance (dashboards and publishing monitoring KPIs), forecast performance through predictive analytics, and recommend remedial actions through prescriptive analytics.
Develop strategies for effective data analysis and reporting, defining measurement requirements.
 


About You
 
Must haves:
 
 
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a data analytics, business intelligence or similar role, ideally working on marketing projects.
Experience building audiences for retargeting, nurturing and growth.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL (BigQuery) and working with large data sets.
Expert knowledge of Tableau and other data visualisation tools, preferably in the Salesforce ecosystem.
Strong understanding of the marketing tech stack (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce CDP, Pardot, Google 360, Advertising Studioâ€¦).
Strong understanding of how databases work, types of data, types of relationsâ€¦
High level of personal initiative and very good strategic and analytical skills.
Excellent communications skills and ability to simplify advanced statistical concepts for a layman audience.
Ability to produce clear and concise data-driven reports and presentations.
Ability to liaise with data engineers.
Fluency in verbal and written English.
 


Preferable:
 
 
Desirable 3+ years of experience working with digital marketing data and marketing automation platforms (Pardot, Marketing Cloud, Advertising Studio).
Basic experience with data sources integration with Salesforce Customer Data Platform.
Basic knowledge of Saleswings and Google Analytics 360 for behavioural analysis.
Working knowledge of integration and data flow between marketing systems and Salesforce.
Working knowledge of APIs, data connectors, and other pipelines.
Experience in marketing operations for technology products.
Data modelling capability with large data sets leveraging an established BI solution (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, CRM Analytics).
Certified in Einstein Analytics is a nice to have.
 


Benefits
 
With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.
 
100% remote working
 
Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).

Wellbeing

Volunteering opportunities
 
Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

to join the UK team based in Bristol. Leidos works closely with its customers to provide ongoing support and services to multiple public sector organisations. job_desc:
Job Title:
 
Personal Care R&D Data Scientist
 
Business Group:
 
Personal Care
 
Location: UK -
 
Liverpool/Bedford, India - Bangalore/Mumbai
 
PERSONAL CARE
 
We are the guardians of outstanding personal care brands that deliver personal hygiene, self-care and confidence to billions of people. We are a successful business with much loved deodorant, skin cleansing and oral care brands including Dove, Rexona, Lux, Axe, Lifebouy and Pepsodent. In Personal Care we make it Personal! Digital capability across Personal Care R&D is essential for the success of our ambition: delivering on our strategic goals year on year and driving efficiency to enable increased investment behind our future innovation technologies and consumer insights.
 
JOB PURPOSE
 
The PC R&D Data Scientist will play a key and varied role in the design and planning of experiments, analyses of data, building and validating predictive data models and interpretation and exploitation of analysis outcomes, to help drive the Personal Care Innovation and Science & Technology programmes.
 
 
Working together with the PC R&D Modelling & Informatics Manager, to build a priority modelling programme to support PC Innovation and Science & Technology through the: design and planning of experiments, analyses of data, building and validating predictive models and interpretation and exploitation of analysis outcomes.
Provision of statistics, machine learning and data science expertise across a range of PC R&D disciplines to both deliver modelling programme and build skills and capability in PC teams.
Engagement and collaboration with global multi-disciplinary teams including both internal and external partners.
Responsibility for the quality and defensibility of statistical analyses, models and data interpretation.
Engagement in continuous learning initiatives to keep abreast of state of the art analytical, statistical and machine learning methods.
 


 
Demonstrated fluency in applying statistics methods in scientific research with a likely Masters in Statistics, Biostatistics or equivalent.
Experience of applying statistical Design of Experiments approaches.
Hands-on technical expertise in data visualization - understanding patterns in data.
Strong technical background in multivariate statistical methods.
Hands-on experience with professional statistical/modelling software such as SAS, Python, R, MATLAB and JMP.
Strong interpersonal skills, oral and written communication skills; the ability to frame a problem.
Ability to collaborate and consult effectively in global teams across time-zones and cultures.
 


NOTES
 
Unilever is one of the worldâ€™s leading suppliers of Food, Home and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 2 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world, including Dove, Tresemme, Lynx, Lifebuoy, Shea Moisture, Persil, Domestos, Ben & Jerryâ€™s, Magnum, Marmite, The Vegetarian Butcher, Graze and Pot Noodle.

Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. Thatâ€™s why our purpose is â€˜to make sustainable living commonplaceâ€™
 
Not only do we offer a competitive salary and pension scheme, we also offer an annual bonus, subsidised gym membership, a discounted staff shop and shares. Youâ€™ll have the opportunity to work directly with our renowned and exciting brands in a flexible and hybrid working environment.

Whilst the role is advertised on a full-time basis, we would be happy to discuss possible flexible working options and what this may look like for you. We are a key advocate of wellbeing and offer a variety of support for our people including hubs, programmes and development opportunities. We strive to achieve a family-friendly and inclusive workplace and to, above all, create possibilities for all.

Diversity at Unilever is about inclusion, embracing differences, creating possibilities and growing together for better business performance. We embrace diversity in our workforce. This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity. We are also more than happy to provide reasonable adjustments during our application and interview process to enable you to be present your best self. To find out more, including about our Employee Resource Groups, please click here Equity, Diversity & Inclusion at Unilever | Unilever.
 
Recruitment Fraud
 
Cyber criminals advertise fake job adverts with prestigious employers as a way of stealing information or even defrauding individuals out of money. In the most sophisticated cases, they will set up fake websites, which have a similar address to companies like Unilever. They even conduct fake telephone interviews and then offer candidates a role with the proviso they pay a fee for background checks or to cover work visa costs.â€¯ These types of attacks are becoming more common as more people are looking for employment in the economic climate.
 
How is Unilever tackling this?
 
Many of Unileverâ€™s recruitment sites publish a warning to candidates about recruitment fraud. The Cyber Security team also proactively scan for signs of people setting up fake Unilever sites and act to close them down.
 
What can I do?
 
If you become aware of potential recruitment fraud, spot fake Unilever recruitment adverts or fake LinkedIn profiles, report them via Una Live Chat.

Unilever does not accept responsibility or liability for any candidates who are financially impacted by recruitment fraud. Your vigilance is key!

job_desc:
Data Engineer
Glasgow/Home, Hybrid
 
Thales is a world leader in the design and manufacture of products for the worldwide defence, aerospace and security markets.
Thales Glasgow design and manufacture a diverse range of Electro-Optical products including Thermal Imagers, Laser Rangefinders & Designators, Vehicle Sighting Systems and Submarine Periscopes & Optronics Masts.
 
Image processing is a key component of our camera systems and with the emergence of enabling technologies that can realise more complex imaging processing techniques (such as those enabled by artificial intelligence), we are looking to add these key differentiators to our products.
 
With this comes a need to manage and develop our image datasets.
 
Data Engineering, a subset of our algorithms engineering discipline, is a key capability for our business and is well positioned to provide opportunity for career growth.
 
As a Data Engineer, you will be involved in all aspects of data engineering, including:
Supporting trials of sensors and algorithm systems
Acquiring image datasets that align with business needs
Management & organisation of data
Develop algorithms to transform data into useful, actionable information
You will have the opportunity to work with a wide range of sensor products that encompass thermal imaging, visual imaging and laser systems.
 
You support multiple projects and as such will require planning and organising skills.
 
We are looking for a candidate who:
Is a team player that performs effectively in a multi-disciplinary team environment and promotes the values of inclusiveness and diversity
Is confident in their ability to help solve complex problems, asks challenging questions to develop their understanding, and suggests new ideas to further our product offering and increase our added value
Is able to manage their own workload and meet agreed objectives, whilst contributing to the development and delivery of wider operational goals
Displays enthusiasm about learning new skills and technology, and takes self-development seriously
Skills, qualifications and experience
Ideally a Bachelor or Masters Degree (BEng, BSc, MEng, MSc) in a Numerate, Scientific or Engineering subject or Higher Education/equivalent training and experience.
Competent in at least one programming language (e.g Python, C/C++, MATLAB/Simulink) and understand the basics of configuration and version management using tools such as Git.
You will have applied your skills to processing video and images using libraries such as OpenCV and understand when and how to use Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML).
 
Desirable Skills:
Knowledge of datasets their advantages, disadvantages and limitations
Understanding of data management, storage, image labelling and wrangling
An IT or software background with some experience of working with or building a data pipeline, designing databases, running queries on databases, etc.
 
 
Eligible for UK SC Level security clearance
title: Data Engineer

job_desc:
To support and assist the on-going development, implementation and embedding of a comprehensive and proportionate risk management framework and risk culture across MRSG, ensuring compliance with Munich Re, PRA, FCA and Lloydâ€™s risk management requirements.
 
To support the Risk Manager with the on-going monitoring of the MRSG legal entity Risk Profiles by being involved with undertaking, analysing and recording results of periodic risk and control assessments across the MRSG entities and escalation of exceptions to the Risk Manager. This is achieved through:
 
 
 
Supporting the development and maintenance of the risk registers for each MRSG entity, ensuringidentified risks and their assessments are completely and accurately documented recorded.
Supporting the on-going development and maintenance of controls in the risk register including the identification and / or updating of effective controls and making recommendations to improve identified weaknesses. This includes coordinating reporting to Munich Re Group Operational Risk Control System (ORCS) for in-scope MRSG entities.
Ensuring an appropriate suite of key risk indicators (KRIs) are identified and maintained, and reviewing relevant business MI to assess business activity pre-defined KRI limits. These variances should be investigated on a timely basis with the business owner and escalated to the Risk Manager as appropriate.
 




 
Note: Initially, Risk Analyst is expected to collate output from meetings and document results in the requisite format. Over time, the Risk Analyst will also be allocated specific categories of risks to undertake risk assessments.
 
 
To support the Risk Manager in the maintenance of an effective operational loss incident management process by assisting with the collation, investigation and reporting of near miss and loss events from the MRSG legal entities. This may include conducting investigations with the incident owner, determining lessons learned and remediation action, drafting factual incident reports for inclusion in reporting to governance groups and Munich Re Group. This activity is coordinated with Compliance as appropriate.
To maintain an on-going awareness of new and / or emerging risks to the business, and ensuring such information is shared with the Risk and Compliance team and that these risks are captured appropriately. This will primarily involve performing internet based research on regulatory websites and producing briefing papers, gap analysis and provide recommendations for remediation where appropriate. This activity is coordinated with the horizon scanning process carried out by Compliance as appropriate.
To maintain an on-going awareness of regulatory and industry risk management developments and ensure that the Risk and Compliance Department are informed and action is taken as necessary. Information sources include MR Group, Lloydâ€™s, the PRA, the FCA and the London Market Association.
 


 
 
To support the Risk team by undertaking any ad-hoc risk management projects and activities as and when required by the Risk Manager. Examples of activities include:
 
carrying out administrative tasks to support the Lloydâ€™s Fundamental Principles process (e.g. sorting /mapping self-assessment templates), scheduling meetings for risk & control assessment papers, part contribution to risk reports.
Assisting in thematic risk assessments, reviews or investigations of topics that may arise from time to time. Possible topics include but are not limited to: Outsourcing / Third Party Risk Management, Operational Resilience, Business Continuity Management, Data Integrity / Information Management, Cyber Security, ESG including Diversity & Inclusion and Climate Change, Solvency II.
Assisting in solvency II / internal model related activities as may be required and subject to other primarily risk activities (acknowledging this is a qualitative role â€“ not quantitative).
Appropriate risk management qualification or qualified by suitable experience in similar roles in Lloydâ€™s and / or London market insurance.
Aptitude to develop technical insurance and risk management knowledge. Be prepared to partake in conversations and meetings â€“ able to tactfully question and challenge syndicate and service company staff, and then present considered views and findings.
Must have strong report writing skills, experience of preparing reports and presentations for Senior management / Committee or Board review. Should be focussed on completing activities to meet internal/external reporting deadlines
Be pragmatic solutions orientated and be conscientious with developing collaborative relationships with busines stakeholders.
Should have broad understanding of the current risk management environment and awareness of key developments in risk management best practice (including providing Thought Leadership in specific topics or areas as requested by the Senior Risk Manager or Director of Risk and Compliance).
Should be proactive and willing to assist in other risk activities that may arise from time to time.
title: Risk Analyst

job_desc:
Security Analyst
 
Do you have a good technical aptitude, like to work as part of a team, enjoy a challenge and relish personal development? Then this could be the role for you. We have an exciting and varied portfolio of clients across Financial Services, Manufacturing, Oil & Gas, Government, Critical National Infrastructure, Aviation and more. Defender

DNS

Marex maintains a strong balance sheet with prudent capital and liquidity positions and has an investment grade credit rating.
 
Marex was established in 2005 but through its subsidiaries can trace its roots in the commodity markets back almost 100 years. Headquartered in London with 29 offices worldwide, the Group has over 1,600 employees across Europe, Asia and the Americas.
 
For more information visit www.marex.com

job_desc:
Do you dare to make an impact within the travel industry? Do you have a passion for unleashing your business skills? Within our Commercial team we have an exciting opportunity for you to put your business acumen and commercial awareness to the test.
 
 
Are you good with numbers and have an outstanding ability to plan for the future? Do you want to join a company where you can genuinely make a difference? If your answer is yes, we want you! Joining our Commercial team will allow you to develop a bespoke career to suit your strengths and interests. Weâ€™re looking for someone who is an engaging, team-player, who is able to liaise with key stakeholders and is a natural with budgets & forecasts.
 
Make your mark in the travel industry and let your career take off at London Luton Airport. In return you will receive a competitive salary, 25 days holiday, free gym, flexible company pension scheme, BUPA health insurance and eligibility to a profit-sharing scheme after two years.
 
MAIN PURPOSE OF POST
 
To track and monitor the aero traffic and income performance of the business
 
To develop and maintain short- and medium-term traffic and aeronautical income forecasts to inform resource planning tools, annual budgets and five-year plans
 
 
To advise & assist the business in key policy methodologies & formulation in respect of aeronautical charging, contract formulation, capacity & scheduling
 
 
To assist in the strategic development of the airport through contribution within the aviation team
 
 
To be an integral part of the aviation function involving mutual cover, support and the sharing of information and expertise within a small team.
 
 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES:
 
 
Maintain rolling records of traffic and aeronautical income that accurately reflect activity, tariff & commercial arrangements.


 
 
Develop and maintain accurate billing adjustment & rebate models reflecting commercial deals which operate outside of the billing database.


 
 
Formulate proposals for passenger numbers, cargo activity, other ATM activity, aeronautical tariff & associated aeronautical income for annual budgets, forecasts & five year plans.


 
 
Run, compile and submit mandatory traffic and related financial reports in the timescale required (monthly or annually)


 
 
Ad-hoc project work, appropriate to the post, including assistance with the financial, operational & capacity evaluation of capital projects.


 
 
Any other tasks, appropriate to the post, which may be required from time to time.


 
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
 
A successful candidate for this role will have:
 
 
Business acumen with strong analytical ability
Knowledge of economics, statistics and accounting principles
Ability to dentify, maintain and work with relevant data sources
Ability to deliver presentations
Ability to prioritise and adapt to rapidly changing demands
Able to maintain discretion with data or information which may be commercially confidential
Confident and willing to work as part of a small team


 
Degree or professional qualification in business studies or a related field (or working towards this aspiration)
 
This job description is intended to give an appreciation of the role and the range of duties and responsibilities to be undertaken. Due to the diverse nature of the role, it does not attempt to detail every activity. Specific task and objectives will be agreed on an on-going basis. The post holder will be required at all times to perform any other reasonable tasks, as requested in order to meet the operational needs of the business.
 
LONDON LUTON AIRPORT OPERATIONS LIMITED IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES EMPLOYER.

We are looking for a Compliance and Data Specialist to join our team. This role forms part of the UK Regulatory Affairs team who work across all L'OrÃ©al UK & Ireland brands and divisions. You will provide support and advise the business on matters relating to Cosmetic Product Notification and be responsible for the management of our UKI regulatory technology and data. Key Highlights of Role/You willâ€¦

The role requires an individual with technical expertise to drive the technology behind R&I and translate operational requirements into technical solutions.
 
 
 
An aptitude for information systems and data management , including Excel. Ability to learn company specific IT systems

Ambition: You anticipate, think and dream big, demonstrating a high level of aspiration. You are self-driven and show proactivity, especially when seeing problems as challenges. You thrive for exceptional performance.

Judgement: You can balance operational and strategic thinking, challenging the status quo and managing confrontation effectively. You cut quickly through complexity and ambiguity whilst also thinking sustainably and are future-oriented. You reduce complexity to get things done.

Resilience: You always demonstrate purpose and ownership mindset but manage your own energy well. You uphold positivity for others and persist, bouncing back when faced with obstacles. You step back at times and accept limits.

Learning Agility: You are a self-motivated learner, showing self-awareness and demonstrating openness and curiosity. You experiment and learn from mistakes and past experiences, always showing courage and stepping out of your comfort zone. You support the development of a learning culture.
 
You get
 
We put people development and learning at the heart of our business; weâ€™ll help you master your role, develop your technical expertise and youâ€™ll benefit from exceptional management and leadership programmes. From face-to-face workshops to our global online learning resources, youâ€™re actively encouraged to embed learning into your daily life and are rewarded for continuous improvement. Donâ€™t forget that every employee gets 3 Coursera credits; that means you can get qualifications from over 1000 universities from around the world, with thousands of courses to choose from.

Looking for a good work/life balance? With our new hybrid working scheme, you can take a flexible approach to work as well as benefit from early finishes on Fridays during the summer...so you can enjoy more time with your friends and family.

As any great employer should do, we make sure we look after your financial wellbeing. Oh, did we mention that as an employee you also get discount sales of up to 70% off throughout the year on our 36 brands? Plus, you also get the option to share that in our Friends and Family sales as well!

How we recruit

Thatâ€™s the beauty of Lâ€™OrÃ©al.
