The role: Poker Product Analyst
 
We are looking for a Poker Product Analyst to join the growing Analytics team in our Leeds office.
 
Are you our next star player?

The Customer Solutions team is part of Worleyâ€™s Growth Division. Our team of consultants, technology experts, data scientists, developers and engineers support our customers as they embrace digital technology and transform their organization.
 
 
 
Digital Advisory services & Human-Centric Service Design
End-to-End Digital Twins as a foundation for smart advisory
Take advisory services & breakthrough analytics solutions to the next level by productizing them and serving them to our clients & ecosystem through user-centric B2B marketplace
 
Sustainability solutions
Autonomous solutions design and implementation


 
Unconventional Industrial Solutions
 
The UIS team consists of over 40 specialist practitioners located across the UK, Southeast Asia and Australia, and provides data-driven solutions for complex industrial problems.
 
We complement conventional engineering approaches to solving problems, by leveraging subject matter expertise and domain knowledge alongside simulation-driven design, data science and machine learning.
 
Our solutions increase operational safety and protect against losses, while optimised asset designs, operational parameters and maintenance strategies deliver significant savings.
 
 
Machine Learning
 
 
Skilled at building predictive models to solve a wide range of problem types, choosing the right approach(es) to maximise performance. Seeks constantly to broaden repertoire of ML approaches used. Able to work in a variety of machine learning applications and coding libraries.
Can demonstrate hands-on experience in at least four of the following machine learning applications: Regression, Classification, Clustering, Dimensionality Reduction, Deep Learning (AI), Reinforcement Learning, Optimisation.
Au fair with current machine learning tools and platforms such as Python, IBM, Knime, Github, R, Spark, Weka, Amazon ML, Azure ML etc.


 
Analytical Knowledge
 
 
Design an analytical project incorporating the right approaches and datasets to solve a given problem
Mine data to understand its quality and distribution, informing model choice and transformations needed
Perform statistical tests on model output to assess performance and ensure the validity of conclusions.


 
Applied Analysis and Insight
 
 
Draw on domain expertise to choose the most appropriate analytical approach.
 
Work with customers and subject matter experts throughout a project to ensure data is interpreted correctly and solutions are viable.
 
Present models to non-technical audiences in compelling business-oriented terms.
Present data in a visually compelling and elegant way making it easy to interpret and draw conclusions
Experience in analysis of IOT/Sensor Data to solve problems in an industrial setting.


 
Technical
 
 
Write code to access and process diverse data types from a range of on-prem and cloud sources.
 
Familiar with cloud computing and big data technologies (Azure, AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Snowflake etc).
Comfortable working on data platforms, such as Snowflake or Databricks, to manipulate data to engineer model features.
Familiarity with the technologies used to validate, monitor and deploy ML models (Tensorflow, ML Flow, AWS Studio, Docker, Kubernetes etc).


 
Softer Skills
 
 
Spend time with customers to fully understand the challenges and the nuances of their organisation and data.
Develop generalised approaches to solving problems in models and code.
 
Bring data and analytics to life through storytelling, and excellent written and verbal skills
Be comfortable working in Agile project-management frameworks.


 
 
Undergraduate/Masters degree in STEM or other numerate subjects. Plus 3 or more years relevant working experience.
 
OR
 
PhD in a relevant field (Machine Learning, Industrial Analytics etc.) plus one year commercial experience
 
 
Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.
 
Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.
 
If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.
 
 
Worley
 
Primary Location
 
GBR-GL-London
 
Other Locations
 
GBR-GC-Glasgow, GBR-NWE-Manchester, GBR-AC-Aberdeen, GBR-SOT-Stockton, United Kingdom

Employee

job_desc:
By clicking the â€œApplyâ€ button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takedaâ€™s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.
 
Department
 
Customer Excellence
 
Line manager position title
 
Insights & Analytics Manager
 
Location
 
Paddington, London, UK
 
The Data & Insights Associate works in partnership with the Insights & Analytics (I&A) team and with a Business Unit (BU) in Takeda UK & Ireland (UKIE) to inform and improve commercial strategy. This individual will understand and anticipate the needs of the business, translating this into effective business analysis by using an appropriate mix of secondary data, primary market research and competitor analysis. These analyses support a range of activities, including monitoring and improvement of commercial campaigns, input into strategic market planning, and revenue forecasting. The Data & Insights Associate translates and communicates their analyses into actionable recommendations to appropriate stakeholders. The Data & Insights Associate will contribute actively to the broader I&A team, including the sharing of best practices.

50% of the role will be dedicated to supporting the Gastrointestinal (GI) Business Unit on I&A Activities (alongside the I&A Manager GI), and the other 50% will be dedicated to Takedaâ€™s data warehouse (Enterprise Data Backbone â€“ EDB) and advanced analytics (supporting the Data & Insights Manager who has ownership of the data warehouse).
 
 
To conduct and interpret market and brand analysis (using national and regional level data where appropriate) for the development of strategic and operational brand plans. To provide Competitive Intelligence to allow Takeda UKIE to anticipate changes in the market landscape and begin to shape the environment to their competitive advantage.
Monitor the performance of individual brands through management and analysis of key performance indicators (KPIs) and communicate results and recommendations to the brand teams.
Driving the development and enhancement of Reports/ Dashboards (both in-house an in partnership with external partners) to monitor Business Performance
To provide analytical and research outputs as required supporting business decisions on promoted products within the organisationâ€™s portfolio. Takeda maintains a UK & Ireland data warehouse that drives reporting and dashboarding for all commercial stakeholders. The Data & Insights Associate will maintain and improve relevant aspects of this system in close collaboration with their colleagues in I&A (particularly the Data & Insights Manager).
Managing relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders from the Global, Regional, and Country level, as well as with External Partners
Managing data warehouse tasks report access in Power BI and in our Reporting Hub SharePoint, managing monthly data loads (supported by external partner), quality control, and troubleshooting.
Develop a pro-active market research/project plan (with support) for each brand which aligns with Takedaâ€™s business needs. Design, commission and manage market research (with coaching/ support) or other third-party analysis necessary for the development of the brand covering aspects of strategy and promotional campaign implementation.
To provide support in specific projects as well as back up within the Customer Excellence team as required.
To rapidly learn and develop new skills, and to keep up with developments in data, analytics, and the pharmaceutical industry environment.
 


 
Strong analytical aptitude is essential (numeracy or a quantitative focus demonstrated in educational or professional history)
Emerging presentation skills, aims to communicate technical material in a non-technical manner
Experience in a data-related, quantitative, or technical role. Power BI experience desired, or alternatively a closely related reporting tool (e.g. Tableau or Qlik, advanced MS Excel). Forecasting experience or market research experience is desirable.
Some understanding of pharmaceutical data is desirable (e.g., IQVIA, Wilmington, Cegedim, NHS data, in-market, and ex-factory sales data).
Ability to deliver training sessions on using Power BI (and other EDB data warehouse tools) to business users.
Emerging business acumen and curiosity around effective marketing and sales strategy in the pharmaceutical industry
Willing to challenge thinking at all levels of the business, embracing diverse views that improve decision making.
 


 
Strategic enterprise thinking Developing
Inspiring and enabling people Foundational.
Focusing on priorities Developing
Elevates capabilities Foundational.
 


 
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Comfortable working in ambiguity
Leads continuous improvement, promotes change
Emerging ability to build strong internal networks (within UKIE as well as above country)
Emerging ability to lead without authority and to influence others
Strong prioritisation skills, clarifies what matters most
Solution-orientated with creative and innovative thinking
Listens to understand
Continually develops self, cultivates a growth mindset, admits mistakes and learns from them
Delivers on commitments, ensures accountability of others
Effective horizon scanning, learning new skills and technologies
Advocates for insights & analytics throughout the business
Excellent computer literacy (Excel; Word; PowerPoint)
Knows when to ask for help, training, or coaching; whilst striving towards increased independent working

job_desc:
This vacancy will close on LinkedIn on the 22nd February 2023, alternatively you can apply directly via this link: https://www.jobs.cam.ac.uk/job/39231/
 
An opportunity has arisen for a talented statistician or probabilistic machine learning methods developer to join Dr Paul Kirk's group at the MRC Biostatistics Unit, Cambridge University, as part of the MIMAH (Minimising Mortality from Alcoholic Hepatitis) Consortium; see also: https://www.mimah.org
 
Alcohol related liver disease (ALD) is responsible for more than 6000 deaths a year in the UK and costs the NHS Â£3.5 billion. Alcoholic hepatitis is a florid presentation of ALD in which patients present with jaundice and liver failure. Unfortunately, around 30% of people admitted to hospital with this condition will die within 3 months. The treatment of alcoholic hepatitis is complicated by the fact that there is inflammation within the liver whilst the patient is very susceptible to infection. As a result, treatment with drugs, such as steroids, which suppress the immune system may exacerbate the risk of infection.
 
We will apply state of the art Bayesian clustering and machine learning approaches to analyse data collected within the MIMAH consortium and as part of the STOPAH trial; see also https://www.mimah.org/biostatistics
 
We are seeking an ambitious and motivated individual to contribute to this research. The team has strong collaborations with groups across the Cambridge Biomedical Campus and beyond. Current team members are working on unsupervised, semi-supervised and outcome-guided clustering and integrative clustering, multi-view modelling, multiple kernel learning, Bayesian nonparametrics, and matrix factorisation approaches, across an array of applications.
 
The successful candidate will have a PhD in a strongly quantitative discipline, ideally statistics or probabilistic machine learning. Experience with biomedical applications would be highly advantageous, but not essential. A desire to address questions of substantive biological importance and disease relevance is essential. Good communication skills and an enthusiasm for collaborating with others are also essential. Strong programming ability would be desirable, and experience of Bayesian clustering and variable selection approaches would be advantageous. Experience with clinical and molecular datasets would be highly desirable. The successful applicant will be supported in their career development with a range of formal courses and on-the-job training.
 
The Unit is situated on the Cambridge Biomedical Campus, one of the world's most vibrant centres of biomedical research, which includes the University of Cambridge's Clinical School, two major hospitals, the MRC Laboratory of Molecular Biology, and the world headquarters of Astra Zeneca.
 
The Unit is actively seeking to increase diversity among its staff, including promoting an equitable representation of men and women. The Unit therefore especially encourages applications from women, from minority ethnic groups and from those with non-standard career paths. Appointment will be made on merit.
 
For an informal discussion about this post please contact paul.kirk@mrc-bsu.cam.ac.uk
 
We welcome applications from individuals who wish to be considered for part-time working or other flexible working arrangements.
 
Click the 'Apply' button to register an account with our recruitment system (if you have not already) and apply online.
 
Please ensure that you upload a covering letter and a CV in the Upload section of the online application. The covering letter should outline how you match the criteria for the post and why you are applying for this role. If you upload any additional documents which have not been requested, we will not be able to consider these as part of your application.
 
Please include details of your referees, including email address and phone number, one of which must be your most recent line manager.
 
Please quote reference SL35157 on your application and in any correspondence about this vacancy.
 
The University actively supports equality, diversity and inclusion and encourages applications from all sections of society.
 
The University has a responsibility to ensure that all employees are eligible to live and work in the UK.
 
Hours:
 
Full Time
Contract:
 
Fixed-term: The funds for this post are available until 31 May 2024 in the first instance.
Closing Date:
 
22nd February 2023
Interviews:
 
TBC
Reference:
 
SL35157
title: Research Associate (Fixed Term)

job_desc:
Arriva has a long history dating back to 1938 when the Cowie family opened a second-hand motorcycle shop in Sunderland, UK. Little did we know it would become the first chapter in our incredible story that would see us grow to become a pan-European passenger transport partner.
 
Today, we are diversified across 12 countries, holding leading market positions in many markets across the countries we operate in. We are one of the largest transport services organisations in Europe, employing c.39,000 employees and delivering more than 1.2 billion passenger journeys every year.
 
Arriva have embarked on a transformational change program to modernise our BI, Analytics and Data platforms. Weâ€™re migrating from legacy on-premises solutions to cloud-native platforms and services.
 
 
We have a fantastic opportunity on the BI & Data Platforms team for a BI Developer to join a small team to provide development and support activities across the platform.
 
Youâ€™ll be working across the entire BI lifecycle â€“ ingestion, transformation & integration, data modeling, visualisation/reporting on a cloud-native platform.
 
The team supports both the Legacy and cloud platforms. The current legacy platform(s) are supported and managed following ITIL processes, but we already have plans to
 
explore DevOps and agile ways of working during 2023 for the cloud-native platform.
 
Arriva operates a hybrid model, this role could be based at our Sunderland, Leicester, or London locations. There will be occasional travel between offices for initiatives/projects.
 
 
 
Develop enhancements / changes based on business/user requirements
Support investigation / resolution of incidents and service requests
Support the business in their BI/analytics self-service journey
Collaborating with Arriva Technology Partners (external 3rd parties / vendors)
Provide out of hours support via an on-call rota


 
 
You can demonstrate experience of working in a similar role within a BI & analytics function.
 
Understanding of ETL and ELT principles, data modeling, data warehouse & data lakes, presentation layers etc will be required.
 
You will have good SQL and ELT/ELT experience and ideally knowledge of the following:
 
oScripting (e.g., PowerShell, bash, python)
 
oAWS services (in a BI/analytics context) although other cloud platforms are OK, the BI context is important
 
oKnowledge of ITIL processes, particularly Service Operations and Service Transition
 
Any experience of DevOps and Agile ways of working would be desirable.
 
Outside of the technical skills and experience, you have strong written and verbal communication skills, a confident communicator and team player. You are passionate about BI & Data and looking to progress your career in this area.
 
 
 
 
Standard Life Pension â€“ AWPP 3% company, 5% employee
 
Hybrid working and free onsite parking.
 
25 days holidays and 8 bank holidays, with the option to purchase up to 10 additional days.
 
Access to our Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
 
Cycle to Work Scheme
 
The Village â€“ our Online Reward Gateway for high street discounts and more
 
Arriva Bus Pass which gives you and your family free travel on all Arriva bus services outside London (T&Câ€™s apply).
 
Global Arriva Inclusion Network (GAIN)- a community of people who are passionate about equality, diversity and inclusion.


 
Why work for us?
 
Our people choose to work for us, and to stay with us, because weâ€™re a great place to work.
 
At Arriva, we strive to create a culture where we can all be ourselves, where we belong, feel respected and our differences celebrated.
 
We actively seek out and value difference. We want our business to reflect the wide range of communities in which we operate, so we can serve them even better.

job_desc:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
 
This is an exceptional opportunity for a Compliance Senior Analyst to join the Global Compliance team as part of the Compliance Centre of Excellence at BCG.
 
The role provides an unparalleled entry point for the right candidate to be part of a continuously improving Compliance team for a global consulting firm that partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities.
 
The Compliance team provides support, guidance and oversight on critical compliance topics that anchor how BCG employees support each other, their clients, and the business â€“ with policies, processes, and systems which BCG continuously improve. The team develops and implements smart capabilities, toolkits, frameworks and training to empower BCG employees to act in accordance with the values and code of conduct, and to promote adherence to laws, regulatory requirements, and internal policies and procedures.
 
The role will report to the Global Risk and Compliance Senior Director, who leads the Compliance Centre of Excellence, and support the day-to-day management of the Global Compliance team. Responsibilities will include coordinating the global compliance program, plus facilitating global compliance events, campaigns, and ad hoc activities, with our compliance counterparts in geographies around the world.
 
The successful candidate must maintain strong relationships across a broad stakeholder remit. Key stakeholders include Subject Matter Expert and Regional Compliance teams; the Risk and Compliance MDP Node network; and other Global Service functions and Business Support teams, such as Legal and Finance.
 
Global Compliance Network Management
 
 
Plan, organize and execute monthly meetings and ad hoc workshops with BCGâ€™s Risk and Compliance MDP network (i.e., scheduling global calls, preparing meeting agenda and materials, coordinating room bookings and tracking meeting follow ups)
Plan, organise and coordinate the Compliance Workshop at the Worldwide Wide Officers Meet twice a year
Maintain Node Job Descriptions, Node Org Charts, Email distribution lists on an ongoing basis
Be the operational liaison between the Centre of Excellence, Subject Matter Experts and Regional Compliance teams to ensure a smooth and accurate flow of information between all stakeholders
Identify and support individuals that carry out risk and compliance activities in business support teams operating in local offices (â€˜compliance championsâ€™)


 
Compliance Program and Operating Model
 
 
Support the Global Risk and Compliance Senior Director with the compliance target operating model i.e., by contributing to the onboarding and training of new hires within the function
Help the Global Compliance team by delivering day-to-day tasks relating to compliance programs (e.g., setting up and preparing agendas for correspondence/meetings, drafting presentations for MDP meetings, global compliance trainings roll out)
Ensure the smooth running of the Global Compliance teams governance and operations commitments, e.g., maintain structure charts, the compliance shared drive, and sharepoint sites
Manage the Global Compliance teamâ€™s participation in the North-eastern University intern program. Responsibilities include leading the hiring, onboarding, training, and ongoing mentoring of a University Undergraduate every 6 months
Assist with the review and ongoing maintenance of compliance manuals/policies/standards and identify opportunities for ongoing improvements (including automation and digitalisation of workflows where possible)
Work closely with the Regional Compliance teams as the point of contact on global policies/frameworks roll-out and queries
Support the Compliance team with responding to queries that are sent into the Global Compliance mailbox


 
Global Compliance Reporting
 
 
Manage the timely preparation of compliance reports for Boards, Committees and Management
Compile management reports, summary analyses, and detailed presentations to describe compliance risks, controls, and maturity assessments
Collate regular management information updates, such as monthly compliance updates for the Global Compliance team


 
Global Compliance Campaigns
 
 
Support with the execution of large-scale compliance campaigns that are run out of the Centre of Excellence such as the annual Insider Trading Program and Compliance Training Campaigns


 
YOU'RE GOOD AT
 
 
Experience influencing staff of all levels of an international and matrix-based working environment
Confident engaging with cross functional stakeholders at all levels to drive decision making
Ability to develop and improve working methods independently
High integrity, flexibility, willingness to progress initiatives while demonstrating a strong sense of ownership and independence
Fluent business English (spoken and written); additional languages desirable


 
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
 
 
An academic degree in a relevant discipline. Advanced degree preferred
Approx. 2-4 years relevant experience in compliance/ or other risk management discipline such as audit, fraud examination, quality control, risk analysis within a financial/ banking institution, professional services or consulting firm
Strong knowledge and â€˜know-howâ€™ of compliance topics such as, but not limited to, bribery and corruption, insider trading, conflicts of interest, third party risk and information management. Comfortable with, and preferably advanced knowledge of, Microsoft Office (Power point, Excel, Word), Trello, exposure to business intelligence tools: Tableau, Power BI
A genuine intellectual curiosity to understand BCGâ€™s scope of activity in the market
Commitment to confidentiality required


 
YOU'LL WORK WITH
 
You will be part of the Global Compliance team reporting to the Global Risk and Compliance Senior Director as part of the wider Global Risk Management team.
